PS my grandkids love them sho much that they have been using them to clean. Maybe you will get that addressed

title: Very well made, fits more than a yeti cooler too. Read full review for more.
review:
I'm very happy to announce that it WILL fit the Kenai 65 quart Coolers.
This yeti tray is only one available atm, and I didnt spend 600$ on a 65 yeti I spent 250 on a 65 Kenai instead. Same cooler for most part made by same machines the same way just alot cheaper. Anyways

This tray is well made very sturdy and dipped in a very thick plastics, which helps in every way possible. It is not very deep though but will sever the purpose we needed it for.

I'm very happy I took the chance hoping it would fit my cooler and overall I'm glad I took that plunge.

Very well made and fits perfectly how can you complain. A must have item, you may want to try and find a deeper one because this would be my only issue with the tray.

If you find this review helpful, please vote, so Amazonian browsers can better learn, research and understand how products work for them.!. Thank you and Happy Buying

title: I Wish It Longer
review:
First, I would like to point out if you need additional or replacement keys, you have to go through Tigr, and they sell them as a 2-pack, and it costs $20 plus $5 shipping. You cannot just go to a hardware store or locksmith store to get a copy.

Second, this is a rather short-reach lock. As another reviewer here stated, I wish this had a longer reach, especially if you're riding an electric bike that might have wider frames.

The Tigr Blue Mini+ is easy to use. It feels solid, yet lightweight. It's a good concept. The lock is easy to put on and take off. A reviewer here reported the lock failed eventually. Tigr sells replacement lock cylinders for $40 plus shipping.

title: Very Smooth Reel
review:
I love to fish, especially when I am with my two sons who make perfect fishing buddies. One of them has taken to spinning reels, while the other prefers another type. So, with two of us in the family favoring spinning reels I was eager to try this reel to see how well it would hold up and perform for me. I have only one issue with it, relating to the spool, but in operation this is a very smooth and well-designed spinning reel.

This is a smaller reel than what I normally use though this is not a problem for me. Instead of large bass, this reel works for me when I am after sunfish and perch. In spite of the small size, even in my big hands the bail does not scrape my knuckles as it spins. This is a plus for me as I have had this problem with smaller reels.

I have two pet peeves with spinning reels that come up time and again. First, if the bail does not pass over the spindle far enough the line does not come off the spool very easily and it greatly reduces the casting distance, even more so than will a cheap rod with sub-par eyelets. This is not a problem with this reel and I have been able to get good casting distance with lightweight test.

The other issue I have with reels that many fail to implement properly is a zero-reverse clutch. When engaged, there should be absolutely no play at all in the reel and there should be absolutely no reverse turning – period. A good number of reels allow a small amount of reverse in the turn which is unacceptable. This one gets it right and when the clutch is engaged there is no reverse at all.

Many reels I have used have 9 or 10 ball bearings. This one has 12. Generally speaking, more ball bearings means smoother operation and returns. This is definitely a very smooth reel, arguably the smoothest reel I have ever used.

There is one negative about this reel that merits mention. The spool is attractive and it has 14 diagonal openings that allow air flow and add to the appearance. These have very sharp ridges that you can feel when you run a finger across them and they are sharp enough that you can cleanly trim a fingernail on them. Normally this is not something I would really mind, except that in the event of a severe backlash you can nick or cut your line which is a more serious issue. If I can find a different spool that will fit I plan to replace it which would make this reel just about perfect.

This is a nice, smaller reel. It gets the important things right – the bail flips properly and the zero-reverse clutch is excellent. It is very smooth too. The spool is the only issue and even then one might argue that I am being picky but it still merits mention. This reel will see more use as we get deeper into the summer.

Disclosure: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at minimal or no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: Not the best...too small for the size listed
review: Produce is a great concept. Unfortunately the stockings run small. I bought 3 pair the same size. The first pair I wore were a bit too tight. The other 2 pair were way too tight. I have been wearing compression stocking for several years, so I know how they should fit. These just do not have consistent  sizing. And the top band is too narrow and rolls, cutting off circulation. I washed them after one use and gave them to a co-worker who is smaller than me.

title: Getting Great Cardio Workouts
review:
This bike is a very good buy for the price - currently listed at $249.22. I was surprised by how easy it was to assemble. The main section, including the wheel, frame, and seat are already assembled out of the box. The rest is simple.
As for the quality, I'd consider it to be excellent. The seat is very comfortable, the wheel spins quietly (it increases slightly in volume as you increase the resistance), and the pedals keep my feet securely in place while riding. I've had some great cardio workouts on this bike. You can really push yourself - and it holds up.

title: Very small, no insulation
review:
These 8oz collapsible cups make me wonder what they're intended purpose is.

They're very small, and don't actually have a lid to seal the opening at the top. They also have basically no insulation, I put my hot coffee in it to try it out and it was very quickly too uncomfortably hot to hold in my hand. I can't see this working well in a cupholder, and its size also makes me think, why not just chug it if you want to carry around so little? 8oz is a very small amount.

For camping purposes, I think there are much better collapsible cups out there, these do compress into a very nice small size, but I just can't see myself wanting to use these.

Pulling them out and pushing them in also isn't the nicest, they are a more rigid material and once you have them fully extended, the bottoms aren't actually flat making them kind of unstable...so you have to hold them...with no insulation. Lol

I like the concept, but I just think there are better options out there

title: The Trident...Just "OK".
review:
Ahh, SOG. I have many knives in the EDC (everyday carry) rotation. I mostly prefer Spyderco as their designs and materials are preferred in my use. I am not new to SOG, however. I've owned EDCs and fixed blades that have been incredible values and exceptional users. When I saw several SOG manufactured blades on Amazon this Holiday season for sale I thought it a prime opportunity to try out a few more examples. Which brings me to the Trident.

This is the black box version of the Trident. It's not the full retail packaged item, but rather comes in a generic looking manufacturer's box from SOG. I could care less about the retail box, so that's a non-issue. What is an issue is the genuine disappointment upon opening and trying out the folder for the first time. When comparing this item to other EDC blades from not only other manufacturers but SOG themselves the whole thing just comes across kind of "meh". I know this is an older design from the outfit, but it may be time to retire it. Despite it's lightweight, the knife just comes across bulky. I could maybe give it a pass because of the 3.75" blade, but the handle doesn't fit well in the hand and can be likened to carrying a 2x4. Alright, that's a little far, but it's just an uncomfortable design to me. Further inspection and this knife at the very least had some care taken in the build. There is absolutely perfect blade centering in this particular example.

Upon flicking open this massive 3.75" blade, you want to be impressed. The Trident fires off a little slow, though. If you've ever held an AEGIS or Flashback you know how some of these SOG assisted openers can snap with real authority. The Trident isn't one of them. As for the steel, it's AUS-8, which isn't a super steel by any means but it's adequate in this application. Extremely sharp out of the box which had sometimes been a problem with SOG in the past. I'm not thrilled with the blade shape, though, not in my uses. This is definitely more hiking folder than everyday use. The pocket clip is a reversible low carry and sufficiently retains tight to the pocket, but I'm not fond of the way the whole thing carries. Again, a bit too much bulk in the dimensions. While we're on the handle again, the glass reinforced nylon that this is built from is too slick. The gimping on top that leads to the blade is also not deep enough or poorly designed which causes thumb slip. Why it's on the blade is a mystery, as those notches in retaining a firm grip are even less useful than the ones on the handle. They need to either be deeper or more aggressive. Probably both as they're too rounded and just cause slip.

Another feature is the lock. I find them redundant and wish SOG offered knife varieties without them, but there it is and I just leave it off. The Trident is also known for its "rope cutting" notch in the handle. I didn't try this feature out, but see it as a means to snagging on items and not lending itself a true benefit. Perhaps I'm wrong on that, though, and I have no field use with that particular feature.

I wanted to like the Trident. It's lightweight, a long blade, and a well-crafted folder. I just find myself dwelling on all of its shortcomings instead. I paid a greatly reduced cost on this leading up to Christmas. It was supposed to be a gift to my cousin. Even at the reduced cost I think I'm going to send it back. The whole product just comes across as barely adequate and there's just better folders out there in every category of use. SOG even makes better carry knives with the Flashback and Aegis lines. The Trident is just a miss from them in my opinion. Choose something else, you'll be happy you did.

title: A simple piece of equipment, but the angle makes it uncomfortable.
review:
The purpose of push up bars are to give you a full range of motion throughout your exercise. When doing a bench press, you can bring the bar all the way down to your chest, which is a good range of motion. Doing a regular push up on the floor, it's not as easy to get that range. That is unless you have these pushup bars.

They are very simple pieces of equipment. Easy to assemble: Connect the horizontal legs to the bars and you're done. They are also easy to use. Place them farther apart or closer to work on the different parts of the chest. This is the freedom that separate bars give you as opposed to a push up board with fixed positions.

Unfortunately, these bars are not horizontal. I suppose that it is supposed to make them more ergonomic but I found that it was uncomfortable to bend my wrist at those angles, especially when doing decline/incline push ups or wide push ups.

I still use them daily and find them to be acceptable.

title: Insufficiently Adjustable

review: Ok for the price.

title: X-body may be limited fit. Effective lights- Ha.. we had driver tell us so..!!!
review:
A steady or flash option visible by approaching vehicles from both front and rear directions… steady rhythm keeps runner from feeling they’re in an underground rave or disco! After x3 wks of use, nothing dim or losing charge- used x30-60min. each run. LED withstood light rain for a 50min. run without issues during/after! Reflective strips aid if running just before/after dusk or dawn when lights may be harder to detect.

Worn X-body + around waist.. belt fit: 5’6”, 115lb. 34B 25yr tiny frame with adjusted fit via the slide mechanism. *Note: feel this will prove a bit cumbersome on larger physiques worn X-body. **If using hydration chest pack belt will need to be on waist (we’re using x1 on longer runs while training for marathon!) All something to keep in mind if bigger or adding any top body paraphernalia or equipment.

USB charges solid with included cord- connection holds tight. Charged overnight belt is full/ready to go in AM. May offer a repeat use capacity on a single charge- depending on length of run. Power pack tucks into band without being nuisance or ruckus bc pack isnt heavy!

An economical option for sharing road space with vehicles- adjustable with options that can adapt to your specifics. Performs respectable for $16 price point! Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

*wow endorsement: waiting to cross street on a run- car rolled up to actually give shout out for a having visual to help protect all parties from a terrible accident. Wow! Need we hear more..?!! Mic. drop!

title: Works great as a front brake on my fixed gear
review: Needed a new brake cable for my fixed gear emergency front brake and this did the trick.  Was able to easily trim the housing and cable to the length I needed and installed in a flash.  Perhaps it's because the housing length is so short that I'm stressing how flexible the turn to the brake from the lever is but after a few years (granted, years of use) the housing has cracked a bit and no longer seats in the end caps.  Still, it continues to function just fine and my brake lever pulls and releases smoothly.

review: The first time these darts bounced and hit the floor, the bent.  The second time they broke.  Shafts survived half of one game.  They fly nice, but break easy.

title: Could Be Better Made
review:
This came fan folded in a rectangular clear plastic container. Even a couple days under my heavy mattress failed to get all the creases out. The word exploring, which has some significant meaning to me working with the older co-ed scouting division, it and the mountains were what I decided to put on my wall the other two words 'never stop' went back in the box.
First impression, the image was hard to get off the backing paper. I had to try several places before I could get it to lift. Then I noticed the actual sticker was somewhat flimsy. I was unable to get it in a straight line on the wall. The backing kept pulling everything down. When I revealed more of the sticker it immediately adhered to itself causing creases and ripples. Once I finally got it on the wall and noticed that it was crooked i tried to lift it up to reposition the word. It does come cleanly off the wall but in two small, fingernail sized, spots its impossible to unstick from itself. It's on the wall, I've gone over it repeatedly with a credit card to try and get the creases and air bubbles out. The two mountain stickers went up much easier. I'll have to see if the problem areas are visible enough to make me take it down. The one I received had instructions for use in eight or nine languages, not one was English! Not very impressed.

title: Impossible to open with one hand
review: The Healthy Human bottles seem to be gone, so I chose this instead. I keep a water bottle in my car and often when I'm at a light I'll take a drink. This would require so much fussing just to open it and then seal it again. I didn't get past the lid. I'll be sending it back.

review: This shirt is about half a size smaller than your standard t-shirt. It is also very thick. It reminds me of the shirts you are obligated to order when your kid is on a team that has "Brian's Mom" on the back. Definitely not my favorite shirt ever. Just not a good fit and not a good feel. Pretty sad about it.

review:
Fun or in the grass or stand!!!
You need to stake this down which is easy to do with the included stakes. Lots of fun and builds up reaction speeds. We used this at the beach and the metal frame holds up well with all the salt.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Nice bottle but I got some odd color that is not even an option to order
review:
This is would have been a nice water bottle. SadIy I didn’t get what is depicted in the picture. For one the color is completely different. I got a clear bottle and not the beautiful blue shown in the picture. It is a 64oz water bottle and it does have the inspirational quotes on the side so that is good at least. But it is this dreary gray color instead and strangely not really a color option that seems to be available so not sure what I really got to be honest. It still holds water though and it should keep you nicely hydrated every day, if you can empty this every day.

It has a wide opening which allows you to quickly fill it as well as add ice to it if you choose to. It has a flip top that has a secure lock so you can protect the opening you are drinking from, from dust, dirt, germs or whatever else really. You can use the straw it comes with or just remove it, totally up to you, personally I prefer to use it without it. It has a nice carrying handle that makes it easy to lug it along with you.

It is BPA and toxin free which is important since you don't want to add toxins to your body slowly but surely through your water, trust me you will add it plenty of other ways, you don't have to add this one. This bottle comes in plenty of fun designs but also some muted single colors as well, so plenty for everyone to choose from. I am very disappointed that I didn’t get the cool color shown so for that I am deduction stars.

title: Found a gross surprise inside packaging
review: This is a review about the packaging not necessarily the bike itself. As I was taking everything out of the box to start putting it together, I noticed there was a green bottle at the bottom of the box. When I first looked at it I wasn't sure what it was until I actually picked it up. It was a bottle of opened green tea. The bottle has what I'm assuming is Chinese writing on it so obviously I could not make it out what it says but I'm pretty sure it's green tea. The bottle was nearly empty with only about a half an inch of liquid left on the bottom. Upon further inspection I see that the package came all the way from China. So the person who put the parts and pieces into the box obviously put there almost nearly Empty Bottle along for the ride. Thanks a lot it's pretty gross.

title: Well Constructed & Sturdy!
review: I am not a runner, but my husband & daughter have recently taken it up. I purchased this through a promotional deal with them in mind, but now that I have it, I'm not sure that I will part with it! I ordered the smaller size so it would accommodate the runners in my family, but it also fits me without any troubles, even though I am closer to the higher end of the measurements.  Although I am not a runner, I do like to walk while my family is doing their C25K training. Most of my pants that I wear for exercising do not have pockets so I often end up holding my phone in my hand. It is super comfortable & can easily fit my Google phone, keys and a couple of other items, too. It doesn't have a lot of bulk like a fanny pack would. I can totally see myself wearing this to Six Flags or other places where I really don't need my purse. I love that it is waterproof, too! The reflective properties are great for safety concerns!

title: Pro: cheap, Con: cheap
review: Price is right, but not as effective as other shad darts in my tackle box. I just used these, and I foul-hooked 5 shad. Not a one actually bit the hook. This makes me think there were tons of shad in the water, but none were interested in biting these. I should note that a different brand's shad dart was effective, so the fish were biting. I'll keep using these and update if performance improves. I also caught a 5-lb catfish on one of these, and it bent the hook.

title: Very high quality.
review: Great for a gift.

title: Headlamp doesn’t work; lantern works nicely but both lights can’t be on simultaneously – 2.5*
review:
In the box is a lantern with three AA batteries installed, a headlamp with two CR2032 batteries installed, and an instruction sheet. Note that the instruction sheet says that the AA batteries are not included but in mine they were included. I had to unscrew the compartment to remove tape holding the end batteries from connecting. A super tiny Philipps screwdriver is needed to get into either battery compartment.

The lantern works. It has a nice handle and the on/off button cycles through just turning the eyes on or turning the bottom on as well as turning the unit off. Both top and bottom cannot be on at the same time. I would have liked this option, so that is a negative. However, the unit is cute.

I had to throw out the headlamp. It would not turn on. I bought new batteries and it still didn't work. Then I tested the batteries that came with the unit in a bike light I have and the batteries worked. The headlamp is junk and that is disappointing. I tried for about 10 minutes to get this to work but could not.

The current price of $16.99 ($19.99 minus $3) is competitively priced for this especially if it comes with both sets of batteries. I am unsure if that is the case for others or if the batteries were included by mistake for the lantern or not. Also, I do not know what the "flash eyes" comment means on the Amazon site. The eyes DO NOT flash, if that is what it means. Since I had to throw out the headlamp, I do not have confidence in this set. Also, I wish the lantern had the ability to fully light up. Therefore, this gets 2.5 stars from me, rounded up to 3 stars.

title: Very Good
review:
This is a convenient, tasty, and easy to make packet of camp food. All you have to do is rip open the packet, pour in boiling water, and wait for about nine minutes. Be sure to dig through the freeze dried food and remove the Oxygen scavenger before you add the water.

Also, be careful when you open the packet because there is no internal bag and you don't want to accidentally spill the contents. The beef stew flavor is pleasing and there is a good variety of meat and vegetables. I ate mine with a couple bread rolls and the result was a very satisfying meal. These are great for trips, or for an afternoon adventure with the kids.

title: Set-up requires strength - sturdy decent trampoline
review:
This little trampoline is doing the job for our toddler.
It does feel sturdy and as stable as a self standing trampoline is going to get. If our daughter jumps too high while pushing on the bar the legs will raise on one side.
She understands rules so it’s not a huge problem.
The main hurdle for us was setting it up. It’s not complicated or long, it just takes a bit of strength.
The sections of the circle would not fit into the designated notch on the legs, at first I thought this was going to be a bust. But once we chipped some Of the thick paint away from the edges and found a mallet to whack them in place, they fit. Using a hammer instead of a mallet at this step is just going to ruin the paint surface so beware. Once that was figured out the rest was easy. Stretching the canvas was fine. It is hard, but that’s what makes it a good trampoline tbh, and the tool does help some. There were two or three I was not able to do myself at all, and needed help with (I’m average strength for an adult woman).
The edge cover material is thick, looks much better than others I’ve seen.
It’s small enough that we can bring it inside and outside as needed, if we carefully navigate doors with it.
Decent product.

title: I love it!
review: This will be a fun way to exercise and tone my abs and other areas. The dolly is big so you can rest your arms on it comfortably. The mat is comfortable.

title: Adjustment is a breeze...great quality!

review: I took these out on my last round. I’m and 8 hdcp that can still hit it. The distance is good, but the feel really surprised me on the green. Was able to get a soft like feel, considering the ball construction. The durability held up as well. Good value!!

A cot should never be this hard to set up, your tired after hiking or setting up camp and just want to relax not wrestle with a cot and not even get it to work with two people.

title: It was fine for the money spent
review: It was fine for the money spent

title: Emblem looks great.
review: Not much heavier weight than lesser priced ones.  Probably paying for the logo.

title: Zulu Nation
review: This is my second one and I am so glad that Amazon has them! They've become hard to find! And water stays perfectly cold. I have two and ready for another!

title: Breaks with one drop
review: I have no idea if this even worked, never gave it a try. It has been in my purse, but I took it out to hold it just in case, and blam, one drop and it breaks! What a rip off! $10 down the drain! What good is a warranty if you can't fire the thing??

title: Multicolored lights only light up when walking at a fast pace.
review: I chose these wheels  because I thought they only lit up with blue lights. As it turns out they’re blue wheels but they have multicolored lights. Also I installed them for a replacement on my Roller board luggage. The lights do not light up unless I pull my luggage quickly. They do not light up at a slow walking pace. Still, I like their blue color and they do roll smoothly.

title: These are great!
review: Awesome little buckets - they pack down to almost nothing, and are so handy for dishwashing! Im sure I will use them for other things as they are a good size bucket / bin, but for dishwashing alone they are perfect.

title: Shocking it fits like a medium
review: Somewhat to small, I wear large and always purchase X large. Shocking it fits like a medium. I wear it, but......women know what I mean.

title: Quality made with detail…
review:
Pants step up to a classier level… I find these made for a more formal/business atmosphere. No worry! Pants can hold their own- appropriate for a day in the office, corporate meeting, interviews, court… Anything professional or dressier!!

Slick material has a nice sheen that only adds to a dressy vibe.. along with pleats down front. Straight leg cut seems to aesthetically lengthen the leg line.. and pant looks fantastic with a heel! Yet, the length wasn’t too long for one who’s 5’6”, 123lb, 23x30, 34B, 25yr old.. size small fit as expected. High waisted will show plenty of whiskering type wrinkles around bends and pockets- the poly fabric likes to hold onto wrinkles a bit.. but wont appear sloppy or disheveled bc of it.

Keep in mind- this is a “throwback” style and not the current trend worn low on the hip!! Take note of style- higher waist and looser trouser cut. These have room to move with you while bring comfort while worn.. but, nothing is fitted from waist down!

Sold at higher price point bc of quality material and craftsmanship. All nicely stitched seams w/out loose threads these have solid finishing detail. Bc of this pant will last for quite some time. Hoping info can help your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Five Stars
review: Love this and good quality

title: Fantastic
review: This is the coolest thing ever. Brought it to Yellowstone and I saw everything! I was actually passing it around to other tourists at one point to check out a moose! I even bought a couple as presents! Highly highly recommend!

title: Durable ball for use as a medicine ball or wall ball
review:
[[VIDEOID:7fd8176a2ae643fb3b760a6fda433931]] Wow, this ball can give you a burn for core training! Endless exercises to choose from too.
I also use this in my basement where I drop it on the floor and do pick up exercises and throwing it against the brick wall. In addition. I use use this on my workout bench too. I also plan on getting an 8 lb ball. Just one is not enough. Dumbbells are good but these are more versatile. Love it!!!

title: resistance band set
review: I was hoping these would be way thinner.  They are super thick and not very useful for me because they are too thick.  I will donate these and look for some thinner options.

title: Love this Mask
review: Recently went to Hawaii for some "first time snorkeling."  Love that you put it on and breathe.  No need to put anything in your mouth.  And the "no interference view" was amazing.  Everyone made fun of me until they tried it.  Now they want one too.

title: Cheap looking and huge
review: Cheap and huge

title: Dissatisfied
review: I use these for night walks. They are very reflective but aren’t made right. The stitching on the straps was very loose and missing string. It all came apart on one of the straps with the slightest tug. Really cheaply made. Won’t purchase again.

title: Not a great flow design
review: Low flow top. Sturdy construction. Good seal. Would not recommend for the cost.

title: Fell apart in a week
review: Fell apart 1 week of use. The back hinge that connects to the part that connects to the strap came apart and you need a special tool to reconnect the bolt. Step son is bummed. But it was awesome for about a week. Too bulky to return, $60 down the drain

title: helpful for wrists for push-ups etc
review: I put it on the edge of my regular mat and then my hands can angle downward when I do push-ups, burpees etc. I don't have arthritis (yet) but my wrists are always stiff and a little sore from that kind of work. This really helps. I could even cut this mat in half so I could place each part farther apart if I wanted, but currently I have no need.

title: Damaged gun pf9
review: Used on my kel-tec pf9, first shot feel off. The second time out it not only feel off, it scared up the rail mount on the frame of my gun. Seemed like a solid unit just doesn't stay on my particular gun and did some damage in the process. I was using 115grain  bullets. My low accuracy mark is due to me not being able to shoot it more than once on both outings.

title: Looks Girly but ...
review: Yeah, okay this carabiner is neon pink. Girly right? Sure, but it is also strong! When I use a carabiner to hold dog leashes while rescuing, it's a matter of life or death. I trust this one.

title: Nice
review: I like this picnic blanket. The price was right, the quality seems good (haven't washed it yet tho), color/print is good, and it seems to be water resistant. It is not as comfy and snuggleable as a normal blanket but it is a good barrier on a damp surface. Happy with the purchase.

title: Quality Sunglasses
review: This is an excellent pair of lightweight, comfortable sunglasses. The nose platform distributes the weight in a way that does not pinch or leave a mark. The sunglasses stay in place even if you shake your head which makes them a great choice for athletes. They come with a storage case, bag, and lens cleaning fabric. There is no distortion in the lens. These are stylish and durable sunglasses.

title: Expected more!!
review: I expected a little more in these Ebifin slacks. They are ok, just nothing fancy. Nothing special.  First, the fabric is thin. And they seem (on my body) to be a little unflattering. They seem to be cut short in the crotch and tight on the thighs. The color is also lighter than I thought they would be. They are described as khaki, but I would describe them as blush. Overall, I can’t give these pants over a 3.

title: Very light, but arrived bent
review: Oddly, this arrived bent. I used heavy weights to flatten it out, and it will still not quite sit flat. I may heat it in some hot water and try again.

title: Not the same as before
review: I got the next up size box last time. They seemed much brighter. These did not give off as much light.

title: Nice
review:
I like the product, but it needs to have sizing or you should be able to buy it
in larger or smaller sizes.

title: Not for me - but a great pack
review: I didn't like the size and shape of this for me. I gave it to a family member who raves about it. It's padded enough and keeps things cold for hours. He said it works perfectly. I found it too bulky (I'm 5'1") and he's taller so that might make a difference for someone. It is limited in size but if you are carrying it on your back, that's probably a good thing. No breaks or spills -- it works well.

title: Birthday bat
review: Grandson birthday big hit

title: Actually a real draft size halter. Fits our Percheron properly
review: It can be hard to find an actual "draft" size halter out there - lots of brands think a large horse size is the same thing and it isn't. This one is a true draft horse halter and fits our Percheron mare correctly. It seems comfortable on her when we use it and the dark green is very pretty against her ebony coat. My only complaint is about the buckle holes along the crown strap. The holes are not reinforced with a metal edge. Over time, they will begin to stretch or fray, but it's not the end of the world.

title: Don't waste your money because I'm already looking at new ones
review: Broke after I used it twice. Also bought a second one for a friend and his already has a break in the plastic. Don't waste your money because I'm already looking at new ones.

title: Peace of Mind
review: I have a 17 year old daughter and was thinking of her when I ordered these. First of all, it says there are 5 tests in the package, but there are actually 10. There are two tests per sheet and 5 sheets included. The paper tests are in a matchbook style folder. I think it would be great if that was then inside a vinyl holder or something to keep it from getting torn or dirty while being stored inside your purse. It says to make sure you read all the directions before administering a test. I found the directions to be extremely difficult to read because they are so tiny! I am not the target audience, so I guess that's okay. It's pretty easy to use. You put a drop of water on each of the test spots and then wait for it to dry which takes a few minutes. It's not a particularly discreet procedure. If you were on a blind date and took this out to test your drink, you can't easily hide your actions. I tested this using plain tap water. The directions say that the water will cause a light blue mark, which is normal.  Mine did just that. You're suppose to tear out the test sheet before testing the drink. But if you only use one test, you still have an unused test on the other half of the sheet, but there's really no place to put it securely.  I was not able to test it with anything that would cause it to have a positive reading, so I can only assume that it will work as indicated. I definitely think it's a good thing to have on hand when you have doubts.

title: Worked great the first trip.
review: The product does not last. Used this on my first trip and worked great. Was excited to use it I. The next trip and it had a leak. There is no way to fix the leak is the pillow had a zipper to acces the air bladder it could be repaired. Waste of money do not buy!!!

title: Great for outdoor event, employment or activity!
review:
Ordered for daughter who works varied shifts as a hotel valet.. and weather gets chilly working early mornings + late at night! This heat source has offered a solution when standing outside in the cold! The massage option is really just a frill on top!! (think continued phone vibration- and note: can be used with heat only!) Light source adds safety perk with ability to use walking in the dark..

Equipped with x3 varied heat levels.. I find its really just high or low- nothing real distinct in between but, its all you’ll need! LED let’s you easily see heat and battery level. If charged overnite with included usb it lasts all day..!!

Worked best tucked into a pant pocket and cup hands around it as needed to kick up heat.. so when not “holding” heat it can penetrate thru clothing layer giving a nice “hot-shot!” Could also tuck into jacket pocket and slip hands in as needed. Not realistic in gloves bc of size and if it does fit.. hand use is obsolete bc of its interference.

A solution for added heat on a repeated bases.. a little bit of warm can go a long way! Great for outdoor work, activity, sport venue, etc.. any scenario involving cooler weather. Hoping info helps your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: A+ for light and customer service; F- for instructions
review:
After Hurricane Sandy hit the east coast and I was without power for 9 days, I decided to purchase one more light to add to my army of 13 flashlights. I wanted something that would illuminate a room better than my underwater flashlight and my headlamp. My underwater flashlight and head lamp happen to be exceptional lights but they can only be used for focused tasks since they lack a wide range. This lantern not only gives exceptional light but it also illuminates an entire small room.

These are the many features I like:

- The lantern is so bright it is blinding but it definitely lights up my kitchen from 1/2 a room away. I just had to make sure I did not look the light in the eye.
- It has a high and low mode.
- It can also be used as a strobe light (meaning in blinking mode).
- It only takes only 3 D size batteries (only one more battery than most D-battery flashlights).
- It's water resistant.
- It comes with a lifetime warranty.
- The lantern has a tent hook on the bottom; although it is a bit difficult to move.
- It also has an EZ-find light that blinks every few seconds; although that "find" light (which sits above the black power button) is barely visible in the dark.
- Customer service is excellent.

The only problem I had with this light is that it did not come with any instructions; it only comes with a wrap-around paper touting its virtues. Therefore, I had to call the company on the 800 I found on the Internet (you can find that # in my comments) to learn how to make the strobe light work. I also asked how the EZ find light worked because I was unable to detect it.

The tent hook and handle are self-explanatory but to make this light work, this is what I had to do. Please note I executed all these instructions with the front of the lantern facing me:

1. Both the top and bottom of the lantern screw off. The top is where the blub is and that can be screwed off counter-clockwise but there's really no reason to remove the top. I screwed off the bottom clockwise and inserted the 3 D batteries as indicated on the stickers inside. I then lined up the red arrows (both on lid and case) when closing the bottom in the opposite direction I opened it and made I heard it click shut.

2. I pushed the black button to operate the light. Pressing it once brought on high mode and pressing it again brought on low mode. Sometimes I found that after one press no light comes on; in that case I pressed it again until I was in the desired mode. The tech said this was normal behavior.

3. To get the strobe light working, I had to HOLD down the black button for about 5 or 6 seconds until the light started to flash. I then pressed the black button to turn the strobe effect off.

4. To see the EZ find light that is located above the black on off button, I moved the lantern to a totally dark room. This light flashed every 5 or 6 seconds but I still found it hard to see.

In summary, this is a great lantern for illuminating a small room or anywhere I need to illuminate a larger area than a flashlight can provide. The light given off seems fluorescent but it's bright enough to work with. The only thing I did not like is that instructions on how to operate the strobe, insert the batteries, etc. were not provided. Although I was able to figure out how to do most of this, I had no clue I had to HOLD down the on/off button for 5 or 6 seconds to get the strobe feature to work. Since this lantern is going into storage until I need it, I will take out the batteries as the EZ find light will probably drain them after a couple of months.

title: Great product!
review: Making my own crossbody bag straps is easy once you know how. This roll of strap saves me money instead of bying a ready made strap. I use this item for my crocheted crossbody bags.

title: Large, bright and convenient
review:
As I write this review the sample that I received is magnetically attached to my refrigerator to serve as a late night kitchen light. I am not going to repeat the product specs, but at the time of this review the dimensions are not provided. Since this is a relatively large light I think that including the is important.

The light is 8 inches long, of which 6.5 inches are unobstructed for displaying the light itself. The width is approximately 1.25 inches. Note also that the shape of this light is hexagonal, and three of the eight sides are part of the illuminating system. That means that this can be used directionally without blinding you in the process. If that sounds silly, I own a round LED light that is 360 degrees of illumination and it can be a chore to use in the dark of night. I have wrecked my night vision with that one more than once, but the design of this one prevents that.

The product specs claim that the four steady settings range from two percent to one hundred percent of the 200 lumens. I personally think the two percent figure is off because even at that low setting this light will illuminate up to a meter (or even more) in front of you, and at full setting it will easily illuminate detail at five meters. I like the flashing setting too because this can be used as an emergency beacon as well as in home lighting.

I have not tested this for a rundown, nor have I tested the recharging time. I did use it for two straight hours on full setting and it only slightly dimmed. If you combine it with a 2000mAh backup battery it makes a great emergency light.

One final note: the magnets in the body are pretty strong. I tried knocking mine off my refrigerator door by purposely bumping into it and it budged, but held fast. I like this one so much that I am ordering a few more. The reason is I prefer rechargeable lights to replaceable battery ones. Plus, if I do need to check something in the yard at night (or make an emergency egress) this light is handily located on my fridge door. A few more would increase both safety and convenience.

title: Great for its intended uses.
review:
Our family of four used this product on our annual 2 week sojourn into a scattered site primitive camp setting. To avoid filling the RV holding tank (requires repeated trips to civilization for a dump station) we used a portable toilet which can be emptied every few days at a nearby national forest vault toilet. The privacy tent was used for the toilet in lieu of draping tarps from surrounding trees. The product was well made with good seams, adequate zippers and durable material and it easily tolerated numerous daily uses. It was exceptionally room for changing or simply moving about. Staking the unit is recommended because its light and easily blown over if windy. However staking would be difficult to do if setting this up for use on a hard surface. For shower use plan for drainage and I suggest bringing a 1 inch shower pedestal. Who wants to stand in mud when they shower. If used for showering and toileting I recommend two tents. One for each purpose. For us the interior storage pouches were handy for sanitizers, paper products etc. First time assembly was not as easy as pictured because the frame and tent were packed separately. Take town and second time assembly were a snap: operating as pictured. All in all, it's a good product that worked very well for us. We anticipate years of service.
By gone Inspector.

title: Solid, but leaks when turned upside down
review: My daughter wanted a giant water jug like this one for Christmas - this is the one she got.  But, it totally leaks when turned upside down to drink from the spout.  There's no straw, so to use the spout for water, it must be turned upside down.  Totally defeats the purpose.  And probably an easy fix....Coleman???

title: Beautiful sweatshirt pullover; very attractive on me; top part appears to run a size smaller
review:
This is a beautiful NFL sweatshirt pullover. The yellow and purple color mix is super attractive. The patch on front is sewed on to last. The front waist pocket is typical. The sweatshirt material is of medium quality and thickness. The current price of $79 is to be expected for sports-related clothing, but I do consider that a tad expensive.

The reason I rated this 4 stars is because the upper part of the pullover seems to be cut smaller than I would expect. The waist is big on me but in the shoulders and around the upper part of the torso, it seems to fit me like large and not an extra large.

title: Good paddle
review: The is a solid paddle, build well and very sturdy. My only gripe with it besides the sticker that was a bit painful to get off is that it dose not adjust all the way down so that you can use it easier if you decide to paddle on you knees. Other than that a great paddle. There are there size adjustments.

title: Long Pole
review: I do not have a stand up board.  I have a kayak with a high seat and stable enough to stand on.  I needed something to help under certain paddling conditions. This will be perfect for bringing along as an extra paddle to help when standing.  While I got a discount to report on this item, I do find the size, length and foldability of this item to be convienient for taking on the kayak for an extra tool.  I will update after more use.

title: The quality is impeccable!!
review:
I ordered the following for review:
JOOLA Infinity Balance - Advanced Performance Ping Pong Paddle - Competition Ready - Table Tennis Racket for High-Level Training - Designed to Optimize Spin and Control

JOOLA Infinity Edge - Tournament Performance Ping Pong Paddle w/Pro Carbon Technology - Black Rubber on Both Sides - Competition Ready - Table Tennis Racket for Advanced Training - Designed for Speed (Blue Handle)

JOOLA Omega Speed - Table Tennis Racket for Advanced Training with Flared Handle - Tournament Level Ping Pong Paddle with Torrent 33 Table Tennis Rubber- Designed for Speed

JOOLA Infinity Edge - Tournament Performance Ping Pong Paddle w/Pro Carbon Technology - Black Rubber on Both Sides - Competition Ready - Table Tennis Racket for Advanced Training - Designed for Speed (Red Handle)

JOOLA Omega Strata - Table Tennis Racket with Flared Handle - Tournament Level Ping Pong Paddle with Riff 34 Table Tennis Rubber - Designed for Spin .

It’s been years since I played Ping Pong and back then I never had the opportunity to use, and was not even familiar with the Joola brand unfortunately. As I have had time to use and play with these 5 different Joola Ping Pong paddles, I must say that they are all incredible compared to any other Ping Pong paddle I have ever used. The quality and performance far exceeds my previous experiences.

Each of these paddles have been designed for a specific purpose which include speed, spin and control. Now not being a professional, I can not “honestly” say that I notice the difference between any of these five different paddles, in any of the different design aspects while using them. However, I can honestly say that visually I can tell the difference by the different rubber padding (sandwiched between the inner and outer rubber) used in each. Some have a slightly different thickness, weight, color and I assume different “springiness”. With that said, each and every one of them have performed absolutely stellar in every way for my, and my family’s play style. Personally they all have incredible spin, speed and control capabilities. They are all built with beautiful build quality, and designed with comfort and balance in mind. I especially love the resin looking inlaid logo at the end of the handles. I realise that it doesn’t make a performance difference but it just ads to the overall beauty and gives each paddle a quality looking finish.

Overall I feel quite privileged to have had the opportunity to use and experience the Joola brand and share my opinions, though I feel absolutely unqualified to have done so. Just know that if you have never used or played with a “quality” Ping Pong paddle, you are truly missing out, and this Joola brand will be the only brand I choose from here on out! The quality is impeccable!!

title: Works but has drawbacks
review:
Pros:
Ambidextrous holster
Fits wide array of guns
Seems to hold fairly securely

Cons:
As others have said, it's thick

Here's an attempt to do just about everything, and to some extend, it does. It's IWB and OWB combined that can work for right or left-handed draw. It'll fit in most locations (back, hip, front) and fits an impressive array of guns. It seemed to work well with a Bersa Thunder CC .380, SW 437 .38 (J-frame snubbie), Kel-Tec P-11, Springfield XDE (9mm) and Sig P-226 (9mm). It feels better with the larger guns, I think, as the holster is then smaller in total carry volume. With .380's, the holster feels as hefty as the weapon. So, it works, but is not my first choice. For the price, I will keep it as seems well made and it can be widely used.

title: Amazing in its simplicity and functionality!
review: My husband and I have been using the Contigo coffee mugs but the model we had just wasn't easy to keep sanitized. The Built brand is far superior! The deep top makes it least likely to have any spillage and the twist top makes it easy to open and close. Cleaning is also very simple and getting into all areas of the top is super easy and straightforward. No secret latches which is actually more annoying than functional. We love these Built traveling mug so much, we got 4 of them! Amazing design in its simplicity and functionality!

title: Great size
review: Sticks great to what ever I put them on.

title: So many courses, Easy to use!
review: My father is the least tech savvy person ever and yet he can navigate this thing. Great buy!

title: Three Stars
review: FYI don't use for camping lol

title: Great Glove and Soft Ball
review: This is a perfect training glove for kids. It includes a ball that is much softer than a regular baseball. The glove is very supple and easy to catch with. Although this is a kid's glove, I could squeeze my hand into it to try it out. I got this for my 9 year old daughter and she took to it right away. The glove is made from synthetic leather that feels great and helps to absorb the impact of the ball. There is a soft liner on the back of the glove to ensure your hand stays comfortable. I didn't feel any interior stitching, and the glove feels very durable. This is a nice starter glove to use to introduce your children to the fun of baseball.

title: Nice
review: Bought for my one person inflatable pontoon battery, a little big but its' nice to have the quick connects. It takes up a lot of room on my pontoon, but gotta have it.

title: too big
review: way too large

title: Pretty
review:
I like bags that have initials on them. They just seem nice. This is a very nice bag. The quality seemed very good. Everything worked fine on it without a problem. It seemed to be durable. We have used it without a problem. It opens and shuts just fine. It seems to be a decent thickness. Everything in it stays just fine.
It is pretty comfortable to carry. It doesn’t feel too bulky. It can hold a decent amount. It looks pretty good on. I like the extra features of it. It is also pretty attractive. It looks nice. I would recommend it.

title: This whistle is very loud.
review: When I used it at night while walking my dog, I felt comfortable that I had an effective way to alert my neighbors that I had a problem. Since I bought it, I have obtained a medical emergency mobile unit, so I don't need it as much, but I plan to keep it handy in my car, just in case.

title: Great for kids!
review:
Ok, let's get something straight- there's no way 3-4 adults are fitting in this thing. But that's normal for tent ratings- they are usually a little bit generous with their occupancy rating and assume bodies are stacked like sardines inside. But this is more like half capacity at best- I'd say maybe 2 adults, or one adult and 2 kids. However, that did NOT stop 3 of my kids from wanting to run inside the very second it popped open. They fit comfortably inside and honestly it makes a great kid's tent if you want, for example, to have a separate adults' tent or even just let the kids have a backyard sleepover. We haven't used it in the rain yet so I can't vouch for that sort of use, but I CAN say that it pops open effortlessly by just removing it from the bag it comes in. Easiest tent install ever! Putting it back in? That's a challenge.
I like that it comes with directions sewn into the bag, but they were still hard to follow if you haven't done a tent fold like this before. It is similar to those car windshield pop up protectors in that it has plastic circular hoops that need to fold along itself to make a large oval into smaller circles. And if you make a mistake, it will POP open in your face and make you start over. That was annoying. But I did eventually get it to the correct size folding on the third try, and was able to get it back in the back and zip it up.
At $70, you can get a much bigger tent from Coleman or Ozark Trail, but not a pop up kind like this one. The instant pop ups fetch a premium, and I recall the last one I saw was slightly bigger than this one but nearly 2x the price, so I think it is priced appropriately for what it is. I'd consider this one a good value, I just wish it was easier to put away, and was a little more realistic about capacity.

title: A Very Nice, Lightweight Sleeping Bag
review: A lightweight, warm weather sleeping bag that keeps me comfortable.  It unzips from the top and bottom. At the top is a Velcro strap to keep it closed on one side and a toggle drawstring to get it to close tighter. It can also be unzipped completely, to open it up and use as a blanket. In between camping trips, I will indeed be using it as a blanket. The bag is thin enough that you will likely want to bring a pad along if you will be sleeping on the bare ground. Oh, and I do like the color, but that is really a matter of personal preference.

title: Five Stars
review: Great price great kayak. seats a little flimzee

title: Lifesaver for sore legs!
review: This is one of the best massagers I have ever tried! You can really get a good deep massage when your legs are really sore. I like how easy it is to hold, you don't get hand cramps while your trying to work on your legs haha. This works for your lower back and upper arms too. Recommend this for anyone who runs or get's charlie horses regularly.

title: Arrived without the bike lock and only the mounting clip
review: This arrived with out the bike lock and only the mounting clip. If I can get this resolved I’ll remove the review, but I’m pretty disappointed I can’t use my bike today after all. I’m really confused how this could have happened in the first place

title: Served It's Purpose
review: This chain is just fine for a young child who is just going to elementary school for the day.  Yeah, the quality could be a little higher, but it works for a younger person who may otherwise lose it, destroy it or do whatever to it until they get older.

title: Worked perfectly for us
review: This was super easy to put up and use. I searched a youtube video to close it, but that was easy too. I may not get another use out of it because my 8 year old dragged it across asphalt as we were walking back to our car. It ripped and I was livid.

title: Camping tools
review: Three words. Cheap cheap cheap.

title: stepper
review: Love how this is not a space hog and was easy to assemble and use. Just need to use it more often,. LOL!

title: A Poor Design Concept Made Of Cheap Plastic
review: In photos this desk lamp appears to have a cool, high tech look. Sadly, the actual product feels very flimsy and cheap. Moreover, it's not clear why something intended as a desk lamp would run on batteries rather than just being plugged into an outlet like a regular lamp. I got this light for our 14 year old family geek. He spends hours at his desk every day doing homework and working on his various projects. A battery run lamp simply can't keep up with his lighting needs, not in any cost effective way. We did check this "lamp" in a darkened house and outdoors at night. It turns out to be much better as a flashlight than as a desk lamp. The pistol grip in it's supporting stand and it's light weight works well for that. It's light is bright and is more than adequate for making one's way on a dark night. It's cheap plastic body notwithstanding, this thing should serve him better as emergency lighting than as a desk lamp which is why I give it 3 stars rather than just 1 or 2.

title: So Disappointed! Internal Framing Broke after 3 uses!
review: What a waste! I was so excited to buy a “high quality” umbrella. I’ve used it 3 times and one of the metal support bands attached to a plastic piece snapped leaving a sad, sagging piece hanging from the umbrella. SO disappointed. I’ve bought grocery store umbrellas that have lasted longer.

title: Interesting
review: Interesting concept. Was hoping it would help w neck pain, but it was difficult to use on the neck. However, I use it on my arms and leg and it feels amazing!

title: too small
review: I ordered the 3X for a big guy, but it's more the size of a XL. These run really small.

title: To dried

title: Gets my son's seal of approval

title: Not the best
review: Great look, cinch broke within a week. Not great quality.

title: Leaking Bottles
review:
All the bottles in 3 separate shipments now have leaked product. The reason is because there is no seal at the top of the bottle. With so many bottles having arrived badly leaked, the fault is with the design of the bottle. I have ordered other similar product made by different companies, and they did not arrive having leaked badly.

The product does a good job of masking odors, and it is absolutely unscented, which is great. But, again, the fact so many bottles have leaked in transit must be fixed.

title: Not really a fan of the calf leash
review: Got this for my longboard hoping it wouldn't get in the way when I'm walking the board, but it doesn't seem to help much in that regard, and the torsion on my knee when the board is loose is much worse than with an ankle leash. Back to ankle leashes for me.

title: 12 Hours hahahahah
review: Once again I have fallen for a false claim. This bottle keeps my drink cold for an hour or 2...not 12 like it says. Buy it because you can add ice to it...but not becuase it keeps your drink cold.

title: Glorified bag carrier! 😂
review:
[[VIDEOID:aae589e93b9afd783b1f9dbccd83a8e9]] This is a pretty sweet cart, easy to put together and maneuver around.
Now will my husband get a deer this coming hunting season, that's a whole nother question, lol!
But he has been begging for one of these carts just in case he ever does actually hunt anything!!
It will make carrying his bags and tree stand out into the woods a whole lot easier...

title: Worth the price!
review: Works well. Good product. Adjustable tension. Feel it work!

title: To many parts and pieces I like to keep it simple and you still have to ...
review: To many parts and pieces I like to keep it simple and you still have to buy a holster I did not even open the package I sent it back. It might work fine but I didn't want it; I think it would be to hard for me to mount with one hand.

title: Very Mix Feelings
review: The tails comes off too easy.  Matter of fact after 3rd time out the feathers came off.

title: Poor instructions and pressure. And no, you can’t put a sous vide into it.
review: I was super excited by the review that mentioned that they heated the water inside this with a sous vide heater. I have one, and it seems like an inspired idea. It doesn’t work. The opening is about the size of a standard garden hose. But a bit smaller, you can’t stick a garden hose inside to fill it.  So I stood there with the hose nozzle aiming a jet inside and getting sprayed occasionally to fill it to the ‘best’ line. I followed the instructions on the box, started trying to inflate it with the foot pump, and on the third pump the pump started leaking water out all over the ground. Thankfully, I contacted the manufacturer and they told me that I should switch the ends of the hose connecting the foot to the shower bag. After I did that, it did work. However, the pressure is just not what I had hoped for. Nowhere near what I get from the garden sprayer.  The instructions need to be clearer. This is definitely better than the shower bags that you have to hang, but I’m not sure it is that much better to justify the vastly increased price.

title: very light weight
review: I had bought this for my brother. He likes it. It's very light and holds a lot. Would i recommend this - maybe. Depends on the person you are getting it for. I would give to kids since these days they bags are heavier.

title: Singing the blues
review: This unt's fine, I've not banged it around too hard - mine's the blue light - it's a novelty of sorts, but in daylight it completely washes out at 10 yards. So yeah, it's kewl, but there's a reason you see blue lasers so rarely - it's actually not blue per se - it shifts towards violet a little bit. Overall, construction is decent. I'd buy again, this time in green for day or red for night - both're higher frequency than blue, maybe that's why can be seen better...

title: Don't Waste Your Time Or Money!!!
review: Sadly there is very little padding in the back and straps and it is poor quality.

title: Was not comfortable for me
review: I’m 6’4” and 230 lbs. I was really hoping this higher back would be more comfortable but it wasn’t. Was at a very odd angle. I went with the lower more standard height backrest and was much better. Quality was fine and it seemed sturdy for what it was.

title: it's OK, but
review: not circle hook, not off set

title: This is horrible. 0 stars if I could give 0
review: It was hard to fill with air, no matter how much we flopped it around.  We finally used a heavy duty blower to fill it up.  After filling it up, we laid on it and the air started seeping right out.  Couldn't lay on it for more than 5 minutes.  I do not recommend.

title: Works great
review: Very good durable belt

title: My horses love this
review: I have 3 horses and every now and then they get a little sore after a longer ride. It is nice to have this Vetrolin Liniment spray on hand by Farnam. I use products by Farnam quite frequently because I know it is a quality line and this one is no different. My horses always thank me with nuzzles and kisses because they know it works and gives them almost instant relief. By the time they are turned back out in the field I can tell that it is working and they are already walking again with more ease and feel that the soreness is easing off.

title: No thank you.
review: Product says "Adjustable- waist sizes 20-42 inches".  I have a 34" waist and can hardly get it to fit around me.  Also, it always drags on the ground.

title: NOT for GOLF; DO NOT BUY IF FOR GOLF
review: Chewy says the advertising on the sellers page is MISLEADING. AGREE IT IS A GOOD PRODUCT, HAS MANY USES but NOT FOR GOLF!!!. ESPECIALLY NOT FOR PUSH CART, wobbly, and flip flop all over. guarantee you that the FORCE WILL NOT BE WITH YOU if and when you use the UMBRELLA IN YOUR GOLF GAME.

title: This is way too thin.  My $5 gas station Mexican Blanket is much nicer & thicker than this.
review:
I searched a lot for a thicker Mexican Blanket.

Though the years I've run into very cheap Mexican blankets at gas stations and loved them. They were thick, warm, and substantive.

This is not. This might be good as a table cloth, or a bed cover for its looks and colors, NOT its thickness and warmth.

It also smells dusty.

Perhaps Amazon is not the place to buy "Traditional" or real "Yoga" Mexican Blankets.

title: Very durable and works well!
review: My wife used this ball for the first time today and loved it! It’s easy to inflate with the foot pump and is great for Pilates and sit ups. Has a nice grip on it so you don’t slip off too. Feels heavy duty and is just wonderful for the price.

title: Fits a Sequoia  - dogs like it
review:
We travel with dogs. A lot of dogs. I usually just lay all the sears flat and put several dog beds down and off we go. But I wanted to try something a little different in the truck since folding the rear seats just puts the dogs on the floorboard. They hate that. This car bed is actually a decent solution.

It fits well in the F150 and the Toyota Sequoia, but its a tad big for the Kia Soul. Once inflated, it's much bigger than expected and stiff. It stays put and doesn't feel flimsy if you lie down on it. I found it to be reasonably comfortable all things considered. I covered with three thick, folded blankets to protect it from dog claws. The dogs were wary at first, but they seem to like it.

title: Cheaply made.  One of the ladders broke on the first ball toss.
review:
This would be a fun toy, but the plastic is cheap and it comes in too many pieces. It's not easy to put the tubes into the connecting pieces.

On the first throw of the balls, they cracked one of the joints. In fact, the balls knocked off several chunks of the plastic joints. It doesn't stay together as well. I ended up putting it by the dumpster at the campground. Maybe, someone will make use of the one ladder that didn't break.

I don't recommend this set.

title: Not bright enough for detailed close up crafting.
review: Is the first click from the off and on switch the brightest? If no, which one should I use for close up detailed craft work?

title: Attractive decal but…
review: This is a very nice looking decal but we had a difficult time applying to a flat vertical glass surface.  Not sure why the upper section of the decal wouldn’t adhere evenly and had multiple air bubbles that couldn’t be worked out. Tried to carefully lift and work out but the bubbles kept coming back in the same place.  Never had that problem before.  Ended up moving to another surface that the bubbles were not so obvious.

title: cute!
review: Very cute, think that it runs a little age, but may shrink after washing.

title: Perfect size
review: Great bag, made well.

title: Meh.
review: Hard to get over the neck of the bottle, and then the leather handle broke off!

title: Product works great
review: Great for my electric scooter makes it a lot easier to carry.

title: Lots of fun
review:
This was a fun game. It is great for a party or just the backyard.

We really like things to keep the kids active. I would much prefer them doing something than watching something. It is great because it is like a game for them but then they are being physically active.

The quality was good. It worked as it was supposed to. It wasn’t too hard to set up.

This is a great activity for a day when you don’t know what else to do or you want your child to burn off some energy. It is a good way to keep a child busy.

The children really liked it.

I feel like this is good for child development. It kept my children's interest. It would also make a nice gift.

I would recommend it.

title: FIVE WEEKS AND COUNTING- And Some Important Tips To Help Keep Things Sturdy.  This Is My Happy Place
review:
(WARNING- This is a long review. I am covering areas about this tent that were a concern to me. If you want a summary, go to the paragraph titled THE BOTTOM LINE)

I wanted to take the time to review this tent. I spent a LOT of hours researching, watching EVERY video and reading every available review I could find out there about this tent to decide which I would get. It was between this tent and [[ASIN:B001TSCF96 Coleman Montana 8-Person Tent]]. As it turned out, we had an immediate need for TWO tents, so I got both of them. You can see my review of the [[ASIN:B001TSCF96 Coleman Montana 8-Person Tent]] by clicking the link

WHAT IS THIS TENT LIKE?
One of the things I was concerned about was the thinness of material. We live in a very high elevation and get constant breezes or wind. There were a number of reviews that spoke of their tents snapping or ripping after only a gentle breeze. The fabric is thin, yes. But it does hold up.

Enough people have posted photos, so I won't post one as of yet. The best way to secure this tent is to ALWAYS leave the fly on. An unexpected storm or wind can come up at any time, and I personally feel that the tent is much more stable with the fly on than without. Make sure that you always stake down everything, including ALL of the ropes. That is what keeps the tent stable and secure.

FLOOR
The floor is very nice, and if you use a tarp underneath and take off shoes before entering, it will last quite a while. I also recommend not using chairs with small pointed feet on it either- it will wear out the floor quickly.

WINDOWS
The windows are perfect. They are protected from all but the most severe of rainstorms so you can leave them open if you like. The back window is open at all times, yes, but if staked down, it is not that big of a deal. If we plan to take this on crowded camp sites, I will sew two rings at either back seam and attach a thin fabric when changing. No big deal.

POCKETS AND LANTERN RING
The pockets are nice and in a good space. There is also a ring for hanging a lantern on if you like.

HEIGHT
The height is perfect for us- the tallest is 5 ft 9 inches. Taller people might not like this tent. The screened in porch is a bit narrow for those with long legs. You pretty much need a chair to use it unless you are a kid and don't need to lean back.

SCREENED IN PORCH
I LOVE this thing. I really do. This is my happy place. It is perfect for two camp chairs to look out at night or in the day. The door of the tent can stay open adding to a spacious feel. It does get wet in the rain. I am currently designing a fly to go over the porch and roll up into the tent when not in use. So far I am almost done with the one half of the fly and plan to finish the other half this week if I can. I hope to do that before the tent is taken down.

Without a fly, your stuff will get wet. There is an area that you can sweep the water into when wet, I use a sponge mop to clean it up so it will dry faster. Otherwise it puddles and does take a long time to dry.

POLES
The poles went up well for us, but you just have to take your time when putting up the tent. Do not race through the process, the fabric can rip if you don't.

TENT SPACE
Our biggest concern was ACTUAL usable space for us. We found that putting a queen inflatable double height mattress in there (Coleman) we have plenty of room for two of us. If using an additional single mattress, we can still do it, but it works best with a sleeping bag on the floor and picked up at night if a third person is in there (child).

When using or covering up the porch in rain, the porch makes a great extension for activities, talking, or just sitting and enjoying the view (if not raining). I absolutely love the design of this tent.

LIGHTING
The tent color is half of the beauty of this tent. The light bright colors are cheerful, let in a lot of light, and also keep it from feeling gloomy on rainy days. At night you can see through it, so keep that in mind when you are getting ready at night.

DOES THIS STAY UP IN STORMS?
The big question. I have an answer for you. We purchased this tent the week before Labor Day (US). We put the tent up immediately and treated it with silicone spray. We didn't need to- it is already made from silicone impregnated ripstop nylon. The seams also came pre-treated with silicone on the fly. AMAZING!.

We have had this tent up with daily use since then and it is now October 8,2016. So far it has been through extreme heat, breezes, high winds, thunder storms, all night rains, and heavy rain storms. The tent has stayed up with no observable damage at this point and stayed very dry too.

IMPORTANT POINTS
After reading MANY reviews on this tent, I decided to help it stay up, I would reinforce different areas. Anywhere that there is a plastic hook, I put a piece of garden twist tie into the fabric loop that holds the hook and tied it around the pole to help it absorb any shock of high winds. Any other plastic rings or hooks were reinforced in the same way. I tucked the ends of the twist tie way under so no chance of the fabric blowing into sharp edges and tearing in high winds.

STAKES
I also recommend getting other stakes for the tent. They stay in the ground during storms more easily too. I got [[ASIN:B01IEBKK92 Pack of 16, 7075 Aluminum Outdoors Tent Stakes & Rubber Hammer & Guyline Tensioner with Reflective Pull Cords & Carrying Pouch]] to use in the fly staking process, and used the ones that came with the tent for the actual tent staked to the ground.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Honestly, this is my favorite tent of all time. It is my happy place. I absolutely LOVE the design, set up, colors, and ventilation of this tent. With a mattress, it is still private to lay down with the windows open and you can still look out at the sky and enjoy the scenery. When you are in the tent and want to have breeze, the front door open makes it seem so airy and wonderful. I can not rave about this tent enough. Five weeks of constant use is more than we planned for, but it has held up so far.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED at five stars.

QUESTIONS AND UPDATES
If you have any questions I have not answered, by all means ask. I hope I can be helpful, as I know how it helps me when others do the same. I will update with any more input should I have anything else to share or if there are problems with the tent.

title: don't use on unsealed basement floor.
review: I had a ton of these on two large basement storage room floors.  Had to move one today and it is wet and moldy underneath.  Rest of basement is bone dry except for where these mats were.  Throw rugs on bare floor are not wet underneath.  Things just sitting on bare floor have no water, floor for 6 inches around walls are not wet.  Just where these were laying.  I had about 30 of them and it is wet underneath every one.
