title: Ok
review: Ok for price.

title: Won't Stay Connected
review:
Wearable fitness bands are becoming popular these days. Like biometric scales they can track your progress and help you get a handle on your health by reporting your information easily and allowing you to connect to your phone or tablet so you can map your progress. I had hoped to start working with the Razer Nabu X and start taking some readings but unfortunately it has not worked out so well.

The platforms for which it is designed to interact are iOS and Android. I have a Windows phone so that rules out my phone, at least for now (this is my fault, not the Nabu X’s fault). In spite of not being supported, it pairs and connects with my phone without any problem at all. I tried with an Android device, a Sony Xperia Z, and while it paired it would not maintain the connection. As such I have a device that I cannot use.

I looked for a compatibility list and found a short list of compatible devices in the QA section of Razer’s support website. The Xperia Z is listed among the supported devices so I am not sure what might be causing the problem. Either it is not exactly compatible as they claim or I received a faulty device. The fact that it connects OK with my Windows phone suggests the former. I will be adding a new Android device, an HTC One, to my network in the next few weeks and will try with that device to see if I have better results.

Aside from not being able to use it for its intended purpose, I would like to mention that it does fit comfortably. I have large hands and wrists and I wasn’t sure if it would clasp around my wrist, but it does (with a couple of holes to spare). It is not so tight as to cut off circulate and not so loose as to slip and slide. At least the fit is good.

Unfortunately I cannot really test this device, as I cannot connect to it long enough to get any data from it. I will keep trying and will come back to update this review if I find success.

title: Not Quite What it Was Meant For
review: Well, my mother has a power bed and it can't be lowered any more than it is. She's been having trouble for months getting into the bed so we decided to look for step stools and such to help her get into the bed. During the search this unit came up and its perfect. This fit just below  and partially under the head of her bed. The textured top provides safe footing. It all we could have asked for. Granted it isn't being used for step aerobics but it does help an 85 year old  woman get safely into bed every night and for that, it works great.

title: Great lamp
review: We live in a hurricane prone area so it is really important to have a good lamp. This lamp was great. It worked very well. It was very rugged. I love how it can do okay through the elements. It felt very well made and high quality. It was bright. I think this would be great for camping or for your car or an emergency kit. I would definitely recommend it.

title: case is waterproof, but audio is bad with it on, and wrist floater detaches by itself
review: The case seems really durable and I really like that it comes with an attachable wrist strap that can loop into the phone. I like to attach that with a carabiner to my pack for day hikes so it’s easily accessible. The package came with clear instructions for testing if the case is waterproof. My major complaint is that the Temdan, yellow, wrist float that came with the case is completely unreliable. So basically, even if your phone is in a waterproof case, it will likely end up at the bottom of a lake or the ocean. I took the wrist floater with me to do standup paddle boarding (SUP) I attached it to a carabiner that had my car key on it and then attached the carabiner to my life vest or PFD. The yellow floater popped off its connection THREE TIMES! We were practicing falling and getting back onto our boards, while on the lake, and other SUP people kept finding the yellow floater and giving it to me. The loop that would normally attach to your phone was still on the carabiner but the yellow floater part kept un-clipping itself and floating away! Thank goodness I didn’t attach to my phone or else my phone would be at the bottom of the lake now. Do not trust it with your valuables! Always have a direct second attachment (like a carabiner) to your body/clothing/life jacket. Also with my iphone 7, everyone I spoke with on the phone said it sounded like I was very far away or I sounded muffled like I was speaking from inside a box. I would have to take the case off for people to hear me clearly. Unfortunately, with all the taking on and off of the case, the rubber seal came off from the inside and the case was no loner waterprooof after that.

title: Study plastic,  hard iron bars!  Looks good,  easy to cradle your bikes!
review:
This appears to be of quality manufacturer, the iron bars which are the most critical part, and the tire cradle is plastic, a hard durable plastic. The set-up is easy to assemble, provided you know something about following manuals and instructions. The concept is for two bikes on one rack. The tires of the bike wheels are secured with a strap. Plus, those umbrella hook like bars are adjustable for attaching and/or securing the frames of the bikes. This is made to allow access to the trunk.

This looks good, looks sturdy. And, most important, there is an attachment that will fit on your trailer hitch.

title: Good for small items or a cold pack
review: Good for small items or a cold pack

title: 50% of content falls short of real function..
review:
One thing this world has shown us lately.. is how unpredictable it can be! Global pandemic, nuclear tension, EMP ability, insurrection, protest takeovers natural disasters, etc. I feel a moral responsibility to the x4 who call me mom to be ready + prepared as possible for a crises. If that makes me a prepper- I’m not sure? I think of it as just being a step ahead vs. the 2 steps behind I usually am..!!

Choosing to create x1 universal “Grab/Go” bag of items- I ordered this survival kit to include. Only its content fell short of expectations with some of the important items- their real usability let me down.

*Rule No.1 in getting prepared- its not about looks! A gimmick that gives false security.. is useless and that’s not ok!! If item can’t perform the function intended.. then, its taking up space and could leave you in a critical bind!! Prior to packing try items if possible to insure functionality.. this weeds out any useless or poor quality- ie, axe included looks the part but is size/strength for a child (hmm.. a child cant have an axe so now what?!) the universal tool.. it couldnt tight/loosen screw on my back door! It actually stripped it as if made of pewter and not stainless. *items MUST function! Already feeling a bit crazy making “lifesaver” pack- at very least I want to know- I was nuts putting in quality items that could help us- and if fears go away.. items I could incorporate for other intended uses!!

I appreciate the hard case as it keeps content safe. But, with nothing secure- if accidental open.. items can spill and be lost! So, why 3 stars? (I wish to give this 50%.) Some items are universal and will suffice ie space blanket, glo stick, whistle, utensil, paracord etc. all can be of solid use.

Overall, spending $40 I want true user ability or just include less so not to create false security. May prove helpful as add-on or a back up with bigger equipment. Kit is very small.. can fit inside ATV, etc so may be good for minimal situations.. I’m not upset by what it doesn’t include- you know that when ordering. I just want included content usable.
Hoping this helps decision and stay safe everyone!!

title: Regular quality golf ball with a unique twist! Perfect for night golf activity..!!
review:
One of those “what will they think of next” type items! Totally fun and unnecessary.. and why not! Living on 7th hole of a golf course.. I’ll let you in on a secret, shsss.. My teens/college kids grew up here- and love to play around on the groomed grounds after dark- usually a lot of silly cart-wheeling and ball hunting! Yep, it’s a real thing!! Ball collecting only to hit them frivolously off into to the darkness.. all bc, they cant see where they went to get them back! Troublemakers- I know! But, a bit of harmless fun they’ve grown up perfecting.. Only now, I’ve found a way to let them play with more of a purpose! GaMe On!! As we’re really about find out who truly has the better shot! (Before its all judged on a “feeling”..as you can tell they take their game very serious!)

Hits like a golf ball, nothing wobbly or lopsided. Without activation it looks/feels in texture, weight, feel and sight just as a golfball should. One wouldn’t know these had magic powers.. something I do wish was marked by word or symbol, bc it’s too easy to mix up with regular balls- I’d hate to misplace or lose bc of this. *can easily mark with permanent marker to avoid losing- I highly suggest doing so! Fun unknowing surprise.. just be sure to reserve time on course at dawn/dusk to have glow be in full effect- Either that or come over for “night games” at our house!!

Great option for those who have back yard putting green.. or even golf gadgets/mobile units one sets up to practice form and such in the in/outdoors of home- ball is easy to find if rolled into bush or under furniture. Great idea to use at the local putt-putt golf galleria.. we usually do those at night time to avoid the heat! Glow lasted well over 5min. bright enough to glow ground around it.. see photos above. Hoping info helps decision- stay safe everyone.. “four!”

title: Excellent once you get in on
review: I own 3 of these for different bikes and the convenience on slidding the bag on and off can't be beat.  My first one which is also on the primary bike I have owned for three years and have not had any problems.  The only problem with this is getting it onto the bike without another person regardless of whether you are attempting to use it on a Schwinn or Trek bike.  On my new Schwinn the screw appeared to big for the hole however when I brought the bike to the bike shop the hole was clogged with paint and then it was discovered the hole was too long for the slot and would have interfered with the derailleur; but a quick change out with a screw used to hold the water bottle solved that problem.  One cautionary note is to place the bag fully loaded onto the rack once it is installed and check to make sure the weight of the bag is not causing the rack to rest on the rear brake assembly; if it is the problem is easily corrected by unscrewing the rack and placing it further away from he bike on the silver bracket slots.

title: It's fine for minor stuff
review:
I'm not at all sure what the hype over this is actually. It's a decent moisturizer cream certainly, but it didn't heal anything any faster than regular Corona ointment. This costs more though.

Our Donkey is forever popping up with random scrapes and bumps. If there's trouble, he's in it. He had two spots on his shoulder - pretty sure he was leaning into a fence post trying to steal hay from the paddock next door.

After 3 days of using this on one spot and Corona on the other spot, both spots are healed. Both areas feel soft and there's no tight edges or open areas. I just don't see any difference between the products except price and easier availability of Corona.

He already has it broken in and it moves great and feels great too. He is very happy with this glove and the way it's made. It is very well made that you can see through the webbing on the glove and the stitching. Very nice.

title: Good Sound Quality, Alexa Feature Lacking
review:
Alexa is slowly taking over my household. We continue to find more and more ways to ask Alexa to perform tasks for us. It could be anything from playing our favorite music to dropping in on one of the kids in their bedrooms. Since we keep expanding, it makes sense to get more Alexa equipped speakers and this need convinced me to get the Marshall Acton II Wireless Wi-Fi Multi-Room Smart Speaker.

With this speaker, you can connect using home wifi, Bluetooth, RCA, or the input jack . We use wifi and while it did take more effort than I expected to get things set up, it seems to be working fine now. However, I have noticed that it takes multiple attempts sometimes to get Alexa to respond. There is lag time and you have to be close to the speaker to make it work. My other, less expensive speakers in my house perform better.

One thing I find cool about this Marshall Acton speaker is its appearance. It is retro all the way and looks much like an amp for a musical instrument looked in decades past. It even has actual knobs to control the volume, bass, and treble. It has been a long time since I controlled sound or anything else by turning a knob and my nostalgic side was quite pleased. As for the input source, you just push a button to go from wifi to RCA, to Bluetooth, etc.

The sound quality of this speaker is good overall and I find it is best used for playing music. Its usefulness for Alexa is somewhat lacking, however, and considering this was the main reason I wanted to get this speaker, I can only rate it average overall.

title: Not just for fishing!
review:
I actually got these to use around the house. Regular handle pliers are nice, but being able to use these as "straight" pliers is extremely beneficial. I like to tinker with household objects--from kitchenware to third-party electronics--and some crevices can be hard to reach with regular pliers because of the way I hold them. I can't get good leverage because of hte angling (apt pun) and then pulling once I've got the griop is additional awkwardness because I can't pull straight. These eliminate the wonkiness. Not only are these pliers made of seemingly durable steel, but the grips are very comfortable and seem like they'll hold a long while. I've already used them to modify a handful of items and I foresee myself using these as my main pliers for years to come.
They come with a plastic band that keeps them closed to prevent unnecessary wear in the tool bag, but unfortunately I've lost mine.

title: Dont buy
review: Do NOT buy this ....doesn't work well & only can get a few games and definitely isn't compatible with alot of devices

title: JUNK after less than 3 mos
review:
I am posting a "reserved" review...After the experience buying the black one for my husband and the first one arrived, opened and not working! (BAD Amazon order fufillers sending an obviously opened and non-functioning product) I have had my Shine for about a week... I wear in on my wrist most of the time.. I chose to remove it before bathing. If I were swimming I would leave it on, although the propoganda states that if you wear in "treated" water it reduce it's life - odd to me. Also, it doesn't auto sync. You must sync it to your phone each day. The upside is that you don't have to charge it, just replace the battery. It seems to be fairly accurate. I will update if there are any use/wear issues. It arrived quickly (I have prime) and in good condition.

UPDATE 10/15/2014..... So... I've been using the Shine for about a month... it hasn't failed, to my knowledge. It syncs when prompted to, although I have found sometimes it takes longer than others even though I set it right next to my phone each time. It has survived one system "update" without noticeable issues. I chose to remove it when bathing. I do wish it auto synced rather than to manually prompt it to do so every morning. I have learned that if you are interested in following your sleep pattern one night at a time (it doesn't provide a graph of experience, however you can review night by night - would be nice to have an over all view), you must use the wrist band. Using the magnetic clip does not provide sleep info. Also note: when using the magnetic clip, be aware that it is HIGHLY likely to detach from you and attach to something else magnetic if it gets close and you may not even notice that you've left your Shine on something else. The "watch" band seems to be very durable. The time option of the Shine is interesting and maybe entertaining for a short while, however, it is not as "obvious" as you might think. It is very easy to misread. I found myself double-checking my phone a lot because I would think... hmm... my Shine says 5:30 but I KNOW it's 6:30. I eventually chose to "turn off" the watch function. Which is another thing.. to change anything you must be attached to where ever you downloaded the progam, not an option on the Shine itself. All of this is just information for those of you who are researching options. Honestly, the best part of the Shine for me is the battery and not having to charge it each night or every few nights. I didn't think I would mind the wrist band, but I am bored with it and it's look now, which sometimes interfers with my jewelry options. I considered the necklace accessory, however, the reviews of it were overwhelming not so great, so I stuck with the wrist band and the clip that comes with it. Over all it seems to fairly accurately record movement. However, when this one fails, I am probably going to search out the next option unless they do the subtle upgrades mentioned above... but even then, I think I'm still looking for the device that works best for me. Hope this info helps you in your research!
UPDATE: NOV 18 2014.... Sooo...about 2 months in and now it sometimes doesn't sync the sleep info. Randomly it just fails. And it would be nice if it would provide a graph or chart or some analysis of your sleep and workout info... but nope. It does now sync with My fitness pal, which is a free easy way of keeping track of your food/calories. Honestly, it's still disappointing because there are so many others that offer you more for about the same amount of money.

UPDATE: 12/4/2014.... Ok... the shine has officially stopped syncing... it's been "sputtering"... not recording data... taking a really long time to sync... etc.. I tried replacing the battery just in case. So... in less than 3 months.. it has stopped working. I would NOT recommend this pedometer at all. You would like to think it work for at least a year! I have the first gen fit bit... I just wanted one I could wear on my wrist. Honestly, I think I will try the wrist model of the fitbit.

title: Nice
review: These are very nice lures. They are very realistic looking and move very smoothly in the water. Coloring is very good on them as well. This is a very nice kit with lots of goodies.

title: L wouldn't even fit a toy yorki
review: Too small. Size chart is wrong.

title: Good pair of goggles
review: I've used these a few time in an in door pool. The blue shading is a big dark for in doors but the fit works perfectly. They are easy to adjust and seems to be made of quality plastics, The fit over my eyes works well. Overall they have a nice look.

title: Inexpensive solution for lighting a bike
review:
I received this set as a free review sample. What I like about them is they can be used as a temporary light set, since they are easily attached and removed from bikes. They will also augment existing lights, and especially of you have a front light, but are depending on a rear reflector to be seen at night.

They are absolutely water resistant as claimed. I have owned mine for about six months and they are practically indestructible. Both the front and rear lights are sufficient to be easily seen in bad weather and at night. The front light is not the best path finder, so think of these as more of a safety light to be seen than as navigational lights in the dark.

Mine are still running on the same sets of dollar store batteries that I put in them five months ago, although I have not used these lights more than a few hours a month. When I have used them, though, it was usually in bad weather thanks to the daily storms we get in my part of the country during the summer months.

Since they are removable you can quickly unlatch them from your bike and take them with you if you are worried about theft. They are small enough to literally fit in trouser pockets or in a purse - or backpack. Plus, given their sturdy construction, safety and reasonable cost they are truly a five star product.

title: YAS
review: BEST WHISTLE EVER

title: Not as advertised but still able to use.
review: This item was not the size it was advertised to be.

title: Very sweet electric skateboard…
review:
[[VIDEOID:5dbb96afe04c9db969e1d25a6cdb57]] Nice 7 ply maple deck, smooth wheels, with average electric power. This board can get going pretty fast on flat surfaces. I like how the remote has: low, medium, and high speed settings for different skill levels. The cutout handle in the deck is really great for easy carrying. The remote works good, just wish it had a better hand grip/strap. My other wish list would be for some more power for uphills. Yet, this might be very adequate for lighter riders. Overall, this was not a disappointment. In fact, it is a hit!

Trust you found this review to be honest and helpful:-)

title: Heats quickly
review: This hand warm heats quickly and works well.  love that it's also a power bank. it charges a cell phone a decent amount of time. Great for emergencies!

title: It's okay
review:
It's okay. The main compartment is sort of oddly designed and considerably less capacious than you'd think for a bag this size. Not too well organized, in my opinion. And you have to undo the main flap to get to the laptop storage, which can be an inconvenience. Its hardware is serviceable but not confidence-inspiring. All in all, it's not bad but it's not great.

The camo version has a really unattractive pinkish-beige lining that looks like ladies' undergarments. Not a fan of that color (except for ladies' undergarments).

title: Granddaughter likes it
review: Cute water bottle that should appeal to most girls. It is perfect for taking to school and would make a great gift. Fun to personalize with initials or other words. Only downside is that it's not insulated to keep water cold.

title: Love these knee pads!
review: They have good padding and very comfortable. I bought them for exercising. I will buy another pair for yard work and gardening.

title: Petite
review:
I like the larger CamelBak backpacks, and recently got a ladies' style one for my wife. I thought this one might be interesting for me to try since it is labelled as a Mens', despite being a "vest" rather than a pack. I'm not a small guy, I wear XL clothes, and this looks kinds of comical on me. I mean, I'm not expecting to be a fashion icon or anything when I go hiking, but I was expecting something more ruggedized and, for lack of a better term, "manly" looking. I put it on and the first thing I thought to do was paraphrase Zoolander's "what is this? A CamelBack for ANTS?!". It looks like I stole a back pack from a school kid and am struggling to make my getaway.
That being said, my pre-teen daughter tried it on and it looks good on her, so perhaps a smaller guy could pull this off comfortably. I feel like I'd rather trade with my wife and use the larger more rugged feeling one, despite it being styled for ladies, and let the girls in my house wear this "mens" one. 3 stars because it is functional and someone in my house can use it, just not the men it is intended for in the description.

title: Wife loves it! Keeps her accountable for drinking water!
review:
My wife loves this water bottle. Not only is the color combination so pretty, but it’s large enough to last all day, without being too big. She tried a gallon one in the past and liked it... but could never finish it. This is a more realistic goal!

It comes with a convenient carrying strap attached to the bottle, and also a straw and drinking nozzle. The lid pops up easily to take a sip and closes back up securely. You can drink with or without the straw and nozzle... your choice! It’s also BPA free, so it gives some peace of mind. 😃

The motivational quotes keep her chugging all day!

title: Bad quality control
review: The hooks are sharp and strong, but there are definitely quality issues with these. The eye on one of the hooks was badly formed and had no hole, making it unusable. At first I thought it was just paint, but I think the metal itself is different on that one (see picture). I also found that these get beat up pretty easily, but I guess that's to be expected for something you drag along the bottom. The other attached picture is after one use.

title: Stylish 4.5 stars
review: The Lark & Ro Fit & Flare Puffer Jacket is cute. The collar can lay flat or if you pull the drawstring and bring it closer to your face and neck. Although it is lightweight, it does keep you warm. However, note that I live in the South, so it does not get extremely cold. I like that the zipper and snaps are hidden. This jacket is well made and stylish. There are some traditional pockets with some interesting detailing (cinched area that reminds you of a belt). I like that this jacket falls just below my knees. I received this jacket/coat in an XL, so there is room if needed to wear a sweater underneath. I am pleased with the quality of this Lark & Ro puffer jacket and would recommend it.

title: Broke while tightening
review: I have weak hands and wrists I also know not to over tighten carbo but this band broke just by making the band fit tight enough it didn't move back and forth.  It makes this pretty garbage.  It also took forever to get to me.

title: All about sturdiness and mobility!
review:
What some may refer to as a “pug goal..” these are a solid set- great for target practice, smaller age, outdoor futsal, 3v3.. both sizes can be helpful for training on the go!

Uber mobile for travel bc so light and easy set up! Included carry handle bag is perf. *just be careful not to push spiked thru the case itself! Goals fold in half like butterfly wings and bag is roomy to let you slip field markers inside. Note: bag cant fit a soccer ball. **HACK: if your after an all inclusive set-up, this bag CAN accommodate a hand pump with deflated ball! Not the most ideal… But it works!!

Set up in under a minute.. simply push the front spikes firmly into the ground and these hold steady.. even with wind- it will blow right through. Net can take a hard shot without dislodging.. which matters most of all!

Most helpful tool for perfecting shot- bc of much smaller.. it trains for a more precise target. Great for personal private lessons or individual practice!! Hope this info. can help your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Huh?
review:
"Wear band securely to measure heart rate."
Doesn't get much tighter unless I force a bruise on myself. Already have marks from the band too tight.
According to the watch I sleep 24 minutes a day.
Glad this was on sale.

title: Good for a Spontaneous Workout
review:
Exercise is important, as I am sure most would agree. But often, it isn’t practical to pay a visit to a nearby gym- you need something that is easily accessible and that you can take with you, wherever you go, for a quick workout. A good option for your workout needs is Portable Pilates Bar Kit with Premium & Upgraded 30LB Thick Resistance Bands.

Pulled from the package, this workout equipment is ready to use. All you need to do is attach the ends of the workout bar. At this point, you can use the foot loops to hold it down, then start exercising. There are several different ways you can use this simple piece of equipment. It can be used to tone different muscle groups depending on how it is used.

You do get a fairly good amount of resistance from this workout bar, but there is no way to control the level of resistance. You have to take it the way it is, since there is no way to adjust it, that I can see. It seems to work fine for basic needs. Once you have used it for a while, I would guess that will no longer be sufficient- it will get too easy and you will likely need something with greater resistance. In other words, this cannot take the place of the sophisticated workout equipment in a well- stocked gym. But the best part about it is that, since it is so small and compact, you can use it whenever you need it.

The best way to utilize the Portable Pilates Bar is to find different ways to do the exercises. I recommend going online and looking for different exercises so that you can workout different muscle groups. It’s a nice, simple piece of exercise equipment and it is useful for those who are on the go and need something to encourage exercise anytime, anyplace.

title: The board is nice, but the darts are garbage.
review: This would be so much better with real darts instead of the round tip plastic darts.  The round tip darts broke with the first use.  I don't recommend this due to the darts.  The board works well.

title: Not as described and disappointed
review: These were not as described at all. My girls were very disappointed as was I. We had no choice but to keep them since we needed them that day. The bridge piece is a rigid plastic that I fear will break with very little use.

title: Decent Design, Love the Piezo, but almost too small
review:
I have had a number of camp stoves and I have settled on using these butane toppers for ease of use and portability. The built in pieze ignition is a fantastic idea that saves the fumbling with matches and makes lighting a two handed job rather than three. I'm not sure why they are not built into all of these.

What keeps this from being five stars is that it is just too small for a lot of uses. This allows for amazing packability, but the arms are very small and it will not comfortably support anything bigger than a cup or a well balanced small pot. I definitely would not try to actively cook on it, but I do have a camp kettle that seems to balance well, and as long as you are not trying to stir or flip etcetera, it will work. Note, there is a photograph in the listing showing what looks like a cup on the oven, the cup was photoshopped on and the stove itself is considerably smaller.

The build quality is not great.

Pros:
Super packable
Piezo Built in

Cons:
Very small, think heating a single mug for coffee or oat meal

title: These whistles never need new batteries.
review: Safety whistles are essential to search and rescue efforts to locate individuals that need aid or assistance from friends, neighbors or first responders.

title: Five Stars
review: Great cap, was what was discribed

title: perfect size
review: This is the perfect size to take to the beach, it will easily fit 2 towels and some reading material or clothes. I'm more concerened about the rain, so I haven't submerged it into water yet. It will defenitely repell water easily and once rolled up, no water seems to get in.

title: Amazing
review: These work amazing, exactly what I was looking for, highly recommend

title: beautiful
review: This is quite a beautiful knife.  My husband is a huge Kershaw fan, has literally dozens of them as well as given away as many as he's owned.  I bought this one for one of his Christmas gifts.  I considered the turquoise inlaid handle as my husband has native american heritage, but found this one to just stand out.  The mother of pearl is a bit more "stand out" than the pics show. It doesn't overtake the bloody basin jasper, but just bigger part of the display than the pic shows as in my opinion. I am very sure that my husband is going to love it.  MADE IN THE USA.  Quality blades that take and keep a nice sharp blade.  This one is a fancy dan compared to his other work blades.. but everyone needs a dressy one.  :)

title: Metal ball completely rusted!
review: So disappointed. I hate receiving something that is obviously unusable. The blue ones in this package were completely rusted. The rust had even rubbed off on the little bag they were in. They are unusable.

title: Very cute subtle snake print
review:
This item is as advertised, no complaints so far besides a strong smell which I hope will fade quickly.
The only thing of note with the snake pattern is that the pattern is way smaller than in the listing photos. It’s less obvious that it is snake at that scale, looks more abstract, almost like an indigo print. I’m pleased bc I picked it more for the color scheme than the snake aspect. It’s very cute!

title: well made and just like the picture
review: This is a well made shirt with nice stitching. The colour looks just like it does in the picture and the quality of the material is nice. The sizing seems right and overall it was a good purchase for a reasonable price.

title: Good deal
review: This hat was awesome for the price!

title: 3 to 7 year olds loved the idea
review: Right out of the box they had a pin size hole in the bowling ball... the pins were fun to play with, never used the entire set

title: No zipper
review: It's easy enough to put up. It didn't have a zipper or a way to get inside the net. You have to raise one side to get in which could let the bugs you're trying to keep out, in. Great for eating and other things that you wouldn't get out of the net for a while.

title: Completely lopsided & useless
review:
Unless you enjoy catching a 14# wall ball with your face than I HIGHLY suggest you don’t buy this product. Quiet literally the worst wall ball I’ve ever experienced. Wasn’t even able to get one workout in with it as it was completely lopsided by the time it arrived.
SAVE YOUR MONEY.

title: Exactly as expected
review: This is exactly what i expected. Same as what my physical therapist has.

title: Comfortable Mat
review: This yoga mat is super comfortable. It has a soft top, not quite like a towel. It feels like a woven mat. The bottom is rubbery and keeps the mat from slipping. It is on the thin side, making a very trim roll for carrying around. I feel like it is a bit more complicated to clean because you can’t just spray and wipe and be done. But I spray it and leave it unrolled for dry, which seems to work fine.

title: Easy to Use
review: My parents had a croquet set when I was growing up. We actually played it quite a bit. The first thing I noticed when I opened this was how light weight it was. It was so light weight that I questioned whether or not it was even made from wood. It is, but it's light weight wood! My parent's set was much heavier than this one. The paint job on the mallets is rather sloppy. The coat of paint doesn't cover the wood entirely and it goes over the edges in some spots. The mallets have to be screwed on to the sticks. No tools are required. If you want to store them back in the box, you have to take them apart. I would prefer a way to store them without having to do that. The balls are heavy enough and have a better paint job. The wickets seem sturdy. Directions are included. Overall, the quality is okay. It is a fun game, but but the highest quality.

title: So small
review: Check the size on this. It is so small. I am so disappointed. It is only post card size.  Not what I expected. I probably won’t do anything with it. Takes a really long time for shipping. Still waiting on the second one I ordered not that I’ll use that one either. Probably super small also. Two thumbs down.

title: Great
review: Work great

title: Five Stars
review: Got these as a present for someone we know that runs at night - she loves them.

title: Works like it's supposed to
review: Just as advertised. It's hard so it doesn't collapse on you if you were worrying about that. Glad I got this one that is half the price of the brand name ones.

title: Looks good on my wall
review: Like it goes with my collection

title: Excellent for Storing Lure Parts
review: I have purchased several of these boxes to store lure parts.  I have always been pleased with the quality of Plano products and generally do not purchase plastic tackle and storage boxes from competitors.

title: Quiet, easy to assemble, seems sturdy.  Rate = A
review:
After reading reviews I decided to splurge a bit and order this instead of a less costly item.
Very easy to assemble, sturdy, have no problems with it moving when in use, nice display, has control to adjust tension levels which work very well.
I bought this for at home use during lockdown, it is very quiet in use, low profile piece of equipment takes up very little space.
Several family members are using it, each at their own comfort level.
I rate this A. Would buy again.

title: Great style
review: The color is great and style is great. It’s not the most comfortable to wear but it’s very cheap

title: Football
review: Bought for my high-schooler son he and his friends love it

title: Couldn’t get it past the feet!
review: We couldn’t even get this suit on. Way too tight near the feet. Returning.

title: Nice but broken
review: Nice board but received broken so it's unusable.

title: Leaks all over
review: We bought 2 Gobie water bottles and they both leaked.  The filter seemed to work well and I liked the overall design, with the wide mouth and soft pump sides, however the amount of water that poured all over us while we drank wasn't acceptable for any price-point, let alone $49.

title: Not waterproof
review: Not waterproof or flattering but very comfy

title: Coolest Skateboard, Fun to Ride
review:
[[VIDEOID:89893e5ed45fed02fc019abe6f8df3c4]] Wow, this is a joy to ride! Very smooth, extra large wheels for a safer ride, and it has brakes!!! The hand remote feels very natural and I love the shape because it doesn’t fall out of your hands. The rechargeable battery does last a long time!!! The description says 3 hours or 10 miles and I found that to be very accurate. It also conquer a 20% grade hill very well. I weigh 190 and was very surprised at how well it rides. Definitely the coolest board I ever owned! The construction is top notch and the battery design gives plenty of ground clearance. Highly recommend!

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Small
review: Cute. Watch the oz. size. Unexpectedly small.

title: Garbage... don't buy it.
review: Missing hardware and pieces didn't fit together like they should. This thing was garbage and a waste of money.

title: A great table piece
review: The blue base is strong and well made but the basket well they could not have made it any cheaper. And 8 cups no way they must be talking about 8 very small tea cups.

title: Tread
review: Super hard to walk on.

title: Two Stars
review: super clunky, uncomfortable. returned it.

title: Really nice fishing rod
review: This is a great lightweight rod, perfect for a beginner or intermediate fisherman. Easy to maneuver, great accuracy in launching your line, I really liked this. I am 5'7" and the size and length of the rod is also perfect for me. Sanlike was a new brand to me and I am really impressed with the quality of the rod. Just be sure you understand this is only a rod and case, you will need to purchase the reel separately.

title: Comfortable exercise weights
review: Much more comfortable than my last ankle weights and adjustable to your size of leg.

title: Four Stars
review: nice size. not super sturdy and the shelving sticks a bit but all and all reliable product

title: Wrist strap ripped first time using them,
review: Wrist strap ripped first time using them, a shame the first time I used them was 10 days after return date

title: Wont work with my ceilings
review: I haven't been able to use the pole because I cant install it properly where I live .  The poll slips and falls over at the slightest movement . I tried to install it in a different room that has  a regular ceiling. I was unsuccessfull because the pole won't extend far enough in that room ( more than a foot short).  The pole has been sitting in my closet , unused.  Too expensive for something I haven't actually been able to use.

title: Great Fit
review: Product was just as described. Good fit and quality

title: Round headrest did not support
review: Did not like the round roller like headrest.  Ordered another with a flat headrest.  I had one for years and it really helped in stabilizing my head and neck.  This just didn't work for me.

title: Very loose came off while riding
review: Very lose fitting came off while riding and the tread after 3 days was starting to fall off not a good replacement 😕

title: Very tight
review: I have fairly small hands, a 6" wrist, and wear a size 5 ring and these are very contriscting around the fingers.  I expected fitted but these are borderline uncomfortable.  I'm going to continue to wear and break them in for a few more weeks and decide whether or not I should replace them with something else.

title: Great little helmet bike!
review: Wish it would remember the last setting but otherwise a fantastic product. Lot of modes. Both the white and red lamps are quite bright. The battery stays for the 2-3 hour rides I usually do. Charging is very fast as well. I don't charge it with a bigger charger, not sure if it will burn out the system. The regular wattage\amp charger works fine. Mounting on my bike helmet was easy and it's quite tight. I feel safeer after using this product.

title: Kirkman Little Giant
review: Nice lantern, works well but even though it was well wrapped it was dinged up when it arrived.

title: Decent quality sun shelter for large group
review: This is ginormous, but not immensely heavy. It takes two to set up correctly, so don't expect to swing it on your own without some difficulty.  I wanted this to act as a shaded area when we're camping or at the cabin in West Texas. It's big enough to provide a safe, shaded spot for our dogs in the afternoon. The big flaps on the sides can be opened or lowered as desired to allow for easy access, air flow or privacy. I can fit our Kia Soul under it as well, but a big truck may be tight. If it survives two summer and fall seasons out West, I'll be quite happy.

title: Get extra spin and control!!!
review: [[VIDEOID:a4f8fa69a93905eaaa575a5bcec57d9b]] Great quality paddle!!!  It really helps to improve your game by adding extra control and spin.  This item is for intermediate players who play for fun.

title: Not an exact replacement but it worked
review: This pump was advertised as a direct replacement for my old pump. It’s not really. The water inlet and output fittings are both higher than the old pump. With the little bit of space that I had to work with, and the inflexible Pex plumbing that was used, installation was more challenging than it needed to be.

title: Super comfortable
review: Perfect for water

title: Perfect!
review:
So big and useful! If you dont need it that big, fold it in half. I've used it as a pad to lay picnic blankets on and a rain fly for my hammock while backpacking. Its on the big side for backpacking, but if you aren't extreme its great. It was nice to have a large covered area.
Seems durable - the straps are sturdy and the metal stakes are good quality.

title: Immediately rusted
review: I've had these for 2 weeks, and they're already rusting. Not great for a tool designed for fishing. Opening and closing doesn't feel particularly smooth, almost like something is catching a little bit. They still work, but would not recommend.

title: I can give my back a nice massage with this but I wish the roller was about 6 inches longer
review: There is a minute and a half video online at the GaiamRestore site that explains how to select a roller; however, I did not yet see any "How To Videos" for this roller as the packaging claims.  Nevertheless, from the picture on the packaging, I just grasp it behind my back with both hands and roll. I can do the same rolling pin style on my thighs. Overall, this roller does what it is supposed to but it fails on one point. I feel that it is about 6 inches too short. I would have given this five stars if the roller were longer so that I do not feel like a contortionist using it.

title: Some good some bad
review: My dog uses racquet balls for fetch and is what they call a super chewer.  I ordered these because I wanted to avoid going to wal-mart.  Some have held up others he has chewed in half.  For some reason, they split at the seam while he was chewing them and they were brand new.  Racquet balls are usually the only thing that he cannot chew to bits, not this time.

title: Easy to carry and cleaning
review: I liked this collapsible bottle. It is easy to carry for outdoor activities.

title: Install on the outside of posts
review: Instructions were inadequate. Works ok after figuring out how to use

title: Yes!
review: On the older bladders have a leaky mouth piece on them. Irritating. This mouth piece shuts off and doesn’t leak. Looking forward to some nice long walks this summer without wearing my beverage. This product is really easy to install and works like a champ. Worth every penny of it.

title: Not so Good
review: The quality of product is great but it is a pain with the seat belt. I finally got tired of trying to straighten it out everytime I locked my seat belt that I took them off and now they sit on the car window during season. I did not contact the vendor because it is not their fault. The design just doesn't work for my 2000 or 2014 vehicles.

title: Two Stars
review: Cheap!

title: Hurt and can't adjust tension
review: I tried once thinking it would be a great watching TV fighter which I've used various brands for years but this thing is large, painful, and I could not find any way to adjust the tension and unless you have legs of steel and are a workout fanatic versus trying to firm up it's not something you should invest in. Start with something that you can adjust the tension in and even then it's still hurt because there was no flexibility and it's a very hard plastic

title: Good item.
review: I bought the sawyer as a gift for my boys abroad in Europe to add to there emergency bags.

title: Not good for non-chubby babies
review: My 18 month old has trouble using it. It doesn't really provide support

title: Nice poncho
review: These ponchos were very small and portable. It is really nice when you want something you can tuck into your purse for a last minute rain shower. They are good for fairs and festivals, too. They were thin but they worked fine. It is better than getting wet!

title: Fine for light liquids
review: I like it because it does not have metal parts which effects the product I am mixing. I don't think it would be great for a heavy substance but for my purposes it was fine.

title: Absolutely necessary on the farm...
review: These rain ponchos are great - we never know when something outside needs attention, rain or shine - and when our rainy season begins, which can be two weeks of solid rain, we’ll be using these every day!  They’re ample size and the drawstring hood is perfect for protecting our hair.  We got caught  all the time last year - with these ponchos, that won’t happen this year!

title: My Grad loved it
review: It comes with a message, but is also a very nice working compass. My grad loves it and carries it with him everywhere. It's always good to know where you're going and where you came from.

title: Neat idea! 🎣
review:
My husband is always dragging around a lot of poles and tackle when we go fishing so I thought I'd surprise him with this carrier.
The color is suitable and the material seems pretty strong, plus it's easy to organize and carry everything, can't wait to try it out this summer!

title: Just received
review: Fits right and looks nice. Time will tell if it holds up.

title: Not well made
review: String came off in just one week! Not durable st all

title: Love
review: My kids love their scooters

title: Not the traditional birthday gift, but he loved it.
review: The latest craze for teenagers is apparently Airsoft. I was use to my teenage boys wanting to go paintballing and play laser-tag, but wasn't sure how I felt about them playing airsoft. The guns look real and for some reason it seems a little more dangerous. However, after being assured that there were some safety classes and tons of safety precautions, I allowed my son to play the sport. Anyway, my son's friend was having an airsoft birthday party and this was one of the items he wanted. While not the traditional gift, he loved it and he was extremely happy with my purchase.

title: Lightweight Wide based and pretty too
review:
Very pretty robins egg blue metallic color. LOL. It is lightweight, with an extra wide base that doesn't wobble. It would take more than a nudge to tip it over. The loop at the top is attached securely so I won't worry so much when it is hung up. Nice tall area for the flame. This should produce some heat as well as light in those emergent situations.

Update: Having recently experienced a power outage when temps were near freezing I can say that using 2 put out enough heat to keep my bedroom tolerable for several hours. I use the kerosene that is labeled as odorless but there is a slight odor. It makes a bright flame but it is the heat that I needed most. I now use it in the evening to get the chill out of the air when I am getting into bed and near my shower so its toasty when I get out. I didn't plan on using it this way but it is a better option than my electric heater which costs a small fortune to operate. This is a real bargain. The quality is excellent and it couldn't be easier to use and to clean. I highly recommend it for more than just emergency light. It is a cheap alternative to using electric heaters in targeted areas of the home.

title: Review for those without tech savvy skills.. like me!!
review:
Bought for a specific purpose, I admit- im still not very well versed with all its features- but, learning as we go! Unfortunately, I have a daughter who fell victim to Covid-19 through contact tracing. Now, 10mo. post isolation.. she struggles greatly with physical side effects. At 23yr old, varsity collegiate athlete at the top of her game.. she has been plagued with chest pain, SOB, racing heart, dizzy spells, mostly when engaging in higher physical activity. Dr/trainer requested she begin tracking and recording everything: rigor of workouts, vitals, onset and severity of symptom..uh, how??!! We found the only way to do this with accuracy was to use a smart watch. Any others in this predicament may gain that detailed data to help them as well.. After all, knowledge is power and dr. need all info to help diagnose and create a plan for moving forward.

This band fits really well and comfortable- after trying a “female” smart watch (thinner band) we found that connection was not solid- I’m guessing due to size? Having this larger face and band eliminated our contact issues- and the fact it’s lightweight and surprisingly not constricting is a total bonus!! This watch does a solid job staying connected while wearing 24/7 (sleep, activity, water, scrimmages or otherwise!) Not to mention- it’s pretty cool in its futuristic transformer vibe! Yes!!! It does feel a bit masculine but, it works universally + functions for either sex! tbh, its sort of a tough, kick butt look! (we call this my kiddos “Ironman heart..” ha! smile where you can, right?!!)

Surprised to see how much data this truly can absorb and process via ones smart phone. As mentioned.. we’re still navigating all of it’s super powers. But, the basics are there: heart rate-pulse, pedometer, activity, GPS tracking.. and sleep (yes!! believe it or not- sleep matters so tracking can show signs of underlying issues- its good info to know!) I recommend reading instructions- but, keep them handy!! In play for x3wks. and we still reference everyday. **Hack: take photo of the manual with your phone- that way info is with you any time/place.. The photo has proven so handy!!

A few quirks to mention are: the actual face display can be sensitive and changed to a different feature without intent! If there is a way to keep this from happening- we haven’t found it? Which leads me to the other issue.. I understand technology advances and definitely above my pay grade- I freely admit. But, I like things I own to be fully understood after reading the manual. This gets an 85% in that department. I absorb some of the blame but I also realize there are more of “me’s” out there.. and this technology is NOT in our wheelhouse! So, a more direct approach on every feature and how to use could have been better. For those tech savvy- I don’t foresee any issue.. the above are my reasons for deducting x1 star. Otherwise, you've got a solid device to help in so many ways- who knew!! I hope this info can help those on my level.. be safe!

title: Great for bikes as well as general purpose flashlight
review:
I received this light as a review sample, which some folks will automatically discount since I was given it for free. If you are one, skip this and read the larger number of reviews from folks who actually shelled out money for this light and you will find that it's still a five star product.

For me this light is not only great for bikes, but is a general purpose flashlight that I keep handy. It removes from the holder and will fit in a pocket or purse (or toolbox.) The main value is it not no only does an excellent job of illuminating near or far objects, but can be adjusted to focus on detailed work or even path finding with a twist of the lens. Plus it comes with a tail light too. That can actually be worn on the back of an adjustable ball cap.

This only complaint I have - and it's minor - is the fine threading on the thumbscrew that allows you to attach this to handlebars. It takes quite a few turns to unscrew it completely. I will say, though, that once it's tightened it stays that way, and you need not remove the mount because the flashlight slides easily out of it with a few twists to loosen the mount screw for the flashlight encasing.

Bottom line: this is an excellent safety solution for biking at night, as well as a handy household (or vehicle) light for general purpose uses.

title: Great!!
review: I really like these. They are perfect for travel. You get just exactly the right amount of soap to wash your hands with one sheet. One caveat, be very very sure that your hands are dry before you try to get a leaf of soap out. Because they melt instantly in the presence of any moisture.

title: Nice seal, but painful
review: Nice seal, but painful at my “third eye “. I’ve had to add padding just to be able to use...

title: A bit expensive but totally delicious.
review: The raspberries are so good. The price was shocking. I may get a few more for my adult son.

title: Sorta worked for a few weeks, then no more.
review:
Terrible quality, shoddy plastics, not durable.
This lid did its job just okay for a few weeks. I always had to push the nozzle hard as far as I could for the water to flow otherwise, just casually pushing it back I’d be drinking air. Slowly even that stopped working and now I barely get any water sucking on the straw, plus it makes this annoying gurggling sound. Just a total waste of money. It’s poorly designed and manufactured.

title: Use when wash comforter or pillows
review: Bought for washer load "weight"- but stinky rubber - Still prefer since they're heavier than laundry balls

title: To small
review: Two small fits to tight wife ordered using their method and it came to small. I tried to get her to send back she says they didn't have any bigger ones. Will not let her buy another one now.

title: Built for fun - and to last!
review: This ball, during the recent holidays was a beach ball, soccer ball, volleyball - a ball to practice with - and anything else the grandchildren needed.  It weathered it all!  We were sure glad to have it around because it inspired so much healthy activity.  Well made Wilson quality.  Takes a beating!  Good choice when the grandchildren are coming to visit!

title: Five Stars
review: Just as expected!

title: Five Stars
review: My Grandson actually wears them!

title: Great for floor exercises
review: I do a lot of floor exercises for physical therapy, and none of the mats I have at home do a good job of making hardwood floor more comfortable, but this mat does a great job. I really like how well padded this is and that it is a foldable mat not a roll up mat, which is my preference.

title: not enough padding on bottom
review: We ended up having to put down a sleeping bag and blanket on it because it was almost as bad as sleeping on the plain floor. I was the first  to try it and thought it was just my older body and it won't be as bad for for my sons friend who was sleeping over but it was bad, he needed lots of padding on it as well. I like that it has the sides that keeps you on it and the pillow is nice if you don't have one, it just needs too be able to get more padding on the bottom.

title: Awful.
review: I was hoping to use these on an upcoming trip but when I finally opened the package, I realized how difficult it is to change the settings on the light.  It would be impossible to do when the lamp is on your forehead.  You have to turn it on and put it in the setting you want before you turn it on, and you have to leave it that way.  I was hoping for something that could be easily adjusted.  But even when doing it by holding it, it was still seriously difficult.  I could barely turn it from "Off" to any other settling.  I would return these and try another.

title: The bottle is fine; the bottlebrush too short to use
review:
I bought this bottle in rose gold, and it looks and feels high-quality.

One point: the bottle comes with a bottlebrush, but the bottlebrush (after you put the two parts together) is significantly shorter than the bottle itself! It will be useful for cleaning only the top half of the bottle interior. It will be useful for cleaning only the top half of the bottle interior. In other words, the brush is useless for this particular bottle.

If the bottlebrush part of this two-part deal is important to you, then you really should purchase a different bottle and brush set.

title: Dangerous
review: The product has metal burrs on it.. freakin cut my palm wide open on it.

review:
No stars earned!
They don't stay together!

title: Better choice
review:
This is the 2nd helmet that we bought and my husband loved it. The first one that we got was a little tight on his head despite getting the right size. When I saw this one I figured this would be a better choice since the front part is higher than the other helmet which means it doesn’t need to cover my husband’s forehead (I suspect that’s the reason the other helmet is a little tight). We got a M/L size and my husband’s head size is 24 inches.
My husband also liked the extra paddings and that they are removable.

title: Two Stars

title: Smaller than I would have expected
review:
First off, the quality of this knife is great, very sharp, very strong. I am using it everyday, and I am really liking it. There are 2 reasons I gave it 4 stars, and those are just personal preferences.
- it is smaller than I thought it would be. It feels just a little too small in my hand. I don't use BIG knives, but I'd like it to fill my grip when I use it.
- the pocket clip feels "upside down" to me. My other pocket knives have had it inverse to this one. When I pull it out of my pocket, it is not the correct way to open it, I have to turn it around in my hand. Annoying, but not a deal breaker

review: Silicone rings in pic show flowers and overall the band looks pretty nice.  When they arrive they look cheap, you cannot see any flowers, please do not waste money on this particular set.

title: The case was impossible to open. Didn't want loose utensils so I returned it.
review: The utensils are OK, but I gave it a low rating because the case you are supposed to be able to put them was broken. I couldn't unzip it. When I pulled as hard as I could, the zipper pull broke off and the case was still hermetically sealed! I returned it. I should have known better than to buy eating utensils from a place that spelled it, "Utilitensil".

review: Nicely made though a tight fit around my neck.  Seems to run slightly on the smaller side.  My neck is much warmer now.

title: Recommend this
review: This helps get my pulse up. It’s a great workout and not too difficult. You can change the levels. It’s great to do while watching tv or before bed to help you relax and snooze off. Great price too.

review: I bought these to go with a big wheel I bought for Christmas. I ended up cutting four blocks of wood and using duct tape to secure. Not very durable.

title: Son didn't like sitting on it. Trying something else.
review: Not for my son. I tried this as a sensory/ wiggle seat for my son and he didn't like the texture to it. I found a plain black inflatable cushion instead and am trying that. He likes it and works ok, just falls off the seat a lot and the bottom peeled, but not the top.

title: No way to holster the gun inside the bag
review:
I was hoping to replace my 15 year old gun pack purchased directly from Glock. This thing is not the replacement. Its a mediocre copy at best, nearly non functional at worst. The zippers stick and can be difficult to open - from day one my other pack had smooth, reliable zippers. There is plenty of rom for multiple magazines.

However, my pack has no velcro or holster attachment inside for my pistol. That's a recipe for disaster. I wear a gun fanny pack when I'm on horseback. I need my weapon secured and riding safely, not banging around loose in a pouch on my hip or waist. Additionally, the sticky zippers mean that I cannot reliably and safely draw my pistol in a crisis. Keep looking.

review: Cheap material. When the object arrived there was a scratch in the wallet.

title: Love the Style, A Bit Small
review:
This fits well for me, but it's a bit on the small side. I like the style because it reminds me of the hat Radar would wear on MASH. I also love the Olive color. The strap is hook and loop, which is better for me, so there is some room for adjustment, but most Western adults, especially men, tend to have very big heads and may not find this a good fit. This would be a better fit for smaller framed men, teens and women.

Thanks for reading my review. I hope you found it helpful and will click the Helpful button below.

title: LOVE these.
review: LOVE these... Throw these on and workout, Sweat your Guts out (that's the point right) and the High Waist is GREAT, Eliminates the fact of wearing a waist trimmer (that I previously had and actually have thrown it away) But I LOVE these!

title: USSSA Slow Pitch
review: Great ball. Our favorite one to use. Classic M stamped and ready to take flight in your USSSA league or tournament play! Will definitely buy again!

title: Not a blanket
review: This isn’t a blanket - it does spread out and is good size and folds down small which is nice but it’s more like waterproofed sheet than a blanket or towel. While it is good size, it wasn’t what I was expecting. It’s not that comfortable to sit on and the description is misleading. I’m disappointed. If this is what you are looking for, the other features are good (size, shape, foldability) but it’s NOT a beach towel or blanket.

title: Let the relaxing begin.
review: The Envlon yoga pants are nice. The fabric is soft, comfortable and breathable. They are a mossy, green color with white stripes down the legs. They have pockets and a drawstring waist. I’d recommend them.

title: this beastly thing sucks
review: I put cold water in it only to have the outside get ice cold and sweat.  It didn't keep water cold at all.  What a joke.  I had to order another insulated and am waiting impatiently for it... was promised same day, now Friday, wait, Sat because someone changed instructions and it wasn't me.

title: Connectons in bad spots

title: Love It
review: I really, really like this product. It came in very handy when on a camping trip in Arkansas. It served as shade on a sunny day and a privacy tent when needed.

title: PERFECT GLASSES... almost
review:
I LOVE these glasses!!!! They are my favorite tortoise shell, and enough wrap to keep sun and wind out.
Adding on to this review.... the reading part is too small to use. You must lift the glasses up to see out of it

title: Bench pad isn't the best quality
review: This bench is a bit lower to the ground than other benches Ive seen but has thick sturdy legs. Simple enough to put together although having the appropriate socket wrench  (11/16ths and a deeper one would be best) for the nuts will make it a lot easier, the tools this comes with aren't the best. The pad is also much lighter than anticipated. It's covered in pleather material that looks and feels inexpensive. The one I received also has some puckering to it, so mine may be a little defective. Pretty easy to move around and works for our needs so I'm pretty happy with it though.

title: Constant front wheel alignment issues!
review: Smooth ride but constant front wheel going out of alignment issue!! Sent back and will not buy this brand again.

title: .50 Cal ramrod - customizable to your needs
review: Rod arrived in Alaska well packaged and as advertised. Using as range rod with spinning jag tip. Easy to cut with proper Dremmel cutting wheel and best feature is ability to custom size with your choice of handle. Rod is a little springy compared to a yellow fiberglass rod I used to own. Price is reasonable and no regrets

title: Love this unit!
review: I have bought 4 of these so far and probably will buy more.  Highly recommended for any use.

title: Definitely not 5/6 person and it leaks
review:
I would like to give this tent a good review but in reality I feel it's lacking in some areas. Areas which could easily be addressed. First and foremost, there is no way you are getting 5/6 people in this tent unless you're laying on top of each other. I'd rate this tent at 3-4 max. It was fine for my 8 year old, myself, and my dog but I could not imagine trying to squeeze more than 1 more person in there.

The tent leaks. This past trip I took it rained for an hour. The rain started out heavy and within the first 10 minutes I could already see water pooling below the doorway zipper. The corners of the tent also took in some water but nearly as bad as the doorway. Thankfully it only rained heavy for about 30 minutes. I laid a couple dirty shirts on the floor near the zipper to collect the water but I have strong doubts this tent would hold up to heavy rain for extended periods of time.

Another issue I have, which isn't a huge one since this is the case with a lot of cheaper tents, are the ties for where you tie the rain fly to the poles and at the top. It's just a pain to get to and tie the knots.

I would probably steer clear of this tent if you're expecting inclement weather.

title: Disappointing
review: What a great concept!  I even tried it in the house to make sure I can fold it.  After reviewing the video---no problem.  Lightweight, perfect size, easy to carry.  Used it the first time yesterday on the beach---terrible!  It is always breezy on the beach----but yesterday wasn't horrendously breezy.  This kept collapsing. We had to prop up against the beach chairs & hold it or it would collapse.  It doesn't have enough support at the top.  I so wanted this to work.  Had to return and will have to use the dreaded umbrella----I hate carrying that!  This pop up tent would be good for the park or backyard, not at the beach----too much breeze

title: Returned so unsure why asking for review. It's ok but not for me.
review: It seemed just fine but I returned because it wasn't for me and I don't know why return purchases keep showing up in the review section but it'll probably work for others and it seems like a decent thick quality.

title: Big and fun
review: My kids were very excited about this. It is so big. It's great, though, because it can deflate to be very small. I think it's great for parties or just for your kids playing. I took off a star because tipping could be a little issue. Overall, though, they just loved it and had fun. It's a pretty good deal.

title: It seemed like the crossbeam poles were too short
review: Nope.  Fell down the first day. It seemed like the crossbeam poles were too short.  A shame, it was a nice size. But not even close to being waterproof either.  It’s going back.

title: Five Stars
review: The wraps are great thanks for the great product my nephew loves them

title: Update - dead battery in 3 weeks!.
review:
Update Jan 23 2016. Downgrade two stars. I'm quite annoyed this morning because in less than 30 days, the so called 6 month life battery is completely dead. That means the unit is not functional at all and if I want to continue to use it, I have to trek to a store and buy a new battery. Really? Three weeks and it's already dead.

*******original review follows*****
MOOV is the first fitness tracker that I have used and it's impressive by any standard. My primary concern about wearing one of these type devices was exposure to water and falling off when I am working with the horses. Ten days of nonstop wear (including in the shower every day) and the unit is still on my wrist and has shown no problems at all.

I've done a few of the program work outs using the app on my phone and I really like the voice coaching in real time reaction to my speed, cadence, and distance. The connection between the tracker and my phone is instant. You get a visual breakdown on the app of your movement, moments of sloth and calories burned. Plus it keeps track of your progress as you improve each time you repeat a workout.

All that is nice, but I have benefited the most from the MOOV's ability to track my sleep patterns and determine when and how long I'm actually sound asleep vs just a light sleep. What I've learned is that I need to go to bed earlier! I hardly notice that this thing is on my wrist now, mostly just when I choose to manually sync the tracker to the app. I am really looking forward to using the swimming options with it once it warms up and our pool isn't ice cold anymore.

title: Poor quality
review: Very poor quality

title: Hmm what do I say
review: Ok first of all, we owned one of the previous models, 14 years old and finally gave up and the spare parts cost more than a new version. We decided to go with this model, exactly the same only with the self ignition feature. Let me tell you, the grill isn't the same sturdy quality, I can't see this last beyond 5 years if you go camping several times per summer. The hinge already feels a bit loose, some of the inner coating chipped off and a small bit of plastic of the catch tray broke off. We did keep the old one for spare parts, so glad we did. Generally, I love the Coleman stoves, but this one isn't up to the usual quality.

title: Great pair!
review: Not sure why roller blading all of a sudden became super trendy, but we were stoked to finally get our hands on a pair of these. My husband loves them!

title: It sucks.
review: I don't like sucking.

title: Love
review: I got the leupold back country scope rings in 1” high it fit perfectly on my Mark V Camilla

title: There is a weight limit.
review: I bought this climber for a friend as a Christmas present. The description for the product (at that time at least( did not mention a weight limit. By the time he opened it and read the directions several months had passed. He found that he is over the weight limit (220 pounds) and is, therefore, hesitant to use the climber. I tried to return it. It was unused and in the original packaging, but the company said too much time had passed. Now I have a very heavy box sitting in the middle of my spare room and no idea what to do with it!

title: Changed my life!
review: I have left hand damage from cancer tumors causing nerve damage in my brachial plexus.  This device allows me to make a fist so I can start re-building muscle by holding on to light weights and certain machines at the gym.  It helps with tasks around the home that I could no longer do because of decreased muscle and the inability to completely bend my hand and fingers.

review: The case with the carabiner rise better than the monitor.
