review: Its is designed quite well and provides the information you want.  I just found it a little too technical for my particular game.  For my level I just need to watch what the allis doing!  For better players I'm sure this will be very helpful.

title: Five Stars
review: love it

title: Five Stars
review: Great coat, warm

title: Slippery, could cause serious injury if used in yoga practice
review:
The design is adorable, but that's pretty much the only reason this thing got even two stars. It's absolutely useless as a yoga towel. I wish I had read the reviews more closely prior to buying but I got excited when I saw it was on lightning sale.

The material is really soft, which makes it EXTREMELY slippery. It's also not quite large enough to fit my standard size Gaiam mat. I tried using the corner pockets to secure it to my mat, but it was sightly too small which made my mat bunch up under the towel. I decided to try to make it work anyway... Maybe 5 minutes into class the slippery material caused my hands to slip out from under me doing downward dog and I almost seriously injured myself. I tossed it aside and will not use it for yoga again.

However, because it's a cute design and I can't/shouldn't return it after using it, I guess I'll keep it to use as a beach towel or for stretching.

title: Not for me, no no no
review: I buy so many coleman products but this one......is a flat out no for me personally.  I could not get comfortable at all. It does not unzip in any way that allows you to move around. The photos are great but in reality, I literally gave it to another camper out of disgust after two nights of no sleep. Would be great for a child or small person who wants to literally be restrained all night,......

title: Comfortable
review: Works great

title: Pleasantly surprised
review:
This product was better than advertised and I thought I had left my review sooner. It was incredibly easy to install. The windshield material does feel thick enough to last several years. It is ideal to make sure that the temperature is a little warmer when install just for the sake of pliability, but I installed in October (in Michigan) at night with no issue.

There is a small gap at the top of my windshield which should help reduce some wear and tear due to any wind resistance as it pushes against the windshield. I installed this on a 1986 Club Car DS. It does also have an original headlight bar. I mention that because without that headlight bar, this windshield would likely be a little on the short side.

title: Okay Rower
review: I bought this rower for lower impact exercise and because I have enjoyed using rowers in the past. This particular rower was exceptionally loud and wasn't the best rower I have ever used by any stretch. That being said, it did what it was intended to do, so I rate it as okay. If you are looking for a cheap rower (because I know how expensive they can be) and don't mind the noise, then this might be a good fit for you.

title: Buy the Polarbear brand instead
review: Do yourself a favor and buy the Polarbear brand instead, it keeps cooler longer.

title: Very easy clean water solution
review: We got these for a week in the sierras camping. We brought drinking water, but wanted these so we could drink out of the streams and "boil water 5 min" taps. They worked really well to help us stretch the water supplies.

title: Would not recommend
review: It was difficult to do many of the moves that I am used to doing with a barbell with this weight. Also, the tube is opaque, so you can't see the water level. You're just guesstimating the weight of the water you've added by holding the tube, which is useless. To top it off, I received a defective product that wouldn't drain the water once added. I returned for a refund, but even if my product didn't have that defect, I would still have been dissatisfied with the item and wanted to return. I don't recommend.

title: Fit great
review: Nice grip and fit

title: Good product
review: Good product

title: Lightweight to carry - easy to clean
review: Great beach blanket - 9X9 - easy to lay down and easy to pick up, shake off sand and fold up.  You can lay towels on top of it  if you want more comfort.  It comes in a great little blue bag, and folds up really small considering its size.  the fabric is silky, and sand rolls right off.  With so much to carry down to the beach, you’ll appreciate this small, light little bag of convenience!

title: Surprisingly Good
review: Good size surprising, caught some nice bass on it.  Little expensive. Excellent for not catching lilly pads.

title: Missing tire levers
review: Did not come with the 4 tire levers as advertised

title: Pretty Good Kit
review: I go camping and I like to have a kit in my vehicle in case I get stuck for a few days longer than I expected because of car trouble, getting lost, or zombie apocalypse.  This kit has a lot of tools that will help you out if you need to survive.  But it's not a full kit, there is no food, no tent and no long range weapons to kill the zombies with.  Overall, it's a great kit for the money, and you can add it to a larger kit so that you'll be prepared.

title: Work great, look awful. LOGO is big, bright, and horrible.
review:
First of all, after installation they work fine. There is no rattle or excessive wobble.

Also I should mention that I bought these in a hurry because I wasn't ready for my first commute in wet weather. I would ordinarily put a lot more time and effort into research.

I put these on a bike I got for $40 on Craigslist and I STILL feel like these cheapen the look and feel of the bike. The big Planet Bike logo is a universe away from acceptable. It's bad enough that it advertises a brand with which I have no connection, but the logo itself feels cheap; it's on par with logos for local car dealerships, DBA web storefronts, and your mom's friend's hair salon. The logo is ugly, superfluous, intrusive - unacceptable. One star off for that but I really feel like I want to take two. There are only so many stars...

The front fender is designed much better than the rear. The stays on the front terminate in good brackets for attaching to the fork. In the rear the design is much more slapdash. It's just bent wire, 1940's style. That's another star.

The installation requires tools that many cyclists might lack. E.g. a Dremel to cut down the excess from the stays - or anything to cut and smooth the wire. The clip at the front of the rear fender requires some home mechanic engineering to attach it to the frame soundly with a bushing. I used a bit of inner tube rubber a zip tie, and extreme bending.

There is nothing holding on the caps on the ends of the wire/rods so I assume at least one will be missing soon. This will take the fenders from cheap-looking territory straight to eyesore. BTW the finish on the plastic looks and feels very cheap. Three stars down.

I put these on a 90's Hard Rock with street tires (Specialized Nimbus) and they work fine. OTOH since I put these on I like the bike less. It's ugly and looks and feels even slower than it was.

IMO these fenders are cheap, ugly, AND overpriced. They do the job, though, so if you are a good wrench and you are insensitive to aesthetics, these may still be good for you.

title: You get what you pay for... Sometimes less.
review:
Not necessarily a fair comparison, but Olight it is not. Both beams are projected at 12 feet. You can see how much brighter the Olight is to the right - more importantly, how it saturates from corner to corner and has twice the diameter - almost like looking at the earth and the moon.

And I can get an Olight for double the price, it's much smaller (yes, it does get hotter) but when the moment of truth comes, do you want to be caught off with substandard equipment? Not that the Fyuchi is wholly terrible, it is not - it's actually workable, but at the same time, spend a little more, get yourself a proper baddies finder.

For now, returning mine.

title: How to use if no instructions as advertised
review: No instructions on how to use it.

title: Decent
review: Does what it says, covers the treadmill, just don't care for the extra material that bunches on the bottom.

title: Do not buy. Not eligible for return
review: The water bottle silicone coat smells strongly like perfume. I have perfume allergies and cannot wash the smell off. Unfortunately,  this item isn't eligible for return... so I am stuck with an expensive water bottle I cannot use.

title: Not a good buy! Poorly made
review: This item tore as soon as I put it on

title: Why did it reek of petroleum!?
review:
The product reeked of gasoline. It burned and irritated my skin even after washing them.

THEY DO NOT STOP SHARP THINGS FROM CUTTING YOU

This is a KNIT!!! The type of weave does stop, say a pocket knife blade being drug across the surface, but puppy teeth, sharp thorns, anything that can beak the surface barrier, you feel as if you had nothing on.

I returned this purchase.

Strongly recommend finding something else other than this.

title: Not very absorbent
review: While this works fine as a hairband and holds my hair back nicely, it doesn’t particularly absorb sweat. It’s not super wide which works fine for me, I just wish it had some wicking properties. I was hoping to use it when I work out but I’ll have to keep looking. It does stay in place and doesn’t slide so you may have more luck than I did. I will use it, just not for what I intended.

title: Not worth the money
review: These all but disintegrated within 2 weeks. They were worn casually, not as work gloves or even under work gloves. Also, the texture on the glove to improve grip (I guess?) Is not as pictured. The picture looks like a honey comb design and the pair we got they were only lines that started to peel off in days. Do not recommend.

title: Man what a find. Read full review for details
review:
I work as a Service Tech and Head of Maintenance for a few restaurants. So I have ALOT of keys and I do mean ALOT. Honestly the jailers keep ring would be great for me but I just don't see me using that for my needs.
I have a company ride and one day I panices when I realized I didn't have my car keys. My old key ring I was using had a really bad habit of releasing keys off of it when I would snap onto my belt or pants pocket. So of course I worried my new rides keys were gone. Thank God I just left at home but that moment I swore I was spending what ever I needed to so I could make sure I wouldn't loose not 1 key.
After a hour or so looking searching I finally happened upon this contraception.
Looked cool seems very useful and I honestly could see why I should trust it not to just release my keys.
I was right 💯 right on the head with these.
The double slide makes sure there can be no accidental key drops. You have to manually remove them for the keys to come off. This was perfect for my uses and needs. I can remove the set I need per store and keep the rest safe. The clip on very easily but I can't say that for removing them. Which is exactly what I wanted. They are made of a good sturdy metal, no plastic. No plastic locks no cheapness at all. I love the entire idea and give the inventory a pat on their backs. I love Mt key ring and wouldn't change it for the world. Best I've ever used and I've been through a few different ones.
Thanks alot guys, I haven't worried about loosing keys since the day I got this in my box.

I have NOT been paid for this review nor any other review so far. (I wish I would though).
This is, as always, just and only my opinion thought my own eyes and felt with my own hands. I take reviews serious, as I rely on them to make my decisions before any and all my purchases. So if you have found my review helpful please vote and let the other Amazonian Browsers get a better judgment of what to expect and how the product works. Thank you for your time and happy buying.

title: Hot hands hayo
review:
Well if you're looking for nuclear hands you have found THE product.

This thing gets real hot real fast. Even at the lowest setting I find it heats up just a bit too much that it's uncomfortable to hold. Having a too warm hand-warmer though is something I'm ok with having. I have tiny, child hands so I don't have a problem with the size, but I could maybe see an average adult being a little disappointed.

Can't say much to the battery life yet, but it's survived constant on and off for 2 full 14 hour night works so far.

Would have given it a 5 if there was maybe 1 more lower level of heat. But a great product nonetheless. Highly recommend.

10/10 will warm my hands again.

title: I don’t like to give 1 star reviews
review:
[[VIDEOID:76028c643631116afecdbcb672781de7]] I hate to give a 1 star but, it is not secure on all surfaces and the stackable levels don’t line up nice. There is noticeable gaps. For the perfect environment this may work fine. But, not for me.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Perfect for teaching kids how to putt
review:
My 3, 6, and 7 year olds are having a lot of fun using these adjustable putters. I can easily change the height to fit each kid, which takes one variable out of teaching them how to putt.

The heads are similar to mini golf putters, so nothing fancy. But they work well enough for the kids on an indoor putting green. They are also very sturdy feeling and have nice grips.

title: great all-in-one product
review: We mainly bought this to use it as a tarp for drizzly evenings camping, but we noticed that it is wonderful in providing shade as well as a blanket for picnics. Very sturdy material and easy to keep clean.  Great item and I will get one more in a larger size if I can find in on Amazon somewhere. The package shows different sizes, but haven't found the larger ones online yet.

title: Fun toy
review: Pretty cool toy. No chance of breaking a window here. A little effort to blow up but works nicely for 5 and 7 year old.

title: Nice Mat But Bunches Up Sometimes Which Is Frustrating
review:
I have decided to practice some stretching and slow flexibility training, so I knew it was time to get a new yoga mat.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes rolled up with elastic to hold the ends and make a handle. There is a paper with a few positions on it for reference, but most of them are on the advanced side (if you are a beginner and very stiff).

PERFORMANCE
This mat does roll out pretty well, although I have had some issues with the end curling, even though I leave it out, roll it backwards and have worked with it. When I am changing positions, sometimes the mat will buckle up and that is frustrating for me.

COMFORT
There is good grip on this mat which keeps me from sliding on the surface when it is flat.

PORTABILITY
I roll this up and put the elastic bands around the ends and the handle makes it easy to carry.

SMELLS?
There are some things that come through with awful smells. This mat was free of that thankfully.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This mat is nice but it frustrates me when it buckles up when I change positions sometimes. I wish it didn't do that.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. If it didn't buckle I would have rated it higher, but the buckling and shifting are annoying at times. For the most part it is useful and I use it still.

title: Worth the money
review: Surprisingly comfortable and very sturdy. Well worth the money

title: It's comfortable!
review: Even though it's a big bottle, the handle placement makes it really comfortable to hold. Also, I love being able to visually track how much water I'm drinking in a day. I highly recommend it!

title: Dents easy and the writing comes off the bottle in 2 weeks
review: Only keeps the water cold for 12 hours maybe and the printing on the bottle comes off in weeks.

title: Inexpensive light didn't meet my expectations, returned for a refund.....
review: I purchased this inexpensive light for my mountain bike.  I wasn't expecting a lot for the price so when I had a problem where the zoom in/out would not hold, I wasn't too surprised.  I contacted the seller and the customer service was absolutely top notch with very sincere emails and quick action to replace the light.  The second light did not have any problems with the zoom, but the light would flicker when I hit any kind of bumps when riding.  I cleaned the contacts and replaced the batteries but it didn't help.  The free red rear light was worthless, it would shut off with any bumps in the road - the first one and second one did the same thing.  I returned the first and second lights for a refund.  I ended up going to REI and spending more for a very nice quality light that totally exceeds my expectations in every way.

title: Only recommend for little kids
review: This Ariel loop was kind of difficult for my teenage daughter to figure out. It seems like its made to support littler kids and although she's a gymnast it was not very helpful for her stretching. It was pretty solid but when she put all of her weight on it started pulling the door and breaking. A smaller child would probably appreciate it more, but she put it away after that first time and hasn't tried it again since.

title: Delivery took to long.
review: My item was supposed to be delivered on Sept. 9.  The delivery date changed 3 times!  From Sept. 9 to Sept. 13, and then Sept. 14.  I did get it by the 13th.  The item is good, reins are a little shorter than I like, but fine otherwise.  If you order from this company, pay extra for faster delivery.  Maybe FedEx will get it to you faster.  HorseLoverz offered to refund the shipping cost, but that wasn't the issue, it really was FedEx.  I will not buy from the company again- I'll stick with companies I've used before.  Faster service and delivery even for standard delivery charges.

title: Absolutely fantastic!
review: I ordered these for my husband, because he carries what feels like a 100 different keys around for work. He's been using one of the clips now for two weeks and said this was a complete game changer. They make finding and using keys so much easier. Plus this clip feels like it is made out of a high quality metal. He's thrilled with his, so we would have to recommend it!

title: Soft, extra wide grip, cast iron coated…
review:
[[VIDEOID:bdf784148fbe4fd68edb8be4fb8bd99b]] These dumbbells are very comfortable for lifting due to the extra wide grip area. This prevents the side from rubbing your thumb area / pinky area. So, lots of range of motion. The neoprene is very secure and creates a nice soft grip. Very impressed!

title: Does it’s jo
review: Sweat bands nothing to brag about

title: Absolutely awesome.
review:
My dad used to have a few of the old plastic Gatorade bottles, so these are more so nostalgic for me. I was curious to see how a stainless steel version would fare, and I'm super glad to say these are far better than the old ones, but with one small drawback.

It's stainless steel, so it can help keep your liquids cooler longer and is far more durable. The green is made of "gator skin," which is far grippier than I thought. It can hold a grip in dry or wet skin and is neither irritant to the touch. The orange cap disassembles for cleaning and is very easy to open.
Here's where my one drawback is. With plastic Gatorade bottles, I'm used to squeezing it a bit to get more liquid out faster. With this, you obviously can't, and the orange lid allows for more of a trickle than a steady stream. It's not a deal-breaker by any means, but the green bottle says to me "squeeze," but here I can't.

It's a cool bottle nonetheless, and is my go-to bottle in the gym now.

With that being said after a week of use I love it although I find myself reaching out for where a handle strap should be.  If it came with a handle strap it would definitely warrant 5 stars.  Other than that it is great quality, durable and sharp looking!

title: Three Stars

title: One Star
review: Never again.

title: Reasonable price but not for every bike
review:
This bike bag is reasonably priced and provides adequate storage for wallet, keys, and a few other items. The reason I am disappointed is because it does not fit my bike (my bike is a Trek Lime). There is a back strap that is supposed to go behind the handlebars but the strap is so loose and cannot be tightened much so it just sags and provides no support. Also, the straps did not securely fit the curvature of my bike handles that when I cinched it to the handlebars it drooped down almost to the front tire.

Therefore, I tried to use this bag by cinching it to the rail above the pedals. The fit was awkward and once I filled the pack with a cell phone and keys, it expanded and hit my legs when riding. I decided to give this to my boyfriend--he loves it because it fits his bike fine.

Although this is a decent pack for a good price, the manufacturer needs to improve on the back strap so that it can be adjustable by more than a few inches. Also,buyers need to be aware that they may not be able to cinch this pack to their handlebars because of where the velcro straps are in relationship to the curvature of the handlebar.

title: Great for adults too
review:
I use this for myself. I got a clear screen protector and applied it then popped on the Big Grips (I got the blue one which is a beautiful blue. I am an adult and I enjoy being able to grip the thing and use it for gaming, without worrying about dropping it or scratching the screen. Most of the time I do not use the stand but at times, when working on the computer and wanting to check things on the ipad once in a while, I will prop it up on the stand and sit it next to me. Its VERY good with games like Hit N'Run, iBoat Racer or Waterslide. I also like that I can grip it and use the other hand with ease on games like Bad Air Day (ok childish I know but its still a fun time killer), Strike Knght, Cave Diver or Summer Games. Once in a while on games I will take it out of the case (Contract Killer is one)but since getting the case, I have probably had it out of the case a total of 10 times.
Recently when on vacation, it was great because I didn't have to worry about the 2 year old, 3 year old, 4 year old and 5 year old in the family getting it and dropping it. I didn't feel the need to protect it like gold because I knew it was safe.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

When I arrived my things were still cold (I did put them in cold) but that makes this a winner for me. It folded down nicely and stores in a very small space, ready for my next expedition.

title: Confusing sizing

title: Only for very tall people!
review:
First, I ordered a 2 set and only got one chair…so, a very expensive chair!😠
I need a bigger chair and this one is wide and heavy duty, but I can not touch the floor when I sit down. This chair is not only for heavy oeople, but also for very tall people. If I could, I would send it back!

title: Buy it, you'll like it.
review: This is great. Cute & safe, checked 2 important boxes. :)

title: Great Chair, Easy To Set Up,  Two Minor Things, But Otherwise Handy
review:
I have had some issues with my back and legs where sometimes I just need to sit with my legs up and my back supported. Outside in the summer, I have limited choices in seating on days like that. This seemed like a solution.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes all rolled up in a carry bag with a simple small list of instructions.

HOW TO SET THIS UP
- Take out of the bag.
- Unroll
- Lay down on area you want the chair to be in
- Unscrew the cap next to the pump button
- Press orange power button
- When lounge is fully expanded, screw on button you unscrewed
- Turn off power

HOW LONG?
This took overnight to recharge for me (although it may have been done sooner than that). As for it inflating, I would say it took under five minutes to inflate- just perhaps several minutes tops. I did find that I had to inflate it a little more than I thought to make it more stable.

COMFORT
This is a nice lounge. It does support the back and even the neck is somewhat supported which is nice. The only issue I have is that unless this is fully inflated, this lounge feels like it is going to tip over easily. Even when fully inflated, it tends to feel like that a bit too.

WARM
On a really warm day this might be a bit hot to lay on for an extended amount of time. There is no venting or netting to let air in behind your body.

BAG SIZE
Another small issue is that once you deflate the lounge, it does not easily fit into the carry bag. I wish that the bag was just a little bigger.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Despite the "might fall over" feeling this has once in a while and the carry bag being a bit too small, this is a nice lounge with decent back support.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. I wish this was just a little more stable once inflated, but it is not so bad that I won't use this. It is comfortable enough to make it worth a little bit of frustration now and then. It is not a deal breaker. The bag really should be a little bit bigger though- even just two inches bigger around would be perfect.

title: Easy to set up and reinsert into the bag

The molle system throughout makes customization endless. The quality of the molle and all the other parts, including the velcro, is top of the line.

I ordered a small, but the sleeve the band came in has both small and large written on it, so I'm not sure what size I received. If it is a small, it definitely runs big. I like how the band connects to the bezel and moves freely, much better than the original Fitbit band it came with.

review: The ab roller has worked pretty well so far. The anti-slip mat slides a bit, but isn't really big enough to prevent my knees from eventually sliding off.

title: Great for traveling.
review: Loved the color. Great on the road. Very happy.

title: Nostalgic.
review: Lately I have become obsessed with collecting cute Pop figures. I enjoyed the 1997 movie The Fifth Element and two of my favorite characters are Leeloo and Diva Plavalaguna. Simply acquiring them both made me smile.

title: Made well and can catch more fish than i can!
review:
[[VIDEOID:5a27871eef6eb5e10f8eb15ec5ee75bd]] I like so much about his rod set. Telescopic with a smooth spinning reel. For left or right hand! Very lightweight and an attractive design. Love the carrying/storage bag. Has all the essentials to get you going. I have since used this for trout fishing and had no issues whatsoever. It is a joy and privilege to take this fishing.

title: Nope
review: The first one we got lasted 3 days and snapped in half while riding. The replacement we got came damaged and broken so we returned it.

title: What's up with Lodge
review: Lodge is not doing a very good job anymore, three times I tried to get this without defects and all three times it had some. The black was off where you could see the gray through it.

title: Nice Quality
review: These interlocking exercise foam mats are a good quality. They do fit together nicely and would offer a decent and comfortable flooring if that was your intended purpose. Mine is not. My son likes to create cosplay costumes. He uses foam pieces like this to create elaborate costumes. He heats them up and while they're warm and pliable, he puts them up against curved surfaces such as large buckets and as they cool down, they retain the shape. These are smaller than the last ones he got from the store, but they are a good size for creating shoulder pads or smaller needed costume parts. These have been working well for his latest creation.

title: Really good vibrations, useless manual, max weight according to manual is 264.5 lbs
review:
Interesting sensations that feel rather good throughout the body. I step on, turn on, and let it do its thing. I am currently at 10 minutes max just standing on it. I'll aim for more over time. When I step off, my feet dont feel real so please be careful. Sometimes I add in squats. Kind of cool to do squats on this. Love the sensory input, and if I worked in an office, I would want to have this under my desk for anytime use. It isn't loud. Or I would pull it out and stand on it for mini breaks. Better yet, if I had a standing desk.

Remote takes two AAA batteries (not included).

I'm 5'10.5", 264 lbs. The product page says max weight of 330 lbs. The manual says 120 kg (which is 264.5 lbs. HUGE difference. Which one is it? FWIW, this thing is really heavy and sturdy, and I imagine it holds more weight than myself easily. That being said..

Manual doesn't provide truly meaningful information. There are two pages of safety instructions, one page of parts list (why?), then a diagram of the components and how to attach ropes (helpful), then product maintenance, and a "speed setting options" graph, ie the Hz/S corresponding to level (really means nothing to me unless the Hz/S is qualified with perceived affect), then a page showing what the panel info means and remote control info. Problem solving. Different positions/postures (seriously, one is called "groveling" with clearly female image on her hands and knees). With no description of benefit. Last page has assortment of generic stretches recommendations. There is more info on moves that aren't related to the actual machine. Blegh.

I would like to know more about what sort of affect certain levels are intended for. What does this machine actually do? Like "here, here is this thing you step on. Turn it on." That is the gist of what I get from the manual.

Also, I cant seem to pair this via Bluetooth to anything I've tried. Maybe its on my end, but nothing happens. I will keep trying. I think the machine utters something about blue tooth, but there is nothing else to be said of it. The manual does not mention it at all. It has a USB port, which does not make it blue tooth. So maybe I will plug something in at some point. In the mean time, I just set this up near my TV.

If you know what to do, and what you are using this for, and have no need of any helpful information, then this machine is surprisingly sturdy and provides lots of vibrations. I see other machines that include ebooks, video links, and more robust info. I just really expected something of this caliber to have an up to date manual and have more information. I see now that they say in the product description that their manual is not up to date and to refer to product page (not any more helpful), but that fries me.. I would not expect a customer (or what if I gave this as a gift?!) to have to track down the product page to learn about it since they couldnt bother to add in a relevant info.

5 stars for vibration feel. I will need to use it for a whole lot longer to determine if there is any actual positive effect. 5 Stars for sturdy, heavy material and heavy duty 3 pronged cord. This is not a cheapie feeling machine.

1 star for useless manual, problems with BT connection

Going with 3 stars. Will up rate if this actually does something more than what a regular workout session provides.

title: This is definitely not for the patient; it is useless to me for anything more than 2.5 lbs tension & quality is marginal
review:
I ordered this because it said it was also a finger exerciser for the patient and not only for the beginner guitarist o pianist. However, I am disappointed.

I had carpal tunnel surgery on both my left and right hands in 2016. Due to carpal tunnel, I had no strength in my hands. In order to build strength, I purchased some of the same tools the therapist had in her office in addition to other tools that serve the same purpose as listed below. I wasted my money on the last two tensioners and wish I never purchased them. The first one is very light and only needed by someone who has no hand strength.

[[ASIN:B00HB7V6JY CanDo GripMaster Hand Exerciser, Yellow, X-Light Tension (1.5 lbs per finger]]
[[ASIN:B00HB7V6GC CanDo GripMaster Hand Exerciser, Red, Light Tension (3 lbs per finger)]]
[[ASIN:B00HB7V6KS CanDo GripMaster Hand Exerciser, Green, Medium Tension (5 lbs per finger)]]
[[ASIN:B00HB7V6JO CanDo GripMaster Hand Exerciser, Blue, Heavy Tension (7 lbs per finger)]]
[[ASIN:B00HB7V6HG CanDo GripMaster Hand Exerciser, Black, X-Heavy Tension (9 lbs per finger]]
[[ASIN:B000UMHUSI PRO Hand and Finger Exerciser, Extra-Heavy Tension (11 lbs per finger)]] - TERRIBLE GRIP, NOT RECOMMENDED
[[ASIN:B00KH3L7KC PRO Hand and Finger Exerciser, XX-Heavy Tension (13 lbs per finger)]] - TERRIBLE GRIP, NOT RECOMMENDED

In addition to the above, I also ordered a [[ASIN:B01NBY83AE Gaiam Restore Easy Adjust Hand Grip]] which I found to be good but there is no way to know the tension on this grip.

Since I own and use the above tools, I wanted to see how this compared. I expected two tensioners in one since it combined the tension of the the light and medium tensioners I have into one rated from 2.5 to 6 pounds. The only thing I like about this exerciser is that this provides 2.5 lbs of tension per finger, which is another level of tension I do not have in my other devices. Other than this, it is useless to me.

NEGATIVES

- The rubber grip on the bottom falls off easily and keeps falling off.

- No instructions exist on how to adjust the tension or what each of the four tension levels equate to.

- Third, to adjust the tension, the two ridges on each side have to be pushed in while the last finger piece has to be pulled out. There are four levels it can slide out to, but it is almost impossible to get those levels to set correctly every time and there is no tension indicator or notches on the unit. All I know is that the fully closed position is 2.5 lbs and the fully open position is 6 lbs but I am not sure what is in-between.

- Lastly, the tension feels the same opened or closed. Apparently, it is just he positioning that is different and which provides a simulated tension level of over 2.5 lbs. Perhaps this will work for the beginner guitarist or pianist but it is definitely not suitable for patient rehabilitation compared to the CanDo tensioners.

title: Works great!
review:
Edit: it is not waterproof. It is more water resistant. Have been caught in the rain when it isn't very hard and it kept things dry but as soon as it down poured, the bag was soaking wet and everything inside

I have been using this for a few weeks now. I go out 5 times a week for 25 miles each time. This holds my patch kit, pump, my star wrench, a small soft sided cooler bag with some snacks, extra water, a baggy of body wipes, a few packages deodorant wipes, and a first aid kit.

When fall hits, I'll need to use my triangle bag again to fit a hoodie inside and move my bottle to the front, though.

title: Warm and Comfortable Socks
review: I am an outdoor enthusiast and these socks are a great choice for a variety of activities. Merino wool is an excellent fabric because it has superior insulating properties and even keeps you warm when the material gets wet. These socks are thick enough to provide good warmth, but not so thick that they inhibit motion. I use them for running, hiking, and cross-country skiing. These socks feel soft on your skin without any scratchiness and are an attractive color. These are practical and durable socks that will keep you comfortable in cold weather.

title: Very comfortable
review: Updated: we used this on our camping trip and it was so comfortable. We have not slept a whole night on these, but I laid on it for awhile the day after we inflated it and they were so comfortable! I am a side sleeper with hips and have a hard time sleeping in blow up mattresses, this does not feel like a blow up. It was perfect and my hips did not hit the floor. We let it self air but did have to blow it up to get the full 3in effect.

title: Very comfy but not durable
review: I used the mat one time. It is very comfortable but it has rips/tears from my ab roller after less than one minute of trying it out.

title: Okay, but there are better
review: Not the best it could have been. It loosens up very easily, and could be a hazard if it were to loosen up too much.

title: Just OK
review:
Let me start off by saying I've owned many of these cheap trackers, and this one isn't terrible at all. The color screen and the multiple faces is fun, but I hoped it would have more customization. I was really excited about the temp sensor, but I can't say it seems terribly accurate. Seems more like a gimmick. The step counter seems pretty accurate compared to other trackers including FitBit, Mi Band, a Michael Kors Wear OS and Samsung product I compared it to, and the battery life is pretty great as long as you don't have all the sensors running all the time (if you do constant heart rate monitoring, for example, expect to charge it every couple of days instead of weeks). I also like the way it charges, much like a similar product I've tried from Letscom. Rather than have a dedicated charger that might get lost in between uses, the charging port is behind the band! You remove one side, and plug the entire watch into a USB port to charge. I love this feature and have only seen in on a couple of other products. I wish more would adopt it instead of magnetic proprietary bases.
At the end of the day, if you just want basic step tracking, sleep tracking and phone notifications on a device that doesn't need to be charged so often, it's OK. Don't get it for the gimmicks like the HR monitor and temperature, I don't think those are accurate. But at the same time, there are more solid products like the Xiaomi Mi Band line which is made to a higher specification and very competitively priced to this one. It's nice having options, but make sure you compare your options before purchasing.

title: Comfortable and looks good. Needs pockets though
review: The vest fits well and doesn’t inhibit motion. Definitely suffers from lack of a pocket of some sort though. The zipper is a little sticky as well. Needs a little lubricant. But all in all it’s a nice vest.

title: Five Stars
review: Great design. A little bit see through, just wear a tank top beneath.

title: seems too wide
review: I picked up a mans and a ladies waist belt and the guys belt actually fits better, it's not a wide as the ladies, they are both the same length so not sure why wider but I find it's way more comfortable for my body type.

title: Dirty and smelly
review: These are filthy and smell like old used tires. For the price, I would expect differently. The black rubber has stained our clothing, our carpet, and anything else it touches. We literally keep it in a box and drag them around when we want to use them. They’re that dirty! And the smell.....Ye Gods! We won’t be buying anything from this manufacturer again.

title: Make sure you read dimensions, not just age range!
review: Much smaller than I had imagined. To small for the child I bought it for... Hoping to return/exchange for something that will work for my larger-than-the-average 2.5 year old, for Christmas. Aside from being too small, it seems well made and sturdy. Wish I could just "honey I blew up the Scooteroo"!

title: extremely heavy but not sturdy at all and pedal broke only after one use
review: [[VIDEOID:ad137e319db011e06efd535ddd025aad]] Are you serious? broke after one use?? its pedal broke after one use , i m so dissapointed. how am i supposed to retrn this now? it is too heavy and it took forever to install since it is too heavy. since it is too heavy i expected it to be more sturdy but it is not. and seat is super weird it it keeps moving, you dont really feel any comfort at all. omg. i hate this. send me a replacement pedal this is too heavy and i got rid of the box already i dont really have time for this.

title: This Razor doesn't seem as sturdy as the Radio Flyer
review: We bought this when our hard-ridden, three-wheeled Radio Flyer scooter lost a wheel.  This Razor doesn't seem as sturdy as the Radio Flyer, but will work well enough for our five year old and two year old.  They are both daredevil scooter riders and it's hard for them to make a sharpish turn when they're going fast.  They like the color and seem to enjoy playing with it.  The only reasons I didn't give it five stars is that it doesn't have a brake and isn't quite Radio Flyer quality...but it's close enough.  And a lot cheaper!

title: Great little set 🐟🐠🐟
review: Bought this for my husband so he could have a traveling pole without taking all his gear. For the price I wasn't expecting top of the line but we were very impressed with the quality, not only is it a full-length pole but the eyes on the pole are chameleon which is really cool and the reel itself is really good quality, he's very happy with this travel set.

title: easy to put
review: Is well worth the money, very heavy duty, would definately buy again..easy to put together

title: Great machine! Built very well.
review: Just got it the other day when it was on sale for 80$ off making it 315$. Only used it a couple of times so far and everything works great. It’s smooth both pull and seat. I’m very picky with things I buy and usually you get what you pay for and this was a steal. Built like a tank. The resistance is ok but with water rowers the quicker you pull the more resistance you get. Only gripe and it’s minor is no backlight on monitor. Other than that this machine is of very high quality. I hope it last for years.

title: Okay
review:
Well made patch! It has a weird velcro backing though, like it is velcroed to the back bit so you can pull it apart, like a sandwich.

Idk why this is so, but it still works as a patch to glue to something, or a patch if you want to have a velcro'd patch.

I cant imagine it working well on clothing though, as it would seperate/get strange in the wash, plus the velcro causes it to almost have a 3D effect....

This velcro-ness is why i removed one star. Otherwise it wouldve been 5 stars, had it been just a normal patch with normal, flat, patchlike backing (sorry for the lack of picture).

title: Very Comfortable
review: This pool chair/float is very comfortable. I'm a plus size mom. It's big enough that I didn't feel like I was squeezing onto something much too small. The mesh covering on the bottom keeps you from slipping through the pool ring. The cup holder will hold a beverage can or bottle. I didn't have an air compressor with me, or an electric pump, so I had to inflate this on my own. My husband took over blowing air into it  because I wasn't making a lot of progress. It's durable and made from a thick vinyl. It should easily last the summer if not longer.

title: Great, Sturdy Jump Rope
review: I started taking boxing this year, and we frequently start class with jump roping to warm up.  I HATED the ones at the gym, as they are different lengths (heaven forbid you get one too short), and even different weights.  When I saw this, I knew I had to get it and put it in my bag!  The handles are really lightweight, as is the "rope," which is a thin steel rope that swings easily and quickly.  You can also easily adjust the jump rope.  As much as I dislike jump roping to warm up, I now at least don't dread it!  I have a nice, easy to use rope--and it's cute!  :)

title: This game is fun
review: We really enjoy this foosball set.  It a lot of fun and doesn't take up too much space.  The quality is about midrange and has stood up to a bit of rough play.  The assembly was easy. Better to have 2 people, but one person can do it.

title: Too small
review: It’s to small for really cold weather and it sits to close to the tent floor and almost ruined my tent but it is a good little heater

title: too much of a hassle
review: Pain to put up and down and it knicks the wall pretty bad. If you are going to get it I would suggest leaving it up and not removing it over and over again.

title: After one week of use one has snapped and the ...
review: After one week of use one has snapped and the replacement has stretched so much it can’t be used. Returning.

title: but it is very comfortable and helps get me off the floor at just ...
review: It's a tad overstuffed, but it is very comfortable and helps get me off the floor at just the right height to sit properly.

title: Hayabusa Rocks...Until it Rips
review:
Stunning peerless design. Light for a triple weave. Strong material. Got this on sale for under $100, fantastic value.

Update 11/16/15:
Previously gave this GI a 5/5, have to downgrade it even though it is beautiful to a 1/5. If it doesn't perform its function of being able to withstand pushing and pulling of BJJ then it is not for BJJ. Crotch tore tonight just during stretching. Are you kidding me?!

Update 11/26/15:
Got a replacement sent to me since it was less than one month old. Decided to see if it was just one defective GI, (since I own white one and no rips so far), and sent back the black version of this Gi. Rolled for 1st time with this GI tonight, Size A4, and in only one class, two tears. There has to be a design flaw with these, (sigh), beautiful gi flawed by bad crotch design. This was only washed once on handwash/delicate cycle then air dried.

title: Doesn't power on
review: I was excited to try this sleeping bag out but unfortunately it wouldn't power on, even after being plugged in for nearly an hour. The USB cable was tricky to find on the right side, and although the instructions says it has another near the bottom, either I really can't find it or mine does not include one. There isn't any other port at the bottom. The third option also mentions another outlet source which I also cannot find. I'm not sure why they would include instructions for a model that either isn't accurate or is missing components. The bag itself feels pretty nice, it's long and has a regular fleece interior. On its own it's probably okay for 50 and up temps if your wearing some warm clothing. Otherwise I couldn't see this being suitable for any colder weather.

title: Extreme Protection for Summer in the Desert or Mountains
review:
We love to hike in the mountains near our Colorado home, but unfortunately, high-altitude sun and bugs can make the aftermath very uncomfortable.

This hat has lots of protective options. First, there's a sturdy, multi-stitched extra-wide brim to shade your face. That alone will probably protect you from the sun (and rain).

If you hate hats because they make your head sweat, you won't mind wearing this one. The crown is lightweight, flexible, and vented. It also has a cord to adjust the size of the hatband! At first, I thought it was a bit big, but that was easy to fix. Hatmakers have finally realized that wind exists and are including chin cords. This model has a nice one. if those were the only features of this hat, it would probably would be enough, but wait, there's more.

There's a snap-on back flat to keep sun, rain, ticks, mosquitoes, and black flies away from your neck and ears. There's also a flap in front that's vented for coolness and easy breathing. Admittedly, you'll look a little odd with both of these flaps snapped in place, but if you've been out hiking or fishing in the summer, you know others may be asking where you got it after they finish laughing. In any case, the hat is very versatile. You can use one of the flaps or neither of them. They snap on and off. Lightweight synthetic fabric, they tuck into your pocket when not in use. (BTW, the hat's fabric is water resistant too.)

Want more? It rolls up to fit into your day pack.

review: Emergency preparedness supplies kits items.

title: too thin
review: The metal on these cups is very thin. They become too hot to hold when filled with coffee or any other warm liquid. I would not recommend

title: Do Not Buy this run away
review: I got mine from Verizon as a package deal. They did an update to the Firm ware and now I have to charge it 2 times a day. The customers service for Fitbit sucks. They blame the problem on the user. I have canceled my service and I will never buy another Fitbit product.

title: Dangerous and low end, clothing quality snaps
review:
My husband is a retired Federal Agent and certified weapons specialist and military armorer certified by seven weapons manufacturers annually. He knows weapons and accessories both on a professional and personal level. He has carried a weapon daily openly and concealed for well over 37 years. He decreed that this holster is at best useless and at worst, dangerous.

First, it had no metal clip to attach to a belt. Second, the strap to secure the extra magazine is thin and easily undone by accident. Third and most importantly, the safety snaps are cheap, weak clothing style snaps. These snaps are supposed to hold your pistol securely in the holster - preventing an amateur mistake where it slips or slides up as you move. Instead, literally the lightest pressure pops the snaps loose unintentionally. That's a recipe for disaster.

The only reason I'm not giving 1 star is because we can replace the straps ourselves in the shop and the rest of the physical holster is decently stitched and secure. There are so many better options out there in very budget friendly options....skip this one.

title: prepper food, pantry food, convenience food-- all good stuff from Augason Farms
review:
Been buying a few items here and there from Augason Farms, usually two at a time (2 is 1, 1 is none). I love their selection and quality. I try to buy when something goes on sale. Very important to me to have "mire poix", so I keep dehydrated onions, celery, and carrots on hand--goes a long way toward flavoring a lot of foods, and amping up nutrition. As well some peppers, eggs, and a few other basic staples that make my life easier. Veggies are nice for tossing into soups, muffins, etc. When I cant get fresh, or I dont feel like chopping, the dehydrated stuff is great to have.

Also, whatever next is on our Apocalypse Bingo Card, I just want to be ready.

title: Satisfied customer - not a bad product
review: Great! Arrived on time. They are a little lighter than expected, I think I need something like a flat band for more stretch. They work efficiently for me to interpret into my workout, creates great tone!

We ended up giving it to a friend that sister comes to town to visit and they really like it, so to each there own.

title: Holds a bunch of water! Seems durable.
review: This holds a bunch of water, seems pretty durable, and the spout makes it easy to fill things up and turn it off right after. All of that being said, this is a bag and where it stays in a cube shape- it's kind of floppy and not super rigid so if you are expecting something to hold shape like a milk jug, this isn't that. But it is a decent thickness and works well enough still.

title: Vibrated off one too many times
review: For the good, I really enjoyed the visibility this mirror provided.  Once it snapped off though I realized just how much I relied on it.  After about a year of riding, it started vibrating up and off the sliderail.  I'd have to slam my brakes and hope a car didn't run it over.  Well, today it didn't just slide off, it completely snapped at one of the adjustment screws...and no, I hadn't made any adjustments to the angle or position in over a year.  It looks like the plastic just gave up and snapped cleanly, despite riding on a nicely paved asphalt road at the time.  It did last about 1.5 years, but something as simple as this, I'd have expected better.

title: Great Relief for Lower Back Pain!
review: I know that the best way to lose weight is from diet and exercise. There are no miracle products out there! But when this became available during a recent promotion, I was curious about it, so I happily ordered it at a reduced cost. I've been using it on and off for the last two weeks. It is surprisingly comfortable. Once it's on, it's barely noticeable. I thought I might get overheated while wearing it, but so far, that hasn't been an issue. It does give immediate slimming results. And it's a lot more comfortable than other products I've used for that purpose. There is some bulk, so I've decided not to wear it under certain clothing items where it is visible because of its thickness. One day, my lower back was hurting a lot. I put the waist trimmer on and it offered immediate relief. I haven't noticed any permanent loss of inches, but I have not been wearing it every day. But just for the lower back relief and the immediate slimming look under clothes, I am very happy.

title: Great colors and easy to install

All in all, we were disappointed with this product.

Overall, it's a great seat!

The green mat is a little small so if you are having an adult party I’d get a better mat but the wheel is great and spins smoothly, I loved our casino night and it wouldn’t have looked as cool without the wheel.  I would recommend if your not a serious Vegas gambler then you’d prob hate it because it’s not Vegas. It’s like pretend you went to your local Party store and thats the quality you get. Stop comparing it to the $300 wood one. It is plastic. But i thought it was awesome and so did all my non gambling professional guests.

Im not sure I want to pay shipping to send this back and then order the black one.  I have a friend who has this and she loves it which is why I ordered one.  What to do...

title: Okay Fit
review: We have a couple of kayaks and a SUP. We just don't have enough PFD's for everyone so we can all go out at the same time. For the record, this one does not say anything about being Coast Guard Approved. In fact the booklet that comes with it says that it will not keep your face out of the water if you are unconscious.  I started looking up the requirements for PFD's in my state and for kayaking and canoeing, you need Coast Guard Approved ones. So I'm not really sure if I can even use this one. So keep that in mind. It's possible that these are similar to the ones that are CG approved, but they just didn't submit to the testing or fill out the paperwork. I do not know the answer. No going beyond that, this fits okay. It was a little snug on me, but I was not surprised. It seems to be made well. I'm just unsure of what I'm going to do with it.

title: Total Excellent Product
review: This comes with a spray can nozzle so that the product can be misted on an area (say you are spraying foam and some comes slinking down the window of your sliding glass door on new construction), I just spray a little in a rag and wipe off the orange gunk with ease.  This unit can also be screwed on a great stuff gun and used to blow out the chamber and barrel of the gun.  Turns it from foam to a liquified orange kool aid.  Very efficient, should get at least half dozen to a dozen gun cleans out of a can.  I'm buying one as backup now so that I don't ever run out.

It's like sitting on a wobbly, hard bicycle seat.  I guess I just have to suck it up and buy the stability ball chair.  Boo!

I do like that this one has the mounting available for a Gopro camera and I'm looking into buying one.

title: The first Osprey product I’ve been disappointed with
review:
I had high expectations for this hip pack. I am a long time user of hydration backpacks while mountain biking (more than 20 years), and I wanted to try something different. After hearing about the benefits of getting weight off your shoulders and lowering your center of gravity, I thought this would be perfect. I’ve been extremely happy with my other Osprey backpacks and luggage, so this is a rare miss.

The good news is there is plenty of room for water, food, tools, a tube, wallet, keys, and phone. With these items and a full 1.5 liters of water, it weighed 6 lbs, which is pretty light. However, the pack would not sit flat against my back as it poofed up like a balloon. It did not sit comfortably flat on my back until I drank probably 1/3 of the water. So it may work better starting out with less water on board.

The other major issue I had was with the hose and magnet. The magnet needs to be a lot stronger because the hose kept popping off when I rode through technical features. I wouldn’t even notice it until the trail smoothed out and I would feel it brushing up on my leg. I’d find the hose dangling precariously by my rear wheel. Also, compared to a backpack where I could immediately let go of the hose if needed, I had some sketchy moments trying to reattach the hose to the magnetic clip while steering around rocks and roots. I think it is just a matter of time before the bite valve gets destroyed by my wheel because the hose disconnected unexpectedly or I didn’t have enough time to reattach the hose and had to drop it.

Another complaint, which may be due to the hip pack instead of a backpack or because of the bite valve design, I had to really suck on the bite valve to get a decent sized drink quickly. I’m used to just biting down and having the water pressure take care of getting a drink. It may only take fractions of a second longer than my trusty backpack, but it was getting annoying, especially on tough climbs where I was breathing hard.

title: Only 1 problem.
review: I just started using this and so far I like it except for one reason.  The cable extends out of the handle off center. I consider this a design flaw.  While using it, the weight feels off balance. One side needs more force than the other. It would be like curling with a 20 pound weight in one hand and a 25 pound weight in the other.  So to accommodate this I switch the cable side to a different hand each set.  In one photo the cable is wrapped around the bar several times and looks like it is centered.  I suppose that might help to alleviate the imbalance issue but I haven't tried it yet.  For the price it is ok but If I had known about the flaw I would have purchased a different rig.

title: Norinco SKS rod replacement
review: Perfect fit for Norinco SKS.  Not much to say... tool does the job it was designed for. no problem with quality or delivery

title: Wow! Very nice set!
review:
I ordered the 'Professional Steel Tip Darts Set - USA American Flag and Patriotic Bald Eagle Inspired Colors - Customizable Configuration 6 Steel Tip Darts |Shafts |Standard Flights | O-Rings | Darts Tool| Sharpener' to review.

I have to say first off that I am not, nor have I ever been a professional Dart player. My experience has been purely recreational and to be honest, it's been close to 30 years since I really played. So when I had the opportunity to order and review this set, I was excited to give it a go. When I first opened this set I was absolutely blown away at the quality and options that come with this Dart set. The last time I played, I used plastic molded darts with dull steel tips. Btw, the steel tips with this set are nice and sharp out of the box!

This set has options. You can choose from the pre-installed aluminum flight shafts or the included plastic flight shafts. You can choose from standard flights, or the included smaller flights. The flights are a nice quality plastic and are a bit tricky to install at first as they are a really tight fit into flight shafts. The set also comes with extra O rings, a tip sharpening tool and a dart tool. What, a Dart tool? I never knew there was a such thing haha.

This is a great Dart set and though I am not a professional Dart player, I would most definitely consider this a professional set. The darts are well balanced and just feel solidly built. Overall I am very happy with this set and think it's a great value for the $$.

title: junk
review: Cheaply made. get what you pay for I guess. Choppy peddling. Not smooth at all. Didnt bother digital readout. This will go into my daughter in laws garage sale for 5 bucks. Toyal disappointment. Spend a little more get a better product. Wasn't able to return. Ended up in hospital. 🤷‍♀️

title: Only "properly" fits tight double thread
review: The threads on it work better and seal better when the bottle has tight double thread, not the single wider almost double thread. The drinking part is not a quick pop lid,rather and unscrew lid. That's fine if you not riding bikes and need to open it quickly. Good for say a in the work office or casual at home bottle. Difficult to show, but the metal bottle has the wider thread. The plastic bottle has the tighter double thread.

title: Works Well, No Fragrance For Those Sensitive To Fragrances
review:
I have used a few products to wash down outerwear, so I am familiar with how they are supposed to work. Let's see how this measures up.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This cleaner comes in a plastic bottle. There is a cap which is dual measuring cap. The cleaning liquid inside is not thick, but thin. It has no fragrance- kind of smells a little like Elmer's glue. It goes away though.

HOW TO USE
It only takes a capful for a small load and two for a double. Sleeping bags take two. When using this in the washer, I apply the cleaning liquid as usual in my front loader. I wash and then hang outside to dry.

RESULTS?
There is no smell to the cleaned items, but they do have water repellent qualities. I like how this one performs.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For cleaning fine down items, this is a great choice. I chose not to wash non-down items with it as they can be washed with other cleaners.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. I like having this around and can get quite a few uses out of the bottle.

title: Uh oh.
review: Playing on this scooter has been my grandsons greatest do you light until a bolt came out of one wheel. What can be done?

title: finally a water bottle I love!
review:
I love this water bottle. Drinking from glass containers has always been a preference for me but of course it's not ideal for taking water on the go but the rubber 'jacket' on this water bottle makes it not only safer to take with you but provides a nonslip grip. I also love that the carry loop is metal and not some cheap fabric. Since the plastic coating doesn't cover the entire bottle and you can see your water level I find that I actually drink more water since I like being able to see the water line as it decreases (yeah I admit it, I don't drink enough water)... plus the mouth is wide enough to fit the ice from our icemaker.
My son who actually drinks ONLY water (yes, you read that right) however, doesn't like this bottle because he's used to a metal one and says it keeps the water colder. I think it's just a matter of preference. If you prefer drinking from glass rather than plastic or metal then you'd really like this bottle.

title: Low Rider
review: Quality.

title: Realistic-Looking Crankbait
review:
Most of my freshwater fishing involves hunting for largemouth bass. I use predominantly artificial lures like this one though I do occasionally use live bait when the fish get especially finicky. I have been experimenting with this bait in one of my favorite lakes and it seems to be a decent bait even though I have not yet caught anything with it. I had hoped to write this review with a picture of a fish caught with this bait but it has not worked out for me yet. (I will revise next spring once I catch one with it.)

This is a large, segmented minnow and it is well-suited for the voracious appetites of larger bass. It is approximately 5” long, a bit bigger than a small fish can handle (which is good – you don't need to waste time catching the little guys). I have the yellow version which looks a little bit like a brown trout.

The lure has 8 connected segments, all joined on a fibrous, narrow strip of some manner of fabric. The distance between the segments is small but it is enough to allow freedom of movement so the segments can undulate as the bait is pulled through the water. It seems to have very realistic motion. There is enough flex to allow some vertical motion but it is limited.

This bait sinks but has no bill so it needs to be cast and allowed to descend. When reeling, if you crank too fast it will end up back on the surface, so it really is not suitable for trolling or fast retrieves. It's a slow retrieve bait. With some practice I have been able to keep it at the depth I want.

I have two observations about this lure that merit mention, neither of which are showstoppers but both need to be kept in mind. First, this lure is a little frustrating in weedy or grassy water. More than once I have gotten weeds in the segments during the retrieve which requires stopping to pull off the weeds when at the end of the retrieve. Second, the rear treble hook occasionally gets hooked over the tail and I have yet to get it to right itself without actually putting hands on it. Neither of these are major issues but they are enough to aggravate on occasion.

This is a nice fishing lure, well made and it has good action. I like the colors and it looks very much like a trout. Be aware that this is a slow-retrieve bait and it does not dive.

Disclosure: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no/minimal cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: Well, you get what you pay for...
review:
Initially I was fascinated with the notion we now have decent fitness trackers with limited smartwatch capabilities for $25-$30. Well, that idea went into the trash almost immediately, as I became acquainted with what the Wyze band can and more importantly--cannot--do. The Wyze band is a lot of things, and great isn't one of them.

First, let me say, clearly, that for $25 or $30, this is a hard device to beat. If you keep your expectations (very) low, in line with the very low price of the unit, you will not be disappointed. The biggest frustration initially was with the lack of clear, helpful instructions. The instructions tell you it is charged out of the box, and that you should plug it in to charge to activate it. Um, okay. The home bar pulses when it is plugged in to the charger, leading you to think it is charging. Perplexingly, there is no charge indicator in the default display configuration while it is charging, so you just think it is still charging. In fact, pretty much everything in the default factory configuration is disabled, including Alexa, even once you set up your Alexa info in the app. Notifications are disabled by default, so nothing talks to the band. You have to turn on notifications, and then scroll through the entire list of all the apps on your phone to enable notifications for each specific app, including calendar reminders, messages, etc. Problem is, nowhere in the documentation (even online) does it tell you this step is necessary. People who are not comfortable messing around with their devices will be frustrated quickly. Nothing is intuitive, and there is no real guidance. It's fiddle-around time--geeks (like me) will be comfy with this. The average consumer will not be impressed at all, and may become quite frustrated.

However, set up frustrations aside, it's the things the Wayz band lacks which may disappoint the consumer. It's a long list, but again, remember this thing is dirt cheap. To begin with, the band has no external speaker. This means Alexa’s responses, when you can raise them (which is by no means assured), are in text on the screen in a *tiny* font. In fact, this tiny font is everywhere. If you wear glasses for reading, you will definitely need them to use this band. This means if you are out walking or running, and you're not wearing your glasses, the band is almost useless. This is where not having a speaker is a real detriment: Alexa cannot speak responses, and without my glasses I can't read them. This is due to the very small screen which is only 240 x 120 pixels. There simply isn't enough screen real estate for a larger font. This screen is *tiny*, and feels about half the size of the screen on an Apple watch. Another design issue worth noting, the band is the cheapest design I have ever seen, and it both looks and feels like it. The plastic clasp feels like it may break at any moment. Also, if you have large wrists like I do, you’re potentially out of luck. The Wayz band ships with only one band, and no larger band seems to be available.

You cannot really interact with this band much, which limits functionality. You can read your incoming text messages and notifications in that teeny tiny font, but you can't reply (or if you can, I've no idea how, as this is not covered anywhere and doesn't seem to be possible). You also cannot dismiss all notifications at once, and will have to scroll through all of them, dismissing them one at a time. A word to the wise: be conservative about which apps you allow to send notifications to the band. If you are all in, you are going to spend a LOT of time dismissing notifications. With the exception of talking to Alexa, which requires you to touch the screen, communication with this band is almost entirely one-sided--you cannot input anything on the band at all, and you must use the app on your phone to interact with it--which begs the question… why am I wearing this again?

Wyze have also not included the ability to control music playback (or anything else) from your phone. With the exception of the heartbeat monitor and sleep tracker, this device primarily functions as a tiny supplemental screen for your phone to give you alerts (and the haptic buzz is STRONG). From what I can tell, the sleep tracking, step counter, and heart rate monitoring are far from accurate, rendering this device mostly useless. Also, if your activity of choice is not walking, running, or jogging, you’re out of luck--it can’t track anything but steps and heart rate, and as it seems to consistently get those wrong, it really does sort of feel like a waste of $30. Perhaps more than anything else, the Wyze band serves as a great advertisement for other, superior fitness trackers, as all the shortcomings of this device just make me want to get a really good fitness tracker/smartwatch and toss this thing.

It should be noted there is also as serious issue with the way the band communicates with the phone. This really was not well-designed at all on the app side. In order for the band to interact with your phone, the WYZE app MUST be running on your phone at all times. This has several implications: 1) security (it can potentially capture everything you do on your phone), 2) it munches up phone battery, and 3) if you close the app, nothing will work, including Alexa. This is *really* uncool, and has contributed significantly to my decision to return it and spend a bit more on another, superior fitness tracker instead. It’s going back.

title: Items are good
review: Wanted black but came in multi colors,had to send them back.

title: Great value!
review: Great value and style -I just purchased a second. Similar items at target price out for almost twice as much.  However, the lid has a hole ....may not be best for someone looking for spillproof model.

title: Light Weight Athletic Shirt
review: This is a great athletic top for cooler weather. The material is soft and light weight. It's see through if you hold it up to the light, but it's not too bad when it's on. My husband will probably opt to wear a shirt underneath it, but that's a personal preference. The Under Armour logo is pretty subtle. It's a grey on grey logo on the sleeve. The shirt is made well.

title: This Will Make Your Children Play
review:
My kids got very excited when they opened up this box and saw all the different sports they could play with this versatile kit. In an era where our children all seem to be slaves to cell phones, this is a great way to get your kids up and active. If you've got a decent sized back yard, or even a large basement that gives little ones enough room to move around, you'll get them running and laughing with this kit.

It takes a little bit of time to put the net together and I wish the instructions had been printed in a bigger font because they were hard to see. However, the construction is pretty intuitive and it goes together easily. Some components of the net are held together with Velcro so you can fold it down and put it in the trunk of your car for a trip to the park.

The set comes with a little air pump and a needle that gets the job done along with a small, rubber soccer ball. It also has one small ball that feels like it's made out of tough foam, and three squishy balls that are perfect for juggling or sticking to the back of the net. It also includes a birdie. Two knee hockey sticks and two badminton rackets complete the set.

This is a good starter sports kit that is tough enough for rough play, but is kid friendly and safe. My kids are 9 and 7 and they're having a great time with it.

title: Ordinary
review: Good part has a hook at the end otherwise ordinary.

title: nice long mat
review:
it has it's own carrying hand and ability to roll it up and keep it rolled up til needed.
but if you do that then it wants to curl up on the ends. so we opted to let the mat stay out flat.

It is nice and firm but yet gives for exercises where your spine is pushing down towards the floor.
The smell disappeared in the first few days. not quite new car smell but wasn't the smell of rubber.

I expected this to be more resistant to scuffs and scrapes. It is very unforgiving to harder rubber shoes as it easily scuffed it and left marks on the mat. Additionally our dog walked across it and her small nails left a few marks surprising us.

so now we make sure we roll up or put it on top of the bowflex revolution to avoid any chance it could get tears.

title: Cute Leopard Print Umbrella!
review: I have tried a few inverted umbrellas. They do offer some features that traditional umbrellas don't have. They're are definitely some trade offs! I love being able to see the cute leopard print. That has nothing to do with functionality, but it's visually appealing. The umbrella opens fairly easy. I took this out on the deck and opened/closed it at least a dozen times. In at least half of the attempts, the umbrella didn't click into place when fully extended. I had to retry it again and sometimes again. The handle is easy to hold and grip. It's also comfortable when holding it for longer periods of time. I haven't had to go out in the rain since this arrived, but with the other inverted umbrellas, I do like how it's easy to use when getting in or out of the car. And of course I really like how when you have a wet umbrella, the moisture closes inside keeping you from getting hit with more water. Overall, I do like it, but it was a little frustrating that it didn't always click into place.

title: mixed feelings
review: It was horrible.  The first company I ordered it from said they shipped it but I never got it, so they refunded my money. I ordered it from another company and it arrived on time,  but I was seriously disappointed.  It looks old and cheap and nothing like the picture. The bracelet part does not look shiny gold like the picture, but more of a neglected tarnished look. Most of the crystals are a see through clear color,  and none of them are bright and shimmering like the photo. I would not recommend it nor would I buy it again. A waste of all that time and money.update:  Well I ordered another one from another vendor to see if that made any difference, and to my surprise it did! The new one I got looks exactly like the photo, and the crystals are very bright and pretty! It also doesn't look tarnished like the other one does. I wouldn't have thought they could have been the same item, but I guess which vendor you chose makes a huge difference on the quality of the product.  Lesson learned, and something to think about when making purchases.

Easy to drink from and leakproof.

title: Bring Back the 80s
review: This exercise gear is bringing back the 80s. It is actually quite a good work out. You really can feel it in the thighs and glutes.

title: Exceeded My Expectations!
review: This inflatable paddleboard has exceeded my expectations. I love that it's versatile and can easily convert to a kayak. It's much sturdier than I would anticipated. This is not your swimming pool float quality. Once it is inflated, you can see how sturdy and firm it is. I was able to set this up on my own for the most part. It does take a little bit of time to inflate. It took about 5 minutes to get it looking like a paddleboard, but it took at least another 5 minutes to get it to a PSI of 12. It took a little longer to get it up to 15 PSI which is the recommended minimum. My husband took over after my 5 minutes because I was getting tired! We will definitely want to invest in an electric pump. A manual pump is included and it's also recommended for deflating it as well. I tried to deflate it without the pump and it did release a lot of the air by just sitting there. But it wasn't enough to pack it back up so we used the pump again. It comes with a paddle that can be converted to the 2 types of paddles - kayak & paddleboard. The seat is easy to install with clips/D-Rings. There's a repair kit. Everything stores nicely in a backpack style carrying bag which is nice and that bag easily fits into the trunk of my daughter's Honda Civic.
