title: avoid this product breaks very easy
review: horrible product over priced breaks after one use and did not get tire off

title: These are not as reflective as I had hoped they would be; wish I had invested the money in a vest instead
review:
I purchased a black pair of these gloves at Marshall's for $4.99 ($10 off the current Amazon price) so that I have something reflective on when I walk in the dark of night. Although, I do wear blinking lights on my backpack and one on my cap, I wanted something for the body other than wearing a vest.

On the positive side, these gloves are thin but have a felt interior that keeps my hands warm when walking. They are like texting gloves but without any finger slots. Four fingers slip through the top and the thumb through the side and all fingers remain exposed. What I don't like about them is that both my friend who I walk with and I do not find these particularly illuminating. When a car's headlights hit them, the design on the gloves are supposed to reflect back. However, they are only mildly reflective in my opinion. Had I known this I actually wouldn't have purchased them even at the low price of $4.99.

On the other hand, if one wants texting gloves without finger holes for four fingers, then this will do fine. For what I purchased them for, I am disappointed. I think it best to invest in a reflective vest instead. I decided to purchase this [[ASIN:B01E68SUVM Fluorescent Green vest]] since these gloves are not satisfactory for that purpose.

title: good mate for a department store bike
review:
More evidence that there's no free lunch. I really wanted a Burley Nomad I saw on Craigslist for $100, but I was too slow and missed it. I should have either waited to find another used Burley or just paid the steep price for a new one. I wanted those three things you can't have all at the same time: fast, good, and cheap.

The Allen Explorer trailer is okay, and I do use it every week for groceries for me and the wife. For that purpose it gets me by with no problems. If that's all I wanted to do with a bike trailer it would be fine.

However, I have just started cycling to gigs (I'm a musician) and when I need to bring my own amp it's really awkward. When I think about covering real miles with a trailer my gut feeling is that this one is heavy, slow, and prone to wearing out faster than one made with an aesthetic/ethic/IDK similar to the bicycle itself - you know, ultralight, rigid, smooth rolling, made to last for decades or more.

Lately every time I have to drive my car I curse this trailer and start thinking about biting the bullet and paying for a Burley.

Besides the weight and general clunkiness of the trailer, a couple things stand out as reservations regarding a recommendation on the Allen Explorer. First, the tires are pretty weak, as others have pointed out. 30 PSI is no joke - I had a blowout after I forgot and pumped them up to 50, which is what is embossed on the tire itself; but I was able to ride home with no inner tube - even with a load of groceries - so mark a point for the cheap tires. The other thing that bugs me is that the floor of the trailer is nowhere close to rigid. It hasn't caused any problems yet, but it makes feel less enthusiastic about this trailer, and pretty much rules it out as a long-distance candidate.

For anyone thinking about getting this trailer, I would just advise you to think long and hard about what you might possibly want to do with it. Don't be like me; I've had this thing less than a year and I'm already thinking about putting down another $340 for a trailer that is very similar but very much better. I'll be lucky to get a third of my money back out of the Allen trailer.

It is a nice plushier sweatshirt material. And the cut is extra, too. It has a rounded hem at the bottom and is slightly longer than a regular hooded sweatshirt. It just makes it that much cozier. It fits a man without looking feminine. But ladies, size up and this is perfectly wearable with leggings!

title: Practice balance

review: My grandsons loves them so if they are happy I am happy. They want to get them out every time they come over.

title: Size runs very small
review:
I got a pair medium sized, and they're super small. My hands are definitely not large hands, but these things are super tight and really difficult to put on and take off. I know they're supposed to be snug, but not tight!
Otherwise, on my right hand the fingers don't quite cover my knuckles so they've been scraped up a lot, but that's probably because my right hand is ever so slightly larger than my left(?).
They're ok padding-wise, but get the large set if you have medium hands!

title: Works, But I Have Used Better
review: This water flask looks and feels very cheap. It also has a lift sport nozzle. (As opposed to other brands that have a squeeze nozzle, so there is nothing to adjust or mess with while you run.)  It also doesn't fit my hand very nicely. I was hopeful, because my Nathan water bottle holder doesn't have a place for my phone. But I'll stick with the Nathan for now. This one is just too bulky and not as user friendly. It does seem to fit my husband better than me, I guess because he has man hands. My iPhone 4 does fit inside the pocket, though there is a little room, so it slides around a bit. But it feels secure in there and I am able to use the touch screen through the outer plastic.

title: Keep it clean!
review: A responsible gun owner does the following: (1) identifies a safe place to store the weapon; (2) attends training on how to use the weapon (properly); (3) knows how to clean the weapon; and (4) purchase the proper safety equipment to use while at the range (i.e., ear and eye protection). This Guard Tech Plus universal gun cleaning kit addresses #3. It is great. It comes with all the accessories needed for cleaning multiple-caliber weapons. The carrying case and the way the accessories are organized inside makes this relatively easy (a no-brainer) when cleaning a firearm. The case is very slim and can easily be stored (on a shelf, under the bed or in the garage). Overall, for those who like to keep their gun(s) clean, this is a great set to have.

title: So expensive

title: Beautiful, Convenient Lightweight Water Bottles with shoulder strap and detachable purse!
review:
I bought two of these portable, beautiful and convenient lightweight Water Bottles with a shoulder strap and a detachable purse. The ocean design is lovely!

The bottles are very comfortable with the shoulder strap. So nice! Included an extra rubber lid thing and a surprise gift! The straws are a perfect size and the mouthpiece is very comfortable to drink from.

Highly recommended!

title: Much thinner than I expected it to be...
review: When I ordered this, I wasn't sure what the mm thickness was and it doesn't show in any of the descriptions. I would be surprised if this is even a 4 mm thickness. While I realize this is only meant as a supplement to a regular yoga mat, I didn't really find that it offered much more support than my regular yoga mat, and for the price, it is just not worth it. I don't have the best knees, so I was looking good padding in order to continue my workouts indoors for the time being. I can't recommend this yoga pad. It needs to be much thicker to really provide the comfort needed.

title: Worked great but broke in less than 2 months
review: So this vest was amazing but after two months the stitching came loose which caused the pellets to leak. Super disappointed.

title: Looks good but lots of issues
review: If you want a cheap iPhone watch this is a good option BUT… it has as very short battery life if you’re trying to check messages and read the time all the time. I turned off notifications and I turned off the function that flashes the watch face everytime you raise your arm. The batter will run for weeks like that. If you turn all the things on you’ll have to plug it in every 4-5 days. Not awful if that’s your jam but I wear it all the time to keep track of steps and sleep and it just runs and runs and runs. One thing I don’t like is the mesh metal band. It snags on everything, clothing, hair, bedding any fabric. The hair thing is especially annoying. I’d recommend the non mesh bands. But the look of the mesh is cool. Also the magnet closure is always coming lose. It slides around and just isn’t tight enough. I fiddle with it a lot. Needs a stronger magnet and it’s less than a month and already tarnishing. Last thing, step count is low but it’s good for motivation and don’t get too attached to the watch face. My watch cycled through watch faces at random. Not sure why.

title: Looking forward to the real test in May
review:
I ordered these trekking poles for the. 3 Alaska trips coming up this year. As my knees, and I am getting older, it was time for me to get poles for my stability. I have tried these around my neighborhood on walks, and they feel good, so looking forward to the real tests coming up. Like that they collapse and come with a pack.

I am hoping to find some other larger rubber tips or feet for extra stability.

title: Five Stars
review: LOVE IT!!!!

title: Perfect coverup
review: Very impressed with the quality. They are easy to use, you just slip it on top of any can. Would be great fun if you wanted to prank a friend 😅

title: Good
review: Good delivery of chalk for lifts without the mess.

title: Small pin sized hole in one tube
review: There is a very small leak in one of the tubes it was a 2 pack I have to pump the bike up after 2 days very small leak not happy

way .. way .. too small !

title: Impressive protection for the slim profile - too bad about the sewn-on caps
review:
As a 40+ rollerskater I upgraded my basic protective gear to these a few weeks ago.

Pros
- Do not disappoint when cushioning falls. No shock to my knees, extremely protective
- Good straps : stay in place
- Slim profile : don’t get in the way of my tricks and casual cruising

Cons :
- Price is steep, but once you fall on those and don’t feel a thing, you’ll feel better about that.
- Caps are sewn on instead of velcro’d. That’s a major con bc you can’t replace them. Knocked down two stars for that. At that price they should be velcro’d.

title: Fun set
review:
I got this for my son, who is really enjoying it. He loves to play like he is a football player. It is a pretty comprehensive set. It comes with the outfit and then helmet. He is six and it fit him great. I was happy with the quality. We've washed it without a problem.

This is great for a small league where they don't want to spend the money for professionally printed uniforms. The numbers are easy to put on. You could dye the uniform if you want or decorate it. I am very pleased with this set and think it is good value.

title: too low for us old people, comfy but wish it was higher
review:
This chair is low, too low, for us old people. At least the chair has armrests that you can use to help get yourself up and out of it. It is comfy and I appreciate the storage pocket on the side. It gives me a place to put a gun and a flashlight for two-legged snakes that may be prowling around at night.

The carry case is cheap and probably won't last near as long as the chair.

I would give it one more star if it was taller.

title: 12 hour minimum for fruit taste
review: This item fits a lot more water than I expected. It seems small and slim, but once you get the water in, it fills the entire bottle. I tried kiwis and strawberries in bottle. I cut up two strawberries and half a kiwi and shook it up. Immediately, you cannot taste the flavor. It took about 6-8 hours for me taste the fruit. I would say that 12 hours or overnight may be better for flavor. I don't like the frosted/ ashy feel it has to it. I also had a problem with when I assembled all the parts after putting the fruit and water in, that the water began seeping out the cracks. I had to really tighten it for it to stop.

title: Broke after 1 week
review: Looks great, broke the ground first week I got it, too expensive

title: I love it. Have it in the house when not camping.
review: Sturdy, firm support. Good quality. Vibrant color. Easy to fold.

title: Not That Great
review: I bought them to try to keep my glasses from fogging up while wearing masks. It says it will work for hundreds of times. It worked for defogging about 100 uses. If you just want to clean your glasses, they’re fine. If you want lasting defogging properties, don’t waste your money. Now, I have a carload of wipes I’ll never use.

title: Well Made
review: I ordered this for my father for Christmas. The XL size fits him as expected. The construction of the shirt is good and the embroidery work is nice. He is very happy with his new shirt.

title: Tastes Great
review: I'm cooking for just me now so I decided to try these dried veggies so that I don't have to buy multiple veggies for small amounts needed in recipes only to toss out all that I couldn't use quickly. I wasn't expecting these veggies to taste so good. I thought I would use them in casseroles and soups but if I soak them first, they stir fry up nicely, too. This blend is very tasty. The carrots and the garlic are thinly sliced, the green and red peppers are cubed, the onion is minced, the peas remain whole, and the taste of the celery is pronounced.  I will definitely buy this blend again.

title: Great product
review: Love how it looks & it's durable

title: Cute but cheap
review: I’ve had this a few months but the canvas is pretty cheap and the zipper broke this week.

title: This gets the job done
review: Washes clothes well.  I would not recommend this for bulky or heavy items. but this is great for apartments that do not have laundry facilities, or your just tired of collecting quarters to spend at the laundry mat.  This does not spin the clothes dry, so I would recommend a Nina Soft Spin dryer.

title: A hammock lover's best friend!
review: Over the years, I've used hooks in trees, since we often go to the same spot to camp again and again--but that meant that I rarely got to use my hammock unless we were camping. My dad spied these and suggested them, so I got them.  I used this on our latest camping trip, and I'm in love!  They were super easy to use--just pulled them out, wrapped around the tree, and I had my hammock set up in just a few short minutes.  The only thing was that I had to add additional knots on both because even with the trees being the perfect distance, the knots weren't high enough on the slings to hold the hammock up (I'm also short, so I can only place them so high, but my brother, who is over 6 foot, still couldn't get them high enough without the new knots).  The great thing is, you CAN add knots, so it just took a second or two to knot, and then I was swinging away in my hammock.  They are lightweight and not bulky (they fit nicely into the bag I already carry my hammock in). I highly recommend for anyone who loves a lazy afternoon (or a comfy night!) out in nature.

title: Easy to use.
review: Used the Ab Sculptor for years when I was consistently working out.  The headrest on it started to crack.  This one is just like it.  Love it.

title: Almost too light
review: Great racket that almost feels too light. Plays well I’ve had a bit of trouble having to adjust to tension. It looks and feels great in hand. Overall I’m pleased with it.

title: Terrible
review: I just discovered this as it was the second one in a package. The tolerances on this one are absolutely terrible. This is not worth even a penny when it’s all crooked like this. I guess somebody fell asleep and the quality check line. Needless to say, I’m out of return time, so now I’m stuck with this piece of garbage. Word to the wise – inspect the stuff when it comes in

title: Five Stars
review: Excellent merchandise, reputable dealer, superfast delivery. That about says it for me...Great.

title: Another pretty looking failure
review:
Very disappointing.

Manufacturers are missing out on an entire segment of the population who needs knee braces - the larger folks. We aren't all athletes who need acl support. But yet again, this "xl" knee brace doesn't even fit past the knee itself.

I have two bad knees with OA in both. I could really use support. But even the larger ones never fit. This pull on is WAY too tight at every point above the actual kneecap.

The construction looks nice, but if you don't have a perfect BMI, keep looking.

title: HEAVY
review:
This is a heavy Treadmill. Not easy to open and close. If you are shorter than like 5'4 or have shoulder issues you may have problems with closing and opening. I'm glad I paid extra so the guys brought it to my upstairs office I. Pretty sure me and my husband could not bring it upstairs together.

On carpet it's impossible to move it around because the wheels don't work on carpet. Also it feels like it's gonna fall when its folded up because it doesn't quite stand on the carpet very well (its shaky). So I tend to leave it open because I fear that my 4YO is gonna mess with it and if it falls on her it's for sure going to either kill her or injur her for life. .. it works fine so far in terms of what it's supposed to do. But really not impressed with the open and close process and safety issues when standing on carpet (I'm pretty sure it's not too different on hard floors either) if it wasn't because I didn't want to deal with the hassles of returning this enormous heavy item (i tossed the box too) would have absolutely returned it. I very much regret this purchase.

title: Versatile!
review: So far, this hasn’t made it to the cooler - we enjoy using it  as a cutting board - it’s lighter than our big, heavy wooden ones, and is so easy to clean.  We can run it through the dishwasher and make sure  it is really clean - can’t do that with the wooden ones.  Very pleased with this versatile divider/board.

It has a classic look and design. It is 70% cotton and 30% polyester, so it keeps you cool and comfortable. It feels like a soft cotton that is stretchy. It fits as expected and washes well. You can put it in the washer and dryer. The only thing is that I think the average consumer will think this t-shirt is a little pricey. Definitely great for weekend wear. 4 stars

title: Four Stars

title: Poor quality control, apparently
review: I spent all the time setting this thing up, and when it was finally ready to go, the up/down resistance buttons had no effect on the bike.  I pulled it apart to double check and yep, it was hooked up correctly.  After a while of pressing, the down button on the bike is now broken (and no, I didn't start pressing harder to make it work, I know that won't have any effect on electronics).  Apparently wasn't made to endure a few dozen presses.  If I decided to keep it, I am now stuck with a bike that operates at one level of resistance.  I'm glad I bought it from a local retailer's online pickup...I love Amazon but I was worried of this very thing--if I needed to make a return I'd have to pay shipping at amazon, and this thing is HEAVY.  Do yourself a favor and pay a little more for a Schwinn.  It has program options, I'm sure better reliability (can't be any worse, right?), straps on the pedals and the option to plug it in if you want.  This thing is garbage.  Maybe you'd get lucky and get a good one.  Maybe not.  You've been warned.

title: Fantastic design!
review: Initial impressions:  I  bought a few of these to experiment with as I was more used to the HKS design with the twist knob.  I think this speedloader is ingeniously designed.  The reviewers that are griping about the difficulty of use?  I don't get it.  You literally put it upside down, seat your bullets, push and twist to lock into place.  When you expel your rounds you simply push the speedloader into place, when it hits the ejector star the rounds will release.  Viola!  Close your cylinder and you're reloaded for the next round of targets.  I just received these, so I'm reserving them at a 4 star with a potential updated review once I've used them a while.  My only concerns out of the package are the build material of plastic used in the locking "mechanism".  This could potentially cause a longevity issue but I'm reserving judgement until I actually see it fail.  I had also hoped these would work with my LCR line of 38's, but they do not unfortunately.  I had read mixed reviews of guys using these speedloaders with the LCR brand.  I'm not sure how they're doing it.  I even tried taking off the grips to see if it would work.  Possibly it works with the .357 framed variety, but most certainly will not allow seating to unlock the bullets in the .38spl LCR revolvers.  It will not permit the speedloader to clear the frame.  They do work really well with J-Frames and my SP101, so I'm keeping them to use with those revolvers.  If they hold up, I'd buy these over the HKS line as the actual funciton is more intuitive when reloading and most certainly faster.

My 6 year old plays on it like superman for her core strength. It's been sat on, balanced on, chucked over and over, landed on the floor and it has HELD UP SO WELL!! title: Nice usable set - some minor issues
review:
As hand exercise gear goes, this set covers the classics. The hand grips seem typical and the actual grips themselves are a durable and reasonably ergonomic. They're larger than som others, but not by much (as far as I can tell), but still, the larger size is a plus. I also like the fact that the tension is adjustable, though there seems to be no correlation between the "poundage" and actual pressure needed... One improvement might be some cushioning on the grips.

The stress balls have a similar situation... they're perfectly functional, and definitely usable, but one of them is labeled 20 pounds while the other is labeled 40 pounds. I cant tell a difference. Overall, a nice, usable set. Just some minor issues.

title: Not 4-Inch Thick at All
review:
When I bought this bike seat just two days ago, the seller advertised it as being 4-inches thick of foam. It's not 4 inches thick of foam.

On the back part, where one would not sit, the foam is about 3.25" thick. On the part of the seat where your bottom would sit, the thickness is just about 2.5" thick.

Because of the misleading claim of it being 4 inches thick, the level of comfort claimed is also not there.

review:

Make sure you utilize the Safety clip-on device! !

title: Great If You Are A Toddler That Goes On Camping Trips- Adults Not So Much
review:
I am recovering from a walking issue. As I continue to recover, I am trying to find ways to include some easy to store stools or small places to sit if I find myself in a situation where I have to stand for too long. This looked perfect.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes all disassembled in a drawstring bag with basic instruction sheet.

HOW TO ASSEMBLE
You take the elastic loop off of the pieces. Then you quickly assemble the pieces which are shock corded together to make a nice stool.

PHONE POUCH
There is a pocket on the front that fits most phones.

WHAT'S THE PROBLEM?
I was so thrilled to get this, but when I put it together, I was not sure if I should laugh or cry. The stool is TINY. I am talking TODDLER TINY. It is not quite 12 inches off the ground and there is nothing to hold on to to get up. This is almost like sitting on the floor- not quite.

If I were to open this up and sit in public while waiting, I am sure I would like weird. It is a very tiny stool which is perfect if you are a toddler. As an adult, it is ridiculous looking.

THE BOTTOM LINE
I had high hopes for this thing. It is so ridiculously tiny that I can not use it. Maybe the cat can have it be her seat in the summer when we are camping. Maybe there is a toad that needs a chair.

MY RATING
ONE STAR. This should be pointed out to be for children or very very small people. It is not suitable for most adults I know- even older kids laughed when I showed it to them. For toddlers, I would give this four stars (because it is tough to put together for toddler ages). For adults ONE STAR.

title: Disgrace
review: This is pretty low Amazon

title: Perfect for the Pool or Beach
review: I often take my kids to the pool and there's nothing they love more than paddling around with their swimming goggles. I grabbed this two pack to have on hand since it seems like their goggles are always getting lost, and it quickly became their favorite set of goggles. They are easy to adjust and don't fog up. I like that they came with a convenient carrying bag so you can gather up all your equipment after swimming and keep track of it in your gear bag. I also like the ear plugs which prevent the annoying sensation of getting water in your ear. The ear plugs are comfortable and work much better than a swimming cap. These are a great set of goggles for anyone who enjoys spending time in the pool.

title: UPDATED REVIEW!
review:
UPDATED: This lantern didn't last more than a year an a half. I think we used/recharged it around half a dozen times. Super wasteful and expected long lasting quality from this name brand.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
This lantern is so bright and awesome! This is easy to use and feels really well made. The clear plastic is very thick; I would consider the plastic to be as thick (if not thicker) than a name brand water bottle. It should be able to take a beating. And the color the lantern throws off isn't too "white" and eye straining either, unlike like the old vintage lanterns had.
The mini flashlight on top is nice too, especially for when you don't want to light up the entire tent space.
The only thing I don't love about it so far is the red USP cord is short. But those cords are a dime a dozen and we have many around the house, so it's was not a deal breaker for us. Also know the removable battery is kind of big. I barely consider the battery pocket sized. But love that it is multipurpose and that I can charge another device off of it if necessary. We'd highly recommend this lantern!!!

title: I had lost my first band that was given to ...
review: I had lost my first band that was given to me so I ordered one. It is ok,but still had many of the same problems as the first one. Doesn't always connect. Have to actually unpair it and pair again for it to connect.

title: Extremely bright, well made, compact flashlight, great belt case and cool charger !
review:
I own several Olight flashlights. The Seeker 2 Pro is the brightest one I have. It is bright! They got a ton of light into a small package. I could repeat the features of this light but the Amazon order page does a great job of listing the features of this pocket powerhouse.

One feature of many Olight flashlights is the magnetic charger. This gives me the ability to recharge either at home or in the car. The included L dock is very neat. The belt case seems very well built also.

This is my first flashlight that shows both the battery strength and output level right in the button. The Olight Seeker 2 Pro has a good feel in my hand. I like the rubberized grip areas.

The 1200 lumen output on high is enough for most any need I have. If more is needed then the 3200 lumen output on turbo is very impressive. This unit can go from 5 lumens ( moonlight mode ) to 3200 lumens ( blinding ) The strobe light should be enough to temporarily blind and disorient an attacker.

This is to me, a very impressive flashlight package that I will enjoy for years to come.

Update 8/7/2019 After using this light more, I am still impressed with. It still has a great feel to it. You can feel the quality in it. It is amazingly bright, packed with features with great customer service to back up great products.

title: Time Spent Unrolling Bands When I Could Have Been Stretching!
review: My mother began physical therapy a few months ago for severe back pain due to arthritis. In PT and when she exercises at home, she uses stretching bands. I tried one of her bands (different brand than Theraband) and liked it, so I ordered these Therabands via Vine for myself.  Unfortunately, these bands did not work well for me at all.  I was able to get just a few leg stretches in before the bands rolled up. (all bands in the pack did this!)  I had to repeatedly start the stretches and then stop to unroll the bands so often, it got to the point where it just wasn't worth it any longer to continue.

I wouldn’t trust a drink (especially without a lid or glass) to stay put. But I could care less cuz I only use it for sitting. I use other frozen bags (pack it-sold on Amazon as well) to keep things chilled. The most I use the side table things for is keys/book, etc.  All and all, I love the chair itself. Folds flat. Which I also like. I can slide it between shelving in our storage or actually flat in my trunk, etc. I would buy it again.

title: Stand in Place and Putt Away!
review:
Golf is one sport for which there is always room for improvement. And one of the areas where many struggle is putting. Getting the grip, the aim, the stroke, and everything else just right takes time and effort and Club Champ is here to help with the task.

With this Club Champ product, you get nine feet of putting area to practice and improve your skill. The carpet comes folded and it can take time to work out the creases, but once flattened you are ready to grab a golf ball, your favorite putter, and start practicing.

Probably the best feature of this Club Champ product is the ball return. It works well and continuously sends the ball back to you. I like that I can stand in one place and putt the ball over and over again. This makes it nice not just for putting practice, but also for kids who can entertain themselves without much frustration.

It’s cool to have a way to practice one’s putting, but there are problems with this product that lead me to lower my rating. The biggest issue I have is with the construction. It is made about as cheaply as possible, apparently for maximum profits. And yes, the design, with its sticker “traps” for sand and water and its background of trees is silly. But it’s the construction that bothers me the most. With repeated use, it’s only a matter of time until the putting green tears or something breaks.

My overall opinion of this Club Champ product is average overall. I was torn between 2 and 3 stars, but I will go ahead and give it 3 because it does succeed at what it was intended to do: Help you practice putting and returning the ball so that you won’t have to chase it down. Take away the ball return feature and it would lose its appeal, but as it stands, it’s acceptable enough to earn a slight recommendation.

title: Overpriced

Dont forget the!

title: Very useful product !!!
review:
This stove is meant for camping but I bought it to use over my fireplace in winter, in the event that we have a power outage,

We have had a few long outages lasting several days over the past few years and I live in cold Michigan !! I had been setting my barbecue grill top over the firewood, but it was cumbersome. I bought the stove early summer and have not used it yet for the intended purpose.

Instead I have been using it for regular summer grilling on my deck !!!

This stove is perfect for 1 or 2 persons. It is easier to handle and clean up than my regular barbecue grill.

I just use a few thin branches and chicken/veggies get one in 20 minutes.

I will be grilling much more this summer :)

title: One of my new go-to bits, highly recommended
review:
I was a little cautious to try this bit at first, being so different from usual and a little on the thin side. But after trying it on a few horses it's become one of my go-to bit (and I'm pretty particular). The joints give it a nice amount of play and provide some tongue relief. The greenies really seem to like it and it's been great for introducing horses to contact. They get a nice firm feel they can trust, and the fact the sides can move independently give them an introduction to a the greater independent movement they'll experience from more mobile bit (like double joints).

Far from being too thin, I find the bits fit horses' bars much better than, say, a rubber bit or happy mouth, which are often either too thick to be comfortable or just too much bulk in a green horse's mouth. There's enough bulk for the horse to feel and trust, but it's thin enough that if you need control it's there - unlike a rubber bit. I was concerned the joints might pinch but I haven't seen any sign of horses acting like it does. And it's surprisingly flexible, curving into a nice C shape which again has a clear limit the horse can trust when introducing contact.

The D rings help the but from sliding as well as make turning cues more understandable - when turning the opposite side D pushes on their lips to bring the head around, it's not just pressure on the inside bar.

I've been entirely thrilled with the response from this bit, and it's my new go-to greeny bit. Every horse I've put it in seems to really like it and I've seen dramatic improvements in contact over too-remedial rubber/plastic bits, and too advanced highly mobile bits. Also an excellent choice for horses who like a quiet bit, or a rider with noisy hands. My horses have given me light and amazingly consistent contact - the only horse I'd recommend against using this bit on is one who wants to be extremely heavy in the contact by leaning on the hand (usually this begins from rider error btw), who prefers a bit with a lot one movement of play, or one with a bull-neck who locks against the bit (I think you could still handle that in this bit if the rider is comfortable).

Anyways I love this bit and highly recommend it for greenies or restarts with mouth issues. I plan to buy another one or two in the future.

title: Quick Dry and Drying
review:
I love these microfiber towels. They take a little getting used to at first but I've used them for years now and this brand is just as good as the others I've owned. I hate super fluffy and as some describe them 'luxurious' terry cloth towels. I'd step out of the shower, wrap myself in a big, heavy towel and I'd be sweating in moments. What's the sense of getting clean if you're going to get all sweaty before you leave the bathroom. I grab a microfiber towel and I'm 95% dry in moments. I don't break a sweat. The towel dries in a fraction of the time a heavy terry towel does. Comes with a bag for transportation that I've never used and has a loop with a snap to hang from a hook which I have.
Highly recommended for home, the gym, camping. A great towel.

title: Universal Adult size for whom? An Oompa Loompa?
review: I'm 5'11" and 195#. I'm not skinny, but I'm not Jabba the Hutt either. I ordered universal adult size. This might fit an oompa loompa, but it won't fit your average adult male. Sending it back. Seriously, who do they use to test these sizes on in China? Disappointed. Ordered a kayak and have to wait for my new vest to arrive before I can use it. It might works for a toddler. Good luck!

title: Sturdy but heavy asf
review: Picked this up for an upcoming camping trip I’m planning. Great tent not doubt it will hold up to any adverse weather or conditions I might run into however it is heavy. I was more concerned with durability than weight on this one but if your camping trip has a lengthy backpacking portion you’ll probably be better off with a lightweight option. If you’re camping somewhere where you can drive right up to your camping spot and there’s not much carrying involved then this is gonna be a great durable option for that. All in all great tent.

review:
This does what it claims. It packs into a very small area. It is lightweight and pretty easy to put together. I have not been camping yet to try it. I do think I will really appreciate the table clamp that holds it to a picnic table. It would be kind of short if you used the ground stake.

Overall, I like this and am happy to have it.

title: Easy to Use
review: This vest is not an official PFD but it does have some of the features of one. It's easy to inflate and use. The leg straps are a bit awkward. They didn't fit around my thighs, but they did fit around my daughter's. It's lighter than a PFD and less bulky which is a plus. I personally wouldn't let a non-swimmer rely on it, but for an experienced one in a calm setting, it's adequate.

title: Not magic like I hoped for
review: It’s just a light towel. Dries super fast and size is good but it stays cool for about two minutes then you feel like it’s a winter scarf around your head. Good to wipe sweat but that’s it. Pretty lame purchase I gave them away to my friends I only kept one. There’s towels out there you snap and they get cold again and again as long as they are wet. This is NOT one. Donate the money to save the honey bees or something else because this is just a waste of money in my opinion. They are packaged awesome and individually and the colors are nice.

title: Multi Use Light
review:
This is a great light. I use lights like these for cycling, camping, running and cross-country skiing, and this is one of the best lamps I've ever used. The straps are easy to adjust and big enough to fit over a cycling helmet (which is a huge plus). The three lights allow for a super bright beam. There's even a strobe feature, although I don't know what that would be for exactly (maybe for signaling help).

The batteries come packaged within the case, but note that you have to remove the plastic wrapping on the batteries before using the item (you can't just pull this out of the package and turn it on). A charger is included and hooks up with ease.

Very good bright light. Use it for household projects or scaling Mt. Everest.

I received a free sample in exchange for an honest review.

title: It does work, but it's really hard & uncomfortable. Leaves a tender place on my forehead
review:
I have mixed feelings about this snorkel. On the one hand it does just what they say it does. On the other hand, it doesn't do these things well. I chose this to use in our pool as I begin to get serious about swimming laps for exercise.

The snorkel itself works fine - air comes in smoothly and every time I inhaled. It's long enough to allow for a slow back stroke without watersplashing into it and it is fine with a traditional side stroke. The problem is with the head band thing.

The clear straps are somewhat adjustable for fit, but the front piece that braces against your forehead is really uncomfortable. It isn't flexible and it's hard. It just pushes against the forehead and hurts. Like leaning into the window sill. I have tried this twice and both times I ended up with a red mark on my forehead after just 15 minutes. I've just taken the head strap off completely and I'll have to try to make the snorkel work without it.

title: Think Twice-apx 50% Restocking Fee, $7.96 plus you pay Mailing Fees, apx $4, to send back
review: Exchanged for different size and sent back in original unused condition.  Seller charges excessive fees upon returns/size exchanges making returns very pricey with apx 50% Restocking Fee, $7.96?! plus you pay Mailing Fees, apx $4, to send back.  Knee pad seems like a decent quality but if you are right at 18.5 inches on bent knee, XXL may be a little too large while XL maybe too small.

title: Good shirt

title: A must have for any campers big, small, young, old!!
review:
Awesomely great invention..!! Better yet, these pack up perfectly for anyone doing some outdoor camping and need to carry their own gear on foot to their destination.. Ha! Such a luxury once you set up camp!

The kaleidoscope design along with the zip around carrier makes this no bigger than a young girls church purse! The over the shoulder strap is also a bonus.. even your younger hikers could carry their own- it’s just too perfect!! The weight is the equivalent of carrying 2 disposable plastic water bottles- just to give you some perspective!

Once erect and locked into position this seat stays secure under the weight of even a large male adult without issue- I was shocked how sturdy this could actually be.. made of woven/interlocking plastic!!? And yet- it’s the woven structure that gives this it’s strength.. it’s such a novel concept- Pure wizardry!! When ready to put away- a simple “unlocking” twist allows for stool to collapse and zip closed.. The easiest part of camping by far!

These are great for seating but, they also make a solid makeshift table.. I loved the fact, they can be washed off so easily with water, rinsed with a hose.. dunked in a river- **I just recommend you let them dry completely before storing in the carrying case!

For any who find themselves needing a seat outdoors on the go.. camping, soccer game, or just a front yard seat around a fire pit- this delivers just as it says it will. Storing in a trunk is so easy.. with their tiny footprint you’ll never even know it’s there! I recommend without hesitation.. I hope this info can help your decision- happy adventures!

title: Very strong magnets
review: Five stars because of the quality of the magnets.  We've had other magnetic darts and they always bounce off the board because the magnets are too weak.  These things stick like glue.  The only complaint is that the way they're packaged you can get a few with bent shafts. But they're plastic so you can just bend them right back.

title: Water poured out when lid was closed...One Star.
review:
Very disappointed. I was looking forward to using this !

I washed my Mossy Oak Double Wall Stainless Steel Travel Mug with soap and water using a soft kitchen brush.
Filled it up with fresh filtered water, put it in my frig.
The next day I took it out as I was leaving the house, but first made sure it was closed.
Turned it up side down in the sink, and The water started coming out through the sides all over.
I then slid the lid back to make sure it was close, then opened it, then slid it back to close again, and the water poured
out all over again.

Mine came with a silicone washer around the lid, that did NOT screw down, and was hard to push on, but it leaked all over.
Also when I washed the lid with soap and water, the soap was hard to rinse out of lid that has the part that you
slide to open and close.

I’m glad I did not have hot coffee in this travel mug, and tried to drink it while I was in the car or anywhere.!
What a awful mess it would have been, beside getting burned.

If I did something wrong let me know?
So far this is a One star.
Made in China

review: Ya get what you pay for. My husband bought a very expensive version of this kind of pump yrs ago, recently my son accidentally broke it (his fault not the pump as it would have likely lasted for yrs more with normal use) anyway so we bought a cheaper version.. after having a higher quality one it's ok for now but I can tell it won't last long :/

title: Comfortable!
review: Finally, a comfortable camping chair with a high weight capacity!! I'm a plus size fifty something woman. The weight limit on this chair is almost half as much as I weigh, so I feel confident sitting it in. I've been in chairs that had a maximum weight of 150 pounds and it's a bit scary! No one ones to be the one who sits in a chair and causes it to break! My adult son is a big guy at about 300 pounds. He can easily sit in this chair, without worrying about it. We also have a few big guys in our friend group. I'm pleased that we have a chair that will accommodate them. It feels sturdy and well made. It only has one cup holder, and it's the size of a regular can of soda. I was a little disappointed with that. Today, so many chairs have two cup holders and even side pouches. This cup holder won't even hold my mobile phone. Also, the carrying bag that comes with this chair is very thin and I have questions as to how long it will hold up. So while it's a very good chair, there are some areas for improvement.

title: Love it
review:
I love this water bottle. It fit all of my requirements:

half liter
non-straw
open mouthpiece for chugging
flip top (not screw top)
easy to clean
fits in cup holder

The fact that it's purple and has the measurements on the side and the nifty times of day is a bonus, along with the strap. Love it!

title: Vibrates really well, longterm effect unknown.
review:
I was surprised to find out the mayo clinic actually states you can lose some calories with these, I always thought they were a sham! So I got one to test and it vibrates extremely well! Very fancy well made piece of machinery! If any of them can give you weight loss- then this one surely will work for that! Quality seems great all around.

As for my opinion on whether it does what it should? I still remain unsure. I'll keep using it and see if it helps long term but it seems like it'd be hard to tell for sure whether or not it helps. Mayo clinic recommends exercising in conjunction with this machine so is that also their way of admitting not to put all of your eggs into one basket and this isn't a miracle cure? You can decide that for yourself. As for this product- it definitely vibrates and is well made so there's that!

I figure if anything I can possible dual purpose it and put a plate across it- use it for a vibration plate for resin and concrete casting to vibrate the bubbles out!

The ball is bright and vibrant, so it's easy to see no matter the conditions. It's low-bounce and resists deflation. I'd definitely put this ball on display. I highly recommend this product.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided makes your decision a little easier.

title: Nice water bottle!
review: I picked this up for my 11-year-old to take to school and it is the perfect size. He's been using it for over a month now at school and it is held up pretty well. It doesn't look brand new but it also doesn't look like it's been used for 2 years already. I've washed it on the top rack of the dishwasher around a dozen times. Only thing I don't like about it is the silly rubber stopper. It's a pain to get back in place and technically does not make this a leak proof bottle. My son's a fidgeter and he tends to play with it and, so we've had a couple of drip leaks. Still on the lookout for one that is truly, truly leak-proof.

title: Not durable enough for mountain biking
review:
I used these once, and they developed holes in the bottom already. There were only a few spots where I put a foot down or got off and pushed my bike. I don’t think these will hold up for much longer, especially if I use them on more challenging trails. Maybe these would work for road biking if you didn’t walk much, but I don’t recommend these for mountain biking unless you can ride the entire trail without stopping or putting a foot down.

Aside from durability, the shoe covers worked well. I rode for 2.5 hours starting at 24 degrees with low wind and it warned up to the low 30’s by the end. I was at a bearable temperature for most of the ride. And I had a few shallow water crossings and my feet stayed dry.

Also, the size xl fit very tightly over my size 9 shimano mountain bike shoes.

title: Cheap China quality product
review:
Update: I received the two Freez Kollant Can Cooler Packs I ordered from Amazon. These cooler packs are a good 30% bigger and the plastic is much thicker and more durable than the Rubbermaid cooler packs . Don't waste your money one the Rubbermaid cooler packs, the Freez Kollant cooler packs are the only way to go!

[[ASIN:B00CKZ9DBK 6 Pack Freez Kollant Can Cooler Pack Gel Cold Ice Substiute Hold 6 Soda Beer 2Pc]]

original review:
I was very disappointed when I saw these six pack cool packs. I am replacing a set that I have had for 5+ years. These are about 30% smaller than the ones I was using. Since these are much smaller in length and width, they don't have as much liquid inside them so they don't even last thru a full day - I am using 2 of these cool packs in my cooler. They are made of a very thin plastic which I don't believe will last very long before they start to leak. Overall I am very disappointed in the product and the quality. I only saw one other manufacturer of a 6 pack cool pack on Amazon, so I will probably try ordering those and see if they are better? That's my 2 cents......

title: Nice pullover that is true to size and warm but a bit thinner than I expected
review:
This is a nice pullover with a thin layer of fleece on the inside. It has a zipper at the neckline and no pockets. The Notre Dame patch is attractive.

This is definitely true to size. I normally take a large in a men's if I want a loose fit and this fits me perfectly with some room to spare. Despite its thinness, it is still warm.  To me this is half as thin as I expected and not as thick as a typical sweatshirt. Nevertheless, I still really like this. 

The current price of $53 for this is expensive but competitive due to the branding (logo / school / team patch).

title: Three Stars
review: i ment another kind

title: Fun to play.
review:
I ordered the 'Franklin Sports Whirl Ball Arcade Game - Game Room Ready Tool Free Arcade Game - Auto Scoring Electronics with Arcade Ball Return Ramp Great for Kids and Family Fun!' for review and would like to share my thoughts.
I had a little bit of a struggle putting this together as I was afraid of breaking the unit as it is made pretty much made entirely of plastic, but it did go together without breaking and set up pretty easy. You will need to provide 3 of your own AAA batteries which isn't a huge deal but I do wish companies would use even numbers of batteries. The score board works fine but it does seem a little flimsy the way that it mounts, but should hold up fine with normal game play. I personally wish that the ramp was a little longer but I am not a designer haha. Overall it is fun to play and the kids love it, however I do think that the original price point is set a little high for what you get.

title: Great alternative Puddle Jumper
review:
Well, the jury is still out on weather Puddle Jumper or Water Otter makes more sense as a brand name, but suffice it to say the two products are very similar. They both appear to work well and are good options for younger children to enjoy a pool with some additional safety. My two younger daughters will hopefully be taking swimming lessons this summer, but for now products like these give them a sense of independence in the water.
But be careful- by no means should this independence mean you leave them unattended in the deep end, and it honestly does not help them learn actual swimming skills. However what it does do is give them confidence. Much like training wheels, it helps them enjoy the experience before they are learning to do it properly, but you have to make sure they don't rely on it when it is time to learn how to do the real thing.
Plus for us is that this is pretty and pink, unlike our other puddle jumper brand one. Basically, the girls will generally fight over who gets to use this one. I might need a second one- but hopefully they will soon learn not to need it at all!

title: Great Board
review: Awesome board that my son loves....great for trick and beginners

title: Not for 16" bikes...
review:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* High quality, very nicely built kick stand.

THE BAD:
-----------
* Not for 16 inch bikes. I got this because the listing says compatible with 16 to 26 inch bikes. As you can see in the pictures, at it's shortest length, it is still way too big for a 16 inch bike. I purchased a different bike stand that was advertised for 16 to 18 inch bikes, and it fit perfectly. If you're looking for a real 16" kick stand, I recommend this one: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07X7MMKHJ/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1

This kickstand is actually pretty good quality, and I'm sure people who can use it will say it's 5 stars. I'm knocking 3 stars for the ambitious advertising of being able to fit from 26 inches all the way down to 16 inches, which it cannot do.

title: Woven bike "toto" basket
review: This is the PERFECT "toto" basket.  So much better than a metal basket that allows stuff to fall through.  It's very pretty with my metallic pink beach cruiser bike.  The first one of these I ordered was missing one of the leather straps... so that was a bummer... by Amazon quickly fixed it.  I will update info if new info would be useful... like wear and stuff...

review:
The idea is really nice, but the majestic portion that’s supposed to stick to the bike falls right off. It doesn’t last two days. I tried emailing customer support, but no one responded in over two weeks.
Don’t waste your time.

title: Very Nice Vest
review:
This electric fleece vest is very high quality and keeps you extremely warm even when the heating element has been turned off. It has two zip up pockets on the front and another over the left breast. There is also an inside pocket for the power bank necessary to operate the heating feature. Take note that this vest does not include a battery, but it features a standard USB plug that is compatible with most power banks.

The vest is operated by a single button that is located near the lower left pocket. You can toggle through three different heating settings. The vest is thin enough to be worn under a winter jacket, and is ideal for keeping you warm during activities such as hunting or spectating a high school football game. This is an attractive and comfortable vest that is perfect for fending off a chill.

title: Highly uncomfortable to use for any length of time; definitely NOT suitable for anyone processing large numbers of birds at once
review:
I clean pheasants for a game preserve. Cleaning 80-90 birds in one night, by myself, is not unheard of. My husband bought me a pair of these last year as a gift. They were more expensive than the shears I'd been using and were reccomended by the salesperson where he bought them, so he figured they would be a better quality tool overall.

It was a very nice gesture on my husband's part, but these shears turned out to be a huge disappointment.

The handles are probably the absolute worst design feature on these shears! They are skinny and hard...does not offer much stability and the hard rubber becomes unbearably uncomfortable after a while. The little nubby grippy things do nothing but dig into your skin. I was beginning to form blisters by the time I'd cut the feet & wings off of 5 birds. If the handles got even a little bit slick, my grip became very unstable; hands sliding down the handle as I'd squeeze to cut through bone.

The bone notch on the blade could be designed better too; it didn't seem to be deep enough to really grab & hold onto the bone as I was cutting. Other shears have a bone notch that's almost a half-circle. It's the perfect shape to hold onto the bone & give you the best leverage to snip right through. With these shears, if you don't carefully ensure the bone is situated JUST right in the little divot before you start squeezing, the bone will just slide down the blade and you'll end up trying to cut it with the middle of the blade which tends to work poorly.

The other major issue I had with these shears is that they bound up every time I cut through feathers & skin. When cutting through wings and especially tails, they'd bind up every time. Seemed like the blades just weren't sharp enough...but brand new, they should have been! Granted, most shears will bind up if you try to cut through a huge wad of feathers all at once or go in at the wrong angle...but these did it every. single. time. A pair of child's safety scissors might have done a better job. I even tried tightening the screw in the middle since it seemed like it wasn't tight enough....because I'd squeeze the blades closed as I made my cut and the feathers would all end up packed between the blades with a 1/8 inch seperation between them. I eventually realized it wasn't a loose screw, but rather the blades were flexible enough to *bend* when they got bound up on feathers and skin. Basically, I'd have to use the shears to break through the bone, then I was better off just ripping the wings and tails off by hand to prevent getting the shears bound up on them.

I made it through about 10 birds before I'd had enough. I had raw, cramped hands and I was having to manually rip appendages off of gamebirds. I still had 60 something birds left to clean and I was already exhausted. Something was wrong with this picture. I gave up and went back to my old shears, which were cheap (about half the price of these) dull, rickety and in need of replacing.....yet compared to the struggle I'd just put up with, they made the job seem effortless.

If you're a casual hunter who just likes to go out & shoot your limit a few times a year, these shears might be more than sufficient for you. If you're using them for smaller birds like quail, or for fish, they'd probably work fine. But if you need a pair of shears that'll stand up to heavier use for extended periods of time, while still being easy to handle and comfortable to work with....these are NOT the shears to buy.

title: Uncomfortable
review:
Bought this for my son, who is an avid kayaker and rafter, and spends his summers as a white water rafting guide: so he spends a great deal of time on the river and can be relied on for good advice when it comes to getting the right gear.

His verdict: this helmet is just plain uncomfortable to wear for several hours on the river. The headband rubbed his skin and put uneven pressure on his head, giving him a headache over time. After a couple days, enough time to give this helmet a fair chance, he decided it just wasn't going to work for him.

It is possible that others may have diferent experience, but for gear that is really going to make the diference between an enjoyable day on the river, or not: invest in something better.

title: May not be the popular opinion, but...
review:
So I saw this grill come up and it was perfect timing because the family was going camping. We needed a new grill so I grabbed this one. It's very well reviewed and I thought I couldn't go wrong. After a fair bit of use, I sort of wish I had chose something more standardized.

The unit I received is relatively fine although I do have some issues when opening / closing the unit. For instance, the right temperature knob pops off every time I open the grill. It's easy enough to slide back on. The support rod on the same side also tends to pop out of it's slot. Again, not a big deal since I can easily pop it back in place. The grill surface, when the unit is open and on a level surface, seems unlevel usually. All of these issues I'm sure can be corrected if I just take the time to bend whatever pieces of metal back into place because I assume it's just some sort of alignment issue. The wire for the piezo adapter pulled off the burner one time while opening the unit which is something I wouldn't have expected to happen. The big problem I have with them is the fact their adapter is set up for their own bottles. I ended up investing in their refill kit and a few additional bottles but they are not cheap. If you look around you can get them for around $25 a bottle and the refill kit you can get for around $35. Regardless, you are not going to just buy some camping propane bottles from Walmart and expect them to work.

I just feel there are cheaper alternatives out there which will allow you to go buy 1lb propane bottles anywhere and use them. That's not the case with this grill, unfortunately, unless you can track down an adapter.

title: Beach/Picnic Blanket that Doubles as a Table Cloth
review:
The picnic blanket that we have used for years is a classic red and white checker pattern vinyl rectangle. It's fine for small outings and it does provide a moisture barrier but it is small and not suitable for more than just one or two people. This is a very different blanket, suitable for picnics and for the beach and much better suited for larger groups.

Unlike a terrycloth blanket or a vinyl sheet, this blanket is made of parachute nylon which has the advantages of being very lightweight and water resistant. It also is very non-bulky and folds up into a small and compact bundle in the *attached* bag, to a size that is slightly smaller than the average purse. I would not have thought it would pack this small, but it's absolutely perfect for packing for a trip.

When completely unfolded this blanket is 7'x7', more than adequate for a group of 4-6 people. Being as light as it is, without anchoring at the corners it can easily get caught in the wind and blow around. So, each corner has a small elastic loop and included with the blanket is a set of 4 small stakes so that it can be better anchored down. Additionally, there are pockets on the corners so that additional weight can be added (rocks or sand) which helps even more when the ground is not suitable for relying solely on stakes. The packing bag doubles as a stash bag for things like sunglasses or a phone or it can be used to hold trash items until it's time to pack up again.

Though this is marketed predominantly a blanket it is more useful to me and to my family as a table cloth for picnic tables. Skyline Drive in Shenandoah National Park has several picnic areas that are wonderful places to stop and spend time for lunch and this blanket covers those picnic tables nicely. The packing bag again serves double duty - it works well for holding utensils (spoons, ladles, etc.) while the blanket is spread on the table and it can again hold small amounts of trash until packing up to leave.

This blanket is a very simple but very nice product that serves multiple purposes. It's fine for use on the beach and it works just for as a picnic blanket but it's just as useful as a picnic table cover. It packs up very nicely and is extremely portable and is not unreasonably priced.

Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: Very Attractive, Poorly Fitting Lid
review:
Bought this for my mom who just got a K-Cup brewer and her tall travel mug wouldn't fit in the brewer. She would give this 4 or 5 stars but I don't reward flawed design. I tried literally for nearly an hour to find a position to place the lid so when you screw it down the opening is at a right angle to the handle. This is how you expect to be able to comfortably drink your coffee. I must have tried fifty times or more and I never ONCE got the lid to screw on 'right'.
I would have, had I bought it for myself, returned it the day I received it but my mother absolutely loves the blue colors and patterns and she makes do drinking awkwardly from the lid. I'm only giving this 3 stars because she asked me not to give it the 2 I think it deserves. Pretty doesn't trump function. While it does keep coffee hot for a couple of hours the lid not lining up correctly would be a deal breaker for me. My mom is more forgiving.

title: Excellent Little Tool To Have Camping Or Roughing It
review:
I have been trying to get various bug zappers to bring with my family when we go to areas that are not close to a plug. This one is interesting. Let's take a look.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes in a small box with instructions.

CLOSED
Closed this is used for a light. It has brighter white light, dimmed light and a warning red light.

OPEN
Open this has the ability to zap bugs.

HOW WELL DOES THIS PERFORM?
This performs well as a light, but as a bug zapper, it really is not the season for heavy bugs like we will be having later in the season. I have not been able to catch the few tiny moths in the house, nor the few tiny fruit flies. That is no surprise, however, because this zapper is not very big and these guys have been all over the house.

The light part is nice for using when necessary to see at night. During power outages it also will be handy.

HOW THIS RUNS
This runs not only on USB charging,, but also works with AAA batteries(3) which don't come with it.

CHARGE TIME
This took a couple of hours to charge up fully and it lasts a few hours depending on how it is used. I usually charge after that, so I have not let it run completely down yet.

CAN IT HANG FROM CENTER OF TENT?
This does make a good light for hanging from the center of the tent when you want to see with an overhead light. It also would do well in that position as a bug zapper. It has a handle so you can twist tie it to the loops.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For using at a camp site or on a deck in summer, this is a nice little light to have at the table at night, or use for walking at night around a camp site. As for bug zapper, in the tent, I would have to have some eye masks to sleep with. The light would be too bright for me to sleep with.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. If this turns out to be a bug zapping wonder, I will stop by and update my rating on this zapper/light. As it is now, it works, seems to do what it is supposed to do, but situations are not dire enough to see how good it really is.

title: Trust the brand- total quality!!
review:
After a failed attempt at an off brand set of ankle weights.. I felt it best to trust the “big guns” when it comes to athletics and sports equipment.. Ha! Adidas didn’t disappoint- they know what they’re doing and have perfected the art.. Duh!! (Shame on me for doubting there would be a difference!)

Compared to others- these weights are leaps and bounds more compatible to the human body.. they are not just a ring of weights with a buckle, end of story! This set has been put to the test in its design and the cut.. Wow! This actually contours with the ankle or wrist- personally, I find it best fits the ankle! But, can definitely be used on either. Using a soft material this shows attention to detail in the cut.. NO sharp edges or corners to irritate the skin. Believe me- this makes all the difference. (with my cheaper set I had cotton stuffed in my sock to combat sharp edging.. which failed me btw and was so not practical!!)

The interior sand or gel(?) used to create the weight is evenly disbursed which also is a necessity. Placement depends on muscles strengthen appropriately- and this does it’s job in spades. Note: if unsure which size weight to order.. keep in mind user activity and length of time! Trust me, even 2-3lb. seem light.. right up until 10min. into a run, workout, or even a walk- and you will feel it adding a difference! I chose 3lb. and find it compatible for those at an intermediate workout level.

Definitely recommend and admit its worth the extra investment to purchase a set from a trusted athletic company- you won’t be disappointed! Hoping this info can help your decision.. stay safe.

title: Quality, taste, & smell is as expected. Rehydrates well, tastes good dry. Mix of chunks & powder
review:
--->>>Cooked, freeze dried chicken in a #10 (ie "number ten") can. Just under 1 lb of chicken. Can eat as is, or rehydrate. Mix of chunks, shreds, and powder. Best use is as a compliment to a dish, rather than as the focus of a plate. Think chicken tacos, soups, casseroles.. stuff like that. Might be ok made into a chicken salad sandwich. Smells like chicken, tastes like chicken. Is on par with other freeze dried chicken. It is no worse than other brands, might be better than some I had. If price looks good to you, and you want a trusted brand, then this ReadyWise freeze dried chicken will be a welcome addition to your food supplies.

I do not rate on price, if I did then I would be rating low. $120 is steep. Prices fluctuate, we all have different budgets, needs, preferences. And current market for emergency food is volatile. I am a bit of a prepper, and I do include emergency packaged products into my long-term storage. I am keenly aware of price fluctuations and that some brands are simply marked at a premium price. ReadyWise is definitely one of them, by far. Nearly double in some comparisons. A more budget friendly option is Augason. Just need to shop around. I can say that this is quality chicken, quality brand, and the extra may be worth it. So with this review I will focus on quality, and include some ramblings regarding filling out your pantry and why, Things to think about.

I really don't focus on "emergency" packed foods. I buy my usual canned/boxed/bagged foods a little at a time, and rotate. I stack my fridge and freezer. I should learn to can and prep my own foods better. In more recent times I have been adding in emergency packed products but usually only when they are on sale. Always been a bit of a "prepper", since I was a toddler it seems, haha. It has served me well through power outages, sicknesses, unemployment, and even bigger stuff like the pandemic, and now... *vaguely gestures around* everything else that is going on. Prices are all over the place, sometimes food isnt available (many times this year I have gone to a store and they have been 100% out of basic chicken, and I am not about to drive all over to find chicken, waste gas time money.. ). I've never been one to be without when anything has come up. I never did "emergency food" if only because I didn't have the budget. I would stick with typical foods and try to store them well. Well now I have a little more wiggle room in my budget, and with the on and off sales of long term storage (20+ years), I take advantage when I can. This ReadyWise is really expensive at $120 per can, AND it has a best buy date of only a few years out. It really should have at least 10 years, and upwards of 25. It is packed the same as other emergency food brands, so I would think that this too should be fine for the duration. UNLESS they mean once opened.. then yeh, I can understand that shorter date. Either way, its all fine by me (when stored under proper conditions food like this should last forever).

I've been adding in emergency packed items to further shore up my options. Chicken is versatile, and I can share some with my dogs and cats if need be (don't forget to prep for them too!). I like buying the #10 cans and tucking them away. Forgetting about them. They stack well, have a uniform appearance, and if they are anything like other brands, the #10 cans should float. I don't live in a flood zone, but these should stand up to water, even with denting. Just remember, all food products are sold based on weight, not volume. Expect to see a half empty can on many foods. Most companies don't do different sized cans because of the preference for uniformity. I tend to see #10 cans, small buckets, large buckets, and the occasional barrel. They all stack.

Does the term prepper freak you out? Everyone's SHTF scenario varies. Doesn't need to be doomsday. I have lived through enough and experience enough that I am always grateful for a little PROACTIVE thinking. Has gotten me through A LOT. It could be bad weather (tornadoes, hurricanes, blizzards, ice storms), could be illness (simple headache to viral and beyond), could be road trip gone wrong (you do keep supplies in your car too, right?!), could be unemployment, sky rocketing prices (yesterday's prices is money in my pocket today) or power outage, or lack of transportation, or oven/fridge/other appliance break down, lock downs, or bigger stuff like plagues, food shortages, supply chain issues, *cough WW3 cough*, etc. No matter the situation we all need some things to get by: we need food, water, shelter, some hygiene and medical stuff, and so on. You don't have to stack "emergency supplies" but you do need to stack shelf stable food items. I don't like to live by "just in time inventory". I prefer to have my working daily pantry, then have extra tucked away that I can pull from as needed. Can't get to the store for a few days, a week, a few weeks? I'm good.

Buy a few extra things every single time you go to the store. Don't need to stockpile all at once. Little bit here and there adds up nicely. If you get to a spot that you feel comfortable and have the budget, then grab the "emergency" items like ReadyWise, Nutristore, Augason, etc offers. I like adding it in and just forgetting about it. It provides a good feeling (psychologically comforting) knowing that something is there if/when needed. Also works great as camping or hiking food (again if price is right). Looking for some practical gift giving ideas? I am a big fan of survival gear, food, tools. I'm known to give smoke detectors and batteries, fire extinguishers, rechargeable light bulbs, and for the extra special in my life-- emergency food. Ones that will recognize the importance.

Anyway, all told.. I give 5 stars because the can arrived in perfect condition, arrived quickly, chicken smells and tastes as expected. It is exactly as it should be. Price is insane to me, but I knew the price when I ordered.

title: A good value, versatile
review:
This is a good home workout weight set. The spinning adjustable weight discs make it really easy to change up how much you are lifting for different uses and different people on the fly, and the mechanism to spin them is very satisfying and smooth. The only thing to keep in mind is that sometimes if they aren't lined up perfectly, it can be a little bit difficult to lift it up. You have to make sure sure they are lined up.
Also, I noticed that right out of the box the label for the brand is already starting to peel.
This is totally aesthetic and has no effect on how the product is used, however it feels weird to see that happen on a brand new item. Otherwise it looks pretty sleek and I'm happy to recommend it.

They are adjustable so you can make them fit you. The kids said they were fine. They helped keep the water out. I would recommend them.

title: soak and/or cook by itself before adding to other food to get successful rehydration
review:
Pointing out a few things brought up in reviews:

1. This is DEHYDRATED zucchini, NOT freeze-dried. Very different methods, different results, different pricing. While Mother Earth does carry some freeze dried, they do not have freeze dried zucchini. Another way to tell? With freeze dried foods, they can be eaten as is (crunchy snack) or rehydrated. Where as with dehydrated foods, most all (except fruits, usually) will need to be rehydrated in order to consume them (too tough to eat). This will require soaking and/or cooking for a period of time. Can't just toss it in the dish you are making and expect it to cook up quickly. So for this, it says to simmer 1 part zucchini to 2 parts water for 10-30 minutes. This very well may take longer. I let it cook for no less than 30 minutes before adding it to what I ultimately want to have it be part of. Another way to get it started is to let soak, then follow up with a shorter simmer.

2. 1/2 cup dried zucchini = 1 cup cooked zucchini. I made up 1/4 cup and it made a very good sized portion. See my pics.

3. End result is NOT EVER going to be same as fresh. Stop that. Then stop blaming the company/brand. YOu will always be disappointed. Best thing to get if you cant get fresh or frozen is to find a company who makes freeze dried. Even then, you are expecting a lot from zucchini. This is similar to others, and there aren't many out there to choose from.

4. Shelf life can be very very long, if not indefinite if stored under proper conditions. Freeze dried for sure, but dehydrated can last a very long time. Be sure to keep it in well sealed container, out of light and dampness. Maybe keep in freezer or further repackaged into mylar or vac sealed jar.

5. Taste is neutral. Kind of like how zucchini can be. I could tell it was zucchini though! I found that with proper rehydration it worked well in adding bulk to tacos, and can always be added to soup. I see it as a nutritional item rather than a way to have a plate of zucchini. Nice way to bulk up meals, add vitamins and minerals, yet not have to rely on fresh (for various reasons). I noticed that the skins were more like late summer yellow squash/zucchini. Kinda reminded me of regular squash- like butternut skins. Not tough but had more "presence" I shall say. DID not taste or feel like "tree bark" in any way.

6. If planning on using it in zucchini bread, muffins, cookies, or sauces, I would recommend running it through the blender after it has been rehydrated. Make it more of a puree. This will impart flavor and decrease any tougher bits.

7. Says processed and packaged in USA, but WHERE do they get their vegetables from?? That I havent seen, here or on their web page

8. If you dont like this packaging, they also offer mylar bag style.

OVERALL: I think it is fine, and it as expected. I love seeing it in my pantry knowing that I have a variety of dehydrated foods to use when I cant get fresh, or food is scarce, or food doesnt look good, or I cant afford it that day. Buy a little here and there and stock up those cupboards. Would like to know where the zucchini comes from?

PS. I miss when we could comment and ask questions of other reviewers. One person just said "poisonous". Like, what do they even mean by that? I had this a few times and doing well so far :)

title: No Help Needed
review:
If you're enjoying the outdoors on a solo trip, it's important to have a tent that you can set up by yourself. This tent goes up in less than five minutes with no help required. The tent is lightweight and can easily be attached to a backpack for carrying. The dome shape gives you more interior space than an A-frame style. The waterproofing comes in handy if you get caught in a downpour. This is a great overall tent. I highly recommend it.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided helps make your decision a little easier.

title: buy it!!
review: great

I swap this one back and forth with the H brand bi-pod on a mini-14 and M1a.  Have yet to notice a difference in the function of either.  Time will tell.. but overall impressed with the quality, value and features
