It was very hard for her to open and close when she first got it but it has gotten a bit easier. She has to touch the straw to push it down and close since she isn’t strong enough to use the handle to close it. Other than that it is great and unique design. Doesn’t leak when the straw is down. Keeps water nice and cold.

title: Looks Nice
review: This is a standard sized steering wheel cover, but it didn't fit my friend's vehicle that I bought it for (GMC Terrain). It looks very nice and it felt like it was made of good materials. I think it would work well for small vehicles versus SUVs and trucks, maybe.

title: Great Size for Day Events!
review:
My husband is an active "Band Dad" and "Scout Dad". He often needs to take extra items with him when he's volunteering. Prior to ordering this bag, he would take an full sized old school backpack that one of our kids used to use. Those backpacks are bulky in size for his purposes and not waterproof. We've had a rainy fall this year so nearly every marching band event has been wet. This backpack is perfect for him! There's enough room for him to keep his jacket, safety vest, rain poncho, snacks, a couple of tools and a flashlight. The side pouches can easily accommodate a large water bottle. There are enough compartments for his needs without having too many that go unused. When he sets it on the ground, his belongings stay dry! The zippers are sturdy and move easily. The whole thing is pretty lightweight & can be folded up and taken with you as in extra bag if needed.

*I purchased this at a reduced price for the purpose of trying it out & reviewing. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: Measure before
review:
Bought it for my son but he was expecting something bigger
It's in his room in the corner he loves Chicago Cubs

title: Nice treadmill
review: This treadmill isn't as fancy or sturdy as my gyms treadmills but it's also a fraction of the cost. I'm a bit bigger 215-220, wanting to be 170 :) At my current weight it make a bit more noise than I'd like. I've done all the suggested adjustments but it still bounces around with my weight. When my kids or wife use it there is little to no noise/vibrations at all. I'm thinking my extra weight is the cause and the fact that its on the second floor. It has all the same features as any treadmill I've been on with the added fan I've never seen, which is kind of nice and the speakers which are underwhelming for me but my kids (teens) like them. It folds upward very easily for extra room. Overall I'm pleased with this treadmills performance and features. Would easily recommend for users under 200 lbs or not using on the second floor. It was easier to setup than I thought, only took me about 20-30 min from opening the box. I needed a little help to get this up stairs but could carry on my own after that, probably not recommended.

title: Interesting Design
review: I've used foam muscle massagers as well as some small plastic ones for me feet. This one is made from a sturdy coated plastic. It's covered in a couple of nubs and rings. Mine wasn't charged when it arrived, but it fully charged within a couple of hours. There are 4 different speeds/levels. I have found that the first one is more than adequate for my needs. I volunteer a lot with my daughter's marching band and during the band season, I will be on my feet for hours. My lower have of my body will be overly tired and sore. This massager has helped with relief. It's not immediate, but after about ten to fifteen minutes, I usually feel better. It's definitely worth checking into.

title: Face Primer
review: At the suggestion of a co-worker, I tried this as a face primer. Wow - it's a pore minimizer and my makeup never looked smoother or silkier. Who knew?

title: Highly recommended
review:
I thought I’d give this a try and figured that even if the syringe was a one time use item (like another reviewer mentioned), I’d still have the valve core remover tool and the spare valve cores.

I was pleasantly surprised that I’ve been able to use the syringe twice already, and I think I’ll be able to use it many more. I used it with bontrager sealant and cleaned it out right away and it didn’t clog. Also, using the syringe is way cleaner than pouring sealant in the tire and having to carefully install the tire and not spill the sealant. Instead, I could focus on getting the tire beads to pop into place, and then I could inject the sealant knowing the tire was installed correctly.

The valve core remover tool is nicely finished and easy to use.

title: Don’t buy unless you have Ader plates
review: Be cautious with these dumbbell handles. Ader doesn’t properly explain that the plates you need for accurate fit are their 1” plates. I purchased the SDH4 for some 80lb dumbbells and the plates are apparently too large according to Ader. Not pleased.

title: Nice Set
review: This is a nice, basic set of survival tools. They all have paracord handles (underneath is just metal). Things needed to be sharpened a bit, but that is usually the case.

title: A thin option for all the perks of wool..!!
review:
A x4 pack of a thinner wool sock.. these bring comfort and provide those useful qualities.. like the moisture wicking we know and love from wool!

Being thin- socks still provide coverage at the foots tender spots making them a solid choice for hiking, camping, horse riding, any rigorous activity. The wool wicks to help avoid rubbing and create sore spots + blisters at points of contact. Wool absorbs vs. disperses sweat into shoe etc. *It’s good to allow washed feet air exposure post using. If prone to athletes foot- one can use talc powder as a preemptive measure.. especially between toes and underneath! (If worn on long treks or expeditions!)

Being thin.. these may wear thru sooner vs. later- however, the wool blended with a synthetic may help support longevity- at a price point of $15 its on point for product received. Elastin is not tight nor compressing but keeps sock in place- we had no issue with sock sliding off into the shoe!

FYI: it’s always best to hand wash wool socks and air dry them! A little woolite or liquid detergent in a sink will do the trick and hang them to dry. Some washers provide a hand wash/gentle cycle- But line dry afterwards.. bc wool WILL shrink..!!!

A decent price for x4 pack of lighter wool socks for summer use.. helping his info can help your decision- stay safe everyone!

Overall, I do like this chair and am happy to have it.

title: Impressive stabilization and ultra heavy duty
review:
[[VIDEOID:146a3850c995983a808dd8e840ab45c8]] This Hoover Dream delivers all your wishes. I found this to really help with stabilization. There are lighted green arrows when you first put your feet on that when they both turn green (you balanced) and can go. Very smooth riding and the two 200w motors goes up and down hills with out lag and jitters. The light are so cool for night riding. Very impressed these have come along way!!!

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: A Different Use For This Senior Citizen
review:
Some folks my age are into aerobics, jogging, weight lifting, and the like. Me, I'm much more sedentary and have no inclinations toward even something as basic as step aerobics. Nope, I have a very different use for this exercise step, one that is important to me. My bathtub is on an 8" riser making it unnecessarily harder to get in and out of. A physical therapist suggested I get an exercise step to make using the bathtub easier. That was an excellent idea and this step works well for that, with a few caveats.

On the plus side, the step feels sturdy to stand on and doesn't slide around. The extra risers allow me to set it at the height that works best for me. A few minor things keep me from giving it a full five stars though. For one thing, this step is very long, making it a bit unwieldy in my smaller bathroom. For another thing there's no handle for easy lifting. Back in the day when I did work out in a gym, they would stack steps like these along a back wall when the aerobics classes were not in session. So the steps were being picked up and moved around a lot. A handle on the side would make that a little easier to do. Finally, some of the plastic under the step seems a bit cheap and brittle. I don't know how that will hold up under extended use. All in all though, this step is doing exactly what I needed it to do and for that I have to give it four stars.

title: Misleading product description
review: I was very upset to receive this product to find that there is indeed plastic on the lid with no indication of if it is BPA free or not. I am very disappointed by the misleading product description. Water will also easily slip between the silicone and the bottle and there is no way to remove the silicone. Ice will not fit inside of it either. Very disappointed but will use it anyway until mold grows between the bottle and silicone, as I have already purchased it and don't want the hassle of returning just a $15 item. I would not recommend this bottle.

title: Can’t beat it.
review: For the price these are perfect.

title: Perfect Band Strength for Recover Work
review:
I have had some damage due to a local tower near us. This has been a difficult journey and has taken quite some time to try to find a way to recover from this and make the damage stop. As I am on this journey, I have had to get some basic things to help me rebuild my legs. This band was essential.

QUALITY
This band is soft, well made, and has the ability to stretch yet challenge well without being TOO tight.

FIT
I have larger thighs (size 14-16 misses US) and this fits perfectly without being too tight.

RESISTANCE
The resistance of this band is perfect for me to do the clam shell. It really gives me exactly what I need to gently start to rebuild my body.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This band is soft, easy to wear and use and store. I like it.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS for this one. I have another band I could not use because it was way too small. This one is perfect.

review: This is a decent tent after you've set it up the first time. It has plenty of room and I am 6'5". I'd give this more stars if the bug room part actually worked. It has no floor, only a screen, so bugs just crawl under it, pretty useless. Better than nothing, but still pretty useless.

title: Easy to Use
review: I walk on the treadmill a few times a week and I thought this might help step up my game. They are easy to put on and use. The strap keeps it secure and in place. I have been wearing them around my ankles. I find them to be comfortable to wear. I can notice a difference with these on while I am walking. They don't interfere with my steps, but make each step a little heavier. When the weather is warmer, I will wear these on my walks outside.

title: Good Water Bottle
review: I love the size of this water bottle. It holds 24 oz. It requires hand washing, but that is usual for water bottles in my experience. And clearly, since it is metal, you can't microwave it. Now, the lid is really not ideal. It is no spill. But not like kid snippy cups. This has a button that you have to press while you drink to open the spout. It also has a spout cover, in addition the the button mechanism. It can be hard to get used to that. You can still drink one handed, you just have to pick it up correctly to do so. It also has a loop on the top that you can use to hang it from the stroller or your bag or whatever. The spout itself is pretty short. It just takes some getting used to with the whole press the button to drink thing.

title: Insulated for drinks,  large enough for snacks and other supplies!
review:
This is a great little handy device for those longer car trips, especially when we carry liquids with us. The bag is, indeed, lightweight vinyl with a large insulated zippered pocket for larger drinks or snacks that must be kept chilled.

There are mesh pockets for smaller water bottles, and a larger mesh pocket for snacks or other necessities. And, to top it off, you have a flap that attaches with velcro for napkins.

I took this on a longer trip and it kept my drinks quite cold. You can add any small ice pack if you need to it remain colder, as the insulation is not very thick, but will suffice for shorter trips.

Attach this to the car seat, and if you have children, it keeps drinks and snacks compartmentalized without floating all over the back seat.

Great little helper.... Product for Review

title: Just ok
review: Came damaged in corners with missy paint. Not the best quality

title: It Chops, Cuts, and Pounds but Remember its Limitations
review:
If you own a home, there are certain, basic tools you need for day to day functioning and care on the outside of your house. Most households already have things like lawn mowers, shears, shovel, etc., but other tools that you will need eventually are an ax and a saw. The Zippo Axesaw takes care of both in a single tool.

Zippo Axesaw is an ax, saw, and mallet all in one and it’s ready to assist when you need to chop, cut, and hammer. The ax- or more accurately, the hatchet- is good for chopping small branches and it seems like it was made to last. The saw, which is the tool I use most, is good for pruning trees. It cuts through them with relative ease. The handling of the saw is not as comfortable as other hand/pruning saws I have used, but it’s still good enough for my needs.

With the mallet, the uses are a little bit limited. The head of the mallet is made from plastic, so you have to be careful what you use it for. It cannot take the place of a metal hammer, so don’t use it for anything except light pounding of things like, say, the stakes for a tent. If you remember its limits, you should be okay.

Having all three of these tools in one is a good idea and I generally like this tool for that reason. However, I will be the first to admit that my other stand- alone hand saws, axes, and mallets are better if I compared them each, one to one, with the corresponding tool in the Zippo Axesaw. With this tool, you sacrifice some of the performance for convenience. But again, as long as you don’t get carried away and try to use the hatchet to chop down a large tree, you should be fine.

Every household needs the basic tools for outdoor care and the Zippo Axesaw is a good choice for many tasks. It’s nice to have all three tools in one device and they each perform at a satisfactory level. I’m not thrilled with the comfort of the handle when using the saw, but this tool is still good for my limited outdoor needs.

title: Exercise bike
review: The assembly was okay. Something like this is more complicated, with multiple pieces, and it's something you want to make sure is put together right, so take your time. The exercise bike worked as it should for me. The seating and positioning is comfortable. It doesnt take up too much space to where it looks like it overwhels the area it's in. It is also easy to use.

title: Quality
review: Very comfortable and looks great. We're patriots fans in living in NY, so we feel the obligation to wear this with pride around here. Quality of the shirt is good, and the size is as expected. This gets a thumbs up from me.

title: Sooooo big.  Doesn't fit our 3 year old at all.
review:
Reading other posts we had hopes at least the knee and elbow pads would fit our 3 year old. Not even close. My wife's thinking about adding velco so we can make it tighter, but that's a pain. I'd say this is for a 5+ year old. And the wrist pads? Enormous.

But, once they fit, it should be a great set.

title: Now this is nice!!!
review:
Ordered a size Large for a ​6'2"
180lbs man

I'll begin by saying this shirt looks excellent on my husband. We both really like it. The fit is true to size and the logo is placed right.
You can feel the quality is there with this shirt. The material is incredibly soft. I would say the fabric feels a tad bit on the thinner side, but it doesn't look like it when he's wearing it. The logo is very thick and the stitching exceptional. The logo patch is also very well made and I anticipate it will hold up in the washing machine through many washings. Plus we found the heathered bleach look is really unique. Overall, it is constructed well too; I didn't find any loose threads that needed snipping or stitching blunders. It is a really nice t-shirt.

Hope this review was helpful

title: Looks good, tedious to put together but doable.
review:
The rack:
This rack is heavy duty. It's heavy and feels sturdy once you tighten everything up. It's pretty big and tall so you can easily grab what you need. Our apartment is smaller so I think something smaller would've worked better.

The setup:
Took a decent amount of time. A lot easier to do if you have someone helping. We started building it but realized we needed a special tool to tighten up the bolts. Without it your rack will be incredibly wobbly. After tightening, feels very sturdy.

The package I received was also missing bolts, so I wasn't able to attach the last rack...

We'll probably just go to home Depot and pick some up but still.

I think this rack will work great if you have an at home gym with lots of dumbbells hanging around.

title: Great addition to my touring bike so I can safely ride in multiple hand positions
review: My touring bike has standard combination brakes/shifters above the drop which I love.  But when I'm in the saddle for 8 hours while touring I want to be able to safely change my hand position while still quickly able to brake in an emergency or just regular riding.  These cross levers easily installed on either side of my stem allowing me to hold onto the top of my handlebars while still having access to functioning brake levers.  They're small enough that they don't get in the way and easily installed over my existing brake lines while still letting me use my standard brakes/shifters.  A great upgrade for more comfortable, versatile riding on long trips.

title: Perfect Capris

They are comfortable, look great and hold everything where it used to stay without any help. And adding pockets was over the top! Wears well, washes well. And I like the capri length (I’m short 5’2” and full length gathers at my ankles).

title: Decent Reel with Zero Documentation
review:
I am not especially skilled with baitcasting reels though I do use them on occasion. I hadn’t heard of this brand before and knew little about it; so far it is proving to be a reasonably decent reel though a complete lack of documentation would make figuring this reel out a complete nightmare without prior understanding of this type of reel.

There are no instructions with this reel, at all. So, do not expect to find much help in the box.

The basic operation is smooth and simple. Push the button, cast and start reeling. Of course, be careful to not let it spool too quickly or it will backlash just like any other baitcasting reel. The retrieve is smooth and the oscillator does a good job of spooling evenly.

Drag is set via a star wheel next to the handle, as expected. It took a bit of fiddling to get it set the way I want it and it is set now to work properly. Line feed speed during casting and retrieve resistance are set via the tension adjustment knob, also close the handle. The magnetic brake system is set via a dial on the opposite side, and it has setting numbered 0-9.

The main issue with this reel is the complete lack of documentation. As I use primarily spinning reels instead of baitcasters, I had to refamiliarize myself with how these reels work. A user’s manual (even one in poor English) would have helped a lot with that, and it could make learning to use this type of reel a lot easier for the beginner.

title: Good size, highly portable, and easy to set up
review:
This goal is perfect for my 3 and 5 year olds. They enjoy kicking soccer balls, balloons, stuffed animals, and anything else they can find into the goal. The 6 x 4 ft goal is a little big for my basement, but it will be a good size for use outdoors when the weather gets nicer. Storing the goal is convenient because it easily folds up and you don’t have to take it apart.

The only downside I found so far is that the poles are not attached to each other, and they come apart easily when setting the goal up. But this isn’t a huge deal because I’ve only done this once since it folds nicely after it is set up.

title: Husband didn't use it because it would have to put ...
review: Husband didn't use it because it would have to put a hole in the bike with a screw, it was a fathers day gift

title: The text of the instructional booklet is so tiny that it is extremely difficult to read.
review: The text of the instructional booklet is so tiny that it is extremely difficult to read.

title: Must have prodect
review: Only used it once but seems to work very well

title: Decent Lock
review: It works. It could use a little quality update on the combo lock, it is not too durable.

title: Works great
review: I wanted one of those for a long time and since I'm wearing glasses (not contact lenses), I was able to use one of my older pair, remove the side and tape it in. I didn't want to spend a lot of money to see if it works at all, but it worked for me. Yay! I'm excited to take this snorkeling on my vacation, I've only tried it out in the tub to see if it leaks. I won't be going for another couple of months, but the tub test was good. The material looks good and sturdy so far, hope that I have years of fun with it.

title: A little underwhelming for adults
review:
My teenaged son was very excited to try this as we have a neighbor with a similar one that is very cool. The controller even looks similar, so he was expecting the performance to be at least within the same ballpark- however we found that the motor on this thing is just not very strong.
My 8 year old daughter can stand on it and have it accelerate nicely, but my teenaged son can't get it to go remotely close to the advertised speed, and if there's an incline at all, it won't move without using his feet to help propel it. And it doesn't stop using the brakes either, it just slows down a little. We know from using other brands that are ACTUALLY made for teenager/adults that these are things it should do, but this unit falls a little short of expectations. It feels more like a motor assisted skateboard on an adult sized person, and maybe really only works as expected on younger kids (under teenage).
If you've never used a proper electric skateboard, this is kind of fun as a motor-assisted one. But it doesn't hold up compared to others.

title: Nice bottle
review: The insulation is minimal so a bottle half full of ice melts very quickly. It takes a bit more hand pressure to squeeze the bottle due to the insulation layer. Overall the bottle works well.

title: Great for shorter distance runs.
review: I tried a bunch of hand held flasks for my first marathon.  This flask is great if you are not planning to refill enroute as it is too flimsy.  The flask does collapse as you drink the water, and it may cause you to grip it tighter than you want.  I am using it for shorter distance runs.  Very easy to use.

title: When you are on a well
review: We are on a well and sometimes well runs dry.  We have two of these to keep 14 gallons of water on hand.  Once you ar out of water,  it becomes painfully obvious how much it is needed.

title: Handy little item
review: It has its drawbacks, but is the most convenient way to keep track of rows.

title: very compact for storage, I like it
review:
This lock folds into a very compact package. It is easy to store. No lock will stop a determined crook but this should really help.

I like the lock and am happy to have it.

title: Warm, thin and lightweight
review: I wanted a warm, but extremely light blanket for overnight horse treks. This one is just about perfect for my needs. It weighs next to nothing and can fit in my saddle bags.  I like the bright red color as well.  The blanket is warm and the large size means it can be doubled up for just one person.

title: Seams come apart!
review: I loved this hat at first but after only wearing it a few times it is already falling apart.

title: Honest Review for a Star Trac Bike.
review: I hate that the heart monitor goes on without me touching the handles. The alarm from the monitor is constant. Would never buy Star Trac equipment again, that’s for sure. Paid for something that is basically impossible to enjoy. The tech that came here once claimed it was from dampness. I purchased a dehumidifier from Amazon and it hasn’t helped. Plus, my garage is insulated including brand new insulated garage doors.

title: This is a scam
review: This device provides limited information unless you sign up for an expensive subscription. The app keeps asking me to upgrade. Don't fall for it!

title: long lasting, very hot
review: These last for 12 hours the way I use them. It helps to keep them inside a pretty tightly sealed pocket or slipper. Inside a looser pocket it will only last for maybe 7 hours, but even that is terrific. They do get very hot, so take care!

title: Doesn't fit small hands very well.
review: Light but too big for my hands. I'm a small lady 5' and my hands slide around in the glove.  The purchase of some type of tape to make them fit better would probably solve this problem.  Definitely protects the knuckles from the pressure points of hitting but at the same time didn't protect them due to the sliding around within the glove.

title: Good for occasional use.
review: The product makes for a good occasional use of golves,  yet should not replace regular daily use of R/L gloves.  May I suggest buying R package and L package, then combine into R and L pairs.

title: Cool
review: I put these on my van rims and I was taken back to my childhood..remember putting playing cards in you bike wheel spokes and hearing them clack and see them spin as they turned? Thats what they remind me of except for the clacking lol. Nice touch to dull wheels.

title: Cool
review: These are very nice lures. They are very realistic looking and move very smoothly in the water. Coloring is very good on them as well.

title: Five Stars
review: wife loves it

title: Garbage
review: Absolute garbage. I bought this months ago to use on my Appalachian trail thru hike. After thrrr  uses the ring which holds the pot together just fell apart and rendered it useless. I wouldn't waste your money on it. It wasn't worth the hassle  of returning. Beware.

title: One Star
review: Did not fit on chair; too short to be of any use

title: Good for my knees
review: Love this-happy I found it

title: Excellent Quality
review: I bought this for my mother (84), she sits and reads and works out.  She says she it has made a lot difference in her mobility.

title: Cheap flimsy zippers make this less useful than it should be
review:
I love a good storage container in the truck. I'm always hauling dogs or horses around which means lots of random stuff just lives in my truck. Extra leashes, first aid kits, bottles of water, emergency cans of dog food, wipes, flashlight, a rope, gloves, and more. I've been using an open top box, but this is so much better.

It has a lower storage area that's propped up with velcroed panels, mesh pockets and zips closed - perfect for the spare dog treats, food and odds and ends. The top half is divided in two spaces and has more mesh pockets and it zips closed as well. It holds the first aid stuff and things you might need in a hurry.

My problem here is the low quality zippers. They peel apart in the middle with very little pressure. The entire zipper and tabs feel flimsy and cheap - because they are. It's easy to unzip the top cover far enough that the whole thing falls off. That sort of renders the cover useless. Put a better zipper on this box and it would be a must have in multiple places for us.

title: the screws do not match a Ruger 10/22 in any ...
review: the screws do not match a Ruger 10/22 in any way shape or form.  the size is not the problem--or at least I think that is not the problem.  these screws are far to coarse and will strip your threads.

title: Very hard
review: Very uncomfortable and hard to sit on. Need cycling shorts

title: Seems Sturdy, A Little Small
review: We just got this and unfortunately only have a scant inch and a half of snow, but it's early.  We did try this out on the small slope of our front yard and we can see the potential for this.  Unfortunately it is a little small for adult riders, but our 6th and 7th graders should be able to get quite a bit of fun out of this.  I like that it cushions a little bit and the PVC material should hold up well to a good snow pack.  The kids are watching the weather to see when they can take this out on a full run!

title: Warm up
review: I got these for my son who works in film. When he's on set it really keeps him warm. This year it was cold up North.

title: It was good at first but
review: But now it goes bright, then dim, bright, then dim.  Made my ride in the dark much harder.  I wish I could return it but it is out of the return window.

title: That purple thing????
review: The rating is higher than the actual benefit.  Used with a different rag it is no different than most ball cleaner. The name is cool.

title: Small umbrella, but made to stand up to the elements
review: I'm usually not a fan of the portable small umbrellas, because they can't handle the downpours and high winds in my area. But the Kailedi umbrella knocks it out of the park. Although small, it doesn't turn inside out when blasted with winds. The teflon coating keeps the rain from soaking through the umbrella. The portable size is really nice for keeping in my car. Like other reviews mentioned, I struggled the first time opening the umbrella, but afterwards it opens and closes easily. It's a great little umbrella for the crazy rain & winds.

title: Don't buy
review: Leaks didn't last.

title: Got it and wanted to return it right away
review: Got it and wanted to return it right away. It’s uncomfortable and not really sturdy. I wish I kept the box or I would have returned it. No box $22 to return it so I was forced to keep it. I’m not taking the lose. Definitely hold onto the box if you buy it in case you want to return it.

title: One of the best resistance bands.
review: Very easy to use and you can adjust the resistance by adding all three bands or place with any combination of the three bands.  I love that I can store them all together, and it is working out great for a PT exercise I need to do for my arm.  It is a classy band combo Nd one of the better ones thta I have tried.  Keeps its elasticity well.

title: Why ride cockeyed?
review: These are great for balancing out your bikes. I often see people with tires sticking high into the air and wonder why they don't just spring for one or two of these. This, less-costly-than-other models does the trick.

title: Not the picture shown!
review: Not the picture shown. Another review said the same thing but I was hoping I would get the right one.

title: The liquid shoots out when the spout is pulled up ...
review: The liquid shoots out when the spout is pulled up. This is a major problem when using on bowling lanes even when riding you're bike.

title: Three Stars
review: Sent it back, did not work for my purposes

title: Very nice looking sport sunglasses
review: These sunglasses look a bit over the top colorful but or sports I think they're a great look. I use these to coach a Little League team. These orange/red lenses I think work great. Not too dark, but just enough to block the sun out. The seem to be quality made glasses. My son borrowed them for a practice and he really like them too.

title: Better than other cheap skateboards
review:
Our first skateboard my kids tried from Amazon was kind of disappointing. It was good to get the idea and feel for riding a board, but steering vs going straight was a little wonky on it. I figured it was just them learning, but when I got this one for another one of my kids, we realized how much better this one is. It feels solid and both kids feel more confident and safe on it than the first one we tried.
Suffice to say, I think we're going to retire the first one and maybe get a second one of these. Really pleased with it.

title: Used for at home practice of Schroth method physical therapy for scoliosis
review: The PT recommend a wall-mounted ladder for doing the required at-home exercises need to help straighten my daughter's curved spine caused by scoliosis. I searched various options and decided to purchase this one.  I followed one of the reviewer's installation suggestions of mounting it on separate boards attached to the studs.  This ladder is used for it's original reason but also by the rest of the family for an indoor play structure and pull-ups when the weather outside is too hot or it's snowing.  Great purchase.

title: Not The Alaskan ice packs these are The Tundra
review: I did not receive The Alaskan ice packs which I specifically wanted. I received The Tundra ice packs. I guess I will see how these ones are. These were for pain not my lunch so I kind of wanted the ones in the photo.

title: Materials ripped on the brand new product
review: The material on mine was ripped when I received it. For 109 dollars for a sleeping pad I expected high quality that would last a long time. The whole seam along the end where you start to roll it up is ripping out. Not impressed. I have ordered a replacement but if the quality is sub par I'm returning it for a refund. I hope I'm able to bump this review up on the second pad I receive.

title: it seems pretty flimsy. I use it to mark my campsite ...
review: I would hesitate before using this for actual camping, it seems pretty flimsy. I use it to mark my campsite when I leave as my rv is my only vehicle. Chairs sometimes walk away, but almost no one will steal a tiny crappy tent. :-)

title: Horrible Toddler air mattress
review: The worst air mattress ever. Its the size of a toddler bed. It last 2 days but I had to keep putting air in it because air kept coming out of it. What a waste of money. It holds up too 110 pounds. But my child is way lesser then that. Horrible. I want my money back

title: Cheap Jacket
review: This jacket is a little cheap feeling. The fabric feels like a cheap, slightly stiff sleeping bag. It is also a little small, especially considering you wear it over thicker clothes and multiple layers. I like the length. It is fine. It is warm.

title: Perfect for 3year old
review: My 3 year old wants to be like her big sis and this is the perfect size. Thanks!

title: Worth the money
review: I am an old skater. Started out skating in the roller rinks in the 60's 70's. Switched to roller blades in the 80's 90's. In 2022 I am now in my 60's and I can no longer roller blade outside for fear of falling and breaking something. This board brought it all back to me. I get the feeling of skating again and the exercise is phenomenal to say the least. Don't waste your money on the cheap roll ups, go for the real deal. This board is good quality and I can hide it away by sliding it very nicely under my couch. I just slide it out and watch my living room TV while I am sliding. It is wonderful!

title: Too thick for my Thompson
review: I have an older Thompson Renegade .50 Cal rifle from the mid-80s. I cannot get these patches to start easily with  .490 100% lead balls. (either hand cast or factory Hornady). It takes some serious pounding to get past the muzzle and doesn't get easier all the way down. They shoot just fine, but a different Bore Butter patch in .010 or .015 seats without even half the effort of these. I think these are 0.018. Quality is excellent

title: Won’t work without power bank.
review: My wife is disappointed with this product. It doesn’t work on it’s own. You need to invest in a power bank for it to even work. I plugged into a USB outlet and it does work, however you need a portable charger to roam freely with the product. The product is pricey for not having a power bank. The material of the belt doesn’t make you sweat on it’s own either.

title: Five Stars
review: keeps your drink really cold for a long period of time.

title: Recommended
review: Only used these a few times but they are easy to adjust and fit both adults and children well. Comfortable with good underwater vision. Also the clasp at the back makes putting them on and taking them off much easier. Good design, I hope they last!

title: Nana scooted in a winning B-day present!
review: My grandson loves it! He even wears his safety pads do he can " go faster"!

title: Super poor battery life - Somewhere around 8 hours I have to change out batteries on BOTH of my H7 units.  2 bad ones maybe?!
review: I love it when it works.  And I really like the online diary and calendar where you can actually see your workouts and look at the data.  I actually have 2 and have the same issue with them both, VERY poor battery life.  I can maybe get 8 - 1 hour workout sessions in before having to change a battery (on either).  I unpair it and remove it from the band every time as stated, just can't get the battery life to last AT ALL.  Not sure what my problem is with them, but it is super annoying to constantly be purchasing and changing batteries out.  Debating if I will change companies for my next one, as I haven't felt like these last like they are supposed to.

title: Easy to clean
review: I bought these to put on the bottom of my rabbits cage. I had a custom made one built because she was kept in a tiny cage and had no room to run around. I wanted something soft for her and easy to clean cause she is unfortunately not litter trained like my last one. These are cute and colorful and when I clean her cage they are easy to take apart and hose down.

title: Just as described
review: Just as described

title: my new lunch bag
review: If you never seen this product. your missing out on their other items. great for grocery shopping. or in this case a lunch bag.

title: Vertically challenged people should be aware of potential fit issues
review:
This bag has a ton of room, but it’s dimensions just don’t work for me. I am less than average height (5’7”) and the bag raises the standover height to where I am sitting on the bag when I have both feet on the ground. And, there isn’t enough real estate between my stem and saddle for me to stand behind the bag. Taller folks with bigger bikes might not have this issue. Also, the width of the bag is exactly how far apart my knees are when I ride. So if the bag isn’t perfectly centered, my knees brush up on the side of the bag.

The bag itself is well made, and I like how there are two compartments with separate zippers. It’s just that, for me, it is a little too tall and wide. I’ll keep looking for a different top tube bag that works better for me.

title: Straw adds plastic taste to your water/beverages...
review:
While this lid makes it very easy to sip water from my Hydro Flask wide mouth 40 oz container there is the unwelcome taste of plastic emanating from the straws. I've washed the straws in every solution I could think of and that taste will not subside. I went back to the old flip top (which restrict your sipping level to almost a trickle).

I washed the straws prior to use and several times afterwards yet I cannot remove that taste... if not for that this would be a 5 star product. The purpose of the stainless steel bottle is to remove the possibility of odors and smell... to find that the straw adds that element back is disappointing.

If anyone has a solution for this please let me know... if I try it and it works I will change my review. Thank you.

title: Nice, Warm Jacket
review:
Although this is designated as a Boys' jacket, I got it for my daughter. I think they could have easily marketed it as a unisex jacket since it is a very basic, simple, and pragmatic design. We live in Northern Wisconsin so we know a good jacket when we see one. Colombia is always a trusted brand and this jacket does not disappoint.

The only trick in picking a jacket online is getting the sizing right. My daughter is 9 and although I was confident this would fit, I also knew that I have a 6 year old waiting in the wings. I'm fairly sure that when my older daughter grows out of this the younger one will take it on (although sometimes hand-me-downs are inexplicably rejected). I got lucky with the sizing, it fit my 9 year old perfectly. I included some photos with a tape measure so that you can see how long the zipper and the arms are. I suggest measuring an article of clothing that you have in your home to compare.

The zipper was 22 inches from the collar to the waist, and the arm was about 16 inches from the armpit to the wrist (note that the tape measure extends beyond the armpit in the photo). Also note that I measured the bottom of the sleeve not the top.

I'm pleased with this jacket but I took off a star for two reasons. 1. I would have liked this jacket to have some reflective elements. I'm a little hesitant to let my girl run around in a black jacket because of visibility concerns. However, she is with me most of the time so I don't believe it will be a problem. 2. I would have preferred pockets that close with a zipper. This keeps snow out of them when you go out sledding, and it also makes sure that you don't lose whatever "precious" treasures your kids happen to pick up. These are very minor criticisms, this is a very good jacket.

title: Very Nice!
review: I got this golf trainer for my husband.  He is an avid golfer and is always looking for ways to improve his game. It was very easy to set up, once you figure how the rods go in the rod pockets. We were surprised at how big it is. We aren't really sold on the idea that this is for "chipping" practice, as when you are chipping you are aiming for a horizontal target, not a vertical one. However, we think this will make a great game at our next yard party. The tent seems to be well made, the rods were easy to put together and use. Overall, we really like this.

title: Very pleased with this product.  Thank you.
review: Very pleased with this product.  Thank you.

title: replacement charger
review: great watch with its progam but the charger was so hard to open and now it is broken

title: Leaky
review: Seal is not good enough to use without spilling water all down my front and it’s not sturdy enough to stick in a backpack pocket.

title: Just headbands
review: It’s just a headband not working for sports or movements coming out fast

title: Not really for small people..
review: Not for small faced people. Great design, but eye design doesn't work for me, can't get tight fit. I am 5'1" and petite and these are just too big  in the eye area no matter what I do to adjust. Quality is ok, but design just doesn't work for my small face.

title: Hard to apply. Directions confusing.
review: This decal is very hard to apply. It says stick it against what you wanted to stick to, but then it doesn’t really say how to get the plastic off. It’s not rocket science so all you do is pull the plastic away after you stuck the decal to where you want it to be. The problem is when you pull the plastic away the decal comes with it. So then you end up having to peel it away from the plastic and the decal becomes distorted, creased and bubbly. It’s always hit or miss with these things but this one is definitely a miss.

title: magic!
review: Believe it or not! I left ice in this cooler for over 9 days, still had most of it when I opened it. Use for fishing, parties, even store meet or whatever! This is the best. Never got disappointed by anything from Yeti! Another highlight here is that the cooler have really strong wheels! I love BBQ! That's my cooler and my seat...

title: It's okay a
review: It seems okay, but but not quite what I need right now

title: Five Stars
review: Love this racquet.  Great racquet at a great price.

title: Quality of bottle is good and
review: The Quality of the Bottle is excellent and comfortable to fill, clean, and use. I didn't felt much useful of straw, as this didn't hold correctly. Other than the straw, the bottle is helpful to track daily consumption.

title: not deep enough for my multi-purposes.
review:
i love the zip option, but the pocket is not deep/big enough for samsung 8 and above sized phones. I ended up using the zippered pocket for holding food doe my runs. I like that there is a holder for the keys and that it has a stretch to it to allow access to the locks from your hips! I wished there were a 'color'/texture to allow me to feel/see where the other openings are, as it was like a fight to find the openings.
It is not that deep, and has enough space for credit card, phone, money. it hugged well and did not ride up my body.
couldn't really use it for travel as passport would be squished.

title: OMG!!!! I AM STILL LAUGHING! :)
review: My fault.... I clearly did not look at the picture carefully. Have just recently moved into a more remote area with lots of black bears. I purchased this and when I went to the Post Office to pick it up, I asked the gal at the PO if she knew what a "Bear Bell" was, since there are so many bears in the area. She did not... so we opened it together and both of us bust out laughing! She looked at it and suggested that I hang it on my Christmas wreath! It is just that;;;;; a little bell on a piece of Velcro. I threw it in the drawer and get a laugh everytime I see it. Yes........... I think you need something bigger/louder/etc. to scare a bear! But... it was worth $6. in chuckles.

title: So much fun, but durability concerns
review:
UPDATE: I can't recommend this product or company.
The bike got caught in the rain so we walked it home and it has not turned on since. The company customer support says once it is exposed to water, they can no longer support the product and don't recommend riding it for safety concerns. Meanwhile, some of our e-scooters were accidentally left outside DURING THE SAME STORM for 2 days and still work fine. An unexpected sudden drizzle is a fact of living in the northeast. If it is not reasonable to expect it to survive some light rain, I can't recommend this product AT ALL. Save your money.

Original review: My kids LOVED this when we got it. They would ride around the block taking turns between this and an our electric scooters. It would zip around and help tremendously with the hills in our neighborhood that are too steep for a traditional bike.
That being said, it started raining when they were using it last and they tried to cover it from the rain but all too late, all of our riding toys got pretty wet.
The next morning, the e-scooters still worked, but this bike has not turned on again since. We tried charging it up, and it seems to have charged but the controls won't turn on. It's possible something shorted out inside which is very unfortunate considering we only had it for about a week or two. The scooters, meanwhile, have actually been left in the rain overnight before (you're not supposed to, but accidents happen), and are still working. I know you are supposed to keep these dry but I'm disappointed that one rain storm broke it.
I'm letting it dry out in the garage and keeping fans on it, and I hope it will come back to life after a few days of sitting, but this is definitely a concern. Keep it dry!

title: Strong and Well Made
review:
I Use this bow often.
The tension is spot on.
It is very accurate.
I like that it is weather resistant. Good for actual hunting.
I would recommend of teens and adults.

title: Make sure your bike has holes for a holder
review: Returned, unable to use

title: Comfortable.
review:
Stays put without being uncomfortable.
Holds a lot. Keys have a hook to prevent loss.
Fun colors! Easy to get phone in and out while still running.

title: It look bigger in the picture
review: Not as big as I thought.

title: Adds extra level of safety to swing set
review: These are so tough. Definitely add an extra level of safety to my daughters' swing set. Thanks!

title: Meh
review: Stiff plastics.

title: Works decently, warm
review: These work better than most gloves,  but arent perfect. They are warm, tho. Would buy again.

title: Everything I wanted
review: These are just what I needed for my rehabilitation they seem strong enough but time will tell i have only had them for a short period, can update in 6 months.

title: need to be a power wind to fill
review: Actually returned because I couldn't fill this - even with a fan.

title: Five Stars
review: Kids and adults as well love this game!

title: This came fitting perfect!
review: I wasn’t sure how the size would fit but it did and we were thrilled. Great shirt

title: Feels good off the club (and does not hold me back in any way)
review:
I don’t golf very often - maybe once or twice a year, so keep that in mind with this review.

I am not too picky about the golf balls I use because I usually lose them within a few holes. And, when I’m looking for my ball, I usually find others that have been lost. So in a typical round, I play with a lot of different golf balls. Some feel harder or more stiff off the club, and others are more forgiving with a less harsh impact. These balls are closer to the latter. It is very satisfying to make solid contact with these balls. I can’t say if they fly further or shorter than other balls. Similarly, I don’t know if these have better or worse spin control. But a clean swing feels great, and the ball flies off the club. I’m very happy with these balls.

title: DID SOMEONE SAY CUSTOMER SERVICE
review:
THIS PRODUCT IS NOT FOR REAL BOXING. THE PRODUCT IS ON A SPRING AND THE BAG IS SOFT. EVERYTIME YOU HIT THE BAG,
IT SPRINGS BACK AND FORTH. NOT ONLY THAT THE BASE KEEP MOVING EVENING FILLED WITH WATER.
BUT THE MOST IMPORTANT REASON I GAVE THIS A ONE STAR, AND UP TO ME IT WOULD GET NO STARS,; THE CUSTOMER SERV ICE
WAS SO BAD THIER ARE NO WORDS. I SIMPLE WANTED TO ASK THEM IF THE BAG IS SUPPOSE TO DO WHAT IT WAS DOING AND THAT I WANTED TO USED THE BAG FOR BOXING, THEY DID'T EVEN RESPOND. AND I HAD TO EVENTUALLY ASK AMAZON TO INTERVENE.

title: Five Stars
review: hard to open bottles without the screw but really good craftsmanship

title: Just what I wanted
review: Did the job, and even better than expected!

title: 100% satisfied.
review: Although there was no replacement clip included, but they did one better and added and extra holder.  I replaced my old holder right away, it fit perfectly  and I am ready to count steps again.

title: Go Bucks!
review: Great past time toy!

title: Outdoor Fun!
review: We enjoy outdoor games like this bean bag toss. This one was easy to put together, but the legs had to be forced into position because they were at a different angle. Once in position, they fall out if you pick the whole thing up. My husband said can permanently screw them into place, but then we would lose the "easy to transport" feature. It wouldn't be too complicated to move them, they just wouldn't pack flat. The bean bags are filled with bean type filler but there's also something in there that crinkles a lot and reminds me of a cat toy. There were a lot of loose threads on the bags, but they seem to be made well. The instructions tell you how to play the game, but we couldn't find anything about the scoring other than the winner is the first person to get to 21 without going over. In reading other reviews, I figured out that it's 3 points for the top hole, 2 for the middle one and 1 for the lower one. Overall, it is a fun game. I like the patriotic look to it so it is perfect for summer gatherings.

title: A necessity for hikers!
review: For those who go hiking, carrying this is essential.  There are just too many stories about young people getting separated from a group and taking off in a wrong direction.  Temperatures drop at night, and that’s when folks get into trouble.  This is very compact and can be used in a number of ways - as a shelter, as a sunshade, or to wrap up in to stay warm.  It’s inexpensive and light weight - no excuse for not having one with you I!

title: Bite size
review: Feels very cheap and the bag is bite size! Nothing about this bag is adult sized.

title: DO NOT BUY **
review: Purchased on June 22 of 22 in the Pacific Northwest and as of January 11, 2023 this thing is shredded not very waterproof nor is it UV resistant at all. Buyers beware.

title: Thick rubber, with very small stem valve for no scrapes…
review:
[[VIDEOID:54d3363eafaa3605bd5d17f9cd3b5302]] This is a nice size tube. It is about as thick as they come. I like the small stem valve so it doesn’t scratch your body. Lots of fun for pools and strong enough for rivers tubing.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Slides Right off
review: It's made of the same material as my kayak and slides right off no matter how much you tighten or loosen the bungy. My husband the engineer and I both tried to get it to stay on for 15 minutes. Back in the bag for a return it went. It had BEEN a return from someone else. I'm not surprised. Don't waste your money.

title: Too thin to lay flat
review: The floor mat is way too thin to lay flat, it curls at both ends, as the old saying goes, “you get what you paid for.” Companies only care about the bottom line, it doesn’t matter to them that their product doesn’t meet or exceeds your expectations, many of them today only care about money, they will tell to make a better mat it cost you more, in the long run. So ask yourself this question; if I buy a cheap mat or whatever in the long it going to the same, cause I will end up buy the a more expensive to replace the cheap one, so who loosing and who is winning? The manufacture that is who winning it called fleecing in America.

title: Good for what it is
review:
These are the best strapless clips I've seen. I finally figured out that clip less are better for most of what I do. I now only have these on my grocery getter bike, which draws a pull-behind cart a couple miles to local stores. For road bikes I now use MTB cleats, which are a good compromise for long distance riding and walking around.

So to be fair to the product, these are five stars if this is for sure what you want. I just think there are better options nowadays than toe clips - at least for me.

title: Slides
review: Slides off head. What a waste of money

title: Good Pink Pants.
review: The color is bright and loud just like I wanted for my event. Ordered it for a Cancer walk and happy the compression helped prevent too much pain. I'm so happy with it that I use it now when exercising even though I usually hate bright pink or neon colors. Been using it the gym regularly now.

title: BROKE IN FIRST WEEK OF USE.
review: Broke within a week of receiving. Glass is very thin. Like the bottle and the lids. It fit in my cup holder, but the arms that stabilize the cups kept getting caught in the silicon webbing. Wish the bottle held up. I'm desperately looking for glass bottles that are tempered and hold up to use.

title: Sturdy quad cane with simple assembly; full cane height adjustable from 30” to 38-1/2”
review:
This quad cane is sturdy. Assembly is super simple. All I had to do was insert the quad end into the handle end, line up the pop out button with one of the holes, and then tighten the locking ring.

The cane is expandable from 30" to 38-1/2" from tip to tip. To adjust, I just pushed in the pop-out button and adjusted it to my desired height (about hip bone area). This is rated for up to 300 pounds and it feels sturdy enough for that weight. The handle is comfortable and the cane is balanced well. There's a small wrist holder on the cane handle but that is nothing special. There is some play in the handle but that is to be expected as a result of its adjustability.

The price of $24.99 is reasonable for this. I feel this is an excellent choice among many on the market.

title: Not for me
review: The stripes were placed so off centered that the top looks like it hangs crooked.  I was not a fan of the stripes at all.  I  think I may would like this top in a solid color and may order one at a later date and try it to see.

title: Bugle horn
review: Hard to pump to ring it.

title: This set is just what I wanted.
review: I use this for exercise and stretching. I can't speak to durability, I haven't had them all that long...

title: Do not purchase!
review: Zipper broke after 6 months.  Seller says the warranty is only 3 months.

title: Works great.
review: This thing is great for legs and arms

title: Grandson loved it
review: Our grandson started using it immediately. He didn't try the stakes he just spread the bases in a square and had everyone playing ball on christmas. When he got back home he got his friends and used the bases for kickball. When he is happy we are happy

title: Good value
review: Very bright reflection, decent adhesive

title: Disappointed
review: Hat doesn’t look like the picture.  I cannot get the hat to re-shape.  It came very crushed and out of shape.  I have hat it several weeks and I am going to try to steam it.  The color of the hat is darker that the picture suggested.

title: Bad Quality
review: The game is fun. It is easy to assemble. But the quality is really bad. The “strings” are metal cables that don’t let the rings swing freely. The burnished wood looks really poorly done. You could honestly make a better one yourself with scraps.

title: Useful in KILLING Cats--Avoid this poison
review: This stuff is highly TOXIC, it states on the bottle that its 5% coyote urine and 95% "Other" ingredients.  It has warning labels all over it that it is toxic to children and domestic animals! And the package is considered "hazardous waste." They warn not to get it on your skin, eyes, or mouth!  My neighbor sprinkled this poison all over his back yard and my cat suddenly started vomiting violently, refused to eat, and had terrible diarrhea.  The vets were convinced that she had eaten anti-freeze or rat-bait!  Cats are much smarter than that, but it must have gotten on her paws or coat and while grooming licked the poison off.  The cat was terribly ill for almost a week and had to be fed by a tube. Remember Arsenic is also natural & organic but highly toxic. Avoid this product unless you want to start killing off the cats in your neighborhood.

title: Five Stars
review: Really strong and is helping me to reach my pull up goals

title: Very comfortable, but there are factors to consider
review:
I received this as a free review sample. The reason why I subtracted a star is neither an iPhone 6+ with a ruggedized case nor a Note 4 with a folio case would fit until they were removed from those cases. Even then the fit was snug. Another issue is the zipper for the long pocket is somewhat flimsy.

Those aside, this is a thick, padded belt that is both comfortable and built to last (except for the aforementioned zipper.) I would have preferred a more universal velcro adjustment and fastening design than the specific size format that uses a little elasticity and requires you to slip it on. But that is a personal preference.

The storage, aside from the phone issue, is more than sufficient for most folks. You can cram a men's wallet, keys and other things into the pockets. There are no washing instructions, but I would personally hand wash this in a mild solution of Woolite and air dry. It may be able to withstand machine washing, but I would not chance it.

One final note: the reflective strips would be more effective had they been a little larger, but I did test them in headlights and they can be seen up to ten or so meters, so there is a margin of safety.

title: Love it
review: Works great, just need to keep the lid off to let it air out at least once a day or else it gets a funky stale smell.

title: Who knew?
review: These are amazing. I wasn't sure how they would actually work but they are perfect for indoor use and low impact jumping. The only reason they didn't get five stars is they came without any instructions. It wasn't rocket science but it did take me a few minutes to figure out how to put them together. Handles are nice to, they come with an extra battery and even though the counter is hard to see, it does seem to work. A list of instructions would make them almost perfect (and a backlight for the counter).

title: Super soft and supportive
review: I have pain in the sacrum which makes it difficult to sit for long periods. Never mind ride a bike. This is the best and most comfortable seat cover I've ever come across. Super soft and yet supportive. Fires perfectly on my beach cruisers oversized seat. Highly recommend!

title: German Martingale not as described on Amazon's description
review: The description states the reins have rubber woven in for a secure grip.  This along with the price was the main reason I purchased this german martingale set.  However, when I received the product, the reins are the typical cotton web type, and the leather quality is really cheap.  In fact, there is a product liability warning tag attached, which I have never seen on a piece of horse tack before.  If I would have known this, I would have spent more money and purchased a better german martingale.  I also needed the product right away.  This is the main reason for purchasing this online.  Otherwise, I would have driven 100 round miles round trip to a tack shop to purchase a much better quality martingale for about $30 more had I known the product was cheaply made and not as described.

title: Useless product
review: Impossible to attach the shield properly to the ball cap.  Good concept, just poorly designed.  Oh well, I have a little pink ball cap now.

title: Solid
review: Exactly like the picture

title: good quality
review: Light weight felt, bold colors and great for my grandsons wall in bedroom.  It's a pennant, what else can I say.

title: Versatile and compact
review: Cool contraption. You have to charge the unit prior to using thru a standard USB port. Once charged, the base sits in a tub/bucket of water and forces a stream thru shower head. It’s not a massively strong stream. But enough to fully rinse shampoo out, enough to wash sand off your feet, enough to wash a dog! If you fill a 5 gallon bucket with water, cover and leave in sun for the day, you can get plenty of warm water at days end. Fairly compact. I wish this came with a bag to tote around. Placing everything back into the box is not gonna happen. Still, very happy to have found a compact way to get a shower!

title: Flex Belt Pads
review: These pads fit my Flex Belt perfectly, just switched from original pads and these are working just fine.

title: Disappointed
review:
We were so excited to get this and take my son out on the lake. He had a blast on it HOWEVER......
After ONE TIME on the lake the seam on the side has come loose. For the price I paid for this product, this should NOT have happened after ONE use!! I am VERY disappointed! I would hope this company would contact me to make this right. If they do I will change my review!

title: Stylish and Perfect for Vacations!
review: This hat is so cute and stylish! It goes with practically any outfit and looks amazing too. It's perfect for taking to the beach as it shields your eyes from the sun while also keeping your head cool. This hat is of good quality and at a great price. Highly recommend purchasing!

title: loses grip
review: after one use, its all mushed up. pretty ball, good handles, but will lose grip fast.

title: Great little tent
review: Perfect size to for two people. Easy to setup in less that 2-3 min. I would say the quality is medium to high grade. Seems to be durable and a good value. I like that you can take the top off an great great views of the sky through the top screens. Pretty like for hiking with. Overall very pleased.

title: Excellent tent, higher than expected!
review:
Note: there appear to be mixed reviews here because there are different tents of different sizes on the same listing. I'm reviewing a 6 person sized tent, and I have to admit it is TALLER than I expected. We used to own an Ozark Trail 7 person tent that was not as tall as this inside.
It took a little while to get it going because the poles are so long, but with some help it wasn't too difficult. I love that it is self standing, nothing needs to be staked down in order to stand (unlike our Ozark tents) however it is still recommended to stake it down to prevent shifting and help with stability. However, if on rocky terrain or otherwise unable to easily shove a stake into the ground, this will still stand. Heck, you can even use it indoors if you have enough space for it.
It thankfully didn't rain too much on our trip so I can't vouch for how water resistant it is, but it seems pretty good.
One thing to note- like all tents, when they say "6 people" they are talking about lying down side-by-side like sardines in a can. It comfortably fits 3-4 with some room for luggage bags on our trip, which seems about right.

title: Seriously?
review: This is absolutely no better than a milk jug it is literally a milk jug with a fancy lid, cheap and flimsy i wouldn't even pay $5 for it if i find it at 5 below, substandard quality i ended up returning it immediately after i took it out of the box. Keep looking because this is the worst water bottle you'll come across.

title: Size !!!
review: You see the product description up there where it says 5 and up twice?! Yes? Well, this helmet is not sized 5+, like you might think. Nope. It is size 8+. It is difficult to buy helmets online because no one posts something as simple as the size of the helmet. So, your sitting there thinking this helmet is a 5+ because it keeps saying 5 and up in the description, you order the helmet for your 5 year old, you get the helmet and it is 8+. So, if you are looking for a 8+ helmet, this is for you. If you are looking for a 5+ helmet, better luck next time.

title: A Great Board!
review: This one is pub quality, and while holes don't truly self-heal, they aren't as noticeable as other boards that I own.  If only this had a cabinet...

title: Great for Competitive Swimming!
review:
This product is really comfortable and doesn't slip. It's very fog resistant as well and gives me a clear view across the pool. There is a slight blue tint which helps if you are swimming outside, but it isn't too dark for indoor swimming. My only complaint is that it is a little hard to adjust and sometimes leaves you with goggle rings around your eyes. Overall, a great product, and I would definitely recommend it!

*UPDATE*
The anti-fog coating has started to wear off, which is a bit disappointing considering the price and other reviews. I swim about 4 times every week, so I understand how this might have happened. However, speedo usually produces quite sturdy products and this one was just disappointing. I would still recommend this product, however, it is only good for small amounts of swimming, maybe once or twice a week.

title: This product isn't for golfers elbow although it states it is in the title
review:
I disliked the fact that the product isn't made for golfer's elbow even though it is described as such. In the literature that came with the item it states 'not proven for golfer's elbow'. There are exercises for tennis elbow but none for golfer's elbow. This item cant be returned so I wasted my money. There was nothing I liked about the product. It seems like it would be quite durable but that doesn't help me.
'

title: Scratched up all over...
review: Came scratched up all over... 0/5. Refund me please.

title: Smells So Much
review:
First, this bag smells. I've now waited a month to review because I had hoped the awful smell would go away, but it just doesn't. It smells terrible. Like a urine soaked diaper that has sat in the car all day kind of smell. It really is terrible. And while it dulls slightly, not enough. You don't want to be in the room with this thing at all. We are having to hang it outside just because of the smell. (We had planned for it to hang in the garage, but that didn't work out, thanks to the smell. Side note: it is moveable.)
Second, it does not come with the hardware shown. You have to figure something else out. It comes with the chain attached to a large carabiner. The carabiner does not fit through the hole to hang it.
Third, the filling hole is humorously small. It comes with a nozzle to attach to your hose to make the tiny hole work. But they have bigger plugs in kiddie pools. It just seems so weird to me that they include a nozzle for your hose, but not the hardware to hang the thing by the chain they send.
Really, the only thing going for this is that it is very durable. The plastic is super thick. So, it has that going for it, I guess. Otherwise, it was mostly just frustrating, difficult, and smelly.

title: Bought it for the price
review: Seems like for a racket similar tape was going for about 2 to 4 dollars this has alot more for less. It is made in China but it works and is very economical. Since it's white obviously gets dirty quick. I only use it maximum of two times per tape. It has breathing holes for better feel once your hands get moist. It Also comes with a thin roll of adhesive tape. I do not know if that is enough for the entire roll of grip tape but I was surprised with the included adhesive tape. I recommend if you use grip tape a lot.

title: was very happy with quality for $10
review: was skeptical at first but it is a Berkly bag came with a nice strap and the bag material is actually very thick thought it would be a cheap dinky bag that would tear easy also it comes with 2 tackle boxes

title: Great for hiking/ biking
review: Another bike packing find for my husband. He loves it and it’s part of his standard kit.

title: Size is great, but...
review: I was really happy to find a mat of this size. However, with just a little bit of sweat my hands start sliding out from underneath me very badly. It grips the floor great; it doesn't grip me. Going back to using my weight equipment floor protector things (those padded square puzzle pieces you can get at Home Depot). Still searching for the ideal solution.

title: Interesting jump rope...
review:
This jump rope is a flexible, light wire encased in soft plastic.
It does not care how big or small you are. Or how much of an athlete you might be.
It shows no remorse when it's stinging whip-like cord snaps against your skin.
Be prepared to have marks singed into your neck and legs upon using.
Oddly, my kids have gotten SO MUCH BETTER at jump roping since I ordered it. It's very fast.
Sizing it was a snap.
Much like the sound it makes when it whips your skin.

title: Compact and Comfortable Sleeping Pad
review:
This is a compact and comfortable sleeping pad. It's made of durable material that is not likely to puncture. It includes a stuff sack, an elastic band, a small square of patching material, and a pump bag. You can catch air with the pump bag and use it to inflate the pad. The pump bag can also be used as a pillow.

I used a small compressor and was impressed at how quickly the pad inflates. It's a very comfortable sleeping pad and it deflates to a packable size. Once deflated, the pad fits into the stuff sack with space left over. This is a practical and comfortable sleeping pad that is a great item for car camping or for camping with your kids.

title: Average quality vintage style compass, not a good value proposition...
review:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Functional compass. Works very well.
* Made to look vintage like the old days.
* Clocks in at about 3.7 ounces.
* Leather case with snap button provided.
* Even better if you're a Henry David Thoreau fan.

THE BAD:
------------
* Has a HomeGoods/TJ Maxx vibe to it. Upon picking it up, you won't confuse it for a real antique collectible. Compared to the plethora of similar compass offerings on Amazon, this one is overpriced. I'll go 3-Stars.

title: Just not the same feel & fit as StaSof
review: I've been wearing the same model and size for years and thought I'd try this bargain model.  It's just not the same same, even though they are both Footjoy.  The synthetic part of the glove just don't stretch or feel the same on the skin.  The more expensive StaSof definitely worth it.

title: Well made for lots of water fun, standing or sitting…
review:
Very buoyant board. In the pic it has the dark blue trim. We do a lot paddle boarding and this has good stability. Easy attach large fin. Small side stabilizing fins are permanently attached. The top has your holding strings for shoes or bags. 36x15x9 and can hold 330 lbs. It also has a very durable outer shell.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Used once and board split
review: I loved the fact it was stenciled on both front and back for use with knives or Axe’s . I received this as a gift for Mother’s Day from my son who thinks it’s cool his 58 year old momma has recently taken an interest in knife and Axe throwing . I soaked the board as advised by others in the reviews but unfortunately, the board split on fist use . Another unfortunate fact is ,because we waited until we were all together at our cabin to throw, we missed the window for return. Totally bummed out in Kentucky

title: Amazing mat!LOVE!
review: Thick and great price!

title: Just for emergencies...
review: I'll be honest. I haven't actually used it and I hope I never have too. But I live in a hurricane-prone area and this seems like a smart item to have in the hurricane box.

title: keeps water cool
review: Nice water bottle, love you can hold it by the strap when your hands are full.

title: Totally surprised - it works and works well
review: So I'm in Florida where it's HOT. Yes it's winter but we're talking high 80's which for me is HOT. A friend said these work so even though I wasn't absolutely sure, I gave it a try and my friend was right. I'm not sure how it works but it does keep me cooler, lasts for several hours and is easy to use. Maybe it's magic? Whatever it is, I'm going to be carrying this around with me over the next few months as we move from spring to summer.

title: Great ultralight bag
review: This is a lovely ultralight, packable backpack - it's a good size for 1-2 L water (a 32 oz/1L Nalgene will fit in each outside pocket), a lunch, and a light jacket. I got the waist pack in the same color and enjoy using them together.

title: Not made for short people (5"2)
review: When you use the 25lb kettlebell to do a squat, the kettle bell touches the floor before you finish a squat which makes your form and posture incorrect for the exercise. It's causing lower back pains because of it. The kettlebell's height too much which is causing the problem. The cushion is nice for the hardwood floor, but I wish I could return this, however,  I don't have the packaging anymore.

title: Great for Sporting Events!
review: We recently went to a preseason football game. I looked for my clear bag and it was all hazy. I tried to clean it but was unsuccessful.  This bag is decent. It's not too flimsy or cheap feeling, but it's not heavy duty either. The zipper works well. The straps seem sturdy enough. It's a good size and it's definitely within the size limits. I am ready for the next game!

title: Great jersey
review: Good material and quality lettering.

title: Cold Water
review: This water bottle has gel inside that you can freeze and then your water is cold. It works fine, but after a couple months, the gel started drying up a bit. I couldn’t find a crack or anything in the bottle, but it looked gross, so I had to toss it.

title: Decent if you’ve never worked out before.
review: It’s a little stronger than the rubber types you can get but too long to do much with it but what you are able to do with it aren’t hard workouts with this band. Not worth your money.

title: Five Stars
review: WORKED PERFECTLY

title: Decoration
review: Decoration only recommended

title: Just Okay
review:
The adjustable belt is really weird. It isn't stretchy. It is just regular webbing with a hook at one end. The hook doesn't stay if you don't have the belt tight. And the belt isn't all that comfortable. I bought this for a kid, so the fit isn't that great for him.
The canteen is plastic, but it is pretty large. The cap screws off and on. The cap saver piece comes off when you unscrew it, so it is pretty pointless. The mechanism that holds the canteen onto the belt is really weird. Everything is metal hooks on this thing. They don't stay well and they aren't very comfortable or convenient. You really just have to take the canteen out of the pouch to drink from it, since getting to hooks on and off is a little bit of an ordeal. Unless you set it down, then it'll just fall off when you don't want it to.
For the price, I'm not too upset about it. But I imagine I'll have to make a paracord "necklace" holder for this before long because the belt and the hooks and all are pretty annoying to work with. I think we'll stick to the circular metal canteens with the neck strap next time.

title: Hard to make the wheels to turn.
review: The wheels do not want to turn. Not happy.

title: Compass spins aimlessly, useless item.
review: I have tried two of these, both just spin around and around and when they do stop, it's at a random spot.  It's a useless item.  Returned both.

title: Not for me.
review:
Seat was immediately uncomfortable. I had to return.

PS if any of the parts are fulfilled by 365 cycles, even if it is a bike saddle, plan on not getting a full refund. How does one see if they like the saddle if they don't take it out of the box and install on the bike?

title: O'Neill HEAT 4/3mm LFS vs O'neill EPIC 4/3mm GBS vs Hyperflex Voodoo 4/3mm LFS vs Quiksilver Syncro 5/4/3mm LFS!!!
review:
At 62 I have been a lifelong big wave surfer and a very strong long distance swimmer (2-3 miles per day 4-5 days/week). I am 5' 11'' tall, with a 31'' inseam, 38-40" waist, 46-47" chest, 52" around my shoulders, and 34" arms with only 13.5" biceps. I gained a lot of weight last year so 3 months ago I hooked up a harness in my pool and lost 20 lbs. swimming 1-3 miles per day in a NeoSport XSpan 3/2mm 2XXL full wetsuit. Now at 227 lbs I am aiming for about 205-210 lbs. by spring, but the water temp cooled to 68 degrees and the 3/2mm wetsuit was no longer sufficiently warm. Water was flushing in my neck and back quite a bit. I first layered a 1.5mm neoprene shirt under my 3/2mm wetsuit and got more warmth and less flushing, but arm flexibility was compromised.
I decided to test the following 3 backzip wetsuits, and I really hoped the Hyperflex Voodoo would be my best choice for swimming in waters that might hit around 45 degrees;

1. Hyperflex Voodoo 4/3mm XXL (LFS)
2. O'Neill Epic 4/3mm XXL (GBS)
3. O'Neill HEAT 4/3mm XXL (LFS)
4. Quiksilver Syncro 5/4/3mm XXL (LFS)

1. Hyperflex Voodoo 4/3mm XXL (LFS) My first shock was that the Voodoo was the hardest suit to put on by far (even over a thin lycra bodysuit) partly because of the non-slip fleece lining, but also because the arms were very tight on my skinny arms, and the suit was extremely tight around my shoulders. I had to have help pulling the floodgate over my head, and zipping the suit up. I am surprised I did not feel terribly choked by the floodgate or by the wetsuit neck when zipped up. Even though the tightness in the shoulders was stretching the neck piece a little, the neck piece still remained comfortably snug. Over all I felt like I was in a 5mm standard 50% flex neoprene wetsuit rather than a 100% stretch suit.
