review: Ok little $$

title: Nice tent
review:
This is a very nice tent. It seems well made. The fabric is nice and thick. I like that it is not that heavy. This is good because sometimes we have to walk a fair distance holding it. It has a lot of different features to it.

It wasn’t too difficult to set up. It felt pretty sturdy. We are part of several scout groups and go camping a lot.

It looked nice. It was sleek. It held up pretty well. It seemed durable.

title: Five Stars
review: Able to pull and hold the weight on fitness machines.

title: Glowing lights and fast fun!
review: We have a Segway Ninebot scooter that we got as a gift for my kids, and they always fight over it. Well, no more! This is a great electric scooter that is every bit comparable to the name brand Ninebot variant, PLUS it was easier to assemble and has cool running lights reminiscent of Tron or perhaps a light saber! The kids now happily switch off between the two. The controls are a little different, there are buttons on the surface that you hit with your foot to control speed rather than a lever controlled with your hand, but after a small learning curve they got the hang of it. Lots of fun!

title: Received wrong size
review: Received the wrong size hat didn't find how to return/ exchange on the site so a waste of time and money

title: Requires Practice but Then Worked Great!
review:
This is a really cool product that once I figured out a few tricks to its use I’ve really enjoyed owning.

It will definitely help to watch videos on tips as to the best way to fill these loungers. If you’ve seen commercials showing people quickly swiping these through the air then sealing and sitting down - that is misleading. There must be enough airflow to adequately fill the lounger sack so that will require either a breeze or creating one. This can be accomplished by holding it open and running or, as I do, using a battery operated fan.

This product is different from others in this category as it has a pillow and a light built it with it - both are nice additions. In addition there are pouches on the side perfect for storing a drink, book, sunglasses, etc.

I got the “Glow Galaxy” model when the rechargeable battery powered light is illuminated the lounger glows a cool deep purple color illuminating the star pattern. During the day the light really isn’t noticeable but at night it’s incredible. The thing I’ve found I really like about having the light is when at a festival or on the beach it’s always easy to spot my group based on where my glowing lounger in located.

As with anything like this, air will slowly leak out - the more weight or pressure applied the faster air escapes. If someone drops too hard down on to it more air escapes. None of this is to be unexpected.

Sitting upright we fit 3 of us comfortably side by side although we are all relatively small.

While at first I wasn’t sure if I was going to figure out if I could fill this and seal it without the air escaping, now that I’ve used it for a while it’s really not a big deal. The lounger is comfortable, holds air adequately well and has nice design elements that others don’t. I have had multiple people stop to ask where I got it as it really is quite unique.

This is a cool product that I definitely recommend.

title: Terrible odor, but I aired it outside a couple ...
review: Terrible odor, but I aired it outside a couple days and it's all good. It's a decent size and good quality. I recommend.

title: This is fabulous. Light weight. Comfy. Using for exercise mat
review: This is well designed and comfortable.  I cannot swear how people would feel using it camping because I'm using it as a cushioned way to do some physical therapy stuff.  The yoga mat was too thin. Its very light weight, yet cushy.  Very happy with its versatility because can't carry heavy stuff around well and it's easy.

title: WRONG manufacturer SIZING!!!
review: wrongly sized the large fits a size 8 foot!!! really disappointed

title: A Solid Choice For Camping And Emergency Use
review: This is an excellent, multi-functional lantern/flashlight. It works well when you are walking in the dark and need a flashlight to see where you are going. It works equally well during a power outage, when you need to light up a darkened room. The blinking red flare also serves as an emergency flare. The whole thing is lightweight, yet solidly built. This lantern will go with us on every camping trip and in between times will serve as back up lighting should the power go out. Our family is very happy with this product and it well deserves a 5 star rating.

title: Excellent Product and Well Made
review: I found this exercise chair on a TV exercise program that helps older folks or people with limited strength or mobility.  I have always feared using a kitchen chair, so was delighted to find this product.  It is really well made and has a good weight limit.  It is sturdy and doesn't move around or feel "shakey".  There are resistance bands attached (you can always find them) and we are still figuring them out as to what we like the best. But, again, this product is well-worth the money.  There were two additional items in the box that we do not need to use.  The one was a foot rest which for shorter people might be a nice addition.  There was also a back support, again we are large and tall enough that we didn't use either.  And the best ... the box came (the shipping was fast and it was well packaged), we opened the box, pulled out the fully assembled chair, opened it up (like a folding chair opens) and we were Done!  It is so sturdy, so well made, this is a keeper.  The chair is made of materials that will be easy to clean and a bonus to me is that it is easy to move.  Good purchase.

title: Fast shipping
review: sicks out 3/4" more than Safariland holster, hard to conceal, but half the price.

title: Very small in size, but nice…
review:
[[VIDEOID:279ec780da8a69c70f7b75cd00b97e6f]] This is a nice vest and well made. The sides are expandable, but it has its limits on size. This will not fit many adults. My son is 13 and super thin and it just fits him. I can expand the side more for him for many extra a few more years.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Oversized ring for standard water bottles
review: This is a simple product.  Nylon strap with a quick release clip, but in actual use, the hole in the ring is too big.  There are many water bottles that will work with this strap, but these days, bottle water companies have reduced the size of the lip around the cap so they now slip right through the ring on this strap.

title: This band is nothing but quality, totally on par!
review:
We ordered a pink band as, we were in the market for a quality item that my extreme collegiate athlete could use and keep up her intense training while traveling on the road all the time.. keeping up workouts is difficult from plane/bus/hotel stays and such.. She does have a workout regiment that she can do on her own, if only... she has a little bit of room and a quality resistant band go with it!!

This band is nothing but quality, totally on par! It is made with integrity, reinforced and stitched with safety and longevity in mind. This provides the details for a good investment and peace of mind.. so much more then, rubber elastic bands that are cheaper.. and have the ability to snap!!! If it’s happened to you- then, you can vouch for how much this can hurt, while leaving a welt the size of Texas. Oh, and worse yet.. scare you half to death!! All leaving you in the end without the workout tool- ugh! This band is over 2” thick and made of material.. assuring there won’t be a “snap snafu” with you as the target!

This has a small/simple travel cinch bag to store this in and keep it confined/easy to pack.. This fits in the tiniest of pockets, and takes up no room at all- She’s kept band clean by using an equipment spray (made by adidas) and wiping it down with antibacterial wipes.. So far, this hasn’t retained any nasty locker room smell and her cleaning regimen should keep it that way! I think one could also hand wash w/ mild soap and hang dry with no issues..

This is part of a 3 band series.. and the size of the band (length) Controls the intensity workout. If purchasing a single band, be certain to get the best fit for your workout routine and examples are described on their website very clearly.. yes, you prefer to vary the band resistance- I would suggest ordering the 3 pack as, the $ spent is a great deal saved vs. ordering individually.

title: Light Weight and Not Durable.
review: The bands are too light. They will break with use.

review: Good Job

review: Good quality and fast shipping.

title: Not what I was look for. Returned
review: Looks nice, but it’s very thin and a little warped right out of the box. May be because they shipped in a box that was too small.  The top knob where you can see your coffee perk was clear plastic.  I was disappointed with that.  Should be glass.  The hardware to hold the top on or hold top to flip back is very soft, thin aluminum.  Top came off in my hand first time I took the top off to pull the internal coffee basket and perking structure out.  I returned this product. It wasn’t what I was looking. for.

title: Runs very very small……
review: This tank top runs very very small. I would recommend buying at least 2 to 3 sizes larger

title: Does the job
review:
I got this for my wife to use when we go swimming. It's waterproof and warm, however do not wear this when YOU are wet. The inside is very furry and will trap water and go moldy in no time.
It is very generously sized and can, in fact, be used to change inside of, which is a big selling point for us. Once you are dry, you can wear it to stay warm over your swim suit, but I really wish it would be useful to change back after you are wet as well (like a big towel).

title: I LOVE these shorts to workout in and the High Waist ...
review: I LOVE these shorts to workout in and the High Waist on them Eliminates the waist trimmer that I had bought previously.

title: Very nice table wrap
review: This would be great for the Fourth of July or for another patriotic holiday. It looks bright and vibrant. It really is very nice. It was easy to put on. Just make sure you have all the measurements right. It did a good job of protecting the table. It really stands out. I would recommend it.

title: Do it
review: Ok.  I am not a total neat freak, but I do LOVE this thing.  I have looked at these for years and after packing for my last trip, I finally just fell off and bought it.  It works just as advertised and another reviewer, "top 500 reviewer" did a very useful video with her review.  I didn't get my folder for free, but I am still going to sing it's praises.  It really does save space to have everything folded in the same way. I travel a lot and I am using it to pack and of course when doing laundry.  After a try or two, I got into a rhythm and it was a dream.  Just remember to place shirts face down first and center them... and then fold up the bottom if they are longer than the folder. Perfect every time.  Pants are good too, just remember that they need to be the width of the bottom, center folder. Also, folding on a surface that is a good height for you is key.  I have bed that is up on feet about 4" taller and so it hits me about mid thigh.  Plus it's a queen size bed.  I just pile my folding on one side and begin. My bed has the right amount of space and is the right height for me, not too much bending and you can easily see what you've got.  I have found that it works best with cotton items... chiffon, floaty, poly- you know, slippery stuff is a bit tricky and takes a bit of practice, but I've even mastered that.  My husband is a husky dude - 4x.  This folds big guy tshirts and others easily. Using the same principles you will learn from practice with regular size stuff, it's truly a breeze and LOVE how all of his shirts are all folded the same way now. Saves space and is neat and tidy without any more effort than normal manual folding.  Haven't tried the towel fold yet, but I will.  Give me time.  I'm still jumping up and down about all the clothing I can fold now! I am admiring the neat and tidy stack of clothing for my next trip as I write this.  Now, being honest, I am going to report that the "hinge" parts are most likely going to give out after a period of use... but as another reviewer noted, gorilla tape will correct this when it occurs. I have some of that stuff.  I will do that because frankly I will never give this thing up.  Other than what I have reported, I don't think I can add anything else.  I will, as I always do, update if there are any issues to report.  I really, honestly love this thing.  It arrived quickly (I have prime) and in excellent condition along with some other items I ordered.

title: Great!
review: I am new to meditation. I found this bench to be extreamly comfortable. I have bad posture and meditation was a little hard. The angle of this bench made it easy to get corect posture and I have been able to double the time I can sit and pratice my meditation.

title: This item was delivered as forecasted, performs well and I highly recommend it to others.
review: This is a wonderful tool that is simple and reliable.

review: I wasn't impressed with this cap, although it fits REALLy well and is comfortable.  I feel the brim is too big for the small, flimsy makeup of it.  I am sure its just a personal thing, but just looks disproportionate that the brim is so large in comparison to the rest.

title: Beautiful streamers
review: Well made, long ribbons, perfect for ribbon dancing. Kids at my church loved them!

title: Go bucs!
review: Looks great, and we love repping our team! Understated but cool!

title: Seems to run small, but somehow motivating.
review: Maybe my stomach area is bigger than I thought, but this corset/compression trainer runs SMALL, and while I can get it on, I’m not sure if it is comfortable to wear more than 5 or 6 hours a day, which is a typical work day. It does slim the silhouette and fits well underneath my clothing giving a sleek, smooth look, especially under dresses. The closure is the typical hook and eye. One benefit is that not only does it slim the figure, but it helps with posture (back). Hopefully, with a little more exercise and persistence, I will see additional benefits of using this garment.

title: It's okay, you might find it better
review: This is just okay. It's got an easy dial so you can change weight without any effort. I do have one that has a lower maximum that I like better - this is okay but the other is easier to change the weight and the base isn't quite as heavy to start. I am a woman and I do have carpal tunnel so this works but I have to be careful. You might very well do better with it.

it a shame because the product seems well built in every other facet and i'm a heavy guy

the sides you push off from are hard plastic that is taller than most shoe soles

it becomes intolerable after a few days use

title: Broke had to send it back
review: Broke on first use. Sent it back

title: Looks great! But wheels get stuck?
review: Maybe we just got a dud, I don't know. I love the look and style of this board, it is aesthetically beautiful, with such detail on the underside.  But my son has fallen off this one more than any other board we have. He's pretty new to skateboarding, but already surpassed most of his friends in maneuvering so he's really got the hang on it by now. This past weekend, a friend came over and they went around the block, his friend used this one and fell off when trying to turn. Apparently, his friend is an experienced boarder and blamed the way the wheels seem to have touched the board on a turn for the fall, which sort of goes along with what my son had been trying to describe. Maybe they are too young and this is a more advanced board, but it says for beginners on the title so I'm not sure what to think. It looks so much nicer than the others we got, but the others are much sturdier and he has no fallen from them nearly as often as this one. So, I guess be careful with this one.

title: A knife with nine tools that fits in one hand.
review: The thing I really like about this multi tools knife is that the scissors are full size not a little dicky scissor like in the army knife. You can also take this tool apart to have the scissors work independently of the knife and the multitools. Thank you for reading my review. I hope you find it helpful.  OZ

title: A great, useful item to give out to the homeless!

If you're going to hand these out this way though, I would recommend giving each person a sheet with instructions on what it does and how to use it. Otherwise, they may not have a clue.

title: Fun
review: My kids enjoyed playing with this set. It is made for the water so it can get wet but you can also play it on land as well. It kept them bust for a while. It felt well made. We have several different toys by this company and have been happy with all of them. It is great to bring to a pool or outside party. I like that it promotes physical activity.

The valve should have been made out of rubber for easy and secure seal.  Not to mention these are very thin tubes and the don’t lay flat.  With air they fold up because of poor design.

title: Nice hammock, but not exactly what they claim.
review:
Let me start off by saying this is a really nice light and comfortable hammock. If that's all you are looking for, it is a good option! But I have to take off stars because there are details NOT as described in the listing or picture.
The issues are:
1) It says it comes with straps, and in the product listing picture, it shows a set of rugged flat blue hook straps. But that's NOT what you get! You get some cut length of generic purple rope (pictured). Does it do the job well enough? Yes, especially if you are handy with tying your own knots, but the listing title and photos give you the illusion of a more premium product complete with hooks, rather than the rope you actually get.
2) Double. I'm not sure what they mean by double, but I'd assume they mean two people can use it at once. Granted, I'm not a small guy, but the way these hammocks wrap around you, I don't see how it is possible for two people to comfortably sit in this at the same time. I guess you could say it fits double capacity the way 22 college kids fit into a phone booth on a dare. Sure, you could, but would you really advertise it as such?
I used to own a different type of hammock that had wood and metal parts to hold it open and flat, like a couch or bed- not a little folding portable kind like this one. THAT could fit two people comfortably looking at the stars, and in fact we regularly had more if you count kids using it like a futon. But hammocks like this one just aren't for more than one person at a time in my opinion. Unless you don't mind being really uncomfortably squashed together in it.

Otherwise, it is a perfectly comfortable and functional hammock that folds really nicely into a small carrying bag.

title: Fragile, needs to be tempered.
review: The first one broke in transit. Bought a replacement. I initially bought because I'm trying to discard all plastic and needed large volume water container since I drink about a gallon a day. Sadly the glass is very fragile, thin and I can't carry it with me due to it's fragile nature. Would love it if glass was thicker or tempered to resist breaking.

title: Unbreakable! Deserves more that 5 stars
review: This is being used by my 12 year old boy. He brings it to school everyday. It's cleaned out nightly, then refilled and tucked in his side mesh pocket of his backpack. Let's just say it's been through some things. It's been dropped at least 100 times. Once from the bleachers onto the cement below. It's been left on an empty school bus, overheated. It's been flipped more times than I can count on bets that he could "nail the landing" because, 12 year old boy. It's been fidgeted with; open, close, open,close, open. Because again, 12 year old boy. And after 4 months of almost daily use, it's still works flawlessly. No drips or leaks. Keeps water chilly cold forever. Deserves more than 5 stars

title: Cute Ringer Tee
review: This is a cute t-shirt. It's a ladies cut shirt and possibly junior sizing. The medium size fits my teenage daughter pretty well. She's 5'7" and weighs about 145 pounds. This is more form fitting than she usually likes, but it's not tight on her. She prefers looser shirts and probably would have gotten a large if she had gotten this at the store. The length is good. The material is thin and light weight. Bras do show through a bit. The Clemson logo is vibrant and outlined in glitter. My daughter isn't really a fan of glitter on her t-shirts, but it's not too bad. Although the description didn't mention glitter at all. The ringer style is cute.

title: So clunky!!
review: Maybe it’s because I play this the super-country way, (a ring, tied on fishing line that hooks to a classic c hook that’s screwed into a tree) that I have a problem with this. The line is thick, almost like a shoelace. The c hook isn’t quite the right shape. I don’t know. It’s not for me. I set it up for my kids actually and they all roared with protest about how bad it sucked. I took it down within a day.

title: Holds lots.
review: The pocket for phone seam failed on one side. One of the belt straps came loose from top seam. I riveted it in place

title: New fresh rubber brakes that work!
review: Short but sweet - these new brakes have nice soft rubber that grab and stop really well, exactly what I wanted and expected - no complaints!

title: won’t recommend to anyone
review: The size is not what it appears to be

title: Loud but
review: It is loud but not enough for cars to hear, with their windows up.  I was nearly back into because the lady couldn't hear the horn but she heard me yell.  Cars on the street couldn't hear it who almost hit me.  The only time anyone could hear is when their windows are down, and how often is that?

title: Not worth it - you can get a pedometer on your phone for free.
review:
The sole purpose of buying this thing was to track my steps and sleep in hopes of losing weight as I decided to get serious about my workouts. I know people who've had these things and loved them. That's not me. I had a hard time getting the charger to stay in the band so it wouldn't always charge completely. It never tracked my sleep-NOT ONCE, it didn't accurately track my steps or the number of flights of stairs even when I was running stairs daily and worked with someone to ensure I was using this stupid thing properly. Within 2 weeks of having the fitbit, I was working out and sweating because that's what you do when you work out and the connector in the back got some sweat on it, the stupid thing stopped working completely. Guess how much it is to fix it?!? That's right, the price of a new one.

Needless to say, I've given up and just decided to be fat. To hell with it.

title: Absolutely fantastic!
review: I ordered this shirt for my daughter, because it's her dad's favorite team. And they're both thrilled that I did! It's a really cute shirt in person. The colors are true to the team's and it is just as vibrant as pictured. This tee runs true to size (tts). The material is on the thinner side though, but I wouldn't call it see through. The v-neck isn't cut to low. Overall, it's was a cute find and we're really happy with it!

title: Okay for play!
review: These are only good for letting the kids play in the back yard or an emergency tent. It's small and easy to carry but tears easily. Just putting the poles through tore it and we were gentle. The dew soaked the tent. And the bottom is very thin. All in all though for $20 a tent (we got 3 because we have 5 kiddos) they will be great for backyard camp outs!

title: Not all that, but a cute idea
review:
This is an interesting little roller.
It is small enough to be easy to handle. The three spikey balls remind me of doggie toys! It is easy to hang on to and roll. Someone else has to do your back - you can't do your own back, and laying on it doesn't work. It feels okay on my back, but not amazing.

It did nothing for my legs, which often ache.

Overall, I guess this did not add anything to my daily life, but your experience could be different.

title: We have had much more expensive holders that really did not work any better than this simple design
review: This is very basic velcro design with a foam insert to protect the velcro from being cut by the ski edges. We have had much more expensive holders that really did not work any better than this simple design. It is a must have if you are carting around skis, but still need your hands free to chase kids.

title: Great...
review: Looks great on my Granddaughter's car.

title: Perfect for moms on the go!
review: Love these! I'm a mom and I am constantly putting my hair in a bun so my hair is frizzy and these help so much with containing it and keeping my hair all in. Makes me look a little less crazy mom lol

title: Older model was better
review: This is my third Stamina Inmotion Compact Strider.  My first two I've had for 4yrs & 2yrs.  I keep one at home, and one at work.  The older one was wearing out, so I purchased a new one.  However, it's the newer model.  I like the old one better.  Having used it consistently, I know the "numbers"....the old machine (on my fitbit) I burn more calories because the "step" motion is deeper.  I still have the older model at work, and burn more with the same amount of time.

title: Don't buy! Very cheap, packed awful!
review: Very cheap!

title: Dressy, Never Needs Charging, But Doesn't Track Much
review:
This KATE SPADE NY BLACK SCALLOP ACTIVITY TRACKER is dressy, and never needs charging (because it's powered by a coin battery), but it's definitely an "activity tracker lite". All it does for "activity" is track steps, calories (as computed by an algorithm), distance, and a few goals (e.g., sleep, daily water glasses). It also has a countdown to important events (birthdays, etc.) feature that gives notifications.

The Quick Start guide is unhelpful. It tells you to download the companion app to your smartphone, and has diagrams for inserting the supplied battery in the watch. The downloaded app tells you how to register for an online account that will actually keep track of your data. The reviews of the app in the Google Play store report that the app is flaky, and may wipe your data.

The watchband is cheap, made of rubber (though it doesn't actually look cheap). This "activity tracker" is basically a toy. I'm sticking with my [[ASIN:B00N2BW2PK Fitbit Charge HR]], which isn't pretty or dressy, but is a serious activity tracker that does much, much more, including telling the time and date.

title: Great concept to help with being comfortable in the water
review:
I was hoping this would help my 3.5yo toddler who's scared of water to like swimming since it helps her float. She was very uncomfortable with the flap at the front of the jacket, and it kept going over her face so she couldn't see. She didn't like it at all but it might work with other kids!

I got the M/L size and it was probably too big for her, she's 3.5 and 29lbs, I'm going to keep it and try it again when she gets a bit bigger! I think it works as intended but it was just my kid who didn't like the way it worked but she's not comfortable in water to begin with.

title: These really keep you nice and cool!
review: My wife and I did some yard work yesterday and these were the perfect relief! Just wet it and wrap around your head or neck and you stay cool! Great for wiping the sweat off your face too! Love the handy carrying cases with clips for when you are on the go!

title: Not polished, mirrored, or reflective. Finish is brushed
review:
1). Love the bottle. Flawless and durable I have used them for years!
2). I did not receive what I ordered... I have had the brushed finush bottle for a few years now and wanted a change so I ordered the mirrored finish. I received the brushed again and it even says reflect on the stamped underside but it's clearly not reflective...

title: Excellent For Changing Up Your Workouts
review:
This is a very good piece of workout equipment that allows you to improve your fitness in a variety of ways. The vest allows you to evenly distribute up to 44 pounds across your body. This is a lot more comfortable and much safer than carrying a weight in a backpack or something like that. The vest is very durable and can withstand the weight without any issue.

The individual weights are metal bars that fit into 32 pockets on the vest. Each pocket can hold up to 3 bars. The pockets have a Velcro seal at the top to make sure the weights are secure.

This vest makes it very easy to increase your workload for pullups and dips. I am a cross-country skier and marathon runner so this is a terrific product for improving leg and core strength. With this vest I can transform a family hike into a brutal workout.

This vest is a terrific option for anyone who is serious about their fitness but has gotten bored with the gym. It allows you to get outdoors and push yourself in ways you never thought possible. It is a versatile tool for weight training and would make a thoughtful gift.

title: Two Stars
review: runs very large

title: Ok for the price point but you definitely get what you pay for here
review: This mini sword is very basic looking, no high quality details or craftsmanship at all. The blade is completely flat where the sharp edge would be, I think it'd have looked better to have polished the edge so it's not sharp but looks more realistic. But again, for the price- it's decent. I think it's a safer toy for kids since it doesn't have a sharp edge but the end is still pointy enough that a kid could stab someone while playing with it so maybe still not a great choice for smaller kids.

title: Just not that hot.
review: It better not be too cold outside to use these. I was Very disappointed that they barely get warm. Also, this size may be OK for 'Small' kids but not for adults.

title: These are the ones you been looking for!
review: Trust me ive looked at them all even on ebay. These are the best and they proved to me they are. My son whos 13 has a friend on the heavier side and these are still looking like new after a few months. Also to the people who say they dont fit .. You have to take the nut off these pegs replace the nut.

title: Light, straight, and good practice arrows!
review:
[[VIDEOID:e5c6a53c54f8d5e3e32bde2abf339ca5]] These have worked good after several days of practice. Just keep in mind that practice arrows don’t always last. I had a few nocks come off, but the tips seems to stay on all of mine. Theses are pretty good and I prefer them over many others.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Fit my 10 speed cassette perfectly, shifts effortlessly
review: I changed my corn cob hub to a less aggressive 10 speed SRAM cassette.  I needed a longer derailleur to accommodate the new range in motion and this fit my Surly frame and set up perfectly.  Installed easily and with plenty of adjustment range I was able to dial this in to my new cassette quickly and it shifts with each pre-positioned click perfectly.  Smooth motion up or down, great derailleur.

title: Well worth the price
review: Well worth the price. We have a lot of power outages and this lantern always works

title: Very nice scooter!
review: Rides nice and smooth, great grip on the handles, nice traction on the foot board, and brake is easy to use! Easy to maneuver and great for tricks! Great scooter for the price!

title: Just what I needed -- I (and my cats) thank you ...
review:
I'm using this on a Nalgene 32 oz / 1000 ml bottle, and it fits and works perfectly. NO LEAKS! I've had this in the bottom of a tote bag on its side for hours (like 3-4 hours), with not a sign of leakage.

I actually purchased it because I have two rather rambunctious cats who have a habit of knocking my Nalgene bottle off my worktable. If I've inadvertently left the lid open, I end up with a real mess. With this lid, even if I leave the smaller lid open, the size of the opening prevents the entire contents of the bottle from spilling. (Yes, I do try to remember to screw the lid back on, but sometimes I forget, and cats will be cats -- they seem to get great enjoyment out of knocking things off tables, bookshelves, mantles, kitchen counters, etc.).

Anyway, if you're thinking about this for a Nalgene bottle, it should work great. Can't vouch for any other bottle brands.

title: Age appropiate for Toddlers...
review:
I like this for indoor use. It is small enough to fit in a small room or basement. It isn't heavey duty for teenages. In fact, it would probably break. But, for its intended ues for Toddlers they love it. The beams have the styrofoam for needed protetion. The beams don't bend out a lot so the styrofoam is essential. I duct taped my too.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Bag NOT Included
review: Perfect for the purpose intended. I didn't get a storage bag with mine though, which was a disappointment. My daughter ordered the same fins, and hers came with a bag, so don't know if some sizes do and some sizes don't include a bag.

title: Great
review: Beautiful colors, looks like we’ll made and will sustain the wind.

title: Really nice!
review:
This sweatshirt was an awesome find! My hockey loving husband was thrilled when I pulled this out of the Amazon bag. He says it is comfortable. Plus, the sizing appears to be correct and it fits him perfectly. I really like black tie-dye look on him too. It's unique.
The material is nice as well. It's not the thickest sweatshirt he owns, but it isn't to thin either. The material is soft and flexible. And the decal on the front is nice also. I've washed it a handful of times now and it is holding up well to the washing machine and dryer. He really likes this hoodie a lot. Definitely consider this one! It would make an excellent gift!
Hope this review was helpful!

title: Hit and miss quality.
review:
If you got a promo code or coupon the day you bought. These might be worth it for 10 - 10ft paracords. 2 of my cords have some loose threads/braids throughout the length. Kind of like pimples. Makes these 2 cords useless for most projects. Maybe these are factory seconds or remnant rejects from the factory. The other 8 look decent, but the silver was so bad it was instantly noted as garbage through the 2 bags these shipped in.

At least they are cheap to buy.

title: Seem to be good quality
review: These look like nice quality springs. I was not able to actually install them because I got the wrong size, but they look like they would’ve worked great.

title: soft side cooler
review: We purchased this cooler for a 3 day road trip.  This cooler was amazing.  Kept things ice cold for an amazing amount of time.  We did purchase some special "flash" freezer packs ... they stayed completely frozen for fully 48 hours.  Amazing.  It's soft sided, of course.  I chose the blue.  It's bright.  The sizing is as represented in the ad. There is a should strap.. and handles, a zipper that is apparently strong.  We've only used it the one time, and I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.  And I hope this info was helpful to you in some way.

title: Family fun!
review: My son loves! Fun indoor versatile exercise!

title: Decent for the price paid
review:
Time will tell if this holds up to the way I will use this bag. I chose it because it can hold 2 spare e-bike batteries and if needed, can hold all 4 batteries in the side pockets.
My wife and I ride Lectric bikes and we have a trail/train path in Akron, OH we like to ride. You ride 20+ mile one way and you can ride the train back. Problem is we needed a way to pull all the batteries out of the bike to even get close to the weight limit for the train crew to lift the bikes on the train. They required all batteries to be removed, safety and lift weight. This bag easily holds the 2 spares for everyday rides, and can carry all four batteries for train transport (quite heavy). Plus enough room to spare for medical and bike kit. We like to be prepared. People always seem to get hurt on trail and rarely have supplies to patch themselves or their bike.

title: Comfortable and Practical 3/4 Run Tights
review: These run tights are made from a soft fabric that feels almost slippery against the skin. The tights fit true to size even though they might appear small when you take them out of the packaging. The tights do not become transparent when they stretch. The moisture-wicking fabric helps keep you comfortable as you exercise. The wide waist band is comfortable and helps provide support to the abdominal area. This is a nice-looking pair of practical and comfortable 3/4 run tights.

title: Totally Broke into pieces!
review:
I wanted to love this... a few of us bought these on the tv show I work on. I loved it the first day.. the second day it started falling apart. We “fixed it”- and the third day It collapsed with me on it, into a hundred pieces! I bought it over our hiatus, so it’s too late to return :(
A cool idea- but so Disappointing!

title: Bought this for our bikes & they fit great in our bottle holders
review: Bought this for our bikes & they fit great in our bottle holders. Unfortunately the don't keep our waters as cold as I would like. The ice cubes melt fast. Not as insulated as I would have hope for.

title: Draft bridle
review: Too big for a haffy, more Belgian sized

title: That their rubber
review: Exercise

title: One I gave someone for Christmas was reported to be ...
review: One I gave someone for Christmas was reported to be o.k., but I received one that was defective (could not use).

title: very soft
review: The pants are extremely soft.  The logo is a bit stiff, but softens in time.

title: Not worth the effort
review: XL didn't fit size 11 shoes.  Wasted money.

title: Plantar Fasciitis Socks (3 Pairs), Black,L/XL
review: I have had PF in my right foot for 2 years and am always looking for additional support. These are more like minimal Compression Foot Sleeves, I sense no Heel Arch or Ankle Support. What has worked best for me is Zensah products.

title: Good bag!
review: I bought this sleeping bag because my boyfriend used the same model on a backpacking trip through the chilly mountains and recommend it. It's a nice warm bag, high quality and warm.

title: Excellent partner paddle.
review: As with my previous review of Joola's paddle, this one was very hot at my work party. We broke these in at a ping-pong business (which I'm not sure is doing so well during the pandemic), and everyone loved using them. The colors are great and the handle is smooth and comfortable in the hand.

title: Yum Craw Fish
review: As I said before, these lures exude an efficient attractant luring bass to the area of the bait. The bass reacts to the action of the bait, as the action is quite natural.

title: Brings Back Memories
review: Back in the early 90's, I had one of those teal and pink Igloo hard coolers. This retro cooler pack brings back memories! This can hold 6 cans in the main compartment. There's a compartment on top where you can keep another can or use it for a snack or your keys & wallet. The whole thing can be worn on your shoulder. It's an easy way to carry your drinks with you. It's a soft cooler with minimal insulation. It would likely only keep your drinks cool and not cold since there is no room for ice.

title: Great goggles!
review: My daughter loves wearing them for swim class. Does not hurt her face, does not fog up, easy to put on and off.

title: After Days Of Working On This, It Is Unfit To Use- Fabulous Design Though
review:
I love this stove design. I really do. The problem is that the way it is made, I have yet to be able to use it.

HOW THIS COMES
This has a great case with a zipper on it. That protects the stove and keeps it handy to transport it while camping.

WHAT IS THE PROBLEM?
This is a camp stove. That means that it does not have to have a mirror finish. For some weird reason, the company that made this stove, found it necessary to cover every single stove part with blue plastic sticky protector sheet. The problem is that they put all of the parts together and the paper won't come out of a lot of overlapping areas such as hinges and bent edges.

THE BLUE WON'T COME OUT
I have tried and tried to get all of the plastic off of this stove so I could use it. Unfortunately, even though I was using tweezers and pliers I can not get the plastic out from the hinges. If this was not a stove for BURNING things, it might not be such an issue. Unfortunately, I can not get the plastic out totally. I refuse to burn this until all of the plastic is out. All together, I have spent a few days on this combined.

THE BOTTOM LINE
It takes a really long time to get the plastic pieces out of this unit. Even after a few days I am still trying to remove the plastic. I am not sure it will all ever come out. I refuse to burn this with plastic in it since there will be food made with it.

MY RATING
TWO STARS. This stove could be a five star stove. With this plastic problem, I am very frustrated with it and wish I had not gotten it. If the company could put it together and leave the plastic off of the hinge and attached areas, at least you could peel it off and have not issues with it. As a camp stove, I am not interested in having a mirror finish at the expense of hours of work to remove plastic.

PHOTOS
I have posted quite a few photos of this stove after I first got it and then around the first set of hinges I could not remove the plastic from. When I can spare the time, I try to remove more plastic, but this is taking a really long time with way too much effort.

title: Very happy
review: Very good investment. Would recommend it to anyone.

title: Sturdy, pretty purple
review: This scooter is extremely cute and the purple color was an instant hit. It is more durable and sturdy than I expected. The little girl next door is absolutely delighted by the scooter. She been essentially alone for months due to quarantine and social distancing and desperate for something new and interesting. She scoots up and down the driveway and the yard and she's no longer pestering me every time I appear. She is nicely balanced on the scooter and having no trouble steering or propelling herself around.

title: Okay, but not remarkable
review: This lantern came with no instructions whatsoever. I kept looking for a button to turn it on, but it has no buttons. It turns on by sliding the whole top up. Clever, I guess, but I wasn't expecting it and it nearly blinded me. Seems some what dangerous coming without a warning. That said, it is bright. I just received so have no idea how long of a run time there will actually be on the batteries. Guess it's not bad for the money, but kind of small and cheap looking. Really, can't say I find it particularly remarkable, but not bad to have on hand for emergencies and such.

title: Very nice! Makes drinking water fun!
review: This is a nice motivational water bottle. It’s 64 oz., so don’t have to refill a lot, unless you drink a ton of water! It comes with a carrying strap and a straw. It also has a button that pops the lid open easily. The motivational quotes on the bottle make drinking water fun! Also it’s BPA free!

title: Good value product
review: Great for barre workout.

title: Made in Chi-na
review:
Noticed the bag looked dirty and was falling apart, threads and a hole in it so i started looking at the product it's self.

The tips are not finished, jagged edges, the u shape the prongs are on are not fully welded on to their handles. So overall lacks uniformity and integrity.

Figuring out Amazon just sells junk made in China. Learned never to buy clothes from this site.

title: Love these! Perfect EDC bracelets
review: [[VIDEOID:418265147cc1a61bdb4e32c7e0b1aec1]] Great EDC bracelets. I had a paracord bracelet before but the only issue was it was a predetermined size and couldn’t be adjusted to fit better. That’s where these things come into play. The construction it’s identical to my old bracelet with one addition that made all the difference. A tiny extra bit to adjust it to preferred fit. Everything works the way it should. Decent whistle, fires Tater and ok compass. All in all this is the perfect EDC for me!

title: I am very disappointed in the quality of the material
review:
As a person who purchases fleece to make blankets, I know my material well. This fleece material is one of the cheapest that can be purchased. If you look closely at it when it arrives (I bought it online) it looks as though its slightly clumpy or matted from the start. This means that after 4-6 washes this fleece material will definitely have a matted appearance and appear much more worn than it is. The fleece fabric used is also very thin. If you turn the jacket inside out and push your finger firmly into the fabric, it appears that it wouldn't take much pressure to tear. I'm not suggesting gauging it with a blunt object, but it should withstand normal pushing as a clothing item will get when be put on and taken off etc. Again., thats a test us fleece blanket makers check for when purchasing fabric for a blanket that we desire to last through years of "normal" wear and washing. I honestly do not feel this jacket would hod up well beyond maybe 6 months.
Columbia is known for having quality merchandise so that is why I chose this maker. I am very disappointed in the quality of the material. I am certain the reviews on here are from buyers who received their jacket, see how soft it is, tried it on and thought it was well made and left a glowing review. I am curious to hear an update from a buyer after they have worn and washed this jacket a few times. I bought this jacket on sale for $36.00 (original price tag of $60.00) Unfortunately I am returning it today.
Old Navy is known for using VERY cheap material for a majority of their clothing, however they use much better quality fleece for their jackets. I know because I own a couple Old Navy fleece jackets. they're not as stylish as Columbia. Quite plain actually, but mine have held up for several years and still look nice. Old Navy fleece jackets go on sale for $9.99 - $14.99 often, especially around Christmas. Looks like I'll be heading back there to pick a few more up.

title: So Much Fun!
review: My 20 year old has been wanting one of these for a while. There's a lake near her campus and there is always a lot of people paddle boarding. This was easy to set up, though it did take a little while to get it fully inflated.  This comes with a pump, paddle (single bladed), ankle strap, and a repair kit. Everything fits nicely into a backpack which makes it easy for transporting. Once it's inflated, it is extremely rigid and it's hard to tell the difference between this and a non-inflatable one. My daughter has already taken it out on the lake and is very pleased with it.

title: Great for hip pain
review: I bought the 4 x 36 and 4 X12 foam. I place one vertically under each greater trocanter laying on my back. It really lets my sacrum relax and hips get into alignment. I have pelvic torsion so this helps me feel neutral because I'm always twisted and can't get straight. It also helps my sacral torsion when I rock my sacrum on it.  The foam is also great under each butt cheek along the sit behind l bone while laying flat to help release a tight hip flexor. I also sit on it on one sit bone when one hip gets higher than the other to help balance the pelvis. This piece of foam is my life saver for pain relief

title: Isn't slippery, has a nice grip.
review:
This is a nice kettlebell. I have the 10 lb weight. The handle is comfortable and isn't slippery. It has a nice grip.

This is a great addition for working out at the gym.

title: Price is right
review: Not necessarily the best quality but the price is hard to beat and if it they are being used for recreation a good item to have

title: Short Kids, or Short space
review: If you have a few short spaces where your table is located.  These may be for you.  Weighted and does the job in the most narrow space we have.

title: Great for the beach ⛱
review:
We finally got to use this blanket today when we stopped by the beach for lunch. We packed some sandwiches and the kids got their sand toys and we had a good time!
The blanket folds easily and the sand did not stick to the weather proof side which was a plus.

title: Sharpal 6 in 1 pocket knife sharpener and survival tool
review: We purchased a couple of these, sharing them with a few relatives who are intense hikers.  We also purchased for ourselves and our survival kit.  We live on the oceanfront and put in our Tsunami bug out kit.  It has the all important sharpener aspect, but also a fire starter. A whistle, etc.  Husband reports that the sharpener works very well on his pocket knife collection.  Win/win.  We probably all need one of these!  Small, compact and easy to carry or put into a kit.  Having said all of this, I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful. All of my reviews reflect my honest, personal experience with the reviewed item - your experience may be different. I am not influenced by any outside source. I receive/accept NO free products or discounts that are not available to all shoppers- ever. For some reason our shopper ranks are no longer visible - so, to give you a little more info about me, I am a top 50 reviewer (#30 the highest rank achieved). Those numbers used to fluctuate over time - up and down but I noticed that they stopped updating regularly - perhaps to phase them out. It's a shame because it did help you see who has been around the longest and who is a trustworthy reviewer.  I've been doing reviews for over 25 years with Amazon - over 6,000 reviews posted, those reviews have been viewed well over 50,000 times, including well over 24,000 likes. Bottom line, I pay for all my stuff, just like you do.

title: Quality for the price. Minor cosmetic flaws.
review:
I bought this product for moderate general purpose use (sit-ups, push-ups, dumbbells) in a basement with poured concrete floors covered with linoleum tiles.

Physically: 6 mats and 12 edge pieces were included. In a 2x3 arrangement, the mats measure about 49.25" x 72.375" roughly. It was difficult to measure the mats because they varied, in my experience, by about a quarter inch from one side to the other, over the 6 foot length. A 1x6 arrangement is not possible because it would require 14 edge pieces of 12 that are included. They seem to be made of a very dense foam.

Cosmetically: All of my pieces appear similar from afar (no discernible color difference unlike some other reviews). The photo on the back of the product picture shipped with the package has one tile of the six that does not match the others slightly, leading me to believe that it is normal to expect a tile that doesn't entirely match and it seems that I got one but it wasn't a color difference. One of my tiles is significantly grittier and more textured than the other 5 which makes me suspect they aren't all from the same manufacturing batch. The pattern of the tiles isn't entirely straight either and over a six foot length, its noticeable how it seems to run off the side. This matters when you go to interlock the other puzzle pieces because the pattern then doesn't always line up (and I couldn't find a way for all of mine to line up right in a 2x3 arrangement)

Summary: If you're going to do sit-ups on these mats, you may want another softer mat to put on top of these but it should work anyway. They have a comfortable amount of give under the ball of the foot of an 180lb man when walking across them. The texture on the top makes them fairly slip resistant. Personally, I would have preferred squared corners rather than the rounded ones for the corner of a room. The durability is alright for me as I will use these alone, but I'm not sure if I would want to put something as heavy as exercise equipment on it. All in all, for less than $30, they are a bargain compared to the other prices of mats that I have seen (and have not owned). I would buy this product again if I had to replace them.

title: Great Basin
review: I got this as a foot soaking pan and it’s perfect.  I’m in the health care field and, after a day in compression sock, my feet are less that fresh and very sore.  A little peppermint, Epsom salts and surgical scrub (for sanitizing) in hot water and I am restored!

title: Not-so-tenacious tape for wetsuit repairs
review: This didn't come with very clear instructions for how to use the aquaseal and included patches in tandem. The patches say "tenacious tape" but they wouldn't stick to my wetsuit despite the area being thoroughly cleaned beforehand. I ended up applying a copious amount of aquaseal to the area and using it to glue the patch on, but the repair looks pretty ugly with aquaseal sticking out from the edges of the tape. I had hoped this would be much better than the neoprene cement I was using, but it doesn't seem to be.

review: This light is plenty bright for early morning rides. The beam is fairly wide but the center is definitely more bright than the edges, so not the most even lighting. The battery life is good enough for me. On high I get a little over 2 hours. And the tail light is a nice addition. I feel more visible during the day with both lights on flash.

I can see I can use this for yoga/stretching too.  I am willing to pay a little more for a trusted brand and I know I have a long lasting product.

title: Truly enhances air matresses
review:
I received this as a review sample along with the base air mattress ([[ASIN:B00IHX26X6 Lightspeed Outdoors 2-Person PVC-Free Air Bed with Battery Operated Pump]]). The product description provides all of the dimensions and the previous reviews are also detailed, so I will avoid repeating those - especially the product description.

This is offered as a general purpose topper that will fit a variety of brands. I tested it on the air mattress, but also on my bed. It securely affixes to the air mattress, but not my bed. I expected the way it fit the bed because it is not designed for those. In both cases, though, it is comfortable. In fact, the air mattress without it was ... just an air mattress, but with this topper is as comfortable as any bed in which I've slept.

As another reviewer stated, getting it into the included bag is a chore, but it is relatively light and compact for folks who camp. For those of us who are going to use this in the home with an air mattress for guests, it will store easily in most linen closets, as well as in some deeper drawers (the bottom drawer in my chest of drawers holds it.

I did not see any cleaning instructions, but given the size it probably will need to be professionally cleaned (and eventually it will). It will definitely not fit in my large size washer.

Overall, if you have never used one of these toppers you probably will not see the need. However, I will forewarn, though, that once you do use it, you will not like your air mattress without it.

title: Really nice gloves
review: Nice gloves, Just the right (snug) fit for ice fishing. Complete with grip(s) and warmth.

title: Great water bottle, easily my new favorite
review:
I love this water bottle! First of all the color is great, the fact that the inside is metal makes it super easy to clean and keeps the water tasting like water.
It’s great at keeping the water cool, as well as super easy to carry with the rubber strap that’s attached to the lid. I also really like the “straw” thing that you get the water from, it’s comfortable, easy to clean, and is wider than a regular straw so you get a good flow of water.
I’ve used it with the filter, and it works fine, it is a little harder to get water out with the filter attached, more like a straw than tilt and water comes out. I prefer using it without the filter because I have a brita filter pitcher in my fridge that I use to fill up my water bottle. It’s super easy to snap it back in for when I’m going to be getting water that needs to be filtered.

title: Hard No
review:
When you think of fitness, the flex comes to mind. When you think of equipment, flex is the last thing you generally want in an item.

The design seems to miss on this unit. The bolt setup should not have rounded heads that sit into a groove in the metal. Washers for all bolts are essential. Locknuts can be a nice bonus.

The unit is fairly high off the ground which makes the flex more noticeable. This is all from a 165lb individual. I end up gripping close to where the handles attach to the machine so there is less potential for flex. I also ended up getting different bolts since the originals started to eat into the metal.

In the words of Wayne from Letterkenny, Hard no.

title: Very large compared to sizing chart.  Will have to return.
review: At this point have to only give 1 star.  Item is being returned due to sizing being completely off compared to the item description.  Measured my hand and ordered just what was supposed to fit.  They are so big I can slide my hand right out of them without undoing the Velcro.  Very large.  And I ordered the small!!! Not even sure the XS would fit.  Seems more like men's sizing to me, and these are supposed to be women's gloves.

title: Lacking a little.
review: This is an extremely durable backpack with reinforced nylon bands running the entirety of the zipper-line. The straps don't have much padding and are adjustable. There is only 1 inside pocket. It is not padded, but is thinly lined with a softer fabric. The front pocket is pretty roomy. THERE IS NO SIDE POCKET FOR A WATER BOTTLE. For the price of this pack, I wish it would have had at least 1 more zippered compartment, more padding on straps and side mesh pocket for water bottle. Love the almost tweed-like look of the material and material is very durable and waterproof.

title: Excellent distraction for a stallion on trail rides with mares. No problems with pinching or sticking on the rollers
review: I really like this bit for trail work with my 14 year old Andalusian stallion. He has a soft mouth and doesn't require a heavy hand or bit as a rule, but when riding in the company of mares, he can become a bit mouthy and prancy - well mannered, but still a stallion wanting to meet the ladies. (I do not use tie downs or anything like that. Stallions must be gentle or gelded in our barn.) The rollers here give him something to do and think about on slower walking sections of a trail or stops and the bit is just a tiny bit heavier than a regular d-ring. I've never noticed any signs of the rollers pinching and my boy has never declined to accept it. I do check the rollers after every use for indentations or sharp edges and I have had to replace the bit a couple of times over the years - but that's not a big deal.

It fits Mauser M18 .308 and Sauer 100 Atacama 6.5prc rifles perfectly.

title: A great twist on the inflatable lounger
review:
I've owned several inflatable loungers over the years, dating back to the original crowd sourced battle between KAISR and Lamzac. The knockoffs are generally kind of cheap but some have had some great ideas and improvements- but none have impressed me as much as this one. The curve of the inflated product is unique as far as I can tell, and fantastic for making it more comfortable. You don't "fall in and get swallowed" as much as other versions and it is easier to get in and out of as well. I'm hoping this will hold up and last over time, but so far I'm just impressed that people are still improving upon this concept.
If you aren't familiar, the idea is to hold the opening towards the wind and use it to inflate the bag. If there's no wind you can move or run a few feet to capture air, then tighten the end and wrap it up so the rest of the bag is tight and takes on the shape of a lounger. I've found that these are great for not just outdoor lounging, but fun for movie night with the kids inside as well. You can totally use a fan to help inflate it if indoors- just hold the opening in front of the fan and pretend it is wind.
This is a great product and I recommend it if you're interested in trying one!

title: Like a Traditional Hula Hoop but Better
review:
We could all use a little more fitness in our daily lives. Twirling a hula hoop is one way to get the body moving and the heart rate climbing without the need for much space. If you want something like a hula hoop but with certain advantages compared to one, then you might like this Smart Hoola Fitness Hoop.

To use this hula hoop substitute, you put it on and attach the links. The weighted piece then twirls around while you move your hips. The hoop itself holds snugly to your body, so you don’t need to worry about trying to keep it up while you move your hips, like you do with a traditional hula hoop.

Putting this together is a little confusing at first, but once you get the hang of it, it’s not bad. The massage feature is nice and it’s something you certainly don’t get with a traditional hula hoop. The weight is just the right size. I was worried that it would be too hard on my back, but it wasn’t. I recommend starting with just 10 minutes then build up to the 30. If you can make a hula hoop work, then you can easily do this. If not, you can pick it up pretty fast.

I like all the new and improved variations on traditional means of fitness. This Smart Hoola Fitness Hoop is different, and in many ways, better than a traditional hula hoop and a great choice for those who want simple fitness and massage all in one.

title: Functional and handy in a pinch. Sheaths are too small, no carrying case
review:
We have a similar kit we put together from various individual pieces over the years and it lives at the cabin in West Texas. My husband wanted another one for the truck so I tried this. The individual pieces are ok quality and should survive mild, limited use.

The fire starter does throw decent sparks for fire making. The knives and hatchet are fine for basic survival uses in a true crisis. We were able to chop a small branch and peal the bark off it with the hatchet and bigger knife. The paracord wraps gives you a bunch of cord for various applications.

However, our complaint is the sheaths. Not one of them fits properly and you have to wiggle the blades around to get them into the sheath - how many times can you do that before you cut yourself or dull the blades? And there's no carrying case for the set when your on the go - again this is not safe or useful on a hike or backwoods camping trip.

review: If you don't mind polyester, which I don't, these shorts look good and generally feel comfortable except for one issue. The cut is just a little too short so that the back does not come up as high on my waist as needed to stay in place. Instead, the back slides down repeatedly. For lounging around the house, these shorts work just fine but I would not wear them when I am going out and about since I have to keep tugging them up. That's too bad because other than that, this really is a nice pair of shorts.

You can't go wrong with them since they have a lifetime warranty. Insulated cups don't sweat and leave water rings on your furniture. They keep drinks colder longer. Primary reason was damaged lids (bent and dented).  They were the flimsiest part of pots.  I was also disappointed that they did not nest well as the video implied.  You had to press them together, slightly bending walls to allow reasonable containment.  I'm not planning to reorder because of this but they could provide a lot of good service for the right purchaser/user.  .

title: A Beautiful, Smooth Reeling Reel
review:
This is a beautiful and wonderfully functional reel. Aesthetically it is stunning with its brilliant white although that is not my purpose for purchasing a reel. I want functionality...long lasting functionality. Right out of the box and mounted, it feels great. The action is smooth and fluid. I was able to get line onto it quickly. The gearing just sucks up the lineage on each turn, perhaps faster than any reel I have owned. There will be the test of time, but right now it is easily the smoothest working reel in my arsenal.

I put a casting plug onto the line and tested it in the side yard (our open water season is pretty much done for the year.) Casts were smooth and the bail flipped over consistently with perhaps a little more resistance than normal. Again, the retrieve was fast, I would have imagine that they retrieve for a twister tail next spring will be very slow.

I like the size, I put it on a single piece light rod that I typically use for crappie and walleye jigging on the river. The only thing bad I can think of about this reel is that is came in November. March seems so far away... I'll update as I see how well it takes abuse of actual fishing.

It even helped me with my coordination and balance (and for a woman in her 60's it's important for me to build on both to stay young). I have been using this daily now for a good 20 minute work out after I do walking and weights and I feel amazing1

title: Update didn’t hold up after 1st summer.But looked good
review:
Update. Aug 2020. We had wind this summer in Ca. And I think this Canopy should have held up better. This is the second summer, and last winter we took it down to store in the garage for the winter.
Now this yr it’s ruined and for the money I would just buy a less expensive one. This just didn’t hold up as it should have, like the cheaper ones have. Although it looked good. We hopefully are having a wood shelter build soon.
—————-
I live on a few acres in the mountains in California on a river. Plenty of trees , but these shelter canopy’s we put up close to the house , and put patio furniture underneath.
I have to say this is nicer then the usual ones we put up, and this Coleman is a thicker material, and the red material is the part
That you can expand to make this larger then 10 x10 feet, that is a cleaver idea.
You do not have too expand this on all 4 sides .

This is Allot heavier then We expected which is great, but it took Almost 3 adults to get this up,
And took us at least a hour!
I do not think this type of canopy I would take camping, just to put up for a 3 days, or few days, then take it down cause we didn’t find this Easy to put up like the cheaper ones I usually buy that have lasted us about 2 to maybe 3 yrs. and we do not take those down.
Although once this is up, its very nice, looks good, and I have to admit its much nicer looking then my cheapers ones, but more
Important for us is, it keeps the area underneath much cooler.
Also the underneath of the canopy is Silver and reflects the sun and heat off.

I hope this lasts us 3 yrs!

title: well built just as you would expect from Gaiam
review:
This balance board is very well built just as I have come to expect from Gaiam. The four corners on the bottom have a rubber area for non-slip on the floor and they give you an easy way to get a grip when moving it. The size is just right. I have no complaints. It does just what it is advertised to do.

My only wish that I was a younger man with better balance. LOL, Hopefully, this will help with the balance issue. Being a grandpa might be a little late to use one of these. I am guessing that someone 30 years younger will master this right away. For an old guy like me, it may take a bit longer.

Overall I expect this to last for many years.

Cushion is comfortable, firm support, seems very sturdy, not likely to lose its shape.
Even better is the company! I did have an issue, I contacted their customer service and I got a replacement sent out the next day, express delivery. I experienced a very friendly, caring level of support and good follow-up, which sadly is rare these days! 5 star service, I would definitely purchase other products from this company in the future.

If one is sitting on the floor, one could bend over and put one’s head on it - but is it meant for that?  It didn’t come with any instructions for meditation, so we are confused.  A nice small pillow we can use with the grandchildren, so all is not lost!

title: Five Stars
review: Great product, haven't had any problems.

title: Not as described
review: These are not the large matches as described!! Don't wast your money pickup some locally!

title: Nice, attractive, but a bit impractical.
review: Nice little unit, but I haven't been using it.  Users are required to measure ten strides in order to "calibrate" the tracker.  But the length of my stride when I'm in the neighborhood or on a treadmill walking for exercise is very different than when I'm grocery shopping,  walking my small dog, or just moving around my apartment.  Also, as with many of these small high tech devices, it can be difficult to push all the right buttons in the correct order within the given number of seconds to "set up" the device.  And finally, the instructions are printed in what must be a 4 or 5 point font that I found difficult to read.  Hard to punch the buttons in order when you're also trying to hold a magnifying glass!  I guess I needed something a bit lower-tech.

title: Wont look like ugly spare black spare tire in your home!!
review:
SOO PRETTY!! This Pearlescent mint is awesome… And yes I’m talking about a yoga ball!!? I love the ball is not “the ugly black spare tire look that accidentally got left out in the living room..!!

The ridged ball serves a purpose which is something some don’t know! This has “small ridges” (a few inches apart) that circumference the ball. These help keep a person in place when using (sort of like tread on a tire but, it’s not grabby!) I see this very beneficial for any who may need a little extra help ie. hindered with Injury, elderly or, just need or lack natural balance..

Although supplied with a hand pump- be prepared for this to take a lot of effort/time to inflate- the better part of an hour.. (especially with 75cm size!!) This has a thick outer surface to keep it from puncture or bursting- which is nice to give user peace of mind. *This has an internal air bladder in case exterior puncture takes place.. it’s made to “break ones fall“ to the ground and let you down slower so to speak. Slower = 1.5sec to deflate so it breaks the impact if popped vs. hitting ground hard if it pops.. (trust me, it still can scare you but, 1.5 makes all the difference!) Bc of time to fill- we ended up using an electric pump to make quicker work of the task.. Those younger with more muscle may not find this as tedious. Just note: this IS compatible with an electric pump and worth getting it out for the job!!

Overall, this is X1 of the more solid yoga balls I’ve seen- it has such an eye on quality and built in safety Im impressed. Sold at $23- The only thing to make this a better option is offer all inclusive set.!! Hoping this info can help your decision-Stay healthy.. stay safe!

title: Fits and Holds Well!
review: I am surprised at how well this fits - I got the XL size, and had to step into it. It is snug, and stays on, doesn't fold up. It can carry my car key, my credit cards/money and my phone. I love that it's "hidden" underneath my shirt and I don't even know it's on when my phone isn't in it. It's SO much better than carrying a purse. The one thing that I wish was different - no logo on front and back.

title: Looks great, but large to carry around all the time
review:
This bottle is somehow larger than I expected. Measurements are on the side, which help you see how much liquid you are actually drinking.

The colors are great...green, white and watermelon pink. It is lightweight and pretty easy to clean. The white middle has a bumpy section to help you hold on to it.
(One of my photos shows this bottle side by side with my 24 oz Bubba cup for size comparison.)

It is also pretty wide. It made it a little hard for me to hold in my hands.
Overall, this is not my person first choice for water bottles, but that is mainly because it is hard for me to hold. This would be a good bottle for camping or gym workouts.

title: Very small, but it works!
review:
[[VIDEOID:31a1c16114baf937cd66c8620bc917ff]] This would be perfect if it was 3 feet high, instead of 11 inches. Plus, when you lay it back to set it up it is lower. You will need a box to set this on. You can hear the ping when you hit it and the targets do swing then too. I really like it, but wish it was bigger.

title: Love these
review: These dumbbells are great!  I love the rubber coating. They are comfortable in my hands and if I happen to drop them, they don't mess up the floor.  I love the bright color. It makes them easy to spot.

title: Better for beginners than advanced players
review:
I liked the other volleyball I got from Amazon better. These are not bad but they are a tad light. I have been playing for over 33 years now and definitely know a thing or two about volleyballs. I think these are good volleyballs for beginners since they are pretty light and therefore would be easier on their hands when playing, especially setting the ball. Seasoned players, like the ones from my team, were not big fans and their main complaint was that the ball was just too light and they felt like "it wouldn't come back down" comparing it to a balloon of sorts.

The material and make of it is pretty good but the leather is a bit on the cheaper side. As i said I can't see seasoned players using this one, they will in a pinch but for the most part I can recommend this ball for beginners and also kids.

title: They love it!

title: Impressed! High quality and thick
review:
This is my first set of resistance bands like this, and I'm impressed. The bands are thick, come in a nice travel bag, and are high quality. I appreciate that the bands are also labeled with the resistance amounts. I've used these a handful of times so far and they have performed well and have held up perfectly--I'd expect these to last a while.

Overall, I'm really pleased! I'd recommend these.

review: As a wrench, it works perfectly.  The quality is nice and the blue makes it easy to find among my tools.  The price under $10 is a very good deal.

title: Lightweight backpack too big for anything but light items; it’s water resistant
review:
I ordered this pack in their [[ASIN:B07RHNRB6R smaller 20L size]] and decided to order this larger one as well.

This backpack is a bit unexpected in its design. It folds into the exterior pocket. Therefore, the pouch that it came in is actually the outside pocket of the pack. All I had to do was unzip the pouch and unfold the backpack from within that pouch. The act of unfurling the bag forms the lower exterior zippered pocket. All that was left was to do was to tuck the loop inside and zipper the pocket.

I was able to fit some heavy books inside with room to spare. However, I do not recommend using this for books or a computer. Since there is no padding in the straps, it is uncomfortable to walk long distances with this unless the items inside are lightweight--like soft clothing.

The material reminds me of the baggalini-type bags made of a strong nylon. However, this backpack is thin, so I do feel anything with sharp edges would tear through this after prolonged use.  The material is water resistant. I put part of the pack under running water and the water just rolled right off.

Besides two exterior pockets and one interior folder pocket, there are two mesh water bottle pockets on each side that fit my standard-sized water bottles with room to spare. The shoulder straps have a tiny pocket on each side for a flip phone or perhaps tissues, etc. There is a chest strap and side cinch straps, since this is a larger (meaning taller) bag. The tiny reflective strips at the edges of the outside pocket, in the center of the bag, and on the outside mesh of the water bottle pockets are a nice safety touch. In this larger size, they sewed the reflector strap to the outside of the water bottle pockets which allows it to be shown. They did not do that correctly with the smaller version.

Overall, for the current price of $21.99 plus 5% off with a coupon savings, I feel this is competitively priced. It packs small and light and is perfect to carry around for when an extra backpack is needed. However, this 35L size is taller than a full-sized backpack and comes without any cushioning. The water bottle pockets are a little wide, so larger bottles will fit in those pockets. I would not put a laptop in this unless it is protected with a padded sleever or otterbox type case. I would also not carry anything heavy in here since there is no shoulder padding; I certainly found it to be uncomfortable to use with heavy items inside. My other version is smaller and heavy items in that one are not as uncomfortable as in this larger size.
