The 3 inches given on the health club size make a major difference in confidence when you are just going and not looking at the floor.

title: Well-padded lifting gloves that are a bit cumbersome to fasten
review:
I have owned a pair of Lee Haney lifting gloves with wrist wrap for 19 years and which I used three times per week for about 12 of those years. I still have those gloves and although they are a bit stiff, you'd never know they were used so much as they hardly look worn. Since the Lee Haney gloves are not padded, I decided to try these gloves both because I expected an increase in comfort and as an enticement to get me back into lifting again.

The gloves I received are a size "Large" and they are heavier than any other lifting gloves I've tried before; the pair weighs in at 6.2 ounces according to my dietary food scale. However, you don't notice the weight when wearing them. Below are the pros and cons I noticed during use:

PROS:

1. The gloves are well padded. In fact, the padding is an excellent feature for when I perform lifts where the weight is in the palm of my hand, such as when doing a bench press or incline press or when the weight is evenly distributed throughout the hand such as when doing squats using a [[ASIN:B0000AVAL2 Advanced Fitness Manta Ray]].

2. I usually take a size medium or large in a woman's glove and this size large fit me comfortably.

3. The extra "leather-like" flap that you secure to the fastened wrist wrap offers extra security so that the wrap won't come undone during a lift and the gloves will remain securely fastened.

CONS:

1. The padding on the pinkie finger was uncomfortable for me when doing dead lifts because the bar was evenly distributed through my hand and the padding on the pinkie finger seemed to get in the way. It almost caused a pressure point of discomfort during each entire lift (ascent and descent).

2. The wrist wrap was awkward to fasten because not only did I have to wrap the strap around my wrist, but then I had to flip over the "leather-like" flap and make sure it fastened to the Velcro on the back of the flap.

3. I was bothered by the white tag inside the right glove during lifting. Perhaps the manufacturer could either leave the tags out or put them on the non-Velcro portion of the wrist wrap.

4. I don't like that the two pieces of fabric used to fasten the glove to the cardboard insert it came with remain sewed to the glove. Basically, the gloves arrive with two tags on each glove that fastens to the cardboard packaging. Those tags remain as part of the glove and to me they are annoying as I see no reason to ever use those tags again.

I do think that if men are considering purchasing these gloves, they might want to consider ordering the next size up. My boyfriend always takes a size "Large" in men's gloves and he had to struggle to get these size Large gloves on his hands.

These gloves are thick and although they feel well-made they don't look well-made on close inspection. Therefore, I'm concerned that the stitching on the padding may come loose. When comparing these gloves to my Lee Haney gloves, I doubt they will last as long but only time will tell.

If padding is important, then these gloves offer that and certainly cushion the lifter during many lifts. However, for me I can only give these gloves an average rating because of the cons and my concern that the stitching around the padding will come loose.

title: Great barre
review: I love that this is adjustable and folds away. I only have a small space and it's nice that I can hide it away when it's not in use. As for using it, it's very sturdy and does what I need for in-home barre work.

title: Not sure they are heavy duty
review: We've had these for 2 months and 4 of them have already broken...

title: I Bought This Gorgeous Brand New Down Coat- Then The Cat..
review:
It is very hard to find affordable down coats and jackets of late. Finding one that is genuine down, has fantastic fabric and is made well is, well, almost beyond my ability. Then I found this amazing gorgeous turquoise down jacket which is the perfect jacket. Lightweight, warm, and SO pretty. I put my jacket down for a moment to go get something and our cat decided to jump on the jacket. When it slid, the claws came out, and well, there was crying, screaming, and flying cats involved.

THAT is where this kit comes in. Let's talk about it..

WHAT IS THIS KIT LIKE?
First of all this kit comes wrapped in a cardboard wrap that is heavy duty. It folds up to go inside the zippered bag inside the package. The package comes with all that is in the description. It is easy to store, easy to backpack with, and very HANDY to have.

HOW DOES THIS WORK?
First of all, my coat is almost a teflon type nylon. Literally nothing sticks to it. That means that the small slashes in the coat where the down is poking out will not sustain either glue or thread- the weave is WAY too tight. It would ruin it. I was so happy to find this kit and truly put it to the test.

APPLICATION ON THE COAT
This is quite easy to apply. You have to poke a hole in the tube as the cap does not have that feature like most things of this nature do. That is one drawback. However, once the tube is pierced, you smear the clear thick liquid around the tear and just beyond, trying to hold the edges together as much as you can for small tears/holes.

HOW LONG TO WAIT?
I tried two types of patches with this. I did just the holes with the liquid sealant itself and then one longer slash with a clear patch cut down to size. In both cases it took about 24 hours or so to set, although I could WEAR the jacket with the patch on it, but washing will not work. It has to wait a week or so to truly set before washing.

WHAT ABOUT CAMPING GEAR?
Well, if you are out in the elements and need to use this, it should perform fine. The patches will set and the alcohol pads that come with the kit will enable you to clean off the fabric. If it is wet, I would not try this, but it if is dry, this should work fine. If you use a patch, rain will bead off of the surface. You can also use the patches underneath and peel them away once the sealant is set.

THE BOTTOM LINE
In my case, this did seal my coat beautifully. Unfortnately now my gorgeous coat is covered with clear shiny spots everywhere, but it still works and I can wear it in spite of the shiny spots. It has held together so far, but I will have to wash my coat soon so if anything happens this time around, I will update.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This actually sticks to my coat that NOTHING will stick to. That is a huge relief. I love my coat. At least I can wear it spots and all.

title: Strong Magnetic Resistant Levels...
review:
This bike has helped me get into summer shape. The magnetic resistant levels is so much nicer than plain hand tighteners. This way it is easy to remember the resistant level and it will stay on that level till I change it. It is pretty comfortable and just a tad of wobble, but doesn't hinder workouts.

I wish the 'tracker" to know my speed, distance, and revolutions per minute was included. I took away one star because I feel this is essential for any serious bike workout.

Otherwise, this is an incredible bike that helps to change positions to target different leg muscles.

Assembly time is only 20 minutes, if you watch the video on how to assemble!!!

It can start a dead battery and works in extreme temperatures. Each bank works independently of the other. It's also very safe. This is the best bang for your buck. I HIGHLY recommend it.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided helps make your decision a little easier.

title: Two Stars

title: Good fix for weak brakes.
review:
I have a Trek 1.2, which came with really weak brakes. I was afraid that I was going to have replace the calipers and all, but adding these front and rear made the brakes on this bike work fine. I can lock up both wheels without too much effort. I have more confidence in this bike now.

The black part goes forward and the fin goes on the bottom. For fit I simply held them to the rim using the brake lever and tightened them in place. The pads are shaped so that they kinda toe in even with both outside points touching.

It is a good product - very well thought out. Comes with an extra set of pads, plus you can get replacement pads so it's inexpensive after you have the pad holders that come with this product.

The package contains one pair of pads - enough for FRONT ONLY. Buy two to do the whole bike.

review: Slightly smaller than standard stated size. Looks good & is comfortable while being safe around industrial setting. Will buy again.

title: You get a lot for cheap, and it warms some, just not a lot
review: If you want a whole bunch of heat, then you'd need to surround yourself with these.  They do certainly "warm up", but anything under freezing level and they don't do a whole lot of good unless you have some serious gloves already, then sure.

title: Works Great And Looks Good
review: This isn't a $50+ glass display case.  But it is a GREAT display case for under $10!  Got it for the ball that my daughter caught at a game and I'm buying another for an older ball of my own!

title: Easy to use
review: Easy to use breath control monitor. Provides accurate readings of lung and breathing strength in support of breathing therapy.

title: Very nice
review:
They liked this football. I am a Gator, so it was great.
This ball was great. The kids loved playing with it. It is so much better for them to be tossing a ball back and forth instead of staring at a screen.

The quality was good. It held up just fine to their handling.

It was a good size for them. It looked good. It seemed durable and of good quality. I would recommend it.

title: Scuba flashlight that doesn't burden your dive.
review:
My many dive lights don't offer the small size, light weight, rechargeable features -- this one does.

It works nice for scuba diving - recreational. Rechargeable each night, for the next day of fun.

Just remember to lube the o-rings so that salt water stays out.

I've taken this light for travel, and it's fine. My larger BIG glowing lights are not suitable for recreational.

title: Love it!!!
review: Perfect for the Giants fans!!!

title: Almost impossible to fine tune on the fly.
review:
The forward bolt is to close to the stem. It make it difficult to adjust on the fly. You can barley get a very basic wrench in there.
So if your a set it and forget it person, then get this. But if you need to adjust it even a few times a week, don't get it.

title: Not accurate
review: Planned to try to reset it with a magnet so I didn't return but ended up throwing it away. Wanted it for a new driver.

title: Step 1, Crack a cold one
review:
You bought a golf cart, but you need that rear seat. You see this listing on Amazon and can't wait for it to arrive. The good news is that it arrives fairly quickly and in pristine packaging, excellent. There are 2 boxes, one has the structural components, the other has the pads... sure.
You open box 1 for all of the structural components to be laid out and to get your project started. No sense getting the seat pads dirty so you leave box 2 sealed up. After separately out the somewhat accurately described bolt kit labels, you decide to get started. Removing the old pieces from your cart is somewhat of a detailed process and is mostly accurate. DO save all of those pieces just in case (pro tip, there will be a just in case).
You've got the cart in the state it needs to be to begin your assembly. As you begin to use the available bolts you start to loosely piece this thing together so sooner or later it looks like a cart seat. The problem here is that several bolts are not found, you need to open box 2 to find those because they are in there when it was close to 5 o'clock on a Friday and that box wasn't sealed before heading out the door at the Modz warehouse.
Anyways, you've now probably got all your nuts and bolts for the cart and a few have loosened up inside your head trying to figure this out. Most of the pieces will line up properly, though attaching the post to the old seat back slot might not work because they weren't fully drilled out like mine. This is where the old bolts come into play (that's not on Modz though).
You are loosely assembling most of the pieces only to find out that the bolts they provided are kind of accurately labeled for proper measurements. It would've been better to just use a metric ruler though because some bolts ended up where they didn't below. The good news is that you've got some extra bolts you didn't use because you used some of the old bolts. Unfortunately, those are the shortest bolts of the kit so you can't use them anyways. Now you've got some sick spare bolts for some future project that may or may not require them.
Once you go to attach the arm rest to the base of the cart you realize the available bolts will be too long so you can't properly open up the seat to turn into a flat bed. This is where the extra washers come into play (don't worry there's somewhere between 10-67 extra washers) so you can shore up the bolt head so there's less available thread on the end. This helps make sure that the bed opens up properly because you are about ready to lay down anyways. The rest of the assembly goes fairly smooth, though getting the seat back supports off the old Club Car DS is super fun since the nut is buried inside of a channel where only a small team of your kids' GI Joe's tools could fit. Once you've turned into Superman to bend that aluminum enough to gap and get the bolt head secure and the incredibly precise angle of your pliers to free up that seatback support you are home free.
From there it's only a few more screws before you are done with a project that you estimated to take about 45 minutes lasted nearly 3 hours.
Cheers! Next time we get to install turn signals, that'll be easy...

title: Works amazing
review: [[VIDEOID:aa8f5fcf1615dd471af890473ac8558d]] I got this Roman chair for my friend, as he just moved to a new place and he wants to set up his own home gym. This chair works so great and it’s very easy to assemble and it’s very sturdy

title: long length, holds in heat, excellent addition to packs, basic cord included
review:
Super long (90+ inches long) and durable, basically as expected and required. While it could be used more than once, it is really one of those things that are a one and done sort of thing (it will never fold back down small). It is the typical long tube. It includes a length of very basic cordage. I prefer a more robust paracord, so if you have that, maybe use it instead. The added length of the tent is to allow it to keep out the elements and to be able to scrunch it it in. Perfect for keeping gear at one end, and exit/entry point at the other. Of course, how much room you have left over depends on your body size. I have never had one rip. Good for short term shelter and warmth.

I am a big fan of the tents. I always keep one in my every day carry, and my hiking bag. While I do keep emergency blankets on hand, I actually prefer these tents over the flat blankets as it can be used as a sleeping bag. or can be cut and shared.

Cheap enough worth while addition to any pack, emergency kit, car kit, etc. I love stuff like this and often replenish, and often buy stuff like this as gifts.

I dont rate on price, but I do comment. Current price of $8.33 is a little more than I normally spend on the tents, but not entirely unreasonable. It is perfectly fine quality, and will do the job as needed. Some kits come with extra goodies, but I cant attest to the quality.

title: Turn-on button hard to use
review: I'm a big believer in these battery operated lanterns that put out a helpful light during electrical outages. Just wish I could push the button on this one to turn it on and off. Fortunately someone was here to help me with the pushing of that button. Once the lantern was on, it put out a tremendous amount of light to help me navigate in a dark room. That button just needs a magical ability to turn it on and off.

title: Average, then slate can break easily…
review:
[[VIDEOID:838d8d8c4da204941eb490f3170e2f3b]] Nice, but needs extra protection. The slate can brake easily.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Amazing improvement!
review:
Two months ago, I had a custom saddle built on an existing 50 year old mesquite tree. (I found the tree in Mexico in perfect condition) This has been an amazing process and the saddle is 90% perfect. My issue was the new stirrups and leather fenders....so stiff and that equates to knee and ankle pain trying to break everything in over time.

These stirrup turners were EXACTLY what I needed. Holy cow! Immediate comfort and correct placement. They do add length so you definitely need to adjust your stirrups. I ended up going up three holes for proper leg placement after adding these. Fortunately, my saddle maker measured my short legs and added extra holes to compensate.

The addition of these turners means I can mount safely from anywhere and instantly find my right stirrup without looking. The stirrups stay in the correct angle and are balanced even on rough, steep mountain trails. That's a big deal out in the Big Bend desert mountains of West Texas. Installation was quite simple and took just a few minutes. My only complaint is because these are so thick and stiff (they have to be) my ankles can take a beating after several hours on the trails. Even in tall boots. I've begun wrapping them in vet wrap just to add a bit of cushion and that has helped significantly. I'm coming in from hard, long rides without limping anymore because my stirrup placement is finally set up correctly.

title: Fun for indoor activity
review: I like to be able to use jumping rope as an exercise activity, but sometimes the weather doesn't cooperate and I really don't have room indoors for a regular jump rope. This weighted jump rope is a great option for me. Plus I tend to be kind of uncoordinated so a cordless version like this one works better. The display is nice and simple, it has a couple of modes to choose from, I like the number of rotations the most and just keep track of the time on my watch. It's made well, durable and my hands can comfortably grasp the handles.

title: Updated Review after several months of use
review: Not worth the premium money whatsoever.  I've used them in multiple coolers with the same result.  They simply do not stay cold the same amount of time as far cheaper options.  Can't believe I fell for the reviews on this website.

title: Really impressed with the quality...
review: This is easy to set up and very sturdy.  Great, colorful playing surface, and all implements are good quality.  I was surprised by the superior condition of the table - it was well-protected by the packing.  Thanksgiving is going to offer a new game this year - can't wait to see the reaction from grandchildren - who are super foos-ball players and are always up for something new.  Who would guess that Grandma would have a air hockey table!  Folks who have seen it have commented on the quality and the Franklin brand as being top notch.

title: Sturdy
review: This is a sturdy water bottle. It has time markings on one side and measurements on the other. I love the peachy pink color! The bottle is translucent so you can see how much water is left. There's a nylon (?) wrist handle that can't easily be removed. It's difficult to wash the bottle without getting the wrist handle wet. Water doesn't seem to hurt it, but it annoys me when it's damp. The water dispenses easily for the most part. When you get down to the last couple of inches of water, you can't tilt the bottle in order to drink the water. Instead you have to hold it straight.

title: Very Accurate
review:
Golf rangefinders can get pricy for well-known brands. This one has the same accuracy that you'd expect from a higher-end model. The USB charging feature gives you peace of mind that your batteries won't die at a critical point. The carrying case is very useful. You could clip it to a belt or your golf bag. Overall, I highly recommend this product.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided helps make your decision a little easier.

title: Flat pillow
review: Very flat pillow. I couldn't even use it because all the fluff was widely spread out and would not come together. Ended up throwing away

title: easy open and close
review: I really love this umbrella. I got it for my sister, but since it is so elegant looking and easy to carry, I might have to get one for me. It flips open so easily. And the case for it is a beautiful blue. Very nice. Very nicely made, too. I think this will hold up for years of use, especially down here along the Gulf Coast where it rains frequently.

title: Nice Water Bottle!
review: This is a nice water bottle. It has a sturdy feel to it. The top flips open easily with the push of a button. The handle is easy to hold with a 2 finger grip. The measurements on the outside are clear & easy to read. It comes with 2 straws so you have the replacement when needed. The Georgia logo is well done.

title: The Akle has a nice smooth spinning motion…
review:
[[VIDEOID:4a7845d12651d9e64ce702177082837c]] The is actually well made and a clever piece of exercise equipment. I like the the wheels are actually tube and real rubber to create smooth and soft floor exercise. With for the asking price to include more weight than just two 5lbs cast iron. The weight locking mechanism is easy to use. Very creative, but very pricey.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Great for when you can't use weights
review: I'm rehabbing a long term injury and I am still not cleared to use weights when I am working out, so I have taken to using bands to help build the strength back in my body. I think the bands do a great job at building strength back, the workouts are still a good level of intensity, while still getting good results, I think I will probably stick with the bands in the long term.

title: well made, nice holder
review: This is well made, secures great to the bike, holds a variety of drinks.  I like it.

title: No bad
review: Good for beginner...

title: WASTE OF $$. FLIMSY! RUSTS QUICKLY!
review: Extremely  flimsy. Lid falls off & is rusting around edges after just 5 or 6 uses. Very disappointed!

title: Flimsy Pump
review: We haven't had a chance to enjoy the ball yet.  The pump included is so flimsy that it cannot be used and the instructions are not very clear.  Will have to update once I get it inflated.

title: Runs large with minimal adjustments possible
review: Unable to use this as it was way too big and only the front velcro is adjustable.  Needs multiple areas of adjustment in order to fit properly.

title: You get what you pay for :(
review: I was so excited to wear these shoes to work after such great reviews and great pricing. But I guess you get what you pay for. I only wore these 3x to work (I’m a restaurant server) and my right foot is sprained. The left side of the shoe crushes my last two toes! I am in so much pain. I doubt they will give a refund since they have been used. Going with my instinct and getting the $124 vessi shoes I was supposed to get to start with.

title: Plastic stick is too short, not as described
review: Quality of cones are decent; however, I'm putting the flags together and it's not the size as indicated. Flags are only 5.25" x 8" on 11.5" plastic stick instead of 7.8" x 11.8" on 14" plastic sticks. Therefore, the sticks are way too short that would be sitting flushed on top of the cone with no wave. I've ordered a set of orange, green, and blue, which is a total of 30 flags. I hope vendor can resolve. I'm about to reoder same colors and hope I get the right size in my next shipment.

title: Ridiculously Big Water Bottle Doesn't Need Frequent Refills!
review:
I love this ridiculously big POLAR BOTTLE "BLUE BIG BEAR" 42-OUNCE INSULATED WATER BOTTLE! It's easy to grip, even when filled with water and ice, because of the pinched "waist" in the middle. The wide mouth allows you to drop in (rather than squeeze in) whole ice cubes, which makes filling the bottle frustration-free. It has a spill-resistant squeeze top that is easy to open and to drink from. (The valve is removable for thorough cleaning, as desired.)

What I needed was a really big water bottle to keep by my TV-watching chair. With this one, I can fill it daily with filtered tap water, and never need to refill it during my evening programs. It's big, but it fits under the kitchen faucet (when held at an angle). The bottle has a carrying ring that makes it easy to transport around the house.

My "Blue Big Bear" bottle doesn't look quite as good as the product photo. The graphic is printed on a slightly crumpled liner that's inside a cloudy plastic exterior. Thus it takes good light at the correct angle for the graphic to show up well, and for the bottle to look really blue. However, I never liked the graphic to begin with, so I don't care about the looks.

This giant water bottle does keep drinks cold. If you need a high-capacity bottle, it's a good choice.

title: Decent but not sure it will last
review: So far so good although the rollers aren't super smooth and the inside wheels don't always spin. I like that there are many resistance choices.  The knee board construction is just plastic though.  Fine for my 120lb frame but I'm hesitant to let my 250lb husband try it...it feels like it could crack under larger weights.

title: Toddler Toy
review: Do not waste your money on this item, unless it is for a toddler! This may help with hand/eye coordination, but if seeking other qualities; this equipment is, NOT what anyone should purchase!

title: Lights Out Can’t Re-charge
review:
Since I had a house fire 7/14/2020 I had to purchase several of these flashlights/lanterns. Most of the features are great- however, the place you plug the charging cable just pushed in leaving two of them unusable. Very disappointed in quality of the charging area. Not enough bang for the buck!

Would like the manufacturer to replace the two that became useless way too soon and with only gentle use, not mountain climbing or camping just providing light.

title: Good container
review: It isn’t a quart just shy of a quart and I wish they had the lid with the handle!

title: The asphalt tips work well in the house too.
review: So glad to have them. I will be walking with them on trips.

title: Returned
review: Wasn’t aware that there was monthly fee

title: No good
review: Zippers were already broken. Returned immediately

title: Excellent Kayak Paddle
review: I use this kayak paddle with my stand up paddle board. It's a very strong and lightweight item that is a lot of fun to use. The paddle breaks down into two pieces that are convenient for storage. There are three locking positions so you can offset the blades from each other if that is your preference. It's easy to adjust the paddle even when you're out on the water. Carbon fiber is a great choice of material because it is strong and light. This is an efficient and practical paddle.

title: They Love Them
review: These little bags, are perfect for boys. They are great for hiking. They make really great pencil cases, as well. The clip over a belt loop, or can be placed on a bag. They can also double as a stuffed animal backpack, as one of my boys showed me.

title: Fit
review: To thin for work socks

title: A No Shape Hat
review: Not a good purchase. The hat has no form. Sits like a wet towel on your head. The photo online displays it as a hat that has shape and form, however, this visual is wrong. And, although it is a "47" version, mine looks like it was worn already. Suggest any Bengals fans look for alternative sources.

title: Cute Shirt, But Shirt Has Snags/Holes
review: This is a cute kids hockey uniform set. It is suitable for play (dress up) or casual dress. It is not sufficient for actual hockey sport playing. The shirt is a one size fits all, 5-9 years old. The Chicago Blackhawks mascot is securely affixed to the shirt. I can't tell if it's painted onto the shirt or a heated transfer. When running my hands around it, there are no edges to feel. The colors are vibrant. The tag identifies it as an officially licensed product. There are at least 4 small snags/holes on the front of it. It looks like it may have been folded and attached together with plastic tag or something because the holes are evenly spaced and if you connected them it would make a square. There was no plastic tag on it when I got it. The helmet is made of plastic. The images are clear. This is definitely for decoration only and not meant to offer any protection. Overall, it's a cute set. I would give it a higher star rating if it didn't have the small holes in it.

title: Three Stars
review: These suits run on the small size and the colored area is not neoprene.

title: Too small
review: Soft..print is awful...size was smaller than expected...just a hot mess.

title: very nice light, bright, easy to charge, well-made, I like it
review:
I have a number of flashlights from this company. They make very nice lights. This little monster will surprise you with how bright it can be.

I like how the switches are set up on the tail cap. They are very easy to operate. I like the fact that the battery is bigger than a 18650 size. It is easy to charge with the USB type C port. I can charge this in both of our cars too.

Overall, I am very impressed with this light.

I like it and am happy to have it.

title: Easy to use, bigger max weight than many others
review:
I also have a 25lb adjustable dumbbell, and this is nice because it goes up to 44lbs, which is way more than most of these I have seen. I don't often use more than 25, but it is nice for when the need arises.
The handle is comfortable and has not caused me any issues. Also comes with wrist straps
Changing weight is super easy and can be done 1 handed with no issues. It makes it nice and seamless when you are trying to change workouts. Starting and stopping to change equipment can really take you out of the zone.

title: Cute shirt. Graphics got a "worn/washed out" look after ...
review: Cute shirt. Graphics got a "worn/washed out" look after a few trips through the washing machine and dryer though. Bright side, the style of the graphics works well with the worn look!

title: Finger inserts are too big for a woman with small hands
review: The gloves are good, but they should have made the finger inserts smaller with the material that stretches. Everybody do not have thick fingers.

title: Great price..
review: perfect for water exercise....

title: 1 star for the Fitbit band, 5 star for Fitbit Support, infuriating!!
review: The band on this Fitbit Charge HR is its Achilles Heel. I've had the Fitbit for over 2 years and have had to reach out to Fitbit Support for 2 replacements. The first band lost the buckle and surprisingly Fitbit does not have a replacement buckle you could take to a jeweler to fit so they shipped at no cost a replacement/refurbished unit. Fitbit #2 worked great for about 9 months and then developed a mystery bubble above what is the "brains" of the unit. This band bubble grew in size to where it is going to pop. Once again, Fitbit Support is sending a replacement/refurbished unit to me at no charge. I want to applaud Fitbit standing behind what they admitted was an issue with this Fitbit HR. The annoying offer they tendered was to give my wife a 30% discount on purchasing a newer unit where the band could be replaced. Infuriating - if it's a design flaw they should offer full retail credit towards the full retail price of a newer model you can replace the band on. 5 start support, 1 star for product design.

title: Nice looking and comfortable to hold
review: I’ve testered with tap water and it does taste better, not as good as bottled water but close. I mainly use at work with the water from the coolers. Works well to eliminate the strong clorine flavor. The straw works well and the water comes out surprisingly very easy. Great product.

title: Does not include instructions, sturdy/good quality
review: Pretty sturdy. Satisfied with purchase overall. Did not come with instructions so a little confusing as to where to place the washer

title: Like the bag.
review: The bag is great, disappointed it doesn't have something that the ball sits in to keep it from rolling around. I don't take it out of the bowling alley, just in my locker for now. It serves its purpose for me and the price was just right.

title: Best shirt ever.
review: This is a great T-Shirt.  I would buy from them again for sure.  Thanks for the great service and awesome shirt.

title: Just Okay
review:
The construction of this hand grip makes me feel like it's a little over priced for what it is. Although it does feel nice and well made, it is mostly plastic.

The package it came in also had only what appears to be Korean on it. So needless to say I couldn't read the instructions or any information on the box for it. Lol but it seems simple enough, twist the knob to increase resistance. I have a pretty weak grip and didn't find the final setting that crazy so this might not be a good product for those with already developed grips.

title: SHIPPING IS HORRIBLE
review: This is about the 6th time I have "reviewed" this product. I received an empty bottled in a destroyed cardboard box that the Post Office but into a plastic bag to deliver to me.  I have since purchased this product locally.  It does remove some of the salt build up (on a metal outbuilding - we live on the ocean front).  Using in conjunction with a pressure washer... which I think actually takes off more salt than product.  Just my opinion.  I would not recommend this seller until they can address their horrible shipping.  Wonder if this review will stick.

title: Watery
review: Nothing like like I have used before, very disappointed.

title: Bottle looks great, minus 1 star because it did pop open ...
review: Bottle looks great, minus 1 star because it did pop open on us once. I was already planning on buying a different lid for it so it wasn’t too big of an issue.

title: Nice tights, a little loose on me but good quality
review:
I was worried that these would be small after reading some of the reviews, particularly about the waist band. I am 5'1", 100lbs, 24" waist 34" hips and for me the xs was a little big, but the waist band (it's elastic, not a draw string) holds them up well. Mid rise.

I noticed immediately that they are quite warm and seem high quality. I think they will hold up well and I intend to use them for running, hiking, and as a base layer. I wish they were a little more snug, but I recognize that I'm way on the smaller end of the spectrum so I understand.

title: ZERO STARS
review: What a disappointment.  Here I sit on my Birthday in my car, its absolutely POURING, and my beautiful new Nautica umbrella has exploded when I tried to open it, two vanes snapped off. At least I dont feel so bad after reading the other reviews.  What a LOAD OF JUNK. Amazon needs to just quit selling this garbage.  I wouldnt pay $10 for this set now, even with free shipping. TOTAL CRAP.

title: Averaging 75 miles a day on my bike, no chafing, no discomfort
review: I spent a month bike touring down the West coast and after being in my saddle all day everyday this butt butter is a life saver.  No chafing, no rubbing, this keeps my legs moving smoothly without over heating or irritating my skin.  Goes on without feeling oily and allows for movement in my riding clothes that doesn't pull and drag on my skin.  Saved my butt.

title: Two Stars
review: BRUSH is way too small!!!

title: Emergency water for a horse
review:
I needed a sturdy, large water bottle with a handle for barn days or trail riding. Something that could fit in a saddle bag.

I actually use this as an emergency water supply for my horse when we're riding the back country. It's working pretty well this far. I try to have us off the trails by 11am since it can be 102 degrees by 1pm now. But sometimes the heat sneaks up sooner than anticipated and I want my horse to have a water option in a pinch.

The bottle does not leak, pours smoothly into a foldable bucket and fits in a cantle mounted saddle bag.

title: Not the greatest product
review: I bought my first ball on July 10, 2017 had to buy a replacement on April 2, 2018 and today October 23, 2018 my ball just got a hole in it and deflated.  I will not be purchasing from Gaiam another Balance chair ball.  I've been sitting on a ball since 2005 and when my office space shrunk I needed a more mobile ball than the golds gym ball with sand in the bottom.  I thought this was a good choice.  Well, the base is but not so much the ball.  The Golds gym grey ball i only had to purchase at most 4 in almost a decade.  I've had to replace 2 with a possibility of a 3rd Gaiam in 15 months.

title: Top switch on off BROKE!!!!
review: I bought this but in an emergency or dangerous situation IT IS USELESS.  The top part to slide the switch to ON fell off some place (I have no idea, just disappeared while I was out jogging).  In order for me to use it I have to dig a finger nail into the broken slot to slide it on.  Useless for any emergency and basically NOW an expensive flash light only.

title: Average at best…nothing spectacular …
review:
[[VIDEOID:f6544dbf561b7f3dc31170165e24dc8b]] This cooler is different and that is the wow factor. But that is where it ends some too. Not well insulated compared to coolers today. The metal is well made and I love the red color. As you can see the decal wasn’t set right on both sides. Handle could be a solid cylinder or something. It looks good, but at the price point not a big wow factor for me.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Complete Junk
review: Poorly made junk. Made in China and marked "Fury" not Rothco. Even the Alice clips are junk. I wish I had read all the reviews. Actually No Stars. Save your money just look for a GI plastic canteen. Remember look for GI not GI style.

title: Great set
review:
The kids enjoyed playing volleyball.

We really like things to keep the kids active. I would much prefer them doing something than watching something. It is great because it is like a game for them but then they are being physically active.

The quality was good. It worked as it was supposed to. It wasn’t too hard to set up.

This is a great activity for a day when you don’t know what else to do or you want your child to burn off some energy. It is a good way to keep a child busy.

The children really liked it.

I feel like this is good for child development. It kept my children's interest. It would also make a nice gift.

I would recommend it.

title: One Star
review: Misleading image and description. Did not come with 30 rings. Came with an odd amount: 11.

title: Five Stars
review: Very solid and well made.

title: So far so good
review: I just got this since a previous bike pump I had fell off too easily.  I like having this compact pump in case I need air and am not near a compressor.  Though the holder doesn't look as robust as others, I really like the strap that holds it to the holder so it won't pop off like others I've had.

title: Compact and effective
review:
This is a little revolutionary as it is a mix of pilaties and weights with cardio. A a tool for women and this corebody equipment keeps the pieces in one single cylinder. Allows up to 10lb of resistance. I love that it is so compact. I am looking for core strength training that is low impact, not muscle building and not clutter my home with heavy equipment. This is it! I am also looking at the Physique 57 training that is pilates centric too, that creates a leaner look and weight loss too!

This pack includes:" the core trainer, a dvd that has 45 minutes and an 30 minutes express plus focus on core training; a set of cards for 8 workouts to focus on lower body, upper body, core and stretch/renew; a food diary; recipes and workout chart! That is a lot of goodies and use what your level of knowledge and guidance needed.

Workout: very effective and I love that fact it is low impact and I had a great work out. I Love running, spinning and various workouts, but wanted something that is low impact with pilates that is core focused. Instructions on the DVD is very good with one person who focuses on modifications if you are still building your reflexibility and cardio. There are three level of resistances that you can work up to, and for me, I am generally weak on my upper body and this workout will really make me focus on this area, whether i like it or not! The workout works out both core, heart and strength training! 3 in 1!

There are not a lot of extra dvds with this tool: 2 so far, so it will be good if they can provide a few more for people like who needs a lot of variety when working out. Great value and I like this tool a lot.

title: Not too bad
review: This wasn't a bad buy but when it came the board was bent in half so when u put the game up to play the board doesn't lay flat it has a bend in it... The balls and darts are ok, I say "ok" because the darts don't have hardly any area for velcro so it's hard to get them to stick, but the balls are fine... Its a cheap toy at a cheap price but in a pinch it works great!

title: Really love this!
review: Bought this for a friend who absolutely loves this little guy.  Great quality....wish it was bigger...but very cool.  Would recommend!

title: Small dumbbell
review:
Aside from the new neoprene smell for the first week these were great.
I needed two of them in order to do my wrist exercises the physical therapist has me doing and avoid going back to surgery and physical therapist.
So i researched and read other peoples comments before purchasing.

Knowing I needed two was a huge help and knowing the smell at first was a bit off allowed us to anticipate what we were receiving. I can't thank the other reviewers enough for providing their comments.

I'm still using them 2-3 a week. these are the perfect weight, size and grip for my required exercises.
I'd buy the next size up if we didn't already own the solid metal ones.

title: Great quality. Great value.
review:
Just got this yesterday, love it. Put it in air fluff dryer with 3 tennis balls. Did not want to wash right away as others suggest. This bag has better loft than a custom made Top Quilt I bought. Love the colors. Love that head and foot ends cinch up. I close the foot end and use as top quilt. Had a slight odor. I put a dryer sheet in hammock with bag. All good now.

This was shipped UPS and they left package at another house. UPS did not follow up with their investigation of where package delivered; so I had to go hunting for it all over neighborhood. Love the USPS. UPS, I have had problems. Just an FYI.

title: Easy access to parts to clean and dry.
review: We use this for spin bike/ tread, gym. and keeps water cold enough for couple hours of exercising.  More importantly, access to parts to clean and dry..so important.  Because, it is pretty disgusting and I had to throw away expensive over complicated water bottles.

title: Five Stars
review: excellent. satisfied, great price

title: Very thick sturdy dart board
review: [[VIDEOID:20cdc7f1b7fcc046845afec87bd0f657]] The is made out of a very thick cork material which is very good.  However, the dartboard itself seems very old or something with lots of cracks in the painted surfaces.  This will last a while, just beware it may not look very pretty, but most dartboards don’t in time:-)

title: A little pricey but worth it!
review: These are the best dryer sheets if you are a hunter. They work very well. I wish they came in a bigger amount and weren't so pricey but they are totally worth it!!

title: Great gag gift, everyone wanted it.
review:
Gave this to my son in-law, he loved it. Everyone wanted it. It was a big hit.
Got'a give this to someone with a good sense of humor, as all gag gifts.

If I did not need this so fast I could have bought this from a different vender on Amazon for about 3.00 less ?

title: Looks great and works well. Adjustable enough.
review: Cut myself like butter on some razor sharp metal burs trying to put the leg pad rods into the frame. Check for metal burs and probably wear gloves for that step when assembling. Great product though.

title: Great pot.  Be careful with lid.
review: We use this coffee pot daily on our kitchen stove.  Tired of pots claiming to hold 8 cups, meaning forty ounces.  We use 12 oz mugs, so a typical pot holds roughly 3 1/2 mugs-not enough for a couple who do their daily bonding over a hot mug o’ Joe.  This simple, handsome pot holds the days beverage.  It’s easy to wash, sturdier than our last similar pot, and is perfect for our needs.  There is a metal attachment between the lid and the handle, however, that may well succumb to use before the rest of the assemblage.  It is a clip that can be widened ‘narrowed as needed to close pot properly.  Because it needs to be malleable, the repeated handling of this softer metal piece feels as though it will at some point snap from being forced open/closed.  Time will tell.  Today it’s IDEAL!

title: Unlock the paid features!
review: It is very upsetting to buy an expensive device, only to find out I have to pay an additional monthly service fees to unlock features.  It is detecting arrhythmia, but keeping it secret from me unless I pay an extra fee.  I could be dying, and it would only report I need to upgrade my membership.

title: Sticky Hands
review: I used the Spin iT Football Sports Grip Spray with my son before we threw the football together. We sprayed it onto our hands and massaged it between our fingers. Our hands instantly became sticky. I would say I had a better grip on the football. My son was catching it more too but that could also mean I was throwing it better, lol. I do think it was losing it's stickiness after a couple of throws though.

title: Nice product
review: Theses are a nice size bait. Very shiny even in cloudy water.

title: Dog shirts are junky!!
review: I guess I should have realized with the price, they were not worth it!  They are sized small & not worth the money at all!!!!!!!!!  I would never purchase these, or recommend them!!!  Totally junky!!!

title: Great Addition to Our Exercise Room!
review: My husband and I have been doing Weight Watchers this year and were very excited to get this for indoor exercise. As far as putting it together, it wasn't too difficult for my husband. If you have never assembled things like this, it may be more challenging.  It does come with a little "L" wrench, but fortunately my husband has a couple of hex wrench sets that he was able to use which sped up the assembly. He put most of it together in the living room and then when he had the two halves of it (front and back), he carried them down to the basement where we are going to keep it to finish. Our bike did come with two left handles. There was a sheet inside the box that said if you are missing any pieces, contact them instead of the store where you purchased it. In our experience, it's not that uncommon to have an incorrect or missing piece. I immediately e-mailed the company and they shipped out the new handle. This was actually a lot easier to get the missing piece than it is with some of furniture that we have had to put together in the past! The bike works quite well. My husband has been using it almost every morning. The seat is not very comfortable, but we have found that to be the case with other exercise equipment. I put a small pillow behind my back when I'm riding it and that improves that a lot. After reading some of the other reviews, I expected it to be really noisy and loud, but it's not at all. My husband was using his own bike on a stand to keep it in place and this is not much louder or noisier than that. It's also a little quieter than our treadmill. We don't have to turn the TV up too loud for it to be heard while using it.  There are a few different levels of resistance and it is pretty easy to change those for your workout. Overall, we are pleased with this recumbent bike and the customer service that the company provides.

title: Larger than what I wanted
review: Too large, over 65

title: An ok flint and steel striker
review: We have a couple emergency fire starters like this, but this one lacks a few things that I would have liked to see.  Mostly, it would be nice to have some magnesium.  To call it 3 in 1 is a little bit of a misnomer as there is a whistle and a flint and striker, so basically two in one.  It is ok, but to be honest, we have better solutions.  This one does spark ok and I think you could get a fire going with this eventually under ideal conditions, but I would still keep a small container of dry tinder to get a fire going.  We use magnesium scrapings for wet condition emergency fires.  I just wish this was a little more.

title: Very Large
review: I ordered a 2XL (I’m female 5’6” 195 lbs.). It was HUGE! Could have put 2 of me in it. I don’t understand the sizing. Do men really have 21” and 26” chests? Sounds kind of tiny to me. Guess I’ll try again with a Large.

title: broke after few uses
review: worked the first few times it fell appart

title: Good buy
review: Solid, good size, and easy to use.

title: Buy it! You’ll be glad you did!
review: I am so happy I bought this! Assembly was not bad- the instructions aren’t great and no UTube assembly video for the pro- but I figured it out in about 30 minutes. I use it all the time, and it works: butt, thighs, abs, arms and back! Easy on the knees and fun to use. Great, sturdy machine with lots of ways to use it to keep in good all around shape!

title: Excellent for stretching in the morning
review: I really appreciate that this has loops for putting my foot through.  The strap is very strong and is a perfect length for most exercises.

title: Fitbit
review: It doesn’t show text messages nor incoming phone calls other than that it works great.

title: Leaking within 5 months - 2nd defective bottle
review: I love Camelbak for the most part. I own more than 6 other bottles, varying from the sport kind to stainless to other hard plastic bottles, but this one has not met expectations. The filtering works well, but I have had two defective bottles within a 5 month period. The first I was able to return to Amazon for a replacement. Now I am on my second, and just within the last month the bottle began leaking terribly. Even with the bite valve down, water pools under and around the valve and then eventually dribbles down the side of the bottle, causing a huge pool of water underneath the bottle. It makes a mess all over my desk and then if I slightly tilt it for a drink, the water that has pooled in the lid gets all over me. Unfortunately I cannot exchange it at this point anymore. I wish I never got it.

title: Perfect fit, thin, rugged built. Read full review for details
review:
Update, used with my Kenia 65 cooler other day, it worked wonders, as the cheap ice I used started to melt this divider helped to refreeze the ice on the bottom of cooler. This helped make my ice last even longer. After 4 days of use it finally thawed. I did how ever notice it didnt seal to bottom of cooler. Meaning water will get to the other side as ice melts. So if your using the divider for dry side wet side it isnt going to work. You will have to make some type of seal between the two sides to have any chance of keeping 1 side dry.
But if your using just to help ice stay froze longer this is so perfect for that use.

I love my cooler and it will pay for itself within 40 days of using just off the ice savings.

This worked perfectly for my new 65 quart Kenai Cooler.. apperently the Grizzley Company owns Kenai as well judging by the pamphlet provided with cooler, so there wasnt much research needed to find one to fit.

There is a few lbs of weight (unfrozen) for it to be less then an inch thick, it's also very rugged, I'm sure it could take a drop or two and shouldnt have any issues. It fit perfectly inside the center divider groove and has about 1.5" left from top inside lip.
There is a drain plug on the ice pack for replacement liquid. The pack is thin enough it will freeze pretty quick but it does have some size to it so freezer space may or could be an issue. This will help to precool your cooler before use so you can get the maximum duration of chill out of you high dollar purchase and use it to keep you cup ice seperate from chilling ice that hands, cans touch everytime its opened.

If you find this review helpful, please vote, so Amazonian browsers can better learn, research and understand how products work for them.!. Thank you and Happy Buying

title: Easy to Carry Quality Bits for my Ebike
review: These are easy to carry when I am riding my ebike, and have handy in case my seat or handlebars should ever come loose. I matched this up with the very small Prestacycle Prestaratchet Pro Tool. The bits, along with the Pro Tool, are very good quality.

title: Great goggles!  Use them daily.
review: I use these to swim laps in a salt water pool.  They work great!

title: Gave it away
review: The head band could not be adjusted .

title: It’s loud!
review:
If you want to be loud, then this megaphone is what you need! It requires 4 C batteries (not included), and has a speaking setting and a siren/alarm setting. The siren/alarm gets loud and can get annoying real fast. My kids love this feature though. 😂

It has a volume control so you can adjust the loudness, which is good. The handle is foldable and actually works as a bottle opener which is pretty neat.

The only thing that could make this better, is if it was charged by USB instead of regular batteries.

title: This table may be tiny standing 15 inches tall but it is well-designed & versatile for many uses as a side table or stool
review:
This is a very tiny table that stands 15 inches tall when fully opened (17 inches when closed) and stands a few inches below my knee. The table/stool has a small 10 inch by 12 inch surface area. It is designed for use when sitting in a low camp chair. This is also very light and easy to carry when folded because the frame acts as a handle. What I particularly love about this tiny side table is that it opens and closes easily but is structurally sound when in either position. I own a full-sized plastic table that is designed to open and close the same way but dangerously collapses at the slightest touch. This table does not do that because it sort of locks in place. It also appears to be made of aluminum.

I purchased this to use as a small table for my balcony for plants and for use as a temporary table to lay books or other items next to me when I am sitting at my desk. I love that it folds down thin enough that I can store it behind or under furniture. I bought mine for $14.99 at a Sierra Trading Post store near me. This was their regular price and they only had one left which was a floor sample. It also had a slight scratch in the top but the table so impressed me that I overlooked that and purchased it anyway since it is also cheaper than Amazon. According to Amazon's site it can also be used as a stool for anyone weighing 200 pounds or less. I tried it as a stool and it was reasonably comfortable.

In summary, this table may be tiny standing 15 inches tall when open but it is well-designed and versatile for many uses as a side table or stool. It folds down thin and the frame can be used as a carrying handle. It is also light enough to carry anywhere. It is easy enough to set up and close yet sturdy enough not to collapse in on itself at the slightest touch. I consider this perfect for home, camping, or just using anywhere one needs a tiny chair (for those under 200 pounds) or tiny side table (for plants, at a ballfield, etc.). I wish it came in larger sizes and other colors (such as teal and purple) because I would buy several more.

title: Workhorse of a cart.  Needs improvement.
review: Easy folding, easy storage in trunk of a car, to/from golfing. Holds up to daily wear and tear.  Yet, the plastic storage container needs better hinges. The wired break is too much. A foot break has less moving parts, and is reliable.  Just total respect for the two mesh bags.  Excellent on that account.  My experience with the middle wheel is negative.  It keeps dangling when attempting to store it away (because it's not locked into place until ready for play. ) Easy cleaning, and it keeps looking good the next day.  Takes abuse of daily golfing.  But, overpriced.

title: Gorgeous
review: It’s so pretty that it’s motivating to use it more.

title: A perfect place for my pistol!  Safety First!!!
review: [[VIDEOID:8e6f9be98db81eea9389748f9d57b64c]] Wow a solid vault with modern features for quick access for the responsible gun owner.  This is the safest gun safe I have ever had!!!  I never keep a loaded gun in the house and this has provided the safest place for me to keep my pistol and bullets.  It also has a 30 second night light that comes on when opened.  This is a great feature for at night.  With this safe I feel like everyone is protected!

title: Cheap
review: Very cheaply made they come apart and the design looks misprinted on the flights. The case is also cheap and doesn’t shut right

title: Annoying lid.
review: Like others have said, the lid is annoying. I jabbed myself in the face a few times.  Them I tried turning the bottle sideways a bit but it tends to spill. I love the color and it emits a really lovely musical tone when you bonk it off something. :-)  And it does insulate well. But the lid......hopefully they redesign that.

title: Wonderful
review: I've used a regular roller for years and have really liked it - but my original is harder and larger. This is way better. It's small enough to carry without (a case would have been nice) and adding the vibrations to the roller seems to take it to the next level. I'm recommending them to friends and family (and making sure no one sees mine when they come to visit). Using it regularly and very satisfied.

title: a very cheaply made carabiner
review: cheaply made, break easily, not good for anything

title: Solid bottle
review: The bottle is great, it comes with two lids which is amazing. The bottle is very durable. I dropped it a lot already so it has a lot of dents but the paint hasnt chipped.

title: nice bottle but the strainer handle broke the first time, threw it away, oh well
review:
This is a nice bottle BUT I ordered it for the strainer that came with it and the handle broke the very first time I used it. I threw the strainer away and now I have just another one of many bottles like it. I am not sure yet whether I like the odd shape or not. I think I prefer my round ones.

Honestly, I am not that impressed with this one. Sorry.

title: Nice. Plenty long velcro strap to get a snug fit.
review:
As expected. Perhaps a bit better as seam stitching looks well done.

But we shall see. Time will tell...

title: Flimsy, cheaply made and suitable for limited, non critical uses
review: If you're expecting a strong cord and key band or carbiner, you need to look elsewhere. These are very, very lightweight and flimsy. The lanyard cord is just elastic that stretches and the ring is the same as you use for pet id tags. It's not strong or secure for something critical like car keys while you're out walking dogs or hiking.  I'm using these for the name tags that are on our horse buckets so each horse's feed mix is in the correct bucket. But that's about all I would trust these lanyards for.

title: Fogs up after many attempts with anti-fog
review: The fit is good, but the lens fogs terribly even with multiple anti fog treatments of different products. Color correction is moderate.

title: Broken instantlyu
review: They break almost instantly. DO not waste your money

title: Makes your workouts more intense!
review:
[[VIDEOID:ce6de0fd9dc2867458f33ec39d2a5505]] Not only is this therapeutic, but it makes your workouts much more intense. This can be used solely to stimulate blood flow and reduce inflammation. But, I like to use it for making my workouts harder and more intense. This machine has one powerful motor in it because it never feels stained or lags. This is a machine that can workout as hard as you do. I also, really like that it helps me to concentrate on areas of my body that needs firmed up. It helps me to feel and pinpoint those areas by the vibrations.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Nozzle is a little short
review: Don't have any issues with this water bottle, it has a nice finish and keeps my drinks cold. The only thing I don't really like about it is that the nozzle on it is short, it's like half the length of the nozzle of my hydro flask, and other brand nozzles. Makes drinking a little less comfortable.

title: Good quality
review: Used for outdoor hammocks.  Does just what I wanted

title: Scratches very easily. I wouldn't buy them again
review: Scratches very easily.  I wouldn't buy them again.

title: Practically Perfect In Every Way
review:
Fully assembled in the box, attach a disposable propane bottle (not included) turn on the gas, press and hold the button until it lights.

The setup instructions are meager and I would recommend the manufacturer put more detailed instructions on the web.

I have used it maybe a dozen times so far. Clean up is easy. Turning it on is a breeze. I had never used a small propane grill but the hook up is simple. You find the 1 pound propane bottles in all the larger stores.

The weird thing is that the legs are not long enough for the propane bottle so you must be able to put the grill on surface that allows the bottle to hang off the end.

You can adapt the fuel to a larger fuel source but that defeats the purpose of the portability.

Heats up super quick. VERY light weight. I have easily cooked 4 steaks one meal, 6 burgers another, 6 chicken breasts another, a dozen hot dogs another as well as 4 pork chops and 4 sauce last night.

The drip tray is easy to remove and clean.

The travel bag is super a mesh side pocket for the gas canister, but you don't want to put a dirty grill in it and bring home to clean - the bag will not be pretty. The lid latches and the legs fold for storage in the bag .

The stainless steel looks great and the bag is terrific for storage and reducing scratches - the product seems durable - I'll let you know if I am still using in a couple years.

I got this mostly for emergency needs but found myself addicted to the ease of grilling quickly and without a fuss.

title: APP NO LONGER WORKS, WATCH USELESS
review:
UODATE AUG 11. 2021:
The sports+ app required to update this watch has not worked in weeks. I have two of these watches now rendered useless. Be warned!!

UPDATE: July 25, 2021:
The app, Sports+, that is required to make these watches work, has STOPPED working. This renders these watches useless. If you look at the app unfo on Google Play Store, you will see numerous complaints with no fix in sight. Very disappointing. I bought 3 of these in total, so I am waaaaay out of pocket.

Things to Know:
Uses the app "Sports+" available free from Google Play Store. Download the app to help you set up the watch.
Turn on Bluetooth on the watch using the LIGHT button.
Thexset up process is a lot easier through the app.
The user manual is thorough.
The price is very reasonable.
Time keeping syncs to match your phone and is very accurate.
Appearance of the watch is a plus. Mine is red.

The light for the dial is not as bright as I would have liked.

Overall a decent choice.

UPDATE, MAY 2021
Well, I tried to change the battery vecause the light seemed dim to me. I made a sorry mistake. I would say DO NOT TRY to change the battery yourself. I cannot restore the watch to its original condition because there is simply too much to realign. I also "lost" two small screws that affix the back. My fault. A word to the wise.

title: Not high enough
review: Too short for me. Could not use. Waste of my money.

title: Very attractive zip-up hoodie; logos are vibrant, but hoodie is very thin
review:
This is a very attractive zip-up hoodie. The Patriots logos on the front, back, and sleeves are substantial and vibrant (see photos). This is also true to size but the hood is a bit over sized in my opinion. There are two generous side pockets.

I like the blue color because it is attractive on me. However, since it is dark, it does pick up all my cats' hair and lint. What I do not like about this sweatshirt is that it is about half the thickness I would expect for a jacket listed at $65 retail. It is very thin and I really dislike that. I have not washed this yet, but based on the feel of the fleece inside, I would hang dry this or dry it on low. This is made in China of 60% cotton and 40% polyester.

title: Bills Mafia keeps rolling!
review: Hell yes! #BillsMafia

title: Way to small
review: My girl doesn't have a bigger than average head yet this is WAY to small

title: Battery issue
review: Returned. One battery didn't work. Tried recharging both and they started to heat and smell.

title: No leaks no fog so far
review: I totally agree with other reviewers. I'm a woman with a smallish head/face and these goggles fit perfectly. No water, no fogging up, and no uncomfortable tightness where you feel like it's ripping your face off when you remove them. I've only had these a short while so I don't know whether performance will degrade over many uses, but I like them well enough now  - even if they do go down hill later - that I'm ordering another pair right now.

title: Easy Peasey Installation
review: I don't even want to think of all the suitcases I have thrown out because the wheels shredded. This 63 year old woman had no trouble hacksawing the old wheels off 2 Samsonite & 2 AT suitcases all with swivel wheels and replacing them with these. The multi color wheels should make it easier to identify my luggage on the luggage carousel. Tried pulling the suitcases on carpet and it glides smoother. These wheels are quieter on both sidewalk and tile than the OEM ones. Great purchase. Just as a precaution I will buy an extra set to keep a wheel in my suitcase just in case of an emergency; one never knows what condition a suitcase comes off the plane in and this should be easy enough to switch out if needed in the airport instead of dragging a suitcase with a busted wheel.

title: Five Stars
review: Great fabric. Quickly shipped. Slightly thinner than most fleece, but still cozy and fun print.

title: Large brolly with plastic spokes [allows for more flexibility against strong wind?]
review: It’s pretty large umbrella.  We didn’t get the usual strong wind to test the spokes, which are plastic versus metal: maybe allow more bend/flexibility.  One minor thing to note, the strap to hold the folds goes in the opposite direction to all the umbrellas we have owned in this life time!  Also great to gave a reflect trim for traffic safety.  Otherwise, appears to be a quality brolly.

title: Five Stars
review: great fit to size ordered

title: Great Bed....
review: This is a fantastic airbed.  It is comfortable and easy to set up.

title: Too small for most faces
review:
I have kids aged 7 and 9 that wanted these (hurray for double packs!), but sadly they couldn't wear them in the pool for more than 5 minutes without complaining they are too tight. I loosed the straps for them, but it didn't help- apparently the around around the nose bridge and eye sockets are just not large enough to be comfortable, and no amount of strap adjusting makes a difference there.
My kids don't have large faces. Other goggles fit them fine. It's just these that are a problem. I'll give it 3 stars because they DO work at being functional, and I like that you get 2 for the price of one, but be warned that your kids might not like them.

title: Very Good Soccer Ball, but the Price?
review:
One of my kids is really into soccer and she attends camps and plays in soccer leagues whenever she can. She needed a new soccer ball, since her previous ones were worn out and losing air, so I went ahead and got the Wilson NCAA Forte Fybrid II, the official soccer ball of the NCAA championship games.

Straight from the box, this soccer ball is a little lighter than expected. In fact, when it arrived in the mail, I thought it had to be something else because the box seemed too light to have a soccer ball inside. But that is what it was and within seconds of opening the box, my kid grabbed it and started to practice.

The standout feature with this soccer ball is the design. The colors make it easy to spot and follow with your eyes during play and the textured surface is better for ball control and taking shots. It is superior to other, less expensive soccer balls, some of which have a completely smooth surface and seem more like a volleyball than a soccer ball.

My kid reports that this soccer ball is easily better than others she owns so I will take her word for it in that department. However, I am a little concerned about the price. It seems quite costly for a soccer ball and I can see how some people will have reservations about buying for that reason. I can’t really compare this directly with other soccer balls of comparable price because I have never purchased one. But I would bet that, somewhere out there, a manufacturer has a soccer ball that is just as good and priced lower than this one.

Soccer is a big deal to my kiddo and she does like the Wilson NCAA Forte Fybrid II soccer ball. It is a good soccer ball overall, but I recommend covering your eyes and not looking at the number on the screen before you purchase. Think too much about the price and you might change your mind.

title: Too narrow, otherwise a five star product
review:
I received this as a review sample and was quite honestly surprised by how cleverly it's designed. More about that below. The main issue I have and why I subtracted a star is it's a little on the narrow side. Otherwise, it's perfect. And for me that includes the relative thinness because I tested it outside on my lawn and it was actually comfortable. Or as comfortable as it can be since laying on it is akin to walking a tightrope because of its narrowness.

When I claim it's cleverly designed I am not exaggerating. It self inflates by opening a valve. For me between the material and the inflation it was sufficiently thick to be comfortable on my lawn. Obviously it will require relatively level and soft (or at least rock free) ground. I closed the valve after it inflated and when I was ready to roll it up all I had to do was open the valve and tightly roll it.

The rolling up part was where I expected a struggle, but that was smooth. It does not roll back up as tightly as it's rolled when you first receive it, but there is still ample room to place it in the included carrying bag.

If I have one recommendation for improvement (aside from making it wider) it would be to use velro straps attached to the air pad instead of the elastic 'garters' that come with it. The 'garters' work fine, but can be easily misplaced. Otherwise, for me this is perfect.

title: usable, sturdy, uncomfortable
review: very uncomfortable at ankles; must wear heavy shoes

title: Be prepared means having equipment that will work when you need it
review: I am a fairly big (wide) guy. This goes with me into the Alaska wilderness along with an original space blanket as part of my 10 essentials. Leave the $1.00 mylar plastic ones at home. Find someone in severe hypothermia and you could easily wrap 2 together and save a life.  Bigger is better... and the quality will last for years in your pack...  Would not make a good shelter, but build a small fire and turn yourself into a reflector oven. Worth the cost. Have it and you will hopefully never need it

title: Strking Out With This One
review:
One of my kids is a daughter who loves to have lots of black legging style pants. She not only wears them for athletics but under skirts or dresses. I thought for sure that this pair would work out, but let's see what happened.

WHAT ARE THESE LIKE?
These yoga pants seem to be thick. They have a high waist with about 3/4 inch elastic encased at the top, and the legs are pretty long. These are a size LARGE

SIZING
I got a size LARGE because my daughter usually wears between a size 10 and 12 US size misses. I figured that these would be plenty big enough for her. I gave them to her to try on and finally she decided to try them on. I was startled by screams from her bedroom about, "Hello, camel toes"

These were too tight, they did not fit right and the dreaded "camel toes" effect in the crotch made them an instant "NO" for her. I usually wear a misses LARGE and these did not fit at all. They were way too small.

SEE THROUGH?
These are not quite as see through as other pants of this type, but they are way too tight. They just don't seem to be designed with appearances in mind, nor comfort for that matter.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Even though these run smaller, they still have a really frustrating fit in the crotch area and were immediate rejected as unwearable by one of my pretty easy going kids. They are more suited for someone that has very slim hipline, perhaps?

MY RATING
TWO STARS. Sizing is off, style seems to be off, these just struck out for us.

title: Warm and Mobile
review: I really like the feel of these gloves. The material is like a thick spandex, so they're not clunky like a lot of other winter gloves. They keep your hands warm without limiting what you can do with your hands. I will likely stick with gloves like this from now on.

title: Five Stars
review: Same as the strap fits and works on my boat perfectly.

title: Didn’t Last Long!
review: We thought that this would hold up well due to the fabric covering and the reviews, but were wrong. We purchased this last June, and were only able to use it 3-4 times last summer, and the last time it was used, it seemed like there was a leak. When we added additional air this spring, it lasted in the water for about 15 minutes before it started to sink. With the air chambers totally enclosed, it is impossible to determine where the leak is, so it looks like it will go in the trash. We fortunately have two other towable that we have had for 3 years that are holding up just fine. Will not purchase from this manufacturer again.

title: I recommend it
review: I Love my gallon jug it keeps me on trade with my water drinking.

title: Less than one day in and the 'issues' are obvious
review: I have a FB friend who swears by her FitBit Force (which I understand is no longer available), so I thought I would compare FitBit models and get the one that was right for me.  Not only did the FitBit One have more features that appealed to me, but the reviews were resoundingly more positive, so I figured I would give it a try.  It came early this morning via UPS, I've already given it a good full charge, read all the pertinent information on the website, and have a solid understanding (I believe) of what I needed to do - and have done - to set it up and get to using it.  Right off the bat I began counting my steps:  The first 30 steps recorded as 84 steps.  Ten more steps (which put me at 40) recorded as (a new total of) 106.  It does say STEPS, not feet.  Hmm.  Will definitely add to this update, but it looks like a cheapy $5 pedometer would have been as accurate for step count (heck, I think Google and Apple have apps available for free that couldn't be worse - I mean, this thing was wayyy off!).  I will update my review a couple of more times IF I find the discrepancy either improves or worsens over the next few days.

title: Don't Buy the Hype.
review: It's fine, if you really want it. I have one, I got locally for $12.99.  Don't buy into the fanboy hype, don't pay more than $13.  These amiibos unlock things in some games, they are not necessary to play any game.  Nintendo muffed the release and now there is rampant price gouging,  my suggestion is wait, if you really want one you may want to try preorders of the upcoming waves.

title: Amazing, Intuitive and Forward Thinking
review:
I never write reviews, but felt compelled to after using this for almost a week.
I have a problem with drinking enough water. I’ve tried Yeti, hydro jug, every brand and the water will sit there all day full. The reminders on this bottle help me stay hydrated during my busy work day. The best part is it’s become a routine for me after only a few days. I no longer crave sparkling beverages or soda. Just water.
I’ve hit my water goal the last 4 days and feel better than ever. Great bottle.

title: you get what you pay for
review: terrible, you have to hold it facing in the opposite direction to feel any air. Don't buy, get the O2 Cool one it's great

title: is more like a shirt and it runs small
review: This is cute don't get me wrong but its definitely NOT unisex, is more like a shirt and it runs small!  I got it for a good price so that makes it OK. But if I had paid full price I would have returned it.

title: Great if used alone-Not with anything underneath
review:
Great mat for a mostly flawless practitioner. This is what it claims to be. Absorbent! Gorgeous colors! And YeS, it IS Skidless-unless, like me, practicing on a hardwood floor, I need extra cushion under this, using my usual sticky mat underneath.
Unfortunately, this moves all over the place on top of my sticky mat.
IMPORTANT note: IF you place ONLY this mat on floor, w/nothing under it, it RoCKS! IF your practice is somewhat flawless-we'll never be perfect...OMmmm...the mat may be PeRFeCT for you. My issue is from chaturanga, jumping forward doesn't happen flawlessly regularly. When my foot hits where I don't want it to, the mat inevitably moves (because I've got the sticky mat underneath.
BoTToM LiNe- if you practice with nothing under the SKiDLeSS, OR, if your practice is precise enough so that your feet land where you want them to almost every time...You WiLL Luv this mat...if you place anything Under the mat, your practice should be flawless enough so that you're not adjusting this nonstop'Namaste

title: Great bands
review: I’ve recently started adding bands to my workouts. I travel a lot and it’s a pain to haul all the things you need from place to place. These bands are heavy duty and come in a convenient carrying bag. They feel very durable so they make a great addition and allow me to do more without having to haul equipment or use a substandard gym in a hotel. Works for me!

title: For younger youth.
review: [[VIDEOID:42a97618e13fc81a06d8bf2e5aa87757]] Weight limit says 100lb but that seems too much a load for this kayak. It’s very very light and very very short. It’s only like, 70inches. All the youth kayaks we’ve used in the past are about 12” longer. There is no seat! Did I miss something? It was delivered with the wrapping all torn but still included a paddle. There are side tie down cleats. So, really, perfect for an elementary aged child.

title: Work great
review: Great value. I put this on my mountain bike and they work well and we’re easy to put on.

title: Decent concept poorly executed
