review: The Dark Room Fast Pitch Dome idea is good: the interior is roomy, the dark panels do cut out a good deal of light, and the tent is fast and easy to set up (external clips attach to the poles with no sleeves to fiddle with).  But what a steaming hunk of crap in the execution!  It leaks in the rain, there are visible small holes in almost every screen and the rain fly straight out of the box, and the cheap molded plastic "pockets" for the pole ends are weak and brittle.  One of these broke the second time we set the tent up (and I've been setting tents up without problems for 30 years).  The stakes are flimsy, the poles are heavy and rattle, and everything just feels like junk.  This is fine for a backyard play tent (I bought ours at Costco for $90, so my expectations weren't high), but I wouldn't trust it camping father afield than that.  I've had previous Coleman tents that I appreciated for their cheap and cheerful car camping approach (always got a few good seasons out of them), but this one just wouldn't serve its purpose.  Probably my last Coleman product for a while.

title: They work!!
review: So, long story short, I ruptured my MPFL and opted not to do the reconstruction. However I am terrified of kneeling so I wanted to protect and pas my knees and voilà, I found these amazing knee pads! So happy 😍

title: not happy.
review: i just looked at this product because i assumed it was just the same as the other smooth fitting that was purchased here.  this is not the same. this tape has a more gritty feel. i have yet to use it until i completely finish my other one, but, not happy.

title: oversized QD swivels
review: The quick detach swivels work just fine with the female inserts supplied...but the actual diameter of the swivel will not fit into any other QD slots on existing attach points on rifles or camera lens foot... too big.  Would not purchase again.. quality is not issue... just size mismatch

title: highly recommend as a great brand and great product
review: Love Gaiam for my yoga props as the quality is always excellent and as described.  I use these bands for lower leg strengths as part of my running strength training.  I have started using these as part of my PT regiment for my left shoulder.  Whilst the instructions are clear, I would recommend that you do some search for books/Youtubes to make sure you are applying any type of strength training, and listen to your body.

title: Well made, stays put
review:
I am pleased with this backpack. It's almost too big for me - I'm short at 5' 4", but it is fine.

I've loaded it with 2 gallons of water, snacks, first aid kit, extra jackets, satellite phone and dog snacks with two hiking piles attached to the sides. We've hiked through a canyon and a rugged cross desert trail with a 1200 foot elevation increase using this pack.

It stays balanced and in place despite climbing up or down steep inclines, scrambles over boulders and through mesquite trees. I don't feel top heavy wearing it as long as it's packed properly. The shoulder straps could use a bit more padding with heavy loads, but I think that's just me.

title: Riser is not for me; poor quality threads.
review:
I think what others have said about the bolt is true - it is too low quality, too soft to work in about out of the anchor nut more than once. The threads felt very dicey.

Also I think than in my own experience using a riser was a bad idea. I was having a hard time getting comfortable on my road bike (contemporary Trek) but I noticed that on my 90's Trek the bars were slammed by comparison and that bike is very comfortable. I did some research and got the bike to fit with the stem at a normal height. So long story short, I would have been better off not messing with a riser in the first place.

Also at some point if I'm buying lots of components to make the bike fit better, I'd be money ahead to just get a $250 professional bike fit at the local shop. In the future I will stay away from products like these on a road bike.

title: Great mat for exercise and pushups
review: Excellent quality and thick cushion foam. I ordered the 3x6 size and it's wide enough for doing pushups. I also like that when you fold it up, the surface that you lie on does not touch the surface that faces the floor (unlike rollup yoga mats). I would buy from this company again.

title: Too small
review: Says junior size but fits like a small child's. Barely fits my almost 7 year old and much too small for my 9 year old.

title: Cheaply made junk!!!!
review: Cheap plastic water bottle falls right out! What’s the point!? Wast of money poor quality

title: Great value
review: Holds lots of fruit and ice. Easy to drink out of. Light weight.

title: Doesn't hold air
review: It was a nice ball when we first received it. However 9 months later it will not hold air. It has only been used on gym floors and kept indoors.

title: Got keys
review: Have one for my switch and though it would be a good to have a backup  - just in case there is someone who feels they need it more than do - when we are sleeping.

title: Helpful to carry and will pay for itself quickly
review: I got the 15 ft version thinking that it would be more versatile than the shorter 9 ft one. However, in actual use, I think the 9 ft version would be just as functional.  9 ft is a pretty long reach, and by extending your arms you can get a couple more feet. Where I play the water visibility drops off quickly and 9 ft is more than enough. But, if the water is clear, the additional space requirements for the 15 ft (the handle is thicker because there are several more pole sections) may be worth it. And fully extended, the 15 ft sags a bit, but it is still easy to use and control. The head grips golf balls easily and securely.

title: Amazingly light! soft + airy- thinner than expected. Torn between 4-5*
review:
Surprised at how soft and inviting this is- does NOT feel like a sleeping bag.. this has more of an airy silky feel and feels amazing against the skin- total comfort 5*. You won’t believe how lightweight either, not even as heavy as a Coke can- it gets another 5*..!! I had no issue folding down and getting blanket back into its sleeve and that was done on first attempt- 5* for packing. (trick is expelling the excess air prior to inserting!)

Ordered in the rocky mtn. print.. it seemed a little less detailed than expected- but, comparing side-by-side to photo.. it’s just bc of large size photo- best viewed laid out flat I’d give it 4*. Overall size is more than adequate for x2 to either picnic or lay sleeping bags on. Ample room to totally engulf x1 adult with ease.. 5* for all size aspects..

Surpassing all of the above expectations- I was surprised in amount of fill.. it was less than expected, especially if to bring added cushion and comfort for sleeping upon. I find this has solid quality, craftsmanship and all attention to detail to be sturdy + withstand wear/tear. Just know.. this won’t be a surplus of cushion on lumpy ground- unless it’s doubled over and used by a single person.. this I’d rate 3.5* for amount of fill or, lack of. Having said that- I do understand the reasoning to why it has the amount it does. So to be fair it was more of my own missed expectation.

This has merit for giftability use- its one that will be around for a long time.. greater for campers, hikers, outdoor enthusiast, etc.. Definitely a higher price point… You’re paying for its on the go abilities. Along with quality materials and craftsmanship used. Not so much a dense or full bottom layer. Hoping info helps decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Five Stars
review: Item was exact and arrived quickly

title: exp DH/FR skater breaks these Stormchaser 83a Cloudride wheels down for you
review:
they ARE as advertised , resilient , grippy af until THICK skin is gone , heavy & center run for flipsbility , however ...
these are , surprisingly, the slowest big , supposed dh wheels that I was stoked to try for a long time.
for some reason , they are the opposite of fast.
Me & my skate group , lotsa exp , decided that the hype is all by PNW skaters who've got meta-Rockies or Washington hills that regardless of the wheel,you're gonna blast top speed ; these will likely be awesome if you are going as fast down a run as you can due to Gravity ,you'll be pleased.
if you're sliding or tucking anyplace under 30,35mph , you'll be looking elsewhere for a wheel .

title: Fantastic!
review: Great fit on any shoes! Minnesota ice and snow, these have saved falls!

title: Good mouth guard
review: I liked the comfort. Though I can say I think I pulled them into much when they were being shaped.

title: Great but cap melts
review: This does what it's suppose to do but the cap melted in the dish washer.

title: Too Lightweight
review: These balls are so light they barely stay on a tee in a light breeze. They have no weight to them so it encourages overswinging. Not good for practice.

title: Great pickleball paddle, I get a lot of compliments on the court!
review: I am a newbie to Pickleball, having played only about 6 games. I will say that this Cyrus pickleball paddle is great for me. Fits ergonomically in my hand well, is lightweight and responds easily to my movements. I swear it makes me play better than I would with a different paddle. I also love the colorful design, I have had several people ask me what make it is and who makes it. Highly recommend to anyone who loves the sport.

title: Good gear - transparent, functional.
review:
I got the base rack, this extension, the workstand, the HiLo (extension), and a hitch lock. It's good stuff. I wanted to get the Sherpa but my wife wanted the ability to haul friends' bikes, too. She drives a Jeep Wrangler and I have to admit that it is fun to pile into her toy car with the top and doors off and go on adventures like high school.

I was concerned that this one is so heavy that she wouldn't be able to remove/install it by herself, or even operate it. It's easy enough for anyone to operate, and we just leave it on. For people with short arms and this extender installed, you will have to figure out how to stand to be able to reach the latch. My wife is 5'0" and she can raise and lower the rack and get her own e-bike onto the rack. She lifts the front tire onto and just rolls it into place.

The hardware that holds the bikes is easy to use and reliable so far. We drove from Kansas City to Des Moines, IA (2.5hrs) for a weekend and the bikes didn't budge.

There isn't much to say about gear like this - there are no issues. Everything works like you would expect, and it vanishes into the background.

Oh, one gripe - they don't offer a lock that both holds the HiLo firmly AND is keyed the same as the rack/extension.

title: Great value/lamp for the price
review: Great little lamp for what I paid for it!!! The power went out the other night and I used it for a good 5-6hours even charged my phone for a while and it was still at full brightness when i got up the next day! Great 👍 light weight çolor and very functional little lamp.

title: Fits but already showing a lot of wear
review: These were ordered to replace the worn tires on our razor kick scooter. They fit perfectly and were easy to exchange out. I've noticed they are already, after only a little over a month, already showing a lot of wear (flattening) on the back tire. I'm not sure I find these to be cost effective.  If it's going to wear this quickly I will look for a cheaper alternative.

title: Taste Great
review: Tast great. Rehydrate easily in just a few minutes. I use them on top of frozen pizza and on kabobs.

title: Decent Camping Set, There are more Premium Designs out there, But this is a good Value.
review:
I love camping gadgets and this one is pretty good. I have seen more eloquently engineered sets that fit together better. For example, this one requires the mesh bag to hold them all together and some lock together piece by piece. Also, the ladle is a little ridiculous and probably unuseable. The bowls are minimalist, but usable, the natural sponge is a baffling inclusion, but the wooden spatula/spoon actually seems pretty good. The Pots themselves are better. The handles are good enough and the pot lid may actually stay in place a little too well.

That sounds like a lot of criticism, but for the price, this set is worth it for the two pots and the spoon. They are made fairly well, but fairly small. I'm 6'4" with a ravenous appetite outdoors so this will work for me and that is about it. So this is probably a soloist set. And at .9 pounds it is decently weighted for backpacking. It would definitely be all the kitchenware you would need to rehydrate freeze dried packets.

title: Great kit to get you started!
review: [[VIDEOID:f854b09b893ca5e0e0d77a31be077622]] I like the variety of cleaning rods and connection pieces.  Very handy for all your cleaning needs.  The case is more than adequate for keeping things together and accessible.  Every gun owner needs some kit to keep their guns looking great.  This was my first kit and I absolutely found it useful in helping me keep my guns preserved.

title: Nice set
review: These are very nice lures. They are very realistic looking and move very smoothly in the water. Coloring is very good on them as well. This is a very nice kit.

title: These can deliver KO power!
review:
[[VIDEOID:696953bf7b0e642c6baed2c721519fc2]] These are my home gloves for competition and sparring. The leather is so supple yet durable. The lace ups actually helps to stabilize and support my wrists when hitting the heavier bags. These fit my hands like an old worn in baseball glove. Super impressed. KO for this high end engineered leather.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Eight Shot Mags
review:
The rotary magazines for the PT-80 work as they are supposed to... There is an occasional "missfire" where the pellet is left in the chamber, but I think that is a flaw in the gun, not the magazine. They are easy to load, and you CAN load BB's into them and they will fire with the same velocity... they will not roll out the barrel.

The only improvement I would make would be to color code, or in some other way mark, the side of the magazine the pellets should be loaded into. Right now, that is difficult to determine, and a magazine loaded the wrong way will not rotate in the gun to give you eight shots.

Good item, well worth the money.

title: Definitely a tool for beginners
review: I got this to use during work while using my standup desk thinking it would force me to pay attention to my posture. It’s cool and all but it’s not very challenging, even with the extension. It’s really easy to just lean forward/back/side to side and forget you’re on the board. I haven’t used it for workout purposes, but I can see this helping plank form.

title: Great Product
review: Nice & easy

title: Great value.
review: Solid construction.  Very durable.  Great value.

title: Runs large
review: Runs very large

title: Seems no matter what you order, you get a glove for your right hand.
review: Poor description

title: Defective
review: Hardware for the 5 point hole did not match the hardware on any stick. Unable to play, returning.

title: Perfect !!
review: I love the size and versatility of this mini soapbox. It fits the lush shampoo bars perfectly and is leakproof! It will fit other small items or other toilet bars. good buy and good value.

title: I Found This Ineffective
review: I have used the "Lethal Human Scent Eliminator" sheets now quite a lot, and I have not found them effective at all in eliminating "human scents". I use them in a top-loading washing machine. I have noticed zero reduction in "human scent" odors. This product is a very, very thin sheet, measuring approx. 6.5" x 8".

title: Awesome Hiking Poles
review: These hiking sticks are wonderful. I use them to get back in shape after my pregnancy and surgery. I bought them because I noticed I was very unstable on my feet due to a lot of knee pain. So I bought the Montem hiking poles because I live in the mountains and like magic I can hike all over these mountains now. I am up to 2 miles again in 6 months post baby. I am loving them. It was the extra stability I was looking for. Thank you Montem.

title: Looking forward to many years of enjoyable use
review:
This literally fits like a glove. It should stretch out a bit with more use, but it fits snugly right now. I typically wear size large work gloves and 8.5 surgical gloves, so my hands are probably average.

The glove itself is soft and easy to break in. I think that is worth paying a little more for. Also, the padding works well, and the Velcro is easy to adjust.

However, I do have one complaint. There is a seam or strap that runs right under the tip of my thumb. I can’t really tell if it is supposed to be there, but if I pull my hand out so the seam is above my thumb, my wrist is not all the way in the glove. I wish the seam or strap would be a bit higher.

title: Pretty colors
review:
[[VIDEOID:977bc9cf9444d908beb856db87fa3a21]] I thought these would be fun for the kids to use in the evening for the badminton 🏸 set I got them.

They function well as birdies but we have had some issues with the lights staying on which it make it hard to use in the dark.

title: Doesn’t keep hot
review: This just doesn’t keep my soup warm. I’ve even tried preheating with hot water. Don’t buy if you want anything to stay warm!

title: Moves slow
review: Easy to set up but moves slowly compared to other scooters. It was also difficult for my 4yr old to maneuver.

title: Good for the kids
review: I wanted an inexpensive mat for the kids to play on outside and this one is perfect, it's very lightweight but the stakes hold it down nicely and when your done just fold it up and toss it back in the carrying bag- very convenient.

title: Lightweight, stays put with sandbags, but needs some simple improvements
review:
[[VIDEOID:71619ac795075e1874433650ef653971]] This works with a lot of repositioning with the two poles. It was just a light windy day, nothing too bad at all. However we had to reposition the poles often.

Here is what I liked:
Very lightweight
Great sand bag design.
This doesn’t blow away like many umbrellas do

Here are my recommendations:
Make the poles with adjustable height
Make a fabric pouch for the poles on top of the tent
Have two smaller poles for in the back of the tent

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Broken plastic
review: Where the springs are on the seat the screw busted out and broke the plastic the screw no longer screws in plastic is broken

title: Good Product - Bad Spray Bottle
review:
Part of the bottle at the sprayer broke off. The plastic is of very poor quality.

The product itself does a good job regarding odors. No staining and no stickiness.

title: Five Stars
review: Great price and does what I expect it to do!

title: Heats up quickly/Easy to hold
review:
This hand warmer has proven very effective as an aid to relieve symptoms of Ray Naud’s Syndrome (White Finger). I use it when walking outside and it has been so helpful in relieving the symptoms of vaso constriction in my fingers. I have asked several of my friends to tell me what they think as they have similar symptoms and they asked me where to get it. They both found the item very comfortable to hold, and the heat relaxing. It fits nicely in my jacket pocket. The only suggestion I have is to provide two as a set asI find myself switching from hand to hand. Overall, I find this product very useful and I am using it regularly when walking and also in the car when it is very cold outside.
Christine

title: Not working for me
review: Let's try this again, I've written a review before that wasn't what Amazon liked to read, but as others mentioned, the sizing isn't correct. That is something that is important to mention for people wanting to buy that product, so I feel my review is important and is very much a product related review. The sizing is nowhere mentioned and the description says 12 x 6.6 x 3.1 inches, which is not correct, the sizing is 5x3.5x1 per each. This review will help others determine if the product works for them or not, so Amazon, this is worth mentioning and posting.

title: Great quality
review: Son loves them

title: Not for me.
review:
This Smart Watch is nice. I got it to keep track of my steps. I don’t like it because you can’t change the date, time, or steps for the day without downloading the app. I could not agree to the terms, so this watch is useless to me.

The box comes with a silver watch. It also comes with a USB cord to charge it. Also included is a device to remove links in the watch if needed. Instructions are included.

I will not be recommending this Smart Watch to family and friends.

title: Quality but unusuable
review: It's made well but after a ton of rinses and washing the rubber tire smell and taste in the water is not worth it. Spend a few extra dollars for a different brand.

title: Thought Heavy Metal was a black
review: Thought I was ordering black, it was a sparkly silver.  Looks pretty but my daughter won't wear it for softball.

title: Comfortable!
review: This hat fit perfect. Not the biggest camo fan but this one is really cute! And Comfortable!! Lovin' it!

title: Lots of bells and whistles - but not working...
review: I’m just not having any luck getting this set up - seems to be missing something.  Followed the instructions to a tee - no luck.  fits the wrist fine - but looks like I got a defective one...

title: Sharp edges cut my hand!
review: Cut my hand the very first time I tried opening the box up.  Edges are not polished and are very sharp.

title: Worthless
review:
trolled with this for over 2 hours, not even a bite! Boyfriend was using a Rapala with no Dipsy, he was catching fish I wasn't.
won't be buying another of these...

title: Not just for exercise bikes, think outside the box...
review: We didn't use this for a bike. It was a solution for my son's loft bed. He can now reach for his water bottle without having to climb up and down. It clamped on the round bar of the bed frame perfectly. It's made of high quality plastic, but the clamp has a metal stem, very sturdy. 5-Stars.

title: Very useful when walking my dog at night
review: It works well.  It hugely increases visibility at night.  It's great for walking my dog at night.  I love that it's rechargeable.  It is quite big, though, so it's pretty big on me, but I just drape it at an angle on my hip and it's fine.  As others have noted, the lit area does not go all the way around, so I land up moving it around when I cross the street to maximize visibilty.  It is still definitely worth buying.

title: Wish I hadn't purchased.
review: The knife seems of good quality and it is beautiful, but somehow it keeps opening while it is in my pocket.  I've so far managed to get my hand out unscathed, but this good have resulted in very severe injuries.  I do not appreciate nearly having my wrist slashed or my femoral artery punctured when I started to sit down with it partially open.  I've gotten other knives from this brand that have been just fine so I know it's likely a fluke, but I'll be very hesitant about purchasing another of this brand.

title: Perfect glasses wish I could buy another
review: Perfect glasses wish I could buy another

title: Great hat
review: Great fitting and dealing hat. It's soft, warm and fits perfect.

title: Five Stars
review: Best bullets i have bought by far

title: Comfortable cushion handle bar
review: I really like these bars, the cushion handle definitely helps with support and doesn’t hurt if you lifting on shoulder.

title: Warm and fits well
review: These are warm and fit well

title: Bolt snapped for me too...
review: Simple and good design however, like many other low reviews state for this product, one of the bolts snapped after the first real use of my 70lb bag. You would think Everlast could afford to spring for better quality bolts and save us a trip to Home Depot for a $0.60 bolt. 😒

title: Not well made, and doesn't allow past 225 lbs
review: Well, I returned these because there was a malfunction in the battery pack section. It wouldn't stay closed when you put batteries in it. It also didn't allow me to enter my weight. I feel like it should at least be able to go up to 300lbs

title: Small lanterns
review: I love these little lanterns. They are very bright, battery-operated, and seem as if they can be used anywhere. Camping, power outages, etc. I live in Florida, so I got them for my 'hurricane kit.' They are small, so multiples will be needed to light a larger area. I purchased one previously and have used it as a flashlight instead of candles or oil lamps since they're less likely to cause a fire. Three AA batteries per lantern and they COME WITH the lanterns. I like Etekcity's products a lot!

title: Great gadget but...
review:
I was initially delighted to get this hanger for my bike. It is quite well made, cleverly designed, and easy to install. The arms close around the wheel as you push the wheel against the pad, then open - and stay open - when you push the wheel up a 2nd time. So it's an easy device to use and works well.

However... we (there were three of us) had a hook to hook runoff between the Gladiator and a cheapo plastic coated metal hook I bought at Ace Hardware for about two bucks. We all preferred the Ace Hardware hook! It was just simpler to use, worked just as well, and took up less space.

title: Did nothing
review: I used this a week, didn’t notice any difference… sent it back and went back to getting massages as those you feel.. this wasn’t worth the money for quality of item you get or poor results

title: It's not a gun case, really
review:
You can keep tea cups, plush teddy bears, grandma's caugh medicine and cat food in this case, but for the love of god, don't put your guns in it. It's not a locable case, because, what's the point of making lock holes in the front when the back hinge pins can be easily pushed out with a pen?! You might have the most intricate and expensive lock through the locking holes, but if the hinge pins can be easily removed by a toddler, then... it's not a gun case. Or at least, it shouldn't be called a gun case, because any fool can get into it in less than 30 seconds. Say bye bye to your expensive firearm... hope you had insurance...

On second note, I applied SteelStik on both sides of each hinge. No more popping them hinge rods easily. But, you have to spend another five dollars and 10 minutes o’ time to make this happen so it finally turns into a semblance of a proper gun case…

title: Broke on second use. Led on one side stopped working. Not waterproof for rain runs
review: Broke on second use. Led row stopped working. Not suitable for rain exposure

title: Great hands free carry option- NO PRINTED LOGO..!!!!
review:
Simple and sleek, 100% solid black.. NO TACKY LOGOS!!!! Not just for golfers, this can offers any a hands-free carrying ability for x6 standard size cans- it’s that simple. Great pool or beach day… Even college adventures!

Zips either direction- giving option to pack different flavors and not unload every single one above it to reach desired can! This split zips down middle so, you have easy access to load and if needed to see all content.. Folds up as shown in photos I posted- fits into kitchen supply drawer no prob.!

NOT hefty insulated- sleeve is thinly lined and capable of containing cold approx. 3-4hr. or more. We used at community pool with cold sodas and 12yr. old carried with ease by use of handle strap.. *Note: careful opening carbonated drinks- cans can agitate/bounce around a bit! Fully loaded it weighs that of a x6pk. (x2 bonus thinner drink sleeves included.)

Makes a great gift or addition for a family outing.. A solid option that’s unique and serves a purpose in a fun way! Makes a great stocking stuffer- hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

title: travel money/ID/Credit card holder. Easy to access, comfortable, lightweight, nice material
review:
Neat. Choose your size wisely. I opted for size Large, and it measures the same as what the product description states. I opted for the large size because my wrists are just at 7", and I figured since this is going to be also further up my arm, then I will want the added wiggle room. Also says can be used on ankle, but I wont be using it that way. If it feels loose at the wrist, then pull it up to be situated further up the forearm. If it is still too loose, then you simply got the wrong size. Try a small.

Has some stretch, isnt too big. Super lightweight. Has a zipper at one end, as well as a slit pocket. Can be worn facing out or facing in depending on what you are carrying.

I didnt get it for carrying my phone. I have a large smart phone (pixel 6xl) and while this fits, it is awkward as expected. The description mentions a small phone, and they dont stress this as a phone carrier, just as an option.

I actually got it for 2 things. I work a physical job and dont take regular breaks or lunches. I take supplements on the fly and like the idea of having somewhere to stow them. I rarely wear anything with pockets. I can easily keep a bandaid, lip gloss, electrolyte powder packet, other small items that I may want to have on me. This feels no different than a shirt sleeve. But the other way I plan to use it, and reason for ordering it is for security of money or credit cards. Nice way to carry something like that when I dont want to be carrying it in a purse. Reminds me of any number of travel items out there that are created for this purpose. So instead of a bra purse or a belt or ankle hidey garment, this little sleeve feels all the more natural and easier to access. I like it.

I can see using this for the gym, especially places that have an ID card. Just tuck the card and my locker key inside then go do my workout.

I imagine there are other uses.

title: Nice, strong cord, bright yellow, adjustable.  JUMP for your health!
review:
Jump rope is an essential part of fitness, for all ages. This jump rope has a nice stiff cord, making it easy to turn at high speeds. It is strong enough that it won't get all twisted as some do.

You can adjust the length to the height needed. It is easy to do. I also like the grip handles. Plus, this jump rope is a nice bright yellow color for easy locating when you need it.

Nice jump rope. Product for Review

title: Have a few of this style pillow
review: I have a few of these inflatable pillows and these aren't terrible but they're not the best by any means.  It's nice that they come as a pair however they do not stay in place at all for me.  No matter what I try to do they just slide their way out from under me.  On my last camping trip I just gave up on them and went back to my normal pillow which does a better job at staying in place.  Much like other inflatable pillows they do fill up and compress down quite easily.  Once it was filled with air there was no leakage or anything.  If it had a better means of staying in place I would have given it a far better review but I spent more time with my head off of the pillow than I did on the pillow any time I would take it with me.

title: Great on a saddle in the back country
review:
I'm really happy with this bottle holder. My Lifestraw Filtering bottle fits in here, it's tight, but it works. The pouch has room for my phone, emergency whistle, pocket knife, small map and compass.

I'm actually using this on short, half day rides in the Chihuahua Desert of deep West Texas. It attaches to the D rings on both my English and Western saddles. It weighs nothing and doesn't add unnecessary weight for my horses to carry. I could fit a derringer in the pouch if needed.

title: Won't stick
review: I dont know how well my kids would enjoy playing this game because they couldn't play it. We couldn't get it to stick anywhere. We tried several different surfaces but it wouldn't stock anywhere. My son got frustrated. Also it kept coming apart. Looked cute if it would have worked.

title: Great Assortment of First Aid Supplies!
review: This first aid kit has just about everything you might need for an emergency. It contains an assortment of basic first aid items, such as band-aids, wipes, and gauze pads. It also has an instant cold pack, tweezers, triangle bandage, disposable gloves, safety pins, scissors,  tape, and a CPR mask. In addition to the first aid supplies, there are also some survival items too. It includes a compass, whistle, rain poncho, and emergency blanket. The scissors are pretty weak as far as scissors go, but I did test them out and they did cut. The tweezers are solid and a nice quality. Everything fits inside the zipper case, but there's not room for much more inside it. I will probably try to add a small tube of ibuprofen and some ointment for scrapes to make my kit complete. The size of this is good to fit inside a backpack or in the car without taking up too much room.

title: Skip this junk, hated it! First one didn't work, second one works but it's terrible!-
review:
I have a 50 watt megaphone from Pyle that I am a LOT more happy with. Plus it has a lot of extra features like bluetooth and a handheld mic where this blue megaphone doesn't have any of that! What's crazy is the other megaphone I have actually comes in at a lower price and has more features and power even, I don't understand it!

SO on this megaphone, the flashlight is an odd thing but it works ok. Don't know why it needed it but it does work ok. The megaphone itself, the first one I got came not working. The next one works but it has a lot of feedback in it and doesn't get that loud at all! I REALLY hate this megaphone and highly recommend you skip it and try something like the Pyle brand. The only downside I can say about the Pyle one is it takes a bunch of batteries and doesn't come with a rechargeable battery pack. I think they make one for it though!
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00NCPG5V8/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1

title: Great for Hunting
review: My husband is an avid hunter and having a portable butcher kit with him has been awesome. He loves this kit. Everything inside has held up amazingly well without anything breaking or becoming dull. It's also very light and he can toss this in his backpack before going out so that he always has it if he needs it.

title: Recommend, very comfortable
review: Very comfortable and exactly what I was looking for. I have very thick hair and have always perspired terribly on my head. I'm a senior citizen now, so i needed something comfy and not too tight. These fit all of my requirements, and my grandsons confiscated 2 of them! I will order another set soon. (I have 4 grandsons so l am a couple short!)

title: All of the above

title: Great Resistance Bands
review: I had some other resistance bands but I've had them forever and they finally gave out on me. Got these and totally love them. They work great and I love the workout I get from resistance bands. These are the perfect resistance for me too. They are easy to use and the handles hook to the bands without any problems. The best part about this is the bag that comes with these. It's an actual string bag and it's big enough to keep everything together but has room for the bands to relax and not be all cramped in on themselves. Great set that I am very happy with.

title: Poor design

title: 18 Months Continuous Use
review: This canopy lasted for 18 months of continuous use, outdoors, on the coast of Florida where hurricane-force winds are not uncommon (it doesn't snow, though).  The most recent hurricane took out the roof, finally.  I definitely stand by its durability in extreme weather (except maybe snow) conditions.  Definitely well worth what I paid for it.  I never expected it to last so long, although I am very pleased that it did.

title: Hard plastic
review:
While this floor mat is definitely 100% waterproof, it’s pretty uncomfortable. I bought this to use as a bed and couch covering to use when my children are down with stomach viruses like ticking time bombs of vomit. My last “picnic blanket” proved to be only water resistant.
THIS picnic blanket is stiff, hard, loud and cold. It resembles something I have to cover my outdoor grill or furniture while not in use. Except stiffer. I was hoping the top of it would at least be a soft material. There is no padding between layers it’s literally a piece of plastic sewn onto another fabric that resembles plastic.
The price I paid was just ok, if I’d known how rough it would be, I’d have literally bought a tarp for cheaper.
With all that being said, I hate going through the trouble to return items, so I’ll keep it. At least it matches my house and it will protect my furniture. I’ll just have to add my own soft padding over it for the kids to nap on.

Plastic handles and the metal brake pull system is cheaply made and hard to adjust. Second, my front rim was bent. Bent enough that this bike is not rideable . Easy install, just slid it on and tensioned it in place. The lever provides plenty of stopping power to my front brake, enough to throw me if I wanted to. The action is smooth, braking and releasing easily. Great undersized brake lever that functions like a standard lever.

title: Nice chair
review:
It is very nice that this reclines. This portable chair worked well. It folded pretty small. We do a lot of camping trips so this is great. It really is so tiny compared to most other chairs. You can fit it in a backpack, which is nice. Of course you don’t need to just use it for camping. It can work for beach trips or other times you need a portable chair.
It was easy to put together. It did not take long at all.
It felt sturdy. It was relatively comfortable. I liked that it had a carrying bag. We were pleased and would recommend it.

title: Perfect water bottle
review:
I'm picky about water bottles, and I really like this one. It's easy to carry and has the measurements in ml and oz on the side. The lid comes off easily and the bottle doesn't leak.

The whole "lock the lid in place" feature is not very easy to do, especially one handed, so I usually don't. I just hold down the rubbery thing with my finger (behind the carry loop) if the cap is in danger of hitting me in the face. Again, not a big deal.

title: Not Quite As Tough As Expected But Looks Like It Will Still Work This Summer So Far
review:
We have company coming this summer. This involves a few tents, but one of the people needs an inflatable mattress and room for stuff. This tent is who we got this for.

ASSEMBLY
Assembly was not difficult in our trial run. The instructions were pretty easy to follow and it does not take more than a half hour to put up with two people unless you are with someone VERY efficient in putting up tents.

WITHOUT FLY
Without the fly, this is a very nice tent - bright, airy, and lots of upper mesh to see the sky. This is perfect on nice days.

WITH FLY
The days that rain might be expected are the challenge. The fly is dark blue. The dark blue makes this tent feel very warm and almost oppressive some days, but it does protect in the rain. My point is if you are the type who does not want to take the fly off and put it on constantly, this might be a big dark for you to leave on constantly, unless you plan to just sleep inside and don't care.

STAKES
The stakes that come with this are not big enough to support the weight of wind and other frustrations. We got spiral stakes to use with this at least on the key points of stress and it works better.

STURDY?
We are only using this for this summer, so hopefully it will last through several weeks of use. We have not had any high winds or severe storms yet so I will have to update as to how well this worked for that.

STORM PROOFING
One thing we learned about tents over long term is that double tarps are a good idea. We put one down under the tent leaving a perimeter that is not too big around the edge. Then we put another inside the tent to further protect should there be a deluge.

STORAGE
I find that having a separate nylon bag for the fly helps a lot when it comes time to put this tent away. It allows for a faster pick up time and less frustrating trying to make everything fit.

SIZE
This is perfect for a queen sized mattress, 1 or 2 people and their stuff.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This is great for a family with sleeping bags and not much stuff, or for less people and more stuff. The stakes could be better, the storage bag bigger, and perhaps a bit tougher construction/fabric, but all in all this is a decent tent and serves our purpose well- I hope.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS at this point. I will update once summer is over as to the longevity of this tent over several weeks.

title: Easy to use! Stable
review:
Used this bike rack to carry 5 bikes on my Suburban (mens, women's, and kids). There are tons of 4-bike racks but few 5-back racks. Happy to find this one.

Easy to assemble and install. Feels very secure.

If you are unsure about needing/wanting the Premium vs. the Deluxe model, go to Allen Sports website and watch their video that shows difference.

The biggest difference for me was the ease of tilting the rack away from vehicle so you can access the back door. Also the bar that holds bikes lowers more easily on this Premium rack.

title: He loved them
review: This was a birthday present and he loved them.

title: Vibrations & Blurry Optics
review:
Two major issues with this rear view cycling mirror. The first issue is vibrations. As of this writing, the listing here at Amazon says no vibrations. The unit I received vibrates very badly as I am biking. And yes, it is tight on the rim of my glasses. The vibrations make it hard to see the objects in the mirror, of course. The second issue is the blurry optics, specifically concerning distance. And yes, I immediately peeled off the plastic protective sheet placed on the mirror at the factory.

It is easy to install. The concept itself is good and it looks nice. It just doesn't work as advertised. Also, you can't really tilt the mirror downward, if needed. You can move it easily side to side.

This was a Kickstarter campaign, and as of this writing, there are two people who reported over there the same thing I myself have experienced.

title: Great quality
review: Great quality. I use this primarily as a mix in for my homemade granola.  My husband loves to add a few spoons full to hot oatmeal.

title: Great lock
review: Seems very sturdy. It was easy to set the combination and easy to use. I bought two for my kid's bikes, and they both work great.

title: Cap does not seal. Leaks.
review: Piece of cheap junk. The cap does not seal the bladder. I filled it with water and screwed it on tight, but water will still leak out. This is unusable.

title: Good Yoga Mat for the Price
review:
If you like to do yoga, you need a good mat. You need something large enough to fit your full body no matter what the pose and you need something that stays firmly in place. A good mat for this purpose and for a fair price is this Primasole Yoga Mat with Carry Case.

Measuring six feet by two feet, this yoga mat is designed to handle most anyone. Only those who are extraordinarily tall will not be able to use this mat. The other standout feature is the thickness. It is about one centimeter thick, so it’s comfortable on your body. And with the included carrying case, you can roll it up and take it with you, wherever you go. It’s lightweight and easily portable.

Another cool fact about this yoga mat is that it holds itself in place. You don’t need to worry about slippage, and that is a very comforting thing. The bottom of the mat is incredibly good at gripping the floor, so there are no worries that you might find yourself taking a tumble due to the mat sliding on the floor.

Primasole makes many good yoga mats and this one is certainly a good one for the price. Yes, there are better ones out there but at this price point, this mat is as good as any and it’s a great addition to your yoga routine.

title: Don't recommend
review: Needs better nuts so it doesn't fall apart.  The suction is ok.  You can't leave it up or it will fall apart.  Taking it down with each use, including putting it up or taking it down, helps. You must also check the nuts with each use.  I wouldn't buy again.

title: Good quality baseballs
review: I like the flat seam balls. Performance can increase either way with flat seemed balls, both offensive and defensive. I can throw these balls with a tick more velocity than the a raised seemed. Overall a great ball with excellent build quality.

title: Good for kids!
review:
Nice simple watch for kids, band does fit adults as well.
Features are easy to use and self explanatory. The pedometer is pretty accurate, which is fun for my kids to track their steps- hey anything to keep them moving!
You charge it by plugging the actual watch in the port which is nice not to have another wire laying around- and the charge lasts for a long time.

title: FANTASTIC High Quality Board BUT Lousy Cheap Brace (Came Broken On Top Of That)
review:
One thing my family loves is the ability to play lawn games. Bocce ball is a favorite around here as is badminton and a few other games we manage to get now and then. When I saw this game, I thought it would be perfect for our family. It would have been, had it not been broken upon arrival.

WHAT IS THIS SET LIKE?
First of all, this set is HEAVY. I mean HEAVY. That means if you have trouble lifting 50 lb bags of grain or similar type things, this might be a bit tough for you. It is doable, but challenging.

There are two score centers. Each one is folded up and they both come together back to back in a very tough canvas bag. The board centers are made of composite board( particle board?) and have a formica type top on them so that drops of water will bead up and not soak in. There is velcro on the pieces to hold them in place when using each different game and also for storage. The bars at the top for the ladder toss are metal and each one is color coded for scores

There are two rope handles one on each board. The idea is that you put the game boards in the case and the handles come through a hole in the top of the case for carrying. Carry pieces come in a mesh bag for the sand bags, and a plastic bag (we replaced with zipper close freezer bag) for the ladder toss pieces.

PLAYING PIECES
The playing pieces are sturdy and well made. There are three red and three blue heavy plastic balls joined by a tough nylon cord. You toss and they wrap around the ladder rungs if you score. There are also 4 blue and 4 red sand bags- not quite 3 inches square. The idea is that when the cornhole side of the board is up, you throw them in the hole.

GAME PLAY
The first way that you set up the game, there are two metal braces that you insert in holes in the frame of the ladder. The composite board (painted black on the back side) is on the grass or floor.

When you are ready to change the game, you unhook the ladder, flip it around and then brace it up in the back with a brace made of composite that props up the ladder underneath, thereby elevating the wood look board at an angle so you can throw the bags through the hole.

BROKEN
It is quite upsetting that a lot of effort went into this game, yet when it comes to the quality of the brace in the back to hold up the cornhole board, is horrible. It is very thin particle board (composite) and one of them came broken- it looked like it left the factory that way. We will try to fix it up by summer if it is possible, but such a horribly heavy game is way too difficult to send back in the mail/delivery. There should have been better quality control.

GAMEPLAY WITH ONE BOARD
We still played with the one board and the other propped up (although I really hate a new game being broken when you get it) and the gameplay was a lot of fun. We only played once outside as we got snow and it never left since. We played it in the basement, but it is more fun outside. We like to get as far away as we can to make it challenging.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For a simple lawn/basement game that will give loads of fun and hopefully stand up to some use if it is in proper shape when you get it, this is a lot of fun. We really enjoyed it. Unfortunately, despite the good quality work on most of the boards, the important brace is cheap and thin- this should have never been make like that. It is heavy to lift so make sure you have someone in the family or group who can lift heavy things to transport and set this up.

MY RATING
I took off two stars for the cheap broken brace. This never should have passed quality control. If this had been sturdier in the brace, I would have given it five stars. As it is, only three.

title: This bag checks off all the boxes flawlessly
review: Epic bag. I oooooh'ed and ahhhhhh'd when I unpacked it because it looks so good. Maybe because last baseball season, my boy had a subpar baseball bag. There was never enough room for his gear, not enough pockets to hold snacks, and a lame water bottle holder that I was never sure if it'd hold the bottle in tight. This bag is bigger than his old one 22"Hx 10"Dx 14"W. Does not look oversized or ridiculous. All our bats fit into 4 side pockets. There is an upper elastic band that holds the bat handles close to bag. The shoulder straps have extra padding so they are quite comfortable. There is a small felt-lined interior pocket for watch or phone,  a VERY LARGE main compartment that fits his helmet and several gloves and a bottom zippered compartment to hold cleats/shoes. And an exterior pocket to hold his sunflower seeds.  So far, the zippers have worked pretty smooth. They continue to zip around the corners with no catches. I feel like, if I designed a baseball bag, it would pretty much be this. Nice job Franklin!
