Decided to order the X-large and there is no difference from the large.  If you have large hands try a different brand as these will not fit you.  I have average sized hands.

title: ppainful
review: hurt mu arthritic hands

title: Silver metal arms too short
review: The two silver metal arms that extend horizontally were too short for my bike. I have a small/medium women’s bike so I’m a bit surprised others with larger bikes don’t have this problem.  I was able to attach it, but because those arms are too short the rack has to tilt forward.

title: Great Tool
review: Great tool

title: Had high expectations and am not very impressed
review: I must of had really high expectations, I used it for about 15 minutes a day after I received it and did not noticed any fatigue. I wanted to buy a machine that had as much power as possible and after looking at all the ones around my price point I decided on this one.

title: FDE bother
review:
So.. no. I have the black one - sssweeeet. This review is about the FDE color - FDE should stand for f'indonteven. Basically, they took a black one (which again, sweet) an very slopily sprayed the paint on it. The paint must have not even set yet when they closed the legs and created hot spots. If you start unscrewing the main retention screw, you'll see it's still black where the spray didn't get to it. And the surface of it is terrible, like a half melted Crispy chocolate bar. Just terrific. In the, causing terror by looking at it way. Needless to say, back it went, got another black one, and that one is just like - was this made by the same company even?! I'll strip it own and paint it myself. But, avoid the FDE like Delta covid.

Update:
When life gives you crappy FDE...

title: Five Stars
review: I got this for my son and he's very pleased.

title: Small, strong
review: Quite small, but handy. I recommend for those with smaller finger if you intend to use the finger hole, as it's quite small. I just wanted a knife handy for cutting tape on boxes and this was perfect for that.

title: Great
review: Makes working out simple while keeping it interesting. Love the workouts they have planned for you.

title: Awesome, high quality, indoor golf putting set with automatic ball return...
review:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Great idea for family time away from screens.
* Work on your putting skills before hitting the real golf courses.
* Automatic ball return is a great feature, especially for those with back issues.
* The base is made of real solid wood.
* The pad has a nonslip rubber bottom and velvet top for smooth golf ball travel.
* 3 golf balls and 1 putting putter included.

THE BAD:
------------
* Nothing we can think of. 5-Stars!

title: Adequate
review: Own 5 Kayaks and this only fit 2. Not the sellers fault. Clearly this is meant for smaller kayaks and 3 of mine seem to have larger egress openings than I realized. Looks like I have to keep using bungee cord and plastic. Its ghetto, but it keeps the critters from nesting over the off season.

title: If only both pairs were the same size
review:
Got to try them for the first time today.
Got the 2 pairs as advertised and tried the black ones upon arrival, the fir was fine.
I just got back from yoga and packed the grey ones for today’s class. They fit smaller then the black ones and were cutting my circulation. The grips works decently well.

title: Great cooler
review: Great size, easy to maneuver and the drain in the corner is super handy

title: OVERPRICED
review: Headline says it all

title: Quality
review: Ver nice quality

title: Easy to tear
review: Easy to tear with just one bite.

title: It helps with long runs.
review: I sized up as these compression sleeves are super tight.  And they still gave me the support I was looking for.  I definitely wear these more in cooler weather, as I still find such compression harder to train during humid/hot weather.  I like lighter color to reflect the summer sun!  Doesn’t shrink if wash in cold water, and retains its compression well.  Definitely worth wearing after a long run.  I love compression for speedy recovery too.

title: Nice Comfortable Fit
review: These have been comfortable goggles to use during my lap swims. The suction is nice on the eyes. The straps adjust nicely. They do not let any water in and don't fog up. Work great for my basic swimming needs. The color is a nice neutral so could be used for a male or female.

title: Thicker than the blue band
review: It's just as pictured! It's good

title: Very nice backpack
review: This backpack is very spacious and heavy duty

title: She’s happy
review: Bought this for my mother after her knee surgery so she could exercise it. She says that it works great, and that she also uses it to help her get up into bed.

title: Arrived used
review: I’m pretty sure this has been used. As pictured, the logo (in the middle where you are most likely to step) has been scraped off. It’s clearly not in new condition. I get that it wasn’t expensive but if I wanted used equipment I would’ve looked on Craigslist and possibly gotten a better piece for the price. Not impressed.

title: Great For Basic Rehab Work
review:
I have been wanting to get some resistance bands that do not snap for some rehab work on my legs while I lay on my bed at night. My last bunch snapped and caused me a problem because of it.

HOW THESE COME
These bands come folded up with a door stop in a mesh bag. There is a sheet with exercises mapped out on both sides. The mesh bag has a cord lock on it for easy closure.

PERFORMANCE
These bands work very well for that I want them for. They help me with my leg stretches and my gentle hip work. They also do work well with the door stop. I found for the leg work the heaviest was best due to the retraction power. For other areas of the body, I go lighter.

QUALITY
The quality of these is far better than the last bunch I had which were supposed to be heavy duty. They should last a little while. I highly suggest that you check them every time you use them for fraying, stitching, and areas of wear.

THE BOTTOM LINE
These bands are a great way for me to do some gentle rehab for my legs. They work well, are decent quality and pack away in a small bag easy to carry.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This is just what I wanted and the longer length make them easier to work with in a variety of positions.

title: Better for small feet
review: It went Tio the physical therapist that I have as he is short and has small feet it did not work for me you must wear shoes as you can slide right off

title: Not easy to use - burns quickly.
review: Does not fully burn the piece - not easy to light.  I was very disappointed.

title: 6yr old likes it
review: My 6 yr old likes this and that it came with a strap to carry it. It is easy to use and drink from. Also easy to clean since there is no straw which is nice. She likes the cute llama on it as well. Seems well made.

title: This hat is small, only the brim is large
review: This hat is very small with a wide brim

title: We've bought 2!
review: My son loves his cardinals backpack.  The colors are bright and vibrant.  We have had to buy 2 because the stitching on the first one's strap started to come out.  For the price though, you can't beat it!

title: One Star
review: Very cheap looking.

title: I definitely recommend to my family and friends
review:
Quick delivery, product matches description and ease of order.
I definitely recommend to my family and friends.

title: EASY CAR ENTRY WHEN IT RAINS
review: I love this umbrella! I thought I had a good umbrella, but I always got wet getting back into the car when it was raining. NO MORE! It's so easy and so fast and I stay dry. And loading groceries in the back while holding keys & phone is made so easy with the C handle. Arrived in 2 days boxed perfectly, no assembly. Quality looks to be very high, I would definitely buy again and this would make a wonderful gift, they're beautiful.

title: Good coat
review: There’s a lot I like about this jacket. The hood cinches (sp?) and there’s a inner flap behind the zipper to keep out the cold. It’s a good length. For a brand I’ve never heard of, it’s pretty high quality. There are also things I don’t like. The pockets aren’t lined, and I wish the flap was in front of the zipper instead of behind it - it would look more dressy/professional. I live in Minnesota and it will require a seriously thick fleece for below 20 temps. But since I can’t wear down, that would be true with almost any coat I bought. All in all I like it a lot.

title: Just what I needed!....until I found the whistle
review:
I have no idea what peoole are talking about a whistle for. I just got this today because I LOVE the bottle but at times unscrewing the lid was inconvenient, though I will probably use the screw on lid more often. Still, I cut the straw, put it on the lid and cautiously took a drink, waiting for a whistle. Nothing. I have been using it like this just to make sure and will fill it with ice and use it again but so far, it’s perfect. I highly recommend it. You do have to cut the straw for the 32 ounce bottle but you get two straws and a straw cleaner. I think it’s a great deal for the money.

EDIT
Spoke too soon. Found the whistle. The loud whistle.
I played around with this for a couple of days. If your ice has melted, it won’t whistle. When I first put it in, I didn’t have much ice. If it’s full of ice, the whistle is loud. I could get short, non whistle drinks, by first blowing into the straw and then drinking but that’s really annoying. I tried not using the straw at all, again full of ice and water as the instructions indicate (first fill with ice and then water) but the whistle was LOUD.
So this does work but not as the bottle instructions indicate it should be used. It will only work if there is not much ice in it. This seems counterintuitive to the original intent of the bottle.
So, I will use it but it won’t be when the water is at its coldest. I’m wondering if the designers tested this when it was not full of ice because otherwise, I can’t imagine this thing getting to market.

title: Weedless
review: Lives up to its name. Again, to put on a hook not to easy.

title: Functional- but wheels can work themselves off in use
review: Ergonomic handles.. As an abroller, it's wide wheel stance is an advantage. As a muscle massage tool, the narrower ring (with wheels removed) is reasonably effective. The problem is that the wheels can slowly slide off while in use. Perhaps some locking mechanism to keep the wheels in place would have made this a much better rollar.

title: Kind of a piece of junk
review: The quality of this is ok, not great. I have used a real thigh master but thought I'd give this a try since it’s inexpensive, but you get what you pay for, right? It isn’t that difficult to push together so there is no way I’d get anything out of using it for my arms and as far as my legs, I barely notice anything. I would not recommend this and from looking at other reviews, they are not all made the same….some are really hard to push together, others are not.

title: Can feel to tight if wearing tights.
review: Comfortable fit under pants. Not bulky. Keeps the knee feeling stable. Does the trick, have a slight turn mediscus.

title: Nice sleeping bag, good quality
review: Very good quality. Very warm. I fit in this just fine and really loved it.

title: Extra roomy and lots of room for balls…
review:
[[VIDEOID:cde8bf29710f4ae6affdb1e9d18f71fc]] Nice designed lightweight with room to spare. This is convenient to pack and store everything in one bag. The netting is strong and the zippers are metal. Very pleased!

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Pay attention to dumbbell sizes
review:
The rack is quite short, but I was expecting that.
The rack will NOT hold 10-30lb pairs, the heads end up hitting each other.
5-10-15-20-25 will be perfect for this rack.
Swapping the 25s for 30s for whatever reason would likely work also.

title: Kid loved it
review: I bought this for my son's camping trip. He really liked it. He liked that it had different modes of brightness.

title: Five Stars
review: Great Item to throw on and workout in. Makes you sweat a ton!

title: Never realize how easy it is to change a bike seat...
review: I don't know much about bike parts, and I was able to change the seat for my son. He was complaining his seat was painful. These things are pretty much universal. The new seat looked exactly like the old seat in terms of hardware. You simply undo one nut, lift to remove seat. Place new seat on top, tighten nut. That's it. 5 Stars.

title: Nice, but not for flat table use.
review: The cover is made of quality materials and would be good for any table that folds up as shown in the first picture.  But I do not recommend for non-folding tables.  I did not zoom in on the picture of the cover on the flat table, until after I received it.  I have a table top for my pool table, so it does not fold up.  This cover does not lay flat on a flat table.  And you need to remove the net before placing it on the table. Amazon allowed me to return it.  It is a good cover otherwise.

title: Scrubs a grab bag gift
review: Loved this product and the person I bought it for loved it also.  I could not find them in stores at the time, and she had just become a Nurse Practitioner and she is a big fan, she loved it.  I would recommend this to everyone.

title: A Nice, Thick, Comfortable Yoga Mat!
review: I don't do much Yoga, but I do like to play Wii Fit a lot and I prefer to use a mat for some of the activities that don't involve the board. I purchased an inexpensive Yoga mat a couple of years ago that has been destroyed by my cats, so when I came across a promotional deal for the Ashram mat, I thought it was the perfect time to purchase a replacement mat! I compared my old mat side by side with the Ashram mat. Both are about the same size, but the biggest difference was the thickness. The Ashram one is significantly thicker and more comfortable. I also LOVE that it comes  with a shoulder strap. As much as I like it, I don't know if I would purchase it at full price since I am not into true Yoga. However, if I was a serious about Yoga, that would be a different story.

title: Fast action!
review: When your balls go flat, the kids have no patience if the re-inflation goes slowly.  This device really does the job quickly - and it’s amazing!  It came with 3 needles for inflating all kinds of balls, so we  are now all set!

title: Are these child sizes?
review: I have other CamelBak products and really like them. I was really surprised with the fit on this one. I got a S/M. It's supposed to fit up to a 32" waist. I couldn't get this thing past my thighs. I have no idea how I'm supposed to get it to my waist. I don't know if I simply got a weird one or if they're all like this. Anyway, the pockets and the water bottle are great. It would work if you clip it to a belt or something. I think it would work better if it functioned like a fanny pack.

title: Looks Great, But Remember It Is Plastic And Hand Wash Only...
review: I can't deal with the amount of work needed to hand wash these, and hot liquids will cause it to leak chemicals.  Basically, I'm only going to use stainless steel or glass!

title: Not good
review: Very cheap, the gage was broken and the peddling did not change when adjusting the knob. Would not recommend.

title: Good quanity
review: Will you certainly get a lot Of quantity and variety in this little tackle box.... And as any fisher person knows That's the best thing..

title: Soft headbands that feel great on; love the USA flag one; will not pair well with all outfits
review:
There are 6 printed headbands in this set. The headbands are relatively soft. They feel great on my head and over my ears. I particularly like the look of the flag designed one. Since each headband is patterned, they will not pair well with every outfit. It is best to pair these with a solid print.

The current price of $14.99 is a slight pricey $2.50 per band.

title: Five Stars
review: This product is as described.

title: Better Than the One that Came with My Kayak
review: This padded seat is better than the one that came with my kayak. However, it's not what I would consider premium. It's an improvement, but I have seen much better ones out there. It attached to our kayak fine. It seems to be well made.

title: Love this for keeping cool in this Arizona desert heat
review: I wear this around my neck every day for work or even around the house, it keeps me so much cooler! I love this product!!!

title: Very light, and resilient!
review:
We finally got a chance to try this out last week, and despite it's odd shape, it worked really well!
We had several different kinds of sleds, and this was the only plastic one to not break on our last trip sledding. Our kids put it through the ringer, and it came out with only a few scratches.
It is easy to use, and the handles are nice and big to be comfortable holding with gloves on.
They did go really fast, it cuts through the snow really well! Try it out!

title: Easy to use
review: I like this roller because it is easy to use, and seems to increase the circulation in my legs.

title: Unique Pool Float
review: This is a unique pool float. It's designed to hold 3 people. Yes, 3 adults can fit in it, but they will end up being close to one another. It worked much better for my tween niece and her friends than it did for my sister and me. There are drink holders. We'll have to see how well it holds up. I don't expect it to last any longer than one summer, but only time will tell.

title: Knife is as described. Well made and razor sharp ...
review: Knife is as described. Well made and razor sharp. The sheath however, does not hold the knife secure (or at all) unless I use a rubber band laced through an upper belt loop of the sheath and around the handle to keep it from slipping out.

title: Exactly what it says it is
review: Exactly as described

title: Awesome Bag
review: Awesome bag! I like the compartments and all of the styling. The blue fabric has a nice sheen and a subtle pattern in it. The only odd thing about this bag is that it completely lacks a frame. Perhaps this can be seen as a unique "feature" over against other, similarly-styled bags.

title: awful boot, awful frame = awful skate
review:
you may be fooled by soft inner padding, but the skate is terrible.

the boot: side walls don't curve over the top of foot leading to strange gap between lace holes, laces, and boot tongue. Plodders may be fine with it, but real skaters won't.

the frames: even worse. two piece design relies on over tightening the axle bolts causing friction between the wheels and frames. noisy "ABEC 7's" are no cure.

STICK WITH BAUER or CCM upper echelon

title: Decent Bottle, Jury is out on filter
review:
We used a lot of water bottles in our family. We do a lot of camping, hiking and canoeing and we filter a lot of water, but for now we mostly trust pumping filters and pump into a clean water bottle, taking care to avoid contamination. My youngest has used this a couple of times just as a water bottle, filtering tap water through it. I'm leery to use is as a filtering solution in the wild, but it seems legit. We will take it to the Boundary Waters Wilderness Area in a few weeks and will decide there whether to trust it, but we will probably just filter into the bottle and use the internal filter as a second line of defense.

Otherwise, I'm not huge on straw bottles, but the kids like them. The bottle is a good size, easy to clean and fits our pumps adapter for filling water bottles well. It has everything we are looking for in a water bottle and more with the filter. Seem pretty good.

title: 2 of them failed on first dive.
review: I'll start with the customer service was great.  However, the light was not.  The first one flooded on the first dive and extinguished the light.  I just assumed it was a fluke and exchanged it.  Second one found me plenty of grouper and lobster for about 3 hours then failed.  It flickers and acts like the button has a problem.  Overall, if you need a dependable dive light, this isn't it.

title: Perfect
review: Does what it supposed to do. Just wished it kept ice longer

title: It's ok. The lower edge of the visor front ...
review: It's ok. The lower edge of the visor front where it attached to the elastic band has a rough edge that may of may not line up with the top of your ear. I was not aware the whole back of this visor was elastic. It does soak up sweat well.

title: Five Stars
review: Exactly as advertised and well made.

title: I'm Enjoying This Stepper
review:
Quite surprised at how much I like this. It's easy to shift around, and convertible from a low height, which is what I'm using now, to a taller version just by shifting the two pieces underneath to the two feet. It's like Lego blocks!

I'm just a little disappointed because, unlike other exercise equipment I have received, this one didn't come with any example exercise routines. I get it, you step up and down on it--a friend of mine who is a fitness advisor said basically the best thing you can do with a stepper is to see how many reps you can do in three minutes--but I thought there might be a couple of ideas for exercise routines like I got with my exercise bike and resistance bands.

title: Save your money
review: Save your money. This organizer does not stretch tight when you velcro it onto the cot so it sags pretty bad.

title: Lot goin on here!
review: The gloves with all the pockets,  thickness of gloves makes them rather cumbersome to use.  I could not find consistency in the battery charging nor the  circulation of  warmth.  I did lose the battery charging rather quick a couple of times.  The material of the gloves is thick and you may be able to use your electronics as it states.  But,  all in all,  they are cumbersome and not 100% reliable.  Use them cautiously.

title: Very delicate
review: Its nice sized, very delicate. Love the filigree but its cheap. It is very pretty, but make sure the “o” ring is closed tight. The chain had slipped out of the o ring. Easy enough to fix! Just grab your small pliers!

title: Recommend it
review: Very happy with this purchase

title: See through
review: These are itchy and see through

title: Lightweight, but weird, unpleasant fabric
review: I really dislike this fabric. It has a slick, weird tactile feel that reminds me almost of a rain coat. It's softer, of course, but still shiny and not at all like a cozy fleece sweatshirt should be. The fit is ok - slightly oversized so you could later under it. If you want a soft, warm, comfy pullover, look at something else.

title: It's ok
review: I don't think the value of it worth almost $80. Yes it's intelligent that you can track your water intake amount but just too pricy for a bottle.

title: SCAM!!!
review: This is a scam!  They are fakes...replicas...  It doesn't say that in the title or description, and they are priced in line with dinosaur teeth and slightly higher than other claws that state they are replicas!  There is nothing to indicate they are fakes even to someone who is looking for that!!

title: Too unwieldy for me!
review: There's was no way I could remain safe on this. It slipped on both a carpet and a floor. If the round base had some sort of gripping material (maybe the same as on the flat part), perhaps this would be a safe product. Returned.

title: Needed to be easy to get on and out of
review: It's a difficult to get in and out of can't use it as an everyday purse so I'm returning it.

title: Nice quality
review: Bought this a year ago and it's still holding up.  My daughter loved this, it arrived on time and in new condition.  The charms slide on the band.

title: Not meant for left-handers!
review: First of all, one of my little keychain hooks was missing, so I had to hook both of them together. Then I discovered (the hard way) that if you are left handed, and try to cut into your food with the edge of the utensil, they start to fold up on you. So I'm awkwardly trying to use the spoon with my right hand. The pros are that they are in a nice little case, so you can just pop them into your pocket or purse and take with you. They are also stainless steel and therefore easy to clean. Cons are the aforementioned left-handed folding up and missing a keychain clip. They should either make them to where they click into place, so either hand can use them, or offer a left handed version. Great value for the money is also a plus, so I'm not going to bother sending them back.

title: Cheaper material than expected
review: Previous reviews make it sound nicer than it is. I got it for about $10 and it’s not even worth $5. You can tell it’s a cheap bag that they jacked the price up on. I bought it for a concert and doubt it will last past that one concert.

title: Three Stars
review: battery died in less than 1 month.

title: Does not fit Crimson Trace
review: Does not fit Crimson Trace CSA-2624

title: Not accurate in steps or heartbeat
review: Does not keep accurate steps or even heartbeats. Compared with 2 pedometers and a Jawbone.  Very disappointed.  I would not recommend!

title: They fit correctly
review: My husband is very pleased with these new grips. They fit exactly and look pretty good too. He said getting the old grips off was more trouble than putting these on.

title: Great customer service!
review:
[[VIDEOID:6ea5a380165be21e1e67e4358fdf511f]] My wife has tried other brands of smart hula hoops, but this one by FYGL *WAS* her absolute favorite.. Unfortunately after using everyday for a week (30 minutes a day), 2 connectors already broke off. 😢

The manufacturer was SO nice to reach out due to this issue and advise how to correct the problem. It is a tedious fixing process, however my wife was able to fix the broken links! She just popped the pin and spring back in place. Before using each time, just make sure the pins on each link are pushed in all the way to prevent this problem from happening again.

It does have some pros:

-It comes packaged nicely in a box, which includes a drawstring travel/storage bag, and you get 16 connectable links with the set. If your waist is a larger size, there is an option to purchase additional links up to a 52" waist. My wife has a 30.5" waist and she used 13 of the links, which is recommended with the size chart.

-This smart hula hoop is perfect for beginners, as it is easy to get it going, and to keep the momentum going. My wife has tried other brands, where it's a bit difficult to keep them going... But this is a piece of cake, literally!

-Also, it's nice as the links are silicone padded in the belly area, which will help prevent bruising. My wife did slightly bruise using the plastic smart hula hoop without the silicone, so this is a luxury!

-The links attach/detach easily, as well as hooking the weight onto the track. The description says that it is quiet... However my wife still found it to be very LOUD! So if you plan on doing this while watching TV, or when the kids are sleeping... I would think again, lol.

Cons:

-The counter on it did not work - - It turned on, however stays at 0. She followed the exact instructions, but couldn't get it to work. But that is not a big deal as you can use a smart watch to time yourself.

Overall, it’s a nice product, with great customer service!

title: Five Stars
review: love the little blankets, very useful, and not heavy.. works perfectly for camping or hiking

title: Five Stars
review: Nice shirt, good product

title: I guess as a headband?
review: I got this as the garter seemed like a better alternative to a face mask. It might be..just not this one. I put it on....and kept having to pull it up as it didn't stay on my face but would scrunch around my neck. If I wanted a scarf I'd have knitted one. Waste of money.

title: Great trampoline!
review: Great trampoline...we've had it a couple months now, and our kids are on it almost everyday.  Took maybe a couple of hours for two of us to set up, wasn't difficult.

title: Perfect Replacement!
review: Perfect Replacement!

title: air dried, fully dehydrated, must be rehydrated for consumption, soak/cook/steep
review:
I keep dehydrated food items on hand for use in slow cooking preparations, and ultimately for food preps (emergency, etc). Great for when fresh food is not available. This is a bag of diced, dried tomatoes. Not just dry, but dehydrated. They should be rehydrated through soaking (or slow cooking in a soup, etc). I suppose they could be consumed direct from bag (I wouldnt), but these are diced and not flaked. Better to use freeze dried if you want a dehydrated product that you can munch on direct from bag. This product is simply air dried. So dry, hard, maybe a little chewy.

Im not a fan of the bag. Better if it were resealable or in a pressure zip mylar. But it adequate enough.

title: Saved the day
review: Great price, saved the day on vacation. Thought I’d have to get while new fins but these fit my 22 year old fins!  They don’t quite buckle as smoothly as I’d like but they were a good price, much cheaper than new fins. And they work great once buckled.

title: Handles broke and seat uncomfortable
review: I have a left leg amputation. My brother died and I got his older Schwin Airdyn Comp- an old model. I use my arms mostly so wanted to do HIIT training using my arms. I also have low back pain, and the seat was extremely uncomfortable (as it is on most air bikes). I contacted Schwin several times to see I they had any other seats available, and no reponse. Dont hold your breath waiting on customer service. I am a bodybuider, so am familiar with hard workouts. The Schwin gives you a great, hard (as hard as you want) workout. Trouble was, the handle bars broke at the junction where the handlebar connects to the bike/fan area. The only way to fix this was to take that area completely apart and insert a new axle. This would have been a major hassle,and possibly required some welding. Forget about getting someone to come to fix it. Needless to say, after doing great HIIT workouts on the bike for less than a year, I had to junk it and am now looking for a new one. Was very disappointed.

title: Do NOT buy this bike!!
review: The breaks on the bike do not work. The material that the wheels and breaks are made of do not allow the breaks to work properly. I brought this bike to a bike shop and the man working there said I would have to buy all new wheels for the breaks to work properly. I almost ran into traffic twice because the breaks don’t work. Do NOT buy this bike!!!

title: Great rod, great value.
review: Extremely light weight and well balanced.  It has quickly become my go to rod.

title: Super loud!
review: I wrote "Super loud" in the title. What more is there to say? Being required to add more to this review is annoying.

title: Ehh
review: Ball never got to full size, no matter how much I pump it. So, it's not rigid enough, and I ordered one that's too small for my body, rendering it unusable.

title: Thin fabric nothing that I would use or gift
review: I was excited to use this in my meditations with my Chakra alignments.  What I thought I was purchasing & what I received were two very different things! The fabric is extreamly thin, not absorbent, or soft, the tassels are very small. So it is folded up into a bin of if free stuff.

title: Meh
review: the item seems strong but doesnt come with the adaptors for the stock and the pump for my mossburg 500. but overall meh... itll do, it was a christmas gift, but i think ill just go buy the one i saw at cabelas...

title: Nice Pack
review: Nice pack but the wrist bands are super small

title: Ultra Compact; Quick Set-Up and Tear-Down
review:
I ordered this folding chair after I discovered that the one I use most often is finally starting to fall apart. My wife has been wanting a newer one anyway. This one came as a bit of a surprise and it is better than I expected.

The chair itself is very compact when stored, taking up about half of the space of typical hunting or beach chairs like this. That was a little startling and I was actually a little unsettled when I unboxed it. I realized that the segments came apart but I did not know the chair broke down this compactly.

The description says “1-minute set-up”. That’s a little ambitious but I will say it took very little time to set up from the time it came out of the nylon carrier to the time it was completely assembled and ready. It clearly takes more time than most folding chairs of this basic design, and the extra time was in getting the frame completely set up properly. There was a small amount of effort required to get the actual fabric attached but this wasn’t too hard.

The chair itself seems very lightweight and I was concerned that it would not support me, but I was pleasantly surprised when I sat in it and it didn’t flinch. It is surprisingly comfortable too, though the lumbar support is minimal.

Teardown is quick and easy, and it took me slightly more time to disassemble the chair than to assemble it. I was able to get it back into the bag without too much effort, either.

This is a decent folding chair that’s suitable to taking just about anywhere, It’s small enough to fit inside a backpack, it is easy to set up and tear down, and it’s comfortable.

title: Cheap light but works; ships inappropriately; lanterns are not built to last
review:
There are two lanterns improperly shipped in a plastic envelope. Each lantern comes with three AAA batteries already installed. A tab has to be pulled out in the battery compartment before they will work. The battery compartment is on the bottom of the unit. The top cover is just some hollow space and holds nothing.

There are two handles for hanging or they can be folded down. The light has to be exposed by expanding the unit. There is only one light mode. Just press the center button to turn on or off. Note that the button is hard to see as it blends in with the top cap of each lantern.

No instructions are provided but none are really needed.

I like that the lanterns can be carried and that it is versatile enough to stand up on its own. Inserting the batteries are also easy.

What I hate about this is that the units are not packaged appropriately for shipment. These are VERY CHEAP lights that I do not feel will last a long time. Also, the screw top that holds the batteries in the flashlight is difficult to re-seat and line up for closure. It took me several tries before the bottoms screwed on correctly.

For the price, these are okay as a disposable light source. However, I rate this 2 stars because the packaging is so poor that if one orders this, most likely it will arrive broken. I just got lucky.

title: Ok, not bad, thin insulation,  tall not wide at the bottom
review:
This bag is deep, but not as wide as my other bags.

I live in the mountains in California and when I go to my two big local Markets here I do not use this thin insulated bag , no need too, but If I go down the mountain to Trader Joe’s & Costco and it takes me a hour to drive home I might take this bag, it’s not bad, but not great.

But yesterday it was almost 100 degrees here. my husband went to the Dr. up here before going to the Local market at 5pm he brought two insulated bags full of the big frozen ice blocks that comes in thick plastic. Bought at Walmart years ago. Keep in freezer all the time.
This bag sat in the car in the shade for two hours ,then husband brought these bags
Into the market, and loaded up with 5 big packages of big chicken
Breasts and cold veggies. Nothing frozen.
Hubby made a short stop and drove home fast he said. We only live about 5 miles from market.
All the food was cold including the chicken. And veggies.

But if I went down the mountain with this bag, and bought frozen items it would not have been cold enough I think!
As I said this has thin insulation, but the out side seems thick as my other bags. My other bag did a little better then this one.

I also notice I paid $25.00 for this bag about two weeks ago, now
It’s $23.OO.!!

title: I hate Camping BUT....
review:
First I should mention i HATE camping, there is nothing I like about it. Its hot, buggy and really after a day outside all i want to do is slip into a cool bed and sleep. My family convinced me an air mattress would make it comfortable and I'd love it. So, we spend big bucks on a mattress, go camping and its awesome ,Til about 11 and then the stupid thing is deflated and Ive got a rock in my hip. Of Course there's no power so we sleep like that til 5 am and I still freaken hate camping.This goes on for a few years,a new mattress every ear due to leaks. I only keep going because because I love my grandkids.
This year I decide to buy this mattress because I don't need power to inflate it. We get it, it looks kinda cheap but, we inflate it for a few days, get it stretched out.Deflate it, roll it up and head out camping.I have No faith in this mattress, none.
My 4 year old grandson inflates this for me(It's that easy), I set up the tent and get this! It stays inflated all night. There were still ticks, it was still cold, it still wasn't the Hilton.BUT, I got 8 hours of Good sleep....and bacon in the morning. I will go camping a lot more now and
This Mattress is going camping with me every time!

Taking the basket off is the only option at that point, but then the bike isn't as cute and my daughter is mad about not having a place to put her "things".

title: Add this to your home gym now.
review:
Update: received my replacement fit deck. It had the same problem as the first fit deck, i.e. just a little bit of force (slap with hand) collapses the leg. Since this is the second time I’ve experienced the problem, I figured I’d give it a try before returning the product and calling it quits. And I’m so glad I did! I did a chest/shoulders workout, keeping the weight light just to test the waters on its stability before putting more weight on it (but mindful of the 330lb max load and I weigh 170lb). I did 55lb dumbbell, 50lb incline, 55 decline bench press and I didn’t notice any instability or hear the plastic straining against the weight. Granted, I eased my way onto and off the bench and will keep doing so until I can fully trust the bench. So if you’ve only got modest weights at home, this unit should be just fine.

I was surprised with how much more pleasant this bench makes banded resistance work. The added height from the site created almost constant resistance throughout the range of motion on front and lateral shoulder raises. A combination of this bench and a good set of resistance bands (I have 150lb of resistance) might be able to replicate a traditional cable pulley station, at least the best we can hope for during Covid. Hope this helps!

Old: Make sure you test each leg’s locking mechanism before your first workout!

Although the unit is rated for 330lbs, I haven’t found any information that specifies whether it can handle that much weight with the legs fully extended and the bench portion set at the incline position. All of the reviews seem to be posted by folks doing light aerobic/HIIT training, which wasn’t very helpful since I plan to use the bench for weight lifting. I weigh 165lbs and wanted to make sure the unit could handle my weight, plus that of my dumbbells (80lb each).

I decided to test each component of the bench first prior to working out and I’m glad I did. One of the legs collapsed from the locked position when I applied only minimal pressure. I know that it’s my unit that’s defective, as opposed to the product generally, because the other leg held up just fine under the same pressure. Thus I’ll be returning this unit and exchanging it for a unit that hopefully has two working legs.

I have NOT been paid for this review nor any other review so far. (I wish I would though).
This is, as always, just and only my opinion thought my own eyes and felt with my own hands. I take reviews serious, as I rely on them to make my decisions before any and all my purchases. So if you have found my review helpful please vote and let the other Amazonian Browsers get a better judgment of what to expect and how the product works. Thank you for your time and happy buying.

title: very easy to install changed from grip shifters
review:
how to install
out of the box shift it to gear 7 that will give you the most slack
shift the old shifter(the one currently on the bike) to gear 7 as well you want the derailuer on the smallest cog
unscrew the cable at the derailuer also unscrew old shifter from handlebars
next watch where the housings are if not that old you can reuse pull the old cable all the way out
mount new shifter to handle bar
thread the new cable thru the old cable housings
at the derailuer turn the barrel adjustment screw all the way in then back it out a turn turn and a half
thread the cable thru pull it snug and tighten then check your shifting shift it up and down if anything is stuck go to the barrel adjuster on the derailuer and give it a turn out or in see what does it

title: Overpriced cheaply made product, I expected more from Franklin!
review:
This is very cheaply made. The part where the balls go in up top is just thin injected plastic, similar to the plastic part of product packages that you throw away. You know the molded plastic piece that holds your item in place in the box, this plastic is about that quality! Just awful.

The part where you roll the balls on is just fabric which I'm not crazy about either honestly. Overall for the price point, I'm very disappointed in this, it should have cost a fraction of what they're charging and there are far far better skee ball type alternatives available out there that you should go with.

I love Franklin but it's a no on this one from me.

title: Sounds like it is going to come apart at every squeeze!
review:
Okay, this is my first exercise ring.
It seems really well made in general.
But there's just no way it should be cracking and snapping like it is!

When you squeeze the ring, and I don't have super strength, it sounds like it is going to break. It is only on one side, where the metal strip and yellow cover meet. I don't know if it wasn't connected right at the factory or quite what is going on with it.

I am worried about an end piece coming out! I read through some other reviews and it sounds like this is NOT the norm. So wondering if I got a faulty ring.

Would love to hear from the company on this issue.

title: Easy to pop up, but came with holes
review:
I want to like this tent. It has so much potential, but it's got some major caveats.
The good: When they say it is easy to set up, they mean it for real! The rods are woven into the material so it can just be lifted and snapped into standing position, which is great!
The bad: The fly could use some TLC, you have to attach the strings yourself to stake it down and hold in position properly to make it waterproof, and that was a little more difficult than other tents we have used.
The ugly: The biggest problem, however, is that we discovered what appears to be tension related holes inside right away. I'm not 100% certain, but this is not our first tent and they appear to have come that way from the factory. We might be able to patch it but this raises some serious quality control concerns. It should not have come this way.

title: Make exercise fun again!
review:
I have a different style weighted hula hoop that I enjoy, but wanted to try this one too. I'm a little uncoordinated and clumsy, so much that I couldn't do a real hula hoop to save my life. So I figured that trying weighted hula hoops with a smooth consistent track would be the way for me to get my exercise in and not get frustrated when I can't keep the weight moving around.

This weighted hula hoop is great for uncoordinated people like me. I can easily and consistently keep that weighted ball moving around me for 15 minutes. No worries about having to stop and restart, I can concentrate instead of keeping moving to keep my heart rate up. I've been able to remove at least one link already and hope to do more.

I took off one star because of the disconnect button. It can be really hard to get the piece to let go to remove the hula hoop. It gets better with time, maybe it loosens up? But I do wish there was a better way to remove the hula hoop. At least one time I've had to yell for my husband to come help me! So it does need a little more design work to be a 5 star for me.

I feel like this is good for child development. It kept my children's interest. It would also make a nice gift.

I would recommend it.

title: Great For Cleaning The Car Especially After Covered In Mud
review:
My daughter got her first car. It is used, but she is still at the point where she can wash, vacuum and clean her car often. When I got this cleanser, she grabbed it and ran.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This cleaner comes in a large plastic bottle with 32 oz of cleaner in it. The scent is nice- almost like a gentle fruity smell with a twist like bubble gum- but not sickening at all.

HOW WAS IT USED
She used 3 caps into a bucket of warm water, and she washed as instructed.

PERFORMANCE?
This cleaner cleaned very well. It removed mud (when she got her car stuck in the mud it was completely covered), dirt, tar, and greasy spots without streaking. The car was left in great condition ready for polish. The surface was left clean with no residue as promised.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For a great cleaning for a car with no streaking or residue, this is good stuff. The fragrance is pleasant but not overbearing and it is easy to use.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. A little goes a long way and the car looked great when done.

title: Comfy but can I have pockets please
review:
These yoga pants are nice and comfortable. I like that they fit and are true to size. The material is very comfortable which is great. It is on the thinner side so great for warmer days and lounging around.
The downside on these, they are not tummy control as advertised. They are actually quite loose. They also don't have pockets, why they still make pants without pocket is just beyond me!

Other than that happy with these but PLEASE, add pockets. Totally missed that part about them.

title: Can't comment on longevity but I am IN LOVE
review: So, for the first time that I can recollect, it's flipping FREEZING in Georgia. In November! I was born last century, closer to the middle than the end, and I swear I don't recall it ever being this daggum cold in Georgia at Thanksgiving. I remember wearing shorts and sweating MANY Thanksgivings. Most Thanksgivings, actually. The thing about cold weather, for me, is once my feet get cold, only running them under hot water for about 5 minutes warms them back up. I usually only have to deal with that kinda cold a couple of months, January through March, and Im usually just fine dealing with it. Welp, the cold came early and so I wanted thick, comfortable, warm socks. Less polyester and more wool. Something reminiscent of slouchy socks from the mid80s. (GADDDDDD I MISS THICK COTTON SLOUCHY SOCKS 😭). These are what I landed on after half an hour of looking through Amazon and they were like a lightning deal or something. They arrived, I laundered them and there has legit not been a day since that I have not worn these socks. I keep them cycling through my washing machine, so it will be interesting to see how long they last. Still... 5 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Gimicky, Wasn't Really Pressurized That well
review: Wasn't really impressed with this product.  When you first get it, make sure and pay attention to how you open it up to fill the top with water so that you can get it back together the same way, otherwise it will leak or it will fall off the plastic top handle.  Was hoping the spray was adjustable like a garden hose sprayer, mist or stream so that you could mist yourself or squirt clean something.  Nope.  It just kind of forks the spray in two directions with a weak stream.  Have you ever seen a water fountain fork a stream in two directions?  Only if someone messed with it.  Really, if you try to squirt this in your mouth from a distance, you will end up wasting water and getting your shirt messy.  You're going to have to just suck it out like the rest of em.  It will squirt out maybe 2'-3' max.  You wouldn't be able to mix up powder in a cup with the limited pressure.  I liked the concept, the execution of it is bad.

It seems pretty low to the ground in fact, probably best for younger kids or lightweight adults. I didn't find it all that comfortable personally, however I am an XL sized adult. You can see in the attached picture that the width is pretty... well, not wide. It is definitely not the best air mattress I've ever used, nor is it the worst. It's just OK. The fact that it comes with a blow up pillow is a nice bonus, and the included motor makes it a decent buy for the price IMO. If you already have a motor however, you can probably get a slightly nicer mattress for the money.

title: men's silicone wedding band
review: Saw another dude wearing one on a job site we were at and I thought is would be a good idea.  Enough though I ordered the size ring he wears, it was huge.  And he didn't like it at all.  Thought it looked a rubber tire or gasket.  He was not a fan.  I think it is probably safer than his gold band, but he tells me that he's worn it for more 30 years at the same job and he's not going to change it now.  Okee dokee. In all honesty, it is not very attractive in my opinion, but it was functional as ring - if it had fit.  I would recommend sizing down - but if you get one that is too small, it's really not useful either.  I think it's just hard to size a ring without trying it on.  If you're willing to spend a few extra bucks, go for it - buying a couple of sizes.  It's a wonky fit because of the material alone.

title: Nice weight and bag
review: It’s nice to have the storage for the line and bag but this line is absolute crap. I never even used the line, just put it in the trash. There’s no way that line could have been used to throw up over a limb of a tree. I purchased a quality line elsewhere and used this bag and weight to complete the package.

title: Great gift!
review: Great gift! May purchase for myself.

title: I was so happy it arrived really fast
review: I was so happy it arrived really fast, but the front shaping of the hat was crumpled and as hard as I tried to smooth it out, it never looked correct or new. It arrived in a non-crumpled box so that leads me to believe it was damaged before shipping.  Also the hat is a bit shallow and had a tendency to ride up. I then noticed when I finally managed to push it on well and pinned it to my hair, the white lines and the brim are not sewn correctly and don't  line up symmetrically. I bought it for my "Sarah Thomas, NFL Official" Halloween costume. If I needed to wear it everyday I definitely would have returned it and if I had planned ahead when I ordered I would have left enough time to order a different hat. In the end I was able to make it work, but I wouldn't recommend or reorder it.

title: False advertising. Not the "totally redesigned" model.
review: The clips on this planet board are not the improved design. They are garbage.  I had to spend an extra $13 on OS clips.  False advertising!!!! (Totally redesigned model these are not!!!)

title: 3 Broke!
review: Here's the deal, I ordered these as open package, but I could tell that only one was tried. As I tried to get keys on these, they were so tight that they actually broke! The spring breaks right off. I was also angry to find these for $3 and change at my local hardware store. These are worthless. Don't waste your money!

title: Impressed
review: Value for money for sure! I use them for Pilates and yoga. I have recommended them to everyone I know, and would definitely buy them again.

title: Great Price for the Specs!
review:
Great design and good price. The reviews were influential in my decision to purchase this brand.
I am 6’3”… around 195 lbs., and can get more than 10 miles, round trip, before the battery starts to slow the scooter down. This is usually an hour long joyride, which is plenty for me. The 19 mph top speed is accurate, and the 15 degree uphill incline is an understatement. I can climb up steep bridges at a decent pace. My 70 year old parents also tried a quick ride, and handled themselves well.
Very happy with my purchase.

title: Five Stars
review: Love my water bottles .

title: Five Stars
review: better then i expected !! using every day.

title: Five Stars
review: Effortless, does not damage the tile

title: Not the best
review: Bands are not very flexible and they have a short usage life.

title: Decent Home Rower
review:
We have been in Crossfit for a while and I have found the rower to be a great workout. Now our busy lives are keeping us from the gym way too often so when we got a chance to get a reviewer rower we were super stoked. Assembly was ok, especially when you realize that the bolts are prethreaded and need to be removed from the components to use them. At first I was surprised that none were in the little bag of bolts I was given. The basic assembly is actually pretty easy, but take a little deciphering from looking at the illustration and reading the brief instruction text. With many distractions it took me about 35 minutes.

The hardest thing about the assembly was getting the seat to right smoothly. It has a couple plates that can move up and down and for some reason they are loose and fall onto the top of the rails. I tightened these away from the rail. Also, there is a bottom roller that needed to be raised with some bolts on the side that took some tightening to get all the rollers in contact and now it glides very well.

As for general use. I now know how spoiled we are to have such nice rowers at the gym. This is decent quality, but not on par with the pro gym machines. The tension at top level is not particularly hard but it does keep the fly wheel from flowing. The computer is good in general, the battery cover was deformed on the back but just looks bad, it functions fine. We also have a little issue with the general angle that might just be familiarity, but you sit well above the plane of the handles so it feels like I am pulling up more than usual rather than just back. I was afraid that there would not be enough pulling distance (i am 6'3") but there is no issue with that. We'll use it and see how it goes.

title: Tough case with vibrant color, good latches, automatic seal & easy to manage foam
review:
The color is vibrant, the latches work well & the handle is handy but not rubberized. The case seals up well & the casing seems tough but I haven't tested for durability or waterproofing. The pull & pluck foam is easy to work with. The little squares are around 5/8" & separate a lot cleaner if they are trimmed with a blade first. I was concerned about the non-separated pieces around the edges but they are holding up well.
The case is smaller than I expected. With all of the reinforcements & thick seal on the outside, there is a diminishing return of space on the inside with smaller sizes. The dimensions in the description are quite accurate. I have a holstered G26 in my pictures & it turned out to be tight. A 1911 might fit but would be happier in a larger case.
I have Pelican cases & the ones from the tool store. The thing that this case & Pelicans have is a valve that lets you check it on an airplane without it inflating like a balloon but still being waterproof. I was inspecting the valve on this one as soon as I got it & managed to break the cover off of the valve.

title: Generally good product with a poor switch system.
review: I like this light for several reasons including the hybrid battery system, lumens, fit and basic quality.  The switching system makes the light completely inadequate.  The switch is obvious at the top of the device but locating the precise pressure point is a fumbling joke and the switch is mushy instead of positive.  At times it takes several seconds to switch on.  Then you have to push and hold if the beam setting is wrong.  I returned all three of this unit (2 were gifts and those parties were also unhappy with switching).  By contrast the CORE  300 has excellant switching capabilities.

title: Defect
review: Cute, decent price. But listen, I am incredibly frustrated with the fact that only 2 of 3 'stages' working. On the pair skates we received: level 1 locks only 2 wheels, level 2 and 3 both leave all 4 wheels unlocked and able to turn. The 3 learning stages promised (1. all wheels locked, 2. two wheels locked, 3. All unlocked) were the reason I chose this particular style of skates for my 2 yr old!

title: This works, but it's expensive
review: If you only have a small area to work with, this is great.  I used it on my camper and it works well, but campers are big and the streaks are many.  The product is too expensive to buy and use on an RV.  It needs to be a concentrate that can be mixed in water and used with a brush.

title: A bit too bulky...
review: My husband put this on and said it is definitely too bulky for him to use while fly fishing. There is potential to use it more for hunting, but he said he didn't like how bulky it was around the middle. The other thing we noticed is that the top zipper was really hard to get open and shut, so I don't know how durable it is going to be over time. My husband said he will try to use it for hunting, but it isn't something he would purchase.

title: Front Light is Defective
review: I knew I probably should've took it as a red flag reading the comments stating that the front light on this product is garbage.. which it is! The front light doesn't have an indicator to show that it's charging so you just have to wait till a LED light in it turns green. It took this thing 12 hours to turn green (for me) and the battery didn't last for 30 minutes! It's not bright at all anyways. I'm disappointed in this false advertising. I guess you really do get what you pay for 😔 - 2/5 stars. The red (rear) light works fine and has a light to indicate charging. That's the only thing that works.

title: Great chair for backpacking
review: I bought this to take on my first backpacking trip.  It is lightweight,  easy to set up and is very supportive.

title: Can you say "bait and switch"?
review:
The stated price was $14.95 to $180.00, but none of the jackets in any size or any color were priced at $14.95.
Amazon should remove this company for false advertising.

title: Wouldn't recommend
review: The adhesive doesn't allow the signage to stay adhered to the window. Would not recommend. Also took ages to receive once ordered. Only thing I liked was the wording...

title: Sturdy
review: It it sturdy. I was skeptical if it would be able to hold adult weight— but it seems to hold up just fine. It definitely holds between 150-200 lbs. easily. The outer foam is glued on and the seam is a little messy. But that doesn’t affect the functionality at all. The carrying bag is a little on the cheap side. Though I personally think it is easier to store and carry without a bag.

title: Great Quality Paddle Board With Lots of Accessories
review:
This is a very high quality paddle board that is the perfect choice for a variety of adventures on the water. It comes with everything you need to get started, and it is very convenient to inflate and deflate. The pump works well and allows you to get to full pressure in just a few minutes. When the board is deflated, it fits easily in the trunk or the back seat of a car making it highly convenient to transport.

I prefer to use this paddle board from a seated position and I love the padded seat attachment. The seat clips into place with four rings that are mounted on the board and requires minimal adjustment. The seat provides good back support as you float, paddle, or fish.

The material of this paddle board is very durable and will not puncture if you hit rocks or sticks. It comes with two fishing rod holders and a variety of other accessories. The storage back is large enough to comfortably hold everything you need, and has shoulder straps which make it easy to transport.

This is a wonderful and convenient paddle board that will allow you to get out on the water in style.

title: Awesome buy!
review: I read a TON of reviews on different brands and pulled the trigger on this one. My husband is in the military and deploys frequently. Purchased as a gift for easy travel. Quality is fantastic! The pole extends and retracts smoothly as advertised. The fishing reel is high quality and smooth. Nice padded travel case to keep equipment protected. We own an embarrassing amount of fishing equipment from moving all over the country therefore targeting different species of fish and this fishing pole rates up there with our best rods! Can't wait to see how it performs... I am considering purchasing one for myself!

title: Great!!
review: Great!!! Go White Sox

title: Poor quality
review: I’ve just been using their chair for a few days and the chair is already falling apart. The quality is not good and I’m only 130 lbs and already feel like it can’t take me

title: Nice bag with lots of pockets
review:
While this bag is on the more expensive side, it's a good one. My first observation was that the bag was bigger than I expected. It has several different pockets ranging from a "hidden" accessory pocket along the back of the backpack (for phones, etc.), to the main pocket for your paddles, to a bottle pocket. Not the mention the larger accessory pocket and medium-sized misc. pocket.

In the main pocket, I'd guess you could fit 3, maybe 4 paddles. Definitely at least 2 without any issues. Also Inside the main pocket, there is a fence hook, which is a nice touch.

In the "middle" pocket (in between the larger accessory pocket and the main pocket, there is room for some balls + more (I'm thinking grip tape, lead tape, etc.). The zippers on all the pockets feel like your average zippers and I would assume they'd hold up well over time.

While this is definitely on the pricier side of pickleball backpacks, I do find it to be pretty nice. Definitely has enough room for all your stuff and feels like a quality bag. I'm expecting this to hold up for a while. Overall, I like it!

title: Just What She Wanted
review: My daughter was asking me for one of these hoola hoops recently. She said they're very popular on TikTok. This item comes with a thin waist trimmer/wrap. The hoola hoop comes in pieces and requires some simple assembly. She had to take out 3 or 4 of the pieces to fit her waist. I am a plus size 16/18 and it fit me snuggly with just one piece removed. It works well. My daughter really got into it. I couldn't wait to take it off - it wasn't my thing! I think I felt a little claustrophobic in it. My daughter currently has really long acrylic nails and found that she needed help to take it off. She was unable to push the button to take it off on her own.

title: Easy to clean
review: Nothing to assemble easy to clean very strong it's perfect what were using it for

title: Granddaddy of the Granddaddies Stroller!  The Sport Series
review:
I have not seen such a more versatile stroller as this. This is for the Parent on the Go, someone who travels to the mountains, jogs, bikes, strolls, skis. This is of superb quality! Easy to assemble, has thorough instructions, clear images.

This is the TWIN set, and, my opinion, is that the space for two seems tight. And, if you have a larger child, I would see no harm in ONE Child in the Twin Seat.

Keep in mind, this is heavier than small compact strollers. It is not something you can pop in and out of the SUV. It is not a stroller you haul to the grocery store! But if you take it for a stroll on the ground or sidewalk, the ride is smooth, with great control!

FIVE ACTIVITIES, 4 SEASONS, 1 CARRIER
This is a multifunction, year-round. You can WALK, JOG, ATTACH to BIKE, HAUL BEHIND YOU as you walk, and of course, the ultimate.... SKI with it!

First of all, I used it on the back of a bike. Nice easy attaching. The glide down the street was easy, smooth. I strolled it on the grass and dirt, and equally as easy to maneuver. The back wheels are large.

As mentioned this is a superb stroller, built to last, versatile!

title: The handles are comfortable, but
review:
Works well but not as handy as I had hoped. The handles are comfortable. But with a fixed length, uses with the handles are limited. You can of course still use this tube without the handles, or cut and modify the length to your liking.

Also, you get one tube, the black one as stated in the text. The picture shows the different strength tubes and can cause some confusion if you don't read the text.

title: Works fine
review: This helmet worked fine. It protected her head well. We were able to get it on just fine. It seemed secure. She felt like it was comfortable. It looked fine. It provided good protection. We were pleased and would recommend it.

title: Igloo BMX cooler
review: This is supposed to be 4-5 day cooler - if kept under 90 degrees...  More like 2 days.  I even used very expensive jumbo shock ice packs.  Eh.  Completely warm on the 3rd day.  It's just a cooler and if you aren't expecting 4-5 days, you'll be fine.  I didn't find it any better than any other cooler I have ever purchased.

title: Instructions not very comprehensible, folding and unfolding it is taxing.
review:
This is an initial impressions commentary less than it is a review. I plan on following up once I've had at least a month's worth of activity with it. Here in Chicago, the weather has been varying at the time of this review, so we've been able to use this only about a solid week's worth.

The night I received it I assembled it immediately. I've put together a few strollers, so I didn't intend on taking longer than twenty minutes. Not with this stroller. It took me almost an hour. The instructions came in two parts: one sheet indicating that it may be difficult to unfold at first, and the main instructions. Indeed, the stroller is very difficult to unfold at first, and it is difficult to fold back.
The instructions were not very coherent; the illustrations, instead of being reference models as in most manuals, were black-and-white photographs which made it difficult to discern exactly what they were trying to portray. Half the time I was trying to figure it out, and ended up going with my gut-feeling (which, thankfully to my previous stroller assembly experiences, led me to the correct outcomes).

Unfolding it the first time proved very difficult. Again, I did this myself with the assumption that it wouldn't be very difficult, so I did have a harder than usual unfolding it into its locked position. Once everything was assembled (mind you, you will need to provide your own tools as mine came with the wrong sized hex/L wrench and was missing the other tool, whatever it was), I was ready to put it in the basement for the time being. We live in a pretty spacious apartment building with plenty of basement storage, and that's where we store all of our strollers, etc. Folding it back was pretty rough; I could not for the life of me tell where the unlocking mechanisms were due to the poorly lit photographs, so I had to figure it out. Once I got it, however, one side of the locks was very hard to unlock.

On our first walks, however, the stroll was fine. It glides pretty smoothly, but I wish the handlebar had an easier and quicker way to adjust the angle, as our previous strollers have. As I mentioned before, it's very difficult to unfold and requires two people, so when my wife tried to get the stroller out on her own she was unable to due to the force required. Who knows how this will be with time.

As I've mentioned, I will follow up with a more experienced review.

title: They are just like the ones at the gym
review: They are just like the ones at the gym, so I can continue my exercises at home or when I travel

title: The medium is very small
review:
Got the red indiana University hoodie in a medium.

Branding- I work at IU so I can attest this is the correct logo and the red seems to match the offical IU red stuff i have and this is why it got two stars. The price is about half of the price of the official IU bookstore but in this case you pay for what you get.

Material- This is about half the normal sweatshirt weight. That could be good or bad. If you are a hot person this would be a good weight. For me I want the thicker because winter in indiana sucks.

Sizing- I'm not sure what this medium is and its label for sure says M but it is definitely not a man's, unisex or womens medium. To me its more like a womens small. The length is 26". The shoulder width is 21". Chest width is 21.5". And this is the kicker... the band along the bottom of the shirt is 17".

I will be returning this and looking local. If I paid maybe $20 for it it would be ok but at $45 you can get better.

title: Nice Variety
review: This is a nice variety of national parks stickers. The quality of the stickers is pretty good. There were a couple that weren't as clear as the others (intentional??). The adhesiveness is fine. A fun gift for the nature lover in your life!

review: Hi, Maggie---This trophy is PERFECT for any award. You can tape a name and small message on the front to [personalize it.  Itis a great vbalue for the price, and well-made.

title: Portable Bike Pump
review: I love this bike pump.  It's portable, super easy to use, and you can use your body weight to pump up the tires by stepping on the little foot pump part, which makes it so simple that even a child can use it.

title: Fuzzy socks are in
review: Fuzzy socks are in. My 12 year old loves these socks. She was so excited to get them. The colors are nice and they're great quality.

title: Runs small
review: I got the L/XL fins and they fit me perfectly. Like a glove. However, I wear a size 9.5, and these fins are supposed to fit 9–13. I don’t think there’s any way in the world that they’re going to fit a size 12 or 13 foot.

title: Not 5lbs Each
review: Put these on a scale, and they come in at 4.6lbs and 4.8lbs... I paid  $2 per pound and expected that I was getting 10lbs of weight..... Definitely not the case. Will be returning and will find weights that weigh what they're advertised as.... Save your money

title: Good Fit!
review: My daughter wears leggings all the time. She lives in them! These mediums fit as expected. She's 5'7" and weighs about 145 pounds. She wears mediums in leggings. These are a good fit. They are mostly opaque, but not fully. They're not super see through, but is she's wearing printed undies, they can sort of be seen. It's not too bad that she won't wear these in public. She's had some that were so see through that it wasn't funny. She'll probably just wear solid dark colored underwear and be fine with it. She loves the pocket and is so happy that leggings are beginning to add them. It's nice to have a place for your phone! Overall, she is pleased with these.

title: To large. Would give 5⭐ if they fit
review: Usually leggings are tight. These are made bigger than all of the leggings I own. I would love the style. I may have to return these. It's hard to return when I'm in bed most of the time in pain.

title: Great set
review: These stickers were very nice. They were a good size. You got a lot of them. They were bright and vibrant. They were really cute. The kids liked them. They stuck pretty well. It was a nice assortment. You can use them on all sorts of places. They really can make something look unique and nice. They were pretty easy to peel. They stayed on well. I was pleased with quality and durability. I would recommend it.

title: Very nice quality
review: Great quality,  comfortable,  great for hiking or just out if you don't want to carry a wallet:)

title: Went over great at Christmas.
review: My friend is a big UK fan. These are good solid coasters, and she was thrilled.

title: What a nice set of goggles!!
review: My son and I love to swim and we go through goggles so quickly. I decided to give these a try... They are perfect!! 2 pairs of goggles come in the pack and for a price you can’t beat. 1 pair is white and black, the other is black. I love that these are adjustable! These goggles fit perfectly for both my son and I. Love that they are Nike too!! Nice quality goggles!! No leaks!! Comfortable!! Can’t be anymore positive about these!

review: I gave 2 as gifts. They loved them .

review: Hi, you can't beat THIS deal. Tasty and wholesome and priced right. MRE's are not often described as delicious but these are pretty darn good,  Mike

title: Nice figure for wrestling fans
review:
This is a nice action figure for wrestling fans. Brett Wyatt is very popular. There is a twist to this action figure in that it gives you the different parts and you have to put him together. You can make different combinations with the pieces they give you.

My son really enjoyed this toy. He liked putting it together (and taking it apart again). The only thing is you have to be sure to keep all the small pieces because missing a few could be a real problem. It's also nice that you can mix and match with the other six inch figures they have. He enjoyed it a lot.

title: Great water bottle!
review: This water bottle is fantastic. It does not leak, and it easily disassembles for cleaning. I use a standard bottle & straw brush. Absolutely no complaints. The clip on the cap is great too.

title: Not for me.
review: I didn't like the quality for me a 50+ year old women I wanted a removable magnetic. Its literally a sticker. I returned it. It will be great for a young person looking for a cute cover up for a ding.

title: Folds easy to put together
review:
I gave it 4 stars because the foam/padding is thin and can slide off. Only complaint.
Positive was really easy to assemble. Once I stared using it I saw results right away. It also folds up and fit into a closet when not being used. I am happy with this product.

title: Works great with no leaking!
review:
I ordered this IPOW Collapsible Silicone Water Bottle Foldable Roll Up Water Bottle 26OZ for my daughter. She's been wanting a collapsible water bottle and this was exactly what she had in mind.
It's made of a high quality silicone and though a little wobbly when fully extended and full, it functions quite well and it doesn't leak. Cleaning is pretty easy too by using a bottle brush or just fill it with some warm soapy water and shake, then thoroughly rinse.
The only downside I can see, is that it doesn't keep liquids cold for long but it is just a water bottle and not insulated. Overall it's great for what it is and my daughter loves it!

title: Fairly easy to put together
review:
Fairly easy to put together. The holes all lined up, which is great for a product like this.

I love the color.

I'm short waisted so this doesn't fit me well for the decline. It would fit a taller person better. There is no slot for the decline so it goes all the way back. I prefer the decline on the one I have. It's old and I don't remember the brand.

I find the vinyl feels a bit cheap. In the recline position the metal post doesn't fit well into the pieces that hold it in place. You have to hit the back from underneath to get it loose. The vinyl that covers the foam appear to be cheaply made.

title: Awesome Disc
review: I beat my old distance record on the very first throw with this disc. It feels great in the hand. It's pretty stable right now, but I'm hoping it develops a bit more turn as it breaks in. I was mostly throwing hyzers, and it kept a straight line very well. My last throw of the night had a bit of an anhyzer release, and it WENT. It ended up next to a building that I thought was way out of my range. I was saying "holy balls" over and over again, and a park ranger felt the need to ask if I was OK. Great disc.

title: Nice glove
review: Nice value glove. Easy to open and close, pre broken in. I used it to help coach daughters softball team U7. Not a lot of coverage on the palm of my hand but does not effect my catching ability.

title: Great product

title: Adjustable!
review:
It's adjustable, with plenty's of room to grow. The tightening knob on the back worked great. The base of the helmet seems to cover the back of his skull well enough, but the helmet leaves a bit too much visable forehead for my liking. He said it is comfortable and he wore it for an hour riding bikes this afternoon outside. It really stayed in place, with little adjusting or movement.
It's more of a plain yellow than the neon yellow pictured here, imo. But that's ok. This yellow is still a highly visable color (especially to drivers), so it gets high marks for that. Also comes with a set of replacement pads, but no extra replacement stickers.
(Please excuse the terrible lockdown haircut!)

title: Ok
review: If you are very out of shape it can help. If you have difficulty getting on the floor it may be a challenge. Cheaply made. But if you need a simple tool it can be helpful. Disengaged the clicker. Annoying. Well packaged. Sturdy for the price.

title: Large pack for longer hikes
review:
This pack is great for longer hikes and long days outdoors. The bladder holds more than enough space for a hike that's a couple miles long in the summer heat. There are plenty of pockets to carry extra stuff and the pack itself feels thin and light but well constructed.

When I first wore this it didn't sit flat on my back and it was kind of uncomfortable because it sat awkwardly on my lower back. I was worried the pack just didn't work for me, but I wore it anyway and by the 3rd use the stiffer back panel had loosened up and it's no longer uncomfortable. Definitely would recommend playing around with the straps and "breaking it in" to get a comfortable fit. I'm definitely happy with this pack and will often wear this around even when I'm not hiking, if I don't want to bring a water bottle with me.

If you do shorter hikes I might say a smaller pack may be better because I wear my pack nearly empty on shorter hikes (besides the water) and sometimes wish I had something a bit more compact, especially when I'm getting really sweaty haha

Hope this review is helpful!:)

title: Get functionality and convenient too!
review: Nice comfortable belt. The smaller packet is perfect for small items like keys, cell phone, id. The larger pocket isa nice touch for bigger items. I like the material and the functionality. The closure is easy and secure l highly recommend this item.

title: like the color
