title: Classic and nice
review: These have a classic look and seem to be well-made.

title: Love this brand
review:
I found this brand for a chair and have decided to stick with them for more outdoor gear.

I have the double adult sleeping bag and it was packaged well and so was this bag. The storage bag these go into are well thought out and help keep it cinched down when storing/hiking.

The bag is quite cozy and I like this one better for warmth than the double bag because it’s less space to trap heat. The lining in the bag really limits the need for additional padding other than ground cover to limit dirt/sand directly on the bag.

The material seems to be made well here again and it is insanely comfortable and very warm/cozy.

The zippers work very well and there is a pull cord at the top to help cinch it closed or closer together on cold nights. It wasn’t difficult to roll back up and place in the bag. There were also no stitching issues either. We are very pleased with this purchase and it definitely makes camping easier if kids are excited just for the sleeping bag.

Much like my other review, I am super pleased here and we are going to get another to complete our sleeping bag needs for camping.

title: I am ecstatic about these Neosport Premium 5mm 5-finger gloves.
review: I am ecstatic about these gloves. I have big palms and shorter but somewhat thick fingers, and usually order large gloves, and these XL gloves fit me absolutely perfectly.  I can't wait to see how long I'll be able to swim in my Atlanta outdoor pool this fall and winter.

Leak showed up when I was using the pump bulb for our outboard. So I removed them, cleaned off the Teflon tape and reinstalled using Permatex. Seems to hold this time. At least it passed the pump bulb test. Other than that it appears to be a solid device.

review: Great little light and fan for our camper. Light weight

title: Comfortable for work
review: Really good knee pads. Light, breathable, and comfortable. These are easy to slip on and easy to wash, just throw in washing machine. I'm a mechanic and wear these all day, working in spaces that take a toll on the knees. The honeycomb design is perfect, it doesn't move your knee around like solid plastic ones. One thing I don't like is the possibility to cut off circulation. The ones I have are large and fit snug, I might have to try xl. They are still comfortable and sometimes I don't notice them, but they do leave indentations in my skin. Again, I might need to go up a size to see if that helps

title: Definitely better than buying a full sized rack
review: I combined this with a door frame chin-up bar in my garage for daily use. Definitely better than buying a full sized rack.

title: Budget bar, nothing more, nothing less
review:
This is definitely a budget bar so do not be fooled in terms of getting a good deal.

The pros are that it handles quite a bit of weight without issue (405 total thus far) and there was limited whip in the bar. The knurl is decent, but nothing to write home about if you want good knurl. The other big pro is this is the perfect beater bar. Use it on your landmine attachment or for barbell complexes before getting into your real working weights on another bar.

The cons are that it barely fits olympic plates on to the sleeves because they weren't machined down enough. It makes for an incredibly snug fit. The other issue is that the rings on the bar aren't spaced out normally. They are about 2-3 inches (each way, 4-6 in total) further in than other bars. Do not use this as your standalone bar as it likely won't hold up over time.

title: Great product, with two caveats
review:
This is a brilliant idea. Saves a lot of time--you can do your own wraps quickly and easily. Two things you need to know before ordering this product:

1) These are meant to be worn inside boxing gloves. Do not try to use them for any sort of direct contact or a) you may injure yourself or others, and b) they will be destroyed quickly. Use them as they were intended and you will be quite pleased with the results.

2) There should be a sizing chart on here. These are meant to be very snug-fitting. I ordered a size large, and they were huge. I returned them for medium. I have average-size hands, and figured large should do the trick. Nope. These are meant to fit tightly.

---
UPDATE: The wrist wrap has started coming apart where it was attached to the glove. I had to sew it back together--I used high-quality dental floss, which is indestructible. One of the ends of the "fingers" is coming apart. This is due to trying to remove them--they are VERY hard to take off after a workout. They fit snugly (like a second skin), and it takes several minutes to work each hand off without tearing them. Even so, one of the fingers is still coming apart. I still like these--they feel good on, but when they finally do die, I think I may switch to traditional wraps.

title: Five Stars
review: High quality material and excellent looking work applying the emblem!

title: Not for 3 adult bikes; fits my 07 Corolla
review: This is ready to be installed on your vehicle right out of the box.  We use it on a 2007 Toyota Corolla and the long trip we have used it for so far has been 200 miles.  We made one stop on the initial trip after about fifty miles to tighten the straps that through typical first time use stretched a bit.  There is no way this will safely transport 3 adult bikes without scratching regardless of your vehicle; there just isn't enough room on the rack.  For two bikes this is an excellent rack, appears sturdy and install was simple by myself; I am a 55 year old female and avid cyclist. It would have gotten 5 stars if the rack could support 3 bikes without scratching them.  Price is wonderful for what you get.

title: Pain relief
review: These work pretty good but seem to bother me after a couple of hours. Not the gel pad but the elastic around my foot. I am in Florida where it’s always hot so that may be part of the problem. When I put them on they do relieve the pain in my feet. I just wish I could wear them longer.

title: Need Juuuuuust a bit more length
review: Hey, maybe this isn't a product defect but I need longer. It isn't longer.

title: Really good 32-oz tumbler ...
review:
I have a couple of other Bubba bottles, and more 32-oz water bottles than I can count (mostly Nalgene, a few others). I usually drink two 32-oz bottles of something every day -- usually water and/or a favorite Crystal Light mix. So I was interested to try out this Bubba tumbler.

I like the design -- a basic tumbler shape, silicone sleeve, flexible rubber-ish straw, tight-fitting lid. It's not spill-proof: the straw is inserted into a hole in the middle of the lid that has a small "divot" to allow air into the sealed tumbler so that you can sip. The straw fits nicely into the hole, but the divot leaves an opening for liquid to escape. Since I'm not very hard on my water bottles, I don't consider this a problem. I'm not prone to dropping or tipping them, so there shouldn't be a problem with spillage.

The sleeve provides *some* insulation so that my drink does stay colder longer than a non-insulated bottle, but not as long as a vacuum bottle. I hand-wash mine -- it's just something I do each night before I go to bed -- so I don't need to deal with removing and replacing the sleeve.

For the price, I think it's a good deal. I'm planning to purchase another one or two to have spares, and I'm definitely taking one of them along on my upcoming travels.

title: SUPER light duty
review: This lantern is quite a bit smaller (always read the dimensions!) and SUPER light weight.  It will only really be useful in a light duty capcity, which is what I had planned, so that's ok.

title: cheaply made.
review: looks very cheap and light weight. so far works fine.

title: Ok mat but NOT like the older version
review:
Not worth the price I paid. I purchased 2 of these mats in search of the Everlast mats that are like the ones in my gym. These look the same but they aren't solid like the old ones. They are better than some of the cheaper versions but again, NOT worth the price. If you expect to get a good sturdy mat like Everlast used to make, this mat is NOT it! I guess they just don't make them like the older version. The original Everlast mats weren't made of sponge. Don't know what they were made of but they're much better than these and yes, my ORIGINAL mats are still going strong. I'm not sure these will last very long at all.

You can see in the picture how the vinyl looks wrinkled. That's because it is and it doesn't fit tight like the original. $[..] would have been worth the price for the original but not for this one, definitely not the $[..] they are asking now!

title: Nice set
review: I like these. I want my kids to get physical activity, so this is nice. The kids enjoyed throwing them. They seemed well made. They flew nicely. It is nice that you got two of them. They were nice and thick. I really like the kids getting exercise. This would make a nice gift. I would recommend it.

title: Great for kids lunches
review: These work great. I use them everyday for both my kids and they keep their lunches cold for hours. You can easily wipe them off, easy to use and they don't take up a lot of space in a lunch pale.

title: Five Stars
review: fits well

title: Great mini backpack/sling
review: This is prefect for when I just want to bring my DSLR camera somewhere. Bringing my big backpack is always overkill for most situations. This is small and perfect for carrying my LUMIX GH5 and a few other small things. Fits wall and is comfortable to wear. Very pleased with the functionality and convenience of this sling backpack.

title: Amazing find!!
review: [[VIDEOID:734d6b7a13556849559aff157fa7d9f1]] Super light weight yet strong and secure. Feels very sturdy and although light, still well made. Love the 4 different heights that it can be changed to. Stores securely in it's own case so no worry about losing or misplacing parts. The net for the bottom is an added bonus. We love this little table. Take it camping, to the beach, the races, or your front yard for a picnic. Which ever you choose, it's perfect! 🥰

title: where the padals screw in it strips after a few days
review: where the padals screw in it strips after a few days to the point the pedal falls off and won't screw in at all

title: Nice product. Bad embroidery
review: I wish they hadn’t had made this beautiful, soft, well-made bolster, tacky  looking by embroidering both sides of it with stupid gold thread. It’s really ugly and cheapens it. Other than that, it’s exceptional, it’s so well-made and sturdy. I love how soft it is, and the very subtle decoration on it.

title: Will not fit my 2006 Toyota Camry Solara Convertible; also does not fit my boyfriend's 2010 Honda Accord w/o a special part
review:
I did not realize that this would not fit my car. I have a 2006 Toyota Camry Solara Convertible and the box says it will not fit years 1993 to 2008. Nevertheless, I decided to see for myself. Due to the way the bike rack is configured, the top bar almost comes off the trunk. As a result, there would be room for only one bike as the track adjusts back and forth depending on how tight it has to be cinched (based on the car model, of course). There are two provided clips that go through the holes to keep the track from sliding after the correct length is reached.

I then wanted to try this on my boyfriend's car which is a 2010 Honda Accord and it also will not fit that either without a special part. Overall, I am disappointed. I had automatically assumed bike racks were universal and did not realize that was not the case. I also did not realize that there is a chart that can be consulted to check for fit. That was my mistake.

Despite this, based on what I have noticed with this rack, the instructions are not very good. Both my boyfriend and I tried to figure them out and found them confusing. In addition, neither one of us believe this would fit three bikes unless the top rod was fastened all the way out and I doubt one would have that option on every car. Had this worked on my car, I would have given this three stars based on my other observations.

title: Update: Falling apart
review:
I wrote this review before I used the set🤦🏾‍♀️ Upon use everything falls apart. As soon as I move the “dumbbells “ in water they fall apart. The gloves offer little if any resistance. The belt? 😑
Very disappointed.

title: Love it. Great quality
review:
I really like exercising with this bar. I use it with my Tonal. Quality is great. Grip is great.
I like the fact that it has the rings for hooks so you can choose how to use it

title: all plastic and not well weighted
review:
The Kica Jump Rope is a modern take on jump ropes. It has a strong bearing allowing for fast and smooth rope movement. The rope is easily adjusted and easily switched out with the weighted balls for indoor use. The electronic counter helps to keep track of number of jumps, total time, and calories burned.

These are all great features that one would want in a modern rope. Unfortunately, the all-plastic build means that the handles themselves are quite light and the thin rope doesn't add a lot of weight. The weighted balls are also not quite weighted enough. The light weight allows for faster jumping but not great if you're looking to train your arms while jumping.

This rope is inexpensive and easy to use, but I find myself going back to the more traditional, more weighted rope due to feeling that the Kica just seems to be less sturdy and a little too light.

title: I wish they didn't change the connector chain link
review: This is a great chain.  I ride a fixed gear bike daily and this chain holds up to years of weather and abuse on my commute with very little give.  My only complaint is they changed the style of the connector chain link so it no longer has a removable locking pin face which you can disconnect to take out a link after the chain stretches from use.  Now there is no way to take out the connector chain link without destroying it and replacing it (as their instructions declare, it can not be reused).  Their old one could be removed and reinstalled without much fuss.  This just means I'll have to old school take out the links with a link tool when I need to shorten my chain, which is a pain.  Feels like they just want you to have to buy a new chain link piece every time from them, which sucks.

title: You get what you pay for
review: Not impressed, don’t recommend it. If you’re looking for a short term solution, buy it. If you’re investing in your health and wellness, I would say “no”

title: Slips against fabric
review: I have not tried this on bare skin. I wear a one piece and it slips.

review: Seems of good quality but definitely not the size I was expecting the shovel head is about the size of a average man's hand.

title: not stiff enough

title: Okay...
review: This was okay....not what I expected.  Of course it may be great for some people.

title: Concept is Okay, but Too Many Issues to Recommend
review:
We like to play games in my household and since my kids love electronics, it makes sense that electronic games would be a popular option with them. So, given my kids love of lights and action, we decided to give Franklin Sports Electronic Basketball Bounce Junior a try.

The game concept is simple enough. You bounce one of the two small basketballs on the trampoline aim for the hops, and try to achieve the highest possible score. You have 30 seconds to hit as many hoops as you can, with the bottom nets worth 10 points, the middle worth 30, and the top one worth 50. Once the 30 seconds are up, the electronic scoring display will show you the result. You can then challenge someone else and make real game out of it. It’s simple fun and kids like it, so it does earn some points in this area.

Other qualities of this toy, however, convince me to reduce my rating. One is the construction. They need to come up with a better way to explain how the different pieces fit together. I couldn’t get the net to fit at first and it was because I didn’t assemble some of the pieces correctly. A little better, more thorough effort on the part of the manufacturer would have made it much simpler and less frustrating.

I have other issues with this toy besides the assembly. One is the ball return. The netting and back piece are loose and are supposed to provide enough space for the balls to drop back to the front so that you can bounce them in quick succession for the best possible score. But the problem is, the balls get stuck, costing valuable time because you have to reach behind and move the backing around to get the ball to drop. This most commonly happens if you hit the 30 or 50 point hoops. The 10 point hoops seem to have sufficient clearance. Another issue I have is with the extension of the net. It needs to be larger so that it can capture the misses and keep the balls contained. But it doesn’t extend very far and that means the basketballs will likely go flying in different directions, again forcing someone to chase them down as the bounce away from the game. Then, there is the trampoline. I don’t know why, but when we bounce, the balls tend to go toward the left. Even a concerted effort to hit the baskets on the right side often doesn’t work- the balls keep wanting to go to the left.

I like the overall idea of this basketball game and the price is reasonable. But the manufacturer needs to make a few simple changes to make the game better. At the very least, the backing needs to be larger so that the balls return with ease. With this and other issues, I cannot rate this game very highly or recommend it overall.

title: Blah...
review: It's ok but can't fit more than one or 2 keys. Was looking for a court officer belt to stop the jingling. Buy it's a no go nothing fits

title: Warriors Fan Will Like This Big Gym Bag
review:
Any Golden State Warriors fan will be happy to carry this NORTHWEST COMPANY NBA WINGMAN DUFFEL BAG (Officially NBA Licensed) to the gym. It’s big (24” long, 12” high), lightweight, and full-featured. It has a small zippered mesh pocket inside (for keys, ID, maybe a phone), a clip-on shoulder strap, and carry handles. There is a rubberized Golden State Warriors logo (blue and gold) on the side and end.

A nice feature is that the duffel folds easily into a round zippered end pocket, making it compact for storage or travel. When the bag is unfolded, the zippered pocket becomes a 12” diameter storage pocket.

The duffel bag is well made. The care instructions say “spot clean only”, though I think the fabric will stand up to machine washing. I’m not so sure about the Warriors logo--it might peel off if the bag is machine washed, so it’s probably best to follow the spot cleaning advice. The gray heather fabric will not show dirt or stains easily.

title: dull
review: I ordered these to shoot a mouse in my kitchen. These things are dull and don't penatrate. You will hurt the mouse not humanely kill it. get steel ones instead they will do the job these will not.

title: size
review: These are good gloves but a bit snug.  I do not have the largest hands in the world and they are kind of tight on me.  If you have large hands do not bother ordering these as they will not fit you.

title: No more squeaky bike!
review: Works amazing. Smooth riding from here on out. I totally recommend :-)

review: Ok for the money but we usued it for our pontoon and I wish I would have ordered a taller one bc this one its so low and I would rather hold it... I do how ever use it when I trolly and does pretty well holding my pole

It was very disappointing to receive it in this state as it wasn’t possible to resurrect it.  Otherwise, it looked like a nice hat

review: Says it would fit an iPhone 11....barely...I have to take the case off and cram it in there....Plastic on it is cloudy and the touch screen doesn’t work. Doesn’t attach well to my Trek bike... Junk. Now that the product is unavailable I don’t even have a Way to contact the seller to let them know how I feel about it.

title: To be updated LATER.  Right now NOT IN USE, sorry.

title: Christmas gift
review: Bought this as a Christmas gift for family. For the price, it wasn’t as impressive as I thought it would be and it didn’t have as much depth (or look as 3D) as it does online. Sometimes when we get NFL gifts for the fam they get all excited…but after opening this it was a let-down. Don’t get me wrong…they LIKED it…but they didn’t LOVE it.

title: Purchase with Insurance, this could be much better!
review:
The shoulder straps could have been more comfortable, maybe if they were wider where they sit on the traps the weight of the vest would be more evenly distributed.
The mesh pocket doesn't make sense to have being that it is on the back of the vest.
Because of the vests design the weight feels very comfortably distributed & natural despite the fact that it is an additional 30 lbs.
I am looking forward to seeing how it holds up to the test of time. I would have also appreciated a manual with tips on how to care for the vest, since I will always be sweating in it.
After moderate usage, on a weekly basis, the clips on the vest have started to detach.

title: Gift for boyscouting Grandson
review: I purchased this for my 7 yr old grandson who is much larger than your average 7 yr old.  He is much closer in size to a 10 yr old, so he loves the extra room this sleeping bag provides him.  He also likes the soft material on the inside and outside - he said it keeps him super warm.  (His scouting troup went camping in 37 degrees and he was warm enough in his thermal PJ's and this bag)

title: Nice glove. Better than others I have used.
review: I prefer these gloves to the Harbingers that I have used for years.  The wrist wrap design is superior in that it is not integral to the construction of the body of the glove.  I am able to get better support for my wrists.  The design also makes it quite easy to vary the degree of compression when desired.

title: Does not fog. It is comfortable.
review: This fits well and snug.  Is it totally waterproof, nope, but it does not fog the lenses and does keep a lot of the water out.  Very comfortable.  I am short sighted, but otherwise, this is my go to goggles now.

title: Nice Fabric
review: I ordered Large and they were way to small for my boyfriend. The product is good, nice fabric and really comfortable but they run to small, or at least for me they came to small.

title: Cheap and lightweight (which is not a good thing in this case)
review: I thought I’d give this bike lock a try, but I didn’t have very high expectations. Even so, I was disappointed. The connection between the cable and the lock has a lot of play in it, and it feels like a strong pull could easily pop the cable out of the lock. Also, the whole thing is very lightweight. It doesn’t inspire confidence that it would hold up to much abuse. I recommend looking at another lock.

title: It's fun but missing parts
review: It's missing the key fob light, the credit card shaped tool, 1 of the pieces of twine & the little screwdriver tools (for eyeglass repair).

title: Easy to use
review: I was able to fit this item on the head of an 8 year old. The inside is padded and it feels light when worn, but you can feel that it has some weight to it for protection. It is matte black and has an ashy feel to it. It was easy to connect the bluetooth and the music plays loud. Sounds like the speakers are placed well so that it evenly distributes sound. The things I didn't like about it was that I tried it once for the connection and then went to use it about 2 weeks later and it was dead. Also the on/off switch is not labeled. When you turn it on, the light does turn blue and makes a dj scratching noise.

title: buy it!!
review: works well, great value

title: A nice cheap tent, cheap materials though.
review:
Broke the very first time I used it! One of the little metal folding pole that hold it up, snapped in the middle of the plastic, so while the string holds it to all be one, its slumped over.
Overall was super easy to put up. And very roomy!

title: OK belt, but has some issues
review: I like the look and quality of the but there are a couple of design issues that make them a little less useful than they could.  The biggest issue is that the buckle halves are hard to pass trough belt loops so that it takes a considerable time to thread the belt on and off.  That is a little frustrating.  I love the feel and flex of the belt webbing, and once it is threaded through the loops, I love way the belt buckle works - almost like a seat belt, but it is just too clumsy to put on and off.  Also nice is how customizeable it is in length.  you choose the length. If not for the problems putting it on and taking it off, I would love this belt.

review: it took a while to put on just hopes it stays on looks good on my jeep

title: Nice bottle with carrying loop; pastic top might break if dropped
review: The attached carrying loop is a real plus on this bottle; my previous bottle did not have that.  This is a nice bottle; lightweight and keeps your drink cold.  It has a good large opening at the top to easily fill with ice.  The top is screw-on plastic.  I assume that if the bottle is dropped very much, the plastic top could break or crack.  My previous bottle had the same issue.  I thought that the flip top seemed to open a little hard, but it is new; maybe after it has opened a few times, it will be easier.

title: Be careful!
review: Be careful!  The casters do not lock, so very easy to fall off of this product.

title: A lot of bang for your buck in this set...
review:
There are a plethora of these listings on Amazon. Most are around $20. You'll need to decide if you need the extras, or if they are worth the $15 bucks.

Here are the extra items compared to the basic $20 sets:
-1 Jump Rope
-5 flat loop bands that increases from 5 to 40 lbs.
-Expander band (the band that looks like a #8)
-Core sliders

If you are going to buy the other accessories or plan to anyway down the line, then getting it all in this package will save you a little money. As for the main feature of this set, the resistant bands, they work great. They are just like any other listings you see on Amazon. I don't think every listing is from a different manufacture. The same manufacture is probably responsible for most of these listings. They get the job done though. Just focus on whether or not you need all the extras.

title: .45 ACP gun bore snake
review: Sent as gift but having used previously..good value for price... use for range cleaning for .45 ACP

title: not real easy to set up, works ok, see below for more
review:
I was actually disappointed in this table. With the Coleman name, I expected much more. Mine came with no instructions. I had ordered this with the hopes of using it for camping. It is more difficult and takes longer to set up than I had hoped for. Now, let us get to the drink holder. I could not figure it out. After doing some searching online I was able to find it. I was going to ad a video for it but it is already buried in the attic. Sorry. Once I found it, it was easy to open. I just could not find it.

The table is pretty sturdy once you get it set up. This is really not a table that I care to set-up and take down on a daily basis for traveling in an RV.

title: Powerful pump
review: Such a great product.  So easy to use foot pump and fills a tire in 4 motions.  Super powerful pump and has four separate fittings for different types of tubes.

title: Good buy for the price
review: Very well constructed ball. Outer shell is soft but sturdy and will last a long time. We use in the backyard and in sand courts.

title: Very nice training football
review: Great quality football. Soft leather with durable stitching all over. Grips are nice, even for my 11 y.o. son's hands. This is a 20 oz. ball. Made in USA.

title: Incredibly secure collars (a.k.a. plate clamps) but be certain you have the correct bar size
review:
I have been weightlifting for almost 34 years with a couple of years off due to changes in life circumstances. Eight months ago I started lifting again three times per week and was so overjoyed to see find these collars that I ordered them without fully reading the measurements.

My bar is almost one inch and these are for two-inch bars. I am so thoroughly disappointed. Please do not make the same mistake I did. Nevertheless, I had a microphone that was just the right size and I affixed it to that and can tell that these are fantastic. It created a solid grip and did not budge when I pulled on it. Part of the internal collar has what feels like (but is not) a rubberized grip that keeps it in place.

To me these are a great invention. My current collars keep loosening as I bench press and plate clamps such as these would ensure that the weights stay on the bar without rattling around and that a quick change of weights is possible. All that has to be done is to loosen the clip, slip the collar onto the bar, and then snap it in place flush with the weight.

These plate clamps remind me of another great but simple invention that I consider fantastic in the weightlifting world and that is the [[ASIN:B0017DGBY8 Manta Ray]]. It is a product I love and have used previously for about 20 years until I stopped doing squats.

The first picture is of the collars. Note that the clamp on the left is open for demo purposes in the picture. The second picture shows it on my weightlifting bar. The third photo shows that it is not meant for that bar because my bar is just a tad under one inch and this is for a two-inch bar. The last photo shows how it grips a microphone with the correct circumference for these collars. I tried that because I had nothing else to test this on.

title: Good quality
review: I bought these to go on a rowing trip. Nice quality and girly.

title: Good for keeping liquid cold, but there are other problems
review: To be honest, I am conflicted about this water bottle.  Maybe I expected it to be something it is not, as I see that many reviewers are very happy with the bottle.  It is true that the bottle does keep water cold for several hours, but I found the bottle very hard to squeeze, and each squeeze did not release much water.  In short, I had to really work to take a drink from this bottle.  Maybe it is because I am over 65 and not as strong as I used to be, but I did not like this bottle all that much.  I cannot in good conscience recommend it, unless you are familiar with this type of bottle and like the way it operates.

title: Ideal for light exercise or therapy...
review:
This exercise machine really preforms well. The large display looks good and make this more enjoyable to use. The display also makes this easy for elderly to use too.

Here are some key features.

This doesn't slip on hardwood or carpet.
The foot/hand pads are rubber and have a strap lock.
The resistant levels are adequate for light exercise.
The machine doesn't get hot and can be used for an extended period of time.
It is super quiet.
Plus, all the readouts make it easy to track progress.

I got this for my mom, and she loves using it. Especially in the winter. Plus, she had knee replacement surgery, and this was super beneficial at helping in recovery, preventing blood clots, and getting back her range of motion.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Received a box cutter too
review:
The product itself was decent. The box was in shambles and someone had taped the ends at some point in the process. That could've been the delivery company or TDS themselves.
It is built well and I really enjoy the design of the product as an open space allows for more exercises inside the rack (like overhead work).
It is somewhat heavy duty in that it weighs 120lbs. The safety rails are solid steel tubing and the J cups have the ability to cinch into position.

The issue lies in the fact that I received an open box cutter (video and pic for proof) in my shipment. There has been no help in this regard.

Overall, it is worth the buy but some business practices need to be fixed.

title: Gross
review: Horrible cancer causing smell. Returned.

title: Easy to Assemble
review: We like to entertain in our large backyard, so I am always looking for outdoor games and activities. I prefer that they don't take up a lot of storage space and that they are easy to set up. With the exception of the soccer ball, everything can fit easily into the box. The flag poles are collapsible, similar to the tent stakes that we have with our quick set up tent. The "holes" are thin plastic and I wonder about long term durability there. I was hoping that I could take this to school and use it with the kids in PE class, but alas, the flags have spikes at the ends to go into the ground so it can rest on flat, smooth surfaces. We didn't have any issues with the length of the grass interfering with the pieces, but our lawn was freshly mowed when we played it. I could see it being an issue though. The set comes with a small air pump which is a nice if you didn't already own one. The game is fun and was enjoyed by everyone playing. It didn't come with any instructions, so we just made up our own rules.

title: Don’t order this tackle box. Just don’t.
review:
Just as others stated, the lid would not stay closed unless a lot of pressure was applied. Also, the hinges don’t hold. Terrible purchase. It was returned. This was my grandson’s birthday present. He was so disappointed!
Read the reviews. They are true!

title: They're pretty cheaply made. Magnets weak.
review: Two stars because admittedly they *do* emit light,  but the plastic on these things is pretty thin and brittle. You don't want to drop things. But that also means don't depend on the magnets on the bottom to be strong enough to hold the light in place. If it stays it's going to fall with the slightest vibration. Husband said, "Crap like this, it's not a good deal even if it is cheap." He's right.

title: Don't last
review: The batteries don't last longer than 5 hours and the heat doesn't go all the way to the toes.  I would not not recommend .

title: False. Does not fit oversized bottles at all.
review:
The description says: "Fits most standard & over sized bike water bottles, including the following sizes: 20, 21, 25, 24, 25 & 33 oz"
The reality is, it doesn't fit anywhere near that size range of bottles. It's no different from the one I have on the bike now, which fits nowhere near an oversized bottle. I am extremely disappointed and will be returning right away. So tired of being fobbed off with stuff that doesn't fit the description.

title: Misspelled and broken
review:
I didn't realize until the cup came in but it is misspelled. It should be HUFFLEPUFF. The white is correct. The yellow is missing the second F.
Also I haven't even used or washed it yet, and the little metal handle on the lid fell off. The lid is scratched.
I was planning to use this cup on my trip to Universal Orlando last week. The graphic was smoothly applied, and aside from the misspelling, I liked this design.

title: stay away from this brand it busted after 2 days
review: i needed leverage and was getting a stuck allen bolt unstuck or was trying then i herd a pop or crack noise and all other wrenches chain remover all fell to the floor all left in my hand was the handle not worth the hassle of a return threw it away stay away from this brand

title: Shines like a silicon rock
review: Even though the picture here for the silver variable is wrong (the real deal does have zoom adjustment ring), this scope is all kinds of right. For the money (and sometimes you can find it even lower) you get a fantastic little rimfire scope with coated lenses and included rings. Set it up on my 10/22 SS and the combo’s wicked fun. The windage and elevation adjustments are great, even though it’s hard to see on the black plastic which way it’s supposed to turn for what – easy fix, use some silver permanent marker to slightly highlight the raised letters and arrows. You don’t need any tools to do the adjustments, and the internal posts are good quality brass. The reticle is a simple 4 plex cross with no BDC holds or any other markings – it’s a point and shoot – for my rifle I set it at 50 yards and it’s spot on (1/2” group was the best I got out of 150 rounds first time with it at the range.) The zoom adjustment wheel is smooth and not too difficult to turn. The included dovetail rings are decent even though there’s no vertical center screw for recoil motion lock – again, this is for rimfire or lighter recoil. I wouldn’t (or I don’t even think it could) mount these on a picatinny rail, but they fit 11mm dovetail no problem. The silver color is a bit too shiny for my taste, that’s maybe my biggest hang-up. Overall, I’d buy again.

title: Very poor quality
review: Did some planks while wearing sneakers.  The mat totally disintegrated where my sneakers touched it.  Pretty worthless.

title: Great lure
review: This is very well made. They wiggles as it moves. Painting on them are well done and realistic. Nice lure

title: Need small fingers to reset pins
review: Cute little game. Very well made. Ball rolls smoothly down little ramp. The only bad thing is you have to pick up and stand the pins back up each time. You must also have smaller fingers or you just keep knocking them over trying to put up lol..bad design there. Would be nice if that could be changed.

title: Great lght but no way to charge it
review:
Lt me start by saying this is a great, bright light. I was very happy with it right up to the point where I went to charge it. Then a funny thing happened. The provided USB cable connector does not fit. None of my other USB connectors fit either. No clue what they have on this light, but it is more oval than trapezoid.

For me, it is a waste of money because it cannot be recharged, which is a real pity because otherwise, it is great.

title: Cute, but runs small and our dog hates it
review: Hmmmm. Got the xlarge for my tall Plott Hound and it's too small for him. Enough so that he refused to even try walking with it on. So I tried shorter, but stouter Rhodesian Ridgeback and...still too tight. It finally fit our short, fat Blue Heeler......and she hates it. She's a good sport with a harness or a winter coat, but this just bothers her. I'm sure this is a cute and fun way to keep a willing dog warm if it fits. Alas, not for my hound dogs.

title: It truly is lightweight, but can bend very easy.
review:
This is a very lightweight table. Like the fact, it is adjustable in height.

The table was bent in shipping but never did anything about it. Once it is bent you are never going to get it right again.

Found this table was too small for my needs so purchased a different brand larger one. I needed space for two people with two laptops to work. This cannot accommodate that.

title: Fits smaller water bottle
review: This does not fit a really large water bottle, only the smaller size. On the other hand, you really don't want that much weight around your neck. The thing I really don't like is how awful this smells. It has been treated with some kind of chemical and even weeks since I bought it, it still smells. I put tissues in this and they smell of chemicals. I'm not sure what to do, I haven't tried to wash it. If you are really sensitive, you might avoid this.

title: Love these
review: Great glasses for the price!! I bought a pair after weeks of my eyes hurting while working outside and they helped tremendously. I accidentally crushed them while working and instantly went online to get another pair because I like them so much. Perfect glasses and great protection.

title: Broke after a week.
review: Garbage do not buy.

title: bendy like a straw
review: This rod is not hardned steel that returns to its original position, no. This is soft, bendable seel, a bit sturdier than a wire coat rack (or is it?) So basically, if you straighten a wire coat hanger, you got the same thing, sans the handle. Umm.... nope.... didn't like it... not at all sir. I have other steel rods that are like a rapier - bend them (not too much) and they return, bounce back right to true. The search continues for .17hmr rod...

title: A low-budget gym that comes with no assembly instructions and one minor defect
review:
This gym arrives in a small box. It comes in 26 pieces with one tightening key and one written "exercise" sheet but no assembly instructions. I also needed to use a hammer (not included) when assembling the pull-up bar.

I am somewhat mechanically inclined, so I was able to use the visual pictures on the box (see last two pictures) to assemble the gym. The screws that attached the arms to the long bar of the pull-up bar caused me a lot of trouble. I eventually had to hammer the screws into the "square" hole when no amount of turning would screw them in. If it were not for that difficulty, I would have had this assembled in about 20 minutes instead of 45 minutes.

- The ab wheel is easy to use and rolls nicely on a carpeted floor.

- The push-up bars are a bit disappointing because the foam handles keep sliding back and forth when I try to do push-ups. The foam needs to be snug and not loose like it is. It requires certain positioning to keep these foam handles from moving.

- The pull-up bar is not something I will use as intended for two reasons. I feel like I will rip my molding off the door frame if I use this or mar my wall surface. Also, I am not (nor was I ever) strong enough to pull up my body weight. Nevertheless, this can be used on the floor as sort of a push-off bar as shown in the last picture.

Overall, I am disappointed in this set. The exercise sheet provided is not an exercise sheet at all. There are no assembly instructions, which is a requirement to me. I also do not like that the foam handles on the push up bars slide around and are unstable. If the foam handles stayed in place, I would have rated this four stars. However, because I consider that a defect coupled with the fact that not everyone will find it so easy to assemble without instructions, I am giving this three stars. Nevertheless, this is a low-budget option for those that do not mind the lack of instructions.

PHOTOS:
Photo one and two are the front and back of the only instructions provided, which is supposed to be an exercise sheet but has nothing to do with exercises. This sheet is a useless piece of paper to me. Photo three includes a picture of the two push up bars and the one ab wheel. Picture four includes the reverse (non-business) side of the pull-up bar and picture five is the business-side (the side where the user positions him or herself) of the bar. The last two pictures are the front and back of the box cover showing the product in use and is what helped me assemble this gym.

title: NOT AT ALL DURABLE
review: The first time I used these mittens to shovel show, they completely shreaded. I do not recommend getting them unless you don't plan to do anything but cover your hands and stand around.

title: love it
review: fit my bottle just fine and provides great protection

title: Don't
review:
The item arrived but with parts missing. I emailed TDS regarding this issue in which they pointed at me for misplacing the parts. After several emails, and days elapsing between responses, they sent replacement parts. One nut was too small for one of the bolts (all within the original box are the same thickness, so it seemed on purpose), and caused the bolt to snap.
I had to get my own replacement parts from the hardware store to get this unit functional. It will take going out of your way to get this machine working properly, as others have mentioned.

Summary:
Nothing but problems with this machine.
It seemed worth it but I was wrong.

title: Fogged up quick
review: second use in the mountain and goggles fogged up

title: "MELLOSMOOTHE"None of my reviews are fake.
review: This tricep rope is very well put together and strong. Put almost 200 Lbs of weight on it with no breaks are problems..

title: Good mate for rack. Works fine so far but feels cheap.
review:
Lacks the feel of really high quality luggage, but it has worked okay for me so far. It is a very good mate for "Delta Mega Rack Post Haste Quick Release Bicycle Seat Post Rack" for which it seems to have been custom fit. As a whole, the marriage of those two items feels well engineered and cheaply made, so you can look at it as a good value or a higher risk for failure on the road. I only use this on in-town rides - never more than 50 miles - so I'm not too worried about roadworthiness. E.g. today I rode my old school MTB - AKA the grocery bike - to my favorite chinese restaurant and took a spoon from home, a tupperware, and a plastic grocery bag for my leftovers. This bag/rack combo is perfect for that kind of thing. If I were planning a trans-continental, epic trek I would aim higher, just because the brand is unfamiliar and the feeling of the materials and construction is budget-minded.

BTW the rack I mentioned needs modification to work without snagging shorts - the stock length bolt sticks out too far and needs to be trimmed - but it's an easy fix with seventh-grade-level shop skills.

title: Great leg workout!
review: This machine was very easy to put together. It’s light enough to move around by one person yet stable. It takes a little practice getting on and off but gives you a great workout. The computer counter is slightly inaccurate when counting repetitions but accurate enough to use.

title: bright lantern, very handy , weak magnet
review:
This is actually a pretty cool light. I love that you can just plug it into a USB socket and charge it up. The white colored bulb puts out much more light than I had expected. I tested it out for 7.5 hours. After about 5 hours or so it was getting dimmer and at 7.5 hours it was pretty dim but still going. There is also a color to keep bugs away and then a third choice that combines both colors.

The magnets that came with it are worthless. They are not strong enough to hold it up. Nice idea, try again with better magnets.

The flashlight part LOL excuse me while I laugh. It does work but gives the worst beam I have ever seen. The picture makes it look much better than it really looks in real life. Oh well, this is sold as a lantern and not a flashlight.

Overall for the price, I am impressed with this. It puts out a lot of light for a small price.

The strap is adjustable and seems like it will last a while and I'm happy that its waterproof (not submersible though which is fine with me). It's nice and not bulky so its appealing to the eye as well. Overall great product for the price too.

This one is very thin and light, but still too hot for summer. It's not heavy enough for cold weather either. Mostly seems to function as a top layer shirt on cool fall days. It washed and dryed well without shrinking. The fabric is a little slick to the touch - not cozy or soft. I don't dislike this thing, but I don't love it either.

review:

The only thing I wish this had is the ability to fold, which would make it easier to store away during the cold months.

title: The biggest negative is that there's no way to know the tension; also I suspect this would easily break at the highest tension
review:
I had carpal tunnel surgery on both my left and right hands last year. As a result of the carpal tunnel, I had no strength in my hands. In order to build strength, I purchased some of the same tools the therapist had in her office in addition to other tools that serve the same purpose.

Below are the strengtheners I already have. The last two I wasted my money on and wish I never purchased them. The first one is very light and only needed if one doesn't have any strength in their hands like me. If there is some strength, then I recommend the 3, 5, 7, & 9 pounds only.

[[ASIN:B00HB7V6JY CanDo GripMaster Hand Exerciser, Yellow, X-Light Tension (1.5 lbs per finger]]
[[ASIN:B00HB7V6GC CanDo GripMaster Hand Exerciser, Red, Light Tension (3 lbs per finger)]]
[[ASIN:B00HB7V6KS CanDo GripMaster Hand Exerciser, Green, Medium Tension (5 lbs per finger)]]
[[ASIN:B00HB7V6JO CanDo GripMaster Hand Exerciser, Blue, Heavy Tension (7 lbs per finger)]]
[[ASIN:B00HB7V6HG CanDo GripMaster Hand Exerciser, Black, X-Heavy Tension (9 lbs per finger]]
[[ASIN:B000UMHUSI PRO Hand and Finger Exerciser, Extra-Heavy Tension (11 lbs per finger)]] - TERRIBLE GRIP, NOT RECOMMENDED
[[ASIN:B00KH3L7KC PRO Hand and Finger Exerciser, XX-Heavy Tension (13 lbs per finger)]] - TERRIBLE GRIP, NOT RECOMMENDED

Since I own and use the above tools, I wanted to see how this compared. What I like about this hand grip is that there's a counter on the bottom of the handle to count how many reps are completed. Every time the handle is squeezed, the counter increases by one. There's also a tension wheel on the side. When turned down all the way toward the bottom of the handle, that is supposedly 20 pounds. When turned up all the way toward the top of the grip, that is supposedly 80 pounds.

This is supposed to be rated between 20-80 pounds pressure but there is no way to tell the tension because it's not marked. Also, when I put it at the maximum pressure and had my boyfriend try it, it seemed like it would break after using it at that level for a while. This is made of cheap plastic and I cannot picture it lasting. The rep counter is reset by pushing in the button on the bottom of the handle and turning the dial continously until 99 reps turns to 00.

I do like the feel of this gripper on the lowest tension and it definitely will strength my hands and fingers. However, the handle does push up against the sensitive scar area in the middle of both of my hands, so that is a negative for me. After having tried this, I would not buy this because the tension is not displayed and the handle pushes up against my scars. The fact that I feel it would break at the highest setting would not deter me from purchasing it because I am almost positive I could never get to that setting. Personally, I feel the other hand exercisers I mentioned above (except for the last two listed), are more suitable for me.

PS The box says instructional videos are online demonstrating how to use this. I tried to find the videos to see if there was a way to determine the tension but as of this writing on (April 2, 2017) no videos are posted on their site.

title: Thin, soft, flimsy, overpriced
review:
I purchased these because I was unable to order the same brand I had previously purchased (due to them being out of stock and me being inpatient and not wanting to wait), and these had good reviews.

Unfortunately, I paid more for these than the ones I previously purchased, and they are a huge disappointment in comparison.

They are very thin, very soft in comparison, and will not lay flat even after two weeks. I even tried using carpet tape to keep them flat, but that lasted only until the very first time I tried a workout on them.

And worst of all, they are extremely noxious smelling. Even after two weeks of being in a room that has the window open six inches, they are off-gassing a huge amount of fumes that I'm not at all confident are safe for humans given how much they sting my eyes and nasal passages.

I will be replacing these at the earliest opportunity.

title: Totally Overrated
review:
Now that I have used this Fitbit for a few weeks I feel like I have an idea about it. I've wanted a Fitbit for years, I've heard nothing but amazing things about it and how great they are. Well, to be honest, I am not seeing the greatness of them now that I actually have one. Maybe it's because this is the newest one, maybe there are still bugs to fix, and maybe it could be my phone that just hates everything about the Fitbit app. Honestly, I don't know but either way, I am so unimpressed with this Fitbit.

The pros I have found out is that it was easy to set up and make an account with Fitbit. Everything downloaded, updated, and whatever else perfectly. It was easy to change all the settings and personalize everything the way I wanted it. I love that you can customize the face so that it matches your personality or the types of apps or stuff you want it to show first right on the face. I like that you can control your music and pay for your watch too. Those are great ideas and honestly if I got out more and whatever else I can see where tons of people would totally get so much use out of it.

My biggest beef I have with this though is the fact that I wear it constantly and I want to keep up mainly with my steps, how much I move, and my sleeping patterns. It doesn't have any problems keeping up with all of that and so much more. The problem I have with this watch is the fact that it disconnects from the wifi and then becomes difficult to sync to the app, if at all. I've already had to reset to factory settings once to get it to reconnect to the app, which also has its own set of challenges because once the watch goes the app doesn't want to do much either. I can't remove the watch to re-add it in the app and I'm unable to view the wifi connections to change them or re-add them. It's like everything stops and becomes completely unusable. It's a real pain, to say the least.

Being completely honest, the watch I replaced with this Fitbit was way better and I never had any issues with it syncing to my phone, the app, or anything else. It did everything that this one does but just not as pretty, which honestly I'd much rather the watch to work and do what I want it to do than to have the cool face and whatever else.

I am so unimpressed and honestly bummed about this watch not living up to the hype. I am hoping that everything works out and the bugs are fixed soon if these are bugs, but I've no idea. Right now the watch is acting up again and honestly, I am thinking I am about to have to reset it again. If this happens I am going back to my old one that I know works just fine. Honestly, don't waste your money on this one just yet but wait to see if the bugs are fixed in a few months.

title: Highly protective sun hat with adjustable rim; runs small; extra accessories are unnecessary
review:
This is an excellent sun hat. It has some ventilation around the center and a very wide brim. I like that there is a cinch strap on the outside in the back (see second photo) to adjust the rim if it is too loose. I actually think the rim is small because it fits me perfectly and I have a small head. I only made a slight adjustment. There is also an adjustable chin strap.

I wore this all day on the hottest day of the year and it kept the sun out of my eyes.

This hat comes with three extra and what I feel are unnecessary accessories. In the package are a pair of socks that come up to my mid-calf, a pair of peds, and a bandanna like "tube." These items are okay but are not great. Although extra items are a nice touch, the hat is the best.

title: nice concept but somewhat awkard in practice.
review:
The Apollo Walker Camping Chairs Folding Portable Beach Chairs are quite durable. The nylon fabric on this chair is quite thick when compared to the cheaper chairs that I purchased to use at my kids' sports events. The main chair has a reclining feature and the foot stool/chair is made just as well.

The concept for this chair is that you can lean back and put your feet up on the foot stool. When necessary, the stool can be used as a separate chair. They do work as intended as you can see from the pictures, what you see is what you get.

What you can't tell from the pictures is that because of the thicker nylon and the fact that there are two chairs, this is a fairly heavy product. The chairs are joined together with a clamping system, which means they aren't as easy to separate as a system that can clip the two together. Also because of the two chairs, they are awkward to fold together and compress small enough to fit back into the bag easily.

So the concept is quite good but when actually using it, you'll find that these chairs do require a little more work and have to deal with the extra weight... that's on top of all the other stuff you're already carrying when you go to sports events or picnics.

title: Best Scooter I Ever Rode...this scooter is fully loaded with every feature!!!
review:
[[VIDEOID:a4e49b08927e5de95f27b16d34d40d92]] Quality Scooter with super powerful and super quiet electric motor:
1. Very safe: smooth throttle and tap break feature and hand brake.
2. Charging is simple: no connecting pins. Straight plug into side of scooter or remove battery to charge separately.
3. The tires are solid rubber: no punctures or inflating.
4. Sleek visible design: turns easy, stable handle bars for appropriate ages, lights in front and back.
5. Many extras: night reflective orange, keys to remove battery, foldable, use your smart for locking off the power and to customize acceleration and braking. Large display for speed, battery level indicator, and lights.

So many great features!!!! So many places to ride!!!
This is the best scooter I ever rode as far as being so smooth in starting and stopping. I am beyond impressed with the quality. Highly Recommend and I am sure to will be impressed too!

If you found this review beneficial, please hit the ‘helpful’ tab below:-)
Thank You

title: Trouble staying at fixed height, anti-shock broke first use
review:
I have trekking poles in my car and at my residence, I wanted a second set at my mothers house for when I'm visiting and want to go hiking near a lake. I thought a cheaper set would work as I am hardly ever here. These are the worst set of poles I have ever seen. I have given poles as gifts and was happy this pair was not one such set or I would have been embarrassed.
I had set the poles at home, to my desired length. At the lake, before I could even take a step, one kept collapsing at the bottom. I did not trek of road, due to this. I fixed the poles again and hoped they would stay but the bottom of the pole seems very flimsy. I decided to walk to road around the lake....cautiously, I have had a double knee replacement so I rely on the poles a bit more than I used to. The pole stayed fixed to my adjustment but the shock nechanism broke in one of the handles.
I have them and as I'm seldom at my mothers, and do not have the time to mess around with sending them back, I will keep them but I cannot recommend them at all and I am baffled by the high rating.
I know walking and trekking poles and these are awful. I guess you get what you pay for.
If you have had injuries to your knees I absolutely would not rely on them.
I was hoping to write a better review as I wanted to like them (though not being my primary poles my standard were low to begin with so I ordered the cheap set) but they are awful.

Absolutely do not recommend these at all!

With my WYZE cam, Alexa notifies me 7 minutes after the cam picks up someone at the front door. Yesterday, Alexa told me someone was at the front door... An HOUR later! I think WYZE needs to really work on the products it has in circulation rather than pushing out a stream of new items. I cannot depend on contact or alerts from Alexa with the tracker now as it is.

title: Nose band was too big, could not get it to fit
review:
I thought this would work as a transition piece while moving my stallion to bitless. He's half Andalusian and half Mustang with a medium size head. Unfortunately, the nose band was still too big despite adjustments and the curb strap was very stiff and difficult to fit. What ended up happening was the metal sides were digging into my boy's face and the nose band was still shifting and slipping down. All of which defeated the purpose of not harrassing him.

The overall construction was fine for a beginner mechanical hackamore and the nose piece was well padded. After an hour of fiddling with this thing and swapping through 3 different head stalls, I just couldn't make it work or fit comfortably at all. I ended up returning the whole thing. I'm going to move him from a regular D-Ring snaffle to a rubber version until I find a traditional bosal set up.

review: This cornhole bean bag set is not only top notch, it is patriotic too!  The colors of red, white, and blue and the stars and stripes are bright and bold.  It comes with a bag to carry and store the 8 bean bags, it is decorated with stars on one side and red and white stripes on the other.  This set of cornhole bean bags will be sure to be a hit at your next barbeque.  The material is very strong and should last a long time.  I would recommend this set to family and friends who wanted to step up their cornhole game.

title: How much work did they put into making this tent terrible?
review: There are a lot of flaps and poles that don't seem to make sense here. This is like high fashion, but in a tent. I wonder if the people who made this tent have ever gone camping. Specifically, backpacking where you are carrying things instead of driving to a camp site instead of driving there. If you're driving, I guess weight and useless gear won't make you as mad, but if you have to carry this, you are going to wonder, "Why?" If you're driving, there are much better wall tents. If you are backpacking, there are much better dome tents. This seems like a middle ground option that is never the best or optimal solution.

title: Does what it does but it's noisy!
review:
I usually ride my road bike on the road. With the recent fires in CA, the air has been very bad. So I got this for days I can't go out for my ride (weather is the issue). The setup is very easy. But this thing is pretty loud. I think it's because of the spinning magnets. It gets louder at higher settings (1 being the easiest). I will try to find a way to dampen the sounds. Right now, I am using my yoga mat under it but didn't help much.

The instruction coolly says that 50% of the noise comes from the wheel :-). I doubt that my bike makes the deep "whooom-wrr-wrr" noise on it's own, even 50%.

But I can live with it. Only going to use it when I can't ride outside and no one lives below me. I think the wooden floor also amplifies the noise. I'll update if I get an eviction notice because it's too loud. :-)

title: Not Really Adjustable
review: This jump rope is really long. It says it is adjustable, but it isn't easy or simple to adjust. I ended up just tying some knots in it. The rope does rotate within the handle so it doesn't tangle. And initially, I thought it would be too light, but it ended up jumping well.

It didn't come with any instructions, so I had to look online for some videos on how to use it. I've also been using it for my plantar fasciitis. The roller is a big size and quite solid. It easily accommodates my body weight. I am very impressed with this. It seems like such a simple thing, but it's been a life saver!

title: Great quality, gentle spurs
review:
Beautiful, well made spurs. Quality construction and I like how tightly everything fits together-- obviously there's attention paid to precise engineering and manufacture. They look like they cost way more than they did!

The surface which contacts the horse is nice and smooth, and the pieces which hold the spur balls are placed in a way that makes it unlikely they'll catch the horse and create cuts or rubs (or just be uncomfortable!). I personally believe spurs should only be used sparingly and only by riders with an educated, still leg. Spurs allow leg cues to be smaller and more refined, they're not for banging on the horse, punishing the horse, or bullying the horse. Because of this I prefer rounded, small spurs with no sharp edges. These are absolutely perfect.

title: This scooter may be overwhelming for beginners, yet underwhelming for advanced users...
review:
THE GOOD:
--------------
* Looks pretty. My girl likes the looks of it, likes the led lights in the dark.
* The build is solid. Feels sturdy, feels high quality.
* It's pretty fast at 7.5 mph.

THE BAD:
------------
* Nothing on the handle bar. There is no hand brakes, no hand throttle either. Everything is accomplished by your feet.
* No speed levels. There is only 1 speed, and it's 7.5 mph.
* Cannot fold to stow away.
* Cannot use scooter as a traditional manual scooter. Because the buttons are on the base, you will be forced to use the electric feature when both your feet are on the base.

THE MAIN PROBLEM:
--------------------------
* It's advertised for 6 to 12 yrs, but I think it's a little difficult for kids in the lower end of that range. My girl is 6, and this did not work out for her on our first day. It's going to take some time. The throttle system is all in the feet. You have to step on the first button, then you push with your other leg to get the scooter to go a certain speed, then you have to step on the back button to initiate the throttle. That's it... you're off! It's pretty fast, and to brake, you need to release that back button and place the same back foot on the plastic guard above the back wheel. It's a lot for a 6 yr old to consume, especially at a high speed. They will panic. But for bigger kids who can get the hang of it quickly, they might be disappointed at the 7.5 mph limitation. So this scooter is too much for beginners, yet too little for advanced users.

THE BETTER OPTION ON AMAZON:
------------------------------------------
* I would spend a little extra and get the Ninebot E10. That scooter can be folded away, has hand brakes, hand throttle, and 3 speed levels. It's lowest level is 6.2 miles and tops at 10 mph. There is no feet coordination to remember. You just peddle the scooter to a certain speed, just like you have to with this Gotrax, but instead of having to worry about where you place your other foot, the throttle is on the right handle, and you simply press down with your thumb. On the left handle is a brake, not only that, it still has a brake on the guard of the back wheel just like this Gotrax. It is much easier to learn for a 6 yr old, and you can learn it at a slower speed of 6.2 mph. When they do get the hang of it, they can go up to 10 mph, and not limited to 7.5 mph. Lastly, with the Ninebot, you can use it as a manual scooter since all controls are on the handle. It would be your child's choice to use the electric component or not. If they're not ready yet, just don't press down on the throttle with the thumb, and simply use it as a normal scooter. You do not have that choice with this Gotrax since all controls are built on the base. Once both feet are on the base, you have no choice but to use the throttle. If you're interested in the Ninebot, here's the link: https://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/R4PVA4J0PW93J/ref=cm_cr_getr_d_rvw_ttl?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B08CRTRNBX

I'll rate the Gotrax 3-Stars, since you are saving money. However, I think you're sacrificing some features that are absolutely worth it.

title: If you are a nerd when gathering statistics about your health then you will love this watch!
review:
So far, I love this HRM. I've used HRMs since the early 90's starting with a Polar. The Polar and the last Timex I owned had a flexible plastic strap. I don't have a large chest so the contact area of the chest strap did not make a good contact with my body. Well that has all changed with this model. The design of the chest strap has been improved. The contacts have been incorporated right into the stretchable portion of the strap and the contact to my chest is direct and immediately provides heart rate information. The functions on the buttons seems to change with every version of watch I buy (the last one I bought was in 2008, a Timex). If this is your first HRM then you wont have any 're-learning' to do like me. I'm not sure of the tap technology yet. It seems like it might be a good idea, but for me (right now I have it on 'medium' sensitivity) it takes multiple taps.
If you're a runner, like me, then seeing your heart rate information while you're running might be challenging. If I want to see my heart rate while running at my fast pace, I usually have to slow down to see the screen effectively.

The only real grip I have with all my HRMs up to this date is the waterproof 'o-ring' type seal. After 4 or 5 years the battery has to be changed and my o-ring has been deformed in that time, so it doesn't quite fit the way it should (to make the watch waterproof). Enough so that the waterproof watch is no longer water proof. I lost my polar watch and my last Timex watch due to this issue. And usually after this long time the watch is discontinued and the o-ring has too. I will either buy a new o-ring for the watch now, or know that when I replace the battery I can no longer wear the watch in the shower or swimming.

You might think, "why did he give it 5 stars". I use the information from the watch, mainly, after my run to track my conditioning AFTER my run (I like the 'recovery' option of the watch), and now that I know what to expect when changing the battery, I know what I can't do. I think the benefits of this watch far out-weigh the issues that I've outlined above. Tracking my heart rate over time is just another statistic for judging my overall health.

title: Great kayak, cheaper elsewhere
review:
I bought this kayak a year ago, and have used it close to 30 times. I have used it as a tandem kayak and as a fishing kayak (not simultaneously - that would be a tight squeeze). It has survived rocky rivers with low water, dozens of fishing trips, and being dragged up boat ramps. I am really impressed with the durability. Also, it fits in the trunk of my Toyota Corolla. Awesome! My only complaint is that the inflatable seats aren't very comfortable for long outings. Also, Amazon is WAY overpriced for this product. When I bought mine, I found it elsewhere for 30% less (still new!). I definitely recommend looking around online before buying here. A good price is closer to $200.

Year 2 update:

The inflatable seats were the first thing to go. Both seats only hold air for a few hours now. They are made out of a much cheaper material than the rest of the kayak, so I guess that was to be expected. I also got my first puncture on one of the pontoons. I used the patching kit and recommended adhesive, but the patch keeps coming off. I think it is because it falls along a natural crease when the kayak is deflated. That constant bending puts a lot of stress on the patch. It's annoying to keep re-patching it, but it does at least hold air while the patch is on.

title: Lacking Safety Features
review: The bag is nicely padded and there's a semi stiff divider between the section for your weapons and the place to store magazines and ammunition. My chief complaint is there are no straps, which could have easily and cheaply been added, to hold the pistols in the pockets designated for them. If the bag is turned upside down for any reason the pistols can easily come out of the pocket they're stowed in and if you're carrying two as the bag is designed for, they can then bang into one another potentially causing damage to one or both. The divider will keep them from striking the magazines but not from hitting each other. The magazine pouches are, at least now while new, quite tight and hold my 10 and 12 round Sig Sauer P365 magazines tightly in place. Even vigorous shaking didn't dislodge them. The outside pocket had a good size gusset and expands to hold a box of 100 9mm rounds and my Uplula loader with room to spare. It also has a large velcro area for membership patches, flags, etc. The carry handles are comfortable. I wish there was a more secure way to hold your pistols in place and I plan on trying to modify the bag myself to achieve this. It should be fine for casual trips to the range just be careful when opening to ensure you don't drop a weapon.

title: Very sturdy, good grip ergonomics
review: Excellent handles, heavy duty construction, solid grip pads under the base of the bars. I expect that this set of push up bars will be the last one I ever need to purchase. The wood absorbs sweat and becomes stained, FYI.

title: Overheating issues, low resistance, but otherwise good.
review:
Excellent price point for what it is. There are no instructions but the diagram was easy enough to figure out.

The main problem is the piston overheats with prolonged use and as it heats up, resistance lessens. This means you cannot do an intense 30 minute workout in one sitting, you have to do sets, rest in between, and then do more sets. I'm in no rush, so I can do this, but you should be aware if you buy this.

Also, the highest level of resistance doesn't feel like rowing through actual water. It's not particularly challenging. You feel it once you are many reps in, so it still works if you go by volume of strokes. But, again, see above for the overheating issue.

Still, if you break the workout into sets of 10 minutes and have maybe 5 minutes of rest time in between, getting 30 minutes of rowing time and 15 minutes of rest still works for me. I'd buy something better for the next machine, but this is a good start.

title: My 3rd northland winter in these socks

I have a few pair that are three years old now that are showing some wear on the heal but I wear tennis shoes year around and I don't wear them tightly laced so I'm hard on socks that way....also, I only wear wool socks during the winter but up here by Lake Superior winter is six months long so thermals and wool socks are the order of the day! title: For advanced users! Very tilted. Traction and strong wood however.
review: This board is for advanced users! The base is tall and you'll need to have good balance already. It does have top traction strips and a strong wide wooden top. I can't use this board as it's too advanced and will cause injury until I'm in better shape.

title: good for the price
review: quality product, sizing is good. go CATS!

title: Not true to size
