title: Perfect for your ND fan
review: My brother bleeds ND Fighting Irish. He's gonna flip when he gets this and his hultz autographed jersey.

title: FLIMSY SUBSTANDARD WT??
review: Very cheaply made. Won't purchase again.

title: Mostly fine. Moves a bit during jogging.
review:
I use this during my jogs. During summer months, I have a jogging schedule that increases with each month; during my runs in the final week of each month, I run with this weighted vest.

It fits me well when I strap it on. I am 5'8" and 160lbs; I cinch the straps almost all the way, making the vest as close to my body as possible. After first usage of this, I realized I can't have it too close because it makes breathing difficult. But I can't find a comfortable spot; when I loosen the straps just a bit, the vest bounces with each stride. There's no happy medium.

Still, the weight is distributed nicely. I don't feel that any particular spot is heavier than it ought to be.

title: The pups and adults didn’t like it
review: The pups, or adults for that matter, didn’t like it

title: Very nice
review: Very sturdy cup holder and nice chrome.

title: Nice Mirrors
review: These mirrors are really nice, love the design of them.

title: Sturdy, attractive & well insulated with nice features & dishwasher safe 16oz is a lot of cup
review:
This cup performs great. It keeps ice for hours & coffee warm for at least until I am done drinking it. The cup's insulation works very well, I filled it with ice the day I got it & it was still full of ice the next morning. It is easy to grip & features a slim profile and rubberized, recessed strip. It drinks easy with no splashing or spilling.
I have been driving around with coffee cups for decades but I am new to these double-walled thermal cups. This cup fits a regular cupholder profile so it is tall to hold 16oz. It barely looks full with 12oz of coffee which is the maximum that my single-serve maker will brew. The top also has a large space between the cap & the brim which keeps it from splashing but makes it even taller.
It is so tall that I have to put a spacer under my coffee maker to drip into it. It is so tall that the stick shifter in my Wrangler actually touches it in 2nd gear. It's so tall that I have to tip it back to over 40° to drink from it once it reaches around half-full.
The recessed lid is very clever, it can seal tight or open a click to drink without crating a vacuum that suddenly releases a cascade of scalding hot coffee. It can be washed on the top rack of a dishwasher which is a pleasant surprise & a good thing since it is hard to reach the bottom to hand wash.

title: Foam mat tiles
review: Great fast service. Bought these to put at the pool for the little ones climbing the slide.  Just in case they slipped and fall backwards to cushion their fall, instead of hitting concrete.

title: They are what claim them to be
review: Could be a little tighter

title: Great but...
review: Works great the only problem is that you have to re-appy it after a few times being exposed to water. Maybe extra strength edition?

title: Meets all inspections.
review: I was pleased to see that this product passed all inspections. We live at the lake and have it tied to a rope in case there is a problem for us or someone else. It is a good size and quality product.

title: Really Cute!
review: These shirts are really cute!  I am a size 14 and wear size L in shirts. After reading other reviews, I did order a size larger than I usually wear. The XL fits well and not too big.  The t-shirt itself is not particularly soft, which was a little disappointing, but it is 100% cotton. It's thin and lightweight. It's a fitted shirt that looks flattering.

title: AWESOME
review: I've seen these "sit and stand" scooters before, but never really understood them until I had a kid the right age for it. When the seat is folded up, it acts like a regular traditional kick scooter. It has 3 wheels so the child doesn't need to balance it, and tilt side to side allows steering, which works well. The wheels also have little LEDs that seem to be powered by spinning motion- the faster the wheels spin, the more light comes from the wheels. Very cute! But the really cool part, is if/when your kid gets tired, you can fold the seat down and they can coast on a chair. I've gone on many walks with our old scooter and my 3 year old son sometimes gets tired and makes someone hold him... which then means, hold him AND the scooter, and drag it back home. But with this, he can just sit on the scooter. Someone can pull the scooter if necessary, and it is much easier than before. Very happy with this!

title: Not what I thought
review: I have ordered several signs from other vendors and they were all metal. This one is like card stock, not metal or even plastic, if it is it doesn't feel like it. It bends easily and is just not what I was hoping for. Since I've ordered other signs and they were all nice metal material this is a big disappointment and not worth trying to return. I don't know if you can tell the difference in signs, ( yes they are different teams ) but aside from that. The Seahawks sign is sturdy metal, the Patriots sign feels like heavy card stock.

title: The Thin Steel Line
review:
These are excellent in quality - from leader to swivel to clamp. I do a lot of offshore fishing and, because of the expense of frequently losing tackle on the reefs around my favorite spot, I normally just use some extremely heavy mono to make my own leaders...but quality like these for such a low price? Looks like I am back to using metal!
Sadly I can't say How well made they truly are...BUT...about the time a 34 inch Grouper was landed...yeah, I figure you can judge the quality by the end results!
Great product!

title: Data it provided was average and then I lost it.
review:
Meh. The data that it gave me and that was brought into the app was average. I saw how many steps, how many minutes active, etc. Great.

Sleep tracker was annoying - I have to remember to tell the thing I'm awake in the morning? Some nights it didnt track sleep.

Then it fell off one day and I lost it. There goes $100 I could have used on something else.

title: Very small
review: These are small. One of them was also sewn too close to the edge, so it has some spots in which it is torn. We kept them because we didn't have time to get something else.

title: Short Velcro
review: The concept is a great idea. However the front Velcro is way too short to wrap around the front of my bike. I wish they can make it at least 15 inches long.

title: Too large, straps look awkward when tightened
review:
Mask is pretty large even for my average-sized face. When you pull the straps to tighten them, the slack cord dangles in front of your ears. These went straight into the trash because they look so goofy.

On the other hand, the mask passes the candle test - meaning it’s thick enough so that air won’t get through when you blow through it- and breathes fine, despite what some people say. As a frontline worker, I want this sort of protection for me and for fellow citizens and think those complaining about “suffocating” probably haven’t gone through much adversity- total exaggeration. So, mixed bag here- good fabric but terrible fit/design.

title: Great gift for an ultimate player!
review: Bought this for my son who plays ultimate frisbee for his college. And he loved it. It’s a perfect little stocking stuffer.

title: Would recommend for any water activities.
review: Would be a great thing to take on water trips of any kind.

title: GARBAGE
review: USED THIS FOR VERY FIRST TIME THIS LAST WED.  THE SIDE POCKETS ARE RIPPING.  GARBAGE PRODUCT.  WOULD RETURN IT IF I COULD, BUYER BEWARE.  PURCHASED IT FOR SIMPLE BEACH PACK, WANTED LIGHTWEIGHT FOR EASE OF TRAVEL AS WELL.  VERY DISAPPOINTED.

title: Nice weight, easy to grip
review: This weight has an easy grip.  It feels balanced in the hand. The rubber coated weight is great in case you drop it on the floor.

title: One Star
review: Did NOT fit the 30 oz. Ozark tumbler.  Much too small to work

title: Nice for cold weather.
review: Keeps my hands warm and charges my phone for use when I travel.

title: These are a must for winter weather!
review: Works well for men women. Saves slips, falls, broken bones and money.

title: Money well spent
review: Bought this for my 285 lb, 6'2" husband who rides a 15 year old Schwinn.  On our 15 mile bike treks he no longer complains of discomfort. He was originally skeptical in spending so much for a bike seat but now says it was $ well spent. The seat installed in less than five minutes.

title: Equipment was damaged
review: Received the product and during the assembly process notice the right upright tube was bent. Also the Console top cover was damage. Still decided to continue with the assembly. Everything went well until I tried to put the last two bolts in the main frame, they would not go in. Not happy about this part at all.

title: Incredible value
review: These are currently selling for less than ten dollars, which is surprising. Usually I spend at least double that and get glasses that bend/break within a few days. I can't say these are high build quality, they probably won't last anywhere near what an expensive pair would, however for the price you can buy SEVERAL of these and still be ahead of the game! I gave them to my son to wear and he LOVES them! They don't look cheap when you wear them, and they do what they are supposed to do: specifically, make it easier to see in bright light and make you look cool at the same time! For the price, this is a no brainer. Absolute bargain!

title: ball of glow
review: What a cool idea! Only problem is it doesn't glow that much for us?

title: Has worked really well for me.
review: I’ve used this folding table every weekend at the Farmer’s Market to hold extra stuff. It’s very easy to assemble and to take apart.  The table top slates are connected but they stack/fold  on top of each other to store. After unfolding the top, you snap 2 poles under the table top to steady it. The base then snaps into these poles. It’s made from lightweight aluminum. I wish it were just slightly heavier. Comes with a duffle bag to store in. I didn’t care about this at 1st, but the duffle has a handle so it can hang on a hook to keep it out of the way and off the ground when not using.

title: Returned it for a Weber!!!!!
review: Order this item 2 weeks ago. Got it in the mail and took it out and one of the side table chrome playe fell of and the Paul Jr designs label was popping up. The lid was off centered so te lid was hard to close you really had to push i and down and line it up to latch. I was already annoyed at this point since it was a gift for my husband and I couldn't wait for him to see it. As heavy as it is te lid is really flimsy and I think needs heavy hinges and better latch. That's not all though... and took it camping right away 2 days later. My husband turned it on and the popping sound started and he opened it and black flakes flying everywhere. Stupid me didnt pack a campfire grill grate just in case and we ended up having to cover the grates in aluminium foil for our steaks and brats and use the camper microwave and futch oven for everything else! What a pain. We were super dissapointed. Should have got the original. 3 of our camping friends have te original and love it. We love our Weber Genesis at home so we did a return instead of a replacement and are going to get the Weber Q. I should have listened to the other negative reviews but thought Coleman would have fixed the issues by now- guess not!

title: It's OK
review: It was smaller than I anticipated and not made very well.  You really can not fit that much in it. It does hold the bottle though...

title: Buy one.
review: I love my fitbit! I like that I can see progress in other areas even when the scale isn't budging (e.g. lowered resting heart rate) and I have a constant reminder to move more.

title: Five Stars

title: Cute for parties
review: These are very cute. They are good for parties or for things at night like a theme park or Halloween. They are bright. They lit up well. The quality was okay. The kids really loved them. They looked nice.

title: Five Stars
review: awesome

title: kids camp bunk beds
review:
UPDATE BELOW: We purchased these for our grandsons visit (5 and 8) - they are terrific. Fairly easy to put together - no tools necessary as they snap together with pop in nibs - would be easier with two people - but I managed to put them together by myself (I'm 58 and not super athletic). Once together, they feel very sturdy. They are the perfect size for our little guys and will be for several years. They have wonderful cloth bags with zippers and elastic bands to secure the pipes and pieces securely. The bags have heavy duty handles. They are fairly heavy - but the bags and handles make it easier to lift and move them. We chose the turquoise - very nice and true turquoise. The side organizers are just wonderful and I think the boys are going to love those too - they will hold the tablets, books, a small night light and other things nicely. I honestly think these are one of our best investments in a while. Having said all of that.. I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.
UPDATE: 7/3/2019.... I continue to LOVE these bunks. I just disassembled the bunk setup - for the first time. I had taken a picture of the pieces in the cases to help me. Took me less than 20 minutes! By myself. It was so easy. And the zippered canvas case/bags are the bomb. So So So easy to store. I am super impressed. The boys, 5 and 8, loved them. They were very comfortable and loved the side organizer attachable strips. These are a bit spendy. But I can see how we can use these for several years. The quality is top notch. I am just really happy with our purchase.

title: Perfect replacement for my daughter
review: I used the chart to determine what size to get for my 7 year old daughter, and it was spot on. The helmet was a perfect fit and she's able to ride her bike again! The color is awesome and she really likes it. Adjusting the strap oddly left a lot of extra slack material left over, but I'm still pretty happy with it. Does what it needs to do, and seems like a decent value.

These are so small, the straps barely fit around my wrists and I have, what I think are small wrists for a man. I was able to snap them into the very first snap holes with great effort.

review: I bought these for curling doll hair. They are the perfect size. You absolutely need end papers though so make sure you buy those also.

title: Love this for more than just bikes!
review:
I had in mind that we'd use this when going biking with my kids, as I inevitably need to adjust something when taking them off the carrying rack. Turns out, this set is EXTREMELY handy to just have around the house! The tiny zipper pouch means I can carry around a tool set in my jeans pocket or throw it in the glove box of my car as a emergency kit. The convenience of it had me grabbing it more often than my bigger screwdriver bit set, as it was so accessible and easy to carry around!
I didn't know how much I wanted this around until I got it. I highly recommend it, for bikes or anything else!

title: Ok set
review: These Are nice fishing items.Except for the handle on the rod It's kind of flimsy and They handle on the real kind of gets in the way sometimes.

title: Nice sports pullover
review:
This is great for the super fan. The logo looks good. It is great to show your spirit for our Florida teams.

This pullover is very comfortable. It is very versatile and can be worn many places. It fits well and feels very good. We have other products from this company and have been happy with them.

It is easy to wash and wear. I wear shirts like these all the time because I would rather be comfortable. It has a nice look to them. It is flattering.

It feels durable. I am pleased with the quality. It is reasonably priced. I would recommend this.

title: Scrap metal

review:
Make sure you read the dimensions. The front to back length is just tiny. It reminds me of a smart car in proportion to my other trailer. Just too short for us or any normal size kiddos. If you have tiny kids I'm sure it will work for you though.
It was easy to put together and take apart and we got it back on the box to return easy enough, which was surprising.

title: This is a great tent!
review: We set it up in our large barn to see how easy it would be - it is easy to set up, and is a high quality tent.  It’s waterproof and windproof and will hold 2 to 6 people depending  upon how friendly they are!  We’ll be using this tent this spring to house family and friends who will come to help us do our spring planting.  We have above ground cots and sleeping bags for a comfortable night’s sleep.  This would be a perfect tent for a family - it really is very pleasant inside with window and window flaps.  These new tents sure are better than the older ones!

title: Customer Service lacking
review:
While I like the jug, I have one lid that is defective and it’s the lid I prefer in order to have a straw in it. I have asked to have someone contact me in hopes I wouldn’t have to send everything back.
Nice bottle, keeps things cold, cute little compass. Customer Service is lacking if you have a problem.

title: Good ping pong balls
review: These balls worked just fine. They were good to use while we were playing. They seemed to be of high quality. We had no issues with breakage or anything. They got good speed. I was very pleased with it. The price was decent for the set.

title: AMAZON will never publish this review !
review:
Do you enjoy having your patience tested? Well then order this piece of cloth! Ordered 4-15, received it 6-09...almost 2 months !
BTW, it's VERY thin and makes one (ME, that's who) wonder if it will really do a proper job this fall season.

title: Five Stars
review: for my son he likes it

title: U kidding
review:
Mounted on a Ruger 10/22 takedown SS, started at 25 and worked progressively all the way back to 75 yards. Love the different types of reticles, for close work, the round one is my fav as it fits perfectly around the 25 yards target. For medium range I go with the cross hairs, and at 75 it's the dot. I've got a cow bell that got rung at 75 yards as many times as it got shot at - if that's not accurate for a red dot, I don't know what is. I was considering dripping a drop of epoxy on each corner (something I do with most of my $50 under reflex sights, but for this one I decided to leave it alone. After couple of times at the range, the glass gasket is still firmly in place - maybe I got a winner. I also like that they put a bit of thought in the design, as yes, it is silver, but the back housing (where the laser is) has a black top which minimizes glare - smart. So if someone had said - $20 and you got your self a keeper, I'd've said, ur kidding!

UPDATE:
Ooooooops... second outing. Didn't hold zero. Zero at holding zero (sorry, I had to). All of a sudden, I'm getting this jumps, vertically, horizontally. Try to adjust, then boom - it switches up 5 inches high at 50, boom you're now 3 inches to the left. Kept jumping all over the place. Right there and then, I put a zero on its life - it's at the bottom of a trash can. Look, if you LOVE wasting time and money, GET THIS! Otherwise, buy youself some good quality icecream for $20 - it'll be a MUCH better investment.

title: Great for beginners!
review: These are a great aid to me since I am just learning to play golf. They help me to measure the depth of the tee and allow me to optimize my initial swing from the tee. I also like that these come in a bag of 50 (so they will last me a while) and they are durable and will hopefully last me a long time. These are also reasonably priced so they are a great deal!

title: Manly Macrame
review: This paracord set has a lot of stuff to make! It comes with lots of paracord and lots of buckles and key rings. We were able to make quite a lot of paracord crafts. There are no instructions, but we were able to find instructions on Pinterest easily.

title: Three Stars
review: Needs improvement, cap spring

title: A little too tall, but my son loves it
review:
My 5 year old should be tall enough for the 16" according to the charts. However when we got it, we found that when the seat is lowered all the way, he just barely can't reach the ground. I think the seat is thicker than an average bike seat by a couple of inches, so those extra inches lift him off the ground by exactly that many too much.
HOWEVER, he loves it. Apparently it is so much easier to ride than his old smaller bike that he as able to make it up a pretty steep hill on our block and still want to go ride more laps around! He just needs to be careful getting on and off, and I'm keeping the training wheels on until he's old enough to reach the ground with his toes like a properly sized bike. But for now, he loves it and literally asks to ride it every single day after school.

title: Lightweight but effective
review: Great lightweight lunch bag for my husband.  Keeps his lunch cool in the Texas summer heat.

title: Helps My Knitting And Other Hands On Activities
review:
I work a lot with my hands. I have noticed while knitting lately that I could use some exercise to keep my hands and wrists from getting sore, so I thought I would try these out.

WHAT ARE THESE LIKE?
These two balls that come in this kit are two different types. One is very soft and the other is a little harder to press. The lime one is the softer one that you begin with. This comes with a sheet that has photos and descriptions of different exercises to do. I have to say that the cautions of catching breath and heart problems made me chuckle.

HOW DO THESE WORK?
I have been using the softer version at first doing the exercises daily and did notice after a week that my hands were not hurting as much when I was knitting. I just changed to the stiffer one and it is more challenging, but it feels nice on the hands, forearms and wrists.

VIDEOS?
I did not find any videos on these, but if I do, I will update.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For strengthening hands, fingers, and forearms, this is a great simple kit. Exercises are easy to follow with photos and descriptions. I did notice some relief after just a week.

MY RATING
This is a nice kit. It helps with knitting and other hands on activities. I am giving this five stars as it is easy to store- not too big- and easy to use too.

title: They will work but...... read my full review for all the details
review:
These are ok. I say that because they are comfortable once tour used to them. They keep the water out but still feel a little odd at first. Noise cancelling is a no go. It will somewhat but when you say noise cancelling this isnt what you would expect. They have to be pushed deep and hard Into ears for them to start having a good enough cancellation effect. I found them to be a pain to remove as well especially if u push them deep to make sure they fit ur ear and keep out water. With wet fingers wet plugs they can be a pain to remove. This may not be the case if your fingers are dry. Over all it was a six pack of plugs and nose clamps for the same price as 2 pair of plugs that look exactly the same from a different store. So I only need them for my vacation and snorkling trip next week and these will do fine I guess.
I have not been paid for ANY review I've ever left. (I wish I did though) This is, as always, just my opinion through my eyes to help others.
If you find this review helpful, please vote, so Amazonian browsers can better learn, research and understand how products work for them.!. Thank you and Happy Buying

title: Easy Assemble
review: I was able to assemble this hula hoop super fast considering my arms are so weak that I cant open pickle jars to save my life. The hula hoop is plenty heavy enough without any filling. I can only do it for maybe 5 mins at a time as I quickly start feeling bruised from the weight. Still, the pain makes me feel like Im actually exercising, so I love it, haha.

title: I like the weight and fabric of this hat
review: I like the weight and fabric of this hat. It has great coverage in the sun and is not much trouble to get the face and neck pieces on. Quality is not good. Face cover is velcro connected and works well, but the back cover is set in hooks. One of the pieces that connect the hook was not stitched when it arrived. Still usable though.

title: They don’t cover your hands
review: I thought they would have thumb holes to keep them not your hand but they didn’t. I would’ve liked them better if they had. I haven’t worn them but once as a result. They won’t stay on my hands.

title: VERY CHEAP~
review: Very cheap I thought it would be better but it feels very cheaply made and the my gf has very small wrist and it barely fit around her wrist. For the money I paid for it and expectations wasn't met

I balanced the table 100% at the ends and corners, but the sagging is enough to make the balls move a littel to the center when they slow down.I could live with this on a cheap portable table, but this one cost $900 plus$241 for set up. title: Obsessed
review:
I ordered 5 different leggings from different Amazon sellers. Hands down these are the best I tried. They are thick and compressive and opaque. The color blocking also is quite flattering. Perfect for stretching, lifting and cardio as minimal sweat shows through.

I would buy these in every color if I could. Just what I was looking for!

title: Ok

Four hours away from home threw them out not worth logging back home to pay huge shipping fees back.  Don't waste your money!!!!!!! I normally don't write reviews but I thought I could spare someone the heartache.  .If, zero stars was an option I would have given it!!!!!!!

title: Nice lure.
review: What can I say ? Its a lure. It looks just like a real fish. Good clear painting and color.

title: Actually works!
review: I've tried all sorts of coolers and these are the best so far. They tend to hold a good bit of water without dripping which can be a plus if you don't mind getting a little wet. Or wring them out as instructed. Although we laughed at the concept of "re-cooling" the towel by snapping it, it worked. We used these for several hot days in San Antonio and expect to use them often. I would buy these again.

title: Can't wait to go fishing 🐟🐟🐠
review: I know you should buy things for function but this reel so was so pretty and it matched my rod perfectly! My hubby is going to set up my rod this weekend and I can't wait to try it! It looks just like a bumblebee 🐝🐝🐝

title: Wow, much better than ice!
review:
We spend a lot of time in the car and always have a cooler packed with drinks and snacks. Needless to say, this got my attention. So I ordered this set and am very happy with them.

First I went to fill one up as a test. Maybe I should have measured the amount of water I put in but I guessed. When I fill the second and third ones, I will measure the amount of water going in.

These are a large size and will require a decent size cooler.

My first test was put in the freezer for 48 hours. Next, I put it my new soft-sided cooler, in the house, at room temperature with nothing else inside. I shut the cooler and left it alone for 24 hours. After 24 hours this frozen pack was still about 90% solid. I was impressed. I closed the cooler and left it for another 24-hour test. After 48 hours it was getting pretty soft, yet was still doing a good job of staying cold.

My frequent car trips last 10-12 hours and these will definitely keep my drinks and snacks cold for those trips. I am certain that if I used two of these and had my cooler filled that things would stay cold for days.

I am impressed with these and highly recommend them. Give them a try, I think you will like them too.

title: Add to Cart! This lantern is amazing!
review:
I am amazed at the amount of light that these lantern produce. One will light up a whole room. After purchasing one set of two lanterns, I’ve purchased four more.
It is very light weight and easy to use. The top slides open easily and stays up for table top use or to use with the carrying handles.
This is perfect for my mother who can not hold a flashlight while she is using her walker.

title: Well made product
review:
I got this for my sister in law and she jogs. She acted happy with it. It has 3 settings I think. I stays solid color. It flashes one end and flashes both ends.
I got the blue and it was a nice color.

title: Didn't look like the picture at all
review: Cheap material

title: Fun for all ages!
review: this is surprisingly light to roll up and carry around and it stores nicely in the box it came in.  It has a foam backing that keeps the green where you put it on a hard surface.  Knowing that my six-year-old twin grandchildren had putters, I thought this would be a great new addition for grandma's new and interesting activities when they come to visit.  I was delighted to see that putting became a multi-generational activity and that there was some learning going on at the same time.  This is well-made, and with reasonable care (and no divots), should last many years.

title: half made in China!
review: I was looking for a lantern made in the USA. This said on amazon made in USA so I ordered it. When I unboxed it the sticker said made in La california and under that it said China! It has the poor quality one has come to expect from chinese products.  The globe is thin, the leaver to raise and lower the globe bends. It will be easy to break this thing. I wouldn't take it camping because of the poor quality it wouldn't survive a long trip. This lantren is best for the house during a power outage where it won't experiance much abuse.

title: Great to pack for a quick bike ride
review: Verr handy! I keep it in my day pack for bike riding. Easy to use.

title: Nice storage for the items I use most often like ...
review:
I bought this for the farm. Too many straps so I cut them off. Nice storage for the items I use most often like my knife and small flashlight. Durable fabric but hay and dirt are always accumulating on the top of the pack as it tends to fold inward. Within less than six months the plastic buckled broke and I just tied the strap but that didn't work well.

I have been trying to get a refund or replacement of better product for 3 months.

title: Good shoes, a little pricey.
review: Never did a 1:1 comparison with Shimano. IDK - how much money would I have to save to make it worth my time? These seem to be the best I've tried, so I stick with these. I have a couple of vintage bikes, so I suppose I will still be using rim brakes long after they have disappeared entirely from bike shops.

title: Leaks
review: The lid leaks on this one. I have another one, that doesn't leak. No matter what I do applying the two pieces to the lid, it still leaks.

title: Two Stars
review: Too small. Returned for a refund and bought another.

title: You want to be really interested.
review: My wife stopped wearing it after a week or so.

title: Ok, but not the best option
review:
We have an almost identical chair from Cabela's that has held up really well for 5 years now and cost half of this chair. I thought having this one with the arms would be an upgrade for our Chihuahua Desert horse camp.

It's ok, but not as good as the smaller, armless Cabela chair. This was a freaking nightmare to set-up. Literally none of the pieces that needed to unfold or turn worked out of the box. My husband actually had undo all the leg bolts, position the frame and legs and rebolt everything. He was not amused.

The feet settle into the gravel and rock in our driveway, but they are still wobbly compared to the Cabela chair - and that chair has smaller feet! The arms on this one do make the chair more comfortable overall and it sits up a little taller. We'll have to wait and see if it holds up for years out in the elements or not.

title: Knife-like edge is USELESS but spoon & fork are great
review:
This is a very light SPORK and feels like it is made out of piece of tin. However, it is made out of titanium, is feather light, and is food and dishwasher safe. There is a fork on one end with one of the tines that has a "knife-like" edge. There is a spoon on the other end. The center holes can be used to fasten this to a backpack.

I got this because many times when I go on a staycation, I pack a cooler with yogurt and stuff for day travel. This is perfect for that. I ate with the spoon and fork fine but I could not cut anything of substance with the knife. I think $12.99 is overpriced for this especially since the knife-like edge is completely useless. A butter knife cuts better. However, the spoon and fork are perfect for any "away-type" eating such as camping, backpacking, or just a staycation with a cooler in tow.

The high price and poor knife are the reason I rate this 3.3 stars.

title: Not liking it
review: Not what I expected. Very hard to assemble.

title: Fun action figure
review: This is more than just an action figure. Your child can put him together. He can mix and match parts. He can also mix with other 6-inch characters in the same line. My son really enjoyed that part of it. John Cena is very popular... this is a good likeness of him. It's great for a child who likes wrestling or one who just likes action figures.

title: Go Buckeyes!
review: These Ohio Buckeye underwear are super cute. While made for a man, women can enjoy them and wear around the house. They are fun, especially if you are a sports lover. The fabric (100% cotton) is comfortable and durable. I love the thick waistband that reads “Ohio State”. The legs are loose. The fit is like traditional boxers. They appear to be well made and wash well. If you love the Ohio State Buckeyes, you will love these. I’d recommend them.

title: Buy it
review: If you have a dart board you need this. Great quality! Highly recommended

title: Nice board
review: Nice longboard. This is a nice basic board. Looks like picture, rides smooth. I think it would be better without the name/logo on it, but other than that it’s a fun board to ride.

title: Perfect for personal hygiene and some cleaning
review:
The review sample I received is perfect for campers who want the convenience of portable personal hygiene and light cleaning tasks. The flow rate of this shower is 2.5 cubic inches per second, which manages to conserve water while providing sufficient pressure for wet-lather-rinse showers. To be sure this is not a high pressure pump and shower head, but is effective.

It also works for light duty utensil rinsing and other similar tasks. You can even shampoo pets outside without using risky 110/120 volt power. The instructions are both clear and contain a lot of useful information. I recommend taking the time to read them over before using this shower head for the first time. There are a few gotchas that you need to heed, including not exceeding USB charging sources of 1.2 Amps.

Assembly is simple, but you need to make sure you do not lose the hose O-ring (I store mine in a plastic envelope). Also you need to ensure that the filter is routinely cleaned, especially if you are camping and using treated spring, lake or river water. This works perfectly with the [[ASIN:B0009PUQVY Coleman PVC Double Wash Basin]] or similar basins. Make sure that whichever basin you use is sufficiently deep to completely submerge the pump. I recommend a minimum of four inches to be on the safe side.

While the USB charging feature is a big plus, you can also use this with an [[ASIN:B00E3OL5U8 Anker 14W Solar Panel Foldable Dual-port Solar Charger]], which is perfect for camping. You can get about an hour of use for every two to five hour charge. That is where the solar panel I cited comes in handy because you can truly leave the grid with this shower head and that panel when roughing it.

title: Love this chair!
review:
This is our second chair of this style, and I honestly really like them both very much. The first time I tried one of these, I was concerned because it doesn't FOLD and UNFOLD quickly like my old camping chairs, you have to assemble it. I called this a con of the product, but now that I've used it for a bit, I understand the process- in order to break it down into something remarkably small, it has to assemble/disassemble. Putting this chair up is more like a small tent than a folding chair. In fact, the supports feels very similar to the kind you see in tents, with elastic-style cords that keep the parts attached, and actually almost assemble themselves when taken out of the bag. Once all the beams are positioned properly, it's just a matter of putting the seat cover in place using the 4 corner grommets. The advantage is that this chair can easily fit into a backpack or other small carrying space.
It is a camping chair at the end of the day so it is a little lower than a regular chair. However, it is great for additional seating when watching movies on our home theater or for backyard movie night with the projector. I particularly like that this one has a little pocket that be used to hold a beverage or book!

title: SUPER comfortable to run with
review: SUPER comfortable to run with. Love that there is a clip for my house key as well. No more awkward arm band or fanny packs with zippers that break. I can jog in confidence knowing my phone and key are totally secure. Highly recommend. Love that I got it for half the cost of the Flip Belt

title: Smooth street surfer...
review:
[[VIDEOID:3f79b8927748f6154ef9a27daa2ac07d]] Very smooth with smaller wheels which provide greater maneuverability. The quality polyurethane wheels also help to create a smoother ride. The double wing tips allow for aggressive skating too. I like the board because it can do it all. Smooth everyday rider to handling more fancy maneuvering. The paint job looks amazing too. It looks more gold in person.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Incredible fun; made of cheap plastic; assembly difficult; scoring incorrect
review:
[[VIDEOID:92883454e041f127c0f7a42a11a0470a]] This game is highly entertaining and lots of fun to play. Although it is called Whirl Ball, it is exactly like the Skeet Ball played in the Arcades down the shore but on a mobile and smaller scale. Despite its entertainment value, there are some flaws with this game. Nevertheless, I rated this 3 stars ONLY BECAUSE of how much fun this is. However, if you want an accurate and quality game, look elsewhere.

FLAWS

- First,  assembly is not "tool-free" as the box claims. It is difficult to assemble and a screwdriver is required to install the three AAA batteries (NOT INCLUDED) for the scoring mechanism. It comes in five pieces excluding the arrow stickers that have to be placed on the ramp.  There is a ball return shoot that connects to the ramp (2 pieces), left and right ends for the score zone area (2 pieces), and the electronic scoring mechanism (1 piece). I had incredible difficulty trying to seat the left and right end for the score zone area. The instructions are not very good and there are arms (see second photo) that have to be turned to the side so that they are flush with the end. If that is not done, they are in the way. Also, it feels as if the plastic is going to break when assembling this. It took me about 25 minutes to assemble these five pieces mostly because of those left and right ends.

- Second, the instructions are practically useless and there really is not any good information on how to play the game itself.

- Third, the plastic feels extremely cheap. At the current price of $49.99, I expected much better.

- Fourth, I ripped a sticker when removing it from the page it came on. They really should already have the stickers affixed to the ramp before shipment so that they are straight and there is no chance of it being torn during assembly. The stickers for the scoring area are already in place so there is no reason these cannot be affixed at the factory.

- Fifth, the electronic scoring unit misses scores. When the play is started, a cheer similar to what happens at a ballgame is played. If my boyfriend or I immediately rolled the ball and made a score, the score would not be counted. Instead we had to wait until the cheer was almost done before playing, so .5 seconds is lost on the clock for the 30-second play. Also, it does not count the score if two balls make a score one right after the other.  You will notice :30 into my video that it counted one 20 pointer and then missed the second one after that. Therefore, when the score said 70, it should have gone up to 90. This means, one has to slow down their play to ensure that all scores are counted. What I noticed is that when it plays back the score count, it will not count the next ball that is sunk during that verbal playback.

- Sixth, the ramp is not really smooth as there is a bump at the connection that causes the ball to "trip up" sometimes.

FEATURES
- Automatic Ball Return Shoot
- Built-In Electronic Scoring
- Folding Legs
- Multiple Score Zones
- 2 Whirl Balls
- Authentic Arcade Feel

In summary, my boyfriend and I love the game. It is lots of fun and provides a truly 5-star experience. However, quality and accuracy are lacking for such a high price point of $49.99.

title: Great for muscle therapy
review: A few months ago I pulled a muscle in my arm and for a while after that it would hurt a little when I made a fist. A PT friend of mine suggested, among other things, that I should do repetitive exercises to strengthen it back up. These are PERFECT for that. Before using these, it hurt to open a clamp to hold up a backdrop at work. After a couple of days of using this at my desk, I'm already feeling better and stronger. Since it is a 2 pack, I can leave one on my desk and keep one in the car or by my bed. They are easy to hold, have a solid rubberized grip, and adjustable tension strength, which is welcome for people like me who want to start off easy then turn it up as I feel better. I recommend it.

title: Better than  a blow up mat, but bulkier
review: I'm not really a camper as a rule. I much prefer the RV way, but some things can only be accessed by foot or horseback. For me, that means some overnight treks on horseback and the associated gear. This  mat is certainly easier to use than one you need to blow up, but the trade off is this weighs more and is more bulky. It does fit across the cantle of a Western saddle and can be tied down correctly, but it is too bulky to fit in a saddle bag. I find the mat pretty comfortable on rocky ground or one night at a time.

title: This was a gift. He loves it so well ...
review: This was a gift.  He loves it so well he intends to get the six kayak​ version, too!

title: Still a fan
review: I'm a all time, true die hard Knicks fan and wanted this hat so bad but it fits a little weird. I don't have a big head and i never have a problem with hats fitting but this hat just sits on the top of my head. Well what a waste, cute hat is going to sit with my hat collection and collect dust.

title: Seems sturdy and functional - finish is not very good
review: It seems to be sturdy. The wrap around the hand area seems rugged and slip proof. I like the way it comes apart into 3 pieces and stows away in it's own pouch. The finish is not very good and the joints are somewhat misaligned... but these issues seem cosmetic in nature and once I start using it, I'm sure none of this will really matter.

title: Compact fold: less space occupied in suitcase.
review: It rolls very thin compared to my normal thin yoga mat, so would take less space in luggage, but it is heavier though.  The weighty feel holds well on carpets, especially in hotel rooms.  Texture allows easy clean and rinse.  Drys very quickly.  You still need to roll it via short sides as I wasn’t comfortable enough to fold along the long side. I may test this on next trip and see if the crease just releases.

title: much smaller than i ever anticipated

title: Good buy
review: Good product. Holds up well. Works well and is effective.

title: A Step Above the Rest….
review:
With many paddle board options today, some may mistakenly think they are all the same. This board provides more side stability which means less swaying, especially when standing. The material and seems not only are sealed, but look flush and level on the edges too. The middle of the board does not have any bow even with over 200lbs in the middle. These are the differences that this quality board provides. I spent my summer in the water on many different boards and this is my keeper. The soft top feels really good when kneeling too. The accessories are nice, but the quality of this board is in the buoyancy and stability.

I thought they would work well, since I had to use small pliers to open and close the lock mechanism. Unfortunately, it didn't last. Although the carabiner was basically intact, the locking mechanism got loosened up, and I had to go looking in the grass for the tags again. Back to the drawing board.

title: Really do work
review: I am a quadriplegic but still am able to use my phone &  easy to put on and comfortable

title: Okay, but could be improved
review: It does what it says, but it's heavy. The straps don't keep it upright, and it's an awkward shape.

title: Looks so good on my watch
review: It's soft and comfortable.  I'll be buying more for different colors :-)

title: The REAL DEAL..100% cotton hoodie- old school style!!
review:
The search is over and I AM IN LOVE!! For any who’ve been trying for an authentic hoodie- you know, the one made of 100% cotton and not the latest synthetic mixed alternative.. This is it!!
Best of all.. sold at a price point of $30- Are you kidding me!!? Reminiscent of what one would find in a college bookstore..This is a soft, slightly worn in (by appearance only) hoodie that has a timeless and classic look about it. This would stir up memories and make a great gift for any alumni without a doubt.. ha! I actually chose a school that I did not attend- just bc, I loved the hoodie so much!! Plus, I think It’s fair to say the California collegiate system is commercialized in such a way.. making it socially acceptable to wear a name that isn’t affiliated to your education per sé.

For those who don’t know… **These are women’s sizes!! NOTHING unisex about this- IF, wanting men’s/universal sizing- this brand does offer this same item in male standard fit. This is cut and sized for the female figure and in doing so, it eliminates a lot of excess bulk- creating a far more flattering look. Having to order XL to insure a fit thru the bust line.. the chest/mid section fit but, without any room to spare! (Feels more in line with Jr. Miss vs. women’s size?!) The length fits a bit longer due to my height and waistband hits just past the bum cheek. For reference: I’m 5’2”, 154lb, 38C, 40+ yr. old and carry my trouble spot thru the mid/waist section (thx to my x4 kids and gravity!) Hopefully this can give you solid info to compare with.

This is a soft quality mid weight cotton that has been constructed with nice attention to detail.. all seams and stitching are on point..and no loose threads. This can easily be layered up and worn in the colder months or, paired with shorts + flip flops over sunburn shoulders for a summer night.. it’s truly the perfect in-between all season item!

I do recommend washing on cold and line drying.. just to be certain shrinkage won’t alter the fit! (Especially in my situation- where I have no room to spare!) Loving this so much, I’ve worn frequently the past few weeks.. and fingers crossed, I have not had issue with pilling. **double knot hoodie string- or clip together prior to wash- these are prone to disappear into the hoodie in the wash.. trust me, after 2nd time- I got smart!

Hands-down I’d recommend on every level.. this is a great quality, 100% cotton, total classic hoodie that would be appreciated by any- I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

title: great quality materials, 10x brighter than what I expected
review: This laser positively surprised me with quality and brightness - I actually don't need all the power it has but hey - I love it. No cons that I found only pros, except maybe that it is indeed not for kids. Very strong laser - I can even see the beam itself in the air daylight at home (it illuminates beam by shining of the flying dust)

title: Great for working out knots
review: This works great for working the knots out of my calf muscles. I use an elliptical daily and walk during my breaks at work so I tend to get a lot of tension and knots in my muscles. I like that you can adjust the massager as each link is removable. It doesn't take much pressure for me to get a good, firm massage. The quality of the massager is great and I expect to get many years of use from this massager.

title: Attaches to Water Bottle
review: This is wide, attaches to a water bottle and filters water. It's light-weight, takes a good amount of suction to work and filters water decently for camping and hiking.

title: Totally Worthless “Exerciser”
review:
This CONFIDENCE FITNESS MOTORIZED ELECTRIC MINI EXERCISE BIKE/PEDAL EXERCISER is totally worthless as “exercise” equipment. It has two good features. First, it’s easy to assemble, if you already know how to use simple tools and how to read the exploded parts diagrams that come with IKEA furniture, children’s bicycles, and similar “some assembly required” items . (The only parts to attach are two base stabilizers and the pedals.)

Second, the console with the readout and the power, speed, and mode buttons is actually a wired remote that you can hold in your hand as you use the “exerciser”.

After those two things, it is all bad news.

+++Even for a fit person, it is hard to insert your feet under the pedal straps. (The Velcro-adjustable straps are essential for keeping your feet on the pedals during exercise.) Worse, the straps are too short to go around my husband’s size 12 shoes.

+++The exerciser weighs only 10 lbs. It “walked away” from my chair so badly, I couldn’t even complete 2 minutes of pedaling. This was true when I placed it on a rubber mat (not included). Bracing the device against a wall to hold it in front of my chair didn’t work, because it just shifted sideways.

+++The motor is extremely weak (110 V), and just moves the pedals around and around at slightly different speeds, in forward or reverse directions. The pedals move your feet and legs up and down, but you don’t really get any meaningful exercise, because you aren’t causing the pedals to move. There Is no way to adjust resistance to make it easier or harder to pedal. The device offers no feedback on your own expended effort.

I purchased the device for my disabled husband to use to build endurance, and it’s a complete disaster. He can’t keep his feet on the pedals, and he can’t sustain even a brief period of sustained “pedaling”, because the device immediately moves forward away from his chair.

title: Five Stars
review: Works great!
As described

title: Compact & Powerful
review:
This lantern isn't just for camping. It's great to keep around for emergencies. It's super bright and can light up your surroundings for several feet. One charge can last for up to 100 hours. This isn't your Daddy's lantern. It's a high tech version of the Coleman classic you know and trust. The best part is that it's very light and portable. You might want to get a few to stash away. I highly recommend this product.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided makes your decision a little easier.

title: Good bar overall
review:
The bar is pretty much as described though my collars were chrome, not black.
The bar is lightweight which is nice for me to do a variety of movements without have the clunkiness of a heavy bar. It’s also not too wide where storage is a concern.

The bar does have some metal fragments inside that rattle but that is not a problem.
The welds are decent and appear like they’ll hold up well over time.
The handles are lined up as they as supposed to be and aren’t welded crooked or at improper angles (ie one welded at 45 degrees and the other being at 35 or 55 degrees which is fairly noticeable).
It has stood up to a decent level of use and some abuse (I’ve found people are generally more aggressive with their equipment so I tried to set it down a bit heavier than normal just to see).
I’m enjoying the bar thus far.

title: Four Stars
review: Wish it included a bering puller like they use too.

title: Display Your Support with This Quality Item!
review: Received in great condition and as described. Great product and quality material.

title: Fine
review: Fine

title: couldn't get it to spit out accurate numbers compared with multiple legit power meters
review:
To KurtKinetic's credit, they really went out of their way to help me get this working. OTOH it doesn't come close to working for me. I now believe that this is because I am using an older, blue Road Machine. For me this tracks pretty accurately with on-bike power meters up to about 300 watts, which for me is barely into sweet spot - beyond that it is progressively less accurate.

I know others have made it work with current production Road Machines, so my best guess is that you must have a current Road Machine to get accurate numbers.

BTW I tried every recommendation from Kurt to get it to work. Same result with TrainerRoad's built-in spindown calibration

In the end I gave up and just put a legit power meter on every bike i ride. I suppose in a few more years power meters will be so cheap that doing it this way will be the only thing that makes sense.

title: Fun Snorkel and Fin Set
review:
This is an excellent product that's perfect for a day at the beach. The set includes fins, a mask, a snorkel, and a convenient carrying bag. The fins have a soft rubber foot pocket that is both comfortable and flexible. The fin is made from a more rigid material that allows you to produce a powerful kick. The fins have an adjustable heel strap to ensure a good fit. There is also a quick release button on the strap so it's easy to take the fins off when you're done swimming.

The mask offers your kids a good field of vision as they're exploring in shallow water. The snorkel clips to the mask strap. This is a quality product that's easy to use and which will allow your kids to have a new kind of adventure.

title: not lightweight. returning immediately.
review: It is beautiful and sturdy, but I can not walk around with this. it is heavier than normal high-back, low beach chairs. The carrying bag also is not comfy. hurts my arm. I found one 1lbs weights less than this. I will purchase that one. sorry for returning but I gotta be honest to help others. if you are a heavy person go for it. it is comfy . but i dont even weight that much i cant carry this. and they dropped the price 20 percent after I purchased. it is a bit unfair that i paid 11 more dollars for the same chair and i still did not get what i need. anyways. returning.
