title: The Real Deal
review:
I purchased this pad last week based solely on the positive reviews. If you've spent any time looking at camping equipment on Amazon, you know that many products and their reviews are suspicious. Not here -- this one is the real deal! I just returned from a backpacking trip where it performed so well that I had to immediately write this review even though I just got home, I'm sore, and I'm exhausted.

First, the size: A third of the size of the lightest pad from the most well-known manufacturer, (and this one is full body, not just torso like their ultra lightweight). Long enough for me 5'9" and my pillow with room to spare.

The quality: Perfectly made, no trouble with the valve or any parts of the pad, no strong odor right out of the package. The material feels so lightweight that I was nervous about popping it but I used it in a tent and directly on a beach for sunbathing and had no issues. I also took a nap on it directly on the hardwood floor in my home to test it for leaks and was very comfortable.

The support: I have tried any number of pads for car camping and backpacking over the years and this was by far the most supportive and comfortable for me. Because of the number of chambers, you will bottom out on this one if you don't have all of your weight on it like if you're sitting upright on it or kneeling on it in your tent or whatever. But, if you're resting flat on the pad it is wonderfully supportive. I'm not a small person and I had no issues with getting a comfortable rest on this pad in any direction - back, side, or belly sleeping.

The functionality: It is very easy to inflate, took me exactly 12 breaths each time. It's easy to close the valve without air escaping. It's wasn't unreasonably loud against my tent or sleeping bag. The texture of the material was good for holding my pillow in place and I didn't slide off it in my taffeta sleeping bag. It was very easy to roll it up and get it back in it's carrying sack. It never went back in as compactly as it arrived but it was close enough (see photos).

I'm thrilled with this purchase and I'm looking forward to many more backpacking excursions with this trusty pad. [I am an actual customer, I have no affiliation with this company, and I received nothing in exchange for this review.]

title: Very nice jugs, fit well in tight spaces and easy to carry
review: I bought these because they fit EXACTLY in the under cabinet of my tiny travel trailer sink. One for fresh water and one for grey water. Now I have 7 gallons of each in containers that are easy to fill and easy to hold. The spigot in the lid screws out so I could put the hose through it on the freshwater, and I can still seal it if I need to carry it for a distance.

title: Too warm to the touch
review: It’s too hot to the touch when you lie down on it. I wasn’t working out but was sitting on the mat and laying on it while stretching-no cardio or even yoga and within the first few minutes this mat became hot and uncomfortable. There’s something in the material or fabric. Maybe it was only meant for hot yoga

title: Good so far
review: Have only had for a week,  but no complaints.  Easy to use,  quick recharge,  and light is a nice touch.

title: Not for guys!!!
review: This was too small for my head and I have a small head. For kids only. Not for adults!

title: Just Great!
review: Got these for trigger point therapy. They are greaaaaat!

title: The jury is still out!
review: I bought this because it was time for a new one after 20 yrs. However, it appears that they don't make them like the used to.  It started out riding smoothly at first, but then after 15 - 20 mins.It starts to get hard to pedal for reasons unknown. Not a happy camper!

title: It is in the Bag.
review: I like that even when you have it folded up and put back in the bag there's still room to put extra things in it. You can easily store flashlights and a snack and room left in there. Thank you for reading my review I hope it was helpful for you. God bless may the rest of your life be the best of your life.  OZ

title: basic, functions moderatly well
review:
I was very excited to get this, and it was fairly easy to set up, even if the directions are not clear. The door that covers the display is made of plastic, not very sturdy, and the door piece is what you use to clip it on your clothing. I'm amazed it hasn't broken, but so far is doing good....I was sure it would break but so far has not.
I never used the CD that came with it, so I cannot review that.
As far as the functions, it is very easy to see the readout and track your distance in kilometers, miles, and steps traveled.
My only real beef with this is the lack of distance traveled accuracy. Even on it's least sensitive setting, it still adds 1/4 more distance then what I actually traveled. Oddly though, it measures steps correctly when walking on carpeting or on an elliptical. At the track and on cement, plan on shaving off 1/4 of your distance to be semi accurate.
If you want to be encouraged by an overzealous pedometer, go for it. It's easy to use, and fairly comfortable.
If you want perfect accuracy, buy something else.

title: Dont waste your money
review: The collars don't fit. I can literally pull them off without turning them. This is actually really, really dangerous. I emailed them for help and never received a reply.

title: Lasted Less Than 6 Hours
review: My 2 year old got this for Christmas from his brother. He opened the box, my husband blew it up. About 4 hours later, the thing was completely shredded. When he hit it, it came apart at the seams. Which then led to the kids trying to climb inside the deflate broken tiger. So not safe at all. I will not be rebuying it for him because I am certain it would suffer the exact same fate. Very disappointed.

title: Dissatisfy
review: At first it seemed okay but after a couple of uses the sheet keeps moving to one side iam trying to return it but I don’t even see the option for returning so disappointed 😞 I was getting so excited about using it.

title: Works well
review: I use this to make "no tie shoelaces" and cable ties. The quality is good enough for those purposes and I would buy this cord again.

title: Looks great put doestnt hold enough and not easy to access
review: I'm just looking for something for dog walking and hiking, so easy access to treats and able to hold drinks bottle. This one is cute but drinks dont fit right and pockets a little awkward.

title: perfect for new Ebike
review: wide platform, easy to install and great grip of my sneakers.

title: Great water bottle
review: I love it!  It's perfect.  Great size, easy to carry, not too heavy.

title: Good product but doesnt fit all.
review: I have a high sierra hydration pack. The bite valve started leaking so I thought this would be a great idea.  Unfortunately the bite valve doesn't fit with the male end of the hydrolock.  Putting it into the hose itself was very easy.  I will hang onto it for use with a different hydration pack.

title: Five Stars
review: My son loved these . Great fit

title: holster
review: great little holster for concealed carry as it fits in pocket easily

title: Fit Bit Inspire
review: I love this device and the app.  No problems.

title: Works great as replacement rollers
review: Works great as replacement rollers.  The holes on the side needed to be drilled slightly larger to fit our main part, but worked great after.

title: Does the job
review: Its ok . Alittle tight and small but does the job .

title: Cute cover.
review: Perfect for after swimming or beach. Not absorbant. Does add some protection against wind.

title: Good Sleeping Bag
review: Very cozy sleeping bag. It is kid sized, but fits my preteen kids just fine. Not too small for them. The fabrics are sleeping bag fabrics, but they are really comfortable. The thickness is good for our particular climate. (Southern US) This is a really good, durable sleeping bag.

title: Everything works great for high intensity workouts…
review:
[[VIDEOID:6c68e4438f90b2901bb968a08186ebe4]] Nice exercise bike for legs and cardio. The easy to use and easy to see display is really nice for indoor or outdoor use. The pulse pickup is fast and accurate. Very steady reading too. Every main part is adjustable: seat, handlebars, and resistant tension. Smooth riding to loose some extra pounds.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Grip Power Pads
review: I just recently started rowing with heavy weights and when I did the bar was rolling in my hands.  With these grip pads, the bar does not roll any more with the heavier weights.  They are easy to get on and off.  I am very satisfied and highly recommend them.

title: Generally a good staff
review: Generally a good staff but should be a little heavier, made from more substantial material, and the rounded shape of the rubber tip attachment makes it less stable on a flat surface.

title: Sturdy light
review: This is a good sized, heavy flashlight that comes with a large battery that lasts a long time.  I keep one in my house and one in my car, and it came in very handy when I hit some debris at night and had to pull over on a highway and check under the engine. Only four stars though because it really isn't very bright.  Bright enough but just 25 lumens so it's good for a distance of about 30 feet or so when it's dark out. Definitely not a flood light.

title: The rack is cheap
review: The rack is very cheap.  Flimsy plastic and when you remove one of the 8 lb weights the entire thing tumbles over.  Junk.

title: This trainer works as it was intended.  It's just not that useful as a training tool.
review:
GS CHIER Tennis Trainer Rebound Ball Portable Training Tool consists of a rubber puck attached to a tennis ball. The intent is that the ball will always come back to the player to aid in hitting practice. In general, the device works as in tended.

The puck is heavy enough and grippy enough to stay in place when the ball is hit and it does get pulled back. Unfortunately, the elastic line gets tangled and affects the bounce of the ball. For a beginner, more time might be spent dealing with the line than practicing. It makes one wonder whether this device is any better than hitting the ball against a wall when practicing solo. For serving and hitting, a bucket of balls will do quite well and for hitting practice, a racketball wall is probably a better choice.

title: Our grandkids enjoy it. However
review: This croquet set is ok.  Our grandkids enjoy it.  However, that said, I remember the croquet sets of my youth & they were better made than the ones today.  It's too bad quality isn't important these days!

title: Extra Durable, Extra Plush, And Extra Large...
review: This raft is made of super thick material that is made to last.  The high back area makes this very comfortable for taller riders too.  The back rest provides lots of support.  The extra large size make this very well balanced in the water too.  Can fit four teenagers easily!!!

title: Sheds like crazy!
review: Sheds like crazy!

title: Three Stars
review: Fit the door and can add resistance bands easily.

title: Great Looking Bottle, Stopper top that does not secure completely
review:
I love this bottle for the simple elegant and masculine design. I have had a fight with my youngest son about who gets it because he thinks it looks cool. Love the color and logo... I can't say anything but good things about it visually. The top is actually a stopper which is a little unusual, and I would trust it to hold water if you were to knock it over on a table top, but I don't have much faith in it being leak proof in a backpack. It takes a little effort to pop it out, but I would think that it could easily be worked off. So that limits it's use a bit, but still perfect for office desk, car, or to have handy on a table when working outside. Insulation seems pretty good too, ice stayed for several hours on countertop.

And I'll say it again, this is a beautiful bottle

title: Great gloves
review: Gloves feel like quality. I will buy again plus they look cool. MERICA!!

title: Dehydrated Potato Sheds
review: Slow to brown and not much potato taste.  Probably will not buy again. Good think they are low in salt.  I added NuSalt, scrambled egg and cheese.

title: great size for multitude of personal carry items
review: I made this into a small purse. Perfect for most of my daily carrying. I made a paracord cross body strap and used carbiner on each side to attach it. Then I was able to add on a smaller molle bag for days I wanted additional carrying capacity.

title: Great purchase
review: Bought specifically for car camping... 2 adults, a 3 yo and a 60lb dog. Would easily fit 4 adults shoulder to shoulder. Incredibly easy to set up and take down with one person. Sturdy and roomy! The 2 vestibules are super handy to have. Zippers were easy for my 3 yo to manage on her own. Like other reviews, I agree, the floor feels thin. I’d recommend a tarp or ground cover of some sort to extend floor life. The storage bag is nice. No complaints, we have really enjoyed it!

title: Bright
review: This light is bright and was easy to attach.  I like that it's waterproof because you never know.  Battery hasn't died yet, so that's a good life.

title: A little bit about way I love this trainer…
review:
After years of competing in triathlons and bike racing, I had my share of resistant trainers. Yet, this is one of the most rugged, stable, and smooth trainers I used. The thick tubing really helps with stability. My Serrota bike that I raced in the Tour De Toona and Olympic Time Trials fit firm and snug. Yes, I still use my old faithful bike that is no longer made. Yet, I’m glad they made this trainer! The motor and fly wheel are smooth and can create intense training level resistance. The ability to connect to the a large screen takes away some of the monotony of training indoors. Great for winter training or those real ugly days. The aluminum flywheel is easier on my tires too.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Four Stars
review: will be great for camping

title: Nice Practice Ball
review: I used this ball for recess during summer school.  The young kids enjoyed it and practiced kicking with it.  It was useful and several felt that it helped them with their kicking.  Difficult for me to assess though.  Still it was an enjoyable tool outside.

title: Thin, super soft beach cloth that repels sand; definitely not absorbent; carrier useless
review:
This beach "towel" comes rolled up in a carry case that is a little larger than a water bottle holder. This is made in China of 90% polyester and10% polyamide. It should not be washed in water above 30 degrees Celsius (86 degrees Fahrenheit) and should never be put in the dryer, ironed, dry cleaned, or bleached.

The material does not feel like the microfiber dusty clothes I have come to know which is fuzzy and catches a lot of lint. Instead, this towel is super soft and slinky and thin. It is also large as can be seen when I laid it across the foot of my king-sized bed. The material repels sand, which is great. However, this is not super absorbent in my opinion. I do not like drying myself with this at all. It does absorb water some but it does not feel right against the skin as a beach towel. I felt like I was drying myself with a slinky scarf.

Nevertheless, I love the design and functionality of this towel. Unfortunately, once the towel is removed from its carrier, the carrier becomes useless. I tried to put the towel back into its carrier after it was dry and it was impossible. Eventually, the carrier just ripped (see photo).

In summary, I consider this more of a thin beach cloth or mat than a towel. I love that it repels sand, feels great against the skin, is lightweight, and large. I love the idea of a carry case but the case is way too small that it becomes useless. I do love the elastic on the towel which allows me to keep it tightly rolled. However, I would never use this like a beach towel to dry myself off. It can, however, be used a little like a wrap on the lower half of the body or slightly over the shoulders. The current price of $20.89 ($21.99 minus 5%) is a little pricey for this. This gets 3.5 stars from me rounded up to 4 stars.

title: Just perfect
review: These earrings are perfect, just the right size to show off our college team spirit and yet not be ostentatious. Really easy to wear also.

title: Not great but good for the price
review: Flimsy product that offers very little grip. Good for the price but I would recommend spending slightly more and getting a better quality pair. It really did not give me the grip needed for lifting weights.

title: Great for Core Work!
review: My husband has been having back issues lately, so he has started doing exercises to strengthen his core. I found some exercises online that required a balance ball. He's 6'2" and weighs about 195 pounds. The ball easily supports him without any difficulties. The ball does require some assembly, but it does come with a hand pump to inflate it. It also comes with a separate stopper that has to be inserted. The resistance bands are nice. The set comes with some color photo illustrated exercises which I have hung up on the wall in our workout area for quick reference.

title: Board is good, anchors press into wrist when on jugs
review: The hangboard came with pretty much everything you need just had to buy a mounting board, only thing I dont like is that the anchors press into your wrists if you use the jugs for pull-ups, I'm thinking about bending the anchors or just taking them off since I dont use them regularly but I really like the different thickness slots

title: Bagh Boy M 330
review: My husband is a golfer & he walks the course 4 times a week. He loves the Bag Boy because it is made well & rolls easier than others he has had in the past.

title: Awesome for indoors fun too!
review:
This is a really cool take on bags. We live in northern Wisconsin, and it's awful cold here. We're stuck indoors most of October through the end of May (that's 8 months)! It's a long time to go without playing some of our favorite group party games!
Everyone we've introduced to this vertical version lights up when they see it; and always want to play immediately. And since it is actually fun too, they also ask where we got it, lol! It is absolutely great. I couldn't be happier with this find.

title: A LIFE SAVER
review: Would love to have this item sent to all of the victims who recently endured the visit of Hurricane Ian. Hint! Hint! This lantern is the answer to anyone having a problem with no electricity. Indoors or outdoors, it provides an enormous amount of light.

title: It's a little small for me you see.
review: [[VIDEOID:311ca30b43f85834c89e944c9df1d220]] Hotep friends. I like the fact that this traveling pot comes with disposable bags and can fit behind a seat in the car or truck. But I think it's a little too short. I wish it was a little bigger. I still recommend if this will fit you friend. Thank you. God bless you. May the rest of your life be the best of your life.  Baba Oran Z

title: A Mediocre Tool
review:
When you try to make a tool do everything you make a tool that does nothing really well. This is small and awkward to use. The hatchet blade extends out from the body LESS than my knuckles do when holding the handle. You have to be very aware of what you're chopping otherwise you're also punching what you want to chop. I had to get a separate tool to open the part of the handle with the several driver bits. Even with some oil and moving it back and forth it's impossible to open without something to pry it out with.
This comes with a holster, not a sheath, a holster and if a cop sees you walking around with this on your belt (and you're not in an open carry state) you're bound to have a few tense moments until you can show what it is. Because honestly, it looks like you've got a small pistol on your belt and in these troubled times that's a recipe for disaster.

title: Great buy
review: This mat is perfect. 2" thick, for those of us who have back/hip issues (I do), quite lightweight, folds up super easy. I have been able to return to exercises that require floor work now with this mat, which I was unable to do before. It's cushion-y without losing needed firmness. Perfecto mundo. SO happy I bought it. I think you will be too!

title: Good weights on a budget!
review:
[[VIDEOID:985857991d02b662b01b1f0d62576b03]] Here is 44 lbs of weights or they also come up to 66lbs. The weight feel durable enough for general use. A nice things is the weight is solid inside and you don’t feel any shifting sand. The long bar is nicely padded and feels better against the back neck for triceps workouts. The dumbbell handles could use some improvement for feel and comfort. Yet, I understand they need to be durable and not fall apart on the handles. The other things I wish they included was the weights to be marked in pounds too. Overall, I am pleased and this set and it will definitely help in my home workout routines.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Fits good if you like your hoodies tight on your neck....
review: Hood is too tight on my neck.

title: Three Stars
review: Great gloves, but definitely run smaller than I expected.

title: Solid performance & great value
review: I’ve had these before, lost them, went to diff company, and now came back. The ability to read greens better with these one is main reason I wear them. They do help in most cases, at dusk it may be less of a help, but otherwise I enjoy them. Now, if I’d quit losing them so often…Ha! 😀

title: Decent pad for camping
review: Certainly not the absolute best sleeping pad I’ve used but it is lightweight if you’re backpacking and relatively easy to inflate. Overall a good pickup if you’re in need.

title: Great ball, very bright
review: This is a very nice soccer ball. My daughter just started soccer and this is great for her. It is very bright. The colors would work for a boy or a girl. It feels durable and well made. It worked great. It lasted without a problem. She was able to use it in her games. I am pleased with this soccer ball.

title: Two Stars
review: Not so good. Not comfy and cheaply made.

title: Great solid piece; more expensive than other triceps bars on the market
review:
I'd like to focus more on my triceps and was interested to throw this into my mix of equipment. So far I like it, I can definitely feel my triceps doing more work just from the positioning of the handles on this bar. I also like that you can add Olympic size weights to it since I already have several of those.

This seems to be a well made piece of equipment, and I don't know much about the "synergee" brand but the price of this tricep bar is a lot more expensive than other triceps bars on the market and I'm not sure I see enough of a difference to justify that price difference. (Hence the minus one star)

title: bummer - started deflating after using it for only 5 nights
review:
We LOVED this bed. Super easy to inflate - not heavy - didn't take up much room when deflated - VERY comfortable.

Only problem it started to deflate/leak after 5 days of use. We filled again and by morning it would be down 30 percent.

We used it inside our new home on carpet so I know it wasn't abused.

Sadly we bought it in November but didn't use it until March and then it was too late to return. Lesson learned.

title: The games aren't easy to figure out
review: Why not include a plug?  The games aren't easy to figure out.  The scoring system isn't very accurate.  And I don't know if this is just this one or all soft tip dartboards, but the darts don't stick in well and break easily!

title: Nice basketball
review: I really like the grilp and feel of this ball. It’s almost like it sticks to me hands. Well made indoor ball.

title: Lifts Your Booty
review:
I have LOTS of workout leggings. This pair is a first for me. The construction creates a "bra" for your booty. It really lifts and makes the most of what you have. It kind of makes you want to back up into the mirror and admire the view. I'll admit that getting these leggings on isn't the easiest thing to do. It's kind of like getting into shapewear. The struggle is worth it. The wide waistband really stays in place and helps to suck you in. The color I chose is actually a vibrant coral pink. I love it! I sized up for comfort. If you're curvy, you may want to do the same. I highly recommend these leggings. For fit reference, I'm 5'6" and 153lbs. The large was a snug fit.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided makes your decision a little easier.

title: Orange E-Z to See if lost!
review: Great for emergencies! Orange E-Z to See if lost! Haven’t had an occasion to use it yet. Gave it to some friends in Chicago so they could have at least one in every car, after hearing story of people trapped in vehicles for hours. Obviously, you can’t keep engine running for that long. Fits in glove compartment easily.

title: Nice board
review:
My son loved this skateboard. We love the design.
We really like things to keep the kids active. I would much prefer them doing something than watching something. It is great because it is like a game for them but then they are being physically active.

The quality was good. It worked as it was supposed to. It wasn’t too hard to set up.

This is a great activity for a day when you don’t know what else to do or you want your child to burn off some energy. It is a good way to keep a child busy.

The children really liked it.

I feel like this is good for child development. It kept my children's interest. It would also make a nice gift.

I would recommend it.

title: Three Bean Chili Mac
review: Very little flavor, very sweet, still looking for the beans, mostly large flat noodles.

title: Lens slid out
review:
Within 20 minutes the lens popped out and when I tried to slide it back in, realized it slid out due to an improper fit.

Was light weight and sun protection was great for the few minutes I was able to wear….

title: Easy to use. It's not a good quality
review: Not good quality.  I don't think this is a good purchase.  I wouldn't buy again

title: Please send a reminder to me in several weeks and I will be glad to provide you with my feedback at that time
review:
Based upon the design, my expectations are that the cleats will perform very well.

Please send a reminder to me in several weeks and I will be glad to provide you with my feedback at that time.

Thank you.

title: I love these, I do wish they were a bit smaller around the wrist
review: I have small wrist and have to wrap the velcro completely around my wrist. It doesn't look right, but I use these while working out.  If the wrist section was a bit snugger, I would give these 5 starts. They fit comfortable, other than the wrist.

title: Not sized properly, or sewn correct
review:
I disliked the fact. They were not sized appropriately, and weren’t sewn correct.
Returned them

title: Not just for golfers!
review: I didn’t fully appreciate the strength of this umbrella until we had our famous Santa Ana winds - which, coupled with rain, hit you with wet, rainy gusts that practically knock you off your feet.  They turn a normal umbrella inside out and useless in one mighty gust!  Not this umbrella - this is the strongest umbrella I’ve ever owned - and yet it is lightweight, and folds up so small that it’s easy to take along anywhere.  I don’t play golf - so it’s not just for golfers!

title: Ok
review: Arrived with screws pulled out of the table had to drill new holes as the original ones were stripped. Not as sturdy as expected.

title: Great Device for Home Exercise
review: I bought this unit after some nasty health problems. I wasn't sure if I'd ever get back to the physical condition I was in before, but now I'm working to go beyond where I was. Having this unit in my home saves valuable time compared to going to a gym. The workouts are very effective. I don't think you can buy a better exercise device for the price.

title: SHAMEFUL. Shipping 3 ounce containers for 6 ounce price. Been doing this for years, hmm?!!
review:
If I would have received the amount that I paid for, I would give this 5 stars. BUT, I received 3 ounces, half the size that is shown. They show 6 OUNCES in the picture, AND the price per ounce reflects this too. But no, I got HALF THE SIZE. I would not have purchased this. I saw some OLD reviews saying this (recently and going back 5 years).. and same story. People spending their good money for a 6 ounce container and getting 3. COME ON. So SHAMEful. Fix it.

That being said, if you want to chance it, know that this is a decent product. Nice size flakes, works well in soups, casseroles, meat loaf. I've been trying it in some soups, rice, and mixing it into meatballs, meat loafs. I bought this primarily to make sure I have some shelf stable vegetables. I go through a lot of various veggies, and now adays items are low in availability (I'm not driving all over for groceries), look sad, or are too pricy. This just helps assure me that I still have my staples. I've been meaning to do my own hydrating for a few years now, but haven't taken the plunge. In the mean time, I stock up on what is commercially available. I like this brand, and may consider more but it can't be from Amazon.

Spinach is a favorite for amping up the healthy aspect of a meal. I really like these dehydrated flakes as it is still close to looking, tasting, feeling like spinach but just in very small pieces. Another option I use is powder form. I normally will get out one of my [[ASIN:B08FF4C5HX Healthy Journey spinach powder]] or [[ASIN:B097KRPDYP XPRS Nutra organic spinach powder]]

title: Doesn't stay on
review:
Good product for the money but it's larger than the actual display panel and since its silicone it doesn't stay on very well even with the included adhesive tape.
It fell off at some point during my ride the other day and I wasn't able to find it.
Still a good product but I wish it fit better.

title: False Advertising
review: This is advertised as one full quart, but by weight only weighs 14 ounces.  As far as I know, one quart equals 32 ounces.

title: Dad liked this
review: My dad liked this gift I got him.

title: Shipped wrong set
review: I ordered the set of three and was charged for the full set but only one item was shipped to me. Seems like a sturdy product otherwise.

title: Works but not for me
review: I needed some options for transporting drinking water for camping (I'm picky, and many containers taint the taste).  This one worked fine, and I liked that it collapses for easy storage, however, the spigot design has a flaw. There's no way to vent the container, so it just gets slower and slower until you stop, set it up and get more air inside.  Overall, I decided that was annoying enough that I sent it back and got two water bags by the same company--they were easier to fill and pour from, and they also collapse.

title: Gets Foggy
review: Although it claims to be fog-proof, it is not. After a week of use, it started fogging up and affecting my vision. Shortly after, it started to leak. It is good for recreational swimming, but I would advise against using it for a swim team.

title: UPDATED!  I LOVE THIS!  It Came Through Where Other Containers Have Not For Me!!!
review:
(THIS IS AN IN DEPTH REVIEW- If you prefer to have a brief summary, see section marked THE BOTTOM LINE)

UPDATE (June 22 2017)
I am putting my update first (usually I put it at the end) because I have developed a whole new love for this bottle. It came through where no other bottle I have would have come close to this performance.

MY SITUATION
I was embarking on a very specific liver/gallbladder cleanse which I needed to do badly. This involved six days of drinking two different solutions in addition to very specific eating plan. The first liquid mixture was raw apple cider vinegar in purified water, and the other was the same with the addition of liver supporting herbal extracts.

In order to do this, I had to drink from each liquid at various times during the day. That is fine if you are home, but I had to be on the road two different times during this period. In addition to that, the weather was brutal. The temperature was in the upper 90s and inside the car much hotter. I did not have a container that would house these things and keep them cold in the car.

PERFORMANCE IN EXTREME HEAT
Then I remembered this. I used this bottle and the sister bottle from the same company with the flip top lid to contain the raw apple cider and purified water mixture. I put in refrigerator cold liquid in the morning and by mid afternoon, even with half of the liquid gone- THE LIQUID WAS STILL REASONABLY COLD!

I came home and by the end of the day, what was left in the container, although not a lot was still COOL- despite being in a very hot car most of the day.

MORE ENTHUSIASTIC RATING THAN BEFORE
I have developed a whole new level of appreciation for this bottle. It is perfection for keeping things cold that I really can not transport any other way. If I could give this 10 stars I would.

BACK TO MY ORIGINAL REVIEW
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

I originally got this to transport my filtered water in the summer when I really want a cool drink of water on the go. I was not as interested in the hot capabilities, although it does work for that.

WHAT IS THIS CONTAINER LIKE?
This container is clearly a double walled bottle with a narrow neck of about 1 3/8 inches diameter. The bottle itself is about 2 5/8 inches in diameter at the bottom. The height is a little over 10 1/2 inches high with the lid on.

The container itself is clearly two walled. It has a cover on it which has a silicone plug that pushes in to seal it. The outside has a clear rim that goes on the outside of the opening when you push in the lid. When you want to make this transportable, you twist it to the left and it will lock it. If you want to open it, you twist it to the right. The directions are CLEARLY marked on the lid in case you forget. The bottle itself is lightweight and not too heavy when empty.

HOW DOES THIS BOTTLE PERFORM?
I really wanted this bottle to transport cold filtered water from home when I want to go somewhere and I want to have cold water on the go. I did not have a need for hot liquids as I have other thermos type devices for that. However, for both hot and cold liquids this does keep things temperature for several hours.

When used for cold, if I put cold water or ice inside, the ice is still there in a few hours and the liquid is ice. If I just put in cold water with no ice, it is still reasonably cool after a few hours depending on the heat outside. We have not had any hot weather yet, so those time marks will change as the seasons do.

For hot, if I put in very hot tea or coffee, it stays hot for several hours, although it has cooled a bit by the third hour. Again this depends on the outside temperature that it is kept at in the meanwhile. When kept in a warm area, the time is a bit longer. I prefer to drink this in a cup, however, not out of the container as with a coffee travel mug.

CLEANING
I do not really like to put coffee in this, as it leaves oils in which could be difficult to clean. The neck is so narrow that you will have to have a rounded brush to clean it on the inside. For hot water for tea it is great, or if I use a rounded brush, I could use it for coffee as an emergency measure. Soapy water rinsed around in it and then emptied out and then rinsed a lot usually will clean it, but anything with milk in it, be sure to give it special care.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Great for cold or hot beverages, this little bottle keeps things at temperature for a few hours. It is rugged, easy to transport, and does lock shut. As long as you have a bottle brush that will fit into this bottle, you can use this for all sorts of beverages. If not, stick to things without dairy or heavy on flavored oils. This fits nicely in the car beverage holder and is great to have. FIVE STARS for this. I really like it.

title: Flimsy compared to hard side plastic jugs
review: We carry water our vehicles at all times. You never know when you might come across a stray dog in need of a drink or end up broken down. I try to keep two one gallon jugs in the car, so this two gallon container is a bit of a space saver. It is a little flimsy compared to the hard side jugs, so I have be careful about where it rides in the car. I actually think I'll reserve this container for the rv or cabin and use my hard plastic jugs in the vehicles just because I don't want this to get punctured or torn.

title: Not for active workout
review: Good for stationary equipment but not for any type of workout with movement.  The interlocking pieces don’t stay together with movement. I ended up buying another mat for working out and putting my bike on top of this one.

title: This knife made my fisherman quite happy. :)
review: My husband loves to fly fish and he has told me for the past while that he needed a longer filet knife, so I snagged this when I saw it. HE LOVES IT!  He said it is built well and has a very sharp blade. He said the handle has some weight to it that makes holding it really easy. He was able to filet his first fish the other night and said it is his new favorite knife to take fishing. My husband highly recommends.

title: Pretty
review: Exactly the right size. Little wiggle room left

title: Good Fit!
review: My husband enjoys scuba diving. We've taken the family snorkeling before, but now my teenage daughter wants to get certified. Some equipment is fine to rent, but my husband thought she should own her own mask at the least. This diving mask easily fits both my daughter and my husband with a little adjustment. It creates a good seal around the face and does a good job of keeping the water out. And when water did get inside, it was easy to clear the mask by pressing at the top ridge of the mask at the forehead as it should. The sides of the mask are black, so you don't have peripheral vision when wearing these like you would with clear sides. It seems to be well made and comparable in quality to my husband's mask.

title: Missing pieces from packaging
review: Missing pieces from the packaging and therefore, not usable.

title: Large is too tight on medium size hands
review: The sizing is way off. These are almost useless. They are so tight that my hands start to tingle after 30 minutes. These are the only gloves that I have had this problem with. Cannot recommend due to sizing defects.

title: Bag is good. Handles not so much
review: The bag itself was great. Large and thick. The handles and clips on the other hand not so much. Not even 2 hours into our float trip and the clip fell off cause the sewing in the strap came loose.

title: Kid Will Wear It
review: It is a little ridiculous trying to get a kid to wear a helmet. Apparently “so you don’t bust your head open” isn’t a good enough reason. However, make the helmet a giant unicorn, suddenly it becomes wearable. So, if you’ve got a stubborn little one— maybe a magic unicorn helmet is enough to entice them to wear it.

title: Works as a watch/pedometer only
review: The app doesn’t connect with multiple attempts so it’s not able to track sleep and other health data without the app. Disappointed.

title: Great for terrible neighbors
review: Perfect for when my drunken neighbors have huge parties behind my house that go on until four in the morning. A few blasts of this air horn quiets them down for a little while.

title: Just Okay
review: The quality is not good as normal Champion line. It's too thin and not durable. My bf wears it only at home. Not recommended.

title: Overpriced for what it is. And too short.
review:
Edit: after using this for a couple weeks I have to say that it’s going back. The foam pad is inside of a slippery thin synthetic fabric cover. So it slides around on the (also slippery) sleeping pad and bunches up and gets twisted up all inside the sheet which makes the whole conglomeration much less comfortable than just sleeping on the plain old sleeping pad. Which is what I am back to doing. The fact that the sheet is shorter than advertised, which made my sleeping pad bunch up a little bit all on its own, did not help matters. Using it just as the sheet alone was ok, but I’m not paying $43 for a thin sheet.
——————original review——————-
For $43, this seems pretty overpriced. It’s also shorter than advertised. My sleeping pad is the exact dimension of length and width that this says it will accommodate, but it’s too short. And my pad is only an inch thick so there should have been fabric to spare. It does make it more comfortable, but it looks like crap with the pad being all wavy since it’s scrunched up inside the cover. I am unsure yet if it is $43 more comfortable.

title: It is really sharp. Good for cutting the head off of a fish
review: Nice quality knife.  Very happy with the bone collector. It fits in nicely with my fish supplies

title: Tends to lose air and bulge with extended use.
review: I know I am using this more frequently than expected but the coils do not stay and then there is a huge bulge. The company has disclaimers printed all over it concerning it softening and needing more air. I’m sure they are aware of the design flaw.

title: I'm a repeat customer, that's the best type of recommendation.
review: Good flavor, and handy.

title: They Laughed At Me When I Got This, BUT..
review:
When I first got this, it was with the intention that in the dead of winter, I would have a way to exercise gently and get my body to be in shape somewhat. My family laughed at me. They are not laughing now.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This came in a box with all of the legs tied back to the trampoline with elastic cords. Each leg is shock corded with metal shock cords, much like you find in a tent. That means that when you want to put it away, you won't be losing any legs.

HANDLE
The handle that comes with it is optional. You can use the trampoline with or without it. It is not hard to put together and it is good if you are hard with balance and need some stabilizing when first using the trampoline.

SPRINGS
The springs of this are very sturdy and well made. I was surprised at how nice they were. They easily held up to 250 lbs of everyone who tried it.

SURFACE
The surface is easy to use barefoot or with shoes on.

EDGES
The edges are protected so that if you wander in your bouncing that you won't hit the edges and plow through the springs as easily.

DOES IT HELP?
I have to say that despite the silliness of the sound, if you just gently bounce on this, it does take a lot out of you and it really does help keep in shape. I intend to use this regularly this winter.

PROBLEMS?
I had only one problem. When I put the legs into place, it is very hard to get them out once it has been used. I think I will put silicone spray on it or something in the future. I want to fold it flat, using the elastic ties that it comes with for easier storage when not in use.

THE BOTTOM LINE
A great exercise unit, this is sturdy, well made, and easy to use. It does fold flat for easier storage, but the frame is stable and strong.

MY RATING
I like this. It really works, feels good to use, and once I get the leg thing worked out, I am sure I will be loving this all winter.

title: Dont buy this product
review: Junk. Havent had it very long at all and all the plastic hardware  is already breaking. NoT a Happy customer. I feel awful. Bought one for a friend..so disappointed.

title: Five Stars
review: Great youth hat. Nice material and fits well.

title: Very nice little stove
review: I'm really enjoying using this stove.  It's been serving me well on backpacking trips.  It folds up nicely and they provide you with a mesh bag to keep it in.  I toss it in my backpack and barely notice it's there until I need it.  Be aware that it only comes with the EN417 valve so if you want to use a tank that has a different connection, you'll need an adapter.  I didn't realize it initially and was going to use Bernzomatic 1lb tanks.  Buying the adapter is simple enough though.  It's a very well built device and I'm happy with it's performance all around.

title: A1
review: Great quality. Love it!!

title: Best bargain for an unexpectedly great emergency light set!
review: I am thrilled with this purchase! Looked through so many choices for an emergency light and finally just settled on this one. Seems like a decent purchase for a decent price. So glad I did! This light had more versatility, incredible brightness, and usefulness than I could’ve imagined. Didn’t even realize it had two detachable flashlights included as part of the sleek unit until it came. The rechargeable battery also uses battery backup with three D’s in the main unit - have to buy them separately!  You’ll also need to buy three AAAs for each flashlight (no internal rechargeable batteries), so make sure you have plenty on hand in the event of extended power failures.

title: Broke first fall
review: My life factory bottles have held up, bought this one just to see and upon arrival I knew it wouldn't last, the rubber casing is so thin. Two weeks and done.

title: Not for Corksicle
review: This was advertised to fit on a Corksicle cup,  it does not.  I was able to use it on a different 16 oz tumbler but do not buy if looking to fit for Corksicle.

title: Battery sucks
review: I just wanted it for the steps turned all the other options off and I cant get the battery to last 24 hours. It said up to 5 days. So I was expecting at least 24 hours.

title: Nice, but large.
review: These are nicely made, but really only stay on your head if you have a good size head. I have a small or petite head, and these just fall right off. I know others commented that these fit, but they sure didn't fit me.

title: Four Stars
review: perfect

title: Doesn’t leak
review: Great insulated beverage container. Camelbaks are great at not leaking which is why I got this one. I keep it on the counter filled with water and then can take it along with me in my purse or backpack and not worry about it spilling. Keeps water cold all day. Easy to open/close. Easy to drink from. Good quality as well.

title: Too much eye suction!
review: I want to protect the eyes, but be able to see during/after swimming! This was horrible! The suction swallowed the eyes!! Returning immediately!

title: Brilliant Product!
review: I used this to scrub everything from the shower tiles to the toilet and was not displeased! It works really well. In fact, I need to get them out again and do some cleaning. These are especially good for shining rims on tires.

title: Nice Quality
review: This is a nice quality yoga mat. The suede surface is soft. There's some placement marks on it that I'm not sure what they are for, but seeing that I am new to yoga, I'm sure that I will figure them out one day. The mat comes with a carrying case. It's heavier than I was expecting and I don't see being able to comfortably carry it on my shoulders for anything more than a short walk. I was impressed that it lay flat first time out of the package and the ends were not rolling up at all.

title: Very Lightweight
review:
This tent is great for either single campers or for couples. It's very lightweight and fairly easy to assemble. The great part is that it won't start leaking or weeping during heavy downpours. The color is fun and bright. It definitely won't blend in to your surroundings. It's a good quality tent. I highly recommend it.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided makes your decision a little easier.

title: Not for plus sized gals
review:
I weighed about 250 when I got this saddle, now about 233. The saddle was great. I love flat saddles and this is one but then after a month of use, the middle started to sag, so it then felt like a saddle with a swoop. This then gave me pressure sores. I have actual notice this issue with the middle sinking down with most Terry saddles. I think they are made for ladies who weigh less.

Even when not on the saddle now, you can just put your hands on the middle and it just sinks down, like it is just cloth on plastic.

So this saddle is great if you weigh less than I did.

title: Horrible
review: These are horrible, boat them to clean my boat, literally fell a part first time using them

title: Super comfortable pack for walking, biking, or hiking; cavernous cargo space
review:
[[VIDEOID:4efefdd0a4252dd270b43bf5abf224e1]] I have three hydration packs (see list below). Of the two I tested so far, I love this one the best. Note that this pack also does not come with instructions and I found that none of them do.

1 - This one - [[ASIN:B07MR4GJL8 Thule (pronounced Toolie) Uptake Hydration Pack, 8L with 2.5L Hydrapak--about 85 fluid ounces]] - superb pack; 5 stars
2 - [[ASIN:B07GHR1RSQ Osprey Women's Salida 8 (about 85 ounces)]] - excellent pack; 4 stars
3 - [[ASIN:B07HJVD4GX CamelBak M.U.L.E. LR 15 100oz]] - I have not tested this one yet

After using this Thule, I absolutely love it even more than my Osprey. It is extremely well designed, comfortable, and stylish and has a cavernous interior for storage.

PROS
- There are several loops all over the pack including one on the bottom that can be used to affix a bike light, hang a helmet with a carbiner, etc.

- There's an outer zippered pocket to store small items such as a cell phone, Chapstick, tissues, etc.

- The main pocket has one mesh zippered pocket next to the hydration bladder that can be used for a cell phone or similarly sized items. There is a large storage area in front of that for a wallet, shirt, or other personal effects for the day.

- Behind the inner zippered pocket is the compartment for the hydration bladder.

- The hydration bladder is 2.5L or about 85 ounces. The pack has a tiny cloth loop that holds the bladder upright when full so that it does not sink to the bottom of the pack. All I had to do was unhook the bladder, slide off the clip, pull it apart like a Zip-lock bag, then fold over with the tracks facing outward, and slip on the clip to close. Note that it is possible to fold the bladder the wrong way. Make sure the fold has the tracks facing out on both sides. Once the bladder is closed, re-attach it to the cloth loop.

- The pack has adjustable waist and chest belts.

- The tubing to the reservoir has a magnetic track that keeps it in place along the chest area of the pack. This is absolutely wonderful even though the track and bite valve faces down and not up toward the mouth. Therefore, when biking, one has to grab the tubing to drink. There is also another loop and clip through which the tubing passes.

- The bite valve is removable for drying. It also has a locking mechanism to lock it so that water does not seep out.

- The pack has padding in the shoulder and lumbar region for extra comfort.

CONS
- This comes with zero instructions but since this is not my first pack, I had no trouble operating this pack.

- My major complaint is that the water coming out of the bladder tastes awful. It tastes like a new shower curtain smells. I was told that I could partially fill the bladder with water and squeeze lemon juice into it and then freeze it to get rid of the taste. I have not tried that yet. This is typical of ALL hydration bladders I tried, unfortunately.

Overall, I love the way this pack is engineered and how comfortable it is to use. Its simplicity is its biggest virtue along with the magnetic tubing track to keep the tubing in place. I used this once so far on a two-hour walk and I did not even know I was wearing this. The bite value is easily accessible but does face down. This means a biker would have to grab it and bring it toward the mouth to use. Drying the bladder between use requires that I stuff the bladder mouth with a silicone ramekin and hang it upside down for several days. It takes about three to four days to dry since this hydration bladder has two halves on the interior.

Video - My recorder is awful; I apologize for the blurriness. Please note that the hydration bladder is 2.5L and the 8L refers to the cargo space and not the reservoir.

Photo 1 is of the specifications.

Photos 2-5 is of the pack.

Photo 6 shows the bladder.

Photo 7 shows the bladder opening. Note that I inserted a Kiwi cutter into the mouth of the bladder to show where the opening is so I could take a picture. However, that green item DOES NOT come with this pack.

title: Good collectable
review: Was an Amazon warehouse item and box had a small crease, but was in good shape and worth the price.

title: Inside pouch is very cheap, but outside looks pretty
review: Initially looking at this, I thought the quality would be great and that this belt would hold up with working out. However, the pockets inside  the pouch layers already looked torn, and very cheap. The design of the pouch doesn't fit much and even though I wanted to like it a lot, I had to return it because it failed my running test. One good point to mention is that it is aesthetically appealing. However, I would not recommend this running belt to others.

title: Very High Quality Bench
review:
This is one of the most solid workout benches that I've ever used. I've been to gyms that didn't have equipment this good. It doesn't shake and it is rated for 1000 pounds, so there is no risk of overloading this bench.

Everything that is needed for assembly is included. All you have to do is screw various bolts into the frame and then slide on the tube with the foot rollers. Assembly only takes about 15 minutes, and the bench is still easy to handle even when fully assembled.

The rollers on the bottom make it easy to push this item around or slide it into a closet for storage. The pads feel good and it's very easy to adjust the bench. There are 8 workout positions including a decline position. There are also 3 seat positions. Overall, I'm very impressed with this bench. It is sturdy, easy to operate, and safe. This is a great choice for anyone who is looking for a home workout bench.

title: Boxed
review: I would live to tell you how it works, but I received it.... Opened it....Checked it out... And put it back in the box..... I was busy, TOO busy to exercise ...... Will update soon, I hope...(really, I will)

title: Not enough pieces to assemble!!!!
review: It’s hard to drive a car when you only get 3 tires !!!

title: Work great
review: These are nice rollerblades that work great, look nice and fit great. They are adjustable size wise which helps them get more use. Makes a nice gift.

title: As described
review: Work very well with glass bottles. Easy to hold

title: Buyer beware of sizing.
review: This hoodie material has no give. I had to order 3 different sizes, 3 separate orders to get one that fit correctly. Size DOES matter here!!

title: Not great.
review: So this horn is loud.  It is loud when you test it out in your house.  It is loud when you are on your bike and you test it outside.  But it is not loud enough for cars to hear.  I had near misses and the people in the cars didn't even flinch.  There was a couple that had their windows down and they acted like they heard it, but most people drive with their windows up and usually with a radio.  The windows up people did not hear it.  Even had my husband sit in our van with the windows up and I was just 3 feet away, pushed the button and he said he heard it but it wasn't really something he would acknowledge while driving.  Kind of like it was just a phone beeping or something similar.  Not that it was a cyclist trying to warn someone.

title: These are too big for me and the rubber is too sparse to provide cushioning when using
review:
I am having a lot of trouble with my hands after carpal tunnel surgery and one of many things I need to do is strengthen my hands and fingers. The occupational therapist has the standard Gripmaster exercisers. After purchasing all of them (1.5 pounds to 9 pounds) and using them, I decided to buy these for future use.

- [[ASIN:B000UMHUSI Gripmaster Pro Extra-Heavy Tension of 11 Pounds]]
- [[ASIN:B00KH3L7KC Gripmaster Pro Edition XX-Heavy Tension of 13-Pounds]]

Personally, I don't like the Pro Edition because it's too big and the rubber facing the hand is not cushioning enough. Also, the Pro Edition does not have the tension in pounds written on the label as do the standard ones I purchased. In addition, the rubber cap doesn’t come off to expose one full strip that can be pressed. Instead there’s only one button for each finger.

The standard Gripmaster (such as the five I purchased below) has a spring loaded button that can be pushed for each finger and the rubber handle can be removed to cover those buttons and expose one full strip that can be pressed on.

[[ASIN:B00HB7V6JY YELLOW Extra-Light Tension of 1.5 pounds]]
[[ASIN:B00HB7V6GC RED Light Tension of 3 pounds]]
[[ASIN:B00HB7V6KS GREEN Medium Tension of 5 pounds]]
[[ASIN:B00HB7V6JO BLUE Heavy Tension of 7 pounds]]

In summary, I do not like these because of its size and lack of cushioning.

PS I attached a link to my review of the regular Gripmaster into the comments section of this review.

title: Socks
review: These socks are thick and look exactly as the advertised picture. They fit as expected. They went up to my thigh, about 2-3 inches above the knee. The only problem I had with them was that the top was a little tight on my thigh and my thighs aren't big at at all (I'm 156 pounds). Other than that, I like them.

title: Nice design, but for me, one deal-breaker flaw ...
review:
I normally use a 32-oz bottle to have at my desk for afternoon water. I've tried several other "straw"-type bottle and never really found one that works all that well for me. After trying this one, I'm still looking for one.

Don't get me wrong -- it's a nice bottle, attractive design, holds enough, easy to transport, and definitely leak resistant. But drinking from it is a less-than-pleasant experience. Somewhere either in the straw connection or the way the "nipple" sits on the straw-holder opening, there's an air leak, so when you suck, you get not only liquid (yay!) but also air (uh-oh). It makes for a noisy experience and a lot of air swallowing. Not exactly a pleasant experience.

I've tried various ways of positioning the nipple -- the design of this, by the way, is really nice - it folds down with a lid that snaps over it. But I can't find any position that results in a tight seal with the straw opening. It's a pity -- because I really like the look of this.

I may have received a "dud," but at least one other reviewer referenced a similar problem. Meanwhile, I'll stick to my non-straw 32-oz bottle choices. Overall -- it's OK, not terrible, but not something I'll continue to use except in an emergency.

title: Did not come as pictured
review: Product was ordered, returned, and ordered again. It came held together by tape with a screw missing. This product did not come as pictured. Very disappointed.

title: Much easier to see your Hits
review: Works just like they say it will and you can see the hits much more easily.

title: Great bottle!
review: I love the color and it makes it easy to keep track of how much I drink each day.  It doesn't leak

title: This mat is comfortable and doesn't have a strange chemical odor I've read ...
review: New to getting into shape after bariatric surgery at the end of January 2016.  This mat is comfortable and doesn't have a strange chemical odor I've read that others do.  I highly recommend this mat.  It's comfortable, easy to keep clean, and store when not in use.

title: Sharp mug
review: The latte mug was very nice! Good quality and holds up well. I was very happy with the purchase and would recommend it other Wings fans.

title: Great-looking family game!
review: So far, we haven’t had the large family groups visiting this year, but when they come this summer, we’ll be ready with Rally and Roar Ring Toss!  Got it out and admired all the pieces - so nicely made - and love that it comes in a nice carrying case. Read the instructions and it looks like a great game for all ages - our youngest visitors are 9, so they should love it.  Most of all for us are games that bring the whole family together, which this does.  Good quality, nice presentation, easy instructions - we’re ready to play!

title: Perfect
review: Fits my autographed baseball perfectly

title: Good targets when they have them on sale
review: Easy to see your hits up to 50 feet. And much cheaper to buy them here vs the range

title: Thick seams, tight on knees
review: These are ok. Not as good as other pairs from different brands though. The fit is strange for me. These fit in the waist and hips, but are tight around the knees. I do not have fat or oversized knees. The seams along the leg are very noticeable - I feel them with every movement.

title: My third one…
review: I got tired of swapping between my bikes, so I bought a second one.  If you want to be seen, this is what you want.  I use different flash patterns and brightness depending on the time of day.  A cop pulled up along side me at a traffic light and asked the brand and model of my tail light.  He was amazed at the brightness during the mid-day sun.  I definitely recommend it.

title: Broke the first time I used it
review: This item broke the very first time I used it on a fishing trip. The tip you suck on at the end clearly malfunction down the entire product didn’t work which was horrible because I was out on the river and needed the water

title: busted
review: I didn't find out until months later, but apparently this burst one of the first times the kids hit it although they aren't too big or strong for. I was quite disappointed to hear that. Had I known I would have returned it for a refund and gotten them something else.

title: Not great quality
review: I bought a couple pairs of these for boxing. After using and washing them a couple times I definitely noticed a difference. The quality was not as good as when I first got them.

title: tire levers very fragile glued dried in tube after few uses
review:
tire levers very fragile glued dried in tube after few uses
when it did work it worked great need to buy more glue have patches no glue

title: Only kept my tea hot for about 3 hours; top design is interesting
review:
I am a bit disappointed in this tumbler because I expected it to keep my tea hot for 8 hours. The Amazon site says it keeps drinks cold for 24+ hours or hot for 8 hours" but it only kept my tea hot for about 3 hours and that is with the top FULLY CLOSED. After 8 hours it was almost as cold as if it had been in the refrigerator. Below are my likes and dislikes about this thermos.

LIKES
- The silicone bottom keeps this from sliding and enables it to stand securely in place.

- The silicone center makes it easy to hold for drinking because my hands do not slip off the sides.

- The top has both an open and close indicator on the rim and a directional arrow to show which way the top should be turned. Turning it further beyond the close will remove the top.

- I love the deep blue color.

- It does come with a limited lifetime warranty but I doubt it is financially sensible to use since one has to mail it back.

DISLIKES
- The contents do not stay hot for longer than 3 hours.

- I am unsure if the plastic holes in the two arms on the top and the arms itself will bend and wear out over time. If those arms break that keep the top in its track, then this tumbler will become useless as a tumbler. It will then become a cup. I think these plastic arms are its breaking point.

In summary, this is a decent tumbler if one will be drinking their hot contents within about 3 hours. Any longer than 3 hours causes the contents to cool and become lukewarm to cold EVEN if the top is fully sealed--which mine was. I do feel the top design is interesting but the plastic arms of the locking mechanism are its breaking point. I am personally disappointed in this. I ordered this for hot beverages and not cold and this does not serve my purpose fully. I suspect this will be better as a cold liquid tumbler but is not great for keeping contents hot for the time specified.

title: Eight-Inch Loops Are Too Short for Adult Use
review:
This THERABAND RESISTANCE BAND LOOP SET (Pack of Four 8-Inch Loops) consists of four short (8”) elastic bands that provide four different levels of resistance for use in rehabilitation or workout exercises. Yellow requires the least amount of strength for expansion; blue, the most.

The resistance in these bands seems to be the same as the resistance you get when you purchase lengths of yellow, red, green, and blue therapeutic elastic in a medical supply store. It’s nice to have a set of the different-colored bands, because you are expected to move from lower to higher resistance as your strength improves with regular exercise.

While it’s convenient to purchase the elastic in loops--so you don’t have to knot the material to use it--you do need bands that are the right length for you. These bands are only 8” long when laid flat (there is a total of 16” of material). Thus they are far too short for adult use, and I wonder whether they are long enough for use by any but very small children.

The bands arrive wrapped around a brochure that has excellent explanations and photos of various exercises that can be done with resistance bands. Mysteriously, the brochure shows adults performing the exercises--and as previously noted, these bands are too short for adult use.

title: Only 1 remote works. Tried changing the battery and ...
review: Only 1 remote works.  Tried changing the battery and still nothing.

title: Great handlebar bag!
review:
This thing is perfect. I was worried that it might not work for me because I have unusual handlebars - the bar is very wide (diameter) but it's also narrow (width). This fit perfectly even though one of the Velcro straps passes over cables. It feels secure with the three straps.

It holds my phone and some other items (wallet, keys) and the plastic front let's me use the phone while it's safe in the bag. It appears to be very high quality and I think it will hold up over time. I bought this do I could follow directions on my phone while I bike.

title: Four Stars
review: Nice item. Keeps everything in place and not swinging around

title: Nice wristbands
review: These were very nice wristbands. They looked just like the picture. The quality was good. It is an easy way to show your team spirit. They felt well made and durable. I like that you can easily wash them. They were comfortable to wear and fit easily. They are stretchy. They were absorbent. I'd recommend them.

title: Five Stars
review: little long made well

title: Disappointed....
review: I ordered the correct size that I normally wear, however, I cannot get my shoe into this Shoe Cover.  MUCH too small.

title: QD sling stud with ring release
review: Bought for attaching a carry strap to an Arca style lens plate.(Nikkor 200-500mm) The lens tripod foot is designed by Hejnar Photo to upgrade original Nikon foot to be No twist.  WORKS 100%.  Tight fit.. no issues risking my Nikon body and this super heavy lens. CON: have to remove swivel to detach from plate and put on Tripod...Takes too long due to the lack of button for QR..  will end up using with sling swivel on something else

title: I was looking for a compression leggings.  Not at all.
review: I did not like it.  I was looking for a compression capris leggings, it is feels like any other leggings.

title: Useful for random items in the truck or at the barn
review: I am using this little box in my truck to hold odds and ends for travel needs. It opens from both sides which can be a mess if you're not careful. The inside sections are roomier than expected. I have Tic-tacs, Chapstick, a little thing of Tylenol, Benadryl and some zip ties in my box. It fits perfectly in the F150 center console.

title: Fake news!@!
review:
Okay, the rag was demonstrated on YouTube when I got taken.
Here is the two issues I have.
The "that purple" thing is matched up with this cloth. The cloth is expensive so you would think it have more material to absorb the cleaner. The thing is so
think that when you put some cleaner on it, it never drys. So you have this wet cloth in your bowling bag.
My send problem with this cloth,
takes a long time for the cleaner and this cloth, to penetrate the ball. Meaning , your ball is wet. You know what type of ball this combination works well with, urethane. Although, your ball is just so wet, it absorbs well in the urethane and takes the oil right off.

title: No Instructions
review: I need these on every pair of shoes and boots on the farm here. I had an ancient pair of Yak Trax that just bit the dust and thought I would take a  chance on these.  There are no instructions in the box, so I wasn't sure how they would go on. It isn't obvious other than front and back.  Once I figured it out  I got them on but they are truly large sized and way too bog for my shoes . Because of this I  wasn't able to walk around in them.  The way they are made I think you will have to be careful about getting the spikes going flat or you will puncture your foot.

title: What's that smell?
review:
Out of eight (8) different cantilever mounts from six manufacturers, this one fit my Ruger PC Carabine the best with the EAGLE 1-8X24 optic. The two posts fit very closely to the turrets center of the scope which provides for a very stable configuration - the center strength matches the center weight of the scope. The three points of tightening are perfect to make sure the whole thing stays on the rail with 0 motion. The weight of this scope was about 163 grams - third best in the pack. The height is about 61mm - no cowitnessing, but that's expected on this carabine. The skeletonized frame holes kinda match the MLok holes of the forend, so it's aesthetically pleasing as well.

BUT. WHAT IS THAT SMELL?! The unit has a very strong chemical smell from the manufacturing process. Not for nothin, but I doused it in alcohol - had a mind of allumahyde painting it, but decided against.

Sans the initial smell, this is a very well worthed canteliver scope mount - it might even be good on higher power applications (but I can only speak of this 9mm situation - great)

title: 2X Fail
review:
I'm giving up, especially since the Amazon warranty was only good for 1 month.

My first one wouldn't even light. But Amazon quickly sent me a replacement...which never really worked.

My second one never truly had a flame. First off, the "torch" was about 1/4-1/2" high for me, never taller. I could barely light a candle with it at its strongest! Today, after using it maybe once or twice a week for 2 months, it just gave up. I'm using quality fuel and I've made adjustments with the meager 1/8" high flame (no longer even a torch) and adjusting the screw doesn't even make any changes to the flame output.

This is a complete dud. 2 lighters didn't even do what they were described to do, and neither made it to 3 months. I'll keep looking.

title: standing water - no drain
review: I really just wanted a couple of camp chairs similar to the very old ones that are finally worn out after at least 10 years of frequent use. The problem with this chair is the "cooler" which doesn't have a way to drain. This completely negates the quick fold up and pack away option I want in a camp chair. I found having a netted cup holder on each arm to be a much more useful feature. If you've used the cooler and it is wet you really don't want to leave it closed or the chair folded for long. If you put something in the cooler - like a can - then you can't really fold and pack the chair to carry it - so... you pack the real cooler....

I got this for my 10 year old daughter and it fits her perfectly. The helmet is appropriate for rollerblading, bicycling, or any other physical activity you can think of. It's very lightweight so your child can wear it without experiencing any neck or shoulder fatigue. The outer shell is made of hard plastic that can hold up to an extreme impact.

The inside label says that the sizing is 52-56 centimeters. It has a comfortable, fully adjustable chin strap. There are also sweat bands on the top and around the rim. I like that the back of the helmet extends down to cover the back of the head. This is a good product that will ensure your children stay safe when playing outside.

title: For an adult- NO. For a child-YES.
review: I was extremely disappointed when I received the Kohree Folding Stool/Portable Camping Stool (for Fishing, Hiking, Gardening & Beach). My husband and teenaged son love FISHING. They are also very serious about the sport and are constantly looking for ways to make their hobby more enjoyable, easier. So when offered this stool, I jumped on it. I thought from the description that was given that it would be perfect. However, it was tiny. Way too small to be of any real use.  My seventeen-year-old son is 6’3 and 160lbs. Unfortunately, it is too low to the ground for him to attempt to sit comfortably in.  My husband is 6’, 220lbs and said that he would only rest his feet on it, while he sits in a regular sized chair. Again, the complaint was that it was too short to comfortably sit on. So, I thought that I would try. I am average sized, about 5’4 (and I’m not telling my weight) and even I found it to be uncomfortable. Number one, at my age, anything that taxes my knees isn’t worth it. If you are average to tall, your legs will not be comfortable (for long periods of time) in a squat position or straight out. Remember fishing takes time and patience, so I can’t imagine sitting on this for more than 5 minutes. And because there is no back to it, there is also no support. With all that being said, I do have a few positive things to say about this stool. (1) I do think you could place a tackle box on top of it. (2) If you have a child under 2, but no older than 4, they would love this chair. They could sit comfortably in it and enjoy helping in the garden, playing on the beach and fishing. (3) I do like this chair comes with a cute little drawstring carry bag with a strap. And (4) this chair is light and easy to carry. Overall, I do think that this is a cute concept, but I don’t think it should be marketed as an adult stool. It isn’t even big enough for a pre-teen.

title: Nice quality.
review:
I ordered the 'EMSWD 2019 Upgrade Handlebar Extension Knee Bar for Segway miniPRO/miniLITE/ninebot minipro/2019 Segway-Ninebot Ninebot S.' for review but unfortunately it did not fit my Segway Ninebot S Plus so I will base my review off of the quality and construction of the bar itself and the included mobile mount.

I was pretty excited to try this Extension bar for my Ninebot S Plus however I was not able to fully install because I have the Plus version, and I was not able to get this kit to work with it. The Plus has a really nice knee bar that also has a light. After some trial and error I finally decided that I would just base this review purely on the quality and construction of the Handlebar which is a pretty decent quality. The handlebars have a nice padded grip and everything to do with the kit was super easy to assemble. This kit also comes with a mounting kit for your mobile phone which actually is pretty nice on it's own. I may use this on my mountain bike as it is much better than the current mounting kit I am using haha. It is not based on springs to hold your mobile in place. It actually tightens down via a screw mechanism which you can then lock into place. if there were to be any issue or concern with this kit, it would be the fact that the hardware used to tighten the two pieces together are plastic. These are just the clamping brackets and personally when I assembled the kit, there were no issues with the said clamping brackets. They fit very snug and clamped shut and secure, so unless you were to take the kit apart and put it together many times over, there shouldn't be an issue at all. Overall, I think this is a nice quality kit and I wish that I would have paid more attention to the description before ordering as this would have maybe been a way to get my wife to ride our Ninebot S Plus haha.

title: Good for Recreational Swimming
review: As a competitive swimmer, I struggled to get my long hair into regular swim caps, but this product was so much easier. The material is slightly stretchier than other caps, allowing for easy use. However, the cap often slips off and this is quite a problem when swimming quickly. It also breaks after a few months of use. Overall, this is a great product for recreational swimming, not competitive swimming.

As I was born in Seattle, raised in the Greater Seattle area, as well as still living here, I have been around for the start of the Seahawks, Mariners, Sounders, and now the Kraken franchises. So I am happy to have this piece on display.

title: Fit comfortable, not for light dirt bike riding etc. Light sports only.
review:
These aren’t the typical knee pads, they are more just another type of protection.
I was expecting these knee pads to be used for Snowmobiling, light dirt bike riding, But there Not.
They aren’t proper gear for extreme sports. I would say more for a knee support like an ace bandage but 10 times more!
This type of Knee Pads are to protect your knees for some types of light sports.

They slip on nicely and feel comfortable .
Almost like a jelly silicone texture in the middle of them so it can form to your knees while in use.
I would Not use these for working on floors etc.

My adult daughter wore these and she has thin legs, and they fit good, did not slide down.
I think there over priced for what they are, as I expected these would work for light dirt bike riding, and snowmobiling in the mountains.
If she hit a small rock, her knees would be ruined wearing this!

title: Very convenient
review: I use it all the time!

title: Feels commercial Grade with Every Functions Needed…
review:
As an exercise enthusiast this bike delivers.

Sturdy commercial steel frame with real rubber level adjustability.
Magnetic control so use know your actual resistant level.
Sliding seat accommodates any size. My daughter is 5’6 and my son is 6’2 and they both fit comfortably.
Every necessary read out including my fav: rpm (revolutions per minute) so I can train within my goals.

The display is even kind of in color. And everything is easy to ready and arranged nicely.

Final thoughts: a home gym equipment makes senses for me with rising gas prices and so many viruses. I can still keep healthy and this bike keeps me motivate with it’s smooth resistance and gym quality feel.

Assembly was pretty easy. It comes almost fully assembled. Just have someone ready to help you carry it inside it is very heavy. Heavy is better for stability and quality.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)
