review:
These are some of the best yoga pants I've ever worn. Quality-wise, the fabric is heavier than most pants and since they are not a man made material, they do not have any sheen to them. They feel better against my skin than polyester. All the stitching is strong and even. Design-wise this pair of pants is ultra flattering. In fact, I've never seen a pair look like this ever. The 2 tone asymmetrical design is current and fun. Philosophy-wise, this brand is in line with current thoughts of sustainability. All organic, no pesticides.
High quality, and you can tell when you wear them.
I am 5'3". This size fits me appropriately.

title: Too expensive for what they are
review: I'm a longtime user of Doc's proplugs and decided to give these a shot to see if I really could hear better (my surf buddies always complain that I have to ask them to repeat what they just said when I'm wearing the proplugs). Anyway, I could hear better out of my right ear, but despite trying all of the sizes, I could never get the left ones to fit right, and the sound was always muddled like it is with the proplugs. Couple that with the fact that the right one came out while surfing the other day and was lost to the ocean after maybe a dozen sessions, and I really just don't think they seem worth the price. I'll probably try the knockoffs of these next (~$12 on Amazon) or go back to proplugs.

Also, getting the tent packed back into the bag proved a huge hassle and the bag ripped with very little pressure.  Don't forget to let it air dry first or you will have a mildewed mess the next time you try and use it.

title: Get one now
review:
The hammy band is the unsung hero! This seemed to hit the market with a bellyflop in that it made a loud smack but that was about it. This product has gone under the radar but has been highly effective.

I have had radiating hip pain that has traveled down my leg. I've tried using different modalities to loosen the area and buy space for additional ROM that is pain free or nearly pain free. The hammy band has definitely helped in that regard because it provides that additional tension on the troubled area WHILE being in motion. This has allowed the muscle to free up and the nerve to move properly as well (less tingly pain lately).

I do use this for every leg session and have been able to return to light squatting after 3 years of problems coupled with "solutions" that always failed after weeks of consistent practice.

Hammy Band ftw

title: This thing is TINY!
review:
I love the compact size of this, it can be easily stowed away in your camping bag without taking up precious space or weight. I also really like that it takes the same charging plug as my phone and my laptop (hurray for standards!).
I actually found that it did not have as strong of an airflow as my larger pumps. To be fair, they have larger motors and fan blades so that is to be expected. But plan for it to take longer to fill your air mattresses and boats than usual. We have an intex boat that takes a while to pump up normally, and it was noticeably longer now. BUT, I also tried it on an inflatable paddle board and it was really convenient to keep it in the backpack with the board. So, overall a useful product as long as you understand the limitations.

title: Osprey Rook 50 is the Deluxe Backpack I was Looking for
review:
If there is one thing I want to do more of this year, it’s hiking. Whether it’s a short hike in a nearby park or a longer hike lasting multiple hours in an open wilderness, I want to get outdoors more than in the past. For this reason, I now have an assortment of backpacks and the latest addition to my arsenal is Osprey Rook 50 Backpacking Pack.

I needed a larger backpack, capable of holding more items and with more versatility. My other backpacks are generally simplistic in design and not made to handle much more than what you would need for about three or four hours. Osprey Rook 50 Backpacking Pack was the larger addition I was looking for. It has a more rigid design with a solid backing and multiple compartments, including one that can hold a sleeping bag. The mesh side pockets and hip belt pockets provide the space you need for a serious hike. And there are multiple pockets overall, perfect for organizing the different extras necessary for a serious expedition.

As for comfort, this one scores good marks. I wasn’t so sure the first time I tried it on for size. I had trouble removing it, but that is because, well, I’m not as flexible as I once was and I didn’t adjust the straps first. That made putting I on easy, but taking it off was a different matter. Once I realized my mistake and adjusted the straps as needed, I didn’t have any trouble at all. I admit, this backpack does feel different from my other backpacks, most of which are not rigid in construction and are more or less collapsible. This Osprey Backpack feels different, but this is to be expected, since it is capable of so much more than others.

This backpack is lightweight for its size. I like the ventilated mesh backing- it’s a trampoline style mesh and it helps with airflow, which is good when you live in a hot climate like mine and need any assistance you can get to stay cool. It has a rain cover, too, and multiple ways to adjust the straps for the perfect fit.

Hiking is slowing turning into a regular occurrence for me. I have joined a few groups that do regular day hikes across the city, as well as longer hikes on weekend. I liked having an assortment of backpacks and the Osprey Rook 50 Backpacking Pack is a most excellent addition to my collection. I can’t wait to put it to further use this spring when I take longer, more strenuous hikes through central and west Texas.

title: Too small to try on
review: I bought these for my teenage daughter who wears a size small (pretty consistently) in all women's clothing right now. Unfortunately these are not a size small in my opinion. More like a child size 10 or size 12. I know they're meant to be tight, but holy cow these are to small to even try on. The fabric is nice, but I won't be able to comment any further on how well these wash or wear. Had to donated them to charity.

title: Great quality, but...
review: The trampoline is sturdy and durable, but way too stiff to bounce, even with some of the bungees taken off. I got this so working out would be fun, not feel like a workout, and be low impact, but trying to bounce on this is exhausting, takes your breath away instantly, and makes your joints hurt. If anyone has suggestions on how to loosen this up so I'm not putting in so much work to bounce, I'd love to know.

title: Gym Quality that Energizes & Motivates…
review:
[[VIDEOID:d92ac00be5c61fffb7b0987e8696a45f]] Impressive gym quality bar. Easy diamond grip pattern. Love the black on chrome look too. Smooth spinning ends with bushings and bearings. Brings my lifting to life.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Nice colors….easy to change out!
review: Great muted rose gold, gold and silver. Very easy to change out on my Fitbit. Comfortable. Yet to see how well they hold up

title: Lights not that bright or consistent
review: This item came assembled and only thing you have to do to get it ready for use is pull the handles up. The item seems sturdy. The base (where you put your feet at) is not textured like most scooters, which usually helps with grip. There are two wheels in the front which should promote balance, but the item seems to slightly lean to one side when one foot is on it. It also seems like you have to put a lot of pressure on it for the lights to activate. They work fine if you just spin them, but they barely turn on when my 45 pound, 4 year old rides it. However, when I tried, they worked better. This scooter does ride smoothly as well and is the perfect height for toddlers.

title: coleman 62 quart xtreme cooler
review: Bought this cooler because we were going to travel and needed drinks and food kept cold for awhile, the product said 5 days, we refrigerated everything before we put everything in the cooler and put ice on top, put in in our air conditioned jeep and 8 hours later ice had melted. It didn't even make it a day traveling to where we were going. DON"T BUY, you will be very disappointed!!!!!!!!!!!

title: A nice one but not there best, I liked the skillet breakfast much better
review:
Mountain house is the best emergency survival, camping food in my mind. I love biscuits and gravy, normally. This one disappointed me. The biscuits were rubbery but edible. The breakfast skillet was much much better in my mind. This is still good but just not as good as others that Mountain House makes.

The shelf life is off the hook, long. The package is light and easy to pack. It is easy to make.

When we go camping, I will order more Mountain House but probably not this one.

PS I just remembered, the sausage bits were very hard. I know this company can do better.

title: Good games, not the best build quality
review:
These games are fun, especially as we are hitting winter in the northeast and need to find more ways to spend time playing indoors. The build quality leaves a bit to be desired, however. The soccer ball actually broke the first time we tried pumping it up, it won't hold any air anymore. We replaced it with another ball we happen to have in our playroom, but I was disappointed.
The goals are somewhat more difficult than I expected to assemble as well. All in all, the games are fun, but I wish the set were made a little bit better and easier. Maybe someone else will have a better experience than we did.

title: Ok
review: Nice vest. Very thin. It ripped the 2nd day hey wore it.

title: Bright
review:
This is a nice lantern. It worked just fine. We didn't have any problems. It is good for home and emergency use as well as for use when camping or outdoors. I like that it is so strong. It seemed to be of high quality. It felt well made. I would recommend it.

We live in an area that gets hurricanes so we need things like this. I like that it had so many features.

title: Good Product
review: Looks just like the picture

title: Like a glovvvaaaa
review: Fits like a glove - absolutely spot on increases the tactiliy of the dials and allows for ultra fine adjustments.

title: Very sturdy and easy to
review: Sent to to my daughter for the kiddos and school, she loves them.  Very sturdy and easy to clean

title: Two Stars

title: Easy to inflate, put away, decently comfortable!
review:
This air camping pad comes in an easy to carry around little baggy. The pad claims to inflate in only 12-15 breaths. Which is true! Granted they were very deep breaths but the pad did inflate very quickly and easily.

The pad itself is a good size. Definitely long enough for a large adult, and slim enough to fit in most sleeping bags. The pad isn't very thick, when I sat in it I could definitely feel the ground but when laying down and your weight is evenly distributed across it, it does provide a decent amount of padding. It's not the thickest, but it's definitely a nice added layer.

Id say the best parts about the product are it's ease of use and transportability. I haven't used it many times so I can't speak of its durability yet!

title: Needs more labels and instructions.
review:
This First Aid and Survival Kit is nice. It is packed full of things you might need on a hike. The compass does not work right. I know where the sun rises and this compass is pointing in the wrong direction. It would be helpful for me to have an instruction paper on some of the items. I had to watch videos to find out what one of the things is used for.

The kit comes with a multi-use tool and sheath, my favorite. It comes with a compass that doesn't work correctly, a whistle, a tool to saw wood (watched to video for this), a tool to start a fire (also watched a video), and a plastic piece with instructions for mouth-to-mouth resuscitation. The kit also included cotton swabs, bandages, an emergency blanket, and a plastic bag with bandaids, prep pads, gloves, and more. This all comes in a camo zippered pack.

I will be recommending this First Aid and Survival Kit to family and friends. I will let them know that the compass in my pack did not work.

title: Will not unlock
review: The first time I locked my motorcycle this lock would not unlock. We tried with all 3 keys for almost 2 hours. I have never been this bad about anything like this. It unlocked at home the day before over and over again and the first time I used it I had to get a wrecker company to cut it off for me. I will never buy anything from this company if they don't make this right with me but they have not so far.

title: Good buy but order a size bigger than yours!

title: Great gift for avid hikers
review: My parents love hiking, they love going to national parks and staying there for a week. So I really wanted to get them something practical for Christmas. My mom has an old ankle injury that acts up so they need a break every couple of hours and this blanket works great, its waterproof so they don't get their clothes wet if the ground is wet, the stakes keep it from blowing away, and perhaps most importantly it weights almost nothing, folds up super small, so its super easy for them to carry in their camelback without even noticing the weight.

title: We got a lemon, it has a tear in ...
review: We got a lemon, it has a tear in the fabric and it is extremely hard to open and close.  That being said, there are other flaws in this design.  It's top heavy, so I can't hang bags on the back.  It folds to be almost the same size it was before so it can't fit in my van unless I remove the third row of seats.  And the storage compartment is very small.  All of these are drawbacks to the stroller functionality, not the bike attachment or jogging stroller if you plan on keeping it in a garage and using it around your neighborhood.

title: Best Paddle Leash!
review: I have looked at several different paddle leashes & none have been as good as this one. First of all, the brass clip is a huge plus. Most of the others that I looked at had plastic clips which are easily broken.  The coil design allows for ultimate flex. The leash unbuckles for a quick release if needed. All of the stitching appears to be strong. I tugged quite hard at all of the connecting "joints" and there were no rips, tears, or any reason at all to believe that it would not hold up to regular use. I'm not sure when I'll be able to test it out, but I will update my review if it does not perform as well as I expect.

The box is nice dark gold, attractive, but then, the paint doesn't drive the car...

Overall, UNDERWHELMED.. And btw, this thing is 'uuuuuuuuge. It's like putting half an english house cucumber on your firearm. At thsi price point there are other units that are almost half the size, and do the same thing, sans the QD.

title: Fine Rod/Reel Combo
review:
I have for years loved fishing and I still have my original fishing reel, a vintage Zebco 33 that still works and I still use on occasion. I have been through countless rods, though. I selected this combo set with my son in mind who prefers the spincasting design of reels, and so far he and I are both pleased with this combo. It seems to be made well and it is well suited for most freshwater fishing.

The reel is an updated Zebco 33, a step forward from my old vintage model in terms of smoothness and operation, though the functionality is basically the same. Push the button to release line for casting, and start reeling to retrieve. It has a solid anti-reverse (though not a zero-reverse clutch). And, the drag is set via a thumb wheel that is easy to turn. This reel has two advantages over its older sibling: it has a nice, large handle so the retrieve is a lot faster, and the handle is reversible so it can be used by anyone and not just right-handers like me.

The rod is a nice, medium-action rod that will hold up well to decent-sized fighting fish. It assembles easily and the eyes are all-metal.

Casting is smooth and easy with this combo. The reel itself is a smooth operator and so far I have had no hang-ups with the cast. The rod does well in casting too, and even though the eyes are very simple the line glides easily through and we have seen no issues with the line catching or being slowed down through the rod’s eyes.

So far, we have no complaints with this combo and we’re already looking forward to more time on the lake with it. It’s a thoughtful combo rod and reel and it works smoothly. It is well-suited for most freshwater applications and with some basic maintenance should last for years.

title: Professional? Not Quite.
review:
I like bocce and I was thrilled to have the opportunity to review this set. I was particularly interested in this set because it is marketed as a “professional” set. As a casual bocce set this is great, but as a professional set it’s out of specifications, by more than a little. Since it is priced as a professional set, it misses the mark, though it is fine for casual and family play.

I decided to do a little digging to see what would designate a bocce set as a “professional” set. According to the Bocce Standards Association (yes, seriously), each ball should be a specific size and weight. Of interest is the weight range: 920g +/- 10g (2 lbs.). That’s a tight range of weights, though for sporting equipment used in professional or tournament play that’s not unusual. I measured all 8 balls on a calibrated scale, set to measure in grams. The lightest ball in my set is 947g, and the heaviest is 1026g (2.25 lbs.). Every single ball is outside of the range. I could see being a little outside of the range, but over 100g is way off. Since the spread between the highest and lowest in my set is about 80g, and the specifications allow for a 20g spread between the extremes, this is not a scale problem. Most players wouldn’t even notice, but that’s not the point.

As a casual set, this is a fine bocce set and should last for years. The balls are solid and made of some form of resin, are consistent in appearance and though do get surface scratches during play and transport (very normal), they’re rugged and should not break, crack or chip unless abused or purposely damaged. The set comes in a nylon carry bag and includes a rule book.

This is a nice casual set, not a professional set. The balls are out of spec which makes it unsuitable for true tournament play. And as a casual set, it’s a bit expensive.

review:

I originally got it for my plantar fasciitis on my foot but it is too wide for that at about 19" in circumference. The one I ordered is 12 inches tall and is sufficient for rolling along one thigh or calf at a time or my back.

This is very light. It feels like a solid Styrofoam cup in the shape of a roller. I think the price of $12.99 is a bit expensive for this. Nevertheless it works somewhat well to stretch out my muscles and is somewhat soothing. On the other hand, I totally dislike the sticker that is affixed to the roller because it takes some effort to remove and peels off a few foam particles with it. I also wish there was some sort of exercise sheet that came with it.

About a week later, the other rod arrived. Instead of an ultralight, it was another medium. I lightly scratched the reel mount trying to get the zip ties off, so I'm not going to bother returning it. Still, it's pretty annoying to receive the wrong product.

review: GREAT COLORS. I didn't read the sizes carefully... and they a SMALLER than most seat cushions, and a little small for my chairs, but that was MY fault. They are a nice quality and really perky looking!

title: Everyone Who Tries This Of ANY Age Ends Up Folded Up On the Ground
review:
We have company coming this week for the entire month. We have set up a pavilion and tents for our company. Part of this accommodation has been chairs. This was a choice of ours.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes in a bag which has basic instructions in it.

HOW TO SET IT UP
This has a zipper foot rest on it with a metal frame that clips onto the chair. If you want to recline, you have to do it BEFORE getting into the chair.

GETTING INTO THE CHAIR
Getting into the chair is challenging. You have to step around the foot rest and then fall back into the recliner if you want it reclining since you have to recline it BEFORE you get in it.

SIZE
I am about 5'6" and this chair is a bit on the short side. Another 3 inches or so would be better but it is still usable.

COOL
This chair has netting which is nice and cool for warm days. There is plenty of air flow.

PADDING
If you want to have a more padded experience, there is a pad you can put on top.

CUP AND STORAGE
There is a can holder for small cups and cans in the handle. There is also a storage bag on the side.

PILLOW
There is a pillow that can be attached and adjusted that is reasonably comfortable.

GETTING OUT OF THE CHAIR
What a nightmare. Everyone who has tried this from young to old has ended up folded on the ground with this chair. It is almost impossible to get out of. You have to step around the foot rest and the handles are at a difficult angle to get any support in getting up. It is downright horrible. The chair folds up easily and tips over too.

Once in a while someone masters getting out of the chair without needing a chiropractor, but more often it is really frustrating.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This chair is reasonably comfortable nice to recline and put feet up but getting out of it is too frustrating. For others who are physically challenged, it could be disastrous.

MY RATING
THREE STARS. The chair is comfortable, but it needs to be safer to get out of

title: One Star

title: Eh, it's okay.
review: First off, full disclosure, I thought this was metal. So I was super bummed when I realized I didn't read description well and plastic came in the mail. That being said, the plastic is somewhat hard and I'm guessing durable, although I'm pretty sure I could cut it will a pair of old scissors. I think the most disappointing aspect for me, was that whatever they used to print onto the plastic had either some bleeding issues or maybe the design was just super pixelated, because the lines are not what I would consider crisp, all the lines in the design look kind of blurry. I mean it is what it is, would I buy it again, no. Would I have paid 10 dollars had I realized it was plastic, no.

title: 2nd time I used this product one of the spokes ...
review: 2nd time I used this product one of the spokes inside broke and the umbrella will not stay shut when retracted. I have umbrella's that were way less expensive this this that are lasting longer.

title: Good product, weird marketing
review:
My younger kids have one of these in their school playroom for indoor recess. I've always wanted to try one, so I got excited to see this listed as good for kids and adults. The listing actually shows several interested additional uses that I've never heard of, like using it upside for Yoga or as a bridge to build toy sets. Those might be valid, but as far as I can tell, the reason one side is carpeted and the other not, is because the carpeted side is supposed to face down and protect your floor from being scratched up. When I got the board, I was even more confused as the included paperwork implies that this is only for kids with a maximum weight far below any adult in my household.
Its weird that the listing on Amazon doesn't match the info included with the product, although my kids are having a blast with it at home. I just wish I trusted it to support me like the listing states.

title: Solid bar - location is key
review:
Nice strong, heavy duty chin up bar. Installation is pretty straightforward... I think the biggest concern is where to locate it. I wanted it in a specific room, but over the door was not an option due to a lowered ceiling and my second choice, over the closet door did not include studs properly spaced. My third choice was against the wall over the light switch... etc.

I wish they would have included some recommendations for a typical home installation such as how far from the ceiling to install, etc.

All that being said, the bar itself is very solidly constructed and comes with all the hardware needed. If you have the right location to install it, it should serve you well.

title: It’s ok
review: I ordered three different items from this brand, and this item had a bunch of issues. The wood was noticeably lighter in color than the other two items received, but I was able to stain it to match better. The bigger issue is that the hex nuts on 4 of the 6 bars were cross-threaded. I was about to get them off with channel locks but that was terrible quality control from this brand. Additionally one of the plates is missing two of the three screws (as shown in the picture). It will work for what I need, but I’d rather have not had to deal with these issues.

title: Soy free! Tastes & cooks like regular milk
review: We have never really found a powdered milk that was truly palatable. Until now. This stuff mixes without any powdery residue or grit left behind. It looks like milk and tastes pretty good for powdered milk. We've used it for mashed potatoes and mac & cheese. Everything tasted like it should and nothing was watery. I especially appreciate that this company does not add soy (common allergen)  to their dehydrated foods.

title: Wonderful All Weather Phone Protection!
review:
This bag works great. The seal at the top clamps down tightly so that no water can get into your camera. This is about the best way I can think of to obtain a functional, underwater camera. I haven't tried this out at extreme depths, but it does work for just splashing around the pool. When you get your bag, I'd recommend you try it out by stuffing a piece of tissue in the bag and submerging it. Leave it under water for a while so you can see the tissue is still dry after use. This will allay your concerns before you try it with your $1000 phone.

I also do a lot of cycling and adventure sports that take place outdoors. This is a great bag for bringing the phone along so it's not destroyed by sweat or rain (I've had both ruin phones). It's a bit more heavy duty than most protective phone bags, and that's fine by me.

I received a free sample in exchange for an honest review.

title: Collectors quality
review: This was a Christmas present for my teenage grandson who is collecting these helmets.  The quality of this product is excellent.  It comes professionally packaged.  My grandson was very happy to get it.

title: great buy
review: grandson really likes

title: Too bad, liked the look
review: 10 year old kid.  Used for half a hockey season, buckle broke, won't tighten now.  Too bad, liked the look.

title: Nope
review: They roll up looking for some other ones...cut my legs several times

title: Good Stool
review: This is a perfect fit under my stroller!  Now when the wife is clothes shopping and I'm sitting and talking to the baby, at least I won't be sitting on the floor of the store...  It would be good for camping too.  Probably a bit large for backpacking though.  I love it!  I do wish it didn't have the battery pack built in, that's just added weight for a feature I don't need.

title: this lasted 5 minutes
review: Got this for my nephew's birthday party. Someone gripped the ball too hard and it popped. The pump is a joke.

title: Five Stars
review: Great exercise mat

title: CHEAP
review: VERY THIN AND PRINTING IS AWFUL. IT WAS TO BE A GIFT FOR MY GRANDSON, BUT WILL NOT GIVE IT TO HIM.

title: Great product!
review: Neat and practical. It works as advertised and does the job. Too many camping and survival gear items are worthless toys, but This item really serves an actual purpose and does it well!

title: Keeps them active
review: These skates were very nice. They were very pretty. My kids liked them a lot. It is so wonderful that they are adjustable. Kids feet grow so fast and skates are not cheap so it is wonderful that you can get one and they can last for a long time. It is nice that the wheels light up. They work fine. The kids really enjoy it. We really like for the kids to be active instead of watching a screen all the time. I would recommend it.

title: Not worth the money
review: It's ok but it does not come with an outside flag hanger. That would be an additional cost. Local stores have better flag units for teams in your area and they are better and the same price or cheaper when on sale. Don't be disappointed for a flimsy team flag.

title: Finish Line Citrus Degreaser Bicycle Degreaser 20oz Pour Can
review: Only used one time before the really cold weather set in. It worked fine and I plan on using it often when the warmer weather arrives. It's too cold to get the bike very dirty now.

title: Weird, slick, shiny fabric. Comfortable for casual wear and good for layering
review:
We don't follow football or the teams, I wanted this shirt simply as a match to the Viking Hat we have for one of our dogs - complete with blond braids. He wears that hat or carries it around, so we went to a party as a set of Vikings the other night - because I am just that silly.

It was in the 30s and this shirt was actually warmer than I expected it to be. It's that weird, slick polyester that just looks shiny and is usually very thin. The inside has a light layer of fleece for warmth and it's soft. Overall, this shirt is well made and easy to wear. I got it a size larger so I can layer it and it works fine.

title: Love this chair...
review: I used this chair last summer for concerts and soccer games. Can I tell you am really impressed. Not too heavy. And it has everything I wanted like umbrella, foot rest, place to secure small items etc... I 100% recommend. I love it.

title: 'SalGoodMan
review: this optic (along with all the other Hardline, Brushline and the Pro equivalents) is made int the Philippines - the "little" country that could. The craftsmanship is par with that of Nikon and Vortex and the glass, well in my opinion, it's actually slightly better than Nikon. If I had any criticisms it would be that the reticle’s height indicators on the rimfire model are a bit too small – they need to be beefed up a bit, and secondly, no parallax adjustment and no reticle illumination. But the knob modulations for both windage and height are uncharacteristically good for this segment as well as the glass and the finish. I paired mine with Winchester (Browning) Wildcat cause it matches the red accents – look and function in one. Add the lifetime warranty and bottom line is – you get a lot for your money. I’ll get another one before people start realizing they don’t have to pay the “big” bucks for the Nikon/Vortex models

title: Impressive quality!
review:
Very impressive quality for the price point! I needed the smaller bell for my adult electric scooter as mine doesn't work anymore for some reason. The little bell included does a single loud ding and is like the bells that they put on the Bird rental scooters.

The bigger bell does that series of dings in a row, it's the kind you normally see on a bicycle.

Both bells are very good quality and ring loudly and clearly! These are amazing!

title: Fits perfectly!
review:
Bike Stays clean and dry, the cover is thick and well made overall. Thanks for the LED safety light it will come in handy.
I will do an update in Spring 2021 on how it lasted through the winter.

title: Just don't buy these
review: Total carp I've had them from another company and they were great these refuse to get wet...water just rolls right off of it

title: Almost awesome?!
review: Love the idea and look... but it does not fit snug and slides off the Yeti.

title: Didn’t turn on
review: I never could get it to work. Refused to turn on. Thankfully the company gave me a full refund.

title: One Star
review: Confusing description did not fit my 08 PDS EZGO

title: Great cleaning kit & includes a hydration bag & nice bite valve.
review:
For the price this is a cleaning kit with a free hydration bag. The cleaning kit is very complete, it has a brush on a long spring that is stiff but flexible for scrubbing the hose, a large brush with handle for cleaning the bag & a smaller brush for the mouth piece & bite valve. It also comes with an expandable hanger that holds the bag open for drying.
The kit is complete & works well. There is really no other way to get the hose clear without the long, spring brush. I cleaned out one of my other bags with the kit & the results were satisfying if disgusting.
The included water bag is made of thick material which I like. The fill opening is large & internal threaded like most of the newer ones I have used. The large opening is easier to fill but hard to get full without spilling. The cap threads tightly & seals well but the strap attaching the cap is very short & pulls out every time I use it.
The hose has a nice quick disconnect on the bag end & a pressure fit on the bite valve end. The bite valve is the larger sort (I prefer the smaller, flat valves) which flows well & it has a pull-on switch & a cap.

title: Four Stars
review: Received as expected.

title: Recieved different design than advertised
review: My  order came today  and I quickly realized this is not the same hat they have advertised. Seems like I am not the only one who has had this problem as I was looking through the reviews.  Total bummer!

title: 1 pack only
review: I thought there would be six packages, but no.  Only one blanket!! Rip-off!!!

title: great for seating on
review: I got this for a classroom, some kids have a hard time setting for long periods for time, and some need the sensory intake the seat cushion gives. It was a big hit for a few of them that have that need.

title: More comfortable than an air mattress...
review: What’s amazing Is how this folds up into a little green bag!  We always have overflow little guests that end up in sleeping bags and the lucky one that had this sleeping pad under his, couldn’t get over what a difference it made in his comfort.  It’s much more comfortable than an air mattress, which doesn’t have a smooth surface.  So, this stores easily until the next sleeping bag guest!

title: Great as a multi day camping/hiking pack
review: Tons of space and pockets. This is my first true hiking pack and I wasn’t sure what to expect. But once o got my hands on the bag I realized it’s pretty decent bag. There’s a metal rod down the center of the pack (I’m guessing that’s normal for actual hiking packs?) I assume to help beep riggidity while carrying a full load out. All in all I’ll get more hands on with it this summer and see how comfortable it is carrying tons of gear. It has the space but if it’s unbearable to carry it’ll defeat the purpose. I’ve loaded it up with random items from my camera bag and go bag just to get an idea of the fit / comfort and so far so good.

title: they DO NOT fit Weaver
review: Nice, but they DO NOT fit Weaver posts because the scross screws are too thick and the spacing is wrong. So as such, it's false advertising. But I found a different use for them so I'm happy

title: perfect size!
review: Whether you want a couple of medium sized cups of tea/ coffee/ soup... this is a really nice size. sits soundly on my backpacking stove. solid and lightweight. Can't go wrong! Great build at a very reasonable price.

title: Fun to use; sturdy
review: I love having this in my backyard! All I did was connect the chains there really was no assembly. The bright red makes it easy to locate. It’s regulation size. It’s super sturdy and weather proof. Even in high Texas winds, it’s never tipped over. Amazing!!

title: Good for the price.
review: Not for tall person. But serves it purpose for gentle exercise.

title: Go Hawks
review: Great sign Great size  better than I ecpected

title: Very happy with product.
review: Good golf ball for my game. Will use these now always over other brands.

title: Not appropriate for kids
review:
The designs are not great. The sleeves work ok though.
They fit tweens, but the images are mostly inappropriate.

title: Buy the AZPORT Swim Cap. This one won't stretch enough to stay put beneath your ears and down your neck.
review: At 62 my hair is not very long and it is thinning, and this cap just doesn't want to stay where I first put it. It seems durable enough but it doesn't seem stretchy enough to pull down below my ears or down onto my neck. I really like the Blue AZPORT Swim Cap much better because it stretches downward more easily and stays where I put it.

title: These bands work well. They have good stretch
review: These bands work well, they have good stretch and are soft, but sturdy.  They aren't dried out.  Great for working your upper body.

title: Too hard
review: I think i need something with just a little more give >>> OUCH! It really hurt to use - my hip, lower back and IT band did seem to loosen up but not sure I give the credit to this.... I think maybe stretching had more to do with my recovery. I did try using a soccer ball to "roll" my IT band and that felt great!

title: A Portable Couch…
review: This is great for any outdoor activities.  I use it for outdoor movie nights.  The back rest is very stable to lean up against.  The base is wide enough so it doesn’t tip.  You can easily inflate to desired comfort from plush to hard.

title: I love it !
review: I love this color. I work at an Amazon warehouse so water is very much needed.

title: soft, light-weight, easy to carry, great to keep in car or RV
review:
This is a pretty nice blanket. It is versatile and easy to take with you. It did take me a while to roll up. I should have looked back at this ad. It would have helped me quite a bit.

I appreciate that it is wind and waterproof, yet the other side is very nice and soft. There are three snaps on it if you want to wear it.

Overall, I like this and am happy to have it. It will be going in my car.

title: Very nice chair.  so much more comfortable than umbrella chairs
review: I recommend this chair.  This style is so much more comfortable than umbrella chairs. It's sturdy, easy to carry, wipes off easily.  The side table is such a huge convenience.  It has pockets on the sides which makes it so much easier when carrying your chair.  You can slip your drinks or whatever into the pockets. No juggling items in your hand.

title: Cute
review: I almost returned this, but after unwrapping and playing with it it turned out very nice. I would buy again. River Run Rustic Wood Crafts

title: It dries pretty fast in the Arizona heat
review: It’s just not as good as my other cooling towels the material is just wet, after I wet my other towel and snap it well it actually feels cool this one is just wet and after being in the heat it’s a hot wet towel

title: Authentic team logos LA Dodgers baseball.
review:
Nice baseball if your a fan of the LA Dodgers. Which my family is..
The ball comes incased in plastic, but its made for taking it out of the plastic. You can use the baseball,
Or collect these , collection series Soft strike balls. Authentic Team Logos

title: Chintzy
review: Real cheap and one sided.  I returned it right away. Trust me, I'm a Buckeye.

title: Three Stars
review: Other than the size problem, it seems to be decent.

title: sizing wasnt what I thought it would be
review: These were a bit too tight. I felt like I ordered correctly.

title: Reasonably priced sports watch, not for experienced deep diving
review: Nice, reasonably priced water proof sports watch. I do like the fact that you can see it in darker waters with the glow in the dark capability. Water resistant to 100m, this is good for those who like to swim in pools, ocean and snorkel (I wouldn't recommend this for scuba diving). There are much better watches on the market but for far higher prices. So, if you are looking for a great looking sports watch (maybe for a younger swimmers and snorklers) this would make a great gift for the holidays.

title: Gift for excersize enthusiasts.
review: These were requested on my adult daughters wish list.  Apparently, these are weightlifting comfort items that are not always available at every gym location. These will allow her to workout at gyms closer to home.

title: Did not fit over my 3hp short shaft.
review: The “cover” was a strange shape that in no way would fit over my short shaft 3HP outboard.  I feel ripped off.

title: Absolute Garbage
review: Broke the 3rd time I turned it on. Wasn’t very bright when it did work either.

title: Nice
review: Nice presentation, good product and useful gift for the fisherman in your life or friends

title: You’d think I’d learn by now
review:
Inconsistent pictures strike again.

You’d think I’d learn by now to check the reviews before buying something but alas here we are again.

This thing is tiny! If you’re training to tranquilize hummingbirds this is definitely the target for you. If you want something you can see without using a magnifying scope look elsewhere.

I will say it’s made well. I’ll give it that.

So here I am telling y’all again. Read the customer reviews before hitting buy now. Those listing pictures are always too good to be true.

title: may have to modify shop vac to make fit on cover
review: it fit inShop Vac just had a cut a little of the plastic to make it fit. Works perfect after install would recommend for older shop vac

title: Awesome
review: Love these coolers!

title: Great deal for 2 caps with straws!
review: Fit my 40oz hydroflask perfectly!  Sturdy made and there's no leaks.

title: Decent flashlight,  good pen
review: This is a neat contraption. It does work as a regular pen, but with the other gadgets attached,  it's too heavy to just carry as a pen. The bottle opener works.  The flashlight is brighter than expected by far. I'll keep this in our bug out bag just to have an extra light source.

title: Thumbs up
review: Love it finally I can sharpen my pocket knives.

title: Excellent for viewing wild animals at night
review: The optics are excellent, I would like it if there was less of a signature from the binoculars in night vision.

title: Well-Made and Fun
review: I just gave this scooter as a girl to my niece (3 yrs old). It took only seconds to assemble, or more accurately, click into place. She was on it immediately and had a ton of fun. It is well made and holds up well to being tossed around. Great gift.

title: UGH!!
review: These smell like rotten bananas--I didn't bother to try one since I couldn't get past the smell!

title: Great set
review:
The table tennis gear was great. The paddles were well made. We have been buying from this brand for years, and have always found them to be high quality. They are easy to use and play with.

These are pretty durable. They last a long time without a problem. This is also a good gift for someone who likes table tennis. You really can do better in your game with a better paddle.

I thought the value was pretty good. I would recommend these.

title: nice set
review: I got these to get started in atlatl. They are great! They are accurate and they fly far and hit hard. I can't say enough good things about this. The ground where I live is frozen and the darts hit the ground so hard they actually went in a coupel of inches! this is Awesome!

title: Hearty & very easy to prepare with a long shelf life.
review:
I have eaten this for breakfast a few times. It is very quick & easy to prepare & it is filling. The taste is kind of bland, I do appreciate the peppers & cheese but a dash of Tabasco is a game changer. It doesn't look particularly appetizing & it's kind of hard to tell what the pieces are before & after they are hydrated.
Preparation is simple, the food to water ratio is 2:1; 1 cup of food & half cup of boiling water. Stir, cover, wait 5 minutes & it's ready to eat. It's cool that it stores for 25 years in the can, it would be great to keep for emergencies & there are 10 servings. I didn't see anything about storage life after it's opened but research says it's "several months".
For camping trips I have bought freeze dried meals before & taken MREs left over from hurricanes. As convenient, hearty & nutritious as this meal is, it just isn't tasty enough for me to look forward to it enough to take on trips.

title: Glows in the Dark!
review: My son picked this out for soccer this year and he loves it! It glows inthe dark which isn't really helpful on the field but fun to play with in the house at night.

title: Excellent Graphics
review: This shirt has some excellent graphics.  High quality construction.

title: Easy to assemble and take down for park fun
review:
I was not sure what I was getting as we are use to using a hard table for ping pong.
To our surprise, it was fun. After 30 mins, we got good exercise.

This was easy to put together, and take down. We took it to our Daughters house
and re-assembled it there. Everyone including the 7, 8 yrs old had fun playing.
When it became dark, we took a car out of the garage , and put this table game in.
We all enjoyed our selves for the evening.

I do not think this will last as long as a hard ping pong table.

title: Great
review: Excellent

title: Great concept
review: Love this..now I have another place for my tissues!!

title: Good Darts- Defective Flights
review: The darts feel amazing, Spectacular grip and weight, however, the flights are produced poorly and one doesn't even fit into the dart. If you buy these make sure to buy an extra set of flights. They weren't well packaged either, the box was dented and the items were rattling around in the box.

title: Very Poorly Manufactured Pickleball Paddle
review:
I had great expectations for this Onix React Pickleball paddle based on the positive reviews.
I was looking for a heavier paddle to help drive the ball further down the court, particularly when playing upwind.
Sadly I never even took this to the court - the quality of manufacture is terrible.
Perhaps I was unlucky enough to get a factory 2nd (I did pay full price), who knows, but this paddle would not pass the basic quality control standards.
The handle binding is loose and poorly wrapped, there are glue blobs on the paddle to hold the edge binding down - and it just looks beat up, fresh out the packet.
Purchased a carbon fiber Prolite Titan Pro (amazing quality) and returned this Onix to Amazon.

title: Best Built Folding Camp Chair I’ve Ever Seen
review:
If you are looking for a chair that is guaranteed to hold up for years of rugged use this is the one you need.

This chair is designed from each detail with stability and strength in mind.

The frame of the chair is heavy duty metal which allows it to hold up to 350 pounds - and it is wide enough to comfortably accommodate that.

The canvas fabric is double stitched and made to hold up for years of hard use without any issues.

The fold out table with cup holder is an awesome addition that is far better than the small cup holder typically seen.

The only downside to the strength of this chair s the weight. It weighs over 16 pounds which is significantly more than most similar chairs but this is due to the incredible materials used in its creation. This makes it an ideal chair for areas where you won’t have to hike a great distance to reach.

We have tested this chair on multiple adventures over the last several months and besides the weight we have been nothing but impressed with this incredibly comfortable, well built chair.

title: Good mug
review: We like this mug, but the the sliding mechanism where the seal is can’t be removed for proper cleaning it builds up residue which can’t easily be cleaned.

title: Ripped on first set up.
review: Lightweight. Plenty large enough for me and my son on a boy scout camp out. But while setting it up, one of the pole sleeves started ripping with very little force. Hopefully it holds up while camping. Very cheap material, so you get what you pay for....?

title: Accident waiting to happen
review:
They warn against a pinch issue, but even with that warning I got a nasty pinch trying to close it back. It’s heavy, but to hold a serous amount of weight I guess that’s necessary.
It was a little uncomfortable, but ok.

title: Lots of Fun
review: Such a cute tabletop game that we can take with us and the kids can play with at the table when we are in a restaurant. They love playing with it and making up their own rules and their own way to play. It also keeps them from wanting to get up and run around. Keeps them busy and entertained until their food gets to them. We also like taking it to the beach and pool and they like playing it there too.

title: Doesn’t function properly
review: One of the buckle things don’t work. It just won’t lock into place. Tried turning it around, forcing it in, fumbling with it....nothing. It works fine if there’s no weight, but the second thr Kayak is in the loop, it just comes apart. Had to tie it off and it looks stupid. Now I’m paranoid the others will break and my kayaks will come crashing to the floor. The hook that goes in the walls doesn’t look very stable for the wall. May have to replace them with thicker screw eyes from the hardware store. Bad buy. Oh well.

title: small but does what it should
review:
This bag was much smaller than I had expected but it holds the tools and leaves room for more. Just as long as they are not very big tools or items.

I am happy with this and will add it to the other bags I have.

title: Five Stars
review: Well made and has a nice zipper. Was thicker than I expected and is very comfortable.

title: Fantastic Party Cups
review: This is a set of four practical cups that are tough enough for serving beverages around a campfire, but attractive enough to be used at the dining table. The cups all have a transparent plastic lid to prevent spilling, but this lid can be easily removed. The cups are similar in size to a standard wine glass but without the stem. They are easy to grip and the stainless steel does not add any taste to your beverage. This is a perfect item for entertaining friends in your back yard or on a camping trip.

title: Dont waste your time
review: these broke almost instantly. Dont waste your time.

title: It was easy to make and smelled delicious
review: I didn't actually get to try this one, my dad wanted all of them. It was easy to make and smelled delicious. Next time!

title: Didn’t get the boots
review: The poles are great. Easy directions on Amazon to follow (they don’t come with instructions) but mine did not come with the boots. As I use poles to hike on pavement, I kind of needed those. Now I have to buy a separate set. I would have given these a 5 if I had gotten the boots. As it is, I’m not very happy.

title: Not long enough!
review: It's not long enough for me. I'm 6' 3" and taller when I'm wearing tennis shoes.

title: Love It!
review: Perfect little accent on my custom Packers wreath, my customer was very happy!

title: Waste of money
review: This should be sold out of a gumball machine!

title: This is the perfect trailer jack!
review: [[VIDEOID:26d2998e7b6ca3cb1490a30a73fb2bcd]] This is a great, small, lightweight, well designed product.  I motorcycle camp with a pull trailer.  Every ounce matters when towing on a motorcycle and this replaced an old several pound scissor jack.  People that see it are amazed how well and easy it works. I made a video using it on my trailer.  You won’t be disappointed.

title: Good Ball
review: This is a nice soccer ball. It doesn’t ship fully deflated, so it does take up some packing room. But you do need to inflate it before you play with it. My boys liked it and had no complaints. Works perfectly and seems durable.

title: Cute
review: cute

title: Deceptive photo....
review: I was expecting to have matching safety glasses with my hearing protection, to my dismay, I had missed seeing the disclaimer in one of the photos that states the eye wear was no included.

title: Professional quality
review: This a professional-quality soccer ball and my grandson loves it.  It takes a good beating (kicking) and stays perfect.  So far, we’ve been kicking it into a net in the backyard for practice.This is well-made and promises to be around as my grandson grows up.

title: Size chart is NOT true to sizing specifications!
review: Runs very small! Feels too restrictive on. Did not keep- returned it!

title: Way too hard.
review: This is very hard and firm. Painful to use, which was unexpected. Cheap, so its fine for the price. But the firmness problem already earned it space at the bottom of the garage bin.

title: The design makes this 5 stars!
review: Great design. So many great details.Love the foot box that is easy to get ones feet out of if too warm. Love the comforter. Material is very soft and luxurious against skin. Like that it has a hood. Love the sleeve for holding sleeping pad. I am 5'2" with slight build and it is great for me. Might be a little short for taller women. If I were 5'5" or above, I would get next highest length. Great Design. No zippers. No shock cord across the face! Decent price!.

title: wow, MUCH smaller than expected
review: seems OK in quality.  but too small for outside display.  :(  my fault, didn't pay attention to the size listed.

title: Helmet
review: The helmet feels cheaply made. It feels very hollow, which is what makes it lightweight. However, that doesn't give me the confidence that it will absorb any impact. It is best fitting for a toddler head. The colors are vibrant and the graphics are clear. However, I dont think this will stand up when it comes to protecting a child's head. The quality feels like it would break or crack with the first impact.

title: There are better urban tires, get Gatorskins
review: I commute daily in Brooklyn, my tires get a lot of wear and have to deal with sharp debris often.  These tires just don't hold up.  They're difficult to install and the definitely aren't puncture proof.  I've switched to Continental Gatorskins which have a band of kevlar instead of just the reinforced rubber that these do.

title: Very good for beginners
review: My step daughter is 6 years old and learning has never rollerbladed. These skates are great for beginners because when you spin the wheels they dont go on and on, instead they spin just a little, which allows beginners to learn and not get carried away. Also, she loves how they light up with all the colors. It was very easy to adjust them and they fit her. She wears a size 11 in shoes. Overall, I think they are a great pair of skates, especially for children just learning how to.

title: Works well! Gets the kids outside in fresh air!
review: What can I say? 5 stars. At the very least this contraption got my son off the video games and outside kicking a dang football. He is happy. I am thrilled. Love it.

title: I like the carabineer.
review: The water doesn't taste good. I don't know if I got a bad one or what but for $40 th is really sad. I bought it for when I travel for work. At home I have a zero water filter at home and I love it. That's my flavour standard for water. This taste like I might as well have put my mouth on the tap. (If anyone's reading this and wondering why I didn't get one of the bottles with a tap/indoor filter, it's because this is the only bottle that doesn't have an exposed drinking apparatus. One of my dogs likes to try and use straws.) Anyway I accidentally let the return window close on this much to my dismay. The best thing about this water bottle is the carabineer.

title: Absolutely LOVE this chair!!
review: The Best!

title: Awesome fitness workout especially with no gym and travel.
review: These are perfect for long days or travelers and need to get a decent workout in.  Can work up a great sweat especially if outdoors. Light weight and easy to pack.

title: Uncomfortable, doesn't help.
review: Seriously uncomfortable, ended up tossing it in the help-yourself closet at work and no one else wants it either.  Don't bother.

title: Works for little bikes too, but oversized...
review: We're using it for two 16" children's bike, so it's a bit oversized for that. So you can see the picture, it's not form fitting like the stock photos. I think I prefer it oversized because covering and uncovering would seem to be easier than if it were form fitting. 5-Stars.

title: like the wider width for handles on totes
review: i sew simple bags and totes for gifts, and the wider width of webbing makes more substantial straps for your hands.

title: This Tent Is Too Much Trouble To Bother With
review: Our family got this tent to use for camping. When it arrived, Mom and one of her sisters tried to set it up in our driveway, before taking it on an actual camping trip. Thank goodness they did because setting this thing up was a mess. Both Mom and her sibling are crafters, so they are gifted with their hands and are used to putting things together. None of that mattered in this case. They never actually got the tent up. The directions were confusing. There were a lot of stakes needed for both the tent itself and the rain cover. The second photo above shows how far they got, which wasn't very far, and certainly not to the point of making the tent anywhere near usable. They never even got the rain cover on. The fabric itself was so lightweight that it doesn't seem durable at all. The instructions say not to put the tent under trees or in direct sunlight as that can damage it. Those seem like funny instructions for a camping tent. If you can't put it in direct sunlight or under any trees, just where the heck are you supposed to set it up on a camping trip? No, this tent was a major disappointment and our family won't bother trying to actually use it. Our 2 star rating is actually generous given how miserable this product is.

title: A cool and useful blade
review: The paint job is cool, and has stayed on, despite a good deal of use. It came really sharp, and I use it as a general purpose knife, it cuts open packages mostly. But has been used on lots of other things in and around the home and outdoors. It's stayed sharp enough, which is good, as I don't look forward to sharpening such a strange shape. It's been good quality, especially for the price point. The sheath works, but isn't the best I've had.

title: Double failure on basic functionality
review:
I got this unit with a coupon which brought the price down to 2/3 of normal price. The unit has very nice audible clicks on both elevation and windage also comes with nice front and back caps. The front glass seems to be treated with layers of chemicals to make it brighter and crisper. The brightness adjustment knob is fairly tactile all the way through left and right.

And those are all the good things I’m to say about this unit. The really really really bad part is that it doesn’t have a Picatinny rail notch meaning it is absolutely smooth as a baby’s butt on the bottom. So you cannot use this on anything that has a kick stronger than a 22 maybe even 22 mag. Because, it will start sliding back-and-forth on the rail unless you use 40 pounds torque on the screws or more. The other basic functionality failure is of the windage knob – it is labeled in reverse meaning right is left and left is right. If you bought this thing and you did not take it to the range immediately to sight it in, you would fail to notice this right away.

For those two reasons it’s going back. One last note – this unit is very bulky. It’s the size of the mini Coke cans.

review: Wow, this is luxury in a sleeping bag!  For the family that “glamps” in the backyard, this is a necessity for Mom and Dad!  Not everybody loves to camp - but, with a big tent, the kids can still have the camping experience in the backyard - and the adults can “glamp” as long as they have this sleeping bag! review: This is a good chair for taking on a campout.  It is light but strong and feels good after a day of hiking.  The kids keep stealing it though, so now I need more of them.

title: Didn't keep my drinks cold
review: I love everything about these bottles, so much so that when I tried mine out I was very disappointed it did not keep my drinks cold even overnight in a cool house. Has anyone else had this problem? The reviews are so amazing I am confused why mine was not up to the standard I have read about. My sister's bottle didn't keep her drink cold either. The ice melted within 6 hours and her soda was flat.

title: Excellent Niche Lighting
review: Other camping lanterns are much more multi-functional than this one. I've had ones that can serve as flashlights, lanterns, or emergency flashers as needed. This one has a much more specific niche, providing portable area lighting and it serves that niche very well. A flashlight provides a narrow beam of light. A lantern that is hung does not light the area underneath it. This product lights up a whole area easily and well. The lighting is adjustable to the level needed. It can be hung overhead in a tent or sideways on a backpack or tree. The lantern is well built and durable. Even if you don't go camping, you may want to have several of these on hand for emergencies like power outages.

title: USELESS!
review: When I showed these to my Physical therapist, she laughed. They are the size of large rubber bands. I can't use them for my leg therapy, not even my arms. What a joke!!! I paid for and bought some colorful rubber bands, period.

title: Love it so far!
review:
We've wanted to get some sort of indoor aerobic equipment, but a treadmill seemed like it would take up too much space. I love that this bike actually seems to be less floor profile space than any treadmill we looked at, and the non-impact exercise of pedaling rather than stepping is more than welcome! The wheels in front mean I can easily push it into the corner of the playroom when not in use, but then wheel it out in front of the TV when we want it.
It was SUPER easy to assemble, most of it comes already made out of the box. You just need to attach the pedals, handle bars and floor supports.
The only thing is that it seems to have a bit of "give", or a slight wobble/creak once I reach a certain speed. Granted, this is a fraction of the price compared to a brand name like NordicTrack, so you can't really compare it to pro gym equipment. Also, I'm around 200lbs so perhaps I notice it more than someone lighter (like my wife, who didn't seem to notice it). For the price, however, I think it is a fantastic value and intend to get a lot of use out of it!

They a great item if you are just starting out and beyond to monitor your steps and your heart rate, and your sleep. It is worth the money you pay.

title: What to get the golfer who has everything
review: These balls are not miracle workers (contrary to the product claims). They are an overpriced gadget that would make a unique gift for the golfer in your life (tell them it's the latest technology). Bottom line, I would not spend $15 a golfball for these when I can buy a dozen of ProTitleist balls for $30 and have superior results. Rating these as a three star because they are unique and I know my brother would love these (for bragging rights to his golf buddies). I personally wouldn't go out of my way to use these high priced balls and prefer the standards.

title: Assembly Required, Sub par Construction
review:
Foosball was a huge hit in college. Who doesn’t remember knocking back a few cold ones while trying to show your masterful skills at the foosball table? Now, Franklin Sports has a scaled down version of the popular game with its 20 inch Pro Kick Foosball set.

Due to the smaller size of this set, I figured it would be good for my kids and when I received this package in the mail, I opened the box expecting the game to be fully assembled and ready to play. It wasn’t. You have to assemble by hand and from what I discovered, the assembly is not that easy. Worse, my set was missing a few important pieces so we were unable to complete the set up until I made a quick trip to a home supply store.

Once assembled, we started to use the game, but we soon noticed that the handles do not move back and forth very smoothly and the screws do not hold very well. The construction of the game is not the best and I really think it would be better of the manufacturer changed things up by using better quality construction. Having it packaged ready to play would be nice, but I could tolerate a little bit of home assembly if the end product was sturdier and better designed.

Franklin Pro Kick Foosball set is too small for adults. It’s really made for children and while I thought my kiddos would find it mildly entertaining, they grew frustrated with it very quickly. It’s an okay idea, but the overall quality and missing pieces convince me to lower my rating and not recommend.

title: Not adjustable, cools like a wet towel
review:
Well, in some ways this is a good hat, but it has flaws and it's priced way above it's league. We're in the Big Bend area of West Texas and that means sun, heat and hats at all times, year round. I have several in various styles and materials.

This one looks nice, the colors are great. The listing says it's adjustable, but that is only for the chin strap, not the body of the hat. If you have a larger head, this isn't for you, my medium head fits fine, but there's no extra space.

As to the cooling effect....once it gets wet, it wets your head and evaporation causes a cooling sensation. This was noticable on a 2 hour hike along the Rio Grande this morning. However, let's just get real for a second.....a thin, wet towel over your head does exactly the same thing. There's nothing special going on with this hat to cool you after it gets wet.

The brim offers plenty of shade over your face and neck which is exactly what any brimmed hat should do. Unfortunately, the construction of the brim is not great. After a single hike, I realized the edge of it is coming apart already. There are equally good and better hats out there that are more budget friendly.

title: Neckline is very tight with no give, runs small in the bustline
review:
Hangman's noose. That's the first thing I thought when I put this shirt on this morning. It's just a very weird fit on me and I find this disappointing indeed because I absolutely love my Craft wool layering shirt in medium.

This one is very body skimming and mine says slim fit on the tag, so I expected it to cling to every curve and lump etc. The fabric is a mix of polyester and elastane with a weave pattern for cooling during exercise, including a sort of open net look in the underarms.

I am a true size 8 and the other shirt in medium fits me with extra fabric - it actually is a hair big, but this one is really too tight across the bust and the throat is way too small. To the point of making me feel like I was choking. I'm not sure if my particular shirt is mis-marked or if they have a problem with inconsistent sizing at the manufacturing level. But I think I'll just pass on this very pricey brand in the future.

review:
Our three year old LOVES this! He glides down the block alongside his older siblings who can balance on 2-wheel ones, and beams with pride that he can ride his own too. The brake system took him a little while to understand, but surprisingly after showing him twice, he understands how to use it to slow down, and can easily tilt the bar left or right to steer in that direction. We had another one previously that offered a sit-or-stand option, but he likes this one better, even though that one also had light up wheels. This looks more like a traditional scooter which he likes, and the lack of a folding seat makes it smaller and lighter too.
Really a great value and we recommend it!

title: Big deck is great for a street riding returning beginner like me. Big wheels roll over debris
review:
I'm closer to 50 years old than 40 I haven't skated since ALF was on TV but I have been eyeing the new style boards for a while now. I chose the long board style because it seemed better for riding around the neighborhood & I hoped no one would expect me to do tricks on it. As a returning rider who has been out of touch for a few decades I can't expertly critique the board but I am thoroughly enjoying it & it has good features for a street board. My daughter's boyfriend borrowed it to take to the park so it must have the right look.
This board is big. At 41", it comes up to my belt when stood on end and gives a stable ride but takes a lot of space to turn. It also seems wider than I remember from my '80s boards & there is a lot of space to move around. The wheels are about 2 3/4" in diameter which is good for rough pavement & rolling over pebbles & even the occasional stick. It's heavier than my old boards which is good for riding if not carrying.
I'm still getting the hang of "pumping" the board but kicking it is certainly faster than walking & a good reason to get out & around the neighborhood. I tightened the trucks to make them stiffer while I get used to it but I always preferred stiffer trucks anyway.
The deck is thick, 1/2" plywood, the top is completely covered with good grip tape & the bottom is painted. It has some concavity which helps to turn. The edges of the plywood are stained & look great except the scratches I have put on the ends. Despite the thickness & concavity, the deck flexes a lot due to the distance between the trucks. I don't know how normal this is since it is my first longboard. It's probably exacerbated by me tightening the trucks.

title: Hiking, Camping, Emergencies, This is there for all Your Needs
review:
My review is of the 5-liter version of the LifeStraw mission water purifier.

Assembly and set up are unbelievably easy. Fill the roll-bag with the cleanest water you have access to. Roll, seal and hang the bag using the handy nylon strap they include. Attach the hose (which also easily detaches) and let the water begin to flow. Purge the red valve which is bad water and then wait for the water to begin flowing from the blue valve which is the good water. Detailed instructions are included and printed on the roll-bag. The kit also comes with a handy stuff sack and a couple extra primary filters which mount inside the roll-bag.

The 5-liter size is good enough for two people, perhaps two adults and a child. For more people you're going to want the higher capacity bag or more than one of these 5-liter kits. I wanted to give this an honest trial. I almost went with the pool water but the chlorine and other chemicals worried me and after an email from the company I'm glad I didn't. Under no circumstances should you attempt to filter pool water. Luckily we received a good amount of rain. Water drains out of our neighborhood through a system of swales and where it runs across our yard we have a good grass base for it to flow across. We took our bag full of water from the front yard and followed all the instructions very carefully. After purging the red valve and bulb I filled a cup from the blue valve side and. . . it tasted as good as the filtered water from our refrigerator. 24 hours later and no adverse effects. This has earned my trust and we'll happily be adding it to our hurricane supplies.
I received this item in exchange for my review

title: Very Comfortable Chair- Lacks Back Support For Some--
review:
I love to rock when I am outdoors. I have had various chairs, but many lack the back support that I need. I got this chair in hopes to finally have one that would work. It works, but I had to put in a back support pillow.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes in a box, well wrapped and then the bag with the frame and chair comes in that box.

HOW TO SET UP
As the instructions show, the frame is easy to set up and fast. You simply hook the chair over the hooks and are good to go.

BACK SUPPORT
This is comparable to a bucket seat in a car. Honestly for me, I need lumbar support. For this chair, it just needs a little lumbar support. I got a lumbar pillow and put it behind my back and I am happy. It is comfortable.

FOOT STOOL
For me, although I am long waisted and 5'7", sitting in this chair needs to have something to put my feet on to be most comfortable. I just get something I can put my feet on even if it is a rock, and then the chair is comfortable for me to sit in for long periods of time. Without it, it puts a little strain on my lower back.

LEGS
The legs of this chair have to be on fairly even ground. Although it can take a little variation, it is best to try for the most even ground you can. Otherwise the strain on the frame can cause it to bend depending on how heavy the person is and how often it is used on uneven ground.

QUALITY
The quality of the case, the chair, and the frame is excellent. Workmanship is very good and the design is well executed. This is a sturdy well made chair. I like it.

DOES IT HAVE CUP HOLDERS?
There are not any cup holders on this chair.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Well made with a great storage/carry bag, this chair is comfortable. I needed a lumbar support pillow which I tucked in with it when stored. A foot stool of some sort helps too. Great chair and we all love it.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This is way nicer than I expected and I am glad we got it. It is a good addition to our camping/roughing it collection. Not for backpacking necessarily, but outdoors camping nearby so you don't have to carry it far is perfect for us.

PHOTO
I did not include a photo with this because there are quite a few with the listing.

title: Can stand in it,  run a little narrow but that makes it easier to roll up and get in bag.
review: This sack comes in handy for soccer / football sporting events. Used it last night at my son's game and it started hailing for about a half hour. I was toasty warm in this. Lots of jealous people freezing their butts off. LOL

title: Great gift for the golfer!
review: Late Father's Day gift!  But,  the lateness is forgotten when the gift is new golf balls!  Callaway is a brand all golfers respect, so these golf balls were a welcome addition to all his golf stuff.  They arrived just in time for some putting practice, so we heard right away that these balls are going to do great things for him.  In the never-ending search for the better club, ball, glove, etc. that will improve the game, these Callawy balls were the best gift we could have come up with!

title: comfortable but
review: Comfortable for a cot, easy to put up. Update... the only thing is my husband said it sucks that you have to put it together every use, too much of a pain.

title: bad tire tread falls right off
review: wasted lots of money on this am very sad that people sell stuff this bad

title: Junk, Does Nothing
review: I've tried two of these things and either I got two broken ones or they just a joke. I read the instructions which were so small i needed to photograph them and then view on my monitor. It's simple, set the string, maintain tension, wind, pull! After that you're supposed to get pretty flashing lights (the LEDs were there) and a spinning ball inside the grip to give you resistance training. No lights, ball barely rotates no matter how hard or sharp you tug the string. I couldn't even manually get the light to light and what little spin developed the most resistance I felt wouldn't benefit a toddler.

title: Nice
review: Easy to put on the pole and the handle turns very smoothly.

title: Doesn’t stay on face.
review: Garbage. Didn’t stick on my daughters face for more than 5 minutes. Waste of money.

title: These are all plastic
review: I didn’t think they e were would look do cheap. And to return I need to take to post office instead of dropping off at Kohl’s or Whole Foods. Only buy if you like plastic

title: Love these Aladdin tumblers
review: Love these Aladdin tumblers. They really keep beverages cold for a long time. The lid and straw are great. If you knock over this it doesn't all spill out.

title: Not as effective as it should be
review: I was really looking forward to getting this band to enhance my booty workouts. I could barely even pull the band up to my thighs. I felt like I was struggling to get into shapewear. Once I finally got it in place, it started to roll down when I did the exercises. I feel like the band needs to be at least double its current width in order for it to be effective. It was okay for squats and hip adductor exercises. It was just plain useless for donkey kicks, fire hydrants, or clams.  I'm glad this was cheap. Otherwise I would be angry about wasting money.

title: Keeps my water cold
review: works well for what it is intended for. I use mine for water only.

title: covers for bike shoes
review: Little disappointed because I thought this would actually cover the entire bottom of my bike shoes. I bought the shoe cover because the bottom of my bike shoes, for cleat pedals, are very slippery when you walk, the covers don't cover that slippery part so they really does not serve any purpose but didn't feel like returning them. I think these are used to coveryour bike shoe clousers, straps.

title: Total crap! Avoid this product
review: These socks suck! First of all, they do NOT provide any sensible warmth at all. Zero! Secondly, I could feel the wire on my right sock, it was absolutely uncomfortable to wear this. I just dumped these socks!

title: Fun set
review:
I remember playing kickball as a kid, so I was excited to give this set to my three oldest kids (ages 10, 8 and 7). It is a very fun game that can keep them active that is not as rough as some of the sports that have more contact. They really enjoyed playing it.

I was happy with the quality of the ball. That felt very well made. My daughter was able to kick it far, wide and high. We had no problems with quality.

I was not as happy with the quality of the bases. They are like a thin foam and would curl up. They didn’t always stay put. I have definitely seen better quality bases. Still, for my kids just playing around, they did work. They were bright and colorful, which they liked.

I know how to play kickball, but it would’ve been nice if there had been some kid-friendly directions included.

Overall, it wasn’t a bad set for the price. It did provide them with a lot of fun.

title: Good quality!
review: Instructions included were very helpful & product was high quality.

title: So Unlike Yeti...
review:
I have been a huge fan of Yeti products for years. Their products have kept my ice water cold (even in the hot summers) and have lasted throughout the night, even until the afternoon the next day with the same ice placed the night before. This Rambler is a huge let down. I expected my water and ice to last until morning and this did not do that. Its a huge disappointment to wake up and find my water at room temperature, especially for the price. Yes, Yeti products are expensive as we all know, but this Rambler does not justify the price. I do not know if I have a defective one or what, but this Rambler is just awful, quality-wise. Its not like Yeti to manufacture poor quality. Maybe its just mine - who knows, but I really do not want to spend $$$ on another one just to find out. My previous Yeti’s (the ones with a straw) did a fantastic job. Yeti has a solid reputation for their products. Either mine is just defective, or whoever manufactures Yeti’s products really needs to improve on the quality.

On a brighter note: The color is very pretty, no condensation, and it is easy to clean and can be placed into the dishwasher. I have not done so, as I hand wash mine, but its a good feature.

title: Child’s size not made for an average size women’s head
