review: I purchased this adorable hat for an out of town guest who would be attending a Reds baseball game with my husband and I... I was embarrassed to find that it was very shallow /small and would not sit correctly on her or even my own head. We are both average size adult females but honestly I don’t think it would even work for my tiny 14 year old granddaughter it’s just not deep enough from the band to the top of the hat . Very disappointed because it’s a very cute hat and I loved the style.

title: STEELERS NATION
review: My uncle is a HUGE steelers fan..as am I. This shirt is a great addition to our fan apperal. It was reasonably priced and great for watching the game in. I recommend this shirt.

title: Love all my travel cups
review: Love all my travel cups.  This is good, but, sometimes I forget to close the tab and then it leaks if it falls over.  Buy, is a good size and keeps my water cold til it's gone.

title: Good For The Beach
review: This is a nice water shirt that will help keep you comfortable and prevent sunburn while you're out on a lake, river, or beach. It is a quick-dry, lightweight shirt that is made from 100% polyester. Note that the shirt is not made out of swimsuit material, but is more like a quick-dry running shirt. The material is a little bit stretchy but is not nearly as elastic as Lycra or Spandex. The colors are attractive and the shirt fits true to size. If you are between sizes, you should select the larger shirt here so it's easier to pull on and off when it becomes damp. You can kind of see through the material so it's best to wear a swimsuit beneath it. The shirt is nice to swim in, and provides a more modest, yet still attractive look. This would be a great option for people who perform aqua yoga. If you spend a lot of time near the water, this is a great item for your gear bag.

title: Okay products, looks cool
review:
This bike tape looks good and does give a much more comfortable and slip resistant grip. I really like the pop the red honeycomb design gives.

I think the adhesive on the tape itself isn't the best. I definitely think they could've given a bit of a thicker strip to adhere onto, and if you make a mistake and want to rewrap, the glue definitely loses some of its stickiness.

The "finishing" tape didn't work very well for me either. One strip worked okay while the other one seemed maybe dried out? It didn't come off the paper easily and was noticeably less sticky than the other strip.

It was my first time trying a wrap and the instructions were not helpful. Lol Its probably pretty intuitive to those that are more experienced but I think more detailed instructions could've helped.

title: Ok, nice size. Some minor stitches arrived loose
review: I like the size and the little pockets. The stitching does not inspire confidence though, doesn't seem super strong and some of the minor unimportant stitches were already loose on arrival. Maybe I'm too used to outdoor brands like REI etc with strong stitching and materials.

title: Broke upon second use
review: I like this game but i used it for the second time today at a birthday party and it already broke. The middle pole won’t screw down. Really disappointed.

title: Good Quality
review:
Tents like this are perfect for summer outings. I was immediately drawn to the emerald green color. It will help the tent blend in to most surroundings. It comes in a bag that's easy to carry. The setup can be done in around 5 minutes with two people. There are clear full-color instructions included. The tent fits two twin air mattresses or four sleeping bags. Overall, this is a good quality tent. I highly recommend it.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided helps make your decision a little easier.

title: Doesn't squeak
review: Looks just like the picture. Haven't tried the whistle (it's pea-less), but the hammer head part doesn't squeak. I specifically wanted a toy that would squeak when I hit people on the head, and this did not do that. :/

title: Nice and Big, I like it, it works very well
review:
We already had a couple of similar bags but I ordered this one anyway. I am glad I did. It is much larger than the other two we have. It holds so much more and keeps food chilled too.

I am extremely pleased with this and happy to have it. I think you will like yours too. Give it a try.
Won as a prize came very fast thru ups. I’m a woman, this item would work for a child. Very small.

title: Great Portable Disk Golf Basket
review: I really like this basket.  We used it at on a vacation to entertain the kids and introduce them to disk golf and they really enjoyed being able to make their own challenges.  I have to say that the basket has its advantages and disadvantages but all in all it is great.  They chains are not the best for catching discs and depositing them in the basket and there are better baskets out there, but not with the great portability and easy of transport of this one.  It assembles in seconds and is sturdy enough to handle wind and strikes by discs with no problem.  Love it and recommend if you are looking for an easily stored, easy to transport practice basket.

title: Accurate
review: This thing shoots accurately and smooth. The darts are crappy, but they are cheap buy better ones. That is my biggest complaint but the gun the main part is fantastic.

title: Arrived in damaged box
review: Package came in damaged box and almost lost an important part due to bad packaging. Bike is ok, it serves the purpose but folding and unfolding is more exercise than riding it. I got a good knock on the head trying to get it to unfold to the right spot so I could lock it in. If that were fixed, it would be a good little bike.

title: Nice
review: I wish they were a bit bigger.

title: Not worth it
review:
The bar is not what you would expect. There is a reason why this bar is quite a bit cheaper than other bars. You will see flaws that you won't expect to see. The weld for the center swivel piece (what connects the bar to a cable) is offcenter. This is not a micrometer level of off-center, but an inch off center. That does play a huge factor in properly balancing out this attachment.

Try to steer clear of this one if you can afford it. It's flaws really outweigh other aspects.

title: Very small
review: Very very small about the size of your hand

title: Small
review: To small

title: Very attractive thin long sleeve shirt with scooped bottom
review:
I love this shirt. It is very thin and almost see-through. The lion on the front and back is super attractive and really pops with the light gray lettering. The scooped bottom in back really highlights the female form nicely. At $42 this is a bit pricey but it is to me expected since it is an NFL branded shirt. I rated this 4 stars only because it is super thin. Otherwise, it is a wonderful top.

I wash this inside out on cold and hang dry it.

title: Great pedometer - throw it in your bag and it is still accurate!
review: We always put this in our bag when we're on vacation so we can see how far we walk each day.  It retains a few days of info so you don't lose your info if you forget to jot it down each night.  Works great!

title: These boxes will tackle more than fish tackle.
review: [[VIDEOID:5a4e18f99b0b6203a23c2bbadffed95b]] Hotep family. I really like these two boxes they have individual compartments on the top and bottom in the bottom ones you can change and rearrange. One thing I like about him I could have one for my small camera parts and the other one for my airbrush parts. I highly recommend my friend. Thank you for looking at my review and I hope it is beneficial for you if it was, please let me know by simply checking the helpful box below. God bless you. May the rest of your life be the best of your life.  Baba Oran Z

title: Wake surf
review: Christmas gift for my grandson. He just started surfing last summer and wanted a better board. He hasn’t tried it yet but he fell in love with it as soon as he unwrapped it.

title: Had to make adjustments
review: This looked like something fun to break up the monotony of the day, or play with friends when visiting. Easy to store out of the way, not too big or clunky. However, the pieces would not fit peoperly, the holes were too big for the screws to work properly. We had to drill a screw into the top to keep the middle pole in place. I also had to replace the strings because they unraveled while tying onto the base. Should provide extra strings if they are that flimsy. Could have been better.

title: It's a decent rack and bar
review:
We built this for our garage home gym, my son was super excited about it. He found the instructions weren't very clear, but we eventually got it up and assembled. With the right counter-weights, it seems pretty solid for lifting your body weight and/or holding barbells.
I like that it has the adjustable knobs to lock in different heights, but we found it really difficult to adjust. One side always seems to get locked in place when the other moves and it is nearly impossible to get them both to move at the same time. It's not a deal killer, it still works fine but I need to help when a family member wants to try it on a different height since they can't do it themselves.
Seems pretty decent for the money, not amazing but not terrible. Definitely works.

title: Worked well in the hot summer weather
review: These cooling towels were just what we needed during our vacation to Disney World in Florida. It was so incredibly hot outside. With the weather and walking for hours, it was almost unbearable. These cooling towels helped take the edge off and helped keep our kids in a somewhat good mood despite the heat.

title: Can be used on MENs pants belt, to carry your CELL PHONE.
review: This item came with too many parts, and cost was reflecting the clip and latch.  If you are wearing this to HOLD your CELL PHONE, on the belt, then you do not need the clip nor the inside latch.  Just trim them off with a scissors, and it becomes streamline and awesome.  Dah!! if the company did this, they could sell for $10 USA dollars and everybody would buy it !!!

title: The lids fail too often
review:
I LOVE my Bubba cups. I have 3 of various sizes, and my daughter has two of the 24-oz bottles (she copycatted me after she saw mine).

My only problem is with Bubba customer service! When my daughter's lid broke (and she only used it at home, and is an adult), I wrote to Bubba because of their guarantees, included photos of the lid, and asked for a replacement lid. We not only did not get any replacement, Bubba CS did not bother to respond AT ALL. That's just not right!

Bubba, I love your cups, but you could have at least replied to our email about a problem!

title: Size up; supportive
review: I recommend you size up.  Initially I purchased a small after measuring the area above my knee.  It was not comfortable enough to wear for an extended period of time so I ordered a large.  The large is the correct size for me.  These are thicker than other knee sleeves. I would bet wear these to sleep in.  Very supportive!

title: great brand - need tweak to structure to allow for income spin bikes.
review: We wanted to switch out the saddle from our Lemond Revmaster Pro and whilst the seat is comfortable, only wished the bar allowed is to push the seat an inch further back [the groove and angle did not help].  Otherwise, less of a sore bottom when taking long spin classes [over 2 hours].  Great brand.

title: Good fit for Schwinn 250 recumbent
review: I bought these for an old Schwinn 250 recumbent bike. These are pretty much the same as the OEM straps - same fit, same thickness, same heavy plastic. Personally, I think a different material would have been a better design but that’s a different issue. I tried a set of “fits-all” nylon/velcro straps before these, but no go. These were fine. Good price, same as OEM quality.

title: OK to notso good
review:
No, I did not expect gourmet meals, but I did expect things like scrambled eggs that were fully reconstituted. They were, instead, dry and chalky in the center when eaten after letting the packet sit for the recommended length of time. Since there was very little excess moisture, I am not sure if waiting longer would have helped..

The others were a bit better, but they still generally suffered from lack of taste and poor to acceptable texture, even after allowing them to sit for twice teh recommended time.

It is impossible to do much about the texture, but I suggest hot sauce, salt and pepper to help with the taste.

If I buy again, I will concentrate on rice and pasta dishes, since they seem to work the best. I plan to stay away from the scrambled eggs and any dessert that requires water.

Since I was testing these for acceptability as emergency rations, I give them a three star rating sicne they are well packaged. likely to survive bad conditions and are reasonably high in calories. If I were doing it for backpacking or hiking, I would drop a star off for the taste, texture and need for condiments.

title: Perfect
review: Quality built, holds 40oz. of water and has an awesome strap hanging off to carry it by.

title: Kind of bulky
review:
Biggest complaint is how bulky this is, especially once you put stuff inside of it. It’s awkward to wear while walking because of this, even if there is only a phone in it.

Second biggest complaint is that only the middle pocket has double zippers, so there is no way to zip the others so there is quick top access to the section without stuff falling out the sides.

title: Charge often and allow TIME
review:
I dropped the lantern while we t was charging and it couldn’t be charged again loose screw inside.

But to light up in area you have to work in without
electricity for example it was great! Use 2 and always have one charging.

title: Not comfortable
review: They feel like they’re too hard to be on my body if that makes sense. Not a fan.

title: Good ball
review: This soccer ball is very good. It is solid. It seemed like it was very good quality. It was made well. My kids liked playing with it. It came quickly. It seems durable and like it will last a long time. We had no problems at all with it.

title: It’s okay
review: I personally didn’t like this. The flavor kind of reminds me of Top Ramen…

title: Like a rock
review:
MTM has the formula dialed in - this box is sturdy as a rock. MTM generally speaking makes some of the best plastic boxes around, period. Since I discovered them about 6 months ago, I've bought a bunch of MTM products - NOT ONE HAS FAILED ME YET. If almost feels like old school product, where it's made well and made to last.

Like a rock...

title: Sweat baby sweat!
review: My wife loves this waist trainer! She has used others in the past, however this is the ultimate! It has the waist belt as well as the thigh area. You can wear it over or under workout clothes, and either way it makes you sweat.... A LOT!!! The rear area is open, which is great if you want to keep that booty! My wife is 5’4” and 130 lbs., the S-M size fit her just right!

title: Works fine.
review:
I ride my bike 25 miles. People like to through glass bottles on the ground for fun I guess and sometimes I don't see the glass and boom, hole in my tire. Have had this 3 times happen and one time a huge goat head. All 4 times the patch has held up. Rode 4 times a week, 25 miles each day all spring, summer and fall. No leaks.

Make sure you clean the area inside the tire, lightly sand then glue it one. Also a little bit of glue on the outside as well. I think this helps alot.

title: prefect
review: My husband can't wait until hunting season now, he said it's comfortable and fits really good.

title: Not bad
review: I have bought several sets of tubes for myself, others and for my office. These are above average. Not sure if they’re durable but so far they are decent.

title: Does not work well!
review: I really thought that this Hula Weighted Hoop was going to be a fun way to get a smidge of exercise at the end of the day but was I wrong!!!! It doesn't spin for more that 1 minute at a time. Several others have also tried it without success. There seems to be a problem with the weighted fob, it just doesn't want to slide around. I would not recommend this!

title: Five Stars
review: Wife loves this product and uses it in the car often to relieve knee pain.

title: These are slow and steady
review: These are fine and will do. They take almost 30 minutes to warm up and they actually stay warm for a really long time. But more like, lukewarm. Nice to have nonetheless in your pockets during chilly fall and winter nights or day, when the power goes out for days in TX during a freak ice storm. You can even put them in socks to sleep in if your toesies get cold!! Added bonus- you can throw away in garbage.

title: quick, easy, fairly flavorful ... and none of it went bad in the fridge! [*grin*]
review:
howdy y'all,

one problem with cooking for one person is stuff going bad on me. most "one person, one week" size items cost nearly the same price as the larger "family" sizes. so i have been switching to dried/freeze-dried items so that i can make "just enuf".

this works well. the black beans are _really good_, but these are fair.

rated a _three_ since it is as expected.

take care,
lee

title: A Little Tricky to Assemble
review: My husband started to set it up one day and it started to rain. He left it out and when we went back a few days later some of the metal pieces had a little rust on them. The rusting was minimal, but apparent in more than one piece. I expected something meant for outdoor play would be resistant to rusting so quickly. Assembly was more difficult than we expected. My husband is usually really good at putting things together. The instructions were not the easiest to follow. We had to get the picture of the product from the website to see how it was supposed to look in order to finish it. It's a nice, large size. I was a little concerned that the wind might blow it over, but my husband said the wind will go through the net and not be able to hold on to anything to lift it. It's a decent soccer goal. I appreciate that it comes with a storage bag.

title: florida state banner
review: I purchased this banner for my husband to hang on the boat dock. The colors are bright and the quality of the fabric is great and sturdy.

title: Great for pool or ocean!
review: Super cute goggles for my two grandsons! I have a huge pool here in our Florida community and we tried them out just this past weekend. Huge hit, they wore them for a couple of hours (with no issues) and were able to see the bottom of the pool (and my son's shark attacks, lol) easily. We are going on a Caribbean cruise in January and I will be bringing them there to see if we can show them how to snorkel for real among the reefs with them. Highly recommend these colorful and useful goggles!

title: Slide down
review: These were fine at first but after wearing and washing, they don't want to stay up anymore and slide down into my boots. They do fit (true to size) and they are warm, but if they don't stay up, they won't work for me. I do have narrow legs so YMMV but not for me.

title: Provides Some Cushioning
review: Been needing something that is easy to do for a small area of concrete floor that I stand on. This is thicker than some other tiles I had. Fits together easily. Easy to take apart and move around.

title: Bottle is Great; Need a Better Way to Flush the Filter for Use, Though
review:
I have been using a Brita squeeze bottle for a couple of years and it has been great when on trips. I definitely have saved money by replacing filters instead of plastic water bottles. I was interested in using this hard bottle from Brita, as using a straw-type nozzle is a lot easier than using a bottle you have to squeeze. The bottle is good and it’s designed well, But, there’s one glaring issue with this bottle.

This is a hard bottle that is resistant to drops and scratches, and will bounce when dropped from sufficient height without breaking.

I like the fact that the cap pops up to reveal a silicone straw, and the bottle has an insert in it that allows the drinker to pull up water from the bottom without inverting the bottle. This is a nice change from how the squeeze bottle is used, which must be inverted. Flow is easy too – the water comes out with little effort.

So, Brita left out one very important detail. The filters for these bottles are a charcoal cylinder through which water is forced, and it is normal to get charcoal dust out of the filter when it’s flushed before first use. So, when using the squeeze bottles, Brita says to flush the filter by filling the bottle and forcing the water through, discarding that first bottle full. This bottle cannot be squeezed, and there are no instructions in the package on how to flush the filter for use with it. Following the instructions with the product description, I flushed the filter under running water for 15 seconds. I then put the filter in my squeeze bottle, and when I forced the water through it initially came out purple-ish black as expected. After it was flushed, there was no more charcoal dust and it was ready for this bottle. Is the user expected to flush the filter by spitting out that first bottle full? I hope not, but without instructions saying otherwise there’s little alternative. The charcoal is not dangerous, of course, but it’s very unappetizing.

This is actually a great bottle and Brita did a good job with it. The issue is with the lack of ability to flush the filter to clear out the charcoal dust. There either needs to be a better instruction set to explain, or there needs to be a tool in the box for properly flushing the filter. If Brita can resolve this problem, this would be a very easy recommend; as it stands, I have reservations about that unless there’s a way to flush the filter without relying on another bottle to do it.

title: Eh, you could do better
review: You get what you pay for. It's fine for the price. Got this June 2 and the handle has been broken since about the 2nd use

title: Ok product
review: Not a bad product and will work for airsoft but pretty pliable and if not stored right can easily deform

title: I ❤️ this treadmill
review:
[[VIDEOID:26e07134efee9ac6aba8875e8a7728e5]] This was very easy to assemble! I was not sure how far to push down on the hand bar release, but to the floor did it! Instruction book was easy to follow and I am very non tech person.

I have issues with fatigue, so I am only on it for about 5 minutes at a time, but this works for me because I can use it through the day, at my convenience!.

The belt runs smoothly and I feel comfortable that I won’t slip.

When you first push start, it will beep and count down 3 seconds before the belt begins to move.

My complex has a treadmill, by the time I get dressed,, I am exhausted. I love the convenience of having it set up in my living area. I walk when I am ready! No waiting.

I have it set up by the window. I have such beautiful views, it really is like being outside. It is a good size, not too small or too large. It is sturdy.

The reason I chose this one is because the controls can be used with the remote or the handbar. When the handbar is up, the remote is not needed.

I would recommend this!

title: Same as a $10.00 pair
review: No different from a $10.00 pair

title: Gaim 2 Pound Hand Weights for Women & Men
review: Purchased these for my post spine surgery OT. Work great and will continue to use them! Very happy with purchase.

title: Doesn't strap onto rack securely
review: I got this rack bag to replace another I had which had gotten holes in it after years of use.  My previous bag had thick horizontal straps which held the bag securely to my rack, but this bag just had two skinny little vertical straps which didn't hold the bag to my rack without use of a bungy cord (not provided).  I sent this product back but the seller stiffed me on a refund.  Though I had just used it once, they would only give me half of what I paid for it.  I found another bag I had around the house (not a rack bag) that I now put on my rack using bungy cords.  If I have to use bungy cords to hold a bag on, I rather have a larger bag than this one which was supposedly made for bike racks.

title: Great Tool for Exercises for all Age Groups
review: We have two of our own and our granddaughter loved them. So, we bought this one as a gift for her. The ball is good for core strengthening exercises and many other types. Durable and maintenance-free.

title: Ok
review: Runs too small

title: Great for those who need to do some PT at home
review:
Through the years I have had a lot of physical therapy for various parts of my body like knee, back ankle and so forth. During those they have used a lot of different tools to help with the therapy. This balance board was one of them and was used especially for the three mentioned. When I saw you could just get that for at home use I figured not a bad idea for someone like me who constantly needs to do some kind of home PT anyways.

That was the right decision. It is very easy to use, does not take up a lot of room and is not very expensive. It works pretty much like the one I used at PT and is really helping me with my knee right now that has been bothering me again but is also helping me with my back. I can only recommend this for anyone who frequently or even just occasionally has to do some PT at home.

title: Flexible, well cushioned
review:
I'm riding in the Chihuahua Desert of deep West Texas and that means rough country, extreme trails with steep inclines and declines, rocks, and heat year round. I needed a better pad than the low end one a friend gave me.

This one is more flexible and "bendy" than the old one and that's good for us. It molds to my stallion's body a bit better and doesn't shift on steep climbs. The lining is fluffy and thick - it will flatten after a couple of rides and that's fine. It is wicking sweat and not getting soaked and stiff right away. My only complaint is this isn't quite as big as it said and that means I have to buy yet another, longer pad when I need to use saddle bags. However, for day rides of less than 6 hours, this is working well.

title: Stitching not holding up
review: This hat is great for sun protection. The ponytail holder is a huge plus. I’ve washed it twice now, and the stitching around the inside is already coming undone. The outer part of the hat is still good. Hoping it holds up a bit longer.

title: Nice for Back
review: This roller is really light weight. At first, I thought the 24" size was just too much. But for your back, it is a really good size. The width is nice, too. Wide enough for your whole body to be supported on it width wise. My only issue is that it is made of tightly packed styrofoam. It just has no durability. Definitely do not use it on rougher flooring. I just expected heavier duty foam and not just tight packed styrofoam. It isn't going to last long, but while it last, it does offer a good stretch through the back.

title: No instruction's, then doesn’t work.
review:
No instruction, and when I got these polls screwed in , the little bracket thing kept falling apart.
Even when together this didn’t work for a straight back.
A broom stick would have been better.
That said my granddaughters 6 and 8 like to use these to twirl with and jump.
Who doesn’t give instructions??? Don’t waste your money

title: THE ARM RESTS ARE NOT AS DESCRIBED -
review:
LEAKED AFTER 2 MONTHS...

TO LATE TO RETURN IT...

THE ARM RESTS ARE NOT AS DESCRIBED - THEY MUST BE INFLATED AND WHEN THEY ARE THEY ARE THE SAME HEIGHT AS THE MATTRESS…

NOT ELEVATED ENOUGH TO KEEP ONE FROM ROLLING OFF…

NOR TO ACT AS ARM RESTS…

THE PHOTO DOES NOT SHOW CLEARLY THE INFLATED ARM RESTS…

I THOUGHT THE ARM RESTS WERE FOAM AND THEREFORE NOT INCLINED TO OVERNIGHT DEFLATIONS…

title: Rock hard
review: Foam is rock hard & low vibration is too much

title: I like it, but I have reservations
review: This trail is certainly easier to use than some. Trying to find the eject button to get the tray for that holds the batteries out is challenging...if you have strong thumbnails or strong fingers, you won't need to bring along a weapon to press the eject button [once you remember where it is]. Otherwise, the cam fastener is a lot easier to open than some others. My reason for holding back stars is b/c it isn't truly waterproof. When I opened the tray to replace the batteries today, I discovered that inside the tray and the old batteries were sitting in water.

title: Holds quite a bit.
review: Durable and it has cute mountain 🏔️.

title: As a gift
review: I purchased this cooler as a gift for my son's baseball coach and personalized it with his name and filled it with sunflower seeds and snacks. I hope he enjoys it

title: Perfect for kid
review: These were perfect....my granddaughters loved these.

title: won' stay put
review: My shield mag will go in but when I draw the mag the holder comes out with the mag. I also tried it IWB and it does the same thing.

title: RACE SEALANT CAN NOT BE INJECTED THROUGH THE VALVE STEM - BUY THE REGULAR STANS SEALANT....
review: I bought the race sealant over the normal sealant because it plugged larger punctures.  When I got the race sealant, there is notice that the sealant MUST be poured directly into the tire!  The sealant can NOT be poured through the valve, WTF!  Why isn't that noted in the description?? I am returning it for the regular version.

title: Love them
review: Love them got two one for me and one for my friend we love using them We use them for coffee

title: Too small
review: I even ordered a size up from what I normally do, and it doesn't come past my waist. I'm not even a tall person. I'm a small Asian woman.

title: Toy for kids but really sharp
review: Jus a lil think can use it to hold things and pull things up somewhere ..the ends r really sharp the string is to thin to really hold and climb anything

title: Excellent deal.
review: Paid $69 on sale.. Great deal, quality product

title: VERY SHORT
review: Disappointed. This is for camping and little kids to sit and eat.

title: Great
review: Perfect glad I got it

title: Sturdy steel poles and net height is adjustable
review:
[[VIDEOID:df454ac17f26a46e6f59b065f7b51b86]] This is volleyball set did not disappoint. The poles are made of thick steel and don’t bend. The net is more than adequate, and it even comes with a ball and bag. My 1 star reduction is because, I think the post feet could have been larger and should be able to put a stake down through it. It could make setting up the net easier.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: NO instruction , going to PT to learn how to use this right !
review:
This is my first time trying to use this foam roller!
It's vey hard , maybe it's suppose to be!
That said there is NO instructions with this at all!!!
I went to google, but a friend said go to YouTube.

I did give a slight roll on my back, & it seemed to help., but who knows for sure!
At this point I'll go to my PT to show me how it does work.
I'm a small boned women that has Osteoporosis , and don't want to screw up my back and neck.

title: Does what I needed
review: I recently purchased a video camera and needed a camera bag. The camera comes with a microphone, handle, cords, remote, and batteries. So I needed something big enough for that. I also volunteer at my local animal shelter. I enrolled in college and was going to need to take the camera to video certain aspects of animal handling. So I needed a bag that was big enough for my camera, gear, keys, wallet, leash, and phone. This bag checks off every item. I feel safe walking around with it. It doesn't get in my way when walking the dogs and playing with the cats. When not using at the animal shelter, it is great for my camera. I had it with me one day when I had to get groceries and i forgot my normal purse. This worked just fine for my grocery shopping trip as well. This is a great little bag. I would definitely buy this again. It seems very sturdy. I am pleased.

title: Good value.
review: I am very pleased with this purchase.  The ladder on our new boat came with a four rung, telescoping ladder.  I hated it.  It was just to long.  I would think it was down completely, and then, when I stepped on it, I would get jerked down because of the last rung not being completely down.  This ladder is perfect.  Being a two rung ladder, it is what I am used to.  Easy to deploy and step on.

title: can break easily
review: I had it in the back seat of my car. Took a turn sharply and the umbrella rolled from one side to the other and the hinges broke for the canopy. I didnt have it for very long when this happened and it became a waste of money.

title: Bottle da
review: Disappointed that it came banged up even in the bubble wrap, which makes me think it was damaged before it was packaged in the box.

title: Cute Keychain addition!
review:
Cute Keychain addition!
A bit stiff at first but softened up and graphics seem high quality -- no peeling or cracking

title: Over amplifies background noise
review: My husband has tried to use this thing for several days and he finally gave up in disgust last night. He had multiple issues with it. The fit is adjustable to a minor degree, but he never got it to feel comfortable. The background noise is heavily amplified, but close up sounds, like voices are not improved. He couldn't use this thing in the truck or at a restaurant at all. He said the background wind/road noise is overwhelming while driving. It just doesn't work well.

title: They Worked Great
review: The rear brakes went out on my Salsa gravel bike a few weeks ago. I put these pads in with no problem and my full breaking power was restored. I'd purchase this product again, they work great.

title: Great For Winter Sports or Spectating
review: I am a cross-country skier and these toe warmers make it a lot more fun to exercise in the winter. They are thin and you can place them either above or below your toes. The toe warmers have an adhesive on one side that keeps them in place as you put on your boot. They provide a comfortable heat for up to 7 hours. I always carry several of these with me when I go out for a workout. This is an excellent product that will allow you to get more enjoyment out of any cold weather activity.

title: Smart!
review:
This was very quick and easy to set up. It didn't take very long at all before it was up and running. When it first arrived, the weather was extremely rainy, so my husband played around with inside the house. We had never ridden hover boards before, so we didn't have any prior experience. It requires the use of an app to control it. My husband and my 17 year old daughter have both downloaded and are the primary users. When riding in the house, they were riding on tile, hardwood, and carpet. The Segway moved over all three surfaces easily and without any hesitations. It went over the transitions smoothly. I was surprised at how fast they were able to go inside the house.

Once the weather was nicer, they took it outside. We live in a small neighborhood with minimal traffic. They have enjoyed riding in the street as well as the driveway. The app limits the speed based on how much driving you've done. The more experienced you are, the faster you are permitted to go.

It has headlights and rear colored lights. You control the hover board with your balance and leaning. My husband says if you think too much about it, it's difficult to control. Instead of thinking about how to control it, he finds it easier to think about the direction instead and has more success with it. I tried to ride the thing once and had difficulties with my balance. I haven't tried since then.It will go for about 25 miles before you have to recharge it. But my husband and daughter love it! They are considering splitting the cost of a second one so they can ride together.

title: They are nice, but hard for me to attach
review: I like the replacement band, but it took 3 days to attach it to the blaze.  I even watched a youtube channel, it just took forever to clip together.  My husband finally took over and fixed it.  It lasted for a couple of months.

title: Took about a month to receive
review: After circling around the US for about 3 weeks, I finally received. Thanks, but no thanks!!

title: Cute Bottle
review: This stainless steel water bottle works pretty well for my high school daughter. First of all, it's not too wide or large so it fits in the side pouch of her backpack. A lot of water bottles these days don't fit. The lid screws securely and doesn't leak. It is a little hard to get the ice cubes into mouth of the bottle. I find that it works best if I put in the cubes one at a time which can be a little time consuming. It does an excellent job of keeping the water chilled. There's always plenty of ice left at the end of the day. It fits pretty well into your hand. It would be nice if there was some way to keep the lid attached to the actual bottle so it doesn't get lost. It's a very nice looking bottle. The logo is pretty small and discreet. My daughter wants me to get her a vinyl initial to put on it.

title: Smaller than other Fitbit bands; VERY difficult to remove from Fitbit
review:
Ugh!!! I have 2 Fitbit bands (brand name) and 2 aftermarket Fitbit bands. I'm pleased with all. I bought this one. I liked that it had watch style clasp. It is MUCH shorter than any of my other size small bands. I can use on if last few holes. So it will go on my arm. Problem is with this style band, it needs to have some extra to go through clasp and a keeper to hold extra down. One of my other Fitbit bands is styled like this and is correct. I'm probably not explaining his very well. It would be kind of like wearing a belt on the last hole. It will fit around your waist but needs some extra to tick in to belt loops.

Also very hard to press the metal part to get it off my Fitbit to change bands.

Doesn't lineup as flush with surface of Fitbit as my other bands do

Just nothing really positive to say. Waste of mkney

title: Inexpensive Board, Fun, Get Value You Pay For
review:
Well this is an OK dartboard and I have liked it so far. In college I threw a lot and had access to a couple of dorm room boards and this one seems a little light compared to the ones we used. The darts are definitely on the light side and have a tendency to bounce rather than stick. But when I pulled my old darts out they stuck well enough.

I wish the display was a little showier and that I could see it better from a distance, but it and the electronic scoring seems to work well. I have definitely enjoyed throwing with my kids. Perhaps they will someday do some league play. They have definitely enjoyed playing cricket in the rec room. It is a cheaper board, but at a cheaper price so you are getting what you are paying for. It seems solid enough though and we have liked having it.

title: you almost need to blot yourself dry vs. how you use a normal towel
review:
I have several towels similar to this one. This one is OK but I really need to blot myself dry vs. the way I normally use a towel. This does absorb water well. It is very light and easy to pack. There are many uses for this.

Overall, I am happy with it.

title: Functional fins.
review: Functional fins that provide for longer strokes. The material feels flimsy to the touch, but when underwater they work as they're supposed to.

title: Not the best quality.
review: Feels pretty cheap. I don't know how the ball will stayed tethered to the tiny, thin connection in has from ball to rope. Rubber feels a bit thin too. No weird smell though and there is ample rope included. But I'd reccomend spending a little more money, to get something higher in quality. Franklin usually puts out great mid-quality items. This is not one of those.

title: This is perfect... if it didn't have dried tomatoes, or so much of it.
review:
The tomatoes don't belong and clash & overwhelm the otherwise harmonious flavors.

I don't think the dried tomatoes taste good in a ramen soup, which is what I wanted this for.

title: Soooo many shortcomings...
review:
I've been a Fitbit Blaze owner for a year now and don't have many positive things to say about the device. The device needs a proprietary charger, battery life is mediocre and the app software is very unreliable. There are times the Blaze refuses to connect to my phone and therefore no updates to my daily activities can be recorded. When it does connect to the app/my phone it takes a very long time to eventually upload the data to the app. The band didn't last the year - I had to replace it after 8 months.

The thing I do love about it is the ability to invite friends to step challenges... Via the app you can see what your invited friends, family and acquaintances are doing. You can set up weekday and weekend challenges along with selected popular routes around the world.

I blame myself for not liking this product more due to not researching it thoroughly before buying it - had I been aware of its many shortcomings it would have stayed at the clearance rack of the going out of business Macy's sale.

I'm looking to either get a better wearable fitness device or just use the step monitor on my Huawei Mate 9 (which seems more accurate anyways).

title: Love the easy set up!
review: We love,love,love this tent! We have 6 kids and it is roomy enough for all of us! We set this up in our yard and it was easy to set up! We live in Wyoming and it is not camping season yet! I am leaving this review for what I have experienced so far! I will edit if I have problems when we take it camping! I love all the windows and think it will be well ventilated! It seems sturdy and so easy to set up! We are so excited to go camping in it this spring! My husband and I set this up by ourselves and it was relatively easy! So far a great tent!

title: Nice quality, waist doesn't tighten enough
review:
I have this fanny pack in bright blue.

The color is lovely, very bright and pretty. The fanny pack feels durable, the fabric and zippers feel decently constructed. This thing is also pretty spacious. Will definitely fit large phones and wallets plus a couple other things.

I docked a star because this may not work the best on you if you have a smaller waist. Im a 28 in jeans and on the tightest setting this fits loose. Would still be functional cross body but this product won't fit well on other smaller people/children.

title: Five Stars
review: Great gift for my Son-In-Law, who is a big Detroit Tiger's Fan.

title: Great little bell!Hot
review: Got a new bike for my daughter, this is the perfect accent for it, works great too

title: ripped after 2nd ride
review: the straps ripped right at the seem horrible bag

title: Two Stars
review: works but nothing special

title: Keeps water out, soft silicone, anti fog , made in China.
review:
I live in the mountains on a river in Ca. And it is warming up here for the kids to go in the river.
Actually they where just in the river yesterday for a while. But they can’t wait to wear these googles when
It warms up more .
The children have so far tried these googles in the bath tub, and these do Not leak.
Pretty easy to adjust to fit them.

The kids are 6, 7 and 8. These will work out good for them in the river. Although Need to buy more.
Other googles I have bought have not lasted for the next season, although these are not expensive,
we will see., but it says there a soft Silicone, Anti Fog.
Two googles in the box, and bag these come in. One is pink, the other looks like a dark Purple!
The 7 yr old Boy won’t wear purple.!!
Made in China.

title: Perfect
review: We received a lovely wind chime as a wedding present 10 years ago.  The sail fell off and got lost.  I came across this one on Amazon.  The perfect answer.  I almost didn’t purchase due to the negative comments.  I am glad I did purchase this.  Perfect for what we intended!  Adds a nice touch.  Received quickly.

title: Torn because I wanted to love it.
review: I really wanted to love this Norman Jr. copper water bottle, but I have some serious concerns. First, the good thing(s): (1) It is aesthetically attractive. The 34oz (1liter) copper, cylinder shaped container is pretty. (2) Apparently there are health benefits from drinking water out of a copper infused container.  (3) It is easy to clean. I hand wash after adding a mild detergent with a gentle brush. And (4) it fits in a traditional cup holder (car). The bad thing(s): (1) The lid is difficult to get on and off. I am not sure what I will have to do to correct this. It is really annoying. (2) If you place cold water in this container, it doesn’t stay cold. Even if you add ice. So, taking this to the gym will not work for some. Most want cool, refreshing water after working out. And (3) condensation collects on the outside of the container which means that it gets stuff wet unlike some of the double insulated ones.  In conclusion, this water bottle looks great but has some flaws.  I can only give it 3 stars.

title: It is not for those with arthritis or hip and back injury.
review: This is an unbelievably uncomfortable aid . I would not recommend . I am returning

title: One worked, one didn’t
review: I really like the tips of these to create peaks in my tarps. Nice curved rubber too. Unfortunately, one of the poles works perfectly, the other will not lock out. It make the pole useless, as it will not get high enough to reach any tarps.

title: Two Stars
review: Might as well just do the "Twist".

title: Sooooo Cute!
review: I love this bike! Be sure you take  your measurements so you buy the right size as you cannot return it after it's been assembled. Mine turned out too big, so my daughter "inherited it;" I'm so sad about that part! I love it though

title: Great way to burn off energy indoors
review: I bought this last year for xmas and my 5 year old and 15 month old still use it all the time. My 5 year old son has a lot of energy and I wanted something for him to do indoors. When he watches tv he always gets on it and jumps around.

title: Cover
review: Not good quality

title: easily shaped to fit child's nose
review: I bought this nose clip for my granddaughter who is learning to do backwards somersaults in my pool.  The clip was easy to shape to conform to her nose.  It did require a few adjustments to fit correctly,  but once properly positioned it remained in place throughout its use.  I especially like the strap because it is thin and flexible which allowed it to rest comfortably on the head without interference. As a bonus feature, the strap allows the clip to be stored and easily retrieved from the pool's edge when not in use.  I consider this very reasonably priced nose clip to be a value-added item for summer pool fun.

title: Defective
review: I have tried a ton of times to get the included RFID Card to register. Both the RFID Key FOB and Key Card should really be pre-programmed at the factory to already unlock this gun safe. While I was able to get the Key FOB to get programmed so the gun safe recognizes it, I could not get the Key Card to sync. So, that means I was doing it right, as both are programmed the exact same way.

title: It’s ok
review: Ok it does what it should,  but straw sucks hard and hole is small to get ice in.

title: Really does stay cool
review: Really does stay cool. Going to use these when we go fishing

title: Great Bands
review: Love these resistance bands. I use them with a resistance band bar I have and they have worked great. Couldn't be happier with them.

title: Fits 24 ounce bottle perfectly
review: I love these stainless water bottles. I so appreciate being able to buy a new lid for $8 instead of a new water bottle. Lids tend to leak after a while. The lid fits perfect and seals nicely. No leaks!

title: Poor quality
review: They didn’t even last a full ride on smooth pavement. We ended up walking miles home multiple times due to flat tires. Will not buy again!!!

title: Battery lasts for 15 HOURS at best...not Days.
review: I bought this watch for its features and price. I owned another smart watch that frustrated me that it needed to be charged every day. The only difference is this watch has an app that has to be constantly running on my phone, so not only does this watch need to be charged every 12-15 hours but the App also bleeds my phone's charge as well. On the plus side, it is a light device with a comfortable band and it gives more sleep information than my Samsung Fit 2 watch did.

title: Very happy with this
review: I've had water pressure issues for a couple years. My parents camp a lot and suggested a battery operated shower, but all I could find was propane. Then I had an idea and found this on Amazon. I turn it off anytime i use soap, so I can get a lot of showers out of just one charge.

title: Handy and portable.
review: It is just as shown, we just haven't used it yet. Have had some real fire restrictions for recent summer camping.

title: good quality !!
review: This i s a good heavy quality paper for wrapping any Cardinal fans gift.  It also made a good background in a picture frame.

title: Small
review: This runs very small. I ordered a medium for my 10 pound Multipoo and it wont even button over his chest.

title: Go Chiefs!
review: Love it! Has held up well in the Florida sun and rain.

title: longboard daddy-O and the bamboo bamboozler that sheds the lbs while I shreds all  'round
review:
So, I am not joing when I say ," I am old-school" I have actually skated a drainage ditch with Stacy Peralta back in early 80's on my old PowellPeralta Bones I with all the accoutrements ; I was a punk that was in the right place , it seems, at right time for about 20 years and skated for about a decade of those.
25-30 years later, I am still thin and athletic; it pisses some folks off that I wear same pants I wore in tenth grade but LATELY I have noticed I am gaining a we bit and getting some flab that I have never had; So, in order to counter balance my engineering jobs required ' sit at computer desk for 10 hours per day" + my age I also wanted to be able to do something with my young kids that like to bike around . So, I o hunting a reasonably priced ( in case I broke something or hated it- like that could happen) long board to carve some while hanging with my kids. We have a deserted mall that has a mile and a half of empty parking lot and traffic-less road around it right down the street. So I thought I would 'test' my old love of riding with the slower, safer, more controlled for my age version of thrashing; long-board riding.
Well, let me tell you something; I was far far far off the mark; there isn't anything 'slow' about long boarding these days. In fact , the current trend is to go as freaking fast as you can and have a durometer wheel that is just right so-as to allow you to ( gasp) break the grip and slide on your darned wheels! It is called ;Free-riding' and / or sliding/ carving/ speed skating....depending on what you prefer & the terrain.
I like to freeride. I got a week in and realized that, while this thing was flexy enough for my 6' frame + 155lb body, to slide like I was seeing on video's , I needed wheels and bearing and bushings of higher quality,so I got some Bones Reds, a set of 82a durometer wider flat big 72mm wheels of "For ya Momma " wheels and proceeded to do my night riding on this setup. Talk about freaking more grip! to break and slide at my weight requires a bit more speed and a bit harder wheel. I fell at around 2am one evening ( lost 6 lbs after 4 weeks and have my abs back!) and slid with no protection on asphalt for approx 25 yards. The Helmet and pads arrived the next day. I still hurt from that one. but this board has no damage at all a, is tough as crap because of bamboo/maple/bamboo/maple/bamboo/maple/bamboo layering and also I was pleasantly surprised to find not just the kick-tail rear but a slight one frontside. Once I got some Orangutang 86a and 65mm Fat Free wheels I can use those, the Venom cone bushings and my uber fast bearings to fly like an eagle and break this sucker into a slide like I was born to do so. I am nearing a full 360 - no stop slide around and I can do the ColeySlide or whatever. My old skills from the 80's are still there and it makes my kids laugh their butts off to see a 45 year old Dad Ollie up a curb or front stand this monster. Did I mention it is REALLY long? like, it is taller than my 7 year old son. I strap it to my HiLift jack on back of my Jeep JK and most folks my age either scoff at my frivolity or jealously ogle the thing.
As I said, exercise is vital; I lost ten pounds and can really skate quite well. This thing will need more grip tape and trucks before the board is wasted it is so tough. A GREAT GREAT GREAT deal for a beginners long board and it looks bad @ssed, too. Just prepare to get better wheels ( the ones it comes with are great but just kinda middle ground...not too soft/not too hard, not to big not to small....replace em) some bearings and maybe bushings . Then go and freeride the night away . Oh, wear a damned helmet or you'll wind up typing crazy ass reviews like this , possibly.
This board kicks boot-ay. Worth every penny. I rock the Quest, and you should too.

( my setup suggestion is Orangutang Fat Free 83a - 86a , 65mm wheels . Get the best bearings you can afford- Bones Swiss are tops but I have also gotten a great ride from old worn in Speedy Lunatic ABEC3's I had from long ago; I just put precision speed lube in em. Also, depending on your weight, a more conical bushing allows for easier turning; but the ones this comes with are fine. Then, order or make some slide gloves and get a helmet and pads and BAM! you be skating to glory in America , the greatest damned country in the world. I skate for liberty and justice for all. PLus, my wife lets me and likes how my body looks 10 years younger with cool scars and leaned up. I thrash the old lady, too! Skate or Die, choice is yours ...I give the Quest board an 8.9 out of 10)

title: Five Stars
review: Great racket for the price. Much better than my old Wilson ProStaff 6.0

title: Easy to use but……
review: Kids still get water into the ears. Was a waste of money for me. Didn’t work..

title: Fades quickly.
review: This is a cute Garden flag but the colors faded very quickly. You will only get a few months out of this at best. This flag faded fast and wasn't even in direct sunlight.

title: Nice concept, but it has too many flaws.
review: [[VIDEOID:20f29cecd1c6ff67bcd9a0434416a50c]] This free standing punching bag was a bit of a disappointment. While the assembly was easy, there are a few flaws with it. The description says that you can fill the base with water or sand. It is just a flat piece of metal, therefore you cannot add water or sand to it. The rubber suction cups on the bottom of it don’t really stick to well to a tile floor. With one good hit, it will go tumbling over. Also, you cannot use on carpet or grass. It would need to be on a hard surface in order to get the suction cups to stick. One last thing is that the screws are at the top near the punching bag itself. If you miss the hit and hit your hands on the screws, it could result in an injury. It was a nice try, but I would not recommend it. There are better options out there.

title: Good purchase
review: Good and sturdy water bottle.

title: Cant sell self set lock without instructions.. I’ve included them below!!
review:
This may be a great lock option… But not if you can’t set the “self setting” combination!! Problem is, no instructions are included with the purchase and that is a must for an item that only functions IF its set up correctly!! After doing research, I found the information..

I found that the code arrives set on straight zeros… if for some reason #’s have shifted, slide them back and then eject the pin. From there- look ant the end you insert the pin.. it has a “set arrow” for you to twist. Turn each dial to the number chosen for your personal combination - WRITE IT DOWN! Then, twist out of the setting position- and done. Probably a better way to explain would be including instructions with photos from the manufacture.. but Im hoping this may make some sense!?

Lock itself feels decent. Keeping in mind any lock is hackable!! I’d only recommend attaching to something else that was solid/stationary or… Use on a bike with an alarm if your so lucky… So if someone tried to remove, it was set off of warning. The chain fibers would take some heavier hardware to get thru- But again, it’s relative… Not something that most of us would have in our household tool repertoire to break through but people that commit this type of crime prob. have invested in this type equipment.

I would say this is a lock used in situations where item can be well observed by the community and its surroundings. Would be a nice option, taking a bike to school during the day.. and has potential to step up- unfortunately, nothing will be full proof! This has ability to deter and if equipped with instructions, it would step it up a whole other level.

title: Great mat
review: Great mat! Makes it so my daughter can practice her beginner gymnastics in the house. Also there was Velcro flaps to add pieces if needed

title: Great for Camping or for Around the House
review:
This is a nice, lightweight camping blanket. It has down insulation and features a polyester exterior. The exterior feels good against the skin and is effective at repelling dirt and liquid. The blanket has a series of snaps along one side. These snaps make it convenient to wrap this blanket around you like a poncho.

I got this blanket for my wife for when we're having campfires in our back yard. This blanket allows her to wrap up and enjoy the evening. The blanket is designed to be used outdoors, so you can brush it off when you're done and not worry about bringing any sand or dirt into your house.

The blanket also comes with a stuff sack for easy storage. This is a very nice camping blanket that has a lot of uses around the home.

title: M3 is not the same as an m5
review: Overpriced junk.  All i needed was the nut because i can get m5 bolts anywhere but they sent an m3.  And m3 isn't going to hold anyways skinny or fat but on a bike seat.  And worse, it just feels like junk.

title: Four Stars
review: This product is discontinued so you can't buy additional parts from the manufacturer.

title: pass
review: Poor quality product. Size not according to pet standards vets use

title: Works
review: I have used the mojo for duck hunting for years....great product

title: They are hooks
review:
I guess as far as hooks go they are fine. They did what I needed them to do.

I am not sure why this review has to be longer than it needs to.

title: Key system is terrible
review: Not only is is hard to get the locking piece to go into the correct slot the, the key will not turn to allow you to get it out once you have unlocked and are trying to re-lock. The key jams often and is totally unusable because you could end up not being able to lock up your bike or unlock it. Terrible product, and super heavy.

title: Golf cart side view mirrors
review: These were pretty good. A little hard to fit on because the holes didn't match my cart, but I figured out a way to fasten them.

title: Three Stars
review: Nice theory but does not keep water cool.

title: My little table!
review: Perfect as side table. These are exactly the size I needed and wanted. I love that they fold to store more easily.

title: Needs More Grip
review:
When you first put your shoes on the pedal, the pedal seems like it has enough grip, but as you pedal, you quickly see that the pedals could use more grip. Perhaps the grippy part should be thicker. My shoes can slide around while pedaling, and this should not be happening on a non-slip pedal, and not ones as expensive as these.

These pedals are certainly very easy to install. They turn the bike crank smoothly. The size is nice. I am just disappointed they don't have a stronger grip while pedaling.

title: Not for long term use..
review: This is a good item but it does leak and you will have to purchase more if you plan to keep reusing the top, which I do. I go to Walmart and fill the jugs, removing the center which is hard at times to remove. It may tear and the pull off tab will break. Also it may begin to tear at the sides. I use it for water for my dogs due to so much sediment in my well water. I use a pump top on the jug to retrieve the water from the jug. If using for a day or just for a trip even cook out it will be great. But long term not so much, will be replacing them often.

title: Two Stars
review: Too small and hard to apply

title: Kids
review: Feels like something your kids can play with in the backyard.... returned soon as I checked the stakes

title: Looser on one hand
review:
Just got these delivered yesterday. I didn’t get these to work out with. I’m disabled and will be using these when I need to use my wheel chair. My hands take a little beating and I was told gloves like these would help a lot.

First trying them on, the left is looser fitting than the right and it’s a bit annoying. I’m going to fully try them out though before making a judgment call of returning them. Maybe my right hand is just bigger enough than my left that I can’t see it but the gloves show it. According to the size chart I should fit perfectly into a large. I don’t think changing to a medium would help because I’m betting they would end up being too small. It will boil down to if I can handle the difference in the feel on either hand or not.

Outside of that concern the gloves appear to be well made and as someone that use to be able to work out, I believe these would work well for that.

title: Fast shipping, great for gift giving
review: Eases of use, Great for gifts

title: Does not track swimming etc.
review: The only things trackable on the app for this device were walk, run, hike. No swimming etc as advertised. Sent it right back. I can get a pedometer to do the same thing without all the tech requirements. Sometimes less is more.

title: Order a size up
review:
I ordered a size up and I'm glad.
They are super tight but they make your bottom pop for sure!

title: Gift able
review: Could be better. But nice flag .

title: Breaks easily
review: Half of them have already broken, the hinge isn't very strong.

title: Nice and sturdy
review: This canopy is designed for two people to set it up. It was easy to assemble and put away. Took about 15 minutes to put together. Feels sturdy and It also does not take up much room so you’re free of clutter. Overall, it is a beautiful canopy.

title: Great target set for tots
review: Easy to set up and easy to use.  Feels stable and the bow has an easy enough draw for a two year old.  The arrows  stick to the target (and stay) and there is a pocket in the back for storage. Great item and my little boy is loving it.

title: One Star
review: These gloves ripped after four or five workouts

title: Slick when wet, very thin
review:
This is much thinner than I think it should be for the price point. It gets very slick when any amount of moisture is on it which isn't great. I ended up getting some nice running shoes to use while working out on it for the traction.

Other than that it's a decent-sized mat that's good for a lot of different exercises. It's nice but I think should be priced much lower. I don't know that I'd even wanna pay half of what they're charging for it honestly.

title: I like fitbit.
review: My family has used Fitbit products for years. Love this one.

title: Compact machine
review: Great little machine to get some steps in, small enough to not become an eye sore in the room and easy to put away.  I enjoy using it but would like if it has resistant adjustment

title: Not as nice as other sets I've seen...
review:
There are so many of these boxing reflex sets sold on Amazon, so you really need to separate yourself. This set unfortunately feels very lazily put together. I guess that's because we've gotten other sets, and so we can compare. The headband on this one is ugly since it uses velcro. The other set we got is just a one size fits all, no velcro. These elastic bands easily stretch, so we like the uniformed designed with no velcro much better. Both have D-loops. Also, this set says 2 levels. I weighed the black ball to be .6 ounces, and the red ball to be .7 ounces. Wow, you move up .1 ounce! LOL! The other set we have includes 3 balls, it starts you at .7 oz, goes to 2.1 oz, then 3 oz.

I give this lazy set 3-stars. Here is the link to the other set, which I gave 5-Stars. Both are vine products, so we have no dog in this fight. Just our honest opinion: https://www.amazon.com/review/R1HQSMN6PSCAOP/ref=cm_cr_srp_d_rdp_perm?ie=UTF8

title: Not The Best Dartboard I've Ever Seen...
review: Scoring is so-so, the sounds are campy, and the darts break easily...

title: Sizes Run Small
review: Love the shoes but the sizes run quite small - ordered a 7, received a 7 but fits like a 5.

title: Arrived broken
review: Great little lantern, looks like the original kerosene lanterns of old. Unfortunately the “bulb” that covers the very bright lights was separated from the lights. We thought it was supposed to be that way and we simply had to put it in place; but you can’t open the lantern part to put it in place. we took it camping with us and threw away the box so can’t return it at this point. Too bad, because it would’ve have been great except for that.

title: Worse thing ever
review: I bought it to help strengthen my legs before I go out and ride and get stuck. This is the worst thing ever. Hard to mount your bike need two people. Also once you mount it no matter how you balance the screws on the side you are pedaling slanted. Can only sit like that for a minute before my back is hurting. Then the control for resistance the screw came but there was not nut so I can't even attach it. If I was able to attach it now I have to figure a way to hold the cable so it doesn't get in the way. I would return it but my dog ate the box and the hassle it not worth it. I would say to any one looking at this product do not buy it.

title: Save your money
review:
I really do not like leaving bad reviews for products, but there is not much that is good about these goggles. They are cute so I'll give them that. But they do not stay on my son's head and they fall apart WAY too easily. They come with adjustable nose pieces, which in theory sounds like a cool feature. But in reality it just means these goggles come apart every time you try and put them on your child's head. Every time. They just pop apart as soon as you try and stretch him. I had also hoped that the extra wide band with the grippy things on the back would actually hold the goggles on his head since his other goggles always slide down, but no such luck! These goggles slide right down his head too. Which means he leaves them on for all of about 2 minutes before he wants them off again. They also don't fit his face well and therefore the water just pours in. They literally lasted about 5 minutes at the pool and then have sat at the bottom of the pool bag on each trip to the pool after that. They are completely useless. They do come in a nice case and include the extra nose pieces and what I believe to be earplugs, though we had no need to even try those out. I had really hoped these goggles would work for us, but they just don't.
*I received this product at a discount in return for my honest and unbiased opinion. All thoughts and words are my own!*

title: works perfectly
review: lost the original and bought this as a replacement.  works perfectly.  using the baby cart to tow  a puppy.. so fun

title: Strangely unsupportive.
review: Strangely unsupportive. I regret this purchase. If I had it to do over, I would go to a sporting good shop and actually sit in various models before choosing. This thing is just plain mushy.

title: Nothing special. Kind of cheap looking.
review:
These are polarized sunglasses with mirrored, colored lenses.
If you love colored lenses, you’ll love them.
The frames are lightweight and comfortable.
They are comfortable on the nose and behind the ears.
These have UV400 protection.
The arms/stems are flexible.
The frames are a light aluminum material (metal) and plastic, which makes them appear a little cheap (definitely close up, at a distance, maybe not as much).
They come in a thin case, with a cleaning cloth and small screwdriver.
In conclusion, the only real issue I have with these glasses is that they feel and look kind of cheap. This may be a good thing if you are someone who misplaces or loses their sunglasses often, but if you are looking for a chic/polished look, these might not be the sunglasses for you. These may work for teenagers (inexpensive investments with some protection) or as a groomsman gift (they would probably look cool in beach wedding photos), but as every day glasses, I wouldn’t necessarily recommend these.

title: Good quality net!
review: We are so happy we choose this net for our Liftime basketball hoop. It fit perfectly  and took 2 minutes to install.  It is very good quality.  Highly recommend!

title: Not for real weights
review: The dumbbell Tree is for 2, 3 and 4 pound weights.  It did not hold up well for 10 and 15 pound weights.  I would NOT recommend!

title: Nice and easy.
review:
Very easy to hang our Disney World pins and some others. The back is very easy to stick and remove pins. When the pins are stuck on there, I have no fear of them falling out, but they are easy enough to pull out and move. The window is super clear (though you'll have to take the protective film off). There's also a nice hook that latches to keep the window from opening accidentally.

It's currently hanging in the kids' room where they can look at the pins they acquired by trading and buying.

title: Doesn’t last
review: This product looked like a good idea for keeping things cold on the road. Unfortunately due to the cheaply manufactured item it doesn’t last long and control board breaks quickly . Definitely not recommended as there are better quality ones available at better prices and longer lasting

title: Tasty but a touch too sweet
review: I received this box of 4 Tone It Up Birthday Cake Protein Bars on 1/11/21 and they have a Best By date of 5/6/21. They smelled and looked good when I opened one up. The taste was similar to a granola bar but not as crunchy. They were a tad on the sweet side, probably thanks to the lines of frosting on top. And, oddly enough, I could have sworn I tasted cinnamon but according to the ingredients list there is no cinnamon in them. A few minutes after I had finished the bar, I had a oat flavored chalky after taste in my mouth. Overall, they were tasty but a touch too sweet for me and I didn't care for the after taste.

title: Total Waste of Money
review:
I had high hopes for this. Boy was I disappointed.

First it is very small as in short and narrow. I don't know too many adults that could sit on this. Maybe a swimsuit model, but not a regular person.

Secondly, it is fairly difficult to put together by yourself. My husband and I struggled to get it together and I would not have been able to do it by myself. There is a lot of tension on the frame when you are inserting it into the fabric. Because of this, I don't see the average person taking this apart every time and rolling it back up.

No way it could be table. Way to small. After you sit on it, the fabric stretches out and there isn't anywhere that is level enough to use.

Gonna make a nice cat bed since that is about all that will fit on it comfortably.

title: too snug
review: The shorts fit well for the most part; however, they are cut oddly in the crotch. I would not buy them again.

title: Good quality and he loved it!
review: Bought for my grandson - a racing fan - he loved it.  I feel bit pricey.

title: Five Stars
review: A great and cute ornament for my theme tree - Go Broncos!

title: Pump did not pump air 😕
review: Pump did not pump air.  Had it shipped to my son’s house and it did not work. 🙁

title: threads busted
review: it just free spins now used it on a chain then went to do it again and i saw metal shavings fall off it the threads got ate up by it's own mechanism (canible?)

title: Much smaller than expected
review:
Every household should have some sort of emergency care kit. I was very interested in this one, as it looked to contain a lot of options. I chose the camo pack option.

First off, I was shocked by how small this kit actually is...it looks much larger in their photos. This is about the size of a sheet of paper. Very compact.

Yes, it has a lot in it, but not a lot of anything in particular. To really make it handy, you'd need to add a lot more bandaids in various sizes, and some sterilization wipes.

That being said, it is still a good purchase and great to have on hand. This would be a perfect kit to keep in the trunk of your car. The pack it comes in is well-made and pretty sturdy.

Overall, I honestly think there are better kits out there, but nothing inherently wrong with this one either. Definitely a good second kit or car kit.

title: A must for your practice
review: A little difficult to figure out how to use initially, but a good product once you do!

title: What a piece of crap!
review: First one I ordered was broken. So I returned it. Second one arrived in a box that looked like it had been mauled by a bear. Then I notice that the leg locks come unlocked with the slightest pressure. Let me reiterate that. THE ONE SAFETY FEATURE OF THE BENCH KEEPING THE BENCH FROM COLLAPSING AND YOU DROPPING WEIGHTS ON YOUR BODY BECOMES UNSAFE WITH THE SLIGHTEST PRESSURE. I'd be shocked if there aren't any lawsuits against this company right now.

title: Works for Western/Frontier type bedroom
review:
Purchased to sit on the wall as a decoration for our Western/Frontier motif bedroom.
Hanging on one wall is a authentic (handed down many generations) musket/long rifle. We didn't have a powder horn (it went to someone else many many years ago and is now lost). Another wall has Replica 1850-75 bow, arrows/quiver, bone knife (more plains look). So this powder horn looked a close enough mix for both.
Hung it above the nightstand. I need to age it yet and take oil to the strap to give it more patina.
tried to pull out the stops... wow they were jammed in. not sure how this could be used in the field, many for enactors but not for real with rapid reloads needed.

title: POOR quality
review: So cheaply made it’s ridiculous.

title: Pretty and Waterproof, but Very Thin
review:
My wife and I like a good picnic and while we do not get to go as often as we would like, we go when we can and we have a good time. I have an actual picnic basket with a red and white checkerboard tarp which is ok but it is not very large and not insulated enough to provide any cushion from the ground. I looked to this blanket as a possible solution. It’s very attractive and it is very clearly a good water barrier, but it offers nothing in the way of padding or insulation.

This is a large blanket, roughly 6'x4.5', which is quite a lot larger than others I have used. It has a very pretty blue plaid pattern and it folds up very compactly so that it is about the size of a handbag. Being so compact it can be packed up and taken anywhere, and the only thing it lacks is a handle to make it even easier to carry though not having a handle is hardly a problem.

The back of this blanket is a hard, semi-smooth material somewhat resembling vinyl but more rugged (it is more like a grilling mat). This provides a great barrier against moisture and protects even when put on a very shallow bit of standing water (though the top will get wet not by soak-through but by submersion).

My main complaint with this blanket is that it is so thin and lightweight that it really does not provide any insulation on hard ground. I was hopeful that it would be more like a thin layer of wool but it’s more like a sheet of material bonded to a plastic backing. That is the sacrifice made to make this so easy to compact.

This is not a bad blanket by any means. It is a good blanket if you need something that can seat several people and it is very pretty. That said, do not expect much in the way of cushion with it. It’s a great choice if you want to sit on damp ground and if you need to pack it for a trip and are short on room.

Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: Faulty stitching, poor window design
review:
Let me preface my review by saying that I absolutely HATE tent camping. However, there are places in the Big Bend region of Texas that you can only access by horseback or on foot. And that requires tent camping. I ride.

After 4 nights in the northern most reaches of Big Bend Ranch State Park, using this tent, I have not revised my opinion of tent camping in general. I made base camp in a remote, long unused old ranch camp which offered a covered 2 sided shed to put the tent under. It was 103 on day 2, so shade is critical. Rain wasn't a concern at all, so I cannot speak to the tent's ability to stay dry inside or not.

It is perfectly capable of staying stupid hot though. The window covers don't roll up properly or stay up when you manage to finagle them up. So any breeze passing by, passes you by.

Additionally, the hook at the center top for a fan or lantern was already coming unstitched the first night. Fortunately, I was sleeping outside where it was cooler when the lantern fell.

Those two issues aside, the tent weighs very little. It pops up and is fully supported in a minute with little effort at all. Taking it down on day 5 was equally simple. It's not really a 3 person tent unless you're tiny people who really like to snuggle.

title: The perfect bag
review: Perfect! I bought it to carry my work card and cell phones in because the phones weigh me down . The perfect bag for e everyday, everywhere!

title: It's just OK, not as high quality as I'd expected
review:
Just OK....The shipping package was bulky so it's a 2 person job to get it into the house.
it's bulky to move around the house, too. Not a breeze to assemble either ( never managed to get the stretchy piece on that is supposed to go around the outer edge) . Safety rail wobbles & can't seem to tighten it.
Unfortunately, I didn't get this put together and used enough times before 30 days expired so can't return it.

title: Lightweight for reasonable cost
review: This chainring (66 g) is just over half of the weight of my current SLX chainring (125 g), and it is even 2 teeth bigger (32 vs 30). On a dollar per gram basis (the difference is about $5), that is a pretty good ratio. The chainring was easy to install, and I have the isoar chainring direct mount tool, which worked perfectly. The chainring works well, but I’m sure the lightweight aluminum will wear more quickly than the steel teeth of the SLX version I replaced. But I’ll have to update this review after using it for a while.

title: Very nice product
review: Good value

title: Useful items in a compact and convenient package
