review: This is one of those things you hope to never use, but you will be thankful to have when it is needed. Overall the quality is good. The buckle is a nice, thick plastic and the compass, while very small, is accurate and agrees with my phone. There also seems to be a generous amount of parachute cord, but I didn’t unravel the parachute cord as it is probably only meant to be pulled apart once. Next, the flint was easy to shave. And last, the shaver is pretty sharp, so it could do more than just that one function. I wouldn’t recommend storing the bracelet unbuckled as you could easily cut yourself or whatever the bracelet is stored in. I will keep one these in my daypack. It doesn’t take up much space and is very lightweight.

title: Great tasting - worth trying if you never have tried it before.
review: It's really Great Tasting. Only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is that as good as it is, I think it's a bit expensive. But I also think it's worth trying at least once if you've never tried it before.

title: Dulls quickly
review: I used the knife 4 times to filet branzio.  It is very dull and won’t sharpen.  I have a chefs choice sharpener that is great with my other knives.  Any advise?

title: Better than nothing, but flimsy
review:
When compared to our actual LifeStraw brand filters, this one feels cheap and flimsy. A water filtration system is a must if you camp or hike and this is probably better than nothing at all.

The end caps don't stay on and that's a contamination concern out on the trails. The included bag is really cheap, thin plastic with sharp edges. It was just garbage and I threw it out.

The straw seems to filter, but there's no way to really know how well. I have this in a ziploc bag in our car as part our emergency desert kit. But the one I carry in my hiking or horse trekking pack is the original LifeStraw.

title: Runs very small
review: These run very small and they aren’t high waisted at all, so if you have a butt, size way up.  I normally wear a size medium in workout pants like this, and I can barely get these up.

title: Returned because I'm not using them they have never even been taken out of the box
review: They I have never been taken out of the box but I won't be using them so I returned them I don't know why it shows up to give a review. But I resented having to buy batteries when everything else except remote controls seem rechargeable

title: Olympic commercial grade dumbbells….
review:
[[VIDEOID:d442e92f573befd37d32d9ba1866097f]] Wow, these are heavy duty and made to last!!! Each bar is 12.5 lbs. They are very easy to grip. The bearings are smooth and natural. They also include 4 clamps to load up the weights. Max weight 350 per bar. I’m not there yet, lol. Great for all types of strength training. I like the helpful exercise chart that is included for some lifting ideas.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Versatility
review: Love the colors and this makes it really easy to change the length so I can carry it more easily.

title: Gave me a headache and my hair was still wet
review: I have a hard time getting it to cover all of my hair. It slowly rides up while wearing. After it rode up in the back, my hair got soaking wet anyway. And then I ended up with a massive headache because of how tight it felt on my forehead. It may just be that I need a bigger size, but I ordered the size it told me to. Also, I do have a lot of hair, so maybe with long thick hair you should go a size up?? Either way, I’m not super impressed with what I have.

title: Easy to wrap handlebar tape that is grippy but not too tacky
review: I’ve used lots of different types of handlebar tape and this is one of my favorites. There is enough friction for a solid, nonslip grip, but it is not too sticky (I’m looking at you lizard skins tape). This is also easy to install. Some of the cork tape I have used in the past were difficult to wrap smoothly.

title: Portable and Lightweight
review:
Cornhole is a fun game that brings back memories of “Toss-Across” for me. I never had heard of, or played, cornhole until it was introduced to me at a social gathering relatively recently. I have wanted my own set for taking to family functions and picnics with friends, and this set is well suited for these situations.

I will start with this: I received the tailgate version which is a little smaller than the regulation size set. The difference is that the boards are a foot shorter. That’s ok, but it does mean that my set is not suitable for true tournament play and instead is geared for casual competition. Both sized sets are available here; make sure you get the size you want. While it may be a little smaller, it has two distinct advantages. First, it is lighter so it is easier to carry. Second, because it is smaller it is more compact and can be stored (and transported) more easily too.

This set is made to be portable. Most sets I have seen have been made of plywood and have fixed legs. To move them is awkward and often unwieldy. This set instead has an aluminum frame and lightweight boards so the weight is substantially reduced. The legs fold under, allowing the set to lay flat. This makes it a lot easier to pack the set for travel and to store it away when not in use. An important detail – when the legs are down they lock in place with a metal bracket so the board will not collapse.

The set comes with 8 bean bags, 4 blue and 4 red. These are regulation size and are interchangeable with other sets.

So far my family is very pleased with this set. It is made very well, it is compact and portable, and because this set (in my case) is the tailgate version it is lighter and easier to store when not in use. This is an easy product to recommend.

title: Basic Bag with Awkward Closure
review:
I like to go on short hikes and since my hikes usually vary from 3 to 10 miles, I prefer to have an assortment of backpacks to fit the need. One thing I lack is a lighter, smaller, more basic backpack and this need convinced me to add this CBRSports bag to my backpack collection.

As for the size of this backpack, it is about what I expected. The 25 liter capacity makes it smaller than most of my other backpacks, but still large enough that it can handle what I need for a hike of a few hours. It doesn’t have tons of pockets and compartments. It is more basic, so it works well when basic is all I need. And it is easily foldable and lightweight, so you can store it most anyplace.

This sports bag passes the size test for a short hike, but there are certain aspects of the design that bother me. The most annoying is the Velcro closure. Look at the top and you will see the Velcro strips. They are on opposite sides of the bag and to use them, the only way you can make them touch is to fold and roll the top. This is quite awkward and it made me wonder if I was doing something wrong. But this is how it works. You can barely get the Velcro strips to touch and even when they do, the security is not as good as it is with other bags.

Another issue I have with this sports bag is the smell. It’s an odd chemical/petroleum type of smell and even after a few weeks of use, it is still present. If you like the scent of gasoline, then you may not mind but I don’t like it. I am hoping that maybe it will fade over time.

For a medium sized backpack, this CBRSports bag is a decent option. It can help you carry your water and supplies for a jaunt in the woods and it’s easy to store. But with the awkwardness of the Velcro seal and the odd scent, this bag can only be rated average overall.

title: Reversed
review: Absolutely top notch far as quality. Except that, it's reversed. Instead of extending back (as I assumed it would) it actually extends forward. As such, it is useless for me. PAY ATTENTION TO THE MOUNTING HOLES AND MATCH WITH RECEIVER BEFORE BUYING

title: worth the money
review: I like how easy it is to store with my shower head. perfect for camping or any other water emergency. would buy this again

title: just does not work anymore light use
review: whgen it worked the 3 times i needed it it worked great the 4th time how ever it no longer pumps

title: Cheaply made!
review: Very poor quality!......Like a toy!......Did NOT trust it so I returned it!

title: Eh Backpack with a Great Logo - Not Worth the Money
review:
When I saw this Gator backpack by Franklin I was excited to get it - but now that I’ve used it I am left underwhelmed.

The logo is EXCELLENT. The modern Albert head logo embroidered on a royal blue field circled in orange - affixed permanently to the heather grey shell outer fabric of the backpack does look great.

Unfortunately that is about the extent of what I like about this backpack.

The outer shell material is excessively stiff and the inner liner shell feels like cheap polyvinyl material that crinkles loudly anytime you move it.

The overall design makes poor use of space and offers almost no built in organization methods, unlike most backpacks.

The outer pocket, where typical backpacks have an area to hold things you need to access easily - writing utensils, keys, wallet, etc - this one opens to a large pocket that encompasses the entire front with only a small mesh divider that rises to the level of the zipper. If you attempt to keep something there the first time the backpack is carried in any way but vertical everything in this pouch mixes within the larger front pocket.

Each side has mesh places to hold water bottles or possibly an umbrella. Unfortunately these are made so small that while you can force a typical water bottle into it - it’s not easy.

The main compartment has 1 divided area that is created with the crinkly material and elastic. It will hold a small laptop but the depth of this bag is so minimal that if that was in it there would be little room for anything else.

While the ergonomically shaped straps have padding and meshed fabric for ventilation the back does not.

The bottom of the bag has 2 zippers that open and reveal the ball hammock that extends from one pocket then buckle clips within the other with 2 plastic buckles. I managed to use this to hold a beach towel once but for the most part I’ve found that feature a waste.

At this price point there are vastly superior backpack options. In regards to functionality, overall design and materials used this backpack is poor and I would not recommend it.

I would advise finding another Gator backpack or attaching an embroidered Gator logo to a quality backpack.

title: I use them to keep my hair back while washing my face.
review:
These LKBOX Workout Headbands are comfortable and stay on. They do not slip while I am exercising and they are easy to put on before the workout and easy to remove afterward. I also like using them to keep my hair back while washing my face.

My package contains 3 headbands and 5 hair ties. One white and light gray, one black and gray, and one black. The back to the headband is thinner with a piece of elastic. It is sewn down twice on each side of the elastic to prevent the elastic from coming out. They come individually wrapped and then put into another plastic bag.

I have recommended these LKBOX Workout Headbands to family and friends.

title: Good idea but not sturdy
review: Strap that is attached to spike broke upon second use

title: Its a good unit overall
review: Its a good unit overall.  What I didn't like about it was that the bib tends to leak down your shirt, so you will look like a moron in a photo opp.  I think the tube should come out of the center if you want it to rather than one side or another.  The reason is because if you put it in a back pack and want to zipper it up around the tube, you don't leave the pocket half closed because the tube is on one side or the other.  Depends on how your pack zipper construction is.  Sometimes it will work as is, other times is wonky.  Its well constructed, but needs another few rounds of design review feedback.  I don't think the molle setup was good enough to attach to my day pack with only 4 attach points  You would really need to attach it through multiple loops for an external carry especially if you wanted to attach anything the back of the molle.  I ended up just puting it inside my pack, which makes the molle pretty useless and expensive.  Might as well just got a bladder and saved the money.

title: Not good for women’s bikes
review: Did not like the engineering of this product and it didn’t work well with a woman’s bike.

title: Good product
review: Can't go wrong with good fishing supplies. These work wonderful

title: On-the-go chair
review: This was extremely heavy when it came in the mail; heavier than I originally thought it would be. However, when I unpacked it I could see the quality and durability of the seat. This was originally intended as a seat to be used on the go. It would be great for attending your kids sports games or even in the living room when my spouse plays video games. I like how it folds up and is easy to carry so it can be transported with ease. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an "on-the-go" chair.

title: Looks like the picture
review: Bought it for my son and he is very happy with it.  It has tons storage compartments.

title: Love this water bottle
review: Great water bottle. Holds a lot of water and easily use ice cubes. The strainer is an extra bonus.

title: Huge! Roomy shower 🚿
review:
As you can see from the picture the shower tent is enormous! Our son is 6'5" and he was perfectly content inside. It was so nice to use our outside shower on our fifth wheel and be comfortable. No arms touching the sides. The only thing it's missing is the option to fully unzip all the windows That way I could have chosen what side my door went on and possibly hooks to actually hold something like a shower head. I'm not sure the two small hooks in the middle top of the shower tent would hold anything like a bag of water. It is not fade resistant. 2 months of consistently being up and it's faded and has multiple holes in the bottom even though we had a rubber matt underneath.
All in all it was a good shower. Will it last longer then one or two seasons I'm not so sure.

title: Best I have ever used. Has many other uses.
review:
I like how compact everything nicely fits into a very durable case. All of the accessories are quality made. I have used gun cleaning kits from many other manufacturers for cleaning engines and restoration cleaning of antiques. This one I can tell it will last it might be slower in ways compared to other methods yet it is gentle and really does an amazing job. Pulling the debris away from all of the areas that you do not want debris to be is critical for the life of everything from a firearm to an engine or anything else that requires the use of a cleaning kit like this. When you are finished using the kit clean everything up, put it away and you should have a tool kit that will last a long time. This is not a disposable or junk kit it is built to last just dont force it use common sense read instructions. I highly recommend this kit for anyone who is learning about firearms because it is simple to use. Used as the instructions say your not going to harm your investment you will protect it along with learning more about your firearms or whatever else you are cleaning. Give one of these a try you might like it. I know that I am very pleased with my purchase. Thank you.

P.S. if you like a bore snake I think you would be extremely happy with one of these kits it does a much better job.

title: Not effective AT ALL at first, but I have since gotten it to work.
review:
I just bought this because I have having issues with blue jays harassing my cats outside the windows and making ruckus.

I put this thing outside on a chair and the freaking blue jays were sitting next to it and on top of it (inches away on the arm and on top!!

EDIT: Instead of tossing this, I thought perhaps the positioning was an issue. You don't see hawks sitting on a lawn chair in a patio (though I still find it unacceptable that bluejays were landing 2 or 3 inches from it on the same chair to hassle my cats inside that were going nuts).

So I removed the red plug at its base and mounted it on top of a stick that was in place to keep a tree from leaning. I also bought the "Gardeneer By Dalen Holographic Scare Tape Reflective Scarecrow Ribbon" from Amazon and added a couple of foot long strips to the top of each of its wings.

I've since seen the blue-jay fly by but not land in my yard a few times and not at all the past couple of days. Same with the squirrel that was eating my mulberries and breaking its smaller branches. So going to change this from 1 star to 4.

title: Great mini football
review:
This is NOT a regulation sized football, let's get that out of the way. This is for kids with small hands who want to learn how to catch and throw around the yard. I have a teenager and a 4 year old who want to play together, and this is great for them to mess around with outside. The feel is pretty authentic, the quality of the ball is there, it's just smaller than a normal sized one.
It comes deflated (no Tom Brady jokes, please) with an included travel pump which is pretty nice. The needle of the pump fits inside the pump handle so you can keep it around in case of accidental deflation (still respect to Mr. Brady, please people!). Get your favorite official NFL-branded team logo on it, and have some fun!

title: DEFECTIVE
review:
WE MADE THE MISTAKE OF WAITING MORE THAN 30 DAYS TO RETURN AND SCHWINN WOULD NOT BACK UP THERE PRODUCT.
EVERY TIME WE TURNED IT ON - IT BLEW A FUSE. NOTHING IN OUR HOME HAS EVER BLOWN A FUSE BEFORE AND WE TRIED IT IN SEVERAL ROOMS. WHEN IT BLEW A FUSE IN EVERY ROOM, EVERY TIME IT WAS TURNED ON, WE KNEW IT WAS THE TREADMILL.
DO NOT BUY!

title: Too big and heavy to carry on a bike.
review: Nice multi tool but too big and way to heavy for carrying on a bike.  I should have looked at it in a bike shop before buying it from Amazon.

title: Five Stars
review: Fun, crazy hat for game day! A must for any NFL fan!

title: NOT FOR HOT LIQUIDS; only keeps liquids cold; it is leakproof
review:
I am INCREDIBLY disappointed because I ordered this for hot liquids because the Amazon description says "double-wall vacuum insulated to maintain cold or hot temperatures." However, once I received this and saw the plastic / rubberized tip and a similar type straw, I thought there is no way this is for hot liquid. I was right. After reading the attached card (see first photo), it says this is not for hot liquid. I have so many cold liquid containers that I did not want another one. This is also expensive and is not worth the purchase for just a cold beverage container when it was a hot liquid container that was wanted.

Nevertheless, it works very well for cold liquids very well. This comes in three pieces (reservoir, top, straw). The straw gets screwed into the top. The tip is pliable and has to be sipped with strong suction. My water stayed cold all night long. I did put several ice cubes in the container with my tepid water and it felt like it came out of the fridge after about 12 hours.

In addition to its thermal properties, it is also leakproof.

In summary, this is four stars as a cold beverage insulating container but zero stars for hot simply because the straw and tip are not suitable for that. Had this "hot liquid" incorrect claim not been made on the Amazon site (which is how all purchasers make decisions), I would have rated this 4 stars.

title: pump broke before I could give it any air
review: First there are no instructions or suggested exercises that would help a novice. Also, the product and others like it claim that it helps strengthen back muscles. I don't know because the pump broke before I could give it any air. Tried to fix the pump, but no dice. I think, if you want a quality product, then choose a different brand. I love most Amazon products, but this one needs to go back to the drawing board.

EVEN WHEN FULLY CHARGED -

I really like the feel of the bamboo handle. It’s pretty easy to use it does take some practice, which I recommend. It’s very light, very compact, and easy to keep stored in your vehicle or backpack. I would definitely order this for something like this again

review: Works well with device, padded, snap hook nice zipper, dies a good job

title: Buyer beware 4 months later belt is torn!!!!!
review: Let me start by telling you that I'm a fit 135 lb 5'6 woman with a 27" waist. In order to wear this I have to cinch it up and I used safety pins on both sides to hold the excess straps from flapping around. The pack itself is great for carrying your phone, keys, gels, etc while running or riding your bike. The problem is the quality of this belt. I bought it in March 2019 and by July 2019 (just 4 months later) it is already falling apart. I only use this at most 2 times a week while cycling to hold my phone. I have another smaller pack with an elastic waistband I prefer for running. The neoprene like material used on the sides of the pack seems to be a very bad choice. If Nathan fixes this defect it would truly be a fantastic belt. I love how the top zipper entry makes the accessibility super nice! It makes pulling your phone in and out much easier(especially while riding) much better than on the front of the pack. There is a separate zipper compartment on the bottom which I use to carry my chapstick. Top zip pack rule! If the belt had a stretchy elastic belt that would also increase the desirability of this wait pack. Nathan fix this issue! Not good business if customers are having to replace something just 4 short months later:/ I should have listened to the many other reviewers who also complained about the same problem...... live and learn. On to search for another pack that is more durable.

title: Seems to help my girl with her summer itching!
review: I wasn't expecting this to have much effect, but it really helps my 14-year-old to an amazing degree when we have to be in the heat for a little while. Even more important to me, she's been itching like mad this week and developing hot spots, and all the usual remedies (Benedryl, expensive hydrocortizone shampoo) weren't providing much, if any, relief. I tried putting on the cooling vest (wet) even though we were inside a cool house, and after a little while, she stopped itching almost completely. This effect lasted through the night (I kept it on her dry at that point) and into today. The peaceful picture I've attached shows a dramatic change from the last several days. I don't know whether it's the cooling effect or the comfort of the vest, but I'm thrilled!! Worth every penny.

title: Really impressed by this knife
review: Just got this today. Was a little worried because there are not any reviews online except for on here, when i opened the box picked up the knife and flipped it open and was just awe struck between deployment, grip, and build quality. Its built like a tank, no wobble, just solid. It also looks amazing the pictures dont come anywhere close to doing this thing justice. Outburst assisted opening is awesome, u feel tension and then bam blade is open and locked almost instantly. Really really well built design. Framelock works perfect and provides a big hunk of metal to lock the blade but is easily unlocked and does not stick. Just really impressed with this knife oh and it came super sharp. Sliced through some thick cardboard like a fresh razor. If i could have put 6 stars i would have.

title: Now it doesn't work at all... I am returning this.
review:
Update... after charging approximately 3 times, now it won't turn on or do anything at all.

I chose this one because it was more attractive than most of the others. It does tell time, and measure heart rate and BP. The touch screen doesn't work, or works intermittently. I have to go to the app on my phone and tell it to take my blood pressure. So, for $50, it might be an adequate, portable blood pressure monitor. That is what I wanted it for, but I'm not really sure how accurate it is. I like that you can customize the display. Upload your own photo, decide what information you want it to show on the face. The pedometer is not accurate; I can log up to 30 steps while I am sleeping! But as a general measure of activity level, I suppose it is somewhat useful. The sleep monitor is okay and makes a pretty graph on my phone... but I frequently get up during the night to use the bathroom, and then it stops recording, so I am not getting an accurate reading there either

title: Easy storage.
review: Practical and legal safety product.  Easy to carry on any type of boat/canoe/kayak.  This is one of those items that  you don't need until you NEED it (stopped by marine patrol or just need to let others you need assistance).  We boat on all types of waters and in different types of vessels.  I always "over carry" safety equipment because you never know if the marine patrol will be extra picky about things.  Several times, on inland waters, I have given other boaters safety flags, whistles....when they were about to get a ticket.  They can get the lecture from the officer; however, they learn that other boaters are there to help them.

title: Useful Kit, Ruined by Bad Case
review:
I selected this first aid kit to carry with me while backpacking. My thinking is that it is small and light and will have the basics down. I also knew that a full first aid kit would be better, but the asking price is low enough that it makes sense for many situations. The kit itself is fine, but like other reviews have stated the case in which the kit is stored is terrible.

I won’t rehash the contents of the kit - that’s in the product description.

The case is a side-latch case about the size of a deck of cards. The whole problem is the hinge. Mine came out of the package cracked and I can see a gap in the plastic where it should be closed around the pin, and it is a matter of time before it snaps completely and won’t close at all. My solution was to move everything to a small Lock-n-Lock which is actually waterproof and can take a lot more abuse. I will try to fix the original case with a glue gun and hope that it holds up better.

I cannot recommend this kit, even at the low asking price. The whole point of this kit is a small, compact and water resistant kit that can go anywhere. Instead, this is a kit with a fragile container that you’ll need to replace, and in that case it makes more sense to get a different kit anyway.

title: Broke after a few months
review: I ordered this 2 months ago to use while running or biking. Today the connector between the hose and the bag broke, spilling water all over the place. I really liked this product but I expected it to last much longer. I was not rough with it and only used it as intended.

title: Good cooler !

title: Excellent
review: Wonderful color and worked for what I needed it for.

title: I Almost Gave Up On Jumprope.. Until This One
review:
I have always wanted a jump rope, but can never find one that works well for me. Let's see how this one worked out.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This jump rope is very interesting. The rope itself is a transparent coated cable. The handles are easy to hold, and there is an easy adjustment where you pull the rope through and tighten it down to get it the right length. You can even trim if you want to. It has a carrying bag which makes it easy to store and take with you.

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
I found that once it was at the right length, this was very easy to use. It worked perfectly. It was the perfect weight, went through the air well and was easy to hold too. I did not trip or struggle with it on pavement OR grass.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For a great jump rope that is easy to adjust, perfectly weighted and easy to use, this is a great choice.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. I finally found a jump rope that works for me! Having a carry bag is key as well.

title: will not fit a head measuring 23-inches.
review: my head is 22.5, and this hat was super tight.  suggest if your head is 21.5 or smaller, this might be ok.  also, the brim of the hat does not have any stiffener or reinforcement.  the hat comes folded and the brim had a big crease through it that I could tell was going to stay forever.

title: Carbide Cutter for RCBS Trim Pro
review: Carbide Cutter for RCBS Trim Pro.. Ordered one from Amazon and when arrived was not in a green sealed RCBS packet but a clear zip lock. The threads were poorly cut.. would not even begin to thread. I suspect this was not even an original RCBS product.  RCBS wanted me to send but did not offer to pay... so back it went to Amazon for a speedy replacement. The new one was in an expected RCBS packaging. Threads are still a little rough... but finger threaded 3/4 way without problem then tightened up. This is the first RCBS product I have been disappointed with quality wise and disappointed that RCBS Customer service did not seem interested in helping me till I shipped a defective product back at my own expense. It is a better choice than replacing with another OEM cutter... hope it fits the 3 way trimmer I ordered.. Also agree that for the price why no set screw?

title: Crazy fast to blow up AIR ONLY Balloons.  LOVE IT
review: Game Changer for parties.  But watch the Video now.  The directions for knotting them is not in the booklet. The box comes with two KNOT makers. Cord is about 5 feet.  So it's great to plug in near an outlet and use on a table. Rocket fast. The photos and videos show some nice decorating ideas. It really is 5 stars.  I know that some may NOT like that it ISN'T a HELIUM one  but the ideas in the photos were fun and creative.  I live on the Coast so we can't use those type of balloons anyway. Believe it or not Helium is banned here. So this was AWESOME to have. I will never go back to the Flower shop and buy them.  I used big balloons for my first project. 6 inches flat from package.  Super nice look.  Strong too. Lasted for days!

title: Sizing is incorrect
review:
Pros: Easy to blow up. I did so just by blowing air into the tube and it took me about 30 seconds to fill it with air. Material for the tube trainer is similar or the same as material that would be used for a swimsuit. The item does float, but I only tried it alone in a pool because my 4 year old could not fit the item. The inner tube seems to be made of what a normal pool float would be made of so I'm not sure of the durability, but I would compare it to that.

Cons: Huge logo on the front is kind of an eye soar. The bottom loop is pretty uncomfortable, especially for boys. The biggest problem is the sizing. This item is advertised to fit kids ages 3-6, but the sizing guide says they are for kids 27-35 pounds and 34-40 inches tall. These measurements are not equivalent to kids 4+, unless they are smaller than the average sized kid. An average 4 year old is about 40 pounds and 40 inches tall so they would not be able to fit this item. I tried this on my four year old, who is tall for his age, so his height and weight are above average, but I was thinking since it said it goes up to the age of 6, it would fit him. The top part fit him just right and he weighs 42 pounds and is 45.5" tall, but I don't see a kid any bigger than that being able to fit into the top half. The bottom half did not fit him because obviously he is above 40 inches tall.

Opens very easily.
Don't know what Green Berets use this; doubtful it is the proud men & women serving in the armed forces of the USA.
Went into the recycling bin. Maybe it's next life will be better !

title: Perfect quality and gift!
review: Perfect colors and clarity - well designed.  Well worth the wait - he loved it!

title: Good concept, could use some polish
review:
I wanted to be impressed with this, I really did. I love the concept, I love the size, and the Bluetooth connection for app stats. But it just feels like it could have used more quality control. The instructions are a little difficult to assemble, and it doesn't instill me with confidence in durability.
Also, maybe this is true of all under-desk bikes, but I imagined that this would be easier to use than it is. You can't sit at a comfortable angle when doing this, so it won't really work at a normal desk or couch. I'd honestly rather get on a real exercise bike where I can sit comfortably and watch TV rather than try to work around this at my desk.
At the end of the day, its an ok product. It works, but it has potential to be so much more.

title: Don’t fit right
review: I’ll never buy this brand again. Very cheaply made!

title: No bar ends on ends of pipe will cut you
review: No bar ends in the picture of item pipe ends are covered in real life they are open on both ends and are very sharp i cut myself on them I added a picture to show what I mean the ends of the pipe are open and the edges are very sharp I sanded mine down they are still sharp

title: Good Size Cooler!
review: Our large, plastic cooler with wheels is often overkill for our needs since the kids are away at college. Plus, the handle doesn't extend easily any more. This rolling cooler is a better size for my husband and me. The handle extends well. The wheels glide easily. The bag can accommodate a good amount of food or beverages. It's perfect for taking drinks and lunch for the day. You can access the interior without opening the whole lid. So far it hasn't had any leaking issues. We tend to use reusable ice packs instead of ice anyway. Overall, I am pleased.

title: These chairs are great
review: Comfortable Lightweight foldable and carries on the back. leaving your hands free to carry more important liquid essentials.

title: Hated it
review: Super gross.

title: Great Bags!
review: I've bought many of these bags from the direct website and they have all been great. Perfect size and up to regulation.

title: Horrible so called gloves
review: Had to peel them apart..feel like they are on backwards when wearing..all finger are same length..soooo baaaad!!

title: I love this bag !!
review: The perfect sling bag ! Cute !

title: Should have been part of original machine
review: It definitely made a noticeable difference in stabilizing the unit.  However making this a separate item and charging 30 bux to boot is not very business friendly.  This unit should have been originally offered with a choice of the foot that it comes with and this one....period.

title: Bankruptcy
review: It’s a piece of crap!  I tried to return it but they emailed me they went bankrupt!  No returns and no credit!  I give it to my son for Christmas!  So disappointed!

title: Be a Chief!
review: This is a cute Kansas City Chief’s jersey/t-shirt. It is made of a breathable polyester material. The Chief’s logo is prominent on the chest of the shirt, which ties across the front. The primary colors are red and black. The shirt is comfortable and cool. If you’d like to wear a long sleeve t-shirt underneath this jersey, during cool weather, that should work too. Overall, this is a decent shirt.  3-3.5 stars

title: Roller with Mat
review: This roller isn't my favorite. It is like a regular foam roller was stuffed inside a yoga mat. So it has this yoga mat texture and thickness on the top, making it not a firm as I like a roller to be. The double layers are also visible in the construction and you can see there is a layer glued to the outside of a foam roller core.

title: Perfect for steeler fans
review: Bigger than I thought but perfect for my dad who is a diehard Steelers fan.

title: Not a good value proposition...
review:
These bands are very high quality, but the problem is that there are other bands that equally high quality and don't cost this much. I purposely got two different sets to see if there was a difference in quality, and there is no way to tell that one is better than the other. The fabric feel the same, the difference is color schemes. This is the other set I got: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08GLZ5GFM

I'm subtracting 2 stars for not being competitive with others on the market.

title: Easy to fold low profile table…
review: This table is so simple to set up and take down.  It is well made and is nice around any campfire or fire pit.  It provides a nice spot to set up for mountain pies, s’mores, and hot dogs.  All my summer cooking fits on this wood table.  Highly Recommend!

title: Nice water bottle
review: Got this for my wife and she absolutely loves it. She takes it everywhere. The only issue is that the handle you carry it with sometimes will not allow a seal and if that happens, it leaks.

title: great walking hat
review: Love to walk, but in the winter months it can get so dark fast, prefect hat for walking trails/parks. I wouldn't wear it on a sidewalk though, too bright for cars maybe.

title: Provides so much fun for our family and it’s good
review: Great value for the money

title: I collect pocket knives and this was a good addition
review: Nice pocket knife and the spring assist is smooth

title: not great
review: the fleece is odd. feels cheap, like it will mat easily.  the pockets are NOT kangaroo style.....they are set into the side seams.  My phone kept falling out.  it went to the thrift store.

title: Best knee pad for wrestling.
review: The only knee pad my college wrestling son uses.

title: Easy to stow and makes the sleeping bag a lot more comfortable.
review: Great product lives up to its promise of comfort and durability.

title: Nice kick Scotter with great suspension
review:
[[VIDEOID:174747c9374252007fed99282e93e535]] We really like this scotter and it is easy to ride for beginners. The wheels are smooth on pavement and the suspensions system has a lot of flex. It folds up easy and is light to carry. We like the white color because it is more unusual. The handle bars are easily adjustable with a push or a button to 3 different heights. The only big disappointing surprise was that it didn’t come with a disc-handbrake for the back tire. No brakes at all except your feet. So, I had to deduct 1 star for lack of a safety feature!

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Good quality, but too large for a "small/medium"
review: I wear a 7-1/8 hat, and this small to medium size is a bit too large for me.  The quality seems good; perhaps it will shrink a little when it's washed repeatedly.  If you have a head smaller than mine you might want to look for a different brand.  I'll use mine for walking (and getting quite sweaty in the process), so my only concern will be keeping it on my head on windy days.  Three and a half stars.

title: Sturdy and a great value for the money
review: This product was easy to assemble, sturdy and a great value for the money. I wrote to the company, to let them know I didn't receive any extra cords. Customer service immediately sent me extra cords, in short order. I also purchased separately, the stabilizer T-Bar. Mounts easily.  Makes easier to maintain balance. Great rebounder from great people!

title: Lots of Assembly Required
review:
This scooter requires more assembly that regular Razor scooters. The regular scooters come out of the box ready to ride. This does not. You'll have to completely assemble it. It does come with the necessary tools for assembly.
It is a great size for my 3 year old. He was really excited. The wider base makes it easier for him to ride and balance than the 2 wheeled versions. And it came in his favorite color, blue. This one is a little smaller than the Kiwi style and suited more for toddlers and small preschoolers. If you're looking for a 3 wheeled scooter for a kid 4+, get the Kiwi, not the Jr. Kiddie. (We have had both.)

title: Yes!
review: Middle aged and in first six months of Crossfit.  I was shocked when jump ropes came out - I hadn't used one in over 35 years.  I was even more shocked at how thorough a workout I got from 5 minutes of jumping.  But I sucked (and still suck.) So I got this rope so I can practice at home and it is way better than the ones they have at the gym.  I still suck, but this rope is fantastic.  The rotation is super smooth and the rope has a nice weight to it that keeps it spinning well and is ruggedly built.  I am very happy with this jump rope and recommend it.

title: Not quality - Why would they send with a pouch that is undersized?
review: The pouch is too small for the towel! I bought the Large size and I struggled to zip it inside the carrying pouch. After getting it zipped, it doesn't lay neat and flat. The towel is curled and bunched to fit in the pouch. I will post an updated review after I use the product. I am leaving on my trip in a couple of days so I don't feel like returning and ordering a new item. Hopefully the quality of the towel itself will be good and outweigh the manufacturer error.

title: Didn't last a week
review: This bikes has a horrible grinding noise. I was told it was the disk breaks and that needed adjusting... It didn't ever fix the sound problem. Now the chain won't stay on and I'm pretty sure the bearings inside the pedals are falling out. I don't recommend this bike at all to anyone. It's way over priced for the quality. Don't waste your money and time with this.

title: Excellent Product
review: A+++++ product.  This blanket is great for outdoors. It blocks both the wind and the rain at football and soccer games. It rolls up tightly so that it easy to carry and fits into an approved NFL clear bag.

title: Overpriced
review: Very thin mat and shiny plastic like material

title: Excellent padding
review: For the size/weight ratio, it had excellent padding and was of excellent quality.  Had emergency repair kit too.  Filling was easy.  Repacking was easy.  The only thing I didn't like about the bag was the taper at the top, because I tend to sleep face down, my arms didn't lay across the padding and pillow as I am accustomed to.  For back sleepers, this would be fantastic.

title: Ok
review: I wished that this had a pocket on the inside and one on the outside with a bottle holder would have been nice too. Using this for my 7year old son for teakando.

title: For outside of tent use.....
review: It doesn't like the wind if you're using it for  outside of a tent!  I'm only using it to put on my lawn for something to lay on when i sun tan and when the wind blew just a little it wouldn't stay down! It's very thin, it's okay!  Just okay....

title: Zero stars
review: Cheap and flimsy. Would never repurchase and certainly would NOT recommend.

title: Love it..
review: Easy to use on trips...

title: OMG too big!
review:
I ordered a XXL for my dachshund, because it says it is for a dachshund.
It is huge, at least 25.5” around the chest. My dachshund would drown in it!
I am so disappointed!

title: Measurement for fit not quite accurate
review: I was disappointed in these. The measurement they suggested was still too large for my small hands. It seemed pretty essential for you to have a tight fit to feel the warmth of these. If they "bag" away from your hands, you can't feel the warmth. I saw others remark they are "skin tight" - they have to be. I couldn't feel the heat on one side at all. Also the batteries were bigger than I expected... it reminded me of half a deck of cards.. not quite that thick. You have to deal with that under your coat. I wouldn't want to fall on them.

title: Tan-tadaaaaa
review:
As someone else had said, you get what you pay for. But why in the world would manufacturing deem it a good idea to insert a round clear plastic tube to prep up the upper insert like a tent, then close the case for shipment??? Would the sponge inserts .... rattle ?!? The case came in with the plastic three inch tube hiding fully erect between the upper sponge insert and the case itself. Because it had been in this situation for awhile, the sponge had deformed and also left an impression on the lower sponge. I can't for the life of me think why this little tube was necessary, except that maybe somebody forgot it somehow and it got wedged. But the end effect is that the sponges are now damaged and it's only a guess whether they will revert to original shape (the indentation damage is pretty severe - see picture).

Other than that.. it's a case. I happen to like the size of it cause it fits my scope. And the price is right... But man.....!

title: Ok
review:
I've had this now for about a week, it works great! If you lay it on the floor of your car while driving it does leak a little but nothing crazy.
UPDATE- had the bottle 2 weeks now dropped it one and it cracked completely the bottle is not durable..

title: The Large Size Isn't Big Enough!
review: I got these for myself and my husband. I got the medium and he got the large. The medium me fit well, but when he tried his on, he said they were so tight on his wrist, his hand started to go numb. When I tried on the large just to see how they fit, they fit even better than the medium, and I have very small hands. I'm disappointed that my husband can't use them, but I'll keep the other pair as a backup for me.

title: Sturdy, but hardly used.
review: Great scooter if you plan on using it around the home or for serious tricks. However, for commuters, it's best to get a folding scooter. This one is lightweight compared to portable options, and the wheels are fantastic. However, because it doesn't fold, it's not as used as our other options.

title: Lacking in longevity.
review: It works fine but it does not last.  I treated mine with the utmost care, and even with that, it started breaking at the plastic joint within a couple months.  I might try an off market and see if they last longer but I hear they don't either.  Maybe a redesign to make a better band is in order.

title: Folded with creases
review: Pennant is nice but has creases from being folded in shipping. I am working to get creases out. Disappointed a little.

title: Good for the price
review: Not as sturdy as I would like, but hard to beat for $10.  I bought this for carrying essentials when hiking so I could keep my pockets empty. However, fanny packs must be back in style because my wife has promptly claimed it. I had to buy another sturdier one for my purposes.

title: Easy assembly, lots of fun!
review: I absolutely love how lightweight and portable this is! Great for taking on camping trips! Was very easy to assemble and a blast to play! Everyone enjoyed cornholing and it was a great time.

title: Love it!
review:
Great light! It's really bright and the various mode are very useful. I live in CA so I can only use the red color. I can tell it really gets peoples attention because people making right turns over the bike lane actually waits behind me on a red light. :-)

Battery lasts for about 4-5 hours (my ride is 1.30 hours/day). Charging is simple. I use a regular charger base (not the fast charging) because I am not sure if this unit can deal with high charge rate. I had bad luck with other things like usb headphones that just couldn't handle fast charging. The regular charging speed is about a few hours. So I usually charge it after a few rides for 2-3 hours.

Mounting is easy. I ride on city streets, so I cannot tell if the thing with stay on after a very bumpy ride. The latch seems pretty solid.

The unit itself doesn't feel very sturdy (light plasticky feel), so I am not sure how it will fare if I dropped it on a paved road. So I am careful when I take it out or put it back in the mount.

title: Product arrived in time and exactly as presented on amazon
review: Product arrived in time and exactly as presented on amazon

title: If you in need of a sauna waist trainer look no further.
review: Strong. Comfortable. Works.

title: Great design and long view
review: Brought for out door use. The design of flash light is great. The distance and brightness is great.

title: Poor design
review: Buying this pretty bottle was my bit to help the environment. No more plastic bottles purchases. But it is very bulky, no mid-grip, and I can't get my hands around it. Looking for another one with a more ergonomic design.

title: Four Stars
review: Sort of looks like picture, not a lot of details, but it wasn't a lot of money either!

title: Ultra smooth gliding with strong magnetic resistance
review:
[[VIDEOID:c9f0f4580cf64cdc9dbb51be4ee7df21]] Impressive quiet rowing with a dial to change the magnetic resistance. I like knowing what resistance I use and seeing the never on the dial is a big plus for accurate resistance. That way I can track my progress better with the LCD data. Data includes, repetitions, time, distance, and you can cycle through automatically. This machine combines cardio and strength training for a blended workout.

Everything is well made and packed securely.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: COLOR BLEEDS; just barely works as foot bath; best for outdoors or repurpose as ice bucket
review:
I have another one of [[ASIN:B091GF5B46 these]] type foot baths and fell in love with it so much that I wanted another one.

In the package is one carry pouch and one very small outdoor foot bath. The basin is fully collapsible and very small.  I unfolded it completely and made sure the edge of the basin was standing up.

As can be seen by my photos, I actually used this indoors and it worked. I had to be careful not to let water flow over the edge. This is really for outdoor use only. To ensure the water stays inside, I only filled it several inches, enough to soak up to the base of my ankles.

Once I was done, I rinsed the bath out. There was a water spot on my floor because the bottom of the basin gets wet when in the sink--another reason this should be used outdoors. Note that it takes many hours for this basin to dry. 

I was actually going to rate this 4 stars like I did my other one because it operates exactly the same. However, the purple color of this bath bled all over my towels and I could not rinse the color out. It destroyed my towels.

In summary, this foot bath is portable and does work as long as one is careful. However, this can be repurposed as an ice bucket with drinks for a picnic or to hold small beach toys for the kids. At the current price of $7.99, this is more expensive than the one I already own. It is not great but does somewhat serve the purpose it was intended for. What I love about this is that I do not have to carry a heavy pail to bathe my feet. Also, it folds down nicely. This would have received 4 stars from me if it were not for the color bleed. I cannot recommend this due to that issue and my recommendation would be to purchase this [[ASIN:B091GF5B46 one]] instead. Not only is that one cheaper but there is no color bleed.

UPDATE: I washed the towels twice that this bucket bled on and the color DID NOT come out. This is such a BIG NEGATIVE. Even if using this outdoors, the color will bleed all over--one's clothes, the camper floor, the towels, etc.

title: This nice jump rope is adjustable, with good grip handles
review:
To use a jump rope in your exercising life is very important. I use jump ropes periodically. This nice jump rope is adjustable. It is easy to adjust the length.

Once you straighten out the rope, it moves easily with the right length for your body height. I like the grip handles, nice to hold, non-slippage, etc. PLUS, I like the bright color meaning, I can always find it when I misplace it.

However, downside, is that I never did get this counter to operate. There is a black push button to move it, but that does not work, therefore the counter numbers will not turn effectively....

So, I think it is great if you do not intend or have a need to use the counter. Review for Product.

title: Leaks
review: Used once and the whole cooler leaked.

title: Well made
review: Well made, strong, tight weave, not frayed.  Set comes with two separate ropes.  All types of uses - built to last.

title: Difficult for larger people
review:
The product is fairly easy to put together, comes with the screwdriver you need for two screws; the rest fits together well with clear instructions. So far so good.

After you've assembled the rocket, then you have the DVD to tell you how to use it. Getting on the floor for a large person just isn't easy at anytime, but getting down on this turns out to be rather simple, it's getting up that's hard. The springs for resistance are not that resistant. The head/neck piece that the DVD tells you is very important to be on your neck/head doesn't reach up high enough. It is perfect for a small person like the girl in the DVD, but watch the big guy in the back, his head and neck tower over the top of the rocket. He looks uncomfortable because he is uncomfortable.

This is not a one size fits all. It does work, though. It does make you use muscles you probably didn't know you had. I can see how continuous use can help flatten stomachs, cinch in the waist, and help back muscles to regain their youthful power. It is sturdy, so heavy people can use it without fear it will break easily.

It is not easy to store. You must remove the handles every time and still it won't slide under the bed.

title: Ships from China
review: The item is great quality.  However,  what is not mentioned in the description is that cell phones with protective cases may NOT fit in the item as described. The second problem is that the vendor is in China.  So you can't return it; unless you want to repackage, get a customs label and pay overseas costs. But, mine didn't fit the Samsung Galaxy Mega 2, and after three emails I was refunded the cost. So, I gave mine to Goodwill.  Measure you items as is and check the item details before deciding

title: Maybe you’ll do better but our arrows arrived bent
review: Folds small for storage and is easy to set up and use. The bow has an easy enough draw for a two year old but the arrows arrived slightly bent which makes shooting the arrows where you want them to go difficult. On top of this, you have to be no farther away than about 3 feet from the target or the arrows don’t stick, they just hit and fall to the floor. I realize this may be a function of the slightly bent arrows but I don’t think this is going to be a favorite.

title: Be safe, be seen....in style
review: Safety first. These are great for increased visibility to motorists. I like the different patterns of light. Easy to charge and charge lasts a long time (6+ hours)

title: Hard to get on
review: Horrible , very hard to get on . Then it made my ears hurt..

title: I can tell how much water I really drink at a glance
review: Nice bottle, it's light holds a good amount of water or drink of your choice. It's leak proof and easy to drink from.

title: Everything I needed.
review: Nice set that has everything you need for handguns. It’s nice to have everything neatly organized in one place so I can get to it when I need it. We have several different sizes of handguns and everything is here that we need.

title: Lovely
review: This would make a lovely gift. It really is so sweet. It comes packaged very nicely. The package is very, very nice. The pouch it is in is also something nice you can keep. The outside of the compass is a little plain, but the inside is really great. I love the saying. It is so sweet. It is something special that you can give to someone. It is hard to find meaningful gifts for my son, and this is nice. He liked it a lot. I was happy with the quality. I would recommend this.

title: Good budget minded set
review: The discs in this set have a “more rubbery” feel than the Innova disc I had borrowed from a friend to try this activity out. I only throw backhand for now and they do well in my opinion. When I try to throw forehand I lose a lot of distance and control. Impacts with trees do leave their mark. I am happy with the set and consider it a good value, especially for someone just getting started.

title: Great safety kit that has everything you need for minor emergencies
review: This is a great safety kit that every home should have. It is a sturdy red case that is easily viewable. It contains everything you would need to assist in a minor injury (loads of bandages and tape of all sizes). I recently bought a second one for my son to keep in his RV as he has two small children and they are always going camping and in areas where the kids are always getting scraped knees and bruises. I think everyone should own at least one of these to keep in your house and/or vehicle for emergencies. This would make an excellent holiday present for someone, too.

title: Tried to fit my leg but can’t use
review: Too tight on my leg.

title: Ok Watch
review: The watch itself works. The app and watch connection is the issue. It syncs when it feels like. Even tapping the watch symbol and pulling down the page to sync it, inconsistently works. It’s a bit aggravating for myself as a parent who needs to monitor my sons heart rate but son loves it so I haven’t returned it. In the future, I probably would select a different watch for him.

title: Nice replacements for undersized caged pedals on stationary bike
review:
These are good pedals. I installed them on my stationary bike to replace the undersized caged pedals that were on it. Installation was easy once I figured out how to do it. You have to use a wrench from the inside of the pedal arm on the bike so that when you screw em in, you're actually drawing them in.

Theres small studs screwed in to provide traction. These are adjustable and removable. But they seem about right if you intend to wear shoes, so I'll probably just leave them as they came.

Recommended!

title: Cheaply made
review: Vary cheap

title: Wasn't too impressed
review:
So we watched the video and followed the instructions- he put this on his fishing rod.
My only issue was that it really wrapped good around some areas and not on other parts. So in the long run will it get water under it and start to peel?

title: A camping necessity!
review: This utility cord is a must if you’re a hiker or camper - it’s inevitable that you will need it at some point.  For us, it was a clothes line between two trees to dry our gear when we were caught in a down pour!  We always bring more home than we take camping, so it aided in tying some equipment on our car roof.  It’s easy to add to your equipment - and we’ll never go camping with out this one again!

title: Three Stars
review: Awesome design but not great quality

title: Autistic Child's best friend
review: I have been teaching her how to tie her shoes for YEARS.  So I did a research and came across this no tie shoelaces.  I gave it a tried and my daughter like it but it's too rubbery..  the rubber part will wear out from daily wears and  tears.  I will post how long it last.  It's now few months and still is okay.  I am looking for a way to see if other options may be better and longer.

title: If you own a copy of Sagrada, it's a must have
review:
We play a lot of board/card games here. Sagrada is fast & simple but supporting only four players can be a problem.
The 5/6 player expansion as solved it completly

title: Keeps 90% of the sunlight out!
review: There is always someone who can’t sleep unless it’s totally dark, so this is the tent for them.  If it keeps 90% of sunlight out, it must really keep the moonlight out!  We like that there is more headroom than usual in this 4 person tent - and that the poles are pre-attached so you can set it up in 5 minutes!  Actually, took us almost 10, but that was more than okay!  The floor is another plus, as it’s got a rim that keeps water out.  Looks like they thought of everything with this tent!  Folds up into a neat carrying case.  Good choice!

title: If it looks like a toy, feels like a toy, it is a toy
review:
This is a cheap toy and is not worth $1 at the dollar store. It is about the size of a cell phone but is practically weightless.

In a word USELESS. Don't even think about paying $18 for this product.

title: Easy inflate, stable and buoyant…
review:
[[VIDEOID:4e9a39689439be9b0bc253bb91b9d660]] Everything is well made and completely sealed. The board has a nice foam pad that is great for kneeling too. The valve is easy to seal to keep the air sealed tight. Also, easy quick deflate and you can use the hand pump to get out the extra air. This has a wide float surface that doesn’t rock easily. And the front is not too pointy. The design looks cool too.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Works great
review: Love it. I organizes and fits all my husband's gear. It's so nice to have everything all neat in the corner of the garage. It seems sturdy enough. I do recommend it.

title: Small with big use
review:
Bought it for my son and he loved it.
Small and portable for his kayak.

title: Nice mat- read below to be sure it will fit your sizing needs..!!!
review:
This mat is nice quality for the price.. it would be great for any beginner for sure! The length is where you need to be sure you get the right/good fit- and this mat is 6 feet long. This may seem plenty big, especially for someone like me as, I’m 5’1”..!! However, keep in mind… Is the movement and stretches you’ll be doing while on your mat! And for those much taller then, my 5ft self- this may pose a bit of a problem by not providing enough length..
•Best way to avoid getting a mat that is too short-
is to raise arms to a relaxed stance above head.. then, add that measurement to your total height- (from top if head to end of palms- add on these inches- not entire arms length!!) this will insure you’ll fit on your mat during all sun salutations and downward dogs! Makes sense.. But, something I hadn’t realized when ordering. Even so, @ 5ft. tall and reach of my arm still left me approx 4+” to spare- But, something to definitely be aware of when selecting!
•Strap is easy to put on and is all one piece-
Assemble in elastic material and has reinforced stitching to avoid breaking. **dont throw it away!! The strap was loose in bottom of box- and if you don’t look thoroughly, it could easily make it out to the trash- mine did!! But, once I realize it was missing I retraced my steps and found it on the bottom of the tubed boxed! Just pat attn.- this IS NOT placed on mat when it arrives!!! **Bonus: I LOVE the length of the strap.. not too long to bounce around your knees and get in the way when carried- This strap offers just enough slack to carry of the shoulder perfectly- I attached photos.. and this is perfect length!!! (length is NOT adjustable!)

•Not all mats are created equal! BUT.. A thinner mat is not always a bad thing. I did order one with extra thickness before.. tbh, it’s very “grabby” on the feet.. This is thinner so, yes! You may feel pressure points on the floor a bit more however, this mat allows for easy movement with the feet- I loved the textured surface- it helps keeps feet from becoming sweaty and slipping!
• I have used the mat a handful of times.. and maybe OCD about disinfecting after every use, I don’t care! I use a misting mat cleaner that is all natural.. I spray both sides with a light coat. So far, we’ve held up just fine! No sticky or, peeling of the mat itself- **the key here people: to let cleaner dry before rolling/storing your mat!!! Here’s a Life hack: whenever you clean your mat, always be sure it’s 100% dry before rolling/storing! You will thank me for this and mats life expectancy will last much longer than you think! Not too mention, you won’t be the one who’s mat stinks up the room for the whole class.. that’s always a good thing!!
Overall, this is a great mat and good investment for any who need a clean, nice, decent space to do their exercises- it may not have all the added extras but, for many... those are just that, extra!
I can recommend this feeling confident it can do it’s job and one will get their moneys worth.
I hope this info helps.. feel free to let me know!

title: Good enough
review: Easy enough to inflate, good bounce. print on the ball is crooked and smudged- looks cheap. Not sure if each one will look like this or just the one i got

title: Not worth your moey

title: love this key holder
review:
I bought a couple of these at a national chain store and liked them a lot. My dad wanted a couple and I was too lazy to make a special trip to the store for them. Since I use Amazon more than any other shopping source (yes, really!), I naturally searched for them online and on Amazon, and decided I could skip the trip to the store.
These keep keys well organized, are extremely easy to use, and I never have to break my very short fingernails again trying to get a key on or off a ring.

title: Awesome!
review: Works for what it was purchased for!  Working out knots in my back!  Awesome!

title: Got to love PINk
review: Great little tackle box, my son hangs out with guys with sticky fingers, no guy is taking a pink tackle box. Lol

title: Not the greatest quality...leaks
review: Although my daughter loved the little character on these they haven held up very good. The rubber around the eye comes off easily. Also, they leak and my daughter finds her self having to empty them quite often at swim lessons.

title: Knife-like edge is USELESS but spoon & fork are usable
review:
I ordered their [[ASIN:B07M8K5VQ8 Titanium spork]] and decided to order this pair as well since it was cheaper and I needed an extra one for my boyfriend when I do day trips.

This is a thick plastic spork that is just somewhat stronger than a typical plastic utensil. It is BPA-free and is food and dishwasher safe. There is a fork on one end with one of the tines that has a "knife-like" edge. There is a spoon on the other end. The center holes can be used to fasten this to a backpack using the reusable teather it comes packaged with.

I got this because many times when I go on a staycation, I pack a cooler with yogurt and stuff for day travel. This is perfect for that. I ate with the spoon and fork fine but I could not cut anything of substance with the knife. I think $4.99 is reasonable for what this is but the knife-like edge is completely useless. A butter knife cuts better. However, the spoon and fork are good for any "away-type" eating such as camping, backpacking, or just a staycation with a cooler in tow.

Even though the price is right, the reason I give this 3 stars is because the knife is useless and the thick plastic has a different mouth feel and pick-up ability. For instance, when I was eating yogurt with the spoon, I could not scrape the container as easily with the spoon end as I could with the [[ASIN:B07M8K5VQ8 Titanium Spork]]. This is good enough but neither their Titanium spork or this one is great.

I attached two pictures. The first photo is of this set and the second photo is with my Titanium version on the right end for comparison purposes.

title: There are better resistance tubes out there
review: I have several sets or resistance bands/tubes and these are my least favourite. The accessories are fairly good quality, but the tubes do not offer the same amount of resistance as my other bands. I would not recommend nor repurchase.

title: Not dishwasher safe
review: Husband loves. Not dishwasher safe

title: Perfect device to help you with doing the splits...
review:
THE GOOD:
---------------
* This is a nice equipment to have if you'd like to improve your splits for yoga, gymnastics, kung-fu, etc.
* The seat included seems high quality and comfortable.
* The bars/struts are made of metal.
* No instructions on how to use it, but watch their demo video, and the unit is pretty intuitive. Just crank the device clockwise to start stretching!
* Customer service was good. I had an issue and they were willing to send me a replacement, but I figure my solution was better. Read below.

THE BAD:
------------
* You adjust the struts by pulling up a knob, so you can drop the pin on the next hole. These knobs are made of plastic and, apparently, not high quality. Because out the box, one of our knobs was broken. Without this knob, you cannot pull up the pin. And in reading another review, seems like broken knobs is common thing. But if you have eye hooks laying around, you can make something better. I simply drilled a pilot hole on top of the broken stem. Then by hand, I screwed in an eye hook. This eye hook is never going to break or come lose. My first solution was glue, it didn't last long. Screwing in an eye hook is the way to go! Look at my pictures.
* The stretchers and the seat are separate components. So putting it away takes a little more management, since it's not an all in one device.
* The included bags that came with it feel like an after thought, and weren't really designed for the components. It would have been great if a bigger, higher quality bag was included so that you can house everything together.

Because of QC issues, I rate this product 4-Stars. It should be 5.

title: Overrated, not warm, runs large
review:
1) you need to be 5’5” or tall for these to fit lengthwise
2) i definitely wear an XL and these are too big in an XL, especially for alleged under garment for layering. Order a size down
3) there’s a bumpy texture to them, so anyone with sensory issues, beware
4) save your money and just buy regular leggings. This is ridiculous.
5) I’m really trying to think of anything positive
6) taper ankle with a band cuff kind of thing, so that looks weird

title: Well made - polyester, thinsulate lining
review: This is a very nice coat - its lightweight, but with the thinsulate lining, it's still plenty warm for fall and early winter (probably good for anything down to some of the sub zero winters we occasionally get). The fit okay, slightly on the snug side and if you're between sizes like I am, I'd recommend going with the larger size. It is made of 100% polyester and doesnt breath as well as cotton (or other materials) might. But it does hold in heat to help keep out the cold.

title: Looks nice but hardly works
review: I really wish this thing reliably did what it's supposed to do, but it doesn't. I spent a bunch of time mounting & adjusting it, and it still allows my chain to slip off the small ring and get caught on the inside, except thanks to the K-Edge, it's a lot harder to get out of there. Why does this happen? Because the metal is so flimsy and flexes so much that it allows the chain to just push it out of the way and go where it wants to. I just bent it back into shape this morning, but I'm sure it will get warped again the next time my chain decides to hop off. Ugh...

title: Great bike lock
review: I have a couple of the same type of bike lock and this one seems like if built better than those. The number wheel is tight and works week. Easy to install the holder on my bike.

title: N,G.
review: Both inner tubes burst at 40 psi! I want to thank their quality control for making these tubes so inferior that they both burst before I even got them on the bike saving me from breaking down on the road. Bad is bad, real bad can be good.

title: I got this, because the manager was seeing clouds ...
review:
I got this, because the manager was seeing clouds and closing the pool. This showed him whether there was a real danger or not. Then he tried the old, "you can have lightning with no thunder, you know? " No, you can't, because lighting is CAUSED by thunder. In other words, then, you just didn't hear it.Some jerk wrote me that I was wrong, but I've done some research since then, and my jr. Hi science teacher was right after all---LIGHTENING IS CAUSED BY THUNDER.!!!!

It still works great, by the way, and it's over a year old.

title: Great Gift
review: For my Crimson Tide loving sister-in-law, this made a fantastic stocking for Christmas.  Instead of using a paper bag, I used this and she loved receiving all of her other Crimson Tide items inside this reusable shopping bag.  It was a fun and practical gift.

title: Massive
review: These are a medium but a medium for who,  a giant?! Really big and baggy. Won’t really work for me. The material is meh.

title: Worked well until it broke
review: I liked the bottom loading which meant the fruit was always exposed to water. Unfortunately the top clasp broke after less than a month.

title: Sticks to the Basics and Gets Them Right
review:
I have a pocket knife in my pocket at all times and I have found having one on me is almost always useful. I had not heard of Old Timer until recently, but their knives look nice and I thought I would give them a chance. So far I am very pleased with this particular knife.

This is a no-frills knife that doesn't try to get too fancy. The blades have to be pulled open manually without a spring assist, and it does not have some of the things that other knives frequently have such as a corkscrew, screwdriver and other integrated emergency tools. Instead it has three blades - nothing more. Each blade is different and has different uses, though the thought that comes to mind when I look at the knife as a whole is whittling and carving.

The blades are tight and do not wobble. That's a good thing and says that the knife as a whole is assembled well. The blades feel solid and secure when opened.

I love the bone handle. It feels good in the hand and it looks retro which is a good thing. The texture makes it easy to maintain a grip, even when hands are just a little wet.

This is a smallish knife, so it will fit in your pocket and not take up lots of room. This is a little smaller than most knives I am used to carrying, and that's a mixed bag to me - on one hand I like having a larger knife, probably because I am used to having one, but on the other I like the fact that it is small, compact and lightweight.

This is a very nice knife that sticks to getting the basics right without a bunch of extras that only add weight and take away from the overall package. It looks great and is made well.

title: Wow - this is great!
review: We’re always having to check our animals at night, and this solar flashlight has a great, strong, wide beam that makes us feel safe - and illuminates any problems our guard dogs may be having.  It’s lightweight - was easy to get charged up and is the first thing we grab for those night-time trips outside.  Very pleased with this flashlight.

review: Awesome!! Product. Great quality sounds. Excellent  Vendor,product shipped efficiently,price point is great! Will purchase again.

We contacted company and they said they would ship out end caps that were broken never received them but overall product works great. Will need to purchase weights for the bottom supports to help keep it in place.

title: Great stocking stuffer item!
review: I ordered this as a stocking stuffer for my son. It's a good looking gadget that's light & compact and will be perfect for camping trips. The clip will be nice for securing it to his gear so he doesn't have to go looking through everything to find it.

title: Sturdy and low price
review: I love how sturdy and lightweight these are for the low price point.

title: practical and very comfortable.
review: Love these for outdoor activities that have the glare of the sun and reflective surfaces.  as a fit they are super comfortable and as i wear glasses, they also fit comfortably over them.  in contact lenses, the goggle has ventilations that prevents my eyeballs from drying.  a modern take of the ski googles - fashionable and yet practical.

review: [[VIDEOID:bdba727e34210f5d3a20ee799a0108cf]] Small form factor makes it easy to carry. I attached it to my hiking bag. It’s perfect as a backup to whatever your main source of light/fire may be. Overall great pickup.

title: 5 stars

title: Bladder could be thicker
review: Bladder is thinner than I thought but it’s ok

title: Fogs Up Glasses
review: The mask is comfortable but I am unable to workout with it because my glasses are constantly fogging up.

title: Good Sleeping Bags
review: Overall I think these are good sleeping bags. They were plenty warm enough for the 60 degree nights we had when we went camping. I bought 2 of these extra-large bags, and was hoping to zip them together and make a King size bag, but that didn't work. Just fyi to anyone else wanting to try it, it does not work. Also these bags are "noisy". If you are a light sleeper, in a tent with another who has this bag, the sounds or their every movement will wake you. It's like listening to someone walking in snow pants, like a woosh woosh sound, combined with a crinkled grocery bag. Though I have a feeling all sleeping bags sound like that now, because of the new fabric they use. I much prefer the heavy flannel/cotton ones I grew up with. All in all these are good bags that get the job done, and are very light weight.

title: Just what was needed!!
review: I've had my electric fillet knife for many years. It needed a new blade very badly. When I ordered this one as a replacement it looked different than my former one. But, it fits and work perfectly! Very sharp, very nice. I'm happy!

title: Works okay
review: A little ridged for my application

title: More manageable size than the 70 for my 5’7” frame
review:
I have used Osprey packs in the past for hiking in national parks and I’ve never been disappointed! The material is durable and although it will show signs of wear if you love it well, they are made to last and I love ospreys lifetime guarantee that they will repair or replace your bag if needed for any reason. (Definitely makes the price seem more justified)
- I was able to test the 70 liter pack as well, and I much preferred the way this 60 felt on my back. The 60 felt way more natural/comfortable for long days, and the top portion wasn’t against and over the back of my head like the 70 was. It felt like all of the extra space on the 70 was all behind my head. If you don’t absolutely need the extra space, I’d quickly recommend the 60 as a more manageable size.
One other thing to note is that at 5’7”, I was near the end of the upper/useable range for the torso adjustment. I had to move it as far as I could to get the hip belt to sit in the correct position. If you are much taller, you may need to consider the men’s pack.
This is a beautiful pack that is ready for adventure. It has ample pockets and compartments for all of your gear, and the straps are easily adjusted to get a comfortable, close to body fit.

title: Works well on my kayak
review: Nicely priced and nice light. I like they give you a few different size straps

title: Keeps you on track and drinking!

review: I think this is a decent basket but one of the welds broke after almost 3 months of continuous use. I was getting pretty close, maybe even over, the weight limit though with my school bag. The welds should be bigger. Otherwise this is a convenient and well designed basket.

title: Hot little thing

title: Two Stars

title: Awesome

It is great to ride with Zwift and such a better experience than the dumb trainer we’d been using. We can switch from my husband’s bike to mine in under 5 minutes. And it is SO quiet, which is the main reason we chose this over Wahoo. My parents have a Wahoo, and it is loud compared to this Tacx. Overall a great purchase. We wish we had a second one so we could ride them at the same time!

Very disappointed in the magnet strength since I've never had this problem with others.  I really want another but am afraid it'll become lost just as easily again...still deciding.

This is a well-made whistle that is light and easy to carry. It works well. The dogs don't care much for it LOL

I like it and am happy to have it.
