title: Good value
review: It’s a great light weight pack. There are plenty of compartments and it’s spacious. My only complaint is that the zippers snag on the fabric often. This makes it difficult to open quickly at times.

review: Don't let this bottle fool you. It looks like it would keep drinks cold but it doesn't. I tend to drink a lot of water and being that it's summer time I wanted a bottle that was leak proof and kept my water cold for hours especially at bedtime. Ice melted and water was very warm by morning. Disgusting!!! I do not recommend this.

review: Ehh, I'm iffy about these. They are super light and to me don't full durable. You have to really push for them to stay in your ear.

review: Fits great in a saddle bag

title: Good gift
review: Good gift

title: The peddles are smaller than I thought!
review:
The peddles are pretty sturdy and have survived two wrecks on trails. The disappointment is they are much smaller than I thought. The inside of my foot (10.5 shoe) hits parts of the bike unless I slide my for to the outside.

I haven't used the clip sides, again due to the peddle size.

title: Basement batting cage
review:
Bought this to set up a basement batting cage for my teenage son who plays high school baseball. He uses a Tanner tree and the skillz practice balls, and it works perfectly. No problem at yet, and the net us so big, I cant see how he can possibly miss it.

Set up was surprisingly easy, and this would be great to travel with and set up quickly. I have to say this exceeded all of my expectations, as well as my son's.

title: Warm, Attractive, Durable Pants
review: These are a great pair of winter pants for outdoor fun. The fleece lining makes them nice and warm for a variety of activities, but they are much less cumbersome than wearing a pair of snow pants. I got the size 28 pants for my eldest daughter and they are a great fit. As you can see from the included images, the length of the leg from hip to cuff is about 38 inches. The knees have extra padding, and the exterior material is both wind and water resistant. The pants also include a lightweight belt. These are great pants for any outdoor adventure.

title: It runs small
review: It’s all good

title: Gift
review: Gift

title: Eh, just ok
review: Eh, they are just ok. The material is thick so I can't imagine working out in them and they are definently not going to work quality. The bootcut-ness at the bottom is super wide, too wide for my taste. The back pockets are nice but the front 3in deep ones are kind of pointless and end up just balling up. All in all they just marginally meet my expectations and don't feel like the hassel of returning.  Large fit nice with minimal underwear line showing.

title: Not for short people
review: They are soft and cute, but very long and wide at the bottom.

title: Started tearing after a couple weeks
review: not gonna last much longer after this

title: Junk
review:
8/27 update. Ive decided this is junk. Its now making all sorts of weird noises and ive had it barely over a month. Averaged maybe an hour a day. Gonna have to take it apart and see whats going on. The speedometer unit is just screwed up there's nothing good about it. I would recommend looking elsewhere.

Assembly: easy peazy. Went together in maybe 30mins. The instructions are off in the sense that somethings came assembled that the instructions said were not and at least 1 part is labeled differently in the instructions than in the here's what's in the box.

Noise: I have it sitting on a towel and it's very quiet to me.

Usability: there is one minor flaw, to raise or lowered the seat you have to get on the ground to see in the little to line up the holes to put the pin in to steady the seat. A flash lighted made it easier but if yiy ha e multiple people using it would be a pain to have to move.
* major flaw to me- the instrument box. The speedometer is way off. I can't tell if it's on mph or kph but I suspect it's just making stuff up. I know my lazy I haven't ridden a bike in 30 years butt is not going 11mph/19kph after pedaling maybe 5 rotations. I also know i do not ride a mile in 4 mins. The calorie count is crazy too. Like the number goes up by 1 every second and I know it's not that easy to burn a calorie!! I'll need to find some other way to try and track that.

Storage- take out a pin, push together and it stands upright (have to put pin back in to make it stay). Good feature. Still takes up some space and i foresee many years of toe stubbing in my future.

I am a little irked by the display not working righ. The good part is the price is good and the ability to fold it up. No way to contact sellar about the display.

title: Not Pretty, But Do The Job
review:
My left foot has been a nightmare since a trip four months ago to NYC for a week. I guess my shoes were not as supportive as I hoped, and I landed a pretty nasty case of plantar fasciitis that has hung around ever since. The fact is, as a school teacher, I'm on my feet most of the day, so by the time I'm home, my foot is in agony.

Really, this looks like a strong "utility" type of sock, which is pretty ugly, but holds in nicely. I do think this one works better than some of the other "sleeves" I've used, as the compression stays constant and doesn't loosen up as much as some compression socks do. I've learned that this is an around-the-house sock, or one that I use overnight. They feel a bit too thick to wear with my regular shoes.

If you're looking for steady support, these work well. Plantars isn't something you get rid of quickly though, so I think it will be consistent use over time that will help heal things up.

title: Returned
review: I ended up returning these because they didn’t mold well to any bar or dumbbell. The grip kept rotating. If I buy a grip like these again, I’d go with the original that these are trying to replicate (fat gripz).

title: Looks awesome... just doesn't hold.
review: Love the Longhorns! But this lasted barely three days on the back of our Acura. I understand that they're not invincible.. but it only rained once and completely lost all hold. We just want to be able to rep Texas but I'm not confident enough in this to buy another.

title: you get what you pay for
review:
What a disappointment. I sent this bed to my daughter's house so that I would have something to sleep on when I visit. It is very thin and the pump is flimsy. The mattress does not pump up fully, I cannot determine if that is because of the pump or the mattress. During the night, unless you are a slight, skinny person, if you turn over you will find that parts of your body touch the floor. This definitely would not be comfortable for two people. Also, getting up in the morning is difficult because you are so close to the floor. A young person may have no trouble but anyone over 40 will find it to be a challenge unless you are an olympic gymnast. I used this for three nights and saved the price of a hotel room. In that respect I got my money's worth but I will not use it again.

Spend a little more money and get a thicker mattress.

title: Four Stars, helps with grip.
review: Nice batting grip tape. Quality materials. Feels like it will last awhile.

title: Thickness is essential!
review: When the weather permits, we take this yoga mat  out on the deck to exercise in the fresh air.  We have a mat in our home gym, but needed one that is large,  nonslip and extra thick, because it’s sitting on rough deck boards.  It’s great to have this rolled up and just set it out when we can.  Makes exercising a really great experience.  Before we had this mat, we used an outdoor rug and it just wasn’t the same!

title: Don’t
review: This was cheaply made and so thin ...a breeze would destroy it

title: Decent rack
review:
The dumbbell rack is average overall. It was packaged fairly decent but if your delivery person doesn’t handle packages well their can be issues.
It went together ok but has the tendency to lean one way or another. Even when waiting until all pieces are in place before tightening all of the bolts.
If you need a decent rack to store a few dumbbells, this is your rack. This is definitely a home use dumbbell rack and won’t stand up to a moderate level of abuse.

title: Very nice
review:
I was surprised how good it is for the price. I bought a cheap one because I figured this is a disposable tool - at least IDK where/how I would sharpen it, and none of them seem serviceable...

This is the first set of purpose-built bicycle cutters I've had, so maybe I am unduly impressed? They seem really nice.

title: SO Disappointed
review: My bar just arrived aaaaand...... There is knurling on ONE side only.  So awesome....my right hand will grip the bar perfectly, while my left slips right off.  Also, the packaging was damaged and left the end of my bar all chipped and ugly looking.  Will be returning and buying a ROGUE bar.  Huge Disappointment

title: Not accurate number of tees in the package!
review: Item was labeled wrong , not accurate in number of tees in the package I ordered 75 pack and there was 62 in the package. Label in the package says 120.

title: Great quality
review: Easy to assemble ( maybe 10mins ) doesn’t include a wrench for the nuts or ratchet so be prepared for this issue.. but once it’s put together properly and tightened down right it’s not wobbly or feeling cheap.. used it a week never had the bench fail and drop or wobble.. it’s for the money a great piece of equipment.  Nice thick and sturdy and feels like one you would see in your local gym.. no regrets here great bench. Build it right and it will work perfect.

title: Easy return
review: Could not get this to blow up properly.  Kids could not use.  Easy return

title: Good!
review: Good product! Does what it needs!

title: Definitely not red but does the trick. It’s pink!!
review: Most definitely is pink not red!!

title: 36 x 25 x 21.5~29 Addtional Details
review: Amazon is not doing a very good job describing this bag.  It is the Topeak MTX DXP trunk bag that requires the quick trax rack, It has the water bottle holder on the back, the largest fold down panniers with reflective tape, expandable top, shoulder strap and rear reflector.  I have owned this bag for three years and am an avid cyclist.  I use the bag for grocery shopping as well as for holding extra clothing.  The water bottle sitting higher up on the bike than when placed on the water bottle holder on my bike frame minimized but does not completely eliminate dust on the bottle on the trails.  There is an adjustable strap on the water bottle holder compartment to adjust for different size bottles.  The bag quickly releases from the rack. Inside the top cover is a pocket that keeps my Iphone safe and away from other items in the bag.

title: Sturdy bag, shoulder straps hurt and chest strap not adjustable
review: This bag has been with me on a few hiking trips and has proved a steady/durable partner. However, the straps are thick/rough and can hurt my shoulders on a long hike. In addition, the chest strap isn’t adjustable which makes it sit on the wrong part of my chest (I am a shorter guy). Looking for a softer bag with adjustable straps soon.

title: Do not recommend Attwood Company
review: Our navigation light worked the first 2 times we used it.  We just went out for the 3rd time and only the back white light worked, the green/red lights did not work.  I had been in contact with Attwood where they will not provide a pre-paid shipping label for me to ship back THEIR malfunctioning light that we have only had for a few months.  I am unhappy with the customer service thus far.  Amazon, however, is always much better and more helpful!

title: Perfect hat!
review: Love this hat. It looks very good on and is very well made. I highly recommend it.

title: XL is small - doesn't fit men's size 13 or 14 sneakers, loafers or boots.
review:
This is a prime example of why I don't buy stuff from random, no name companies. These crampons look like decent quality for a single season of regular use and at the under twenty bucks range, that's perfectly acceptable. However, the sizing is so far off it's not even funny.

The XL do not fit on my husband's size 14 boots or his size 14 sneakers and they are still too small for his size 13 loafers. They don't even slip over the heel on the boots, never mind actually going on. I tried them on my women's size 9 barn boots and they fit fine - so the XL is really a medium or smallish large.

title: Read the ingredient label - why added unnecessary chemicals
review:
Totally my fault for not reading the ingredient label. I truly didn’t think this would have anything other than potatoes and salt. Which is the beauty of freeze drying foods. You should not need the added chemicals for longevity.
Once again, a food product that has unnecessary chemicals added to it. Gotta love the so called FDA, that is not always looking out for our best interest.
I truly do blame our FDA more than the company. Who’s watching the watchers?
Many added chemicals to the American food supply are not only banned, but illegal in many other countries for known harms to humans, as well as the environment our government tells us their care so much about.
Illegal - Let that sink in for a moment.
Illegal for known harms such as, but not limited to: infertility, cancer, ADHD, learning disabilities, ADD, neurological disorders and neurotoxic, diabetes, endocrine disrupters, inflammation to name a few.
One should ask themselves, and perhaps their government, politicians and health agencies this. If other countries can create the same or similar products without using these chemicals, then why do we Americans not get the same?
Celery seed & rosemary can be used as a food preservative. Natural coloring can come from carrots, turmeric, beets etc. Do why use artificial chemical coloring dyes?
Until we shut off Netflix for a bit, learn, share, and get completely frustrated and angry, then demand change by not buying these products as a first step, why would they ever stop.
Oh and BTW, these chemicals substitutes aren’t always even cheaper. Some are actually MORE expensive to use. Again, let that sink in!

title: Too whippy unless you like long lazy kicking while snorkeling.
review:
I should have read the ad and left it at that. I needed a size 11 shorter fin for long distance endurance swimming in a harness in my pool year-round and for kicksets. I did not need a fin that was too buoyant and would make me lazy in my kicking. I certainly didn't need such a whippy fin useful for long lazy kicks while snorkeling.

I compared the yellow and black Phantom Aquatics Speed Sport Adjustable Snorkeling Fins L/XL (size 9-13); the US Swim Divers Grey and Black Large Fitness Fins; the black and yellow Cressi Palau Short Snorkeling Fins size LG--XLG; the SEAC Black (Large 9.5 --11) Fins with the fixed heal strap and open heel; and the TYR BP Burner Fins LG (size 11 -- Blue & Black). First off I had to send back the large SEAC's and large TYR EP Burner's to get the XL size. Both of them were painfully tight on my size 11 feet.

The worst first. The yellow and black Phantom Aquatics Speed Sport Adjustable Snorkeling Fins L/XL (size 9-13) are for snorkeling and not for training of any kind. The boot and heel strap are amazingly comfortable and strong, but the composite fin is too long and whippy for training in either a pool or open water. I would not even want to do kick sets with these. I personally would not even want to use these for snorkeling because I would always be waiting for the tips of my fins to catch up to what I was trying to do in the water to position myself for snorkeling/sightseeing.

The disappointment next. The U.S. Swim Divers Large Fitness Fins had an open heel which I generally prefer because I wear different booties during the 12 months of the year. The length of the boot was perfect, the heel strap was strong, easily adjusted, and comfortable, and the boots felt really comfortable in shape and foot support EXCEPT for the constant pressure on the knuckle of the little toe on each foot. I'm absolutely a typical size 11, but they hurt my foot, and if you have a slightly thicker or wider size 10.5--11 foot go up to the XL. I personally didn't order the next size up because while I was kicking with them I could really feel that this fin was not stiff enough for training, and certainly not for kick sets. The rubber fin was bending too easily on every kick at the seam just beyond my toes on both fins - IMOP a serious design flaw for a "fitness fin." I could never do kick sets in these, but I could use these for snorkeling since the tips of the fins do spring back almost quickly enough to be responsive to my changes in direction and speed.

SO COMFORTABLE BUT SO LONG. The black and yellow Cressi Palau Short Snorkeling Fins size LG--XLG had a great shaped boot, a strong and flexible heel strap, and they were absolutely the MOST comfortable boot of all those I tried, BUT these were definitely a better snorkeling fin and/or an open-water training fin. They were absolutely strong enough for open water training (which I rarely get to do anymore), but too way too long for endurance training in a pool with a harness. If these were 2 inches shorter they would have been my overall pick of a stiff training fin.

I liked the way the SEAC Black Fins looked, but had to go up to the X-Large (11-12.5) and they were perfect. They have the fixed heal strap which I usually don't prefer, but this one is strong and stretchy enough to be very comfortable. The open heel did not make my feet feel unsupported at all. With barefeet they were a little soft, but with a 2mm or 5mm neoprene bootie they fit my feet perfectly. The front of the boot is comfortable lengthwise and widthwise, and there's no unnecessary gimmics in the fin design. As the ad says these are ideal for open water snorkeling for a good swimmer, and ideal for pool training. The fin is short enough and stiff enough for what I wanted to do. I can do flutter kicks or slow subtle kicks just to keep my feet afloat when I am working on my upper body. The fins do not add any extra buoyancy which I don't need with easy kicking or with a wetsuit on six months of the year. I am so glad I loved these.

I just had to try something new with the TYR BP Burner Fins LG (size 11 -- Red & Black). They had to be exchanged for the XL - the Blue and Black, and I feared they might be too big, but I found they have a very stretchy and supportive heel pocket, that was as comfortable and supportive as the adjustable heel straps I usually prefer. The TYR EP Burners boot will be my spring and summer fins as they fit my naked foot or with a 2mm bootie perfectly. It's good that the fin is just that short because just another inch or so and the fin would be too flexible. Perfect design by TYR for a training fin. As the ad says "The perfect fins for training at race cadence." I kept these for warmer water training and the SEAC's for cold water training. I would also use each of these for snorkeling, as I am a strong swimmer and I want my fins to be very responsive to the demand I am putting on them to change direction or to accelerate and change speed.

I was not asked to give this review or compensated by anyone. Happy training.

title: Great If You Can Not Do Conventional Push Ups Due To Wrist Issues
review:
When it comes to push ups, I have had a struggle with them for years due to wrist issues. The strain is too much and I can not do them. These handles, however, help. Let's see how.

WHAT ARE THESE LIKE?
These are thick black PVC sort of pipe. They come in pieces and you put them together. You will have to lean heavily on them on the floor to get them to snap into place. There is an orange cushioned handle that you grab.

HOW DO THESE PERFORM?
I have to say that these are pretty sturdy but I used them on a rug. I have not used them on a slick floor. They stayed in place well and seemed to hold the weight well too. I would say that these are probably more for people under 300 pounds or perhaps less than that.

STORAGE
These don't take up much room and are so lightweight that they can easily be stored under a couch or out of sight. I like to grab them and do a few pushups now and then. I noticed my kids have been doing the same.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For a quick way to do pushups that does not strain the wrist the same way, these can be held in either direction and used to help the arms get exercise without hurting the wrists so much. They seem to support the weight well and are lightweight and easy to store.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. The cushion could be just a bit larger for my hands. It is still a bit slim to get a good grip that does not hurt the wrists at all. But that is just a small thing. These are handy to have around.

Overall, it's just okay in my opinion.

title: This one is pretty good!
review: Great water bottle. Love the fact that there's some texture on the outside to help with grip. The wide mouth is easy to drink from. No leaks so far and I'm happy there's not a massive logo on bottle.

title: Granddaughters love it
review: My granduaghters (3,7) both love LOL dolls so they were excited when this arrived. Instructions were easy to follow. Parts all came in good condition with no dents, scrapes or missing parts. Putting on the springs weren't as hard as I imagined. The last small screws that went in were the hardest and took a lot of elbow grease. Some of the very top horizontal curved bars face more inward than others so it was hard to tell which way they went. Could use a label since you can't tell until you have them up if they are the right direction. Overall I liked almost  everything about this, except the last part of tying the elastic straps on. There are A LOT of them and wasn't sure if I should be double knotting or single knotting them. Wish there was a better way to secure it than individually knotting all the straps. I was able to do almost all of the assembly by myself, but used some help when putting on the net. But I think one person could do it all just fine. Took about an hour and half to assemble. This is a good size if you have a small yard. Both granddaughters fit on it just fine even though it says one person only. It has good bounce to it as well. For the price, I would probably buy the 7ft little tikes trampoline without the LOL graphics or 7ft Best Choice trampoline. They are both almost $100 less expensive.

title: Whole Body Fitness & Therapy
review:
I've seen the larger version of this machine in some physical therapy clinics and gyms. The mini works just as well, but takes up less space. It's a great way to either amp up your workout or help your body recover. The vibration makes your muscles work harder during exercise. You can accomplish more in less time. It also works to push lactic acid out of your muscles to reduce soreness. It's also useful to flush your lymphatic system. I would definitely recommend this machine for anyone who takes their health and fitness seriously.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided helps make your decision a little easier.

title: St. Louis Cardinals  MLB Team Logo 2.5-Inch Wristbands by Franklin Sports
review: fits our almost 10 year old little leaguer just fine. Not the MLB quailty I was expecting however.

title: Not as expected...in a bad way.
review:
This kama looks nothing like that in the picture, although its dimensions are correct.

The seller did not indicate that the kama would be unsharpened...and it is going to take A LOT to sharpen this due to the thickness of the steel. The kama blade is also set in the handle, not on top of the handle, and the blade is single-pegged, with a flimsy-looking method, not traditionally double pegged, and it does NOT have a tang that extends down into the handle as the picture would suggest, since the blade is attached to the handle in an entirely different manner than depicted....

Although the materials seem sturdy, the construction does not seem to make it suitable for real use.

Buy this only if you want an unsharpened practice kama. Seller really needs to update the picture.

Edit: Also, the packaging was falling apart upon arrival. Almost two inches of the tip of one kama was sticking out and some of the paper was torn. Needs to be packaged better, but at least it was still undamaged, which proves the materials are suitably sturdy. I don't know if it will stand up to a real impact, though.

EDIT: One kama blade rotated today (the peg loosened and it flipped out to the top of the handle). It proves that the attachment method used does not make this a functional piece. 2 star rating changed to 1 star. These kamas were poorly put together and the picture is very deceiving.

I could get them to grab but it wasn't right.  I was unable to get them hooked under the mount's guide but still be loose enough to slide.

title: Long, 5-Lb. Weighted Bar Is Good for Starters
review:
The smallest DAY 1 FITNESS WEIGHTED WORKOUT BAR (5 lbs., 48” long, padded foam, solid steel) is a good choice if you’re just starting to work out with body bars. The long, 5-lb. bar feels surprisingly heavy, when you begin doing squats, lunges, and overhead lifts with the bar in your hands.

A weighted bar--basically a barbell bar with the weight evenly distributed through the bar--takes up a lot less space than a dumbbell set, a barbell weight set, or a weight-training machine; and it’s extremely versatile. You can use a weighted bar in your conditioning, flexibility, and strength-training routines to get improved results. (To find many videos and suggestions for using body bars safely, just Google for “how to use weighted bars”.)

This Day 1 Fitness body bar seems to live up to the seller’s “heavy duty” claim. It is also comfortable to grip, and feels extremely well balanced when I use it.

title: Great expandable weights
review: Bought these to add to my gym.  After reading a ton of reviews about the bowflex version of these, I decided on  buying the powerblock.  I bought the 50 pound version and already am looking into getting the add-on 90 pound attachments.  Handling these are compared to holding 2 regular dumbells.  I can do over head extensions, bench press, curls and many more exercises without any limitations for there size.  I have been the gym for 6 years now and decided to make my own gym at home.  These cost better than buying 20 or 30 individual dumbells.  I gave it 3 star because 1 of my plates were warped.  Even though it works fine still. the weld more likely did not settle properly to align straight.  Also gave it 3 star because the paint on the plates were chipped a bit as well.  Also in the corners on the inside rust started to show, only had them for less than a month!

title: Like it
review:
My kids liked playing tetherball.

We really like things to keep the kids active. I would much prefer them doing something than watching something. It is great because it is like a game for them but then they are being physically active.

The quality was good. It worked as it was supposed to. It wasn’t too hard to set up.

This is a great activity for a day when you don’t know what else to do or you want your child to burn off some energy. It is a good way to keep a child busy.

The children really liked it.

I feel like this is good for child development. It kept my children's interest. It would also make a nice gift.

I would recommend it.

title: Small is very small
review:
We have very small wrist in our family and the small size is very small. It is in fact, too small. We have to loosen the wrist wrap to fit, and that leaves some of the velcro exposed, which causes it to scratch our skin. Also, they aren't very protective. My daughter has been using them on a punching bag and her knuckles are still getting scratched up.

Between the wrist and the knuckles getting scratched and marked up, I can't give these 5 stars.

title: Give a man a swing trainer, and....pfft goes the conversation!
review: Not being the golfer myself, I can only say that this swing trainer has been in constant use since it arrived.  I hear a lot about how it has improved my son's swing and how now he can constantly check himself to make sure he is getting all the power he needs to blast the ball down the fairway.  He has evidently been able to increase the difficulty, as he has exclaimed about his progress and improvement.  He's certainly enjoying using it, as he now comes home from work, grabs the trainer, and heads for the backyard!  We're all expecting great scores on the golf course this coming season!

title: WORST PIECE OF GARBAGE I'VE EVER ENCOUNTERED IN MY LIFE.
review:
Don't waste your money. Run far far away from this horrible, horrible piece of garbage. The whole thing is made of thick, bulky, cheap, SLIPPERY junk material that has no business being around horses. Not only is the lead too bulky and slick to *safely* hold on to (seriously, it's dangerous-- it'll slip through your hands and cause severe burns), but the darn halter is too slippery to stay even tied! I know how to tie a rope halter correctly (knot goes on the bottom/back, not top/front) and there's no WAY that should slip, never in my life had another halter slip like that even with a big ornery horse tied solid-- yet this joke of a halter I had to tighten up every few steps while leading a yearling pony! God's honest truth, every few steps. I hate this thing, viscerally, from deep down in my being I loathe it, with every fiber.

This halter/lead is literally dangerous and an accident waiting to happen on several levels, and it shouldn't be on the market. It's garbage, and the absolute worst piece of equipment I've ever bought. I halfway wonder if it's not some Chinese fake, as I can't believe any actual tack company would green-light this piece of junk. Please don't waste your money on this.

title: Best invention ever
review: Just returned from an elk hunt in very cold weather. I cannot explain how valuable it is not having to disrobe in the freezing wind each time you needed to go. My best friend and I marveled the entire week. Thank goodness, it’s about time!

title: Not overly impressed.
review: I am not by any means a connoisseur of tension bands. In fact, I was hoping this would be a good, entry level way to begin resistance training. I can definitely feel the muscles being exercised while using this band, but I find the band a little unwieldy to hold on to. Other reviews mentioned how helpful it is to be able to change hand positioning to increase/reduce tension, but - for me - the webbing is neither comfortable to fit my hand into nor to hold on to. And it's made from the kind of material that picks up *every* bit of debris. My son dropped it on the floor, and now I'm trying to pull and wash pet hair off this band. Not fun. Also, after just a little use, I am seeing wear in the band - little pock marks here and there. This band is just "ok," nothing I've been overly impressed with or expect to last for a long time.

review: Bought this for hunting and worked very well, kept my hands very warm, was well pleased.

title: Great Bike Basket for 24" kids bike
review: Great bike basket! It was tough to find a basket to fit a kids bike, but no problems with this one! It is sturdy and doesn't swing around. Fits on my 12 yr old's 24" bike. He installed it mostly on his own with a little help.

title: Fits 2021 RAV4 pretty good
review:
Fits 2021 RAV4 pretty well. Gives room to stand, change clothes, escape from bugs & have privacy while camping/sleeping in the car. Room for a small table, cooler & two standard camp foldIng chairs inside.
I do put a cheaper blue type tarp under it to protect the bottom, as a ground cloth. A 6x8 tarp will fit and have a little extra to slide under the car a bit for extra clean storage space. Many campgrounds have gravel campsites which will deteriorate the floor quickly. This is a very cheap way to help turn your hatchback car/suv into a little camper.
Improvements I would recommend in the next series… a little stronger material throughout for longevity, a little bit bigger storage bag and add 2 loops at the top to attach to roof rails on the car.
Over all I would recommend and would buy again. It is a inexpensive tent. But it’s functionality is very useful to me.

title: Great Pool float that Is Made to Last…
review:
[[VIDEOID:e42835b15cc1b0496bb791cef6a5d949]] Very well made with thick ‘paddle board’ type quality layers. All the edges and corners are well wrapped and protected. The float provides plenty of buoyancy. The side handles make it easy to lift out of the pool or carry. Easy to clean too, with dish soap if needed.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Five Stars
review: Great communication from seller and product is excellent

title: I just keep the Velcro always attached to the other end and it doesn't seem to shred as easy. These are also very short
review: The Velcro strap gets on any part of the wrap it begins to shred it.  I just keep the Velcro always attached to the other end and it doesn't seem to shred as easy.  These are also very short, there is a big difference from the 180" ones.  If you are trying to use this to stabilize your wrist and you are an adult you might want to consider the 180" ones.

title: Doesn't hold a candle to the CRZ Yoga leggings
review:
TLDR, the CRZ Yoga leggings are much, much better and the same price.
These leggings fit very strangely. I am 5'4", 140 lb, wide frame. I sized up per recommendations and ordered a large. The hips were slightly loose (I must be between sizes), the thighs fit fine (I have thick thighs), calves were loose, and these were WAY too long. Like, multiple inches of bagginess. These leggings also came in at a disadvantage of being tried on at the same time as the CRZ leggings, which are a gift from the heavens. Definitely returning these.

title: Sloppy fit. Soft, thin fabric
review: Meh. I wanted a long sleeve, oversized t-shirt to work horses on cool mornings. This one is very soft. It fits with lots of extra room under the arms and the neck, allowing for freedom of movement in the saddle. However, the fabric is quite thin and it looks very sloppy. For my needs in the horse barn, it's fine, but I certainly wouldn't wear this around town.

title: Perfect size cooler for lunch and snacks.
review: This cooler has really been an excellent buy.  My husband uses it for his lunch everyday, and with the cold packs, it keeps everything nice and cold, plus it is large enough for snacks, beverages and lunch.

title: Too hard to understand readings
review: Too hard to understand readings

title: NEIGHBORHOOD HIT!
review: We bought this for a neighborhood bbq night game--the kids (& adults!) LOVED it! It was definitely the hit of the party! VERY brightly lit and it was so much fun! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

title: Not an upgrade
review: While the outline of these does match the count ours of the originals, they are just cut out of some Velcro backed foam with a layer of fabric on the side towards your head. I gave it two stars instead of only one because the pads are usable in the top of the helmet and the extra Velcro dots are a nice touch, allowing you to add or repair missing or worn out ones. Overall I would not buy this again, as I will still end up having to buy the real Lazer pad set.

title: Not a great fit
review: Finger spaces too large. I returned them.

title: training wheels
review: Perfect present for my 5 year old. Defiantly made to have training wheels, which was a little bit of a bummer

title: Good birthday present
review: Perfectly matched my sister's hydro flask and a good present

title: 29x2.1 tire
review: easy fit, takes patience installing. . .

title: Excellent Camp Gear
review: Got this for my son who hikes camps and hunts all year. Excellent quality product and durable. Makes great coffee; we used filters. You may have to get the mix right on your coffee grounds but we made some at home to get that right and just wrote it on our filter box so we'd remember. We think it's affordable for the quality product that ships fast. We think an outdoor must item

title: Attractive Functional Stainless Steel Water Bottle
review: Beautiful water bottle that holds a good amount of liquid and is very satisfying.  The grip is prevents the owner from dropping it and the water stays cold for hours.  I love it for its shape, design and easy to use bottle.  I love that it is very attractive.  People ask me where I bought it.  Amazon!

title: I would not recommend it for use on grass
review: Bought this in 2012 for Jazz Fest in New Orleans.  I would not recommend it for use on grass, lost one of the plastic tips in the dirt along the way.  If the ground is not level, you will more than likely tip over.  Not the most comfortable chair, especially if you're a bit overweight.  Buy a blanket or cushion to sit on instead, your buttocks and crotch will thank you!

title: Love camping chairs!
review:
I have a few of these we like to bring on trips as well as for impromptu seating outside on the deck sometimes. In general I find chairs in this style to be insanely comfortable considering their size and how compact they are, you just have to trust you aren't going to fall when you sit down in it!
This particular one improves on the old design by adding some cushion to the back which is very welcome! Like other similar chairs, it folds up really well and can be carried in something so small it can fit inside of a backpack. These are so useful!

title: Perfect fit and comfortable.
review: These gloves are perfect to wear when using a punching bag. The size large fits both my son and I’s hands perfectly. Very comfortable too!

title: All Strung Out
review: Like this line for all my fishing needs, good quality and durability.

title: Love
review: Lions fan! Love these

title: Helps cover and protect
review: [[VIDEOID:604608310f60ee63ce1c05d9b0eceb1b]] Product is just as described works excellent. Lightweight comfortable and convenient. This was a great product to use after I had double carpal tunnel release surgery and had to keep bandages and wraps on my wrist. This way my wraps didn’t try to come off while I was sleeping or getting dressed etc.

title: Long Battery Life, Tangle Free Cord, Dimmable Lights…
review:
[[VIDEOID:582be8e61c0413658ec3af062dc680df]] Here is what I Liked the most:
* the cord doesn’t tangle
* easy to hang with a hooks on the power pack and at the end of the rope.
* lights can be dimmed or brightened
* the power pack is very handy and waterproof design
* long life battery and can charge phones, and looks great lit up

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Check the size
review: Ordered a medium and got sent a small luckily it will work for the moment but will need next size in a few weeks..

title: It is a winner!
review:
Love this machine, it does not bother knees, hips or any spots and when I'm done exercising, I'm totally relaxed.
I did not receive directions for use and that was the only drawback.

title: Need a security harness to keep together
review: [[VIDEOID:b255a105eba566d5376502655d6c7a30]] Work good for my family

title: Better instructions would be a plus
review:
This was a pain to assemble by one person. Had to take it apart several times. Holes didn't line up so things had to be reshaped to align. Assembly time was 3 1/2 hours.

Better instructions would be a plus.

The bench seems sturdy enough for an average size person.

There is a screw missing.

title: Five Stars
review: Great for pilates!

title: It works but....
review: Wash it first don't just rinse. I took a big drink of some plastic floaties in my water. Its fine to use now but that first experience was pretty much awful. No one wants to drink plastic .

title: Good Mat Design
review:
I got this mainly for my wife, but I also do the p90x Yoga routine and know the value of a good mat. I liked this mat design better than the typical rolls you see people carrying around. Those rolls tend to curl up at the ends which gets pretty annoying and is a distraction from what you're trying to achieve. This mat lays absolutely flat and is easy to clean (hand wash, don't put it in the washing machine).

The surface has a good grip and you feel very stable whether you use it with bare feet or socks. It's not as thick as a typical mat, but it is very large and you can fold it up on itself if you need extra padding. The product measures 70 inches by 24 inches and comes in an attractive box that makes this an ideal gift.

The fabric is thick enough not to tear and provides a little bit of cushion although this really can't be called a pad. Still, I liked the portability and non-slip features of this mat. Also, it's small enough to fit in a backpack, so you don't have to carry around a huge rolled up tube. Finally, it doesn't pick up odors even with regular use.

The product description says "towel" mat, but this is not really a towel. One side of the mat has a kind of rubbery, grip surface, and the other side feels like a dense knit cloth, but you wouldn't want to try to dry yourself off with this. It's thick enough that it would prevent sticks from poking through the mat.

For anyone who doesn't like normal Yoga mats, this is an innovative and effective design that is sanitary and built to last.

title: Very lightweight, chips easily, dirt cheap, HUGE
review:
Bought for a multipurpose camping mug, because I wanted something big enough for anything, and very light and cheap enough that if it gets damaged or lost I won't care. Got a set of two on sale along with two of the matching 6" bowls for under $10 for all four pieces. Yes, really. Could not be happier, even though one of the mugs has a chip on the far side of the lip (not the side I would use for drinking). The chipped one is backup.

This is cheap stuff folks - do not expect it not to chip if you drop it on a hard surface, but it will not break. The equivalent of the Coleman mug in every way (in fact, it might be the exact same mug, private labeled...). Again, don't overthink this: it's seriously inexpensive (the smaller 12oz Coleman one goes on sale often, btw).

FYI, this mug is HUGE. It will hold 24oz - that's the contents of TWO cans of coke/beer/etc. I've included a photo to give you a sense of scale. You know how some people (me) keep pens in coffee mugs? Well, this mug is too big for that. The pen in the mug in the photo is a normal Pilot G2 07. The mug would hold easily 150 of them. If you filled this with coffee, you would have enough caffeine to get your day started RIGHT, and you may have an uncontrollable urge to chop a lot of extra firewood. ;)

title: Good except the meat chunks were very hard
review:
Mountain House makes the best, emergency, survival food out there. This had good flavor except for the fact that the meat chunks were too hard to eat. This was the same issue that I had for the biscuits and gravy. Extremely hard little meat pieces. It pains me to say this because they have other meals that are just plain wonderful. I still have the chili mac to test and have high hopes for it. The skillet breakfast is great and even good the second day! The turkey tetrazzini is also great.

My wife liked the flavor but picked out the meat pieces due to the hardness. I let this sit for the required amount of time.

It bothers me to only give this one three stars because I know that they have many great meals available. I will order more Mountain House when we go camping but not this one.

title: Poorly made!
review: These are super comfy, lightweight and breathable but unfortunately the quality is just not there and they started to fall apart on second use.

title: Too small
review: too small, not what I ordered

title: Five Stars
review: Perfect for my 2 year old Godson.

title: Tight at the knee
review: These socks are comfortable and breathable. There are ridges around the foot and above the ankle. They feel more structured, not soft. The only flaw is that the top of the sock is very tight at the top. I don't see how this would fit anyone with a regular sized calf/knee, because it's pretty uncomfortable. However, the sizing for the foot is fine.

title: Durability of product
review: Good price if they wear well.  Only used once so far.

title: Inferior product
review: I had a Fitbit One, which I loved, and I lost it running a charity 5k. I couldn't justify spending $100 on a new one that I would probably lose again, so I got this one. I hate it. Don't waste your money. I tested it many, many times, both by counting my steps and checking it and while walking with friends who have the One and Flex, and it does not accurately count your steps. I think it's only accurate if you're running. Do yourself a favor and spend a little extra on one of the more expensive ones. Just make sure it's securely fastened so that you don't lose it!

title: Great Concept and Material Quality...Possible Fitting Issue, Depending on Ear Size
review: I really want to like this because I think it's a great concept.  It looked promising after reading the product description, looking at the photos, and watching the video.  I do like how it looked and felt right out of the box. It's constructed very well (solid feel to it) and the lighting piece pivots and turns easily.  The distance between the rectangle part towards the back that loops over your ear and the front part of the unit that holds the lighting piece, though, is narrow and is not adjustable.  It feels like it's about to fall off, especially with eyeglasses on. I will keep trying to find a sweet spot for putting it on because that's really the only issue; otherwise, it's of top quality and it emits a very bright light.

title: Ring toss for outdoors and indoor use!
review: [[VIDEOID:cfcd52f2283c7255f8b61dd5c63939bb]] Very fun party game for all ages.  Everything looks super good and the wood has a descent thickness too in case it falls it shouldn’t break!  The rings are nice and rubberized and you get 24 of them too in 4 color sets.  Great case for storing everything in too.  This has been used at various community and church events and has been a big hit.  Makes a great prize giving game too.

title: It's big like it says
review: It's big like it says. The straps started falling away after the first use so I will need to make repairs. Since I think it was a used product, I guess that's fine. I would have preferred that someone note that and correct it before sending out, but it's not that hard to fix.

title: Not my favy
review: I was surprised that this was soooooo long when i assembled it. It was fine quality. Though the hook that holds the bottom was a little flimsy. The wood is poplar, so it super light.  I ended taking it off my wall.  I’ll have to think about it.

title: Thin Plastic
review: The quality of the bottle is very cheap.  It's thin and I would be afraid it would spring a leak.

title: Recommended
review: They work. There isn’t a whole lot to say about fire starters. Either they work or they don’t and these ones do. They’re lightweight and the cable is a good length. It fits well in my hiking bag, go bag and camping stuff. The compass could come in handy, but it’s so small that I wouldn’t rely on it first, I would use a regular compass and only this one if it was all I had.

title: A Well Made Product - I Love It!
review:
In thinking about how to review a water bottle, I figure there are three important questions about one. Does it leak? Is it durable? Is it easy to carry around? The appearance of the bottle can be an extra bonus if it is noticeably nice looking. This Takeya water bottle scores excellent on all counts including the appearance bonus. Testing for leakage was easy. I simply filled the bottle and left it lying top down on a steep incline with a dry t shirt underneath it. After three hours, not a drop had leaked out. Regarding durability, only time will tell for sure but the bottle feels sturdy and well made. As for portability. the bottle is slender enough to fit most cup holders and there is a nice sized handle attached to the lid for easy carrying. The bottle is a cobalt blue that I find to be quite beautiful but that may be a matter of personal taste as I've always liked that color.

There is one other thing of note. Before the Takeya bottle arrived, I thought its claim to having the "best lid ever" sounded a bit overblown. After all, a lid is a lid isn't it? Well, as soon as the bottle arrived and I took my first drink out of it, I realized that this was a particularly good lid for me. I tend to be clumsy and fumble fingered enough that I drop bottle caps and lids on a fairly regular basis. This lid has two parts, a larger one for filling the bottle easily and then a smaller cap to unscrew when taking a drink. That smaller cap is attached to the larger lid which means I'll never have to worry about dropping it. That's just a sweet little extra for me but one that I really, really like. All in all, I think this is an excellent product. It's about as well made and attractive as a water bottle can be until they manufacture one that can go in the kitchen to refill itself. :)

title: I am disappointed after getting only 5 months of use.
review: 5 months after purchasing this watch it totally fell apart on me to where I could not even attach a band.  I did not find the steps, sleep or pulse really accurate.  It is a slim nice looking tracker but nice looking doesn't go very far when it falls apart.

title: The zippers were all wonky and the packaging was dusty
review: Not a bad product but I was not impressed with its presentation. I was able to fix the zippers but I shouldn’t have to. Fingers crossed it lasts 🤞🏾

title: Very small ponytail hole
review: The hole for the pony tail is very small and hard to get my hair through. I like how big the brim is and seems like it will be pretty nice once I get the wrinkles out. I will have to cut a larger hole in the back myself in order to make it work for me though.:/

title: Cap = great , ear plug = trash , nose clip = trash
review:
It doesn't really keep the water out of my ears, more like keeping water in; water will slowly seep in and stay in my ear until I pull the side up to let it out. So... the good thing is this cap is big enough for long hair when I pull it into a high bun , and keeps most of my hair dry; only the hair line will be a bit wet.

The ear plug is too soft to push into the ear canals

The nose clip is painful to put on and off, the plastic is not flexible at all, and it popped right off within one minute of swimming.

I am only willing to buy this cap again if the price is lowered, because the ear plug and the nose clip are just extra trash.

title: Perfect size, durable.
review:
I prefer sturdy tumblers like this one for home use. Glassware is cool, but with kids and a cat it's impossible to keep glass long.

This is the perfect size to gulp water down in one go, or else to have a drink at the ready. It's been easy to clean too. There are measuring guides inside; while I've yet to utilize them, it's nice to have them there in case I ever have a need.

title: The splatter target doesn't splater
review: I expected to be able to see where my shot went but couldn't see a thing. It was only 7 yards away. They need to fix the "splash" on these before they sell them as the aren't as advertised at the moment.

title: Arrived BROKEN
review: This item arrived broken, but I didn't realize it was until my husband opened it two weeks later for his birthday.  It had been shipped to us with a very heavy steel camp table.  One of the sections of the rod was smashed nearly flat.  The pole is unusable.  Very, very disappointed.

title: Quality gym product for some great workouts!!!
review:
[[VIDEOID:dd88cba029e139af26ec2cc0790921fd]] These parallel bars can be used for a variety of intense workouts. The construction is top notch. The bars are thick tubing and nice foam that doesn’t hurt your hands. Skinny bars put more pressure on your hand’s at the touch point. I find these so comfortable on my hands for all the exercises. The rubber base pads really support the beams from wobbling. I am a big fan of these bars now that I’m working out at home!

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Great set.. offer plenty of resistance!!
review:
Looking for an @ home workout during covid19..?! Stop here! This is a great set that is user friendly, decently priced, easy to store and travel with (once that is possible again!) And let me tell you- it offers plenty of intense exercise that all can be done with an exercise band. Ohh, and this does so with each level kicking the intensity up a notch. Ulala.

These bands are made of a durable quality and provide BOTH, the stretch and resistance- without both, you won’t get what’s truly needed. These are a perfect in width and have been ergonomically designed so, they won’t roll down when in use. Trust me on this one.. I had a diff. set in a “pretty pastel“ of the same style band- only wider and had big issues with those rolling. These are cut thinner and also, have a smooth finish so no pulling the skin- a total added perk!

This uses a “step up“ level that is conducive to this type of workout equipment. These have plenty of defined levels- clearly marked from easy to extreme! And you will definitely see (feel!!) the diff. in between levels- TBH, I’m getting a solid workout at level 3... I can barely pull off- 3 sets/10 reps with the 4th- So much so, I haven’t even attempted band 5! But, this is a good thing! As my workout and strengthening continues, I’ll have the next level waiting to keeping improving my workout!!

These bands are clearly marked and as mentioned, they step up level of intensity with each colored band- I appreciate the ability to use different bands for different muscles/exercises. Hack: look online- you can easily find videos and step-by-step examples or, instruction for varied exercise options.
I realize these are photographed being used on butt, hip, thighs.. however, you can find plenty of options for varied muscle groups.
**Hack: To clean, I use a- yoga mat antibacterial spray or, a wet wipe to clean off. Wait until dry, before putting away..(I store in bag they provide!)

Hope this info helps... Feel free to let me know!

title: Listen to your guts.
review: What I like about this product is the ease of going between a straight shot and a curve shot. I purchased a storm C2 glove at first, when I got the glove the mechanism was complicated to me. Also, the bracket that held the strap that goes around your wrist; that clamp was loose and everytime you released the strap, the clamp would fall. Calling and speaking with the seller was not helpful in minimizing the concerns of losing the clamp or making all the gadgets less complicated. I asked him if all of the devices came with an unattached clamp, and he assured me that they all come that way now. I have been using a pro release glove for many years. Well I  returned the storm. I went ahead and purchased the Brunswick bionic from a different seller on Amazon, bowl.com. the glove is not anything like the storm c2. The clamp is secure to the strap and very easy to put on and take off. The mechanism is uncomplicated to work and the adjustment works well to release the action on the ball. Perhaps the other seller is a representative for storm, I don't know,but he know nothing about his products to have given me such a untrue story. Am happy I went with my gut and brought this glove. I believe ed anyone will be happy and roll lots of strike with it.

title: wrist / ankle weights
review: I needed these to lift after an osteoporosis diagnosis.  I purchased these because I can put on my wrists, ankles or just hold them.  So far, I am very happy with my purchase. They are cloth covered and very easy to handle.  Having said all of this, I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful!

title: Cheap junk and poor quality
review: Very cheaply made. Cheap fabrics not made to last.  We needed something to work outside in 120degrees+Weather. This won’t do at all! So hard to find the quality product I’m looking for. Used to have one that you submersible and lasted cooling for 3-4 hours. Wish I could remember the brand! Returned

title: Mark your coffee/tea mug or water bottle
review: I perfect size for smaller or larger mug or thermos to identify them.

title: Good value for the money
review: The quality of this product was the same as the equipment that was used at the Physical Therapy Rehabilitation Facility where I just was treated.  Good value for the money.

title: Good paddle, good length, good sized blade
review: Good solid paddle, great length, works great for my canoe.

title: Runs a Little Small
review: This is a great lightweight shirt, perfect for warmer weather. The shirt is made well and looks just like the picture. Sizing runs a little on the small side or it could be a slim fitting shirt instead of a regular one. My husband regularly wears medium t-shirts, but this one is just too tight in the shoulders and chest. I suggest going a size up.

title: Beautiful but broken/fixed
review:
It's a beautiful score board but unfortunately it arrived broken. We are waiting for the replacement. Hopefully it's in one piece

Update: we were sent a brand new score board and it is great! Works really well to keep score and is beautiful!!!
Easy to blow up.  Very sturdy.

title: pantry staple emergency or not
review:
Some Augason Farms stuff I buy as emergency food, some I buy for regular use. If I can price out something in this form that is same price or less than other forms, then I go with this as it can be stored away or kept in my working pantry. I use a lot of Augason Farms, and I've been pleased with this.

Dehydrated celery is a great addition to the pantry. Sometimes I dont have fresh, or I have fresh that went bad, or I dont find it in the store, or what is there looks bad, or price is way outside my budget. Having some dried celery tucked away in my pantry really helps stretch the budget and brings value to my time.

I keep the recipe trifecta on hand, "mire poix": celery, carrot, and onion. I keep fresh, frozen, and dried on hand. Usually used in recipes that will help rehydrate these foods no problem. Celery is very easy to rehydrate. I usually just add to the cooking process and its good to go.

Food scarcity is legit, so if you can stock up when items are on sale, then I recommend to do so. Consider it insurance.

FYI: food and such are sold based on weight, not volume. There is 1lb, 2 oz packed in this #10 can (that reads, "number ten" not "ten pound"- it is a size of can). Using a #10 can means that it provides uniformity among storage. Emergency supplies are packed for long term and are packed to stack. They also float. They can be repurposed. Even if one gets a dent, contents are still good (unless and actual hole, which is not likely to happen). The food will not be filled to the brim, and also.. food settles after packing.

title: cheap
review: after 3wears, the stopper on one skate came off.  The inside of the skate has no cushion, not comfortable on bottom of the feet.  CHEAPLY MADE! 1 SKATE IS ALREADY SHOWING WEAR/TEAR/AND DESTRUCTION AFTER BEING WORN (AT MOST 7X)  ***IF INVITED TO A SKATE PARTY, NEED SOMETHING FOR 1-3 WEARS, THEY ARE AFFORDABLE AND WILL DO THE JOB.  IF YOU NEED SKATES FOR DAILY WORKOUT, WEEKEND FUN, REGULAR AT ROLLER RINK....I WOULDN'T RECOMMEND

title: Great for camping
review: I’ve used this for a few camping trips. Works great! Nice strap to carry and the lid seals tight. Great product.

title: Terrific Selection of Sizes and Finishes
review: It is difficult to find assortments of the most used sizes of treble hooks.  This product meets this need.  It is my second purchase and I plan to buy more in the future.

title: Nice Pad For The Size
review: I don't have too many pads because they take up a lot of room, but this one is very small so I gave it a try.  I'm okay with the ground at most sites, so I probably won't change, but my kids love it and it does work well.  Like most self-inflating items, it only inflates about half-way, then you blow it the rest of the way up.  It is easy to blow up.

title: Finally all sizes in one.
review: I didn’t know there was such a thing as an adjustable kettlebell but this solves the problem of different weights for different exercises. It assembles (and de-assembles) quickly and easily and provides a good range of weights without takes up a ton of space.

title: Not For Humid Climates
review: I bought this for my son who works in construction. Doesn't work well in humid areas and this is the deep south so doesn't work well.

title: Very dangerous
review: I just bought this product so I could ride around the neighborhood with my daughter.  The first few trial runs wre great, and she loved being in the seat.  But the 3rd time out we took a different route that had a few gentle speed bumps for cars.  When I was almost home I felt the weight in back of me shift, and my daughter and the seat fell into me.  ALL FOUR bolts holding the seat in place had come off during our ride.  Had she fell backwards instead of forwards she would have fallen onto the pavement in the middle of the road we were crossing.  I do not recommend this seat at all and am taking it back to the store where I bought it as soon as possible.

title: Soft and comfortable
review:
This shirt fit as expected. It looks a bit boxy, but that it is to be expected with a sleeveless shirt.
Very soft material and feels well made.
Best of all, it was available in my favorite team, GO FLYERS!

title: Glad I went with this Machine Rower
review: I retired this summer from a full time desk job, and at least 100 pounds more than I want to be. Wanting to start a fitness program, now that I did not have a 10 hour day, I remembered that I really enjoyed my rower machine in the 1990's.  I did not want to spend quite as much as I did, however the reviews on the cheaper ones just were not as stellar as I would have liked.  I spent several days reading and researching what was available and decided that this unit using my own weight, legs, arms to maneuver this to an incline was smarter than a unit with a pump or cable.  It was easy to assemble ( I am a 62 yr old female ) and absolutely hysterical to try to get started on.  Once I adjusted the tension knob for the rowing arms and readjusted the foot pedals I was good to go.  Now, I have two bad knees, and a torn Achilles tendon, riddled with arthritis and fibromyalgia - I weigh 284 lbs at 5'9".  I had to figure out a way to get ON the seat since the device is on the floor and I can't do that (yet) but here it is - I love this machine - I do my stretches first, I have music set for a 45 minute workout - so far day three on the machine I have gotten about 7 minutes in with the full machine and another 10 minutes just using the pedals and seat to work muscles and get the cardio that I am supposed to.  My knees hurt LESS and I can already get up my cellar stairs with less pain.  It works my core too, and then of course the arms.  Since I don't want to get injured I am going slow but the machine itself was worth every penny.  I can move it around at will and store it upright.  It fits right in my art studio so it is not in the way in the rest of the house.  And the seat is wonderfully comfortable to sit on.  I can even stand up from the seated position on my own already.  Very pleased, I hope it lasts a while, I did keep all papers and tools in case.  Thanks for a great machine.

title: True to color
review: These are good  average sheets, I have noticed the longer I have them they are shrinking a little each time I wash them.  They are not soft sheets at all, but you get what you pay for 😵

title: This fishing scale is easy to use
review: This fishing scale is easy to use, easy to read and so far is accurate.  I have no problem weighing fish with this scale.  I love that it goes up so high. We have some big catfish in the south and it's nice to have a scale go up to 110 pounds.

title: Black is cracking and falling off after 2 days of wearing it
review: The black face is cracking and falling off after 2 days. Poor quality.

title: Excellent Bike Lock
review:
[[VIDEOID:a01d3ba760ef93ce761cf0c0cf53d265]] I bought the 35" model. I can hang it at the center of the handlebars while riding, with the lock at the bottom. The weight keeps it from flopping around. I also have the option of wrapping around the stem directly under the seat. I like the handlebars option better since it is instant off and on.

This is a heavy chain, and it appears like it would be difficult to quickly cut. I really like the magnetic connection as you insert the end of the chain into the slot in the lock. I like that it's an all-in-one chain bike lock with the lock attached, and that the entire chain is covered. Locking and unlocking is easy and fast. They provide 3 keys. You cannot just simply get extra keys at a locksmith store. You would have to order the replacement keys via the company.

title: Jump Rope
review: This is a good jump rope. It is very light weight. It does not make a clicking noise though when it hits. Also don’t know if that would be great for double unders. I don’t really know, because I really can’t do a double under, so that is just my guess. But it is a good jump rope and I do like it.

title: Save your money for something better
review: Basically just tshirt material with velcro.  Saw better at Petco for more money.

title: Some shedding

title: Fabulous,affordable,viable dropdeck cruzr u can build in2a Switch40 Tigerlike lngbrd4cheap!
review: This is a very good deal for the taller or older longboarder ( due to it's 41"length) . It's meaty but not over heavy. I count 8 ply (2glass 5 maple w 1bamboo/maple top ply w cool inlay stripes) so just a little flex at my weight. I used a large sheet of griptape. The concave is perfect. I used Calibre II 50° w/ zephyr speed bushings and some 70mm,78duro speed Dregs wheels. I can circle descend a hill outside my house & cruise 1.2 mile before having to touch asphalt for a push. It sits about 3/4"-1" off ground & is so,so smooth. I have freestyle , fast ultra rocker LBs , I have cruiser / slide decks & even downhill speed decks but when I seek chill, slow, very fast , controlled cruises, I pull this badboy out. I weigh 155lbs so I chose blood orange barrel 80street-side & a venom 90 tall barrel deck-side w flat washers; allows max turn for a very non-turny type board. Worth every dime. Highly recommended if you're near 6' tall and over 140#s.  Comparable to a Landyachtz Switch40 Tiger but I use no riser so a tad lower. I was super surprised by this deck quality.

title: Bigger Than Expected
review: This massage roller was much bigger than expected. I am not always very good about reading dimensions before ordering. I was hoping to be able to put it into a backpack and take it with me to my daughter's winter guard competitions so we could help with some of the soreness and stiffness that the students have after they compete. However, it's too large for that. It would fit in the backpack if I didn't have anything else it it, but I have a lot of other things that I need to transport with us, so it didn't work for that. The roller is also firmer than I expected. Since it's made from foam, I thought it would give a little but it doesn't. It's hollow which is nice and allows you to grip it better. We've been using this on my husband's lower back and it seems to offer some pain relief. I'm storing this in our workout room on the equipment shelf so it's handy to use when needed.

title: I'm astounded at how I love this fitness hoop
review:
Based on the other reviews, I expected to be extremely disappointed in this Altus Fitness Hoop. However, I absolutely adore this product because assembly is easy (see ASSEMBLY CAUTION note below) and since the hoop is weighted it is easy to keep going while doing the regular "hula hoop" motion. The hoop also has an all foam exterior so it cushions the impact on your mid-section.

I was able to do the traditional core excercise for 20 minutes straight without a problem. The only issue I had was that my mid-section felt sore because of the constant weight that was rotating around my stomach and waist. (The instructions warn of this for first time users.)

The hoop is a bit large and you have to use all the alternating color segments when assembling, so you can't make it smaller. It is about about 2-3 inches larger in circumference than my regular adult hula hoop which fit snugly inside the circumference of this hoop. As a result, I had to use this in the parking lot of my condo complex because I had no room in the house. This resulted in some spectators, of course.

Besides doing my core exercise in public, I also tried to do the arm exercises with the hoop. However, due to the weight I was unable to; but then again I never used a hula hoop any other way other than on my hips and that is all I wanted this for.

Other than the soreness I felt due to the rotating weight, this hoop is lots of fun. I can't vouch for the claim that it will imporve core strength and trim your waist, but I suppose that it might if you do it longer enough over a couple of months. When I hula my movement is very subtle so I doubt I'm burning more than a few calories. However, if you really gyrate when you hula, then you'll get more of a workout with this device.

ASSEMBLY CAUTION: The assembly instructions that came with this product are extremely poor. The way to assemble this hoop so that it does not come apart is to insert each segment into the previous segment and make sure that the "segment's release button" for each segment on your RIGHT is slightly protruding under the foam where the button connector dots are located for each segment on the LEFT. To test, twist (in an up and down motion) the left and right segments you just connected and also try to pull the segments in the opposite direction. If neither segment twists or pulls apart, then they are securely connected. Repeat this procedure for each segment of the hoop. Not once did this hoop fall apart on me. However, had I not done the twist and pull test, it would have fallen apart repeatedly because it takes some finagling to get each segment in place securely. Although this hoop is easy to assemble it still took me about 10-15 minutes to assemble the entire hoop since I made about 4 attempts and 4 tests per left and right segment to get the segments securely connected so they wouldn't fall off no matter how hard I pulled or twisted.

May 14 Update: I've been using this hoop every day except one for over a week now and still love it. It has not come apart once. Due to the weight of the hoop hitting against my body on rotation, I did develop a one inch bruise on my right hip. Other than this brusie I don't have any negative effects and the soreness I experienced when I used it the first time has gone away completely. I absolutely love this fitness hula hoop. Although I don't think I'm losing any weight from this, I find it a lot of fun and it's worth it just for that. One caveat - if you have cats (or dogs), don't leave the hoop where they can reach it. I put mine by the door a few minutes before I went out with it and my cats chewed through the soft foam on one segment of the hoop. The foam is easily destructible.

title: Decent for a hard bottom boat, but heavy and difficult to assemble
review:
This seems like a pretty decent raft with real seats and a hard bottom. I've owned and used an Intex Excursion 5, so I'm comparing it to that inflatable boat. The Intex is rated to seat 5 people but it's not much more than air pillows on an inflatable mattress. This Anythingsports model seats only 4 officially, but feels solid, you can stand, move around, and sit with your feet under you like a proper raft. It has a hard back for a motor mount, but I found the oars actually very easy to use to maneuver (much better than the Intex).
However due to the hard floor and the rear back, it's actually SIGNIFICANTLY heavier and harder to build. The instructions are also pretty terrible and difficult to understand. Carrying it requires at least two people in my experience so far, and inflating it with the included pump is a joke. It uses Halkey-Roberts valves for the air in multiple locations (3 sides and one bottom), which means none of my regular electric pumps worked. When using their foot pump, it was really difficult to make it all the way inflated, so we took it out with visible wrinkles still in the siding. It help up alright, but I managed to find an electric pump on Amazon with the correct Halkey-Roberts valve and was able to fill it all the way much more easily (see pictures).
It comes with an included carrying bag, but it's sort of a big flat shape of material with straps to tie at the top- not as much as bag as a way to just tie everything together. Things constantly shifted while carrying it and the bag started to rip in some places already. Honestly, for around a thousand dollars that they are asking, it feels like they could have given you much better bag or at least thrown in an electric pump. The experience would be so much better if they had.
Compared to our Intex 5 seater, the Intex is missing much of what makes this great- there's no hard bottom, motor mount is an extra accessory, it's more difficult to row, etc... BUT, it's easy to carry and assemble solo, and it costs only about 200 dollars. For 5 times more, you get a much easier and more comfortable raft, but much more difficult to build and carry, and you need a special electric motor if you don't already have one of these valves (it is the same kind found on many paddle boards).
Feels like the price tag is little high for what you get, but I see other similar boats cost more so maybe this is considered a good value for a hard bottom.

title: Too flexible at the joint in the rubber at the end of your toes for a training fin.  Better for snorkeling.
review:
I really wanted to like these US Swim Divers Fitness Fins. I needed a size 11 short fin for long distance endurance swimming in a harness in my pool year-round. I did not need a fin that was too buoyant and would make me lazy in my kicking.

I compared the yellow and black Phantom Aquatics Speed Sport Adjustable Snorkeling Fins L/XL (size 9-13); the US Swim Divers Grey and Black Large Fitness Fins; the black and yellow Cressi Palau Short Snorkeling Fins size LG--XLG; the SEAC Black (Large 9.5 --11) Fins with the fixed heal strap and open heel; and the TYR BP Burner Fins LG (size 11 -- Blue & Black).

First off I had to send back the large SEAC's and large TYR EP Burner's to get the XL size. Both of them were painfully tight on my size 11 feet.

The worst first. The yellow and black Phantom Aquatics Speed Sport Adjustable Snorkeling Fins L/XL (size 9-13) are for snorkeling and not for training of any kind. The boot and heel strap are amazingly comfortable and strong, but the composite fin is too long and whippy for training in either a pool or open water. I would not even want to do kick sets with these. I personally would not even want to use these for snorkeling because I would always be waiting for the tips of my fins to catch up to what I was trying to do in the water to position myself for snorkeling/sightseeing.

The disappointment next. The U.S. Swim Divers Large Fitness Fins had an open heel which I generally prefer because I wear different booties during the 12 months of the year. The length of the boot was perfect, the heel strap was strong, easily adjusted, and comfortable, and the boots felt really comfortable in shape and foot support EXCEPT for the constant pressure on the knuckle of the little toe on each foot. I'm absolutely a typical size 11, but they hurt my foot, and if you have a slightly thicker or wider size 10.5--11 foot go up to the XL. I personally didn't order the next size up because while I was kicking with them I could really feel that this fin was not stiff enough for training, and certainly not for kick sets. The rubber fin was bending too easily on every kick at the seam just beyond my toes on both fins - IMOP a serious design flaw for a "fitness fin." I could never do kick sets in these, but I could use these for snorkeling since the tips of the fins do spring back almost quickly enough to be responsive to my changes in direction and speed.

SO COMFORTABLE BUT SO LONG. The black and yellow Cressi Palau Short Snorkeling Fins size LG--XLG had a great shaped boot, a strong and flexible heel strap, and they were absolutely the MOST comfortable boot of all those I tried, BUT these were definitely a better snorkeling fin and/or an open-water training fin. They were absolutely strong enough for open water training (which I rarely get to do anymore), but too way too long for endurance training in a pool with a harness. If these were 2 inches shorter they would have been my overall pick of a stiff training fin.

I liked the way the SEAC Black Fins looked, but had to go up to the X-Large (11-12.5) and they were perfect. They have the fixed heal strap which I usually don't prefer, but this one is strong and stretchy enough to be very comfortable. The open heel did not make my feet feel unsupported at all. With barefeet they were a little soft, but with a 2mm or 5mm neoprene bootie they fit my feet perfectly. The front of the boot is comfortable lengthwise and widthwise, and there's no unnecessary gimmics in the fin design. As the ad says these are ideal for open water snorkeling for a good swimmer, and ideal for pool training. The fin is short enough and stiff enough for what I wanted to do. I can do flutter kicks or slow subtle kicks just to keep my feet afloat when I am working on my upper body. The fins do not add any extra buoyancy which I don't need with easy kicking or with a wetsuit on six months of the year. I am so glad I loved these.

I just had to try something new with the TYR BP Burner Fins LG (size 11 -- Red & Black). They had to be exchanged for the XL - the Blue and Black, and I feared they might be too big, but I found they have a very stretchy and supportive heel pocket, that was as comfortable and supportive as the adjustable heel straps I usually prefer. The TYR EP Burners boot will be my spring and summer fins as they fit my naked foot or with a 2mm bootie perfectly. It's good that the fin is just that short because just another inch or so and the fin would be too flexible. Perfect design by TYR for a training fin. As the ad says "The perfect fins for training at race cadence." I kept these for warmer water training and the SEAC's for cold water training. I would use each of these for snorkeling, as I am a strong swimmer and I want my fins to be very responsive to the demand I am putting on them to change direction or to accelerate and change speed.

I was not asked to give this review or compensated by anyone. Happy training.
