title: Fantastic sleeping bag
review:
I knew I would like this just based on how it was packaged. The bag it goes into is well thought out and helps keep it cinched down.

The blanket itself is quite large and easily fits two people (my kids love it) and stayed in it all day when I got it out of the bag. We also took it with us on a trip last night and they said they wouldn’t need an air mattress since it was thick enough on its own.

The material seems to be made well and the box says it weighs almost 10 lbs which seems true to form given it is insanely comfortable and very warm/cozy.

The zippers work very well and there is a pull cord at the top to help cinch it closed or closer together on cold nights. It wasn’t difficult to roll back up and place in the bag. There were also no stitching issues either. We are very pleased with this purchase and it definitely makes camping easier if kids are excited just for the sleeping bag.

title: Needs a strap or velcro for easier transport. Well made and no chemical odor
review:
We don't hike per se, but we do head out to the ranch in the deep West Texas borderlands a couple of times a year and you absolutely need water on your person out there. The Chihuahua desert and Chinati mountains combined with extreme temperatures out there can cause a serious hydration problem very quickly. Typically, I put two one gallon containers per person in our saddle bags and we ride out. I like the idea of having this water pouch for walking with it's built in straw.

The pouch itself is easy to see with clear sections in the camo print so you know exactly how much water you have left. The straw has a pull off cover and it pops back into place with a firm click so you know it's really closed. The fill opening is wide enough to refill with a water hose or just using the regular old kitchen faucet. I was surprised that the pouch has absolutely no plastic or chemical scent whatsoever.

My problem is the lack of velcro or any sort of straps to attach it to a backpack or belt. Basically, you have to carry it or already have a backpack with existing straps or a pocket available to hold a water pouch. It this had an attached loop even on the top, I could clip it my saddle or my jacket - I rarely use a backpack when on horseback so we'll have to retrofit something to this.

title: Cute!
review:
Very easy to put on. I bought the two blue ones to attached to the front wheel. I have a pretty visible flashing red light at the back. I ride mostly on city streets so it's important to be visible when the sun is going down. Putting the two blue ones on the front wheel helps me to turn them on without dismounting when I have stopped. I turn them on when it's getting dark. The two lamps also creates a bluish light just underneath the bike. That in combination with the forward flashlight mounted on the handlebar gives me enough visibility as I move forward and also for cars that are passing me and making any right turns or veering into my lane.

Very happy with this product.

title: No instructions and cheap quality but still functional resistance bands
review:
I expected more from this resistance band set but for the current price of $17.99 it is just okay. First, this set comes with absolutely no instructions other than what I found on the Amazon site. Second, one of the clips on the resistant band barely opens and when it does it sticks. Third, the foam on the handles does not extend the full length of the handle. Forth, the internal roll on the door anchor easily slips off.

My biggest complaint is the lack of instructions. Nevertheless, I tried each one of these cables. The resistance is too light for me. I eventually combined all the cables onto the handles and that provides the best resistance. In that mode, this is pretty good.

I personally will not use the door anchor as I never like using door knobs or my house framing for exercise equipment. I always feel damage will be done. In fact, I had loosened a door knob once by using that for resistance bands.

The ankle straps are nice and they are comfortable as well due to the thin internal padding. I find it awkward to use resistance bands on the ankles, but others might like this. Once again, I feel the bands will have to be doubled up to get a good resistance.

IN THE PACKAGE
- Nylon Carry Bag with cinch tie for closure
- A door anchor
- Two cushioned handles
- Two Velcro ankle straps with padding
- 5 bands totaling 100 pounds
--> Yellow band = 10 lbs
--> Blue band = 15 lbs
--> Red band = 20 lbs
--> Green band = 25 lbs
--> Black band = 30 lbs

In general, this is an okay set for upper body work. My main disappointment is the lack of instructions as there was no user manual in my set. I know the Amazon site says it comes with that, but mine did not. My second disappointment are sticky clip and about a 1/4 inch of missing foam on the handles.

title: Works perfectly to tighten my shoe and sneaker laces
review: I purchased two of these for my shoe and sneaker laces because I find it difficult to keep pulling the laces from the bottom to tighten them. These hooks work perfectly and they are not only for roller or ice skates. My only complaint is that the seam on the sides of the handle where it meets the hook sticks out. Nevertheless, I am still happy with my purchase even though I consider $18.12 ($16.99 plus $1.13 tax) an expensive $9.06 per hook which probably cost less than $.80 cents to make.

title: Ingenious design; four pieces turns into one leakproof bottle
review:
This is an ingeniously designed infuser bottle that disassembles into four pieces (lid, main bottle cylinder, reamer, bottle base). I used this to hold some limes by using the reamer to extract the juice into the base and then letting the lime halves stay on the bottom. I then screwed the reamer into the base, then screwed the bottle cylinder on top and filled with water before putting on the cap and shaking.

The cap has a cloth strap for carrying. The bottle is made of BPA-free plastic and is not dishwasher safe. When fruit is placed on the bottom, there is no way to get 22 ounces of liquid in this container. Nevertheless, I love the design, the color, and the ease of cleaning.

The only thing I dislike is that I have to unscrew the cap to take a drink. I would have preferred a clip top that I can just pull up and drink from. I also wish the carry strap was made of silicone because the ribbon takes time to dry. Also, note that one has to be careful not to hold the bottom section as leverage when unscrewing the cap on top. Hold the top section only because this will avoid the bottom section from being unscrewed with the top and causing a leak. Other than this, this is a nicely designed water bottle.

title: Wow! Very fun and quality is solid!
review:
[[VIDEOID:e53d44f424ad031caa224478290f5a38]] I ordered the ‘Segway Ninebot S-Plus Smart Self-Balancing Electric Transporter, White’ for review and I would like to share my experiences and thoughts.

I would like to start by saying that I had the opportunity many years ago, to ride on the original Segway and always thought that someday I would buy one, as it was a super fun experience. Second, I have only ever ridden one other “Hoverboard” and I happen to own that one. Although it is fun to ride, it’s crazy sensitive and not as easy to control as the Original Segway nor the Ninebot S Plus. In fact I won't even ride the other hoverboard anymore.

So the Ninebot S Plus basically comes shipped in two parts. There is the Mainframe which is the wheels and motor, and the Steering Bar which is the part that sticks up and has padding at the top which you use your knees to steer with. Assembly was pretty straight forward (if I remember right) and I had no issues getting it all set up. After a full charge I was ready to try it out and I must say what a huge difference it was compared to the other hoverboard that I own. The auto self balancing of the Ninebot S Plus (when powered on) is absolutely incredible. Though it does take some getting used to, it’s super easy to get on and go. Unlike the smaller hoverboard I own, which is so squirrely to balance and steer by pressing forward with either your right or left foot. The Ninebot S Plus self balances and the steering is as simple as just pressing your right or left knee against the steering arm. It doesn’t take much pressure at all to turn, so you do need to be careful or you will end up on the ground as it can really easily turn-on-a-dime!

Another thing that the Ninebot S Plus has over the other Hoverboard that I own is the huge 11” air filled rubber tires. This makes the ride so much smoother and it will easily handle rougher terrain. The solid rubber tires on the other hoverboard makes it near impossible (for me) to ride on an uneven road and forget about dirt trails. Any little bump causes the board to turn one way or the other because it messes with your balance. The Ninebot S Plus handles uneven surfaces like a champ, and I have even ridden it on some dirt trails which it also handles quite well as long as it isn't too rough.

The Ninebot S Plus is advertised as having a 22 mile range which I will say is probably pretty accurate. I took it out to one of my favorite local parks that I bike around frequently, and I am sure I put about 10-13 miles on it and abt two hours later with a full charge, and I ended up with about 35% battery left. The park trails were mostly paved (yet bumpy and uneven in parts) with a few hills that I have no idea the grade, but it handled everything I threw at it with ease. Once I really got the hang of it, I was cruising at top speed and felt that I could have handled much more than just the max 12 mph. This leads me to my biggest gripe about the Ninebot S Plus. Though I understand the Top Speed Limit, and I appreciate the safety concerns, the annoying alarm sound that starts at about 11.5mph needs to have an option to be turned off. Once you hit near top speed that alarm starts beeping and it automatically throttles you back anyway. The throttling I can handle, but the alarm is just plain annoying. I couldn’t find settings anywhere in the mobile app to turn it off. If you are reading this Ninebot, PLEASE let us turn the alarm off ;) On a side note - you can also adjust the Max speed in the Mobile App for beginner riders. By default, upon first-use the Max speed is set to like 6mph and after you have ridden it for a bit you can use the App to bump it up to the max 12 mph.

The included Remote Control is fun to use to drive the Ninebot S Plus around remotely, but there is a bit of a learning curve. The joystick is pretty sensitive and it gets a bit confusing when you steer it around back towards yourself. The controls at that point are backwards. Similar to flying a drone. The remote also acts as a follow-you device. This means you can walk away from the Ninebot S Plus while holding the remote, press the follow me button and the Ninebot will follow you. It’s almost like taking your dog for a walk and it can be pretty fun although I rarely use it that way as I would much rather be riding it haha. The other feature that my Daughter actually realized, is that the remote can be used to honk a horn on the Ninebot. While riding the Ninebot and holding the remote you can just press any button and the Ninebot will honk. I wish I would have known this before my trip to the park as I could have used this feature to warn the pedestrians as I came speeding up behind them as the Ninebot is so quiet.

There is also a plug at the top of the steering arm that is for a camera that you can supposedly purchase separately, however I can not find anywhere in the states that sells it. I read a forum somewhere that said they decided not to sell this in the US market which is crazy to me. If the plug is there, shouldn’t we be able to buy and use the camera? Oh well. I guess I could rig up a Go Pro mount.

BOTTOM LINE
I could go on and on about the Ninebot S Plus and how much fun it is to ride, battery life, the included remote control, 11” air filled rubber tires, 12 mph top speed (with the annoying alarm), the free Mobile App and the 22 mile battery range. And I forgot to mention the kewl Smart Safe Lighting feature. It’s basically a headlight that will automatically adjust brightness depending how dark it is. I personally have not yet rode it in the dark outside, but have seen it working while playing with it in the house at night and it works great. Overall this is a quality item that should provide many years of family fun. Our family absolutely loves it!

title: Golf cart dream item..  if only it could work!!!
review:
Who wouldn’t love some great tunes on their golf cart..?!! As a family who owns a golf cart yet, has never golfed a day in our life - we’ve spent the last decade doing nothing but, fun rides and adventures all around our planned community with our kiddos on this toy. Music would only enhance this- and give us golf cart karaoke?!!

Problem is.. this is a one size fits most. But, it didn’t come close to being “most” for us! How.. when we have the same speaker used in the sellers sample photo description- see photo I included..??!! Right from start when trying to attach we had issues.. this has 6 velcro straps coming out of the sides- (picture a big bug with legs!) Zero instructions included and you'd think this would be straightforward.. Trust me, we tried straps forward wrapping around pole and then, backwards just the same- we even went back to description online.. studied the photo and still had no success.

Problems we incurred:

•Straps are not long enough to wrap around the pole and speaker- and have enough length to close on themself. (this is placing the speaker in same spot as advertised!)

•2 of the 3 sets of straps were sewn in backwards- so, if wrapping around the direction they’re attached- The Velcro teeth on x2 straps are on the wrong side. (Equivalent to getting two negative signs together..) hoping this is an error!

•From photo description it appears we are missing a middle extra strap? Photo shows x1 in brown strap thru middle but, we don’t have anything of the sort...??

•This has no bottom support or “shelf” for added protection.. this could lead speaker slide at the bottom if it were to become a loose. Golf carts bounce around a bit and vibration may cause this to slip. So, bottom support would be helpful if not, necessary to protect the speaker from falling down and give the user peace of mind.

•This is missing a simple but straightforward set of instructions.

overall, this may work with a much smaller size speaker- one with hardly any girth.. Even then, it may be hit/miss to get the securely fastened. I’m afraid a smaller speaker may not produce enough sound to be heard over a motorized golf cart and will it stay safe? In leui of listing this “one size fits all/most..” this would be beneficial to list the actual length and dimension of straps so, one can verify speaker sizes that would work! Listed at a price point of $10- this could be a great find.. if, it could be successful. Tbh, It may be safer to invest more solid option to ensure it will fit/function as expected. I hope this info can help your decision… Feel free to let me know!

review:
This is a nice bottle. It is made from durable plastic. The surface does not feel slippery and is easy to grip. There is a wrist strap connected to a key ring at the top of the bottle. The bottle is labeled with time goals and motivational phrases on one side, and shows measurements in ml and ounces on the other. This is a great bottle for staying hydrated and for helping you to achieve your health and fitness objectives.

title: Color is not like the photo or the description
review:
I bought these because the idea of a neon green whiffle ball was nice.
I love that color, and for my purposes, it would be fun.
I don't golf - I use these for cat toys.

The color is actually more of a dull light olive green - think Shrek.
There was no brightness and definitely not neon!
The photo on my calibrated monitor is definitely not like what I received.
(And I do graphic work, so my color is very accurate to real life.)

So, the product is fine, but the color is definitely NOT neon green.
If you use them for golf, you might be able to see them on top of short grass okay, but
if you plan to use them where the grass levels change a lot, it would be better to stick
to the actual brighter colors, like the oranges or yellows.

Again - not uber important for what I use these for so I am not returning them,
but don't expect a vibrant, bright color either.

title: Good Bike
review: Overall this is a good bike. The assembly was pretty easy compared to putting furniture together. It arrived without any damage, which is good. The seat is pretty big but it's hard and not soft, so the increase in comfort is only it's size being bigger. The peddling is smooth and it's pretty quiet, you only hear the whirring of the fan. My wife is 4'11" and I am 6'5" and we both can use it just fine. The seat adjusts enough for us both to use it. It is solid and does not move around when using it. Otherwise, good bike.

title: Convenient and Interesting Feature Set
review:
I selected this multi-tool with the intent of replacing several smaller tools in my tool bag. My bag has gotten a little overloaded and this would be a good option for reducing some of the bag clutter in favor of a more compact and versatile single unit. It's an interesting tool with some good features, but it's not quite what I was hoping for. This is a case of failed expectations more than anything.

Though it looks very much like a pocket knife, it is a full multi-tool. The design is quite different than any other similar tool I have seen or used as it does not emphasize the pliers. As a result, it is smaller and more compact than most multi-tools. That's a plus out of the gate.

I could go through the list of all the features it has, but those are spelled out in the product description and would serve only to waste time and space. Instead, I will focus on the specifics that I think are worth mentioning.

Like most multi-tools, this one does not have a spring-assisted swing-out blade, though it does lock nicely. This means you have to pull it out and manually snap it in place to lock it. If you're used to having a spring assist, this will be a disappointment, though it should not be a surprise if you've worked with other multi-tools. Also no surprise - there is no safety stop at the base of the blade, so be careful when cutting.

The pliers are workable but are thin and awkward. The folding handle is thin while the other handle is the case of the tool, and as a result the pliers are somewhat unbalanced in the hand and a little awkward to use when you first work with them. The idea behind a multi-tool is convenience and not to be the primary tool, so this is forgiveable.

The bits that come with the tool set this unit apart from any other I have used. Instead of one or two swing-out drivers, this one instead has a single post and a set of bits that can be changed. This gives a tremendous amount of flexibility. There's just one problem - the post does not lock in place and can fold in on you while in use. This represents the one real complaint I have with the tool as a whole - locking the post would have been an easy feature to implement and woul dhave made the tool a lot safer. Please use some caution when working with the bits.

This is not a bad tool at all, but it is not perfect. It is designed for convenience and it does work well. My main concerns are safety-related, and even so one should keep in mind that this is a convenience tool, not one on which you should rely every day. If you're looking for a multi-tool, this is a reasonable choice that's worth a look.

title: Decent Camping Lantern
review:
[[VIDEOID:7cace53d54dd11d9ca86d52ec20f0527]] If you ever go camping or if you live in an area where there are frequent power outages you understand the need for a good lantern. I have worked with several lanterns and while I have used some that are a little brighter or a little more compact, this one is a decent one that has some good features. Besides having a couple of operation modes, it is chargeable via solar energy.

This is a reasonably bright lantern but it is not blindingly bright like some others I have seen. This is a trade-off in my book. If you are expecting something that is bright enough to light a small camp area and allow you to read by it, this is a decent lamp. If you want something to light a 20'x20' room it is not strong enough to provide color recognition through the whole room.

This lantern has a rechargeable battery that can be removed and plugged in to the provided power adapter for recharging. It can also be opened up to expose a pair of solar panels so it can be charged up via solar power. There is something very important to understand about solar charging, though – using the solar panels to charge this lantern takes a lot longer than if plugging the pack in. I have not tried to completely charge the lantern via solar power but in my experience solar charging takes roughly 4 to 5 times longer. That said, if you do not have the option to plug in, the solar panel is a superb option.

This lantern seems to be solidly made and resistant to easy breakage. So, I believe it would survive a drop from a short distance, though I would hesitate to test this theory. The hook loop on top is plastic but it seems sturdy enough to handle frequent use and abuse.

This lantern has two operation modes. It has two brightnesses – dim and bright. The dim light is enough to light a hallway when carrying this lantern though it is not going to work for tromping through the woods. The bright setting is not actually all that bright but it is enough to see through a large room and make out everything in it, though it does not cast enough light to see colors clearly at more than 10' or so.

Overall, this is a decent little lantern. It seems to be made well and it can be charged by either a power adapter or solar power. Just keep in mind that it is not going to charge quickly if using the solar cells to charge it up.

Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: Quit charging after 6 months
review: Quite charging after 6 months

title: Like that it matches our pool table felt
review: Like that it matches our pool table felt.  Less streaking on the felt from the blue color...Pool table is a moderately cool moist basement. This chalk has kept its quality for sure.

title: but my children do not like it as much as the stiffer option
review: This mat doesn't fit as snugly as the original that came with our trampoline despite being the identical size. This weave/material/whatever "gives" more, therefore reducing the bounce.  I cannot speak to the longevity as it has only been on for a couple of weeks, but my children do not like it as much as the stiffer option.

title: Strong, Sturdy, and Durable
review:
Lawn chairs are useful for many purposes. They come in handy when you attend events and are a practical addition to your backyard. They are not all created equally, though, and one of the better ones I have used is this chair, the Tepui Single Chair.

Taken from its transporting bag, this lawn chair is ready to use- you just have to pull the legs apart and stand it up. It has a cup holder for drinks and I like that it is placed below the chair, attached to the leg. With other lawn chairs, the cup holder is right there, on the arm of the chair, and your drink can get in the way of resting your arm. I also like that the covers on each arm are removable. They are held in place with Velcro and if you don’t prefer them, that is perfectly fine, as they are easy to remove.

With comfort, this chair is better than most. I don’t get that ‘sinking feeling’ like I often do with other lawn chairs. This one feels more secure and the weight limit rating confirms that it is, indeed, stronger than the average lawn chair. Another cool feature is the mesh back. It allows air to flow through and it does make a difference at keeping you cool and preventing perspiration from forming on your back.

This lawn chair is easy enough to fold back up and place into the carrying bag when you’re finished. I should point out that this chair is heavier than others so carrying it for a long distance could be tiring. However, it is also stronger and more durable than others. I am willing to put up with the added weight to have a better lawn chair.

I have several different lawn chairs for home and event use. This lawn chair from Tepui is an excellent one overall, delivering on comfort, quality, and strength. It is the best lawn chair I currently own and now that I have used it a few times, I am ready to toss my other, cheaper chairs in the trash and replace them all with this one. It really is that good!

title: Do not size up!
review:
I had some trouble deciding whether I should get the small or XS, I'm 5'7" 120lbs so I'm on the thinner/average size.

I got the XS and I'm glad I didn't size up, these XS gloves fit well but they definitely don't fit snug so a small would've been loose on me.

These gloves seem pretty well made and for the price are a good deal. I wish they offered the XS in other colors besides pink though.

The fingers are on the longer side, it's not uncomfortable, and it's nice if you want extra protection.

These work well for weight lifting to prevent calluses and offer a bit of wrist support.

title: Hardest to use...
review: I'm terrible with planks so I was terrible at this. Maybe my abs are in need of a lot of strengthening but I couldn't do exercises with this for the life of me. I miss the old 80s ab roller where you sit up and aren't putting pressure on your arms. I returned it. Its too hard, trust me.

title: best water bottle ever
review: I have tried so many bottles and finally found the one! No metallic or other taste just clean water. Washes easily and doesn't retain odors. Also I have dropped it so many times including in my garage on the pavement and never broke or cracked.

title: Works Well!
review: These night vision binoculars work pretty well, especially when there's still a small amount of light. The binoculars require batteries which were not included. We're using rechargeable ones with it. It doesn't magnify to the extent that traditional binoculars do, but they do enlarge somewhat. My husband has had fun with recording the images that he sees with these. It comes with the SD card which we appreciated.

title: Awesome
review: Worked great for filling my break fluid up! Very easy to use and understand!

title: I ordered these but ended up returning them
review:
I ordered these but ended up returning them for a couple different reasons:
• The mesh pockets on the side do not fit my iphone 6 in its case, which is the biggest catalyst for my returning these.
• Despite generally wearing a size 4-6/small, I ordered the medium in these and it was definitely still a struggle to get them on.
• The fabric had some kind of weird feeling/coating to it. Perhaps that would have gone away once washed, but I do not know.
• Also as a note, I'm 5'7" and thought these were a little long (though, granted, I normally wear capris).

title: Loud, weigh nothing
review: We are spending several weeks in the deep West Texas desert mountains this fall. An emergency whistle is an absolute must for hiking, riding horses and  anything else outside. These are very lightweight and the lanyard fabric is smooth and soft, so you can wear it without irritation.  The whistle is very loud and can be heard a a fair distance in a pinch. I like the multi pack option - I can keep a whistle in each car, back packs and one in my saddle bags.

title: For the price - excellent purchase
review: This knife is fun to open.  It's sharp as f.  Beware, it's safety orange in color.  Probably not a bad idea if you're out in the woods hunting and drop it.  If the needs arises, won't hesitate to buy again.  Would be a great stocking stuffer for the men in your home or the blue collar guys at your work if you're looking for a decent little gift everyone can use.

title: Solid, old school seatpost.
review:
Resolution of the tilt is pretty coarse. If you are searching for a very specific saddle angle - e.g. transferring a fit from one bike to another - this could prove frustrating. Better to go with a contemporary design with no notches.

OTOH if you are familiar with this 1980's type design and you like it, you are probably not going to do any better at any price. The fit into the seat tube was precise.

I am now using this for an extra saddle I use on my trainer. I have a saddle that has too much padding for long rides but perfect for 90 minute trainer sessions. This seatpost is about the exact right quality and price for that application IMHO>

title: DO NOT BUY!
review: The worst cooler. It said it was water proof it would hold ice. The entire backpack is soaked I’m soaked and now my daughter doesn’t have a cooler to take her cold drinks to go to track! Very upset!!!!

title: Mediocre duration of cooling but good for a lunchbox
review: Meh. As well as these things can work, this brand does but I find they keep stuff cold for about 4 hrs so, good for a lunch box but not for using in a cooler to keep drinks cold or anything...

title: Nice rollerblades
review: My step son used this item. He wears a size 2 (these skates are for sizes 13-3). The colors look good and seem to be made of solid material that will hold up well. I would advise reading the instructions to maintain the life of the product because they give instructions on how to do that, which is useful. The lights are a nice touch, but you can only see them inside or in the dark, they wont be visible in the day. It was hard for me to learn to adjust them at first, but once I got the hang of it, it was pretty easy. My step son said they were easy to ride also and he seems to enjoy them. However, I would not have paid $50 for this item.

title: Great
review: Works water proof

title: Fun
review: Fun drinking cup. Thought it would be more “flavorful” but it is a cool concept.

title: Great Protection
review: Loved this hat so much I purchased another one in different color for my Auntie. Gave me excellent protection of face & back of neck in 90 degree beach 🏖 weather

title: Can’t charge or Re-charge Just Died
review:
It died and won’t take a charge after infrequent and gentle use. Waste of money and not as bright or versatile as the WSKY ONE that can be used as flashlight and flashing red in case car breaks down or whatever.

Would not recommend!

title: Where have you been?
review:
This is an amazing product.
I have used a running belt and arm band and they become uncomfortable after several miles.
I tried this and I think it is a great idea. It works if you put it in the front, not really on your back.
I hope the magnets and Velcro last!

title: Lays kind of funny if you are larger busted
review: Runs small. See through. Lays kind of funny if you are larger busted.

title: Bladder is good quality, but I prefer camelbak’s bite valve
review: The 3L version is a little wider and shorter in length than my camelbak 3L bladder, but it still works fine in my hydration pack when filled up. I had broken the plastic hanging tab on my old bladder, and this one has a more durable feeling plastic for the hanger. However, I don’t like the plastic piece in the bite valve. It doesn’t provide as much water flow as my camelbak’s bite valve. I also don’t like the bite valve cover as it is hard to undo while mountain biking and it annoyingly flops around if you leave it undone. The solution was easy though... the camelbak bite valve fits in the tubing. It was difficult to get the original off, but it wasn’t too hard to replace it with the camelbak bite valve.

title: A life saver for locking "Halkey-Roberts" style valves
review:
We own a couple of paddle boards that use what I thought was a proprietary interlocking air valve. It looks sort of like a bayonet that twists into place, and can be released by twisting the pin inside to hold it open. They came with manual pumps that are a royal pain to use, but I couldn't get them to fill with any of my standard air pumps because the valve was so specific.
I recently picked up an inflatable raft that uses the same kind of valve, and after doing some Googling, I discovered it IS, in fact, a standard called the Halkey-Roberts mini valve. Well, sure enough, they DO make pumps like this one that fit that sort of twist-lock valve! I'm SO happy I found this after years of assuming it was some weird non-standard. It works great on both my paddle boards AND raft, saving me from getting tired of pumping before we even make it onto the water!

It isn't as fast as some of my other standard pumps, but to be fair we are pumping to a very high PSI to make things like the paddle board rigid. There's a lot of pressure required. Meanwhile, I like that it has an automatic shut off you so can leave it going and walk away once you set the desired pressure. No more babysitting the pump. The cord isn't particularly long, but I use it with a portable battery bank that offers a 12V DC port so that's fine. I DO wish it had other options like AC power or just a DC input for us to power it however we wish instead of limiting us to an automotive style plug, but I can't complain too much. The fact that this exists has already saved me so much time and effort. Very much recommend!

title: Works
review: The end a little more pointer I give it all five and maybe buy again if pointer.

title: Not so good
review: These are shiny, no dents to match the Glock and also have seems where the equipment left marks. So as such, they are not nearly as good as say Pierse's. Yeah, they are cheaper, but you get what you pay for.

title: Adorable gift for the little girl who likes to fish!
review: Very cute, well made, accompying storage bag and tackle box made it the perfect gift.  :0)

title: not for me
review: water goes in no matter which style you swim

title: Great flag
review: Great flag

title: Nice light battery needed
review: Smaller than appears

title: Awesome baseball holders!
review: I was very pleased with these baseball display cases. I wasn’t sure with them being so reasonable. Will definitely purchase again. Very sturdy and definitely giftable.

title: You definitely get a workout
review: My electric ones and other pumps broke from age and Heat being stored in a garage and I don't want to pay at the local air pumps for everything from basketballs and soccer balls to bicycle tires although I'm primarily using it for bicycle tires so I will just consider it a workout and hope for the best

title: As Advertised
review: Very small. Great for carrying on a bike. I probably would not re-order this as it is very small and difficult to use

title: Buyer beware!
review:
Look, this is probably my fault, but I thought I had purchased a bear bag with attached line. When in fact this is so l.j d as a bear bag "kit" that consisted of a little bag with a length of twine and a small carabiner.

The twine and carabiner look cheap and not up to repeated use. The carrying bag is essentially useless.

I would not recommend this to anyone.

title: For the price, these are decent enough brakes that last well enough
review:
I commute daily on a fixed gear bike with a front brake. I need the stopping power in a single brake to be able to halt me immediately. These work great, install easily and don't squeal loudly. Since I ride daily I go through brakes pretty quickly and I wouldn't say these are cheap brakes, I get a few months out of them, but there are definitely more expensive brakes out there that would hold up longer and stop better.

Still, for 3 sets of brakes these are a bargain and do the job I need. I'll keep buying'em.

title: Five Stars
review: Light to carry but feels sturdy when seated

title: MISLEADING
review: "...Different colored reactive zones within the target..."  Ummm... no. These are PLAIN PAPER targets, not reactive at all. The only way they react is by tearing up from the bullet's punch - doiii.. Reactive in the true sense of reactive paper, nope. BTW, they are supposed to include four (4) 3" ACTUAL REACTIVE targets, but this package doesn't include that. Maybe that's why it's cheaper than the $20 stacks. Still though, don't try to mislead people with words like "reactive.. " else, you're gonna get a "reaction"

title: Works good
review: These work great and no different than the fat gripz.

title: We're missing the mark on this one
review:
I really like the concept and intent behind the design of this carrier. However I believe the bag needs to be taller so the drawstring cinches around the neck of the water bottle. The current design still allows the bad to slip off and move around when cinched as tight as possible.

I like the pockets on the front, however I would have to remove my phone case for it to fit in the large pocket. Of course I understand the primary function is not the added items you'd like to carry, just my findings as far as what works for me.

The carrier is made of quality products and I really like it, I just wont use it as much as I thought I would.

title: The perk of the 3 in 1 is awesome.. very convenient!!
review:
The idea is there and in theory.. these Snapatite little gems can do the trick and be that all inclusive utensil you’re looking for.. A few things to help you make an informed decision:

•The perk of a 3 in 1 is nice- doesn’t get much easier than that! However, the type of food eaten will effect the efficiency of these utensils.. *note: they are far from norm. of daily use but, expected.. the knife is to cut/separate simple things vs. using dirty hands! Fork has stable prongs to pick things up with ease. Spoon does the trick as well- but, is a tad smaller in size..
•Color coding is sublime.. especially, if you have kids, these things matter! Assign each person a color- Then, it’s their job to wash, pack, keep track of, and/or- store as expected.
•washing with soap/water will work fine on plastic. Just be sure to rinse/clean INSIDE the knife sheath too!! If using knife while eating and restoring to one unit, this can get food yuck inside- so, inspect all pieces before thinking this is clean and packing away.
•Keep in mind- overall size Is still smaller then, Standard utensil.. Even with both sides connected. May be a total bonus if, space is an issue- but, may be harder to use for some larger adults.
• These do not come with any type of personal cover or, storage bag. For germ safety/keeping clean, this would be great if included. But, one must provide protective cover on their own.
•safety/peace of mind- this can be used for all ages without worry of injury. Love the knife is covered to prevent accidental piercing of pack/person while storing.

I ordered to place inside emergency “bug out” kit for me/my fam.. with hope I’ll never need to use for this purpose. Yet, with things as crazy as they are in the ‘corona world’ right now.. We must be ready for anything. I’ve got kiddos who will look to me to fix things if, they go downhill quick!! So, for my purpose- I’m happy with the product! If things settle back down, I’ll take the pack camping and have everything all ready to go.. For our needs this worked great and has the ability to do the same for you as well!
I hope this info helps.. feel free to let me know!

title: Buy it if you want to die
review: Do your research before using this!!! When in Hawaii every expert said do not use this, that there are a tremendous amount of people have been dying using them. I thought this was crazy and something “must have been wrong w them” , so I tried this anyways and it was AWFUL. I felt like I was going to suffocate and it made me panic. My husband tried it to see if I was being dramatic and after a few minutes said “omg this is horrible. I can’t breath”. The charter boats won’t even allow you to use this (and after trying it I know why!).

title: Not a great quality, look elsewhere
review: Cheaply made golf cart cover. Barely fit on my Yamaha, had to be super careful putting it on, I was afraid it was going to rip. I am not sure how long this will last if I keep putting it on and taking it off (bound to tear at some point). I would suggest you look for a more expensive quality cover for your cart because this one isn't it.

title: Excellent value for paracord
review:
This is a nice quality para cord and a great value for the length! We use these for a variety of things from obstacle courses to wrapping steering wheels.

This is a great para cord, it is strong and the black is solid throughout the length.

title: Not sure
review: They’re designed different than what I’m used to. Starting to get used to the way you peel the coated paper off the actual tape but I will probably go back to the brand I’m used to using

title: Five Stars
review: Awesome product. Works well. Use over camp fire and even over backyard fire pit.

title: Short time use and it no longer flips open
review: I bought three of these since I use them every day. Even though I love them, after only a short time the rubber seal has broken and it no longer has the flip activation that I loved about it.  Now I need to manually open it and when I drink the top part comes back onto my nose.  I don't mind opening it manually, but, I'm not liking the sitting on my nose part.  I've only ever hand washed the top part.  I thought buying three and alternating them they would last longer.  They may want to think about adding some rubber rings with their order?

title: Fall out
review: They are a joke, they fall right out of the ear. Gave a five star for easy to remove, cause they come out by themselves! 🙄

title: Ha-ha!
review: Actually, we got this mug for our mini-Winneago rig - we’re outfitting it and renting it out when it’s not in use.  So, the mug was going to be a laugh that sorta went with the traveling rig!  Great mug - good size, and we’ll probably end up ordering  another one!  It’s good for a laugh - but it’s a well made mug, too!

title: Two Stars
review: Smaller than other items I purchased from same company

title: Kinda big
review: Not a pocket knife - too big for that. More like a broad knife. It’s not the sharpest I’ve had but still ok. The blade shape is useful for opening things. The spring snap is positive and best are the slight finger grooves improving the hold. Maybe best for keeping in car door pocket or using for opening boxes. Price is right.

title: Comfortable, Blocks Odor Well...Unfortunately, This Sock Doesn't Hold Up Very Well.
review: My husband owns , uses and likes Hissox athletic socks. He gets a lot of use out of them and he says they hold up well.  With regards to this particular sock, the Hissox men's low cut no-odor/no show workout socks, he does kind of like it but says its, "not my favorite" (out of all of the Hissox he currently owns).  This sock is comfortable and light and the 'no odor' claim is correct.  But according to him, this particular Hissox sock doesn't hold up as well as the other Hissox he owns.  The second time he wore this sock, the sock itself began to wear down on the bottom of the foot portion of the sock on both feet.  This area did not 'spring back' into place after the socks were washed, you can see a noticeable area on each where the sock is  worn down.  This particular pair of Hissox has been worn only twice and unlike his other Hissox (as well as other brands of athletic socks he owns), it doesn't look like this pair has much life left in it after only two uses.  He is pleased with the comfort, the fit and the no-odor portion of the sock.  But the quality of this particular Hissox (and ONLY this sock!!!!) is not up to par with the others and it is unlikely he will use or purchase this  sock again. (He WILL continue to use Hissox, just not this particular sock!)

title: Fun for Everyone
review: Great product- purchased for our vacation to Wisconsin over Christmas and my kids and I had a blast with these!

title: Not very long
review: This item was not as big or thick as I thought it would be.  It is very soft and colorful.

title: My doggie is a hurricane rescue
review: Living in Florida we get some of the loudest storms ever. This works. He calms down and we get through it

title: Missing phone mount.
review: Works as described. Good value but was missing the adapter to mount phone.

title: Meh!
review: If you need food for survival purposes, this will do in an emergency. They are really rather tasteless. They can be much improved by adding some fresh ingredients, like ground beef, onions or tomatoes. Use them for camping or store them for emergency use.

title: Keeps everything super cold BUT BROKE IN 6 months
review: My boyfriend does roofing in Arizona and it’s very hot, he said this kept everything super cold. However it already broke (the spring came out of the locking mechanism)

title: Same Problem
review: The charger has 4 setting for 4 brands of Battery. Using the setting they have chosen, the charger continues to blink, and does not charge. It does not work with any of the other settings either. It simply blinks telling you it is searching. A blinking lump of metal.

title: So tiny. Would not buy this
review: The post are so tiny. You are probably paying for the burner which we haven't tried because we can't find fuel that fits it. At this price point I would just buy a cheaper mess kit and burner separately. The post are tiny but seem well made though.

title: Will order again!
review: Bought for my son. Just what he needed.  Will order again. Quick shipping.

title: Eh
review: I don't think these are that great. They're much thinner and looser than I had imagined and tend to slip and slide towards the back of my head after only a short period of time.

title: Happy.
review: Gift. Happy.

title: Greatest Idea
review: Good in weeds I haven't caught anything. Still great idea.

title: FSU FAN
review: LOVE IT!!

title: Heavy duty!
review: This helmet is very sturdy.  Well made, cute and has all the certifications that you want to protect your child. I got this for my granddaughter and she thought it was very pretty. This is one heavy duty helmet and I am so glad I found it.

title: Not waterproof
review: A sad waste of money. Not only is it not waterproof, but every card inserted to capture photos was ruined. A loss that exceeds the cost of this fault camera.

title: This is the second scooter like this I've bought
review: This is the second scooter like this I've bought.  The first stood up to daily, almost constant use for three years before the base plate cracked, but my youngest, who is almost 2, still uses it.  I bought the new one for my older daughter.  Nice and sturdy, easy to turn, wheels turn smoothly, and the brake is easy to use.  When we wear this one out, I'll probably buy another!  This new one has an adjustable handlebar that we didn't have with the previous scooter.  We love the whole thing!

title: Happy
review:
We are only using the toilet. We still have not used the sink.
The toilet was worth the purchase

title: I liked it, my wife didn't
review:
This is a nice, lightweight hat. It is made of what looks like waterproof material (I haven't tested it), and I like the strap that comes with it. That's the good news. The bad news is that my wife thinks it looks silly. Evidently the top of it is too short and so to her it looks like it's too small.
I wanted to get it for our vacation in a couple of weeks, but I have a feeling I'm not going to wear it..
Bottom line, it's a nice hat with good ventilation but the top may be too short for some people's taste.

title: Weird substance all over my mat
review: [[VIDEOID:f7a4683a2e7207a70146e45394ed3967]] What is this nasty stuff all over my mat?

title: One layer of protection in snake country
review:
I received a pair of these as review samples. While they are perfect for their intended use - keeping mud off your jeans while mucking about in swampy and muddy places, they are also excellent for protection against some snake bites. To be sure, they are not going to work as your sole protection, but they do provide an additional layer that will protect your ankles from fangs.

The key is they are loose and billow around your ankles. When worn over flared and thick trousers and snake proof boots you have protection in depth in that area.

Of course, they are also excellent for reducing mud as you hike (or even do yard work after a heavy rain.) The velcro makes these easy to put on and remove, and will not jam or break like zippers or come loose like buttons and cord.

Bottom line: they are perfect for hiking in snake country as well as keeping mud to a minimum.

title: Decent gloves, but require non-standard batteries/charger
review:
These gloves are decent. In terms of comfort and warmth, these are fine. My biggest bone to pick is that the gloves require non-standard batteries and charger. Other heated gloves/vests I've tried have all been powered by USB power banks, and you can use any USB power bank. These gloves, however, come with their own batteries and are charged via a DC port (I think that's what it's called). USB power banks, wall plugs, etc. are very common these days, so it's easy to find a charger. With these, if you lose them, you might as well buy a new pair of gloves. For this reason alone, I would skip these.

In terms of functionality, these work great. They are comfortable, heat up quickly, and get to a good range of temperatures. The gloves also have a stylish design. Another thing that I liked about these is that they aren’t SO big/puffy, like most heated gloves.

These would be 4 star gloves if they used a more common battery pack/charger. But because of the non-standard battery/charger, I can't recommend these.

title: MY NEW BEACH CHAIR
review: Both light and comfortable----perfect for "older" people! (and well-worth the price)

title: Holds my balls up well
review: I've played three rounds with these tees and I can say with no reservations that they do a fine job of holding up my balls so I can whack them into orbit.  I've never seen a tee better (or worse) than these.  They come with a fancy paint job too.

title: Light and Comfortable
review: Being of cotton with just 5% spandex material, these are very light and comfortable capri pants. They're well made and have held up very well to washing.

title: Too tight across shoulders..
review: Fits too tight across shoulders,otherwise would like it,just can't zip it up and move around comfortably...so kinda defeats purpose of a jacket to stay warm in.

title: Love it
review:
Update after a few months the screen in the drain is really getting on my nerves. The drain is covered by a fine mesh screen and if you’ve ever used a fine mesh sink strainer you know that they clog up quickly. So now this fine mesh is constantly clogged up and you can’t remove it so there’s no way to clean it. so now every time I have water in the sink I have to stand there with a stick or some thing scraping the mesh so that it will drain. It’s aggravating. And unnecessary. They could’ve put a plastic grid in there because if something goes down the drain, it’s not the end of the world because it only goes 2 feet before it either ends up in a tank or on the ground. So the fine mesh was a poor design choice. Maybe I’ll drill some holes in it I don’t know. But it is definitely aggravating to use right now.

Old review..........I have this set up in my art studio shed which does not have running water. I do a lot of watercolor, so having something I can fill my water jar with is nice, and I can wash the paint off my hands when I’m done. I think it would be good for camping too, though I have an RV with a real bathroom, so I don’t see me using it for that purpose. But it’s great in the shed.

title: CANNOT BE TRUE CARBIDE!!!
review: THE GOLF CLUB CARBIDE GROOVE SHARPENER WORE DOWN IMMEDIATELY UPON USING IT ON MY GOLF CLUBS.  GENUINE CARBIDE DOES NOT BREAK DOWN RAPIDLY.  I'VE WORKED WITH CARBIDE FOR MANY YEARS IN MY CAREER AND CARBIDE TAKES A BEATING, IT DOES NOT WEAR DOWN EASILY.  VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!!

title: Not impressed with the customer support
review:
Initially the fitbit flex worked really well and I was very pleased. All the sudden it would still charge fine but a full charge that initially would last almost a week, was now barely giving me 24 hours of usage of the flex.
I contacted customer support and the only way to do so is using email. It takes them about 2 days to get back to you (had issues before and it took that time both times). They told me the firmware needed to be upgraded and would improve the performance of the flex. I did that and sure enough no change. The full charge still drains within a day and makes the unit rather useless. Having a week on one charge wasn't too great to begin with but having to charge it every day?

I informed customer support that it was still not working, well that was a few days ago and I still haven't heard a thing back from them about replacing or fixing it.

Rather disappointed in the customer service. You can't find a phone number to actually just call and get things done and the support with email takes days to even get a reply.

I was going to get the new unit they have the force, but now considering their customer support I might just cut my losses.

title: Nice enough set but horrible quality control
review: The set is thick and seems well built enough but our knee and elbow pads aren't centered so if someone were to fall using them, it wouldn't really provide the protection you need. That aside they're decent quality. Fix the quality issue and it's a good product.

title: Mat Seems Okay - But No Bag!
review: The mat seems okay after three uses, but being new to yoga and mats, I expected this to come with a bag to put it in.  It does come with a strap, but that doesn't offer any protection while on the train, bus or even from the elements.  I would much rather they had ignored the strap and included a bag to protect and carry the mat.

title: Black not Blue and Fair
review:
Ok. I admit I should have read better but the pictures is blue and the description is black. I somehow went with the blue picture and of course, got black. My fault but come on, how hard would it be to put a picture of black headphones on the page for apparent idiots like me?!? Second, I have others, a pair of Pyramex Low Profile Ear Muff 31dB for example, that do a much better job and are less bulky and also a better value at 10$ than these at 15$ for 28dB. I actually do not know how they got the rating they did. I could hear quite a bit when these. I kept them because its better to have an extra pair but I doubt I will hardly ever use them
If you are going to use these at a shooting range, beware, they don't block out much sound.

title: Not durable
review: Extremely disappointed in this product. The bottle had fallen from a ottoman no more than 6 inches from the ground and broke. The spout of the container broke completely out leaving my carpet soaked. Ive had my children drop cups of the same make from highchairs with not a single break. I do not recommend this item.

title: Very sturdy
review: Comes complete with a pump. Holds air well and is very firm. I use it to release hip flexors which are always a problem for me. This solves the problem.

title: Gifted
review: Nice flag cool graphics

title: Recognition
review: It was exactly as promoted and displayed:) Recieved as agreed!!:) Easy to order:):)! Exactly what I needed... Fun recognition...

title: Fell apart and cut my hand, twice!
review: I bought this pump in June and have only used it twice.  Both times it fell apart while pumping my tire.  Both times it cut my hand.  It didn't even fill my tire with air.  Worse pump I have ever used.  Even the cheaper ones never cut my damn hand!!!!

title: So Glad I Bought This
review: I bought this on sale, and I am so glad that I did. It is sturdy, and I can keep a good amount of food cold. I didn't know I needed this in my life.

title: Easy to pack, but flat
review: These pillows really do compress down tiny, which made them very easy to pack.  I bought them for my husband and son for a camping trip.  Both said they kind of stayed flat after taking them out of their bag, and didn't offer much support.  Both ended up using a bunched up sweatshirt underneath to give it some "lift".  Would recommend buying/using two, especially if you like a bigger pillow.

title: The doors werent even attached
review: I opened this up and 1st thing i notice is the doors to the wooden cabinet werent attached already. It was a little bit of a pain in the butt to get those on. Now that the doors are on the little pegs that hold it on keep falling out. Yes i put them in all the way and yet they still have a tendency to fall out. I dont trust the 2 tiny screws they give you to mount this heavy cabinet to a wall.So ill have to wait to mount till i have proper heavy duty screws and anchors. The final thing i dont like about it is when i screwed or pushed the 2 screws in the doors to attach the knobs the cheap coating on the door started to bubble up. Overall its pretty heavy,unassembled, and cheaply made. I would not recommend anyone buy this. Unless you get it really cheap. I regret trying to save a few bucks and next time i will splurge on a high quality board.

title: Great gift idea
review: Gave this as a gift to kids. They loved it, easy to set up and use, sits above ground. Durable!

title: Great gift for grandson
review: Bought as birthday gift for grandson

title: I love this Rumblex Plus
review: Great machine.  I am new to vibration and I really like it.  My muscles feel very tingly afterwards and my joints feel better.  I love it and am very glad I made this purchase.  Worth the money !!

review: The first time out in the water one of my husband's fins cracked/bent/broke where the foot part (black) meets the fin (yellow) part, this made the fin unusable.  Considering we were on a snorkel vacation we were not happy with the product.

review: This bumper fit the stock well.  It was a tad tight, but needs to be.

title: Nope. If you practice daily vinyasa flow, pick a different mat.
review: I had a Gaiam mat for years and with now daily use, it finally lost all of its grip. I was satisfied up until recently, so I thought I'd stick with the same thing. Well, Gaiam must have changed something. This new mat does not have a good grip at all; I was sliding in downward facing dog.

review: Perfect.. just what we wanted

title: I love this umbrella style
review: Pretty, super easy to open, less of a wet mess, and drip dries standing on its own.

title: Would not recommend this glove to anyone that doesn't have a black ...
review: The glove is ok but the blue coloring bled all over my racquet's formally white colored handle.  Would not recommend this glove to anyone that doesn't have a black racquet handle.

title: Five Stars
review: We got this to fix missing ones on our air mattress. Turns out all sizes fit, which was unexpected!

title: Will not stay in place
review: Nice material, feels comfortable but they do not stay in place. They roll down and flip over. Did not see a size in the description. My thought is for a large or extra large leg.

title: Perfect travel pillow and beach pillow!
review: Great comfy pillow, I used traveling and on the beach on vacation! So easy to inflate and deflate!

title: Hail to the HIRAM
review: Feels like a more expensive unit - seems the build quality is there. It does come with co-witness post which can be taken out if like low profile. I've not shot with it yet, but seems an awesome addition for AR type or carabine. I've another Hiram unit I'm pretty happy with. This one seems to be sturdy enough for even a shotgun

title: Solid replacement lid for gallon rtic
review: Well I bought a gallon jug, the jug fell off my forklift shattering the lid ( the lid doesn’t take a fall very good ) .. needless to say I got a replacement and so far so good.

title: Got a dud at first
review:
The scooter I got just flat out didn't work. Assembled it, charged it up as instructed in about three hours, hit the throttle and nothing, didn't budge at all. Swagtron customer service said they've heard of Amazon shipping refurbished scooters as new lately, which I'm guessing happened to me because the "new" scooter has a few scratch marks and gouges down near the joint where the handlebars fold up.

Also the rear disk brake is very stiff and you have to manually push the brake lever back into place or else it drags on the wheel, and the screw that fastens the brake lever to the handlebars was almost impossible to turn, I lost some skin on my fingers and stripped the screwhead getting it into place. Now I have to get it off again and pack the whole thing back up.

Amazon customer service is shipping what they say will be a brand new scooter that works, and they're also sending UPS to pick up the old one for no charge. Hopefully this will get resolved but this is all a real disappointing pain in the neck.

UPDATE: Got the replacement from Amazon in a few days as promised. It definitely seems new, since there's packaging and safety stickers that weren't included with the first one I got. No scratches either. The brake lever went on easily and works well. But best of all it actually works. Pick up the front wheel and hit the throttle and it maxes out at 17.9 MPH with no load. Haven't tried it outside yet because of weather but I have been driving around an indoor garage and it hits over 14 MPH no problem, which feels pretty fast. The light works well, the app connects easily. The battery has dropped by 50% just driving indoors so I doubt the range is as advertised.

title: Perfect
review: bought this and the bucket to go together. very well made. I would buy this agan

title: The mouth piece works great too. Good quality
review: My daughter will use this in the pool.  The masks fits well and is airtight with no leaking.  It's adjustable so it fits my small head and also her head which is a little bigger.  The mouth piece works great too.  Good quality, looks as though it will last a long time

title: It's okay
review: I used this in physical therapy and it didn't really help me all that much. I didn't like having to wear shoes, but it was painful to not wear them.

title: pretty small diameter, but decent construction and works!
review: Decent overall sturdy construction, but small.  I am not a large person by any means, but this board has a pretty small diameter and if your going to lean upper body/elbows on it for core strength, IMO, its pretty small. You really have to bring your elbows in to hold onto the board.

review: Good design and quality. Came with good batteries. Very impressive quality and usability.

title: Make sure the bike is assembled properly from the factory
review: When we started putting the bike together, the front part is on backwards.  In order to fix this problem, I will have to figure out how to take it all apart and redo all the brake wires and gears. I’m very frustrated. It looks beautiful and once I figure out how to do all that, it will be a good bike.  There are no instructions on fixing this problem.

title: We’ll made

title: Truly heavy duty

My yard is clay and it was difficult to drive these anchors all the way in. I had to use a wrench to get some leverage with the last few turns. But this meant the anchors weren’t going anywhere. I used these for a bounce house, and they were way better than the cheap plastic stakes that came with the bounce house.

One of the two tires that I received had old looking rubber and a damaged wire bead.  I really like the Hard Shell Gator tires but if you need foldable tires, DON’T use this seller.

title: Decent but has some issues
review:
Decent bench but does come with some issues.

Pros- Moves around (on hard floors) easily so you can move it to new workout position in the room. Good black paint job and looks nice, Great weight storage, adjustable slots, curl bar and leg lift apparatus is good. Relatively solid look and feel (minus the bench)

Cons - The bench is wobbly which is incredibly distracting and very frustrating. I have shoved wood shims into the bench shaft and that has helped but I cannot adjust the seat forward or backward with the wood shims in place. Seat attaching to adjustable shaft is also wobbly so both wobbles combined is frustrating and distracting. The bench is not detachable so when doing flat fly's you sometimes hit the barbell rack. Finally the seat does not adjust and pivot up far enough to do some of the exercises. It only adjust flat, medium and a little above medium.

title: Doesn't Move Around
review: I'm in my 50's and I have recently started watching (and doing) beginning yoga videos online. I had a pair of cork yoga blocks but my husband got rid of them because he didn't think I would use them. This block is not as sturdy as the cork ones. When I stand on it, it does compress and squish down a bit whereas the cork one did not. I also don't feel as secure on it as the cork ones.  This comes as a single block. The block is quiet and doesn't move around on the hardwood floors. Overall, it's okay, but I like the cork ones a lot more.

title: I didn't listen
review:
My husband is a knowitall - they all are. I've been mansplained more times than I care to remember. BUT, and I hope he never reads this review, in this case he was right.

I bought this for my HK16 22lr which I enjoy tremendously. The previous red dot was a cheaply made $20 unit but it worked OK until the glass popped out on a super hot day this past July. I liked this one because a friend of mine has it on her rifle - but my hubby was mad at me because he had this last year and hated it (it did quit on him).

Well.... my red dot was DOA! No light, no laser, nothing. Without saying a thing to him, I just returned it. Then, I found a better one for $60 - Riteon! And it IS right on! Good company, good red dot.

Far as hubby, even a broken clock is right twice a day.

title: Makes a clicking type sound no bell sound
review: Our "bell" makes a clicking type sound. No "bell" sound at all.

I think this would make a great gift/stocking stuffer for the teenager or senior citizen on your gift list who is interested in tracking their intraday activities.

I love Amazon, but these seller inconsistencies make me want to stop ordering from them!

title: Large fits my big head. Accurate sizing, know your head circumference, choose size wisely
review:
I am reviewing the Jeff & Aimmy Cotton Vucket Hat in the color " Black#990022", which is gray with a black bow. I was supposed to receive the hat in black ( 00707_black), so that it was may come up under my review. I will include pics of the hat on.

Before you select one, make sure to take a look at the sizing. There are TWO sizes available, Medium OR Large. There is no elastic, nor ability to adjust, so choose wisely.

Medium fits 55-58CM (22.2"-22.8");
Large fits 58-61CM (23.03"- 24.0") ----my head measures 23.75", this fits very well.

Despite that the product description states that the hat is adjustable, it is NOT. The only portion that is "adjustable" is the optional chin strap. On mine, it can be kept clipped on, or taken off. There is a toggle to make it tighter against the face, or allow it to be loose.

The interior has what appears to be an elastic band, but it is not elastic. It's purpose is more like that of a sweat band or to provide some grip, but it doesn't not stretch. This will either fit, or it won't.

I normally like Jeff & Aimmy products, and overall I like this too. I just want to see a cleaned up, more accurate description. (and what are with all the reviews for this product yet are for something not being sold here?)

The material is soft, light. The brim is long but can be folded back some as needed.
The slit for the pony tail is subtle. So it will blend in when not in use. But to use it, is a little awkward as you will have to feed the pony tail through a narrow slit. Not bad though. Doable.

I do appreciate that there are size offerings for larger heads. It is rare- extremely- that I find a womens hat that fits anything above 22.5". MY cranium is 23.75", so I can't wear most stuff. SO unless you have a bigger head like mine, you will most likely be wanting a medium. If your "large" is too big, then you ordered the wrong size as the size large is accurate (23.03"- 24.0"). It will just fit if your head it 24". Might be snug. It fits mine just right at 23.75". Or if your medium is too small.. then again, likely wrong size. selected. Either way, make sure you got what you ordered.

I use sun hats (when I can find them in my size) a lot. I prefer to avoid the sun. I keep it off my face and body, especially during the summer months. Between sun sensitive meds, rosacea, and just wanting added protection from UV rays, a sun hat is a great thing to have. Since I can add this to my list of companies that sell larger sized hats I will possibly be back to purchase more. I like the overall look (even if I did get something different than anticipated).

title: Sending it back after seeing the pic of woman getting hurt on it
review:
Even though it was easy to assemble but we have decided to send it back because the trampoline is actually way too hard. Even when Im on the ground I trip all the time. There is no bar on it for safetyand thought I may fall off of it after seeing the lady in the video with bruises on her face.
A few years back I was healing over my sprained ankle and it hasnt fully healed so I dont want to take any chances.
It is way too hard to disassemble it too because Im scared its going to snap on me while I try to snap it back into the box.
