title: less for camp more for everyday use (cold or w/ microwave)
review:
I like the idea. If you are using this for home, office, hotel, on the run. For those applications you are likely to have food that doesn't need to be heated or you will have access to a microwave. Maybe even for camping, or day hike, so long as you are not looking to also cook with it- as it is not meant for flame or direct heat. For that, I prefer to pack a metal bowl and cup set.

There are two "plates" at .75" deep, and a "bowl" (or lid) that measures 1.5" deep. The three items stack.

There are 2 eating utensils. Spoon on one side, and a combo Knife and Fork on the other. The spoon and fork work fine. The knife is best for items you want to cut that don't need a lot of work to get it done. Softer, easier items are best.

There are two cups. The base is a soft silicon that smooshes up inside. The lid/cap is attached. It flicks open easily, yet doesn't snap tight (too bad). Comfortable enough to drink from it with cap open, or can keep it closed and drink from the small opening.

The cups don't stand well on their own empty. They do fine with liquid inside. One of my pictures has the pink cup leaning up against other stuff because it is empty. The green one is standing fine, but I have water poured inside.

Everything stacks and fit together nicely. Needs harness to hold it all together.

Nylon with mesh, draw string bag is just big enough to fit the stacked together and harnessed items.

I tried this set at home with my lunch, so I could see how everything performed. I like the look of it, I like the materials used. I think this set would do well with an additional lid/bowl so there would be 1:1 for each set. Especially as a cup and a utensil fits nice in each plate, it would be nice to have an additional lid for one of the sets. This would allow the set to be parted out (say one for work, one for car) and/or as well as allow each user to have the exact same thing. I don't know why it wasn't arranged to be like that.

I do like the cups, overall, and am considering toss one in my purse.

title: Need to sync every day if you use a HR monitor with this product.
review: This device has been great except for the HR monitor.  I have the HR chest strap and vivofit that works with the HR transmitter, but the software is really not equipped to handle so much data (i.e. 1 hz or 1 HR reading per second).  I have to sync my vivofit daily otherwise I lose days of data and get errors because the HR data overwhelms the Garmin Express software.

title: Super tight
review: Super tight kinda small

title: Inaccurate Dimensions
review: At the time I bought this Mega Plus Seat, seller stated at Amazon it is 3.2 inches thick with foam, and 14.17 inches wide. The Mega Plus Seat is only 2 inches thick and 13.5 inches wide. I returned the seat for a refund.

title: Warm hands are great!
review: We had occasion to use this hand warmer while out in the latest snowstorm, and what a difference a hand warmer makes!  Fits  in the pocket and is rechargeable, so it’s ready for the next storm.  Very glad to have these - when hands are warm, everything else feels warm, too!

title: Pay more for a better product
review: For the price, it is what you pay for. Pay the extra money and get a better one. Missing some bolts and the instructions were HORRIBLE. It does its job, just expected more I guess.

title: I sooo wanted to like this bike bag
review: This bike bag is wonderful but has a fatal flaw.  The straps that are on the underside to attach it to the bike rack are crap.  They are too long.  The velcro is placed too far away so that if you pull it to the tightness you need, the velcro misses itself entirely.  That pretty much renders it useless.  I've tried numerous fixes, short of cutting the strap and sewing it back together shorter, mostly because I don't have a sewing machine which you would need with the kind of pressure you have to put on it to make it tight.  Another thing is the placement of these straps makes it anything but quick release and quick re-attach.  As I live in a large city, I have to take the bag with me whenever I make a stop, and fiddling around underneath with hard to reach attachment points adds way more time to each stop.  The third thing is that those straps are of very poor quality.  The weave is loose and they are flimsy.  Which is strange because everything else about this bike bag is very well-made and well-designed.  In the final analysis, I gave up, attached a milk crate to the back of my bike, and I throw this bike bag in it.  Which pretty much invalidates the panier function I wanted.  Also, not the sleek sportive look I was going for, but it sure beats the frustration.

title: Use for hot windows!
review: I have a west facing scorching hot house, and I covered my windows with these sheets over the weekend-- what a difference!

title: Track Your Rides
review:
With many of us working out at home now, sometimes we need a little extra motivation. This gadget helps you track the data of each ride. You can either use that information for self motivation or use it in competition with friends and/or family. It's small and easy to mount. The GPS takes a little while to set up the first time. My only concern might be the battery life, but that's a minor issue. Otherwise, I think this is a good buy.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided helps make your decision a little easier.

title: Overpriced
review: It is a nice football but not worth the price

title: Good fit
review: Fits well, excellent quality and very sharp looking.

title: it's amazing!
review: It's very soft, flexible, and seals very well around the eye. The lens/view is clear under and above water; it does not fog, it's amazing!

title: Fish on hooked up
review: Great quality

title: Feel liek they will fall apart quickly
review: They are definitely not a quality product and just like a ton of other things on Amazon, they are exactly the same item listed under a different "brand" name.  I do not trust these,  I ride on road and gravel and feel like they will break easily.

title: On the short side
review: Cute jersey but I didn't care for the high neck. Returned it because it looked funky on me. True to size but it is short.

title: Nice value set.
review:
I ordered this 'JIFAR Skateboard Helmet CPSC ASTM Certified Impact Resistance Ventilation for Multi-Sports Cycling Skateboarding Scooter Roller Skate Inline Skating Rollerblading Longboard' for my 11yro daughter to replace her old helmet which was getting a bit to small for her.

I figured this would be a nice fit for her however it fits just a little to small for her. I think it would have been better for a little younger child, but with a few adjustments I was able to make it work for her. The included pads are nice but have not been used really yet as I mainly ordered this for the helmet. The pads are of good quality however, and seem like they would last at least until she were to grow out of them. The helmet is also of nice quality and aside the fact that it fits a little small, it should last until she completely grows out of it. For the most part, after my adjustments to it, she seems to think it feels comfortable and she loves the color and style. I hope that this was helpful.

title: Strongly recommend
review: Love them! Very durable and don't slip!!!

title: Ready for a tailgate party!
review: These are serious bag toss game parts - very heavy and substantial!  All set for the first tailgate party - easy to carry in the car and to set up.  In the meantime, we can set them up in the backyard and practice!  More backyard fun!

title: Hmmmm
review: We bought this for a 5 year old that swims like a fish and is a HUGE mermaid fan.  The ankle back strap would just not adjust properly so it would not stay on.  We had a group of young girls, ages 5 to 10 and we were not able to adjust the strap so that it would stay on.  After trying them on a wide range of different ages and sized girls, I would not recommend these fins.  Not to mention that these promised with "prime shipping" and I didn't catch in the check out process that there would be a HUGE delay in shipping.

title: A must for Veterans, Military and Others
review: We can never forget the sacrifice our military make for others all over the world. Regardless of politics they sacrifice! This is a great token to show appreciation and recommend it for the home, cars and work places.

title: Not a perfect replacement if you have an older frame, but does the job
review: My daughter has an older Zuca frame that we bought second-hand. The handle jammed and wouldn't telescope no matter what we tried, or how many gallons of WD40 we poured down the inside. We had no luck taking the handle apart to get to the spring, so we just bought this replacement. And it fits about 80%. It's the same length and all of the holes line up except for one pair on the back, so we tell her not to lift it by the handle when it's telescoped, though that's just a good rule of thumb. Otherwise, it's perfect. It was a cinch to install. I'm about as inept with a screwdriver as they come and I did it in about half an hour.

title: works great!
review: well made, works great!

title: You get what you pay for.
review: Handle grips are JUNK...between trying to get the bolts loosened to get them on my handle bars and tightening them to my handle bars...two of the four bolts stripped out. They’re worthless, not to mention, the end caps don’t fit and they look cheap.

title: Lack of quality control
review: Okay so I was excited to be able to use this on our mini vaca. However when the ring toss came that was not the case anymore. 3 out of the 5 poles are not threaded so they just wobble around in the holes. The stakes continue to fall out when a ring is thrown at them  One or the rope circles was not even together in a circle form, like the glue was no good. I have to say even at $20 this game is not worth the cost. I'm thinking quality control is lacking on this item because there are many good reviews!

title: Absolutely love it
review: I ordered this for my teenage daughter, but I just might have to steal it back sometimes. It's just that cute. It is a decent quality hat too for the price point. I would but this again, for sure! I think it would make a great present too!!!

title: Smells very strongly of chemicals when first opened
review:
I had to leave this in the garage for a few days to let it air out. It still has a faint smell, but it is much better than before. For something that advertises itself as free from harsh chemicals, the strong smell surprised me.

The mat itself is great. It is a generous length, but I wish it was a little wider. The top surface is very nonslip even though it is pretty smooth. It is heavy, with a solid feel. The cushioning is good for the thickness (which isn’t really very thick), but it works well over hardwood and concrete flooring.

title: For 45 minutes I have a great workout
review: I am not a cyclist, but like to spin to stay healthy.  Troy is great coach and this workout involves fast spinning sets, interval sets, and hill sets.  I was not bored at all and boy did I feel like I got a great workout.  Between each set there is a rest time, and to some degree you need it provided you put in 100% during the set!  The group included all age group, all with decent fitness, so you are not training with just triathletes!  Although there were references to cyclist terms, this you figure out pretty quickly what it means by looking at the leg speed of the group!  This is my first spine rival DVD workout and I am impressed and I will look into getting a few more.  One less star since I wish they had references for spin bikes too.

title: Broke quickly really cheap!
review: Poor quallity

title: buy it!!
review: well made, works great

title: Clever & useful basket, dismal mounting brackets
review:
The basket for this is very useful & clever design. The basket is large. It detaches easily by folding up the handles & can be carried into a store or wherever. When the handles are folded down, the basket is locked to the bracket, when they are extended up, they unlock. We added the small carabiner to keep the handle from being jostled by bumps allowing it to detach.
The mounting bracket attaches to the bike with nothing more than gravity & a lot of faith. We put the zip ties around the handlebar brackets to keep them from coming off on bumps. The bottom bracket uses a flimsy piece of velcro that broke immediately after the picture was taken & was replaced with yet another zip tie.
Once we got the mounts firmed up (mostly with a bunch of zip ties), the basket holds well & is useful. The handlebar mounts have rubber coating but the bottom bracket inexplicably does not & will beat up the paint on the stem.

title: Works well, comfortable and easy to put on thanks to clasp
review:
I like that these have generous rubber padding around the eye cups to keep the water seal from breaking. Some cheaper goggles seem to skimp in that area. They also have a very easy clasp attachment in the back which makes putting on and removing these feel more premium.
They work very well and my kids tell me they are comfortable, so I'd say they are a win!

title: I wound not trust this in deadly situations
review: The build quality is subpar. The plastic doesn’t feel high end and as a matter fact feels like it would break off under stress. The light beam is very narrow and not strong enough for anything over 7 yards. So if you were using this in the woods it will disappoint you badly. On the flipside the laser is quite bright and seems like you can go fairly long distance. The connection point to the Picatinny rail is very flimsy, so flames in fact that I don’t think they should be used on anything over airsoft rifles. Overall I would say I would not buy it again and recommend you don’t either. It would be far better for you to save your money and get something of higher quality.

review: Too small for what I needed.

title: Garbage
review: This is just a sock, didn't do anything to help my foot, another rip off on Amazon.

title: Good design improves on an old reliable system.
review:
It's designed to cut on both sides so you don't have to worry about how it lays of the top of a limb. At 48", you can use long strokes. It does not come with a rope, but it's probably better to pick the rope you want, rather than using some cheap poly rope that typically comes with these.

Rope saws do work pretty well, but they're a lot of work. It takes some time and quite a bit of effort, pulling back and forth on your ropes. Hardwoods like Oak, will take a while. A four inch Oak limb, 30 feet in the air will tire you out but because of the improved design features, it will be easier than older designs. It beats climbing way up into trees and hanging from ropes with a chainsaw in your hands!

It's a fairly simple concept that works. The tricky part is getting a rope threaded through where you want it. You can put some small stones into the pouch to make throwing bag with some string attached, the use that to pull your rope and the saw through.

title: Not for women's bodies?
review:
It's small and lightweight, which is what I wanted. I don't think it would take much to tear the material as it seems pretty thin, but that's what you get for lightweight and cheap.
What bothers me is the way it's designed. The plastic strap adjuster and the strap are designed in such a way that they chafe terribly on arms. It rests on the side of my boobs and my arm rubs against it, which makes for a very uncomfortable hike. I wouldn't take this longer than a shorter day hike the way it's chafing my arms and my husband will probably be the one carrying if he's with me. I have never had this problem with backpacks before, so it must be in the design somehow. Loosening or tightening didn't seem to make a difference. I guess that's what i get for buying a cheap backpack?
The water bladder is fine, but the mouthpiece is pretty tough to use. I'm used to a camelbak which is easy to bite and drink from, but this one you really need to use your teeth on it. But it's a locking mouthpiece and it ensures that you won't have water flowing out if you accidentally sit on it. I find it easier to lock than the camelbak I previously had so I guess there's a little bit of a trade off.

title: Easy to assemble! Fun theme!
review: We had this assembled in minutes! So easy to put together! My daughter has loved it! I’m impressed with the sturdiness if it and how easy it is for me adjust the seat height. My daughter loves the lol theme! Perfect bike for a beginner!

title: Very nice bike, easy to assemble and use!
review:
Came mostly put together already so the remaining small percentage was easy to setup. I saw someone complaining about vibrations but mine is on a rubber mat and I have zero issues with that. The bike functionality- it works flawlessly and I really enjoy it! I love the workout I get from this and I love the tablet/ phone stand on the front of it! I turn on some music or a movie and get to working out, makes time go by much quicker!

I can't think of anything to complain about on this one, it's an amazing piece of equipment that I'm very satisfied with! The listed price point I think is pretty fair for such a sturdy bike.

title: Worked for me.
review:
This has been a great set of bands to rehab and old shoulder injury. The set contains multiple different resistant bands and attachments depending upon your needs. You can go from 10-50 lbs in 10 pound increments. I mainly used the 10 and 20 and had great success.
The Bands stretch well and I have yet to have one break. The price is very competitive and is withing a few dollars of most of the competition.

title: I Should Get Paid For The Work I Had To Do To Make This Work
review:
I know. There are some people out there who will get this item, have no issues with it and think it is marvelous. I am not one of those people. I had high hopes for this lounger, but my God, the stress I had to go through to make it work..

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This comes in a very tight bag. It is wound up tight and it has a clip to it.

CLIP
The latch on the bag that you have to undo has a special button on it. This button was turned around to face the rolled up bag, so I had no idea how to get it undone. It took me 10 minutes to get the latch to work. Finally it did.

BAG DESIGN
This is a weird couch to be blunt. All it is is clear plastic encased inside of ripstop nylon caseing. There are two channels of plastic which need to capture air and a piece of mesh in between.

On the end of the bag are flexible pieces encased in the ends which are supposed to be held open as you run through the area holding it up like a giant wind sock. The idea is that these channels fill with air, you roll up the end and it is a beautiful thing.

Yeah, if you like sweat running down your face and the neighbors wondering what the heck you are doing with this demented looking kite in your yard running around flapping like a sick bird.

HOW IT REALLY WORKS
I took a HALF HOUR to try to get air into this thing. It would twist and turn around itself every time I tried to fill it with air. I could NOT get it to fill with air no matter what I did.

My husband saw me struggling with this and came over with that knowing look that his stupid wife could not possibly understand how something this ingenious would work. I gave it to him.

A half hour later with all sorts of words I can not repeat, he said, "How the heck is anyone supposed to do this without high winds?"

All of a sudden, a huge breeze came up and we both had to hold this thing in the air, pried open at the mouth to get the air encased in it. It didn't work GREAT, but at least we got it somewhat inflated.

HOW TO SHUT THE CHAIR IF YOU ARE LUCKY ENOUGH TO CATCH AIR
Once we got some air into it, I rolled up the back as tight as I could. My husband sat in it and flipped over. He was very irritated and tried again. He started to sink to the ground.

WHAT IF IT IS NOT FULL ENOUGH?
I rolled this thing up four more times and then tried it. It was full enough to lay on it without being ejected cartoon style on the lawn.

IF YOU GET IT INFLATED HOW IS IT TO LAY ON?
After over an hour of work with this stupid thing, I finally got it tight enough where I could lay on it and have it not be sinking. Then it happened. The stupid thing began to sweat under me. Yes, there is mesh in the center, but within five minutes, I was sitting in a pool of sweat. After about 15 minutes I had to get up and wipe off the chair. It was 77 degrees out and the sun was in and out a bit.

STAKE
This comes with a stake to make it not blow away in wind. If you plan to use this on a beach, good luck with that. The sand won't hold this tiny spike.

SEAMS
Another thing- once the chair had been sat in for a while, I noticed the seams were coming out- and pulling TERRIBLY. This thing would not last if you tried to put up to 600 lbs in it- heck not even under 200 lbs would it last a really long time.

COMFORT AND ELDERLY
There are two other things I want to rant about with this chair. It recommends that it is supportive and comfortable (once you get it inflated) and it is good even for elderly. Let me tell you this. It is not that comfortable, and getting out of it is horrible. If you have an elderly person you want to embarrass, this is the chair to use. You might find them laying flat on their face unable to get up from their prone position once they manage to get out of this marvelous chair.

PUTTING IT AWAY
Then my last rant is about the storage bag. Trying to roll this monstrosity into the small roll that fits into the tight bag is yet another frustration with this thing.

THE BOTTOM LINE
As you can see, my experience with this chair is anything but stellar. After working really hard with two people to get it inflated enough to use, the thing makes you sweat, and it is very hard to get out of. It is not any kind of chair I would want to try to use without a high wind. Then if you had high winds, you would not want to be laying in the thing, although it might blow your sweat away.

MY RATING
ONE STAR. This experience was not good. I think this is WAY overpriced for what it is. It might be portable and small for storage, but the amount of work it takes to have it useful, it just is not anything I would ever buy again. About the only thing that did NOT happen is our cat trying to jump on it with her claws.

title: junk!!!!!
review: This is a piece of junk. They market it as a puzzle but if you try to move the pieces it falls apart. the whole thing just fell to pieces when we move the squares. I didn't cost much but was not worth 2 cents!!!!

review: Nice lightweight stuff sac, good for holding sleep clothing or a warm layer while backpacking. There is no dust flap though (probably to save weight) so do not over stuff.

title: Useful Workout Accessory With Light Resistance
review:
This GAIAM RESTORE STRETCH BAND STRAP (with Loops for Medium Resistance) is handy to have around as a workout accessory, but it doesn’t offer much in the way of resistance. For me, it helps a little with a couple of rehab hip stretches: (1) a knee-toward-the-shoulder stretch; and (2) an across-the-body leg stretch that requires holding my leg with a strap or leg lifter.

You need to be careful with this item. It comes with some safety warnings, and with a nice chart of exercises (8 exercises in all). However, I tweaked a muscle in my left thigh when I was trying a right-leg stretch that requires running the strap along your back from foot to hand (hand extended above shoulder). I should have read the instructions more carefully before I tried to get the strap into the correct position.

The band is well made. It has 6 numbered loops for your reference in matching various stretches to your particular body’s needs.

Useful Workout Accessory With Light Resistance

title: Football gloves
review: These gloves are perfect for football. The price is a great value for the money and a perfect fit.

title: Great flavor with the bacon.
