title: Loved the Game, But Fell Apart
review: We loved the game. We set it up on a folding table for the kids at church. It was really fun to play with. Adults, teens, and kids all had a blast. However, it didn't hold up well at all. It lasted through a couple of days of play and then the whole thing had to be trashed.

title: The rod is great, the app needs work.
review:
I used to own a Radica Bass Fishin' game, until the reel on the device broke. No, I wasn't violent with it. Actually, I think it broke because I sat on it (I was a heavy child). Nevertheless, I had much fun with it, and wanted a replacement ever since.
When I saw this available for the iPhone, I snatched it right away, hoping to relive the Radica days.

I noticed right away that the menu is a little confusing to navigate. The app developers chose to go with a heavy app--meaning graphically and operationally--which sucks battery and requires lots of interactivity to work it properly. Once I got fishing, though, it was pretty simple.
And that's another problem; it's *too* simple. I get a bite as soon as I drop the line, which sort of diminishes the fun. Reeling in fish is trickier, with a lot of the line cutting almost always. The reel could also use some sensitivity adjustments, because my slowing down didn't reflect in the app itself.

I think the main complaints I have are with the app itself, so we could see major improvement in the future.

The device itself is great and sturdy. It held the iPhone safely and seems like it'll last a long while.

title: Amazing durability!
review: I love these bottles! I was so nervous to buy glass because I'm constantly dropping things, but decided to take a chance on these because of the great reviews. They have been dropped from 5-7 times each on cement, tile and other hard surfaces and still work perfectly after 10 months. The carrying loops are getting worn,  but that is to be expected after constant carrying and washing. I am very impressed with these bottles and would definitely purchase again. I only wish they had a larger option. Thanks Zulu!

title: Perfect cup .. it holds ice up until over night
review: This cup is awesome

title: Old, crumpled up and used looking
review: I received something that looks like it's been in the bottom of somebody's bag for several months. Something else to return.

title: Didn't fit the tricycle
review: This was for our granddaughter's trike but there was no way for it to be secured without it flopping down. Had to throw it away. Don't waste your money, unless there are 2 bars at the top, where the handles are. I'm guessing it would have work better if it was for another type of bike. The trike she has is a Radio Flyer.

title: Great size, sticky enough and works well
review: Nice yoga mat. I've only used it a couple of times, but it works just fine. It is sticky enough that my feet don't slide when doing yoga or pilates and it rolls up into an easily transportable size when I need to take it and go. I have a big heavy mat that I use for jumping around and weights but this is perfectly suitable and lightweight enough to use for bending and stretching types of exercise. It's way easier to use than a heavy mat. It works for me--size is right for doing the types of exercise I do, and the portability is huge for me.

title: Pretty
review:
I like the colors on this. It is pretty, and unique, compared to other sunglasses.
These sunglasses are very nice. They are comfortable on. I really like that they have protection against the sun. It is so important to protect your eyes from the sun’s harmful rays. I felt that this did that very well.

It looked pretty good on. I didn’t feel like it was too heavy or tight or anything. I thought it was pretty flattering. It covered a nice range of my vision.

It felt like it was well made. It seemed to be of decent quality. It didn’t break or anything.
I like the polarized feature.
Overall, I am pleased and would recommend it.

title: I've Owned Three and They ALL LEAKED!!
review:
First of all, this mattress is extremely comfortable and probably the most comfortable I've ever had in my entire life. BUT, in the 8 months after I bought it, I've had to replace it TWICE, and ALL THREE MATTRESSES WERE DEFECTIVE. The company promptly replaced it the first 2 times, but
I finally asked for a refund after the 3rd defective mattress had been sent to me. To be clear, only one person was sleeping on it, so it was far below the weight limit, but after a very short time, the first 2 mattresses failed and completely flattened and couldn't be reinflated. This happened without any "warning" and both times I was woken up in the middle of the night with the mattress completely deflated. The company promptly replaced it a 2nd time, but this 3rd mattress is by far the worst and doesn't hold air at all. I did contact the company about it a 3rd time and asked for a refund or a replacement from a lot without manufacturer defects, and they did refund my full purchase price. This is really disappointing because this mattress is really comfortable - - at least when it actually holds air!

title: fold it narrow, scrunch it, or keep extra wide for most coverage. High compression
review:
These are made well, and the colors are vibrant with various designs. When I see multi packs, I usually decide ahead of time how many I will actually like to use. Then I decide from there. Sometimes they are same as shown, sometimes different. These are same as shown in upper most picture. Since I could see the designs included, I knew there were a few I would really like, and the rest will be my less preferred headbands when it comes time to use one. Cute ones for heading out and about, less cute for doing gross chores.

I have a big head- 23.75", so I wasn't surprised when these fit a little more snug than I care for. But they fit. There is plenty of stretch. I really like that they are extra wide. I can simple fold them in half if I want a more narrow band, or scrunch them for cute casual look, or wear them full extended for the most coverage of forehead and hair.

The material is dense. It is stretchy, but its a tight stretch some from the size, but much directly related to the material. It is cotton and spandex. No idea how much spandex, but I assume a higher amount because of the combo of stretch and snug fit (will stretch but fit snug i think regardless of head size)

Well packaged. I think the boxing is cute. Small box, hinged lid, tissue covering rolled and labeled headbands. Just has pleasing appearance. Gift worthy if you know anyone that would like something like this.

I always use sweat bands that serve as head bands. I have tiny hairs that drop down and annoy me, so I like to keep my hair pulled up off my face entirely with bands like this. Also works for use in doing make up, washing face, using face mask. If you use virtual reality and find yourself sweating under the googles, I like using bands such as this to help.

One last use that I have is for keeping my visor on. I have some headwear i use when I am outside working, and the added material helps keep stuff in place that would otherwise slip easily.

4.5 stars.

title: Not as great as I thought.
review: Loved my fitbit at first. But once I started having charging issues that was it for the device. It was not used long enough for it to give out the way it did and the folks at fitbit didn't seem to care.

title: Five Stars
review: Perfect!  Thanks!

title: Good
review: This is a great product. Works well and washes off nicely

title: Needs improvement
review:
Bought two, returned two. Different packages. The first one had a focus wheel (the large one) that would not stay on the focus adjustment knob - reason is the retention screw simply would not tighten enough to hold the wheel in place properly. Hence, avoid the packages with the focus wheel - it's useless. The second one I bought, simple package with sunshade and dovetail rings, had a manufacturing defect where the front half of the scope wasn't joined correctly to the back half - I don't know if they use glue or it's finely screwed on, but the scope is canted, like a limp d. Getting a replacement, we'll see how it holds up. Overall, the glass seems good, but so many other things are off that it's hard to recommend. Quality control needs to step up and catch these defects before they reach the customer.

Update: received replacement for the second one, and that one TOO has the defect. I have never seen this with any other scope. Granted, this scope is silver so you see every little imperfection. It has to be a bad batch, but that means quality control is really off. Bottom line is, I’m keeping it because as far as silver color scopes go the choices are limited, and don’t feel like painting a higher quality one. To be fair, the glass is of decent quality so maybe end of day, the “paint doesn’t drive the car”. I just hope this canting doesn’t result in crooked vision affecting the poi adjustments.

2nd Update: But wait, yet again like moth to (silver) flame I got another one, hoping this time it'll be OK - nope! On this one, someone forgot or plainly missed to wipe the inside of the viewfinder glass - see those concentric cirles and the "glue"? smudge in the center of it? This is sloppy beyond belief. I'm done, I'll no longer buy anything WestHunter - they don't seem to have even a rudementary quality control - how can something so basic be missed? Instead, got me an illuminated FFP scope with similar parameters from Primary Arms - yes, it's $26 more, but well worth it, beause it's quality and is illuminated as well.. (but alas, not silver... Meh, who cares, remeber - "the paint doesn't drive the car")

title: Love the design
review: Absolutely love it

title: The worst by far
review: If there is one good thing I can say about this unit is that it makes a nice arc as it flies towards the trashcan. This unit is probably by far the worst in NCstar product I have a bought. It absolutely does not fit an H&K MP 5 22 LR. There must be a lot of shill reviews out there because he has a high rating. But don’t be fooled - this thing is maybe a good 30 to 40° tilted to the right, Not that you can really even mount it. Because, the cut for the factory rail fitment is just not deep enough and therefore you cannot mount this thing without extensive drilling cutting filing. I know that the OEM part is expensive but isn’t time more expensive? I mean this is a complete garbage, and I’m being kind about this. Do you like to waste your time? Buy this, buy it now.

title: Thick heavy Duty work out band, not cheesy.
review:
This band is not your cheesy easy to use elastic type of band.
It’s thick , heavy , with not much give to it. Although I’m a older women That does not have the strength of a 40, or 50 yr old women that works out almost everyday. I did that in my younger years.
This measures 14 in long, if it opened it would 28 in long.
almost 3 3/4 wide.
Inside the band has some type of material that does not let
This slide down, it’s kind of a lite rubbery texture.

I’m a small slim women , if your wider then 14 in, you might have a hard time pulling this up to do butt exercises using this.
Although there are other exercises you can do.

If you seriously work out, you will like this band

title: Stepping up my home workout
review: These are great! Thanks to covid I'm trying to get more exercise at home. My wrists get fatigued with regular pushups as my body is getting older, but I also like the way I can spread these apart for a slightly different angle to the push up, which works different muscles. Very simple product that just works as intended. I'm very pleased with it!

title: Don’t buy it unless you want to figure out how to put it together
review: Horrible and no clear instructions to set up. No help from the company to get better instructions.

title: You can get your range with this Finder.
review: I like the fact you have two ways to gauge your range with this thing. It's easy to use and seems to be pretty accurate too. I recommend my friend now you can find out exactly how far away your ball lands in. Thank you. Brother Oran Z

title: Not true rocket copters as pictured
review: They are inexpensive and you get a lot. But they are not nearly as durable as the name brand and don't last more than a handful of launches

title: Great Travel Towel Set!
review:
I love that you get two sizes of towels in this set. We used another of the GreenTreen sets with a beach towel and smaller towel on a rustic cabin stay in Alaska and loved them. In fact, we loved them so much we chose to receive a reviewer a set for each of our kids for camping with them. Kids love the colors and the carrying bag and while the camping season is getting to the end, these will definitely be going to the Boundary Waters Canoe Area with us a couple times next summer.

The construction is decent and the material is good and absorbant. They really did the job for us in AK and they held up to washing a couple times. So far, definitely recommend!

title: Eat what you know you like,if you must carry it for miles.personal favorite.
review: A favorite.

title: Sweats, Leaks, and straw wouldn't pop-up the way it was supposed to!
review: I would love to have one of these but the one I bought was horrible. The lid locked great but the straw wouldn't pop-up the way it was suppose too and it would leak. The bottle sweat soooooo much that I needed to carry a towel around just to wipe up the water.  That was not good on the furniture either. The good thing was that I didn't have any problems returning it.

title: Great swimming goggles!
review: I love this! Fits very snuggly and the bands are easy to adjust. The eye pieces stays on very nicely without pinching and no water leaks in!

title: Charger is cra*😒
review: So the battery already did not stay chartered for very long (barely an hour) but then my son (9 y/o and 60 pounds) got electrocuted. Upon me inspecting the charger I noticed it came apart and basically broke inside his scooter. I have 6 kids and taught them all about electric safety and how to properly unplug stuff and we have never had this issue. Might I add with getting a pretty good shock it could have been worse than it was. Truly upset by this product. Might I add now I’m at a loss because we bought him AND his twin the same hoverboard for Xmas just a different color.

title: Very little installation instruction
review: I paid over $300.00 for this tricycle, because at 64 my legs get very tired, but although the tricycle is beautiful, I haven't been able to use it at all. I'm not a bike specialust, and with the limited instruction page that was included, I was not not able to get the derailed system installed correctly, have gone back to just using my old bike every now and then, I'm very disappointed.

title: Too small.
review: These were too small and I couldn’t get them to stay up on my arms.

title: Not bad, but not great, good
review: I tried this on in water for the 1st time and it did not keep my hair dry.  I pin my hair up in a barrette so it does have space at the top, but it did feel snug when I put it on even though it was easy to put on and I didn't need help.  It wasn't snug to the point of a Speedo cap where it takes minutes to get used to your brain being squeezed though.  My edges did get wet and water seeped up towards the top of my head a little bit, but I am still going to keep it because I like the silicone and I am tired of buying and returning caps to see if one will work even though this is more than I want to pay.  And I don't go under water when I swim.  To test this out I just turned my head from side to side while swimming.

title: Works as a taillight but it's practically impossible to open to install or replace the batteries
review:
This is a 2.4 lux/4 lumen rain proof and splash proof bicycle taillight which takes 2 AAA batteries (not included). These batteries should provide 36 hours of illumination according to the package.

Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this light. First, it's practically impossible to remove the cover to insert the batteries. There's a notch at the bottom of the light that is used to open the compartment. I had to use a letter opener to pry it open while squeezing the top a bit. The force that had to be used damaged the plastic around the notch but did not affect the light's functionality. There are four plastic prongs that hold the top reflector onto the base and I can see these prongs breaking when opening or closing the compartment to replace the batteries.

I have a Trek bike and it was difficult to position on my bike because the height of the light got in the way of the reflector that was already there. However, the mounting bracket is a typical bracket that clenches itself around the bike frame. The light clips onto the fastener and can be removed and used elsewhere, such as clipping onto a backpack or hat for use when walking.

The light turns on via a button on the back. Only the top "bulging" part lights up as the bottom acts as a reflector.

Because of the difficulty of opening this light and chance for breakage during battery replacement, I personally cannot recommend this. This is not a light I would purchase after having tried it.

title: Get the Job Done, But Expensive
review: These are high quality hook protectors.  I use them when shipping fishing lures from my Ebay store.  But they are expensive.  There are other products on the market that are just as effective, but cost far less per unit.

title: Not Leather
review: This is not leather cover it is a plastic cover. I ordered it because it said leather. Very disappointed

title: East and west are still mixed up
review: It’s a beautiful compass and the case is nice. I saw other reviews that said east and west were mixed up on their compasses. When you look at this compass, the painted end of the needle will point towards N on the rose when you’re facing N and it will point to S on the rose when facing S. However, the painted end of the needle will point towards W on the rose when you’re facing E and it will point to E in the rose when you’re facing W. As this isn’t an orienteering compass there’s nothing for you to adjust so that it shows the direction of travel. Just remember that the needle will always point north and if you remember where east, south and west are in regards to north then you will know which direction you’re truly facing.

title: Seems good at first but loses a lot of air quickly
review: This ball would have been great but it looses air overnight so anytime I want to use it I have to spend 10+ minutes to pump it back up. Not sure if I just received defective ball but  I will Have to buy a different one.

title: Seems to Do the Job
review: Let me start by saying that this item did not come with any instructions. However, I contacted the seller and they emailed them to me in a reasonable amount of time. We recently purchased a pair of kayaks. We also bought a utility trailer to transport them as our SUV doesn't have a roof rack. My husband attached these kayak racks to some wood pieces that he had already installed onto the trailer. It holds the 2 kayaks on their sides which leaves about half of the utility trailer available for bikes and other gear. While it may not be the conventional use of this rack system, it works well and my husband is pleased. We did have to purchase longer carriage screws since we had to go through the wood, too. I've included pictures.

title: Good product good price
review: I put it in my closet doorway. The closet door can close also. It came with screws but I used longer stews I had to make it extra  sturdy  I weigh 175 and it supports me with all my push ups

title: Nice instrument for a good price.
review:
Wow nice. I didn't see it in the description, but I did want to point out that the whole thing rotates between the black and grey parts. This makes it possible to see the gauge with any orientation.

The bleed feature is nice. It's tricky to land right on a number but I'm getting better at it. IDK how important is this level of precision; but having this gauge I no longer have to worry about it - I use the best precision I have available and it doesn't matter whether it matters.

title: Five Stars
review: Good sturdy knife.

title: NeoSport gave me all I need to use my Atlanta outdoor pool right through most of the winter when water is at least 50 degrees.
review: I have a big head as far as wearing hats of any kind.  I also have a wide square jaw but not a long face.  This fit me perfectly and formed a great seal around my face, even when I put on my mask over the Hood.  I can swim through the winter in my outdoor Atlanta lap pool in this Hood, with my Neosport 5mm XSPAN Neoprene wetsuit, Neosport 5mm gloves, and Neosport 5mm Hi Top Zipper Boots.

title: Let't Hoop!
review: I have a teenage son that has decided that he wants to play basketball. He is 6'3.5 but has absolutely no basketball skills on the court. He is no LeBron James or Steph Curry. But what he does have is a champion's heart and a desire to learn. So when he offered to pay for half if I'd order it for him, I couldn't refuse. Why not? Anything that I could do to encourage him to play outside instead of playing video games, I was willing to contribute to. When it arrived, he was able to assemble it. It was easy to fill and maneuver.  He has been balling ever since and his game has improved. This  basketball goal has given him hours of fun and a ton of exercise. I'd recommend it.

title: Would not recommend
review:
There are some pro's to this product, and there are several cons to the product.
Full review (4:23) [...]

The "pull-pins" were not included, simple screw-lock's were included.
The arm pad is not "very wide", it's rather narrow (15" wide).
The price is solid but there needs to be some adjustment to the design to make this a worthwhile purchase.
There are more pros and cons detailed in the video.

title: Beautiful expressive color Helmet
review: The color on this is awesome .  I am so glad I came across it .  Very light weight. Inserts for better fit. Inserts are washable a huge plus .  The comfort and great adjustable fit makes for better ride . I've gotten great compliments on my helmet .

title: Nice quality, as described
review:
Got these to make my own basement gym area, and they are working fine!
Super easy to put together, and covered the 24 sqft as advertised.
Nice and spongey and comfortable. Saves your joints and your equipment.
I will likely get another set because 24 sqft isnt as big as you would think, it would be better doubled.

*** I hope you find my review helpful and it helps you select the item that will fit your needs!

title: Great for a beginner like me
review:
This HEAD Ti. Radical Elite Tennis Racket is reasonably priced for a beginner but doesn't compromise on build quality.

It's always tempting to purchase the $15 rackets that are sold at the popular low-cost retail stores in their small sports section next to the pet food but step up the budget and the quality of the racket changes quite a bit.

This racket's frame is rigid, light and doesn't feel like cheap aluminum, it is well balanced with the center of gravity right at the bottom of the oval frame. In this listing there is no option to choose your grip size but as other reviews have pointed out, it is 4 3/4, meaning it is not for kids.

The string is strung well, to the correct tension (according to my coach) so there really is nothing to do but unpack and play with this racquet.

If you need a good beginner racquet or just a backup second racket, this would be a good choice.

title: depends on how you use them
review: the set I got the lids popped open releasing content into my water giving me little floaties all over the place.

title: was not new no box all scratched up
review: they where supposed to be new not new have dirt on them no box came in a ziplock bag not happy

title: Good enough to keep----well not so fast!
review:
For the price, it's good enough to keep. Comparing to the one i'm replacing, there are things I like better & other things not so much. Because I'm nuts & work out a lot. I have one at home and one at work. I purchased this for replacing the one at work. The foot pads are not wide enough. There is no difference between level 1 and 8, and to make sure the part was correctly installed, you almost have to take it apart again----not going to happen. My old one came together besides the foot pedals & handles----so YOU didn't have to install anything that prevented it from working properly. I only used it 1 day so far, so if at the end of the week I really don't like it and ultimately return it, I'm going to keep it.

Update: I'm returning only because the foot pedals are so narrow, my right foot keeps falling off, It's too bad because it's very smooth, no noise, even with those other minor issues, I would have kept it, but my foot falling off is too dangerous......For comparison, I'm 5'1", 105lbs, size 7 sneaker.

title: The perfect Youth baseball glove
review:
This is a great glove for my 8 year old!
Great medium glove and is exactly what I wanted. Not adult size!
And is the perfect step from minors to majors!

title: I love this! I usually wear a women's medium or ...
review: I love this! I usually wear a women's medium or large, and I ordered a medium and it fits perfectly! Super cute and comfy. Great color and design. Although its probably a fake because it was so cheap, it seems super authentic! 10/10 would recommend!

title: Good Protection
review: Bike helmets are a necessity, especially with kids. This one seems to offer good protection. The straps are adjustable and there's a knob on the back that you can adjust for an even better fit. The material seems good. Overall, it seems comparable to other kids bike helmets out there.

title: Perfect for Hot Days!
review: I bought a half-dozen of these and have already gifted two friends with a couple! These towels soak up water quickly: Wring out, 'snap' like you'd do with a bedsheet, then ENJOY! They seem to stay cool for a half-hour walk in 80-degree temperature with humidity, which is wonderful!

title: Very fun
review:
The kids really liked the scooter. It is nice that it is so adjustable.

We really like things to keep the kids active. I would much prefer them doing something than watching something. It is great because it is like a game for them but then they are being physically active.

The quality was good. It worked as it was supposed to. It wasn’t too hard to set up.

This is a great activity for a day when you don’t know what else to do or you want your child to burn off some energy. It is a good way to keep a child busy.

The children really liked it.

I feel like this is good for child development. It kept my children's interest. It would also make a nice gift.

I would recommend it.

title: No Leather Scent
review: Good brand, poor product.  It smells no more like leather than my dog does.

title: I don't like it.
review: If you look in the picture I took the front interior of the hat is lined with this black material and it's very stiff compared to the rest of the hat and it makes the hat lay strange and a bit uncomfortable, I don't care for it.  It has good reviews so maybe I'm in the minority on this.

title: 2 cans were crushed
review: 2 cans were totally crushed.  The rest were fine but bummed about losing 2 cans of balls.

title: Worthless
review: They do NOT stay in place at all. Not worth the price

title: The best! Keeps cold all day long!
review: This water bottle keeps liquids cold all day long! This Yeti is sturdy, easy to clean, and fits in cup holders.

title: Great Set
review: Great set of adjustable weights with a number of options for assembly and use. Compact and just the right amount of weight to compliment my workout.

title: Really unsatisfied
review:
This tunic is a big disappointment. First of all, it doesn't fit. I am between a size 2x and 3x right now. I ordered a 4x because I like my tunics to be roomy and non-binding. Amazingly...this is TOO SMALL! Too small! When I ordered it 2 sizes bigger than what I needed. That actually makes me angry that this manufacturer either doesn't understand American sizes, or doesn't care and is pawning off their stuff on unsuspecting buyers. How can you get it that wrong!

The other thing that gets to me is the material it is made from. It is mostly polyester and a little bit of spandex. I hate polyester. It doesn't breathe and I always feel hot in it. If I had known this ahead of time, I would not have bought this. But, NOWHERE on the page did I find a description of the material it is made from. Nowhere. When it arrived, I quickly looked for...and found...the tag where it clearly stated that it was mainly polyester. UGH!

I am not recommending this mostly based on the sellers deceptive practices, but also because it doesn't fit..

title: Four Stars
review: Nice reel

title: Spiritwear!
review:
Nice spirit wear.
Decent quality.
Runs true to size.
Inexpensive.
Perfect for tailgating and the weekends.

title: Great machine if looking to quit a membership with a gym
review: Just finished installed the treadmill. Everything packaged nicely and installed in about an hour. It does not come with a small belt lubricate.  Will need to order one from life span for $14.00 or buy one with this purchase. This does not come with a built in Bluetooth, nor can you hook up the additional bluetooth adapter to the treadmill. I'm sure it states it in the description but has a sub port to save all information to transfer and view on a computer.  As I have a fitbit and the Samsung fitness app, this bluetooth option does not bother me.

title: Absolutely terrible.
review: This is the stuff they serve in prisons. I can't even describe the flavor. Maybe tastes like tang without the orangy goodness

title: Important component of your kit!
review:
This stuff can do anything, or so the box claims.
•Drinking cup? Yes!
•Arm sling? Yes!
•Water bottle repair? Yes!
•Roast S'mores? NOT YET BUT WORKING ON IT!!
Super smart to have on hand, not only while camping or in a bug out bag, but for around the house too. I had to use this to tape my rear light back on my truck when it popped out while going down a bumpy road. Its pretty thick, not as thick as classic grey duct tape though. And quite sticky. It's weatherproof and withstands uv rays. I had no problem tearing it off by hand.

title: Didn't work out of the package!
review:
I bought this at a local store for $13. We were leaving for camping when I had the smart idea to check our headlamps before going, and it just so happened that both of ours didn't work! So we picked this up at Shopko.
We got to the camping site later that day and I put it together. Lo and behold, it didn't turn on. I thought maybe I had placed the batteries incorrectly, so I switched them. Still no light.
Big bummer for a camping weekend. Would've thought a new headlamp--no matter how cheap--should work right out of the package.
I emailed Coleman since I lost my receipt. We'll see if I hear back.

update: I heard back and coleman wouldn't help me. Nice of them. They said I have to return it to the store. Since I don't have the receipt I might have to get it exchanged or store credit, neither of which I want. All I can say is that I'm lucky I didn't buy this out of town on some longer camping trip farther away.

With my experience with coleman, between tents and this headlamp, it seems to be hit or miss. I've had a tent that didn't last very long because the fabric that the poles slid through wore out in probably two years or less, rendering it useless since it then couldn't hold the poles. I'm not impressed.

title: Great for beginners
review: Beginning pickle ball player! The set is affordable and a great intro set into the sport! Love the design and the feel of the hand grip. Very easy to hold on to.

title: Decent First Paddle
review:
This is an OK paddle. I don't love it, I don't hate it. I think my favorite thing about this paddle is the colorful design on the paddle face.

The face itself has almost no texture/grit, which as a brand new player may not matter, but will quickly become important after you get the hang of hitting the ball. The paddle face is approximately ~0.5 inches (~13 mm), which is on the thinner side. The upside of a thin paddle is that it provides more power than a thicker paddle, but on the downside, it will be tougher to spin with it (which is compounded by the fact the paddle face has no texture).

Another thing I didn't like was the handle--it feels flat, like a piece of wood. Round handles are much more comfortable in my experience. The grip, however, was pretty nice. It is soft and comfortable to hold, and absorbs sweat pretty well. An added bonus with this paddle is that it comes with a paddle cover. Not a huge deal, but a nice touch nonetheless.

My bottom line is that this is a decent first paddle. Otherwise, I would pass.

title: Not as advertised
review: They’re flashy looking training wheels but they did not fit my child’s 20” bike as specified. Only one side fit and other wouldn’t attach. Three stars for the all the extra bell and whistles it comes with. Unfortunately it was a return.

title: Works Well
review: I have two kids in college. It was a no-brainer to give one of these to my daughter, but my son has to park far from campus to get classes and one of his classes gets out after dark, so I thought it would be good for him to have one, too. My husband and I had them try the sprays outside to make sure that they knew how to use them. They are easy to operate and provide a decent spray of pepper juice. They can do single, bursts or multiple bursts depending on the need. The quick release keychain works well.

title: Perfect weekend volleyball set. Easy setup.
review:
This is a perfect weekend at the beach or backyard bbq volleyball set. It is by no means as tough and rugged as pro volleyball equipment that you'd find in tournaments, or at school gyms. That said, it's a perfect set to use 4 or 5 times a year, then break down and store. The set up is remarkably easy, it took us less than 15 minutes. Everything is included in the bag. All the ropes are pre- strung. It's almost like it just unfolds and you just need to stake down poles. Each side has 3 tie-downs/support ropes. Each rope is connected to a metal ring. You slip that ring around a stake that you'll need to drive into ground. (See pic)
On the side of one of the poles is a counter, so you can easily keep score. (For some reason the kids thought this was the coolest part) Also included is a simple hand pump and white volleyball. The ball is shipped flat, so you have to pump it up yourself. Not a top quality ball, but it feels soft and it holds air for a long time.
The entire set breaks down fast. And it all fits into a durable zippered nylon bag that has a carrying handle. I really like the fact that it's so compact and simple. I feel that we will play more because it's so easy.

title: Lasted About Two Weeks
review: My little kids were excited to have their very own trampoline. This trampoline was appropriately sized for my very small toddler (25 lbs.). But my 40 lb. six-year-old was far too big. The net around the trampoline came just below his shoulder. It also had a tendency to tip over. We had to clear the ground under it very well because the smallest stick or bump on the dirt would make it tip. After two weeks, my toddler falling into one of the posts made the post break off, leaving a jagged metal spot where it stood. There was no way to just take the net off the trampoline and keep using it because the posts that hold the net posts in place stick up about 6 inches around the edge of the trampoline, leaving metal posts around to fall on. We ended up having to just disassemble it and throw it away.

title: Soft, giftable, no pilling
review: This is a basic plush team blanket. There is nothing wrong with it, but nothing that makes it outstanding either. It is true to color, soft, and thick enough to provide warmth on a fall football morning without being bulky. It is packaged nicely enough to be purchased as a gift. Only reason for docking one star is because- as per usual with these types of licensed items- they lose some of their softness after washing despite following instructions.

title: Image is significantly smaller than the listed size
review: I wanted this for my little Kia Soul, but I was disappointed when it arrived. The listing says it's a 3" x 5" decal. It is not. The actual image is only 2" x 2 1/2" - the rest is the excess sticky part. What that amounts to is a very tiny image that literally cannot be seen on the car unless you're standing next to it. I will say that they provided a refund without problems, so customer service is reliable.

title: Husband and son approved. 4.5 stars
review: My husband and son are big fisherman. They love the sport. So, selecting this Real Fish lure was a no-brainer and I thought the perfect gift for one of them. It is super lightweight. It is small enough to fit in any fishing bag or tackle box. It is nicely painted with sections that allow it to move gracefully through the water. It looks very realistic. There are tiny hooks on the bottom which snare the big ones. The fisherman in my house both approve.

title: Form fitting, stylish, comfortable, & gorgeous top but wish I ordered a colored one other than grey
review:
I love the style and feel of this grey top. Too bad I am so fat that it does not look as great on me as I would have liked. Nevertheless, that is not the fault of the product. This is super comfortable and is form fitting. It moves easily with the flow of the body, so it is perfect as a yoga top even though I do not do yoga now but have done so in the past. I also love how stylish this is.

Note that I normally take a large to extra-large in shirts depending on the cut and make. Sometimes I even need a plus size. However, this extra-large is a bit loose on me and I am chesty and have a big back. I wish I had gotten this in a large and chosen a different color.

Overall, I highly recommend this.

title: Five Stars
review: they work great

title: Nice lure
review: This is very well made. It wiggles as it moves like a real fish. Painting on them are well done and realistic ...very nice lure

title: Best price
review: Fantastic deal.  Logos look great, not too small, and you get both front mats for the price of one.  I can't speak for longevity but with such an affordable price, I wouldn't hesitate to buy more as needed.

title: the tube literally pump it up like a ballon
review: I don't know understand how and why there are so many rave reviews. In my case, it doesn't work at all. It is my son's bike, followed the repair instructions, yet it doesn't really have the bonding strength and thickness to hold. As soon as I pump in airs, the tube literally pump it up like a ballon.  And adding to the worse, this item is *not* returnable.

title: It is precise and easy to use
review:
The old saying that a person who has one watch always knows what time it is, but a person who has two watches is never sure, comes to mind here. If this is your only pressure gauge and you dial in your tire pressures based on this tool, you’ll be happy. But if you have a couple of different gauges like me, some on pumps and another that is independent like this one, then you won’t be exactly sure which one is accurate.

However, consistency and precision is what matters. Based on several years of use and comparison to two other gauges and my car readouts, I trust my digital gauge on my bike floor pump for accuracy from psi ranges in the mid teens to the mid 50s. I took readings from several different pressures as benchmarked with my pump, and this analog gauge consistently read about 1 psi lower. That consistency is more than good enough for me. And by way of background, I’ve set up my mountain bike and gravel bike with tubeless tires, and I am particular about the pressures I run in different conditions.

Also, this gauge has a rubberized face and comes in a sturdy and well padded case. Since this is a precision instrument, I appreciate the protection to keep this device working well.

Overall this is an easy to use tool that feels like it will last a long time (as long as you don’t abuse it).

title: The color is spot  on
review: I bought it from my truck but it's not what I thought it was but the sticker is really cool

title: Nice & Thin Whistle!
review: What a uniquely shaped whistle! It's nice & thin and has a built in clip so you can just clip it to your pocket, shirt, bag, or whatever so it's always handy. Personal safety has become such an issue lately. Something as little as this whistle will make me feel safer when I'm out walking. I did test it for sound and it works just fine, though my pets did not appreciate the loudness of it.

title: Bright and sturdy.
review: This is our third time ordering these. We have a set in the trailer, one in each room and our granddaughter plays with them outside and offers to them to her friends to use for evening fun.

title: Comfy
review: Good lounge pants. Weak pockets, but the pants themselves seem very durable. I like them.

title: Therapist approved
review: We have a massage therapist coming to the house and she was happy to see this deep tissue foam roller.  She’s careful in how she uses it.  It’s a bit difficult to use on yourself (except on legs) so it’s nice that she likes to use it.  She showed us how to use it on our backs.  This is a great roller for folks who know what they’re doing!

title: Not good.
review:
This one is not good. It's not well made at all. Flimsy and broke easily.

Nothing was good about this one. the frame is cheap and fragile as well as the balls.

Not recommended

title: Soft
review: Love it, as advertised. Quality material, looks great, soft material.

title: TAILLIGHT IS NOT RECHARGEABLE!!!!!!!
review:
DO NOT BUY!!!!

I was looking for a USB rechargeable light when I found this. It doesn't tell you this but the Taillight is NOT RECHARGEABLE. The whole reason for buying and feature I was looking for is not present.

The batteries are also an odd size but I never tried to replace them so IDK how hard it would be.

title: Sides weather very quickly
review: WHile the top of the cornhole wood stays smooth and clean, the sides and legs weather very quickly and look nasty after a few weeks.

title: Ordinary Chair
review: The chair is not uncomfortable but some reviews are a bit over board as to the level of comfort.  The chair is more upright than slouchy and for the price, you are better off shopping around.  Additionally, I have had the chair for about a month and the blue coloring of the fabric is already fading.  It is under a covered seating area and apparently the afternoon sun is hitting it and doing a number on it.

title: Snug
review: I found with silicone rings that they’re snug, so order a half size up. These were snug at first, but I stretched them a bit and they fit really well. The metallic colors are sticky. The black, white, pink, and marble are more matte and much more comfortable to me. I barely notice they’re on. They’re so comfortable!

title: Light But Lined
review: This is a nice lightweight but warm hat. Wore it outside on a windy 40 degree F day and it was toasty warm. I like the two-tone look.

title: ... and now he uses these and he loves them easy to use and stay cold long when taken out ...
review: Bought these for our son he loves them he drinks a lot of water we were spending tons a month in cases of water bought him these and now he uses these and he loves them easy to use and stay cold long when taken out of the fridge. Great buy !

title: Not good bands
review:
These bands are not good.

1. The elastic does not have good range. It does not feel even throughout the pull like the SPRI brand. You cannot get a good resistance, even in simple moves.
2. The d-ring is extremely small and it is hard to switch out the handles.
3. The handles feel cheap

Go for a more expensive brand. I am very disappointed in this product.

title: So so target system
review: Used for pellet rifle training - not too great for needs

title: What a sport bag!!!
review: Amazing bag. The pocket for holding the matt can be tucked into itself when not carrying the mat. Very well made.

title: It fast drips when turned upside down.
review: When my 3 year old niece turns it upside down, it will fast drip. However it does keep the drinks cold long enough for her to drink. I bought it for water only since the spout is not very easy to clean.

title: Great transaction!
review: Great transaction!!  Roasting forks as described!! Seem very well made!!  Can't wait to use them!!!  Like having them with the colors so everyone know which is theirs!!

title: Great cover
review: Bought this cover since my fitbit band was starting to wear and pop up a bit- this cover is perfect to keep that under control and protect the electronic parts. Great to wear at my work and don't have to worry about anymore wear and tear.

title: Nice, roomy bag
review:
I was pleased with this equipment bag. It really held a lot. My son put too full size balls in it and there was still room for other things. It would work great for a variety of sports, including of course baseball since it has a nice space for the bats.

It felt like a quality bag. It seemed durable, which of course is important with people lugging it to sporting events and such. The only thing I didn't like was the huge logo on it... I wish that had been more subtle, but it doesn't really matter that much. Overall, it did what I needed it to do. With the straps it was easy to hold and carry. I would recommend it.

title: Washable and protects bottom of water bottle
review: I really like that the rubber protects the whole bottom and fits perfectly

title: Track nighttime visitors!
review: We’re moving to a farm - the farmhouse is surrounded by a fenced area, but during an unexpected snow storm, we discovered all kinds of tracks indicating animal visitors close to the house.  We set up this camera, and we’re ready for whatever visits - a couple of nights with nothing yet!  This was easy to set up on a tripod we have so we’re ready! Had to check a couple times to make sure it’s working - it makes very little noise and doesn’t need a flash evidently.  Great idea - just what we needed.

title: Poor fit
review: The neck was way too big. He couldn’t wear.

title: v.good
review: v.good but cotton must be softener

title: Stopped working after firmware upgrade
review:
These dumbbells are very sturdy and look like serious business!
I got these during prime day, price seem competitive at $300 and the adjustment system was a plus.
One of the problems I have with these is space, since they need to be in their cradle, they take up more space than two separate dumbbells each in their own base. So for a spaced constrained home gym like mine, this is a disadvantage.
Main issue I had and reason why I'm returning is because I couldn't really used them due to a firmware upgrade issue. I received them during the weekend, assembled (minimum required), and tested them and they worked fine, when adjusting the knob, the necessary plates would be selected.
However, a couple of days later as I was ready for my first workout I downloaded the app and proceeded with registration and so on. As part of the process the firmware got updated. After that, the knob doesn't work and I can't adjust weight. If I cycle power I can adjust once or twice and then it becomes non responsive again. So I created a ticket for support, but got a response for a different product. Then I called in, we tried to do a hardware reset and it didn't work. So the agent said that she already had four similar calls, that I should either return or wait for a new base that can take several weeks.
Waiting for that long is not an option for me, so I have to return. I wish the company would give me another option, like replacing with a set of regular adjustable dumbbells instead of these smart ones.
It is concerning, considering this is a company that basically sells smart connected products, that they can have such low quality software upgrades that brick your device and then you have to wait weeks for it to be fixed. I'd think twice before getting more expensive equipment from Nordictrack.

title: It’s okay
review: The sit is wobbly and lump sided

title: Nintendo Amiibo's Overvalued Painted Plastic
review:
I got this at a brick and mortar store for $11, all it does is unlock some outfits in Mario Kart 8 and somethings in Smash Bros. Possibly not worth $10 let alone these crazy inflated prices caused by Nintendos SOP of weak releases. Don't overpay for these mediocre quality, plastic painted figurines. Many of the figurines have noticeable imperfections, so why everyone rates them a 5 out of 5 is beyond me.

*update 12/22/2014 These are available at stores for $12.99 still, as far as I can tell, I noticed two today. In fact I still see them from other online retailers for $12.99.

*12/30 Well I see the price has returned to normal which is good, after using this for while I will add a few remarks. I think the paint will wear quickly if carried around and used with a DS or portable device, Luigi isn't considered a "top tier" character in Smash Bros, and it just unlocks a Luigi themed racing suit in Mario Kart, (I don't have Hyrule so I'm not sure what it unlocks there), so unless you really like Luigi or are going to collect them all, you may want to consider other Amiibos. And if you really want something pay attention to the upcoming releases and pre order.

title: Warm and Comfortable
review: These socks are very thick and plush. It's easy to remove the batteries when recharging is needed, though the charge lasts a good while. They keep my feet nice and warm without feeling like they're sweating.

title: These golf club head covers are so super cute! They are very well made and honestly ...
review: These golf club head covers are so super cute! They are very well made and honestly look like puppets but so much more well made. They are super soft and very protective. They are wool lined and will protect the club from all of the nicks and bumping around that happens in the golf bags. Work great and are super cute.

title: Second best investment next to my POC helmet!
review: If you can fit this on your bike - do it!  This has saved me on three occasions where an accident was almost unavoidable.  The dumb*ss in the car heard me and then saw me and then stopped before we collided.  It is the second best investment next to my POC helmet.  This sounds like and is just as loud as those canned air horns you hear people use at football games.  I have one horn on my hybrid bike and my fat bike.  Note: the unit comes with an air charge in the can so when you push the lever on the horn the first time, you will jump.  I charge mine to 120 psi and I get a lot of little blasts or four to five reasonably long blasts.  I can use my mini hand pump or a gas station air hose to do a quick refill.  Also, the manufacturer sells an extension hose if the stock hose isn't long enough.

title: Favorite pillow because not too high or firm.
review: Have many different pillows for my hammocks. This is my favorite. Cute, compact, not too firm-just how I like it. Good price too.

title: Great Fun!
review: We got this for our grandkids & they love it . . . in fact, we all enjoy playing it!  It's basically a horseshoes game, but with loops of ropes instead of horseshoes.  Great way to spend time with the kids!

title: Four Stars
review: Nice size and the magnet works really well

title: They suck.
review:
I have used these for 2 months. They have kept my hands warm when it is above 32. Below 32 and I have to add another layer.

The stitching on these have started coming off. Also the touch screen sections are extremely annoying.

I have now given up on these and switched to flip top mittens that are for ice fishing.

title: Ok if you want to kill zombies
review:
Good looking knives however...
They do not hold an edge. Almost impossie to sharpen

title: Steelers Gloves
review:
Did not expect the palms to be a different material. I was looking for all over cotton gloves. The palms are like rubber work gloves with the little bumps. Did not care for that.
Also too big. Should be offered in different sizes.

title: It looks nice, but not designed for hanging on a wall.
review: This football display case is nice, however when it came to hanging it on the wall, that didn’t work. It ended up falling down! Luckily, I was able to catch it before it hit the ground! The screws are cheap and are not strong enough to mount to a wall. It is a nice display case, but not designed for hanging on the wall.

title: Great bar
review: This is a great bar. I do find myself wishing the knitting were a little more aggressive.

title: Fun croquet set that seems high quality except that the mallets keep loosening from their handles
review:
This set includes:
- Six (6) all weather colored balls of one color of each (red, yellow, orange, blue, green, and black).
- Nine (9) all weather plastic coated metal wickets.
- Six (6) solid wood mallets with wooden handles (30.75 inches assembled) --one for each color. They have double metal locking joints and assembly is required each time.
- Two (2) 24" wooden stakes with colored lines that match the colors of the balls and mallet handles. NOTE that I received four (4) wooden stakes in my package (see picture).
- One carry case.
- One paltry instruction sheet.

I had always wanted to play croquet and this is my first set. When I first opened the package, I was really impressed and considered this five stars for the price since it contains everything needed to play. In order to store all the items in the carry case, the set must be disassembled each time after play. What I mean by this is that the wooden handles have to be screwed and unscrewed from the mallet head. Since I live in a condo, I cannot leave this set assembled after playing as I have no garage to store this in and I have to remove the wickets from the complex's lawn when done with the game.

After watching some how-to videos, my boyfriend and I played this. We had a lot of fun as it is a cross between golf and bocce ball to me.

It was during play that we noticed a problem with this set. The biggest issue is that each wood mallet with its associated handle kept loosening up no matter how hard we tightened it. Several times we had to re-tighten the mallets. Also, after our game was over, we noticed that the plastic coating on the wickets was chipping off on the bottom and exposing the metal and this was the first time we used the set. I suppose this is to be expected, however..

Overall, we enjoyed this game and the set seems to be good quality with the exception of the mallet head and its associated handle loosening up. It is for this reason only I rate this 3.4 stars. A really professional set would be more than double the price of this one. If I were in the market for a higher end set, I would look into this [[ASIN:B073YFZY9M Amish-made croquet set]].

title: It Works, Sort Of. . .
review:
The towel does cool your neck and when it warms up from your body heat, something it does fairly quick because it doesn't breathe, all you need to do is give it a snap in mid air and as long as the towel is reasonably damp it will provide cooling. It doesn't drip, per say, but it will dampen a shirt if tucked under one.
I have three issues with this towel:
First, it smells funky. I've used it, rinsed it, wrung it three, four times and there's still that rubbery, plastic odor to deal with. It lessened some but not completely
Second, it feels kinda weird in the hand and initially on the neck. After you wear it for a while you learn to ignore the rubbery fabric on your skin.
Third, the container it comes in is small, it's not easy to get the towel back in to store it and if you don't get it back in a mostly air tight container where it will stay partially damp forever(ish). However, if you hang the towel across a bar and go off to bed. . . it dries as stiff as untanned leather. Wetting it restores suppleness but if you forget you practically have a board on your hand.
Something that just occurred to me. If you're putting this away damp after having been on your sweaty body what's the chance of unpleasant things growing in the damp nooks and crannies f the towel inside the plastic container. That has me somewhat concerned. make that four issues. Still it will cool you down at the neck or wherever you put it and it can be 'reactivated' numerous times and rewet as needed.

title: Nicely made, looks great
review: These do the trick in protecting my woods.
